original: VājasaneyiSamhitā /SuklaYajurveda iṣe tvā / ūrje tvā / vāyava stha / devo vaḥ savitā prārpayatu śreṣṭhatamāya karmaṇa ā pyāyadhvam aghnyā indrāya bhāgaṃ prajāvatīr anamīvā ayakṣmā mā va stena īśata māghaśamso dhruvā asmin gopatau syāta bahvīḥ / yajamānasya paśūn pāhi //
analyzed: vājasaneyi samhitā sukla yajurveda  iṣe tvā   ūrje tvā   vāyavaḥ stha  / devaḥ vaḥ savitā prārpayatu śreṣṭhatamāya karmaṇaḥ ā pyāyadhvam aghnyāḥ indrāya bhāgam prajāvatīḥ anamīvāḥ ayakṣmāḥ mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śamsaḥ dhruvāḥ asmin go patau syāta bahvīḥ    yajamānasya paśūn pāhi
translated: In the Vajasaneyi Samhita. Sukla Yajur Veda. For food to you. For strength to you. O winds, you are. May the god Savita impel you for the best deed. Be ye swollen, ye that are not to be slain, for Indra's share, ye that are full of offspring, free from disease and evil. Let not the thief rule you, nor the reviler. Be ye firm in this lord of the house, in abundance. Protect the animals of the sacrificer.

original: vasoḥ pavitram asi / dyaur asi pṛthivy asi / mātariśvano gharmo 'si viśvadhā asi parameṇa dhāmnā dṛmhasva mā hvār mā te yajñapatir hvārṣīt //
analyzed: vasoḥ pavitram asi   dyauḥ asi pṛthivī asi   mātariśvanaḥ gharmaḥ si viśvadhā asi parameṇa dhāmnā dṛmhasva mā hvār mā te yajñapatiḥ hvārṣīt
translated: Thou art the strainer of the good. Thou art the sky. Thou art the earth. Thou art the cauldron of Matariśvan. Thou art all-supporting. Be thou firmly established with the highest support. Do not tremble. Let not thy lord of sacrifice tremble.

original: vasoḥ pavitram asi śatadhāraṃ vasoḥ pavitram asi sahasradhāram / devas tvā savitā punātu vasoḥ pavitreṇa śatadhāreṇa supvā / kām adhukṣaḥ //
analyzed: vasoḥ pavitram asi śata dhāram vasoḥ pavitram asi sahasra dhāram    devaḥ tvā savitā punātu vasoḥ pavitreṇa śata dhāreṇa supvā    kām adhukṣaḥ
translated: Thou art the strainer of the good, with a hundred streams. Thou art the strainer of the good, with a thousand streams. May the god Savita purify thee with the strainer of the good, with a hundred streams, with pure (streams). What hast thou milked?

original: sā viśvāyuḥ / sā viśvakarmā / sā viśvadhāyāḥ / indrasya tvā bhāgam somenā tanacmi / viṣṇo havyam rakṣa //
analyzed: sā viśvāyuḥ   sā viśva karmā   sā viśva dhāyāḥ   indrasya tvā bhāgam somenā tanacmi   viṣṇo havyam rakṣa
translated: She is the life of all. She is the all-creating. She is the all-supporting. I extend to thee the share of Indra with Soma. O Vishnu, protect the offering.

original: agne vratapate vrataṃ cariṣyāmi tac chakeyaṃ tan me rādhyatām / idam aham anṛtāt satyam upaimi //
analyzed: agne vratapate vratam cariṣyāmi tat śakeyam tat me rādhyatām    idam aham anṛtāt satyam upaimi
translated: O Agni, lord of vows, I will observe the vow. May I be able to do it. May it succeed for me. I now turn from untruth to truth.

original: kas tvā yunakti sa tvā yunakti kasmai tvā yunakti tasmai tvā yunakti / karmaṇe vāṃ veṣāya vām //
analyzed: kaḥ tvā yunakti sa tvā yunakti kasmai tvā yunakti tasmai tvā yunakti karmaṇe vām veṣāya vām
translated: Who yokes you? He yokes you. For whom do you yoke? For him do you yoke. For the rite, for the garment, for you both.

original: pratyuṣṭam rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭā arātayaḥ / niṣṭaptam rakṣo niṣṭaptā arātayaḥ / urv antarikṣam anv emi //
analyzed: pratyuṣṭam rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭāḥ arātayaḥ   niṣṭaptam rakṣaḥ niṣṭaptāḥ arātayaḥ   uru antarikṣam anu emi
translated: The Rakshas is repelled, the evil spirits are repelled. The Rakshas is scorched, the evil spirits are scorched. I go along the wide atmosphere.

original: dhūr asi dhūrva dhūrvantaṃ dhūrva taṃ yo 'smān dhūrvati taṃ dhūrva yaṃ vayaṃ dhūrvāmaḥ / devānām asi vahnitamam samnitamaṃ papritamaṃ juṣṭatamaṃ devahūtamam //
analyzed: dhūḥ asi dhūrva dhūrvantam dhūrva tam yaḥ smān dhūrvati tam dhūrva yam vayam dhūrvāmaḥ   / devānām asi vahnitamam samnitamam papritamam juṣṭatamam devahūtamam
translated: You are the burden-bearer. Burden the burden-bearer. Burden him who burdens us. Burden him whom we burden. You are the most excellent carrier of the gods, the most collected, the most offered, the most acceptable, the most invoked of the gods.

original: ahrutam asi havirdhānaṃ dṛmhasva mā hvār mā yajñapatir hvārṣīt / viṣṇus tvā kramatām / uru vātāya / apahatam rakṣaḥ / yacchantāṃ pañca //
analyzed: ahrutam asi havirdhānam dṛmhasva mā hvār mā yajñapatiḥ hvārṣīt    viṣṇuḥ tvā kramatām   uru vātāya apahatam rakṣaḥ   yacchantām pañca
translated: You are the unshaken Havirdhana (Soma-cart). Be firm. Do not tremble. Let not the lord of the sacrifice tremble. Let Vishnu step on you. For wide space. The Rakshas is removed. Let the five hold you.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / agnaye juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi / agnīṣomābhyāṃ juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   agnaye juṣṭam gṛhṇāmi    agnīṣomābhyām juṣṭam gṛhṇāmi
translated: By the impulse of God Savitar, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee, agreeable to Agni. I take thee, agreeable to Agni and Soma.

original: bhūtāya tvā nārātaye / svar abhivi khyeṣam / dṛmhantāṃ duryāḥ pṛthivyām / urv antarikṣam anv emi / pṛthivyās tvā nābhau sādayāmy adityā upasthe 'gne havyam rakṣa //
analyzed: bhūtāya tvā na arātaye   svar abhivi khyeṣam    dṛmhantām duryāḥ pṛthivyām   uru antarikṣam anu emi   pṛthivyāḥ tvā nābhau sādayāmi adityāḥ upasthe gne havyam rakṣa
translated: For the existent, for the harmless one. I will ascend to the sky. Let the houses be firmly established on the earth. I enter the broad atmosphere. I place thee on the navel of the earth, in the lap of Aditi, O Agni, guard the oblation.

original: pavitre stho vaiṣṇavyau / savitur vaḥ prasava ut punāmy acchidrena pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / devīr āpo agreguvo agrepuvo 'gra imam adya yajñaṃ nayatāgre yajñapatim sudhātuṃ yajñapatiṃ devayuvam //
analyzed: pavitre sthaḥ vaiṣṇavyau   savituḥ vaḥ prasave ud punāmi acchidrena pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ    devīḥ āpaḥ agreguvaḥ agrepuvaḥ gre imam adya yajñam nayata agre yajñapatim su dhātum yajñapatim devayuvam
translated: Ye are the two strainers, belonging to Vishnu. I purify you with the impulse of Savitar, with the flawless strainer, with the rays of the sun. O divine waters, that lead the way, that go in front, lead this sacrifice to-day to the beginning, lead the lord of the sacrifice to the beginning, the lord of the sacrifice who is devoted to the gods.

original: yuṣmā indro 'vṛṇīta vṛtratūrye yūyam indram avṛṇīdhvaṃ vṛtratūrye / prokṣitā stha / agnaye tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / agnīṣomābhyāṃ tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / daivyāya karmaṇe śundhadhvaṃ devayajyāyai yad vo 'śuddhāḥ parājaghnur idaṃ vas tac chundhāmi //
analyzed: yuṣme indraḥ vṛṇīta vṛtratūrye yūyam indram avṛṇīdhvam vṛtratūrye   prokṣitāḥ stha   agnaye tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi    agnīṣomābhyām tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi    daivyāya karmaṇe śundhadhvam deva yajyāyai yat vaḥ śuddhāḥ parājaghnuḥ idam vaḥ tat śundhāmi
translated: Indra chose you for the battle with Vritra; you chose Indra for the battle with Vritra. Ye are sprinkled. I sprinkle you agreeable to Agni. I sprinkle you agreeable to Agni and Soma. Be ye pure for the divine rite, for the worship of the gods. What ye have struck with the impure, that I purify in you.

original: śarmāsi / avadhūtam rakṣo 'vadhūtā arātayaḥ / adityās tvag asi prati tvāditir vettu / adrir asi vānaspatyaḥ / grāvāsi pṛthubudhnaḥ prati tvādityās tvag vettu //
analyzed: śarma asi      avadhūtam rakṣaḥ vadhūtāḥ arātayaḥ   adityāḥ tvac asi prati tvā aditiḥ vettu    adriḥ asi vānaspatyaḥ   grāvā asi pṛthu budhnaḥ prati tvā adityāḥ tvac vettu
translated: Thou art the blessing. The Rakshas is shaken off, the evil spirits are shaken off. Thou art the skin of Aditi. Let Aditi accept thee. Thou art the stone, the offspring of the wood. Thou art the stone, the broad-based. Let the skin of Aditi accept thee.

original: agnes tanūr asi vāco visarjanaṃ devavītaye tvā gṛhṇāmi / bṛhadgrāvāsi vānaspatyaḥ / sa idaṃ devebhyo haviḥ śamīṣva suśami śamīṣva / haviṣkṛd ehi haviṣkṛd ehi haviṣkṛd ehi //
analyzed: agneḥ tanūḥ asi vācaḥ visarjanam deva vītaye tvā gṛhṇāmi    bṛhat grāvā asi vānaspatyaḥ   saḥ idam devebhyaḥ haviḥ śamīṣva suśami śamīṣva   haviṣkṛt ehi haviṣkṛt ehi haviṣkṛt ehi
translated: Thou art the body of Agni, the sending forth of speech. I take thee for the feast of the gods. Thou art the stone of the Brhat-sâman, the offspring of the wood. Do thou, well-kindled, be kind to the gods this sacrificial food. Come, O preparer of the sacrificial food! Come, O preparer of the sacrificial food! Come, O preparer of the sacrificial food!

original: kukkuṭo 'si madhujihva iṣam ūrjam ā vada tvayā vayam saṃghātamsaṃghātaṃ jeṣma / varṣavṛddham asi / prati tvā varṣavṛddhaṃ vettu / parāpūtam rakṣaḥ parāpūtā arātayaḥ / apahatam rakṣaḥ / vāyur vo vi vinaktu / devo vaḥ savitā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ prati gṛbhṇātv acchidreṇa pāṇinā //
analyzed: kukkuṭaḥ si madhu jihvaḥ iṣam ūrjam ā vada tvayā vayam saṃghātam saṃghātam jeṣma    varṣa vṛddham asi   prati tvā varṣa vṛddham vettu   parāpūtam rakṣaḥ parāpūtāḥ arātayaḥ   apahatam rakṣaḥ   vāyuḥ vaḥ vi vinaktu    devaḥ vaḥ savitā hiraṇya pāṇiḥ prati gṛbhṇātu acchidreṇa pāṇinā
translated: Thou art the cock, sweet-tongued: speak forth food and strength. By thee may we conquer every gathering. Thou art the increaser of the rain: may the increaser of the rain accept thee. The Rakshas is cleansed away, the evil spirits are cleansed away. The Rakshas is smitten away. May Vayu part you. May the God Savitar with the uninjured hand receive you, Savitar who holds the golden hand.

original: dhṛṣṭir asi / apāgne agnim āmādaṃ jahi niṣ kravyādam sedha / ā devayajaṃ vaha / dhruvam asi pṛthivīṃ dṛmha brahmavani tvā kṣatravani sajātavany upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya //
analyzed: dhṛṣṭiḥ asi   apa agne agnim āma adam jahi niḥ kravya adam sedha    ā deva yajam vaha   dhruvam asi pṛthivīm dṛmha brahma vani tvā kṣatra vani sajāta vani upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya
translated: Thou art the bold one. Drive away, O Agni, the raw-devouring Agni. Chase away the flesh-devourer. Bring the God-adoring. Thou art firm: make the earth firm. Thee for the love of prayer, for the love of the lord of the house, for the love of kinsmen, I place for the slaying of my foe.

original: agne brahma gṛbhṇīṣva / dharuṇam asy antarikṣaṃ dṛmha brahmavani tvā kṣatravani sajātavany upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya / dhartram asi divaṃ dṛmha brahmavani tvā kṣatravani sajātavany upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya / viśvābhyas tvāśābhya upa dadhāmi / cita sthordhvacitaḥ / bhṛgūṇām aṅgirasāṃ tapasā tapyadhvam //
analyzed: agne brahma gṛbhṇīṣva    dharuṇam asi antarikṣam dṛmha brahma vani sajāta vani upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya   dhartram asi divam dṛmha brahma vani tvā kṣatra vani sajāta vani upa dadhāmi bhrātṛvyasya badhāya    viśvābhyaḥ tvā āśābhyaḥ upa dadhāmi    citaḥ stha ūrdhva citaḥ    bhṛgūṇām aṅgirasām tapasā tapyadhvam  /
translated: O Agni, grasp the Brahman. Thou art the supporter; support the atmosphere. For the sake of holy power, for the sake of lordship, for the sake of kinsmen, I place thee, for the slaying of my foe. Thou art the upholder; support the sky. For the sake of holy power, for the sake of lordship, for the sake of kinsmen, I place thee, for the slaying of my foe. I place thee for all the quarters. Ye are the layers; layer upwards. Be ye heated by the heat of the Bhrigus and the Angirases.

original: śarmāsi / avadhūtam rakṣo 'vadhūtā arātayaḥ / adityās tvag asi prati tvāditir vettu / dhiṣaṇāsi parvatī prati tvādityās tvag vettu / diva skambhanīr asi / dhiṣaṇāsi pārvateyī prati tvā parvatī vettu //
analyzed: śarma asi    avadhūtam rakṣaḥ vadhūtāḥ arātayaḥ   adityāḥ tvac asi prati tvā aditiḥ vettu    dhiṣaṇā asi parvatī prati tvā adityāḥ tvac vettu    divaḥ skambhanīḥ asi    dhiṣaṇā asi pārvateyī prati tvā parvatī vettu
translated: Thou art the shelter. The Rakshas is shaken off, the evil spirits are shaken off. Thou art the skin of Aditi. Let Aditi accept thee. Thou art the Dhisana, the mountain-born. Let the skin of Aditi accept thee. Thou art the sky-supporting. Thou art the Dhisana, the mountain-born. Let the mountain accept thee.

original: dhānyam asi dhinuhi devān / prāṇāya tvā / udānāya tvā / vyānāya tvā / dīrghām anu prasitim āyuṣe dhāṃ devo vaḥ savitā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ prati gṛbhṇātv acchidreṇa pāṇinā / cakṣuṣe tvā / mahīnāṃ payo 'si //
analyzed: dhānyam asi dhinuhi devān   prāṇāya tvā   udānāya tvā   vyānāya tvā   dīrghām anu prasitim āyuṣe dhām devaḥ vaḥ savitā hiraṇya pāṇiḥ prati gṛbhṇātu acchidreṇa pāṇinā   cakṣuṣe tvā   mahīnām payaḥ si
translated: Thou art corn; drive away the gods. For expiration thee! For cross-breathing thee! For inspiration thee! For long life's continuity, for support, I take thee. May the god Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, grasp you with his flawless hand. For the eye thee! Thou art the milk of the great ones.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / saṃ vapāmi / sam āpa oṣadhībhiḥ sam oṣadhayo rasena / sam revatīr jagatībhiḥ pṛcyantām saṃ madhumatīr madhumatībhiḥ pṛcyantām //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām     sam vapāmi   sam āpaḥ oṣadhībhiḥ sam oṣadhayaḥ rasena    sam revatīḥ jagatībhiḥ pṛcyantām sam madhumatīḥ madhumatībhiḥ pṛcyantām  /
translated: In the impulse of God Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I mix. May the waters be united with the plants; may the plants be united with the sap. May the rich ones be united with the wandering ones; may the sweet ones be united with the sweet ones.

original: janayatyai tvā saṃ yaumi / idam agneḥ / idam agnīṣomayoḥ / iṣe tvā / gharmo 'si viśvāyuḥ / uruprathā uru prathasvoru te yajñapatiḥ prathatām / agniṣ ṭe tvacaṃ mā himsīt / devas tvā savitā śrapayatu varṣiṣṭhe 'dhi nāke //
analyzed: janayatyai tvā sam yaumi    idam agneḥ   idam agnīṣomayoḥ   iṣe tvā   gharmaḥ si viśvāyuḥ    uru prathāḥ uru prathasva uru te yajñapatiḥ prathatām    agniḥ te tvacam mā himsīt   devaḥ tvā savitā śrapayatu varṣiṣṭhe dhi nāke
translated: For generation I unite thee. This is of Agni; this is of Agni and Soma. For food thee! Thou art the hot-liquid, life of all. Spread widely! Spread widely for thee. May the lord of sacrifice spread widely for thee. May Agni spare thy skin. Let the god Savitar bake thee in the highest vault.

original: mā bher mā saṃ vikthāḥ / atamerur yajño 'tamerur yajamānasya prajā bhūyāt / tritāya tvā / dvitāya tvā / ekatāya tvā //🔽devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade 'dhvarakṛtaṃ devebhyaḥ / indrasya bāhur asi dakṣiṇaḥ sahasrabhṛṣṭiḥ śatatejā vāyur asi tigmatejā dviṣato badhaḥ //
analyzed: mā bheḥ mā sam vikthāḥ    atameruḥ yajñaḥ u tameruḥ yajamānasya prajā bhūyāt    tritāya tvā               devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   ā dade dhvara kṛtam devebhyaḥ   indrasya bāhuḥ asi dakṣiṇaḥ sahasra bhṛṣṭiḥ śata tejāḥ vāyuḥ asi tigma tejāḥ dviṣataḥ badhaḥ
translated: Be not broken, be not shattered. Let the sacrifice be not broken, let the sacrificer's offspring be not broken. For the three-fold thee, for the two-fold thee, for the one-fold thee.🔽By the impulse of God Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee, made ready for the Gods. Thou art Indra's right arm, a thousand-pointed dart, a hundred-edged, with keen edge, a slayer of foes.

original: pṛthivi devayajany oṣadhyās te mūlaṃ mā himsiṣam / vrajaṃ gaccha goṣṭhānam / varṣatu te dyauḥ / badhāna deva savitaḥ paramasyāṃ pṛthivyām śatena pāśair yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tam ato mā mauk //
analyzed: pṛthivi deva yajani oṣadhyāḥ te mūlam mā himsiṣam   vrajam gaccha goṣṭhānam   varṣatu te dyauḥ    badhāna deva savitar paramasyām pṛthivyām śatena pāśaiḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ tam atas mā mauk
translated: Thou art the Gods' altar, O Earth. I will not injure the root of the plants that are in thee. Go to the fold, to the cow-pen. Let the sky rain for thee. Bind him, O God Savitar, with a hundred fetters on the lowest earth, him who hateth us and whom we hate. Let him not go free from thee.

original: apāraruṃ pṛthivyai devayajanād badhyāsam / vrajaṃ gaccha goṣṭhānam / varṣatu te dyauḥ / badhāna deva savitaḥ paramasyāṃ pṛthivyām śatena pāśair yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tam ato mā mauk / araro divaṃ mā paptaḥ / drapsas te dyāṃ mā skan / vrajaṃ gaccha goṣṭhānam / varṣatu te dyauḥ / badhāna deva savitaḥ paramasyāṃ pṛthivyām śatena pāśair yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmas tam ato mā mauk //
analyzed: apārarum pṛthivyai devayajanāt badhyāsam    vrajam gaccha goṣṭhānam   varṣatu te dyauḥ   badhāna deva savitar paramasyām pṛthivyām śatena pāśaiḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ tam atas mā mauk    araro divam mā paptar    drapsaḥ te dyām mā skan    vrajam gaccha goṣṭhānam   varṣatu te dyauḥ    badhāna deva savitar paramasyām pṛthivyām śatena pāśaiḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ tam atas mā mauk  /
translated: I would bind thee to the altar of the earth, to the place of sacrifice. Go to the fold, to the cow-pen. Let the sky rain for thee. Bind him, O God Savitar, with a hundred fetters in the highest earth. Him who hates us and whom we hate, let him not escape from hence. Fall not to the sky, O Araru. Let not a drop of thine fall to the sky. Go to the fold, to the cow-pen. Let the sky rain for thee. Bind him, O God Savitar, with a hundred fetters in the highest earth. Him who hates us and whom we hate, let him not escape from hence.

original: gāyatreṇa tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi / traiṣṭubhena tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi / jagatena tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi / sukṣmā cāsi śivā cāsi / syonā cāsi suṣadā cāsi / ūrjasvatī cāsi payasvatī ca //
analyzed: gāyatreṇa tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi   traiṣṭubhena tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi    jagatena tvā chandasā pari gṛhṇāmi   sukṣmā ca asi śivā ca asi    syonā ca asi suṣadā ca asi        / ūrjasvatī ca asi payasvatī ca
translated: With the Gayatri metre I encompass thee. With the Tristubh metre I encompass thee. With the Jagati metre I encompass thee. Thou art the smooth one and the propitious one. Thou art the pleasant one and the good to sit on. Thou art the strength-giving one and the milk-giving one.

original: purā krūrasya visṛpo virapśinn udādāya pṛthivīṃ jīvadānum / yām airayamś candramasi svadhābhis tām u dhīrāso anudiśya yajante //
analyzed: purā krūrasya visṛpaḥ virapśin udādāya pṛthivīm jīva dānum    yām airayam candramasi svadhābhiḥ tām u dhīrāsaḥ anudiśya yajante
translated: Which they have placed in the moon with their own powers, the wise ones, pointing to that, offer sacrifices.

original: prokṣaṇīr ā sādaya / dviṣato badho 'si //
analyzed: prokṣaṇīḥ ā sādaya dviṣataḥ badho si
translated: Place the sprinkling waters. You are the slayer of enemies.

original: pratyuṣṭam rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭā arātayaḥ / niṣṭaptam rakṣo niṣṭaptā arātayaḥ / aniśito 'si sapatnakṣid vājinaṃ tvā vājedhyāyai saṃ mārjmi / pratyuṣṭam rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭā arātayaḥ / niṣṭaptam rakṣo niṣṭaptā arātayaḥ / aniśitāsi sapatnakṣid vājinīṃ tvā vājedhyāyai saṃ mārjmi //
analyzed: pratyuṣṭam rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭāḥ arātayaḥ   niṣṭaptam rakṣaḥ niṣṭaptāḥ arātayaḥ   aniśitā u si sapatna kṣit vājinam tvā vājedhyāyai sam mārjmi    pratyuṣṭam rakṣaḥ pratyuṣṭāḥ arātayaḥ   niṣṭaptam rakṣaḥ niṣṭaptāḥ arātayaḥ    aniśitā asi sapatna kṣit vājinīm tvā vājedhyāyai sam mārjmi
translated: The Rakshas is repelled, the evil spirits are repelled. The Rakshas is scorched, the evil spirits are scorched. You are not sharpened, you slay the enemy. I cleanse you, the strong one, for the sake of strength. The Rakshas is repelled, the evil spirits are repelled. The Rakshas is scorched, the evil spirits are scorched. You are not sharpened, you slay the enemy. I cleanse you, the strong one, for the sake of strength.

original: adityai rāsnāsi / viṣṇor veṣyo 'si / ūrje tvā / adabdhena tvā cakṣuṣāva paśyāmi / agner jihvāsi suhūr devebhyo dhāmnedhāmne me bhava yajuṣeyajuṣe //
analyzed: adityai rāsnā asi viṣṇoḥ veṣyaḥ si    ūrje tvā    adabdhena tvā cakṣuṣā ava paśyāmi   agneḥ jihvā asi suhūḥ devebhyaḥ dhāmne dhāmne me bhava yajuṣe yajuṣe
translated: You are the girdle of Aditi. You are the garment of Vishnu. For strength I take you. With undeceivable sight I see you. You are the tongue of Agni, the well-invoking one for the gods. For every abode of mine be you for every Yajus formula.

original: savitus tvā prasava ut punāmy acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / savitur vaḥ prasava ut punāmy acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / tejo 'si śukram asy amṛtam asi / dhāma nāmāsi priyaṃ devānām anādhṛṣṭaṃ devayajanam asi //
analyzed: savituḥ tvā prasave ud punāmi acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ   savituḥ vaḥ prasave ud punāmi acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ   tejaḥ si śukram asi amṛtam asi    dhāma nāma asi priyam devānām anādhṛṣṭam devayajanam asi
translated: With the impulse of Savitar I purify you with the flawless filter, with the rays of Sûrya. With the impulse of Savitar I purify you with the flawless filter, with the rays of Sûrya. You are the light, you are the bright, you are the immortal. You are the abode, you are the dear abode of the gods. You are the inviolable place of sacrifice.

original: kṛṣṇo 'sy ākhareṣṭho 'gnaye tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / vedir asi barhiṣe tvā juṣṭāṃ prokṣāmi / barhir asi srugbhyas tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi //
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ si ākhareṣṭhaḥ gnaye tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi   vediḥ asi barhiṣe tvā juṣṭām prokṣāmi   barhiḥ asi srugbhyaḥ tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi
translated: You are the black, you are the dweller in the dust. I sprinkle you agreeable to Agni. You are the altar. I sprinkle you agreeable to the strew. You are the strew. I sprinkle you agreeable to the offering-spoons.

original: adityai vyundanam asi / viṣṇo stupo 'si / ūrṇamradasaṃ tvā stṝṇāmi svāsasthāṃ devebhyaḥ / bhuvapataye svāhā / bhuvanapataye svāhā / bhūtānāṃ pataye svāhā //
analyzed: adityai vyundanam asi    viṣṇoḥ stupaḥ si    ūrṇamradasam tvā stṝṇāmi svāsasthām devebhyaḥ   bhuva pataye svāhā    bhuvana pataye svāhā      bhūtānām pataye svāhā
translated: You are the outpouring of Aditi. You are the top of Vishnu. I spread you, soft as wool, easy of access to the gods. To the Lord of the Bhuva I offer. To the Lord of the Bhuvar I offer. To the Lord of the Bhutas I offer.

original: gandharvas tvā viśvāvasuḥ pari dadhātu viśvasyāriṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhir asy agnir iḍa īḍitaḥ / indrasya bāhur asi dakṣiṇo viśvāvasuḥ pari dadhātu viśvasyāriṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhir asy agnir iḍa īḍitaḥ / mitrāvaruṇau tvottarataḥ pari dhattāṃ dhruveṇa dharmaṇā viśvasyāriṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhir asy agnir iḍa īḍitaḥ //
analyzed: gandharvaḥ tvā viśvāvasuḥ pari dadhātu viśvasya ariṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhiḥ asi agniḥ iḍaḥ īḍitaḥ   indrasya bāhuḥ asi dakṣiṇaḥ viśvāvasuḥ pari dadhātu viśvasya ariṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhiḥ asi agniḥ iḍaḥ īḍitaḥ  / mitrāvaruṇau tvā uttaratas pari dhattām dhruveṇa dharmaṇā viśvasya ariṣṭyai yajamānasya paridhiḥ asi agniḥ iḍaḥ īḍitaḥ  /
translated: Let the Gandharva Visvâvasu invest thee on every side for all security. Thou art the sacrificer's guard. Thou art Agni, worshipped with praise. Thou art Indra's right arm. Let Visvâvasu invest thee on every side for all security. Thou art the sacrificer's guard. Thou art Agni, worshipped with praise. Let Mitra and Varuna invest thee on the north with firm decree for all security. Thou art the sacrificer's guard. Thou art Agni, worshipped with praise.

original: vītihotraṃ tvā kave dyumantam sam idhīmahi / agne bṛhantam adhvare //
analyzed: vītihotram tvā kave dyumantam sam idhīmahi    agne bṛhantam adhvare
translated: Thee, O sage, the priest of all, we kindle, thee the bright, O Agni, in the sacrifice.

original: samid asi / sūryas tvā purastāt pātu kasyāś cid abhiśastyai / savitur bāhū sthaḥ / ūrṇamradasaṃ tvā stṝṇāmi svāsasthaṃ devebhyaḥ / ā tvā vasavo rudrā ādityāḥ sadantu //
analyzed: samidh asi    sūryaḥ tvā purastāt pātu kasyāḥ cit abhiśastyai    savituḥ bāhū sthaḥ   ūrṇamradasam tvā stṝṇāmi svāsastham devebhyaḥ   ā tvā vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ sadantu
translated: Thou art the kindler. Let Sûrya protect thee in the east from every curse. Ye are Savitar's arms. I spread thee soft as wool for the Gods to sit on. Let the Vasus, Rudras, Âdityas sit on thee.

original: ghṛtācy asi juhūr nāmnā sedaṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sada ā sīda / ghṛtācy asy upabhṛn nāmnā sedaṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sada ā sīda / ghṛtācy asi dhruvā nāmnā sedaṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sada ā sīda / priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sada ā sīda / dhruvā asadann ṛtasya yonau tā viṣṇo pāhi / pāhi yajñaṃ / pāhi yajñapatim / pāhi māṃ yajñanyam //
analyzed: ghṛtācī asi juhūḥ nāmnā sā idam priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sadaḥ ā sīda      ghṛtācī asi upabhṛt nāmnā sā idam priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sadaḥ ā sīda      ghṛtācī asi dhruvā nāmnā sā idam priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sadaḥ ā sīda     priyeṇa dhāmnā priyam sadaḥ ā sīda     dhruvāḥ asadan ṛtasya yonau tāḥ viṣṇo pāhi    pāhi yajñam    pāhi yajñapatim   pāhi mām yajñanyam
translated: Thou art the ladle, by name Ghritachi. Sit on this dear place of thine, dear as a seat. Thou art the Upabhrt, by name Ghritachi. Sit on this dear place of thine, dear as a seat. Thou art the Dhruva, by name Ghritachi. Sit on this dear place of thine, dear as a seat. Sit on this dear place of thine, dear as a seat. They have sat down in the womb of truth. Protect them, O Vishnu. Protect the sacrifice. Protect the lord of sacrifice. Protect me, O Vishnu, who am the sacrificer.

original: agne vājajid vājaṃ tvā sariṣyantaṃ vājajitam saṃ mārjmi / namo devebhyaḥ / svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ / suyame me bhūyāstam //
analyzed: agne vāja jit vājam tvā sariṣyantam vāja jitam sam mārjmi    namaḥ devebhyaḥ svadhā pitṛbhyaḥ su yame me bhūyāstam
translated: O Agni, victorious in strength, I cleanse thee, thee that art to be victorious in strength, as thou art about to start. Homage to the gods. Svâhâ to the Fathers. Be thou easy to handle for me.

original: askannam adya devebhya ājyam saṃ bhriyāsam / aṅghriṇā viṣṇo mā tvāva kramiṣam / vasumatīm agne te chāyām upa stheṣaṃ viṣṇo sthānam asi / ita indro vīryam akṛṇod ūrdhvo 'dhvara āsthāt //
analyzed: a skannam adya devebhyaḥ ājyam sam bhriyāsam   aṅghriṇā viṣṇo mā tvā ava kramiṣam   vasumatīm agne te chāyām upa stheṣam viṣṇoḥ sthānam asi    itas indraḥ vīryam akṛṇot ūrdhvaḥ dhvaraḥ āsthāt
translated: This day I shall mix the butter for the gods unspilt. With thy foot, O Vishnu, I will not tread on thee. I sit in thy shade, O Agni, that is rich in goods. Thou art the place of Vishnu. Hitherward hath Indra wrought his strength. He hath mounted the sacrifice.

original: agne ver hotraṃ ver dūtyam / avatāṃ tvāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī / ava tvaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī sviṣṭakṛd devebhyo indra ājyena haviṣā bhūt svāhā / saṃ jyotiṣā jyotiḥ //
analyzed: agne veḥ hotram veḥ dūtyam   avatām tvām dyāvāpṛthivī   ava tvam dyāvāpṛthivī sviṣṭakṛt devebhyaḥ indraḥ ājyena haviṣā bhūt svāhā    sam jyotiṣā jyotiḥ
translated: O Agni, do not fail as Hotar, do not fail as messenger. May Heaven and Earth help thee. Mayst thou, O Heaven and Earth, as Svistakrit, be for the gods. O Indra, be with the oblation of ghee. Svâhâ! The light with the light.

original: mayīdam indra indriyaṃ dadhātv asmān rāyo maghavānam sacantām / asmākam santv āśiṣaḥ satyā naḥ santv āśiṣaḥ / upahnutā pṛthivī mātopa māṃ pṛthivī mātā hvayatām / agnir āgnīdhrāt svāhā //
analyzed: mayi idam indraḥ indriyam dadhātu asmān rāyaḥ maghavānam sacantām   asmākam santu āśiṣaḥ satyāḥ naḥ santu āśiṣaḥ   upahnutā pṛthivī mātā upa mām pṛthivī mātā hvayatām      agniḥ āgnīdhrāt svāhā
translated: Here let Indra bestow his power. May the wealthy ones attend on us for wealth. Ours be the blessings. Ours be the true blessings. The earth, the mother, is invoked. Let the earth, the mother, call me. Let Agni from the Âgnîdhrîya call. Svâhâ!

original: upahūto dyauṣ pitopa māṃ dyauṣ pitā hvayatām agnir āgnīdhrāt svāhā / devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / prati gṛhṇāmi / agneṣ ṭvāsyena prāśnāmi //
analyzed: upahūtaḥ dyauḥ pitā upa mām dyauḥ pitā hvayatām agniḥ āgnīdhrāt svāhā   devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   prati gṛhṇāmi   agneḥ tvā āsyena prāśnāmi
translated: The invoked heaven, the father, let the heaven, the father, call me. Let Agni from the Âgnîdhrîya call. Svâhâ! By the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan, I receive thee. With the mouth of Agni I eat thee.

original: etaṃ te deva savitar yajñaṃ prāhur bṛhaspataye brahmaṇe //
analyzed: etam te deva savitar yajñam prāhuḥ bṛhaspataye brahmaṇe
translated: This sacrifice, O god Savitar, they announce to thee, to Brihaspati the Brahman.

original: tena yajñam ava tena yajñapatiṃ tena mām ava //
analyzed: tena yajñam ava tena yajñapatim tena mām ava
translated: By it the sacrifice, by it the lord of the sacrifice, by it me.

original: mano jūtir juṣatām ājyasya bṛhaspatir yajñam imaṃ tanotu / ariṣṭaṃ yajñam sam imaṃ dadhātu viśve devāsa iha mādayantām pra tiṣṭha //
analyzed: manaḥ jūtiḥ juṣatām ājyasya bṛhaspatiḥ yajñam imam tanotu    ariṣṭam yajñam sam imam dadhātu viśve devāsaḥ iha mādayantām pra tiṣṭha
translated: Let the mind, the swift one, enjoy the ghee. Let Brihaspati spread out this sacrifice. Let him make this sacrifice free from injury. Let all the gods rejoice here. Stand firm.

original: eṣā te agne samit tayā vardhasva cā ca pyāyasva //
analyzed: eṣā te agne samidh tayā vardhasva ca ā ca pyāyasva
translated: This is your fuel, O Agni. By it grow great and be strong.

original: vardhiṣīmahi ca vayam ā ca pyāsiṣīmahi //🔽agne vājajid vājaṃ tvā sasṛvāmsaṃ vājajitam saṃ mārjmi //
analyzed: vardhiṣīmahi ca vayam ā ca pyāsiṣīmahi  agne vāja jit vājam tvā sasṛvāmsam vāja jitam sam mārjmi
translated: May we grow great and be strong.🔽O Agni, victorious in strength, I cleanse you, the swift one, victorious in strength.

original: agnīṣomayor ujjitim anūj jeṣaṃ vājasya mā prasavena prohāmi //
analyzed: agnīṣomayoḥ ujjitim anu ud jeṣam vājasya mā prasavena prohāmi
translated: After the victory of Agni and Soma, may I win a victory. By the impulse of strength, I drive away.

original: agnīṣomau tam apa nudatāṃ yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmo vājasyainaṃ prasavenāpohāmi //
analyzed: agnīṣomau tam apa nudatām yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ vājasya enam prasavena apohāmi
translated: May Agni and Soma drive away him who hates us and whom we hate. By the impulse of strength, I drive him away.

original: indrāgnyor ujjitim anūj jeṣaṃ vājasya mā prasavena prohāmi / indrāgnī tam apa nudatāṃ yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmo vājasyainaṃ prasavenāpohāmi //
analyzed: indra agnyoḥ ujjitim anu ud jeṣam vājasya mā prasavena prohāmi    indra agnī tam apa nudatām yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ  / vājasya enam prasavena apohāmi
translated: After the victory of Indra and Agni, may I win a victory. By the impulse of strength, I drive away. Indra and Agni drive away him who hates us and whom we hate. By the impulse of strength, I drive him away.

original: vasubhyas tvā / rudrebhyas tvā / ādityebhyas tvā / saṃ jānāthāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī / mitrāvaruṇau tvā vṛṣṭyāvatām / vyantu vayo 'ktam rihāṇāḥ / marutāṃ pṛṣatīr gaccha vaśā pṛśnir bhūtvā divaṃ gaccha tato no vṛṣṭim ā vaha / cakṣuṣpā agne 'si cakṣur me pāhi //
analyzed: vasubhyaḥ tvā   rudrebhyaḥ tvā   ādityebhyaḥ tvā    sam jānāthām dyāvāpṛthivī   mitrāvaruṇau tvā vṛṣṭyā avatām   vyantu vayaḥ ktam rihāṇāḥ   marutām pṛṣatīḥ gaccha vaśā pṛśniḥ bhūtvā divam gaccha tatas naḥ vṛṣṭim ā vaha    cakṣuṣpāḥ agne si cakṣuḥ me pāhi
translated: For the Vasus thee! For the Rudras thee! For the Âdityas thee! Be ye twain united, Heaven and Earth! Let Mitra-Varuṇa favour thee with rain. Let the birds fly away, having eaten the food. Go to the dappled mares of the Maruts. Having become a spotted barren cow, go to the sky. Thence bring rain unto us. Thou art the guardian of the eye, O Agni: guard my eye.

original: yaṃ paridhiṃ paryadhatthā agne deva pāṇibhir guhyamānaḥ / taṃ ta etam anu joṣaṃ bharāmy net tvad apacetayātai //
analyzed: yam paridhim paryadhatthāḥ agne deva pāṇibhiḥ guhyamānaḥ   tam te etam anu joṣam bharāmi na id tvat apacetayātai
translated: The fence which thou hast fenced round thee, O Agni, O God, being guarded by the hands of men, I bring that hither according to thy will, that thou mayest not be heedless of us.

original: agneḥ priyaṃ pātho 'pītam //
analyzed: agneḥ priyam pāthaḥ pītam
translated: Ye have drunk the way that is dear to Agni.

original: samsravabhāgā stheṣā bṛhantaḥ prastareṣṭhāḥ paridheyāś ca devāḥ / imāṃ vācam abhi viśve gṛṇanta āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam //
analyzed: samsrava bhāgāḥ stha iṣā bṛhantaḥ prastareṣṭhāḥ paridheyāḥ ca devāḥ    imām vācam abhi viśve gṛṇantaḥ āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam
translated: Ye are the sharers of the droppings, ye are the mighty, ye are the gods who sit on the grass-bunch, who sit on the enclosing-sticks. All ye Gods, accept this speech of mine, and be seated on this strew, and rejoice yourselves.

original: svāhā vāṭ //
analyzed: svāhā vāṭ
translated: Hail!

original: ghṛtācī stho dhuryau pātam sumne sthaḥ sumne mā dhattam / yajña namaś ca ta upa ca yajñasya śive saṃ tiṣṭhasva sv"ṣṭe me saṃtiṣṭhasva //
analyzed: ghṛtācī sthaḥ dhuryau pātam sumne sthaḥ sumne mā dhattam  / yajña namaḥ ca te upa ca yajñasya śive sam tiṣṭhasva su ste me saṃtiṣṭhasva
translated: Ye are the two spoons. Protect the two ends. Ye are in bliss. Place me in bliss. O sacrifice, with reverence to thee, and with reverence to the sacrifice, be thou united with my bliss. Be thou united with my prosperity.

original: agne 'dabdhāyo 'śītama pāhi mā didyoḥ / pāhi prasityai / pāhi duriṣṭyai / pāhi duradmanyā aviṣaṃ naḥ pituṃ kṛṇu / suṣadā yonau svāhā vāṭ / agnaye saṃveśapataye svāhā / sarasvatyai yaśobhaginyai svāhā //
analyzed: agne dabdha āyo śītama pāhi mā didyoḥ   pāhi prasityai pāhi duriṣṭyai pāhi duradmanyāḥ aviṣam naḥ pitum kṛṇu suṣadā yonau svāhā vāṭ   agnaye saṃveśa pataye svāhā    sarasvatyai yaśaḥ bhaginyai svāhā
translated: O Agni, of unfailing strength, unwearied, guard me from the lightning-flash. Guard me from the noose. Guard me from the ill-omened. Guard me from the ill-omened curse. Make food for us free from poison. In the pleasant abode, hail! To Agni, lord of the resting-place, hail! To Sarasvatî, sister of glory, hail!

original: vedo 'si yena tvaṃ deva veda devebhyo vedo 'bhavas tena mahyaṃ vedo bhūyāḥ / devā gātuvido gātuṃ vittvā gātum ita / manasas pata imaṃ deva yajñam svāhā vāte dhāḥ //
analyzed: vedaḥ u si yena tvam deva veda devebhyaḥ vedaḥ bhavaḥ tena mahyam vedaḥ bhūyāḥ   devāḥ gātu vidaḥ gātum vittvā gātum ita     manasaḥ pate imam deva yajñam svāhā vāte dhāḥ
translated: Thou art the Veda, whereby, O God, thou hast become the Veda for the gods, whereby mayst thou become the Veda for me. The gods, finders of the way, having found the way, go the way, O lord of mind, this sacrifice, hail! place in the wind.

original: saṃ barhir aṅktām haviṣā ghṛtena sam ādityair vasubhiḥ saṃ marudbhiḥ / sam indro viśvadevebhir aṅktāṃ divyaṃ nabho gacchatu yat svāhā //
analyzed: sam barhiḥ aṅktām haviṣā ghṛtena sam ādityaiḥ vasubhiḥ sam marudbhiḥ   sam indraḥ viśvadevebhiḥ aṅktām divyam nabhaḥ gacchatu yat svāhā
translated: Let the sacrificial grass be besmeared with ghee and sacrificial food, together with the Âdityas and Vasus, together with the Maruts. Let Indra be besmeared together with the All-gods. Let it go to the heavenly vault, what is hail.

original: kas tvā vi muñcati sa tvā vi muñcati kasmai tvā vi muñcati tasmai tvā vi muñcati / poṣāya //
analyzed: kaḥ tvā vi muñcati sa tvā vi muñcati kasmai tvā vi muñcati tasmai tvā vi muñcati   /
translated: Who releases thee? He releases thee. For whom dost thou release? For him dost thou release. For prosperity.

original: rakṣasāṃ bhāgo 'si //
analyzed: rakṣasām bhāgaḥ si
translated: Thou art the share of the Rakshas.

original: saṃ varcasā payasā saṃ tanūbhir aganmahi manasā sam śivena / tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyo 'numārṣṭi tanvo yad viliṣṭam //
analyzed: sam varcasā payasā sam tanūbhiḥ aganmahi manasā sam śivena    tvaṣṭā su datraḥ vi dadhātu rāyaḥ numārṣṭi tanvaḥ yat viliṣṭam
translated: In splendour, in milk, in bodies, we have come together, in kindly spirit. May Tvashtar, the bountiful, allot to us riches. He mends what is broken in our bodies.

original: divi viṣṇur vy akramsta jāgatena chandasā tato nirbhakto yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ / antarikṣe viṣṇur vy akramsta jāgatena chandasā tato nirbhakto yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ / pṛthivyāṃ viṣṇur vy akramsta jāgatena chandasā tato nirbhakto yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ / asmād annāt / asyai pratiṣṭhāyai / aganma svaḥ / saṃ jyotiṣābhūma //
analyzed: divi viṣṇuḥ vi akramsta jāgatena chandasā tatas nirbhaktaḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ    antarikṣe viṣṇuḥ vi akramsta jāgatena chandasā tatas nirbhaktaḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ   / pṛthivyām viṣṇuḥ vi akramsta jāgatena chandasā tatas nirbhaktaḥ yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ  / asmāt annāt    asyai pratiṣṭhāyai   aganma svar   sam jyotiṣā abhūma  /
translated: In the sky Vishnu strode, with the Jagati metre. Thence was he banished who hates us and whom we hate. In the atmosphere Vishnu strode, with the Jagati metre. Thence was he banished who hates us and whom we hate. On earth Vishnu strode, with the Jagati metre. Thence was he banished who hates us and whom we hate. From this food. From this support. We have come to the light. We have become united with the light.

original: svayambhūr asi śreṣṭho raśmir varcodā asi varco me dehi / sūryasyāvṛtam anv āvarte //
analyzed: svayambhūḥ asi śreṣṭhaḥ raśmiḥ varcaḥ dāḥ asi varcaḥ me dehi         anu āvarte
translated: Thou art self-existent, the best ray, thou art the giver of splendour. Give me splendour. I turn with the course of the sun.

original: agne gṛhapate sugṛhapatis tvayāgne 'haṃ gṛhapatinā bhūyāsam sugṛhapatis tvaṃ mayāgne gṛhapatinā bhūyāḥ / asthūri ṇau gārhapatyāni santu śatam himāḥ / sūryasyāvṛtam anv āvarte //
analyzed: agne gṛhapate su gṛhapatiḥ tvayā agne ham gṛhapatinā bhūyāsam su gṛhapatiḥ tvam mayā agne gṛhapatinā bhūyāḥ   asthūri nau gārhapatyāni santu śatam himāḥ   sūryasya āvṛtam anu āvarte
translated: Agni, lord of the house, may I be a good lord of the house with thee, O Agni, as lord of the house. Mayst thou be a good lord of the house with me, O Agni, as lord of the house. Let not our domestic rites be fruitless. A hundred winters. I follow the course of the sun.

original: agne vratapate vratam acāriṣaṃ tad aśakaṃ tan me 'rādhi / idam ahaṃ ya evāsmi so 'smi //
analyzed: agne vratapate vratam acāriṣam tat aśakam tat me rādhi idam aham yaḥ eva asmi saḥ smi
translated: O Agni, lord of vows, I have observed the vow, I have been able to do it, it has pleased thee. I am now what I am.

original: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svāhā / somāya pitṛmate svāhā / apahatā asurā rakṣāmsi vediṣadaḥ //
analyzed: agnaye kavyavāhanāya svāhā somāya pitṛmate svāhā   apahatāḥ asurāḥ rakṣāmsi vediṣadaḥ
translated: To Agni, the carrier of oblations, Svâhâ! To Soma, the lord of the Fathers, Svâhâ! The Asura Râkshasas that sit on the altar are destroyed.🔽Those Asuras who, being Asuras, move about in their own nature, assuming various forms,

original: ye rūpāṇi pratimuñcamānā asurāḥ santaḥ svadhayā caranti / parāpuro nipuro ye bharanty agniṣ ṭān lokāt pra ṇudāty asmāt //
analyzed: ye rūpāṇi pratimuñcamānāḥ asurāḥ santaḥ svadhayā caranti    parāpuraḥ nipuraḥ ye bharanti agniḥ tān lokāt pra nudāti asmāt
translated: who carry off the oblations from the near and the distant, may Agni drive them from this world.

original: atra pitaro mādayadhvaṃ yathābhāgam ā vṛṣāyadhvam / amīmadanta pitaro yathābhāgam ā vṛṣāyiṣata //
analyzed: atra pitaraḥ mādayadhvam yathābhāgam ā vṛṣāyadhvam    amīmadanta pitaraḥ yathābhāgam ā vṛṣāyiṣata
translated: Here, O Fathers, rejoice, take each your proper share, be strong. The Fathers have rejoiced, have taken each his proper share, have become strong.

original: namo vaḥ pitaro rasāya / namo vaḥ pitaro śoṣāya / namo vaḥ pitaro jīvāya / namo vaḥ pitaro svadhāyai / namo vaḥ pitaro ghorāya / namo vaḥ pitaro manyave namo vaḥ pitaraḥ pitaro namo vaḥ / gṛhān naḥ pitaro datta sato vaḥ pitaro deṣma / etad vaḥ pitaro vāsa ā dhatta //
analyzed: namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ rasāya   namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ śoṣāya   namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ jīvāya    namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ svadhāyai   namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ ghorāya   namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ manyave namaḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ pitaraḥ namaḥ vaḥ  / gṛhān naḥ pitaraḥ datta sataḥ vaḥ pitaraḥ deṣma    etat vaḥ pitaraḥ vāsaḥ ā dhatta
translated: Homage to you, Fathers, for the life-giving! Homage to you, Fathers, for the drying up! Homage to you, Fathers, for the living! Homage to you, Fathers, for the Svadha! Homage to you, Fathers, for the terrible! Homage to you, Fathers, for the wrath! Homage to you, Fathers, Fathers! Homage to you! Give us homes, O Fathers! We give you, O Fathers, this! This is your garment, O Fathers. Lay it on!

original: ā dhatta pitaro garbhaṃ kumāraṃ puṣkarasrajam / yatheha puruṣo 'sat //🔽ūrjaṃ vahantīr amṛtaṃ ghṛtaṃ payaḥ kilālaṃ parisrutam / svadhā stha tarpayata me pitṛn //
analyzed: ā dhatta pitaraḥ garbham kumāram puṣkara srajam     yathā iha puruṣaḥ sat  ūrjam vahantīḥ amṛtam ghṛtam payaḥ kila alam parisrutam    svadhā stha tarpayata me pitṝn
translated: Lay on the germ, O Fathers, the boy with the lotus garland, that here a man may be.🔽Bearing strength, immortality, ghee, milk, and the flowing beverage, ye are Svadha. Satisfy my Fathers.

original: samidhāgniṃ duvasyata ghṛtair bodhayatātithim / āsmin havyā juhotana //
analyzed: samidhā agnim duvasyata ghṛtaiḥ bodhayata atithim    ā asmin havyā juhotana
translated: Serve Agni with fuel, awaken the guest with ghee. Offer your oblations in this (fire).

original: susamiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtaṃ tīvraṃ juhotana / agnaye jātavedase //🔽taṃ tvā samidbhir aṅgiro ghṛtena vardhayāmasi / bṛhacchocā yaviṣṭya //
analyzed: su samiddhāya śociṣe ghṛtam tīvram juhotana agnaye jātavedase  tam tvā samidbhiḥ aṅgiraḥ ghṛtena vardhayāmasi bṛhat śoca yaviṣṭya
translated: To the well-kindled, to the radiant one offer the fierce ghee, to Agni, the all-knower.🔽O Agni, with fuel we increase thee, with ghee, the most radiant, the most youthful, of great splendour.

original: upa tvāgne haviṣmatīr ghṛtācīr yantu haryata / juṣasva samidho mama //
analyzed: upa tvā agne haviṣmatīḥ ghṛtācīḥ yantu haryata    juṣasva samidhaḥ mama
translated: To thee, O Agni, let the active, the ghee-filled, the fuel-filled, come. Accept my fuel sticks.

original: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ / dyaur iva bhūmnā pṛthivīva varimṇā //
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar dyauḥ iva bhūmnā pṛthivī iva varimṇā
translated: Earth, atmosphere, heaven. Like the sky in breadth, like the earth in greatness.

original: tasyās te pṛthivi devayajani pṛṣṭhe 'gnim annādam annādyāyā dadhe //
analyzed: tasyāḥ te pṛthivi deva yajani pṛṣṭhe gnim anna adam annādyāyāḥ dadhe
translated: On the back of you, O Earth, who are the altar of the gods, I have placed Agni, the eater of food, for the sake of food.

original: āyaṃ gauḥ pṛśnir akramīd asadan mātaraṃ puraḥ / pitaraṃ ca prayant svaḥ //
analyzed: ā ayam gauḥ pṛśniḥ akramīt asadat mātaram puras    pitaram ca prayan svar
translated: The speckled cow has come hither; she has sat down before her mother and father, going to the light.

original: antaś carati rocanāsya prāṇād apānatī / vy akhyan mahiṣo divam //
analyzed: antar carati rocanā asya prāṇāt apānatī   vi akhyat mahiṣaḥ divam
translated: Within she moves the light, breathing in and breathing out from the breath. The great bull has filled the sky.

original: trimśad dhāma vi rājati vāk pataṅgāya dhīyate / prati vastor aha dyubhiḥ //
analyzed: trimśat dhāma vi rājati vāc pataṅgāya dhīyate    prati vastoḥ aha dyubhiḥ
translated: The thirtyfold abode shines forth; speech is placed in the bird. He is turned towards the light with the bright ones.

original: agnir jyotir jyotir agniḥ svāhā / sūryo jyotir jyotiḥ sūryaḥ svāhā / agnir varco jyotir varcaḥ svāhā / sūryo varco jyotir varcaḥ svāhā / jyotiḥ sūryaḥ sūryo jyotiḥ svāhā //
analyzed: agniḥ jyotiḥ jyotiḥ agniḥ svāhā sūryaḥ jyotiḥ jyotiḥ sūryaḥ svāhā   agniḥ varcaḥ jyotiḥ varcaḥ svāhā   sūryaḥ varcaḥ jyotiḥ varcaḥ svāhā    jyotiḥ sūryaḥ sūryaḥ jyotiḥ svāhā
translated: Agni is light, light is Agni, svāhā. Sūrya is light, light is Sūrya, svāhā. Agni is radiance, light is radiance, svāhā. Sūrya is radiance, light is radiance, svāhā. Light is Sūrya, Sūrya is light, svāhā.

original: sajūr devena savitrā sajū rātryendravatyā / juṣāṇo agnir vetu svāhā //
analyzed: sajūs devena savitrā sajūs rātryā indravatyā   / juṣāṇaḥ agniḥ vetu svāhā
translated: United with the god Savitr, united with the night that is rich in Indra, may Agni, accepting, enjoy, svāhā.

original: sajūr devena savitrā sajū uṣasendravatyā / juṣāṇaḥ sūryo vetu svāhā //
analyzed: sajūs devena savitrā sajūs uṣasā indravatyā    juṣāṇaḥ sūryaḥ vetu svāhā
translated: United with the god Savitr, united with the dawn that is rich in Indra, may Sūrya, accepting, enjoy, svāhā.

original: upaprayanto adhvaraṃ mantraṃ vocemāgnaye / āre asme ca śṛṇvate //
analyzed: upaprayantaḥ adhvaram mantram vocema agnaye    āre asme ca śṛṇvate
translated: Let us go forward to the sacrifice and utter our prayer to Agni, to him who hears us and is near to us.

original: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam / apām retāmsi jinvati //
analyzed: agniḥ mūrdhā divaḥ kakud patiḥ pṛthivyāḥ ayam   apām retāmsi jinvati
translated: Agni is the head, the height of heaven, the lord of this earth. He quickens the seed of the waters.

original: ubhā vām indrāgnī āhuvadhyā ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai / ubhā dātārāv iṣām rayīṇām ubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām //
analyzed: ubhā vām indra agnī āhuvadhyai ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai    ubhā dātārau iṣām rayīṇām ubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām
translated: You both, O Indra and Agni, are to be invoked; you both shall rejoice together in the gifts. You both are givers of food and wealth; I invoke you both for the winning of strength.

original: ayaṃ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ / taṃ jānann agna ārohāthā no vardhayā rayim //
analyzed: ayam te yoniḥ ṛtviyaḥ yatas jātaḥ arocathāḥ   tam jānan agne āroha atha naḥ vardhaya rayim
translated: This is your proper place of birth, whence born thou shonest forth. Knowing this, O Agni, mount up, and make our wealth increase.

original: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ / yam apnavāno bhṛgavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśeviśe //
analyzed: ayam iha prathamaḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ   yam apnavānaḥ bhṛgavaḥ virurucuḥ vaneṣu citram vibhvam viśeviśe
translated: This one was first established by the establishers, the priest most to be worshipped at sacrifices, whom the Apnavâna Bhr̥igus made to shine, the wondrous, mighty one, in every house.

original: asya pratnām anu dyutam śukraṃ duduhre ahrayaḥ / payaḥ sahasrasām ṛṣim //
analyzed: asya pratnām anu dyutam śukram duduhre ahrayaḥ payaḥ sahasra sām ṛṣim
translated: After the ancient light of him the milch-kine have shed the bright milk of him who wins a thousand, the sage.

original: tanūpā agne 'si tanvaṃ me pāhi / āyurdā agne 'sy āyur me dehi / varcodā agne 'si varco me dehi / agne yan me tanvā ūnaṃ tan me ā pṛṇa //
analyzed: tanū pāḥ agne si tanvam me pāhi    āyuḥ dāḥ agne si āyuḥ me dehi   varcaḥ dāḥ agne si varcaḥ me dehi    agne yat me tanvāḥ ūnam tat me ā pṛṇa
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the protector of the body: protect my body. Thou, O Agni, art the giver of life: give me life. Thou, O Agni, art the giver of splendour: give me splendour. Whatever is defective in my body, O Agni, make that good for me.

original: indhānās tvā śatam himā dyumantam sam idhīmahi / vayasvanto vayaskṛtam sahasvantaḥ sahaskṛtam / agne sapatnadambhanam adabdhāso adābhyam / citrāvaso svasti te pāram aśīya //
analyzed: indhānāḥ tvā śatam himā dyumantam sam idhīmahi    vayasvantaḥ vayaskṛtam sahasvantaḥ sahaskṛtam   agne sapatna dambhanam adabdhāsaḥ adābhyam   citrāvaso svasti te pāram aśīya
translated: Agni, the subduer of foes, the uninjured, the unassailable.🔽O thou of wondrous wealth, may I fare prosperously to thy further shore.🔽Do thou, O Agni, attain to the splendour of the sun, to the praise of the Rishis,

original: saṃ tvam agne sūryasya varcasāgathāḥ sam ṛṣīṇām stutena / saṃ priyeṇa dhāmnā sam aham āyuṣā saṃ varcasā saṃ prajayā sam rāyas poṣeṇa gmiṣīya //
analyzed: sam tvam agne sūryasya varcasā agathāḥ sam ṛṣīṇām stutena  / sam priyeṇa dhāmnā sam aham āyuṣā sam varcasā sam prajayā sam rāyaḥ poṣeṇa gmiṣīya
translated: To the dear abode, I to life, to splendour, to offspring, to the increase of wealth.

original: andha sthāndho vo bhakṣīya maha stha maho vo bhakṣīyorja sthorjaṃ vo bhakṣīya rāyas poṣa stha rāyas poṣaṃ vo bhakṣīya //
analyzed: andhaḥ stha andhaḥ vaḥ bhakṣīya mahaḥ stha mahaḥ vaḥ bhakṣīya ūrjaḥ stha ūrjam vaḥ bhakṣīya rāyaḥ poṣaḥ stha rāyaḥ poṣam vaḥ bhakṣīya
translated: Ye who are blind, may I enjoy you who are not blind. Ye who are great, may I enjoy you who are not great. Ye who are strength, may I enjoy you who are not strength. Ye who are the increase of wealth, may I enjoy you who are not the increase of wealth.

original: revatī ramadhvam asmin yonāv asmin goṣṭhe 'smiṃl loke 'smin kṣaye //
analyzed: revatīḥ ramadhvam asmin yonau asmin goṣṭhe smin loke smin kṣaye
translated: Ye rich ones, rejoice in this womb, in this cowpen, in this world, in this abode.

original: ihaiva sta māpagāta //
analyzed: iha eva sta mā apagāta
translated: Stay here only, do not depart.🔽Thou art gathered together, of all forms; with nourishment enter me, with the state of a good householder.

original: samhitāsi viśvarūpy ūrjā māviśa gaupatyena / upa tvāgne divedive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam / namo bharanta emasi //
analyzed: samhitā asi viśvarūpī ūrjā mā āviśa gaupatyena      upa tvā agne dive dive doṣāvastar dhiyā vayam   namaḥ bharantaḥ emasi
translated: To thee, O Agni, day by day, with homage, we come, O layer of the dust, with prayer.

original: rājantam adhvarāṇāṃ gopām ṛtasya dīdivim / vardhamāṇam sve dame //
analyzed: rājantam adhvarāṇām gopām ṛtasya dīdivim    vardhamāṇam sve dame
translated: The King of sacrifices, the guardian of truth, the radiant one,🔽Increasing in his own abode.

original: sa naḥ piteva sūnave 'gne sūpāyano bhava / sacasvā naḥ svastaye //
analyzed: sa naḥ pitā iva sūnave gne su upāyanaḥ bhava    sacasva naḥ svastaye
translated: Be easy of access to us, O Agni, as a father to his son. Be with us for our welfare.

original: agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhavā varūthyaḥ / vasur agnir vasuśravā acchānakṣi dyumattamam rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: agne tvam naḥ antamaḥ uta trātā śivaḥ bhava varūthyaḥ   vasuḥ agniḥ vasu śravāḥ acchānakṣi dyumattamam rayim dāḥ
translated: O Agni, be thou our nearest friend, a kind deliverer, a good protector. Agni, the good, hath come to us with good fame. Grant us most glorious riches.

original: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ / sa no bodhi śrudhī havam uruṣyā ṇo adhāyataḥ samasmāt //
analyzed: tam tvā śociṣṭha dīdivas sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ    sa naḥ bodhi śrudhi havam uruṣyā naḥ adha āyataḥ samasmāt
translated: Thee, O most radiant, we implore for bliss, for our friends. Be thou our protector. Hear our call. Preserve us from misfortune.

original: iḍa ehy adita ehi //
analyzed: iḍe ehi adite ehi
translated: Come hither, O Idâ. Come hither, O Aditi.

original: kāmyā eta / mayi vaḥ kāmadharaṇaṃ bhūyāt //
analyzed: kāmyāḥ eta mayi vaḥ kāma dharaṇam bhūyāt
translated: May these be desirable to you. May I be the fulfiller of your desires.

original: somānam svaraṇaṃ kṛṇuhi brahmaṇaspate / kakṣīvantaṃ ya auśijaḥ //
analyzed: somānam svaraṇam kṛṇuhi brahmaṇaspate   kakṣīvantam yaḥ auśijaḥ
translated: Make him to resound who is to be praised, O lord of prayer, Kakshîvân, who is Auशिg's son.

original: yo revān yo amīvahā vasuvit puṣṭivardhanaḥ / sa naḥ siṣaktu yas turaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ revān yaḥ amīva hā vasu vid puṣṭi vardhanaḥ    sa naḥ siṣaktu yaḥ turaḥ
translated: He who is rich, who brings no sickness, who finds treasure, who increases prosperity, may he, the strong one, favour us.

original: mā naḥ śamso araruṣo dhūrtiḥ pra ṇaṅ nartyasya / rakṣā ṇo brahmaṇaspate //
analyzed: mā naḥ śamsaḥ a raruṣaḥ dhūrtiḥ pra nak nartyasya    rakṣa naḥ brahmaṇaspate
translated: Let not the wicked, the impetuous, the violent one's dart strike us. Protect us, O lord of prayer.🔽Great be the heavenly favour of the three, of Mitra, Aryaman,

original: mahi trīṇām avo 'stu dyukṣaṃ mitrasyāryamṇaḥ / durādharṣaṃ varuṇasya //
analyzed: mahi trīṇām avaḥ stu dyukṣam mitrasya aryamṇaḥ    durādharṣam varuṇasya
translated: Hard to be overcome, of Varuna.

original: nahi teṣām amā cana nādhvasu vāraṇeṣu / īśe ripur aghaśamsaḥ //
analyzed: nahi teṣām amā cana na adhvasu vā araṇeṣu    īśe ripuḥ agha śamsaḥ
translated: For they have no foe, no spiteful enemy, in their contests, in their battles.

original: te hi putrāso aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya / jyotir yacchanty ajasram //
analyzed: te hi putrāsaḥ aditeḥ pra jīvase martyāya   jyotiḥ yacchanti ajasram
translated: For they, the sons of Aditi, grant light that never fails to the mortal man that he may live.

original: kadā cana starīr asi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe / upopen nu maghavan bhūya in nu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyate //
analyzed: kadā cana starīḥ asi na indra saścasi dāśuṣe     upa upa id nu maghavan bhūyaḥ id nu te dānam devasya pṛcyate
translated: Never art thou barren: thou never failest the worshipper, O Indra. Still and again, O bounteous one, the gift of the God increaseth.

original: tat savitur vareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi / dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayat //
analyzed: tat savituḥ vareṇyam bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayat
translated: The excellent glory of Savitar the God we meditate, that he may stimulate our prayers.

original: pari te dūḍabho ratho 'smām aśnotu viśvataḥ / yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ //
analyzed: pari te dūḍabhaḥ rathaḥ smām aśnotu viśvatas   yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ
translated: May thy car Dūdhabha, O Indra, come to us from every side, Wherewith thou protectest him who offers.

original: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ suprajāḥ prajābhi syām suvīro vīraiḥ supoṣaḥ poṣaiḥ / narya prajāṃ me pāhi / śamsya paśūn me pāhi / atharya pituṃ me pāhi //
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar suprajāḥ prajā abhi syām su vīraḥ vīraiḥ su poṣaḥ poṣaiḥ   narya prajām me pāhi    śamsya paśūn me pāhi     atharya pitum me pāhi
translated: Earth, ether, heaven, may I be prosperous with offspring through offspring, rich in heroes through heroes, rich in nourishment through nourishment. Protect my men, O Narya. Protect my cattle, O Śamsya. Protect my food, O Atharva.

original: āganma viśvavedasam asmabhyaṃ vasuvittamam / agne samrāḍ abhi dyumnam abhi saha ā yacchasva //
analyzed: āganma viśva vedasam asmabhyam vasu vittamam   agne samrāj abhi dyumnam abhi sahaḥ ā yacchasva
translated: We have come to the all-knowing one, best finder of wealth for us. O Agni, O emperor, win thou for us splendour and strength.

original: ayam agnir gṛhapatir gārhapatyaḥ prajāyā vasuvittamaḥ / agne gṛhapate 'bhi dyumnam abhi saha ā yacchasva //
analyzed: ayam agniḥ gṛhapatiḥ gārhapatyaḥ prajāyāḥ vasu vittamaḥ   agne gṛhapate bhi dyumnam abhi sahaḥ ā yacchasva
translated: This Agni is the householder, the Gārhapatya, best at finding wealth for offspring. O Agni, lord of the house, bestow upon us glory and strength.

original: ayam agniḥ purīṣyo rayimān puṣṭivardhanaḥ / agne purīṣyābhi dyumnam abhi saha ā yacchasva //
analyzed: ayam agniḥ purīṣyaḥ rayimān puṣṭi vardhanaḥ   agne purīṣya abhi dyumnam abhi sahaḥ ā yacchasva
translated: This Agni is to be worshipped, possessing wealth, increasing prosperity. O Agni, to be worshipped, bestow upon us glory and strength.

original: gṛhā mā bibhīta mā vepadhvam ūrjaṃ bibhrata emasi / ūrjaṃ bibhrad vaḥ sumanāḥ sumedhā gṛhān aimi manasā modamānaḥ //
analyzed: gṛhāḥ mā bibhīta mā vepadhvam ūrjam bibhrataḥ emasi    ūrjam bibhrat vaḥ sumanāḥ sumedhāḥ gṛhān aimi manasā modamānaḥ
translated: O houses, do not be afraid, do not tremble. Bearing strength, we come. Bearing strength, with a good mind, full of good thoughts, I go to the houses, rejoicing in my mind.

original: yeṣām adhyeti pravasan yeṣu saumanaso bahuḥ / gṛhān upa hvayāmahe te no jānantu jānataḥ //
analyzed: yeṣām adhyeti pravasan yeṣu saumanasaḥ bahuḥ   gṛhān upa hvayāmahe te naḥ jānantu jānataḥ
translated: To those in which he goes when away, in which there is much joy, we invite the houses. May they, who know, know us.

original: upahūtā iha gāva upahūtā ajāvayaḥ / atho annasya kīlāla upahūto gṛheṣu naḥ / kṣemāya vaḥ śāntyai pra padye śivam śagmam śamyoḥ śamyoḥ //
analyzed: upahūtāḥ iha gāvaḥ upahūtāḥ aja avayaḥ    atho annasya kīlālaḥ upahūtaḥ gṛheṣu naḥ   kṣemāya vaḥ śāntyai pra padye śivam śagmam śamyoḥ śamyoḥ
translated: The cows are invited here, the goats and sheep are invited. And the essence of food is invited in our houses. For your welfare and peace, I go to the auspicious, the prosperous, the peaceful, in each peaceful (house).

original: praghāsino havāmahe marutaś ca riśādasaḥ / karambheṇa sajoṣasaḥ //
analyzed: praghāsinaḥ havāmahe marutaḥ ca riśādasaḥ    karambheṇa sajoṣasaḥ
translated: We invoke the Maruts, the devourers of Rishis, in unison with Karambha.

original: yad grāme yad araṇye yat sabhāyāṃ yad indriye / yad enaś cakṛmā vayam idaṃ tad ava yajāmahe svāhā //
analyzed: yat grāme yat araṇye yat sabhāyām yat indriye   yat enaḥ cakṛma vayam idam tat ava yajāmahe svāhā
translated: Whatever sin we have committed, we offer it up in sacrifice, svāhā.🔽Do not be angry with us here, O Indra, in the battles with the gods, for thou hast great power, O mighty one.

original: mo ṣū ṇa indrātra pṛtsu devair asti hi ṣmā te śuṣminn avayāḥ / mahaś cid yasya mīḍhuṣo yavyā haviṣmato maruto vandate gīḥ //🔽akran karma karmakṛtaḥ saha vācā mayobhuvā / devebhyaḥ karma kṛtvāstaṃ preta sacābhuvaḥ //
analyzed: mā u su naḥ indra atra pṛtsu devaiḥ asti hi sma te śuṣmin avayāḥ   mahaḥ cit yasya mīḍhuṣaḥ yavyā haviṣmataḥ marutaḥ vandate gīḥ  akran karma karma kṛtaḥ saha vācā mayobhuvā      devebhyaḥ karma kṛtvā astam preta sacābhuvaḥ
translated: Even the Maruts, the bountiful ones, praise the song of him who has offered oblations.🔽The workers have done the work, together with the delightful speech. Having done the work for the gods, go to rest, O companion of the light.

original: avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa nicerur asi nicumpuṇaḥ / ava devair devakṛtam eno 'yāsiṣam ava martyair martyakṛtam / pururāvṇo deva riṣas pāhi //
analyzed: avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa niceruḥ asi nicumpuṇaḥ    ava devaiḥ deva kṛtam enaḥ yāsiṣam ava martyaiḥ martya kṛtam    pururāvṇaḥ deva riṣaḥ pāhi
translated: O Avabhṛtha, O Nicumpuṇa, you are the one who moves along, O Nicumpuṇa. I have gone away from the sin committed by the gods, and from the sin committed by mortals. O god, protect me from many reproaches and dangers.

original: pūrṇā darvi parā pata supūrṇā punar ā pata / vasneva vi krīṇāvahā iṣam ūrjam śatakrato //
analyzed: pūrṇā darvi parā pata su pūrṇā punar ā pata   vasnā iva vi krīṇāvahā iṣam ūrjam śatakrato
translated: O full ladle, fly away, well filled, fly back again, well filled. As with a garment, we exchange food and strength, O performer of a hundred sacrifices.

original: dehi me dadāmi te ni me dhehi ni te dadhe / nihāraṃ ca harāsi me nihāraṃ niharāṇi te svāhā //
analyzed: dehi me dadāmi te ni me dhehi ni te dadhe    nihāram ca harāsi me nihāram niharāṇi te svāhā
translated: Give to me, I give to you. Place in me, place in you. I remove the mist from you, remove the mist that I may have. Svāhā.

original: akṣann amīmadanta hy ava priyā abhūṣata / astoṣata svabhānavo viprā niviṣṭhayā matī yojā nv "ndra te harī //
analyzed: akṣan amīmadanta hi ava priyāḥ abhūṣata    astoṣata sva bhānavaḥ viprāḥ niviṣṭhayā matī yojā nu ndra te harī
translated: They have eaten, they have rejoiced, they have become dear. The self-shining sages have praised with their most recent thought. Yoke now, O Indra, thy two bays.

original: susaṃdṛśaṃ tvā vayaṃ maghavan vandiṣīmahi / pra nūnaṃ pūrṇabandhura stuto yāsi vaśām anu yojā nv "ndra te harī //
analyzed: su saṃdṛśam tvā vayam maghavan vandiṣīmahi pra nūnam pūrṇa bandhura stutaḥ yāsi vaśām anu yojā nu ndra te harī
translated: We will praise thee, O bountiful one, O thou who art fair to behold. Now, when praised, goest thou to the cow, with thy yoke-fellow full of food. Yoke now, O Indra, thy two bays.

original: mano nv āhvamahe nārāśamsena stomena / pitṝṇāṃ ca manmabhiḥ //
analyzed: manaḥ nu āhvamahe nārāśamsena stomena    pitṝṇām ca manmabhiḥ
translated: We invoke the mind with the Narashamsa hymn, and with the thoughts of the fathers.🔽Let the mind come back to us again for thought, for power, for oblation,

original: ā na etu manaḥ punaḥ kratve dakṣāya havise / jmok ca sūryaṃ dṛśe //
analyzed: ā naḥ etu manaḥ punar kratve dakṣāya havise   jmok ca sūryam dṛśe
translated: that we may look upon the sun and the earth.🔽May the divine people, the fathers, grant us our mind again,

original: punar naḥ pitaro mano dadātu daivyo janaḥ / jīvaṃ vrātam sacemahi //
analyzed: punar naḥ pitaraḥ manaḥ dadātu daivyaḥ janaḥ   jīvam vrātam sacemahi
translated: that we may live and enjoy our kinsmen.🔽We, O Soma, bearing thy mind in our bodies, in thy vow,

original: vayam soma vrate tava manas tanūṣu bibhrataḥ / prajāvantaḥ sacemahi //
analyzed: vayam soma vrate tava manaḥ tanūṣu bibhrataḥ   prajāvantaḥ sacemahi
translated: may we live with offspring.

original: eṣa te rudra bhāgaḥ saha svasrāmbikayā taṃ juṣasva svāhā / eṣa te rudra bhāga ākhus te paśuḥ //
analyzed: eṣa te rudra bhāgaḥ saha svasrā ambikayā tam juṣasva svāhā eṣa te rudra bhāgaḥ ākhuḥ te paśuḥ
translated: This is thy share, O Rudra, together with thy sister Ambika. Accept it, hail! This is thy share, O Rudra, the mouse is thy animal.

original: ava rudramad īmahy ava devaṃ tryambakam / yathā no vasyasas karad yad yathā naḥ śreyasas karad yad yathā no vyavasāyayāt //
analyzed: ava rudramat īmahi ava devam tryambakam   yathā naḥ vasyasaḥ karat yat yathā naḥ śreyasaḥ karat yat yathā naḥ vyavasāyayāt
translated: We will invoke Rudra, the god Tryambaka, so that he may make us better, so that he may make us more prosperous, so that he may lead us to success.

original: bheṣajam asi bheṣajaṃ gave 'śvāya puruṣāya bheṣajam / sukhaṃ meṣāya meṣyai //
analyzed: bheṣajam asi bheṣajam gave śvāya puruṣāya bheṣajam
translated: You are medicine, medicine for the cow, for the horse, for man, medicine for the ram and ewe.

original: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ puṣṭivardhanam / urvārukam iva bandhanān mṛtyor mukṣīya māmṛtāt //
analyzed: tryambakam yajāmahe sugandhim puṣṭi vardhanam   urvārukam iva bandhanāt mṛtyoḥ mukṣīya mā amṛtāt
translated: We worship Tryambaka, the fragrant one, the increaser of prosperity, may I be released from death, as a cucumber from its stem.

original: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ pativedanam / urvārukam iva bandhanād ito mukṣīya māmutaḥ //
analyzed: tryambakam yajāmahe sugandhim pati vedanam   urvārukam iva bandhanāt itas mukṣīya mā amutas
translated: We worship Tryambaka, the fragrant one, the knower of his husband, may I be released from here, from there, as a cucumber from its stem.

original: etat te rudrāvasaṃ tena paro mūjavato 'tīhi / avatatadhanvā pinākāvasaḥ kattivāsā ahimsan naḥ śivo 'tīhi //
analyzed: etat te rudra avasam tena paras mūjavataḥ tīhi   avatata dhanvā pinākā vasaḥ kattivāsāḥ a himsan naḥ śivaḥ tīhi
translated: This is your food, O Rudra, by it pass beyond the clouds. Lay aside your bow and quiver, clad in skins, do us no harm, pass by in peace.

original: tryāyuṣaṃ jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tryāyuṣam / yad deveṣu tryāyuṣaṃ tan no astu tryāyuṣam //
analyzed: tri āyuṣam jamadagneḥ kaśyapasya tri āyuṣam   yat deveṣu tri āyuṣam tat naḥ astu tri āyuṣam
translated: The three-lived one of Jamadagni, the three-lived one of Kashyapa, the three-lived one among the gods, may that three-lived one be ours.

original: śivo nāmāsi svadhitis te pitā namas te astu mā mā himsīḥ / ni vartayāmy uṣe 'nnādyāya prajananāya rāyas poṣāya suprajāstvāya suvīryāya //
analyzed: śivaḥ nāma asi svadhitiḥ te pitā namaḥ te astu mā mā himsīḥ    ni vartayāmi uṣe nnādyāya prajananāya rāyaḥ poṣāya suprajāstvāya su vīryāya
translated: Thou art called auspicious. Thy father is the axe. Homage be to thee. Harm me not. I turn thee back for food, for offspring, for the increase of wealth, for good progeny, for hero strength.

original: edam aganma devayajanaṃ pṛthivyā yatra devāso ajuṣanta viśve / ṛk sāmābhyā saṃtaranto yajurbhī rāyas poṣeṇa sam iṣā madema / imā āpaḥ śam u me santu devīḥ / oṣadhe trāyasva / svadhite mainam himsīḥ //
analyzed: ā idam aganma devayajanam pṛthivyāḥ yatra devāsaḥ ajuṣanta viśve    ṛk sāmābhyā saṃtarantaḥ yajurbhiḥ rāyaḥ poṣeṇa sam iṣā madema   imāḥ āpaḥ śam u me santu devīḥ   oṣadhe trāyasva    svadhite mā enam himsīḥ
translated: Hither have we come to the place of sacrifice on earth, where all the gods rejoiced. Crossing by the Rik and the Saman, by the Yajus, may we rejoice in the increase of wealth and in food. May these waters be auspicious to me, O divine ones. O plant, protect me. O axe, harm me not.

original: āpo asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena no ghṛtapvaḥ punantu / viśvam hi ripraṃ pravahanti devīḥ / ud idābhyaḥ śucir ā pūta emi / dīkṣātapasos tanūr asi taṃ tvā śivām śagmāṃ pari dadhe bhadraṃ varṇaṃ puṣyan //
analyzed: āpaḥ asmān mātaraḥ śundhayantu ghṛtena naḥ ghṛta pvaḥ punantu    viśvam hi ripram pravahanti devīḥ   ud idābhyaḥ śuciḥ ā pūtaḥ emi    dīkṣā tapasoḥ tanūḥ asi tam tvā śivām śagmām pari dadhe bhadram varṇam puṣyan
translated: May the waters, the mothers, purify us. May they, rich in ghee, cleanse us with ghee. For they, the divine ones, bear away all impurity. I go forth from them, pure and cleansed. Thou art the body of the penance of consecration. I invest thee, auspicious and kind, promoting a happy complexion.

original: mahīnāṃ payo 'si varcodā asi varco me dehi / vṛtrasyāsi kanīnakaś cakṣurdā asi cakṣur me dehi //
analyzed: mahīnām payaḥ si varcaḥ dāḥ asi varcaḥ me dehi    vṛtrasya asi kanīnakaḥ cakṣuḥ dāḥ asi cakṣuḥ me dehi
translated: Thou art the milk of the great ones. Thou givest splendour. Give me splendour. Thou art the pupil of Vritra's eye. Thou givest sight. Give me sight.

original: citpatir mā punātu / vākpatir mā punātu / devo mā savitā punāv acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / tasya te pavitrapate pavitrapūtasya yatkāmaḥ pune tac chakeyam //
analyzed: citpatiḥ mā punātu   vākpatiḥ mā punātu   devaḥ mā savitā punau acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ   tasya te pavitra pate pavitra pūtasya yad kāmaḥ pune tat śakeyam
translated: May the Lord of Thought purify me. May the Lord of Speech purify me. May the God Savitar purify me with the unsullied filter, with the rays of the Sun. Of thee, O Lord of the filter, of thee who art purified by the filter, whatever desire I have in purifying myself, may I be able to accomplish that.

original: ā vo devāsa īmahe vāmaṃ prayaty adhvare / ā vo devāsa āśiṣo yajñiyāso havāmahe //
analyzed: ā vaḥ devāsaḥ īmahe vāmam prayati adhvare   ā vaḥ devāsaḥ āśiṣaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ havāmahe
translated: We implore you, O Gods, for wealth as the sacrifice proceeds. We invoke you, O Gods, the blessings that are meet for sacrifice.

original: svāhā yajñaṃ manasaḥ / svāhoror antarikṣāt / svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām / svāhā vātād ā rabhe svāhā //
analyzed: svāhā yajñam manasaḥ svāhā uroḥ antarikṣāt svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām svāhā vātāt ā rabhe svāhā
translated: Hail to the sacrifice of the mind! Hail to the sacrifice of the wide atmosphere! Hail to the sacrifice of heaven and earth! Hail to the sacrifice from the wind! I grasp (it). Hail!

original: ākūtyai prayuje 'gnaye svāhā medhāyai manase 'gnaye svāhā dīkṣāyai tapase 'gnaye svāhā sarasvatyai pūṣṇe 'gnaye svāhā āpo devīr bṛhatīr viśvaśambhuvo dyāvāpṛthivī uro antarikṣa / bṛhaspataye haviṣā vidhema svāhā //
analyzed: ākūtyai prayuje gnaye svāhā medhāyai manase gnaye svāhā dīkṣāyai tapase gnaye svāhā sarasvatyai pūṣṇe gnaye svāhā āpaḥ devīḥ bṛhatīḥ viśva śambhuvaḥ dyāvāpṛthivī uro antarikṣa    bṛhaspataye haviṣā vidhema svāhā
translated: To inspiration, to exertion, to Agni, hail! To meditation, to mind, to Agni, hail! To consecration, to fervour, to Agni, hail! To Sarasvatî, to Pûshan, to Agni, hail! To the waters, the divine, the great, auspicious to all, to heaven and earth, to the wide atmosphere, to Brihaspati let us offer oblation. Hail!

original: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam / viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase svāhā //
analyzed: viśvaḥ devasya netuḥ martaḥ vurīta sakhyam   viśvaḥ rāyaḥ iṣudhyati dyumnam vṛṇīta puṣyase svāhā
translated: Let every mortal man win the friendship of the God who guides. Every one longs for wealth: let him choose glory that he may prosper. Hail!

original: ṛksāmayoḥ śilpe sthas te vām ā rabhe te mā pātamāsya yajñasyodṛcaḥ / śarmāsi śarma me yaccha namas te astu mā mā himsīḥ //
analyzed: ṛk sāmayoḥ śilpe sthaḥ te vām ā rabhe te mā pātama asya yajñasya udṛcaḥ   śarma asi śarma me yaccha namaḥ te astu mā mā himsīḥ
translated: In the art of the Rik and Saman ye are. I take hold of you. Protect me till the end of the sacrifice. Thou art shelter. Give me shelter. Homage to thee. Do no harm to me.

original: ūrg asy āṅgirasyūrṇamradā ūrjaṃ mayi dhehi / somasya nīvir asi / viṣṇoḥ śarmāsi śarma yajamānasya / indrasya yonir asi / susasyāḥ kṛṣīs kṛdhi / uc chrayasva vanaspata ūrdhvo mā pāhy amhasa āsya yajasyudṛcaḥ //
analyzed: ūrj asi āṅgirasi ūrṇamradāḥ ūrjam mayi dhehi    somasya nīviḥ asi   viṣṇoḥ śarma asi śarma yajamānasya   indrasya yoniḥ asi    su sasyāḥ kṛṣīḥ kṛdhi    ud śrayasva vanaspate ūrdhvaḥ mā pāhi amhasaḥ ā asya yajasi udṛcaḥ
translated: Thou art strength, of Angiras's race, soft as wool. Bestow strength on me. Thou art the girdle of Soma. Thou art the shelter of Vishnu. Give shelter to the sacrificer. Thou art the womb of Indra. Make the fields rich in corn. Rise up, O tree. Stand erect. Protect me from injury till the end of the sacrifice.

original: vrataṃ kṛṇutāgnir brahmāgnir yajño vanaspatir yajñiyaḥ / daivīṃ dhiyaṃ manāmahe sumṛḍīkām abhiṣṭaye varcodhāṃ yajñavāhasam sutīrthā no asad vaśe / ye devā manojātā manoyujo dakṣakratavas te no 'vantu te naḥ pāntu tebhaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: vratam kṛṇuta agniḥ brahmā agniḥ yajñaḥ vanaspatiḥ yajñiyaḥ    daivīm dhiyam manāmahe su mṛḍīkām abhiṣṭaye varcaḥ dhām yajña vāhasam su tīrthā naḥ asat vaśe    ye devāḥ manaḥ jātāḥ manaḥ yujaḥ dakṣa kratavaḥ te naḥ vantu te naḥ pāntu tebhaḥ svāhā
translated: Make the vow. Agni is the Brahman, Agni is the sacrifice, the sacrificial post is sacred. We think of the divine thought, kindly disposed, for protection, the thought which brings glory, which carries the sacrifice, which is easy to find for us. May the gods who are born of mind, who are yoked with mind, who have the power of Daksha, favour us. May they protect us. To them hail!

original: śvātrāḥ pītā bhavata yūyam āpo asmākam antar udare suśevāḥ / tā asmabhyam ayakṣmā anamīvā anāgasaḥ svadantu devīr amṛtā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ //
analyzed: śvātrāḥ pītāḥ bhavata yūyam āpaḥ asmākam antar udare su śevāḥ   tāḥ asmabhyam ayakṣmāḥ anamīvāḥ anāgasaḥ svadantu devīḥ amṛtāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: Be ye waters auspicious to drink. Ye waters, be ye kindly disposed within our belly. Be ye free from demons, free from disease, free from sin for us. Let the divine, immortal waters, which strengthen the truth, be agreeable to us.

original: iyaṃ te yajñiyā tanūḥ / apo muñcāmi na prajām / amhomucaḥ svāhākṛtāḥ pṛthivīm āviśata / pṛthivyā saṃbhava //
analyzed: iyam te yajñiyā tanūḥ   apaḥ muñcāmi na prajām   amhomucaḥ svāhākṛtāḥ pṛthivīm āviśata   pṛthivyā saṃbhava
translated: This is thy sacrificial body. I loose the waters, not offspring. Released from sin, offered with Svâhâ, enter the earth. From the earth be born.

original: agne tvam su jāgṛhi vayam su mandiṣīmahi / rakṣā ṇo aprayucchan prabudhe naḥ punas kṛdhi //
analyzed: agne tvam su jāgṛhi vayam su mandiṣīmahi    rakṣā ṇaḥ aprayucchan prabudhe naḥ punas kṛdhi
translated: O Agni, do thou watch well. We will rejoice well. Protect us, not sleeping. When we are awake, make us again.

original: punar manaḥ punar āyur ma āgan punaḥ prāṇaḥ punar ātmā ma āgan punaś cakṣuḥ punaḥ śrotraṃ ma āgan / vaiśvānaro adabdhas tanūpā agnir naḥ pātu duritād avadyāt //
analyzed: punar manaḥ punar āyuḥ me āgan punar prāṇaḥ punar ātmā me āgan punar cakṣuḥ punar śrotram me āgan     vaiśvānaraḥ adabdhaḥ tanū pāḥ agniḥ naḥ pātu duritāt avadyāt
translated: My mind again, my life again has come to me. My breath again, my soul again has come to me. My eye again, my ear again has come to me. Unerring, protecting the body, may Agni protect us from evil and blame.

original: tvam agne vratapā asi deva ā martyeṣv ā tvaṃ yajñeṣv īḍyaḥ / rāsveyatsomā bhūyo bhara devo naḥ savitā vasor dātā vasv adāt //
analyzed: tvam agne vrata pāḥ asi devaḥ ā martyeṣu ā tvam yajñeṣu īḍyaḥ   rāsva iyatsoma ā bhūyaḥ bhara devaḥ naḥ savitā vasoḥ dātā vasu adāt
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the guardian of vows, a god among mortals. Thou art to be worshipped in sacrifices. Give us this, O Soma. Bring more. The god Savitar, the giver of treasure, has given treasure.

original: eṣā te śukra tanūr etad varcas tayā saṃ bhava bhrājaṃ gaccha / jūr asi dhṛtā manasā juṣṭā viṣṇave //
analyzed: eṣā te śukra tanūḥ etat varcaḥ tayā sam bhava bhrājam gaccha   jūḥ asi dhṛtā manasā juṣṭā viṣṇave
translated: This is thy bright body, this thy radiance. Therewith become united. Go to the shining. Thou art the rib, held by thought, dear to Vishnu.

original: tasyās te satyasavasaḥ prasave tanvo yantram aśīya svāhā / śukram asi candram asy amṛtam asi vaiśvadevam asi //
analyzed: tasyāḥ te satya savasaḥ prasave tanvaḥ yantram aśīya svāhā śukram asi candram asi amṛtam asi vaiśvadevam asi
translated: Of that of thine, O truth-powerful one, in the impulse, I would have the control of the limbs. Svâhâ. Thou art bright, thou art pure, thou art immortal. Thou belongest to the All-gods.

original: cid asi manāsi dhīr asi dakṣiṇāsi kṣatriyāsi yajñiyāsy aditir asy ubhayataḥśīrṣṇī / sā naḥ suprācī supratīcy edhi mitras tvā padi badhnītāṃ pūṣādhvanas pātv indrāyādhyakṣāya //
analyzed: cit asi manā asi dhīḥ asi dakṣiṇā asi kṣatriyā asi yajñiyā asi aditiḥ asi ubhayatas śīrṣṇī    sā naḥ su prācī su pratīcī edhi mitraḥ tvā padi badhnītām pūṣā adhvanaḥ pātu indrāya adhyakṣāya
translated: Thou art the intellect, thou art the mind, thou art the thought, thou art the gift, thou art the Kshatriya, thou art the sacrificer, thou art Aditi, thou hast two heads. Be thou to us auspicious in thy rising and in thy setting. Let Mitra bind thee with the fetter. Let Pûshan guard thee on thy way for Indra, the overseer.

original: anu tvā mātā manyatām anu pitānu bhrātā sagarbhyo 'nu sakhā sayūthyaḥ //
analyzed: anu tvā mātā manyatām anu pitā anu bhrātā sagarbhyaḥ nu sakhā sa yūthyaḥ
translated: Let thy mother think of thee, let thy father, let thy brother born of the same womb, let thy friend of the same herd.

original: sā devi devam acchehīndrāya somam rudras tvā vartayatu svasti somsakhā punar ehi //
analyzed: sā devi devam acchehi indrāya somam rudraḥ tvā vartayatu svasti soma sakhā punar ehi
translated: Go to the god, O goddess, to Indra, to Soma. Let Rudra turn thee back. Return with Soma as thy friend.

original: vasvy asy aditir asyādityāsi rudrāsi candrāsi / bṛhaspatiṣ ṭvā sumne ramṇātu rudro vasubhir ā cake //
analyzed: vasvī asi aditiḥ asi ādityā asi rudrā asi candrā asi  / bṛhaspatiḥ tvā sumne ramṇātu rudraḥ vasubhiḥ ā cake
translated: Thou art the Vasu, thou art Aditi, thou art the Âditya, thou art the Rudra, thou art the Chandra. Let Brihaspati place thee in bliss. Let Rudra with the Vasus accept thee.

original: adityās tvā mūrdhann ā jigharmi devayajane pṛthivyā iḍāyās padam asi ghṛtavat svāhā / asme ramasva / asme te bandhuḥ / tve rāyaḥ / me rāyaḥ / mā vayam rāyaspoṣeṇa vi yauṣma / toto rāyaḥ //
analyzed: adityāḥ tvā mūrdhan ā jigharmi devayajane pṛthivyāḥ iḍāyāḥ padam asi ghṛtavat svāhā asme ramasva    asme te bandhuḥ tve rāyaḥ   me rāyaḥ   mā vayam rāyaspoṣeṇa vi yauṣma   totar rāyaḥ
translated: I warm thee on the head of Aditi, on the altar of earth, the place of Ida. Thou art full of ghee. Hail! Delight thee in us. Thy friend is in us. In thee are riches. In me are riches. Let us not be deprived of abundance of riches through thy favour. Come hither, O wealth.

original: sam akhye devyā dhiyā saṃ dakṣiṇayorucakṣasā / mā ma āyuḥ pra moṣīr mo ahaṃ tava / vīraṃ videya tava devi saṃdṛśi //
analyzed: sam akhye devyā dhiyā sam dakṣiṇayā uru cakṣasā   mā me āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ mā u aham tava    vīram videya tava devi saṃdṛśi
translated: I have been united with the Goddess's thought, with the eye that looks on the gifts. Do not take away my life, nor will I take away yours. May I know the hero in your sight, O Goddess.

original: eṣa te gāyatro bhāga iti me somāya brūtād eṣa te traiṣṭubho bhāga iti me somāya brūtād eṣa te jāgato bhāga iti me somāya brūtāc chandonāmānām sāmrājyaṃ gaccheti me somāya brūtāt //
analyzed: eṣa te gāyatraḥ bhāgaḥ iti me somāya brūtāt eṣa te traiṣṭubhaḥ bhāgaḥ iti me somāya brūtāt eṣa te jāgataḥ bhāgaḥ iti me somāya brūtāt chandaḥ nāmānām sāmrājyam gaccha iti me somāya brūtāt
translated: Say to Soma for me, This is your share of the Gayatri meter. Say to Soma for me, This is your share of the Tristubh meter. Say to Soma for me, This is your share of the Jagati meter. Say to Soma for me, Go to the kingship of the meters by name.

original: āsmāko 'si śukras te grahyo vicitas tvā vi cinvantu //
analyzed: āsmākaḥ si śukraḥ te grahyaḥ vicitaḥ tvā vi cinvantu
translated: You belong to us. The bright one is to be grasped for you. The variegated one shall arrange you.

original: abhi tyaṃ devam savitāram oṇyoḥ kavikratum arcāmi satyasavam ratnadhām abhi priyaṃ matiṃ kavim //
analyzed: abhi tyam devam savitāram oṇyoḥ kavi kratum arcāmi satya savam ratna dhām abhi priyam matim kavim
translated: I praise that god Savita, the wise one, between the two bowls, the one with true impulse, the giver of treasure, the dear thought, the wise one.

original: ūrdhvā yasyāmatir bhā adidyutat savīmani hiraṇyapāṇir amimīta sukratuḥ kṛpā svaḥ //🔽prajābhyas tvā //
analyzed: ūrdhvā yasya amatiḥ bhās adidyutat savīmani hiraṇya pāṇiḥ amimīta su kratuḥ kṛpā svar  prajābhyaḥ tvā
translated: His lofty impulse shines forth in his own power. The one with true wisdom, with golden hands, has measured the sky with his mind.🔽For the offspring, you!

original: prajās tvānuprāṇantu prajās tvam anuprāṇihi //
analyzed: prajāḥ tvā anuprāṇantu prajāḥ tvam anuprāṇihi
translated: May the offspring follow you. May you follow the offspring.

original: śukraṃ tvā śukreṇa krīṇāmi candraṃ candreṇāmṛtam amṛtena / sagme te goḥ / asme te candrāṇi / tapasas tanūr asi prajāpater varṇaḥ parameṇa paśunā krīyase sahasrapoṣaṃ puṣeyam //
analyzed: śukram tvā śukreṇa krīṇāmi candram candreṇa amṛtam amṛtena    sagme te goḥ    asme te candrāṇi    tapasaḥ tanūḥ asi prajāpateḥ varṇaḥ parameṇa paśunā krīyase sahasra poṣam puṣeyam
translated: I buy thee, bright with brightness, the moon with the moon, the immortal with the immortal. In thy mouth be the cow. In thee be the moon. Thou art the body of heat, the colour of Prajapati. Thou art bought with the highest animal. May I prosper with a thousandfold increase.
