original: mitro na ehi sumitradhaḥ / indrasyorum ā viśa dakṣiṇam uśann uśantam syonaḥ syonam / svāna bhrājāṅghāre bambhāre hasta suhasta kṛśāno / ete vaḥ somakrayaṇās tān rakṣadhvaṃ mā vo dabhan //🔽pari māgne duścaritād bādhasvā mā sucarite bhaja / ud āyuṣā svāyuṣodasthām amṛtām anu //
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ ehi sumitra dhaḥ   indrasya ūrum ā viśa dakṣiṇam uśan uśantam syonaḥ syonam    svāna bhrāja aṅghāre bambhāre hasta suhasta kṛśāno    ete vaḥ soma krayaṇāḥ tān rakṣadhvam mā vaḥ dabhan  pari mā agne duścaritāt bādhasva mā su carite bhaja     ud āyuṣā su āyuṣā udasthām amṛtām anu
translated: Come hither as a friend, O Mitra, to the friend. Enter the right thigh of Indra, the eager one the eager, the kindly one the kindly. O Svana, O Bhrâja, O Aṅghâri, O Bambhâri, O Hasta, O Suhasta, O Kṛśâna, these are your Soma-prices. Keep them. Let them not fail you.🔽Keep us afar, O Agni, from evil-doing. Allot to us good conduct. With life have we risen from our own life. We have risen to the immortal.

original: prati panthām apadmahi svastigām anehasam / yena viśvāḥ pari dviṣo vṛṇakti vindate vasu //
analyzed: prati panthām apadmahi svasti gām anehasam    yena viśvāḥ pari dviṣaḥ vṛṇakti vindate vasu
translated: We have found the path that leadeth to bliss, that hath no hindrance, Whereby one may avoid all enemies, and win wealth.

original: adityās tvag asi / adityai sada ā sīda / astabhnād dyāṃ vṛṣabho antarikṣam amimīta varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyāḥ / āsīdad viśvā bhuvanāni samrāḍ viśvet tāni varuṇasya vratāni //🔽vaneṣu vy antarikṣaṃ tatāna vājam arvatsu paya usriyāsu / hṛtsu kratuṃ varuṇo vikṣv agniṃ divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau //
analyzed: adityāḥ tvac asi   adityai sadaḥ ā sīda    astabhnāt dyām vṛṣabhaḥ antarikṣam amimīta varimāṇam pṛthivyāḥ   āsīdat viśvā bhuvanāni samrāj viśvā id tāni varuṇasya vratāni  vaneṣu vi antarikṣam tatāna vājam arvatsu payaḥ usriyāsu    hṛtsu kratum varuṇaḥ vikṣu agnim divi sūryam adadhāt somam adrau
translated: Thou art the skin of Aditi. Sit on the seat of Aditi. The Bull hath stablished the sky, hath measured the air's breadth, and the earth's width. The Sovran Lord hath sat him down on all existing things: all these are Varuṇa's ordinances.🔽In the woods he hath stretched out the air, and in the steeds the strength, and in the cows the milk. In the hearts he hath placed thought, in all places the fire, the sun in the sky, and the Soma on the mountain.

original: sūryasya cakṣur ārohāgner akṣṇaḥ kanīnakam / yatraitraśebhir īyase bhrājamāno vipaścitā //
analyzed: sūryasya cakṣuḥ āroha agneḥ akṣṇaḥ kanīnakam    yatraitraśebhiḥ īyase bhrājamānaḥ vipaścitā
translated: Mount the eye of Sûrya, the pupil of the eye of Agni, Wherewith, shining, thou goest with the swift steeds, O thou of exceeding wisdom.

original: usrāv etaṃ dhūrṣāhau yujyethām anaśrū avīrahaṇau brahmacodanau / svasti yajamānasya gṛhān gacchatam //
analyzed: usrau etam dhūrṣāhau yujyethām an aśrū a vīra haṇau brahma codanau            gacchatam
translated: Ye two, O oxen, who bear the yoke, who are free from tears, who slay not the hero, who urge the prayer, go ye to the house of the sacrificer in safety.

original: bhadro me 'si pracyavasva bhuvaspate viśvāny abhi dhāmāni //
analyzed: bhadraḥ me si pracyavasva bhuvaspate viśvāni abhi dhāmāni
translated: Thou art auspicious to me, O lord of the world, go forward. Pass over all the worlds.

original: mā tvā paripariṇo vidan mā tvā paripanthino vidan mā vṛkā aghāyavo vidan //
analyzed: mā tvā paripariṇaḥ vidan mā tvā paripanthinaḥ vidan mā vṛkāḥ aghāyavaḥ vidan
translated: Let not the robbers find thee, let not the thieves find thee. Let not the wolves, the evil-doers, find thee.

original: śyeno bhūtvā parā pata yajamānasya gṛhān gaccha tan nau samskṛtam //
analyzed: śyenaḥ bhūtvā parā pata yajamānasya gṛhān gaccha tat nau samskṛtam
translated: Becoming a hawk, fly away. Go to the house of the sacrificer. That is our agreement.

original: namo mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase maho devāya tad ṛtam saparyata / dūredṛśe devajātāya ketave divas putrāya sūryāya śamsata //
analyzed: namaḥ mitrasya varuṇasya cakṣase mahaḥ devāya tat ṛtam saparyata    dūredṛśe deva jātāya ketave divaḥ putrāya sūryāya śamsata
translated: Homage to the eye of Mitra and of Varuna: to that great God offer ye worship, to the Truth. To the far-seeing Ensign born of Gods, to the Son of Heaven, to Sûrya speak reverently.

original: varuṇasyottambhanam asi / varuṇasya skambhasarjanī sthaḥ / varuṇasya ṛtasadany asi varuṇasya ṛtasadanam asi / varuṇasya ṛtasadanam ā sīda //
analyzed: varuṇasya uttambhanam asi   varuṇasya skambha sarjanī sthaḥ   varuṇasya ṛta sadanī asi varuṇasya ṛta sadanam asi    varuṇasya ṛta sadanam ā sīda
translated: Thou art the prop of Varuna. Ye are the prop and the prop-pin of Varuna. Thou art the seat of Varuna's law. Thou art the seat of Varuna's law. Sit on the seat of Varuna's law.

original: yā te dhāmāni haviṣā yajanti tā te viśvā paribhūr astu yajñam / gayasphānaḥ prataraṇaḥ suvīro 'vīrahā pracarā soma duryān //
analyzed: yā te dhāmāni haviṣā yajanti tā te viśvā paribhūḥ astu yajñam    gaya sphānaḥ prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ vīra hā pracara soma duryān
translated: All those abodes of thine which men adore with sacrificial gifts, may all of these attend thy sacrifice. Giver of food, protector, with brave sons, slaying no man, pass through the houses, O Soma.

original: agnes tanūr asi viṣṇave tvā somasya tanūr asi viṣṇave tvātither ātithyam asi viṣṇave śyenāya tvā somabhṛte viṣṇave tvāgnaye tvā rāyaspoṣade viṣṇave tvā //
analyzed: agneḥ tanūḥ asi viṣṇave tvā somasya tanūḥ asi viṣṇave tvā atitheḥ ātithyam asi viṣṇave śyenāya tvā soma bhṛte viṣṇave tvā agnaye tvā rāyaspoṣa de viṣṇave tvā
translated: Thou art the body of Agni: thee for Vishnu. Thou art the body of Soma: thee for Vishnu. Thou art the hospitality of the guest: thee for Vishnu. Thee for the falcon bearing Soma: thee for Vishnu. Thee for Agni, giver of increase of wealth: thee for Vishnu.

original: agner janitram asi / vṛṣaṇau sthaḥ / urvaśy asi / āyur asi / purūravā asi / gāyatreṇa tvā chandasā manthāmi / traiṣṭubhena tvā chandasā manthāmi / jāgatena tvā chandasā manthāmi //
analyzed: agneḥ janitram asi    vṛṣaṇau sthaḥ   urvaśī asi   āyuḥ asi   purūravāḥ asi    gāyatreṇa tvā chandasā manthāmi   traiṣṭubhena tvā chandasā manthāmi    jāgatena tvā chandasā manthāmi
translated: Thou art the birthplace of Agni. Ye are the two male ones. Thou art Urvasi. Thou art life. Thou art Pururavas. With the Gayatri metre I churn thee. With the Tristubh metre I churn thee. With the Jagati metre I churn thee.

original: bhavataṃ naḥ samanasau sacetasāv arepasau / mā yajñam himsiṣṭaṃ mā yajñapatiṃ jātavedasau śivau bhavatam adya naḥ //
analyzed: bhavatam naḥ samanasau sacetasau arepasau mā yajñam himsiṣṭam mā yajñapatim jātavedasau śivau bhavatam adya naḥ
translated: Be ye of one mind, of one thought, free from disease, to us. Injure not the sacrifice, injure not the lord of the sacrifice, O ye two Jâtavedas. Be gracious to us this day.

original: agnāv agniś carati praviṣṭa ṛṣīṇāṃ putro abhiśastipāvā / sa naḥ syonaḥ suyajā yajeha devebhyo havyam sadam aprayucchant svāhā //
analyzed: agnau agniḥ carati praviṣṭaḥ ṛṣīṇām putraḥ abhiśasti pāvā    sa naḥ syonaḥ suyajā yaja iha devebhyaḥ havyam sadam aprayucchan svāhā
translated: In Agni moveth Agni, entered, the son of the Rishis, the guardian from the curse. Be gracious to us, well sacrificing, offer here the oblation to the Gods, ever watchful. Svâhâ!

original: āpataye tvā paripataye gṛhṇāmi tanūnaptrye śākvarāya śakvana ojiṣṭhāya / anādhṛṣṭam asy anādhṛṣyaṃ devānām ojo 'nabhiśasty abhiśastipā anabhiśastenyam añjasā satyam upa geṣam svite mā dhāḥ //
analyzed: āpataye tvā paripataye gṛhṇāmi tanū naptrye śākvarāya śakvane ojiṣṭhāya   anādhṛṣṭam asi anādhṛṣyam devānām ojaḥ na abhiśasti abhiśasti pāḥ an abhiśastenyam añjasā satyam upa geṣam svite mā dhāḥ
translated: Thee for the downward, thee for the upward course I take, O Tanûnapât, thee for the Shakvara, for the Shakvara's strength, most mighty. Unassailed art thou, unassailable, the Gods' strength, uncursed, a guardian from the curse, unblasphemed. I have approached the truth directly. Do thou make me happy.

original: agne vratapās tve vratapā yā tava tanūr iyam sā mayi yo mama tanūr eṣā sā tvayi / saha nau vratapate vratāny anu me dīkṣāṃ dīkṣāpatir manyatām anu tapas tapaspatiḥ //
analyzed: agne vrata pāḥ tve vrata pāḥ yā tava tanūḥ iyam sā mayi yā u mama tanūḥ eṣā sā tvayi    saha nau vratapate vratāni anu me dīkṣām dīkṣā patiḥ manyatām anu tapaḥ tapaspatiḥ
translated: O Agni, guardian of vows, in thee, O guardian of vows, is that body of thine, it is in me; that body of mine is in thee. Together, O lord of vows, let us observe the vows. Let the lord of consecration regard my consecration, let the lord of austerity regard my austerity.

original: amśuramśuṣ ṭe deva somāpyāyatām indrāyaikadhanavide / ā tubhyam indraḥ pyāyatām ā tvam indrāya pyāyasva / ā pyāyayāsmānt sakhīnt sanyā medhayā svasti te deva soma sutyām aśīya //
analyzed: amśuḥ amśuḥ te deva soma āpyāyatām indrāya eka dhana vide    ā tubhyam indraḥ pyāyatām ā tvam indrāya pyāyasva   ā pyāyaya asmān sakhīn sanyā medhayā svasti te deva soma sutyām aśīya  /
translated: May the ray, O god Soma, swell for thee, for Indra who knows the one treasure. Let Indra swell for thee; swell thou for Indra. Swell us, O Soma, our friends, with the sacrifice. Prosperously may I attain thy pressing, O god Soma.

original: eṣṭā rāyaḥ preṣe bhagāya ṛtam ṛtavādibhyo namo dyāvāpṛthivībhyām //
analyzed: eṣṭāḥ rāyaḥ pra iṣe bhagāya ṛtam ṛta vādibhyaḥ namaḥ dyāvāpṛthivībhyām
translated: Desired are riches for the envoy, for Bhaga. Truth to the utterers of truth. Homage to Dyaus and Prithivī.

original: yā te agne 'yaḥśayā tanūr varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā / ugraṃ vaco apāvadhīt tveṣaṃ vaco apāvadhīt svāhā / yā te agne rajaḥśayā tanūr varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā / ugraṃ vaco apāvadhīt tveṣaṃ vaco apāvadhīt svāhā / yā te agne hariśayā tanūr varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā / ugraṃ vaco apāvadhīt tveṣaṃ vaco apāvadhīt svāhā //
analyzed: yā te agne yaḥ śayā tanūḥ varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā   ugram vacaḥ apāvadhīt tveṣam vacaḥ apāvadhīt svāhā   yā te agne rajaḥ śayā tanūḥ varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā   ugram vacaḥ apāvadhīt tveṣam vacaḥ apāvadhīt svāhā    yā te agne hari śayā tanūḥ varṣiṣṭhā gahvareṣṭhā    ugram vacaḥ apāvadhīt tveṣam vacaḥ apāvadhīt svāhā  /
translated: That body of thine, O Agni, which is most excellent, which is in the iron, which is in the wood, which is in the water, which is in the plants, which is in the trees, which is in all beings, which is in all creatures, which is in the past, which is in the future, which is in the present, which is in the seen, which is in the unseen, which is in all that exists, which is in all that does not exist, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in all that is to be, which is in all that is not to be, which is in all that is, which is in all that is not, which is in

original: taptāyanī me 'si / vittāyanī me 'si / avatān mā nāthitāt / avatān mā vyathitāt / vided agnir nabho nāma / agne aṅgira āyunā nāmnehi / yo 'syāṃ pṛthivyām asi yat te 'nādhṛṣṭaṃ nāma yajñiyaṃ tena tvā dadhe / vided agnir nabho nāma / agne aṅgira āyunā nāmnehi / yo dvitīyasyāṃ pṛthivyām asi yat te 'nādhṛṣṭaṃ nāma yajñiyaṃ tena tvā dadhe / vided agnir nabho nāma / agne aṅgira āyunā nāmnehi / yas tṛtīyasyāṃ pṛthivyām asi yat te 'nādhṛṣṭaṃ nāma yajñiyaṃ tena tvā dadhe / anu tvā devavītaye //
analyzed: taptāyanī me si   vittāyanī me si    avatāt mā nāthitāt    avatāt mā vyathitāt   videt agniḥ nabhaḥ nāma   agne aṅgiraḥ āyunā nāmnā ihi   yaḥ u syām pṛthivyām asi yat te na ādhṛṣṭam nāma yajñiyam tena tvā dadhe    videt agniḥ nabhaḥ nāma   agne aṅgiraḥ āyunā nāmnā ihi   yaḥ dvitīyasyām pṛthivyām asi yat te na ādhṛṣṭam nāma yajñiyam tena tvā dadhe    videt agniḥ nabhaḥ nāma   agne aṅgiraḥ āyunā nāmnā ihi   yaḥ tṛtīyasyā
translated: Thou art my warm-hearted, thou art my helpful friend. Help me from want of a protector, help me from want of a refuge. Let Agni know the name Nabhas. O Agni, O Angiras, come hither with thy name of life. Whatsoever thou art on this earth, thy inviolable, sacrificial name, with that I establish thee. Let Agni know the name Nabhas. O Agni, O Angiras, come hither with thy name of life. Whatsoever thou art on the second earth, thy inviolable, sacrificial name, with that I establish thee. Let Agni know the name Nabhas. O Agni, O Angiras, come hither with thy name of life. Whatsoever thou art on the third earth, thy inviolable, sacrificial name, with that I establish thee. I follow thee, O god, for the feast.

original: simhy asi sapatnasāhī devebhyaḥ kalpasva / simhy asi sapatnasāhī devebhyaḥ śundhasva / simhy asi sapatnasāhī devebhyaḥ śumbhasva //
analyzed: simhi asi sapatna sāhī devebhyaḥ kalpasva   simhi asi sapatna sāhī devebhyaḥ śundhasva    simhi asi sapatna sāhī devebhyaḥ śumbhasva
translated: Thou art the lioness, the conqueror of foes. Be ready for the gods. Thou art the lioness, the conqueror of foes. Be pure for the gods. Thou art the lioness, the conqueror of foes. Be radiant for the gods.

original: indraghoṣas tvā vasubhiḥ purastāt pātu / pracetās tvā rudraiḥ paścāt pātu / manojavās tvā pitṛbhir dakṣiṇataḥ pātu / viśvakarmā tvādityair uttarataḥ pātu / idam ahaṃ taptaṃ vār bahirdhā yajñān niḥ sṛjāmi //
analyzed: indraghoṣaḥ tvā vasubhiḥ purastāt pātu   pracetāḥ tvā rudraiḥ paścāt pātu   manojavāḥ tvā pitṛbhiḥ dakṣiṇatas pātu    viśvakarmā tvā ādityaiḥ uttaratas pātu    idam aham taptam vār bahirdhā yajñāt niḥ sṛjāmi
translated: Let Indra-Ghosha protect thee from the east with the Vasus. Let Prachetas protect thee from the west with the Rudras. Let Manojava protect thee from the south with the Fathers. Let Vishvakarma protect thee from the north with the Adityas. Herewith I cast out the heated water from the sacrifices.

original: simhy asi svāhā / simhy asy ādityavaniḥ svāhā / simhy asi brahmavaniḥ kṣatravaniḥ svāhā / simhy asi suprajāvanī rāyaspoṣavaniḥ svāhā / simhy asy āvaha devān yajamānāya svāhā / bhūtebhyas tvā //
analyzed: simhī asi svāhā   simhī asi āditya vaniḥ svāhā           asi brahma vaniḥ kṣatra vaniḥ svāhā   simhī asi su prajā vaniḥ rāyaspoṣa vaniḥ svāhā                asi āvaha devān yajamānāya svāhā   bhūtebhyaḥ tvā
translated: Thou art the lioness, hail! Thou art the lioness, winning the Adityas, hail! Thou art the lioness, winning the Brahmans, winning the Kshatriyas, hail! Thou art the lioness, winning good offspring, winning abundance of wealth, hail! Thou art the lioness, bring the gods to the sacrificer, hail! Thee to the beings!

original: dhruvo 'si pṛthivīṃ dṛmha / dhruvakṣid asy antarikṣaṃ dṛmha / acyutakṣid asi divaṃ dṛmha / agneḥ purīṣam asi //
analyzed: dhruvaḥ si pṛthivīm dṛmha   dhruva kṣit asi antarikṣam dṛmha    acyuta kṣit asi divam dṛmha    agneḥ purīṣam asi
translated: Thou art firm, support the earth. Thou art firm-seated, support the atmosphere. Thou art unshaken-seated, support the sky. Thou art the filling of Agni.

original: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ / vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ svāhā //
analyzed: yuñjate manaḥ uta yuñjate dhiyaḥ viprāḥ viprasya bṛhataḥ vipaścitaḥ    vi hotrā dadhe vayunā vid ekaḥ id mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ svāhā
translated: They yoke the mind, they yoke the thoughts, the priests of the great wise priest. He alone, knowing the ordinances, assigns the priestly offices. Great is the praise of the god Savitar. Svâhâ!

original: idaṃ viṣṇur vicakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam / samūḍham asya pāmsare svāhā //
analyzed: idam viṣṇuḥ vicakrame tredhā ni dadhe padam   samūḍham asya pāmsare svāhā
translated: This Vishnu strode forth, he set his foot thrice, he placed it firmly in the dust, Svâhâ!

original: urāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtam sūyavasinī manave daśasyā / vy askabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ svāhā //
analyzed: urāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtam sūyavasinī manave daśasyā    vi askabhnāḥ rodasī viṣṇo ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhitas mayūkhaiḥ svāhā
translated: Be ye two full of milk, full of milk for the man who hath good grass, for the sake of the sacrifice. Ye have stretched out these two worlds, O Vishnu. Thou hast fixed the earth on high with thy rays. Svâhâ!

original: devaśrutau deveṣv ā ghoṣatam / prācī pretam adhvaraṃ kalpayantī ūrdhvaṃ yajñaṃ nayataṃ mā jihvaratam / svaṃ goṣṭham ā vadataṃ devī durye āyur mā nir vādiṣṭaṃ prajāṃ mā nir vādiṣṭam / atra ramethāṃ varṣman pṛthivyāḥ //
analyzed: deva śrutau deveṣu ā ghoṣatam   prācī pretam adhvaram kalpayantī ūrdhvam yajñam nayatam mā jihvaratam    svam goṣṭham ā vadatam devī durye āyuḥ mā niḥ vādiṣṭam prajām mā niḥ vādiṣṭam     atra ramethām varṣman pṛthivyāḥ
translated: O ye two that are heard by the gods, proclaim ye among the gods. Going forward, arranging the sacrifice, lead ye the sacrifice upwards, do not falter. Call ye to your own fold, O ye two goddesses, do not call away our life, do not call away our offspring. Here do ye delight yourselves in the middle of the earth.🔽The mighty deeds of Vishnu will I tell you, who meted out the regions of the earth,

original: viṣṇor nu kaṃ vīryāṇi pra vocaṃ yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāmsi / yo askabhāyad uttaram sadhasthaṃ vicakramāṇas tredhorugāyaḥ //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ nu kam vīryāṇi pra vocam yaḥ pārthivāni vimame rajāmsi    yaḥ askabhāyat uttaram sadhastham vicakramāṇaḥ tredhā uru gāyaḥ
translated: Who fixed the highest habitation, the far-stretching, the three-fold, the lofty one.

original: viṣṇave tvā //
analyzed: viṣṇave tvā
translated: Thee for Vishnu.🔽O Vishnu, from the sky or from the earth, or from the great wide region of air,

original: divo vā viṣṇa uta vā pṛthivyā maho vā viṣṇa uror antarikṣāt / ubhā hi hastā vasunā pṛṇasvā prayaccha dakṣiṇād ota savyāt //
analyzed: divaḥ vā viṣṇo uta vā pṛthivyāḥ mahaḥ vā viṣṇo uroḥ antarikṣāt    ubhā hi hastā vasunā pṛṇasva prayaccha dakṣiṇāt ā uta savyāt
translated: Fill both thy hands with treasure, give from the right and from the left.

original: viṣṇave tvā //
analyzed: viṣṇave tvā
translated: Thee for Vishnu.

original: pra tad viṣṇu stavate vīryeṇa mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ / yasyoruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣv adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā //
analyzed: pra tat viṣṇuḥ stavate vīryeṇa mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ    yasya uruṣu triṣu vikramaṇeṣu adhikṣiyanti bhuvanāni viśvā
translated: That Vishnu is praised for his strength, like a terrible beast, a forest-roaming mountain-dweller, in whose three strides all the worlds are contained.

original: viṣṇo rarāṭam asi / viṣṇoḥ śnaptre sthaḥ / viṣṇoḥ syūr asi / viṣṇor dhruvo 'si / vaiṣṇavam asi viṣṇave tvā //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ rarāṭam asi viṣṇoḥ śnaptre sthaḥ   viṣṇoḥ syūḥ asi    viṣṇoḥ dhruvaḥ si    vaiṣṇavam asi viṣṇave tvā
translated: You are the forehead ornament of Vishnu. You are the two jaws of Vishnu. You are the thread of Vishnu. You are the firm one of Vishnu. You are of Vishnu. For Vishnu you.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nāry asi / idam aham rakṣasāṃ grīvā apikṛntāmi / bṛhann asi bṛhadravā bṛhatīm indrāya vācaṃ vada //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   ā dade nārī asi   idam aham rakṣasām grīvāḥ apikṛntāmi   bṛhan asi bṛhadravāḥ bṛhatīm indrāya vācam vada
translated: In the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take you. You are a woman. Here I cut the throats of the Rakshas. You are great, with great sound. Speak the great speech to Indra.

original: rakṣohaṇaṃ valagahanaṃ vaiṣṇavīm / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me niṣṭyo yam amātyo nicakhāna / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me samāno yam asamāno nicakhāna / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me sabandhur yam asabandhur nicakhāna / idam ahaṃ taṃ valagam ut kirāmi yaṃ me sajāto yam asajāto nicakhāna / ut kṛtyāṃ kirāmi //
analyzed: rakṣaḥ haṇam valaga hanam vaiṣṇavīm    idam aham tam valagam ud kirāmi yam me niṣṭyaḥ yam amātyaḥ nicakhāna     idam aham tam valagam ud kirāmi yam me samānaḥ yam asamānaḥ nicakhāna    idam aham tam valagam ud kirāmi yam me sabandhuḥ yam a sabandhuḥ nicakhāna     idam aham tam valagam ud kirāmi yam me sajātaḥ yam a sajātaḥ nicakhāna             kirāmi
translated: The Rakshas-slayer, the charm-destroyer, the Vishnu's. This charm of mine which the neighbour or the non-neighbour hath buried, this charm of mine I uproot and drive away. This charm of mine which the equal or the unequal hath buried, this charm of mine I uproot and drive away. This charm of mine which the kinsman or the non-kinsman hath buried, this charm of mine I uproot and drive away. This charm of mine which the co-uterine or the non-co-uterine hath buried, this charm of mine I uproot and drive away. I uproot the charm.

original: svarāḍ asi / satrarāḍ asy abhimātihā / janarāḍ asi rakṣohā / sarvarāḍ asy amitrahā //
analyzed: svarāj asi    satra rāj asi abhimāti hā   jana rāj asi rakṣaḥ hā   sarva rāj asi amitra hā
translated: Thou art the self-ruling, the ruling in the Sattra, the overcomer of enemies, the people's ruler, the Rakshas-slayer, the all-ruling, the slayer of foes.

original: rakṣohaṇo vo valagahanaḥ prokṣāmi vaiṣṇavān / rakṣohaṇo vo valagahano 'va nayāmi vaiṣṇavān / rakṣohaṇo vo valagahano 'va stṝṇāmi vaiṣṇavān / rakṣohaṇau vāṃ valagahanā upa dadhāmi vaiṣṇavī / rakṣohaṇau tvā valagahanau pary ūhāmi vaiṣṇavī / vaiṣṇavam asi / vaiṣṇavā stha //
analyzed: rakṣaḥ haṇaḥ vaḥ valaga hanaḥ prokṣāmi vaiṣṇavān    rakṣaḥ haṇaḥ vaḥ valaga hanaḥ nayāmi vaiṣṇavān    rakṣaḥ haṇaḥ vaḥ valaga hanaḥ va stṝṇāmi vaiṣṇavān               upa dadhāmi vaiṣṇavī      tvā valaga hanau pari ūhāmi vaiṣṇavī            asi     stha
translated: I sprinkle you, the Rakshas-slayers, the charm-destroyers, the Vishnu's. I lead you, the Rakshas-slayers, the charm-destroyers, the Vishnu's. I strew you, the Rakshas-slayers, the charm-destroyers, the Vishnu's. I place you, the Rakshas-slayers, the charm-destroyers, the Vishnu's. I enclose you, the Rakshas-slayers, the charm-destroyers, the Vishnu's. You are Vishnu's. You are the Vishnu's.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nāry asi / idam aham rakṣasāṃ grīvā api kṛntāmi / yavo 'si yavayāsmad dveṣo yavayārātīḥ / dive tvāntarikṣāya tvā pṛthivyai tvā / śundhantāṃ lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ / pitṛṣadanam asi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   ā dade nārī asi    idam aham rakṣasām grīvāḥ api kṛntāmi   yavaḥ si yavaya asmat dveṣaḥ yavaya arātīḥ   dive tvā antarikṣāya tvā pṛthivyai tvā    śundhantām lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ pitṛṣadanam asi
translated: By the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee. Thou art a woman. I cut off the necks of the Raksases here. Thou art barley. Drive away from us hatred, drive away calamities. Thee for Dyaus, thee for Antarikṣa, thee for Pṛthivī. Be the worlds purified, the seats of the Fathers. Thou art the seat of the Fathers.

original: ud divam stabhānāntarikṣaṃ pṛṇa dṛmhasva pṛthivyām / dyutānās tvā māruto minotu mitrāvaruṇau dhruveṇa dharmaṇā / brahmavani tvā kṣatravani tvā rāyaspoṣavani pary ūhāmi / brahma dṛmha kṣatraṃ dṛmhāyur dṛmha prajāṃ dṛmha //
analyzed: ud divam stabhāna antarikṣam pṛṇa dṛmhasva pṛthivyām    dyutānāḥ tvā mārutaḥ minotu mitrāvaruṇau dhruveṇa dharmaṇā    brahma vani tvā kṣatra vani tvā rāyaspoṣa vani pari ūhāmi    brahma dṛmha kṣatram dṛmha āyuḥ dṛmha prajām dṛmha
translated: Prop up the sky, fill the atmosphere, be firm on the earth. Let the impetuous Marut settle thee, Mitra and Varuna with firm law. Thee for the love of holy power, thee for the love of princely power, thee for the love of increase of wealth I encompass. Prop holy power, prop princely power, prop life, prop offspring.

original: dhruvāsi dhruvo 'yaṃ yajamāno 'sminn āyatane prajayā paśubhir bhūyāt / ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī pūryethām / indrasya chadir asi viśvajanasya chāyā //
analyzed: dhruvā asi dhruvaḥ yam yajamānaḥ u smin āyatane prajayā paśubhiḥ bhūyāt   ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī pūryethām    indrasya chadiḥ asi viśva janasya chāyā
translated: Thou art firm. Firm be this sacrificer in this abode with offspring and with cattle. Be ye filled with ghee, O ye heaven and earth. Thou art the roof of Indra, the shade of all men.

original: pari tvā girvaṇo gira imā bhavantu viśvataḥ / vṛddhāyum anu vṛddhayo juṣṭā bhavantu juṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: pari tvā girvaṇaḥ giraḥ imāḥ bhavantu viśvatas   vṛddha āyum anu vṛddhayaḥ juṣṭāḥ bhavantu juṣṭayaḥ
translated: May these songs of mine, O lover of song, be around thee on every side. May the delights be delightful to thee, the ever-waxing, in thy ever-waxing age.

original: indrasya syūr asi / indrasya dhruvo 'si / aindram asi / vaiśvadevam asi //
analyzed: indrasya syūḥ asi   indrasya dhruvaḥ si    aindram asi   vaiśvadevam asi
translated: Thou art the thread of Indra. Thou art the firm one of Indra. Thou art of Indra. Thou art of the All-gods.

original: vibhūr asi pravāhaṇaḥ / vahnir asi havyavāhanaḥ / śvātro 'si pracetāḥ / tutho 'si viśvavedāḥ //
analyzed: vibhūḥ asi pravāhaṇaḥ   vahniḥ asi havya vāhanaḥ   śvātraḥ si pracetāḥ   tuthaḥ si viśva vedāḥ
translated: Thou art the all-pervading, the swift-moving. Thou art the bearer of oblations. Thou art the swift, the wise. Thou art the all-knowing.

original: uśig asi kaviḥ / aṅghārir asi bambhāriḥ / avasyūr asi duvasvān / śundhyūr asi mārjālīyaḥ / samrāḍ asi kṛśānuḥ / pariṣadyo 'si pavamānaḥ / nabho 'si pratakvā / mṛṣṭo 'si havyasūdanaḥ / ṛtadhāmāsi svarjyotiḥ //
analyzed: uśij asi kaviḥ   aṅghāriḥ asi bambhāriḥ   avasyuḥ asi duvasvān   śundhyuḥ asi mārjālīyaḥ samrāj asi kṛśānuḥ pariṣadyaḥ si pavamānaḥ   nabhā u si pratakvā    mṛṣṭaḥ si havya sūdanaḥ   ṛta dhāmā asi svar jyotiḥ
translated: Thou art the swift, the wise. Thou art the supporter, the bearer. Thou art the one to be served, the worshipper. Thou art the pure, the purifier. Thou art the all-encompassing, the all-pervading. Thou art the seat of oblations. Thou art the abode of truth, the light of heaven.

original: samudro 'si viśvavyacāḥ / ajo 'sy ekapāt / ahir asi budhnyaḥ / vāg asy aindram asi sado 'si / ṛtasya dvārau mā mā saṃtāptam / adhvanām adhvapate pra mā tira svasti me smin pathi devayāne bhūyāt //
analyzed: samudraḥ si viśva vyacāḥ   ajaḥ si eka pād   ahiḥ asi budhnyaḥ vāc asi aindram asi sadaḥ si    ṛtasya dvārau mā mā saṃtāptam    adhvanām adhva pate pra mā tira svasti me smin pathi deva yāne bhūyāt
translated: Thou art the ocean, the all-encompassing. Thou art the goat with one foot. Thou art the serpent of the deep. Thou art speech. Thou art of Indra. Thou art the seat. Let not the doors of truth burn me. O lord of paths, lead me across. Let there be well-being for me on this path leading to the gods.

original: mitrasya mā cakṣuṣekṣadhvam / agnayaḥ sagarāḥ sagarā stha sagareṇa nāmnā raudreṇānīkena pāta māgnayaḥ pipṛta māgnayo gopāyata mā namo vo 'stu mā mā himsiṣṭa //
analyzed: mitrasya mā cakṣuṣā īkṣadhvam    agnayaḥ sagarāḥ sagarāḥ stha sagareṇa nāmnā raudreṇa anīkena pāta mā agnayaḥ pipṛta mā agnayaḥ gopāyata mā namaḥ vaḥ stu mā mā himsiṣṭa
translated: Look ye upon me with the eye of Mitra. Ye are the united fires, united are ye, with the united name, with the terrible host. Protect me, O ye fires, nourish me, O ye fires, guard me. Homage be to you. Do ye no harm to me.

original: jyotir asi viśvarūpaṃ viśveṣāṃ devānām samit / tvam soma tanūkṛdbhyo dveṣobhyo 'nyakṛtebhya uru yantāsi varūtham svāhā / juṣāṇo aptur ājyasya vetu svāhā //
analyzed: jyotiḥ asi viśva rūpam viśveṣām devānām samidh    tvam soma tanū kṛdbhyaḥ dveṣobhyaḥ nya kṛtebhyaḥ uru yantāsi varūtham svāhā   juṣāṇaḥ ap tur ājyasya vetu svāhā
translated: Thou art the light of all forms, the fuel of all the gods. Thou, O Soma, art the wide protector for the foes who have wrought harm against the bodies. Accept the ghee of the offerer. Svâhâ.

original: agne naya supathā rāya asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān / yuyodhy asmaj juhurāṇam eno bhūyiṣṭhāṃ te namaktiṃ vidhema //
analyzed: agne naya su pathā rāyaḥ asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān   yuyodhi asmat juhurāṇam enaḥ bhūyiṣṭhām te namaktim vidhema
translated: O Agni, lead us by a fair path to wealth, thou who knowest all the ways, O god. Drive from us the sin that makes us stumble. Most ample adoration be to thee.

original: ayaṃ no agnir varivas kṛṇotv ayaṃ mṛdhaḥ pura etu prabhindan / ayaṃ vājān jayatu vājasātāv ayam śatrūn jayatu jarhṛṣāṇaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ayam naḥ agniḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu ayam mṛdhaḥ puras etu prabhindan   ayam vājān jayatu vājasātau ayam śatrūn jayatu jarhṛṣāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: May this Agni make room for us. May he go forth in front, breaking through the foes. May he win the prizes in the contests for booty. May he conquer the enemies, rejoicing. Svâhâ.

original: uru viṣṇo vi kramasvoru kṣayāya nas kṛdhi / ghṛtaṃ ghṛtayone piba prapra yajñapatiṃ tira svāhā //
analyzed: uru viṣṇo vi kramasva uru kṣayāya naḥ kṛdhi   / ghṛtam ghṛta yone piba pra pra yajñapatim tira svāhā
translated: O Vishnu, spread thyself wide. Make wide room for us to dwell. Drink the ghee, O thou whose birthplace is ghee. Pass over to the lord of sacrifice. Svâhâ.

original: deva savitar eṣa te somas tam rakṣasva mā tvā dabhan / etat tvaṃ deva soma devo devām upāgā idam ahaṃ manuṣyānt saha rāyaspoṣeṇa / svāhā nir varuṇasya pāśān mucye //
analyzed: deva savitar eṣa te somaḥ tam rakṣasva mā tvā dabhan    etat tvam deva soma devaḥ devām upāgāḥ idam aham manuṣyān saha rāyaspoṣeṇa svāhā niḥ varuṇasya pāśāt mucye
translated: O God Savitar, this is thy Soma. Guard it. Let it not fail thee. Thou, O God Soma, as a God hast gone to the Gods. This (have I offered) to men along with increase of wealth. Hail! I am freed from Varuna's noose.

original: agne vratapās tve vratapā yā tava tanūr mayy abhūd eṣā sā tvayi yo mama tanūs tvayy abhūd eṣā sā mayi / yathāyathaṃ nau vratapate vratāny anu me dīkṣāṃ dīkṣāpatir amamstānu tapas tapaspatiḥ //
analyzed: agne vrata pāḥ tve vrata pāḥ yā tava tanūḥ mayi abhūt eṣā sā tvayi  yā u mama tanūḥ tvayi abhūt eṣā sā mayi    yathāyatham nau vrata pate vratāni anu me dīkṣām dīkṣā patiḥ amamsta anu tapaḥ tapaspatiḥ
translated: O Agni, guardian of vows, in thee, O guardian of vows, that form of thine which hath been in me, may that be in thee. That form of mine which hath been in thee, may that be in me. As is right, O lord of vows, according to our vows, may the lord of consecration approve my consecration, and the lord of austerity my austerity.

original: uru viṣṇo vi kramasvoru kṣayāya nas kṛdhi / ghṛtaṃ ghṛtayone piba prapra yajñapatiṃ tira svāhā //
analyzed: uru viṣṇo vi kramasva uru kṣayāya naḥ kṛdhi   / ghṛtam ghṛta yone piba pra pra yajñapatim tira svāhā
translated: O Vishnu, spread thyself widely. Make wide room for us to dwell. Drink the ghee, O ghee-born one. Go forward to the lord of the sacrifice. Hail!

original: aty anyām agāṃ nānyām upāgām arvāk tvā parebhyo 'vidaṃ paro 'varebhyaḥ / taṃ tvā juṣāmahe deva vanaspatedevayajyāyai devās tvā devayajyāyai juṣantāṃ viṣṇave tvā / oṣadhe trāyasva / svadhite mainam himsīḥ //
analyzed: ati anyām agām na anyām upāgām arvāk tvā parebhyaḥ vidam paras varebhyaḥ    tam tvā juṣāmahe deva vanaspate deva yajyāyai devāḥ tvā deva yajyāyai juṣantām viṣṇave tvā    oṣadhe trāyasva svadhite mā enam himsīḥ
translated: I have gone beyond another, I have gone up to another. I have found thee for those above, not for those below. We accept thee, O God, O lord of the forest, for the worship of the Gods. May the Gods accept thee for the worship of the Gods. For Vishnu thee. O plant, protect. O axe, do not injure him.

original: dyāṃ mā lekhīr antarikṣaṃ mā himsīḥ pṛthivyā saṃ bhava / ayam hi tvā svadhitis tetijānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya / atas tvaṃ deva vanaspate śatavalśo vi roha sahasravalśā vi vayam ruhema //
analyzed: dyām mā lekhīḥ antarikṣam mā himsīḥ pṛthivyā sam bhava    ayam hi tvā svadhitiḥ tetijānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya    atas tvam deva vanaspate śata valśaḥ vi roha sahasra valśāḥ vi vayam ruhema
translated: Dig not the sky, injure not the air, be united with the earth. For this axe, sharp-edged, hath led thee forth to great good fortune. From this place, O God, O Tree, rise up with a hundred shoots; with a thousand shoots may we rise up.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nāry asi / idam aham rakṣasāṃ grīvā api kṛntāmi / yavo 'si yavayāsmad dveṣo yavayārātīḥ / dive tvāntarikṣāya tvā pṛthivyai tvā / śundhantāṃ lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ / pitṛṣadanam asi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   ā dade nārī asi    idam aham rakṣasām grīvāḥ api kṛntāmi   yavaḥ si yavaya asmat dveṣaḥ yavaya arātīḥ   dive tvā antarikṣāya tvā pṛthivyai tvā    śundhantām lokāḥ pitṛṣadanāḥ pitṛṣadanam asi
translated: In the impulse of the God Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee. Thou art a woman. I cut the throats of the Rakshas here. Thou art barley. Drive away from us hatred, drive away evil. For Dyaus thee, for Antarik-sha thee, for Pṛthivī thee. Let the worlds be cleansed, the seats of the Fathers. Thou art the seat of the Fathers.

original: agreṇīr asi svāveśa unnetṝṇām etasya vittād adhi tvā sthāsyati / devas tvā savitā madhv anaktu / supippalābhyas tvauṣadhībhyaḥ / dyām agreṇāspṛkṣa āntarikṣaṃ madhyenāprāḥ pṛthivīm upareṇādṛmhīḥ //
analyzed: agreṇīḥ asi su āveśaḥ unnetṝṇām etasya vittāt adhi tvā sthāsyati    devaḥ tvā savitā madhu anaktu    su pippalābhyaḥ tvā oṣadhībhyaḥ   dyām agreṇa aspṛkṣaḥ āntarikṣam madhyena aprāḥ pṛthivīm upareṇa adṛmhīḥ
translated: Thou art the foremost leader, easy to enter for the Unnetris. From this place it will stand over thee. Let the God Savitar anoint thee with honey. For the plants with goodly berries thee. Thou hast touched the sky with thy top, thou hast filled the air, thou hast rested on the earth.

original: yā te dhāmāny uśmasi gamadhyai yatra gāvo bhūriśṛṅgā ayāsaḥ / atrāha tad urugāyasya viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam ava bhāri bhūri //
analyzed: yā te dhāmāni uśmasi gamadhyai yatra gāvaḥ bhūri śṛṅgāḥ ayāsaḥ   atra aha tat uru gāyasya viṣṇoḥ paramam padam ava bhāri bhūri
translated: There hath been laid down the highest place of that wide-going Vishnu.

original: brahmavani tvā kṣatravani rāyaspoṣavani pary ūhāmi / brahma dṛmha kṣatraṃ dṛmhāyur dṛmha prajāṃ dṛmha //
analyzed: brahma vani tvā kṣatra vani rāyaspoṣa vani pari ūhāmi    brahma dṛmha kṣatram dṛmha āyuḥ dṛmha prajām dṛmha
translated: I encompass thee, winning the Brahman, winning the Kshatra, winning increase of wealth. Support the Brahman, support the Kshatra, support life, support offspring.

original: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yatas vratāni paspaśe      indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: Behold the works of Vishnu, whence he looked on the observances. He, the friend of Indra, is to be yoked.

original: tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam sadā paśyanti sūrayo divīva cakṣur ātatam //🔽parivīr asi pari tvā daivīr viśo vyayantāṃ parīmaṃ yajamānam rāyo manuṣyāṇām / divaḥ sūnur asi / eṣa te pṛthivyāṃ loka āraṇyas te paśuḥ //
analyzed: tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam sadā paśyanti sūrayaḥ divi iva cakṣuḥ ātatam  / parivīḥ asi pari tvā daivīḥ viśaḥ vyayantām pari imam yajamānam rāyaḥ manuṣyāṇām    divaḥ sūnuḥ asi    eṣa te pṛthivyām lokaḥ āraṇyaḥ te paśuḥ
translated: That is the highest place of Vishnu, which the wise always behold, as the eye is stretched out in the sky.🔽Thou art the all-surrounding. May the divine clans surround thee. May they surround this sacrificer, the wealth of men. Thou art the son of heaven. This is thy place on earth. The wild animal is thine.

original: upāvīr asi / upa devān daivīr viśaḥ prāgur uśijo vahnitamān / deva tvaṣṭar vasu rama havyā te svadantām //
analyzed: upāvīḥ asi    upa devān daivīḥ viśaḥ prāguḥ uśijaḥ vahnitamān    deva tvaṣṭar vasu rama havyā te svadantām
translated: Thou art the all-approaching. The divine clans have gone up to the gods, the most eager, the most fiery. O god Tvastr, rejoice in the treasure. Let thy offerings be sweet to thee.

original: revatī ramadhvaṃ bṛhaspate dhārayā vasūni / ṛtasya tvā devahaviḥ pāśena prati muñcāmi dharṣā mānuṣaḥ //
analyzed: revatīḥ ramadhvam bṛhaspate dhāraya vasūni    ṛtasya tvā deva haviḥ pāśena prati muñcāmi dharṣa mānuṣaḥ
translated: Rejoice, O Revatî, O Brhaspati, hold fast the treasures. With the bond of holy order I bind thee, O oblation to the gods, from the violence of men.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / agnīṣomābhyāṃ juṣṭaṃ ni yunajmi / adbhyas tvauṣadhībhyo 'nu tvā mātā manyatām anu pitānu bhrātā sagarbhyo 'nu sakhā sayūthyaḥ / agnīṣomābhyāṃ tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām    agnīṣomābhyām juṣṭam ni yunajmi   adbhyaḥ tvā oṣadhībhyaḥ nu tvā mātā manyatām anu pitā anu bhrātā sagarbhyaḥ nu sakhā sa yūthyaḥ    agnīṣomābhyām tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi
translated: In the impulse of God Savitar I yoke thee, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan, for the delight of Agni and Soma. Thee for the waters, thee for the plants. Let thy mother regard thee, let thy father, let thy brother born of the same womb, let thy friend of the same herd. For the delight of Agni and Soma I sprinkle thee.

original: apāṃ perur asi / āpo devīḥ svadantu svāttaṃ cit sad devahaviḥ / saṃ te prāṇo vātena gacchatām sam aṅgāni yajatraiḥ saṃ yajñapatir āśiṣā //
analyzed: apām peruḥ asi   āpaḥ devīḥ svadantu svāttam cit sat deva haviḥ    sam te prāṇaḥ vātena gacchatām sam aṅgāni yajatraiḥ sam yajñapatiḥ āśiṣā  /
translated: Thou art the overlord of the waters. Let the divine waters be sweet to thee. Even what is well-offered, an oblation to the gods. Let thy breath go with the wind, let thy limbs with the pure, let the lord of sacrifice with the prayer.

original: ghṛtenāktau paśūms trāyethām / revati yajamāne priyaṃ dhā ā viśa / uror antarikṣāt sajūr devena vātenāsya haviṣas tmanā yaja samasya tanvā bhava / varṣo varṣīyasi yajñe yajñaptiṃ dhāḥ / svāhā devebhyaḥ / devebhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ghṛtena aktau paśūm trāyethām   revati yajamāne priyam dhāḥ ā viśa    uroḥ antarikṣāt sajūs devena vātena asya haviṣaḥ tmanā yaja sam asya tanvā bhava    varṣaḥ varṣīyasi yajñe yajñaptim dhāḥ    svāhā devebhyaḥ   devebhyaḥ svāhā
translated: Anointed with ghee, protect the cattle. O Revatî, enter the dear place of the sacrificer. From the wide atmosphere, with the god Vâta, do thou, with this oblation, sacrifice in unison with his body. Be thou with his body. In a wider sacrifice, make room for the performance. Hail to the gods. To the gods hail!

original: māhir bhūr mā pṛdākuḥ / namas ta ātānānarvā prehi / ghṛtasya kulyā upa ṛtasya pathyā anu //
analyzed: mā ahiḥ bhūḥ mā pṛdākuḥ    namaḥ te ātāna anarvā prehi    ghṛtasya kulyāḥ upa ṛtasya pathyāḥ anu
translated: Be not a serpent, be not a viper. Homage to thee, O sharp one. Go forward without turning back. Along the channels of the ghee, along the paths of holy order.

original: devīr āpaḥ śuddhā voḍhvam supariviṣṭā deveṣu / supariviṣṭā vayaṃ pariveṣṭāro bhūyāsma //🔽vācaṃ te śundhāmi / prāṇaṃ te śundhāmi / cakṣus te śundhāmi / śrotraṃ te śundhāmi / nābhiṃ te śundhāmi / meḍhraṃ te śundhāmi / pāyuṃ te śundhāmi / caritrāms te śundhāmi //
analyzed: devīḥ āpaḥ śuddhāḥ voḍhvam su pariviṣṭāḥ deveṣu   su pariviṣṭāḥ vayam pariveṣṭāraḥ bhūyāsma  vācam te śundhāmi   prāṇam te śundhāmi   cakṣuḥ te śundhāmi   śrotram te śundhāmi   nābhim te śundhāmi   meḍhram te śundhāmi   pāyum te śundhāmi   caritrān te śundhāmi
translated: O divine waters, pure, bearers of purification, well cleansed among the gods. May we be well cleansed, may we be the purifiers.🔽I purify thy speech. I purify thy breath. I purify thy eye. I purify thy ear. I purify thy navel. I purify thy penis. I purify thy anus. I purify thy footsteps.

original: manas ta ā pyāyatām / vāk ta ā pyāyatām / prāṇas ta ā pyāyatām / cakṣus ta ā pyāyatām / śrotraṃ ta ā pyāyatām / yat te krūraṃ yad āsthitaṃ tat ta ā pyāyatāṃ ni ṣṭyāyatāṃ tat te śudhyatu / śam ahobhyaḥ / oṣadhe trāyasva / svadhite mainam himsīḥ //
analyzed: manaḥ te ā pyāyatām   vāc te ā pyāyatām   prāṇaḥ te ā pyāyatām   cakṣuḥ te ā pyāyatām   śrotram te ā pyāyatām   yat te krūram yat āsthitam tat te ā pyāyatām ni styāyatām tat te śudhyatu   śam ahobhyaḥ   oṣadhe trāyasva svadhite mā enam himsīḥ
translated: May thy mind be full. May thy speech be full. May thy breath be full. May thy eye be full. May thy ear be full. Whatever is harsh in thee, whatever is firm, may that be full for thee. May it be settled. May that be purified for thee. For good days. O plant, protect. O axe, do not injure this one.

original: rakṣasāṃ bhāgo 'si / nirastam rakṣaḥ / idam aham rakṣo 'bhi tiṣṭhāmīdam aham rakṣo 'va bādha idam aham rakṣo 'dhamaṃ tamo nayāmi / ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī prorṇuvāthām / vāyo ve stokānām / agnir ājyasya vetu svāhā / svāhākṛte ūrdhvanabhasaṃ mārutaṃ gacchatam //
analyzed: rakṣasām bhāgaḥ u si   nirastam rakṣaḥ   idam aham rakṣaḥ bhi tiṣṭhāmi idam aham rakṣaḥ vaḥ bādhe idam aham rakṣaḥ dhamam tamaḥ nayāmi   ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī prorṇuvāthām   vāyo veḥ stokānām   agniḥ ājyasya vetu svāhā    svāhākṛte ūrdhva nabhasam mārutam gacchatam
translated: Thou art the share of the Rakshas. The Rakshas is cast out. I stand over the Rakshas. I drive the Rakshas away. I lead the Rakshas to the lowest darkness. With ghee do ye besprinkle heaven and earth. O Vayu, of the drops. Let Agni enjoy the ghee. Hail! Having been offered with 'Hail!' go ye to the Maruts' region that is above the sky.

original: idam āpaḥ pravahatāvadyaṃ ca malaṃ ca yat / yac cābhidudrohānṛtaṃ yac ca śepe abhīruṇam / āpo mā tasmād enasaḥ pavamānaś ca muñcatu //
analyzed: idam āpaḥ pravahata avadyam ca malam ca yat    yat ca abhidudroha anṛtam yat ca śepe abhīruṇam   āpaḥ mā tasmāt enasaḥ pavamānaḥ ca muñcatu
translated: Carry away this sin and this impurity of mine, O ye waters, whatever evil I have done in secret and in the open, whatever I have done by word, by deed, or by thought. O ye waters, deliver me from that sin.

original: saṃ te mano manasā saṃ prāṇaḥ prāṇena gacchatām / reḍ asy agniṣ ṭvā śrīṇātv āpas tvā samariṇan vātasya tvā dhrājyai pūṣṇo ramhyā ūṣmaṇo vyathiṣat / prayutaṃ dveṣaḥ //
analyzed: sam te manaḥ manasā sam prāṇaḥ prāṇena gacchatām   rej asi agniḥ tvā śrīṇātu āpaḥ tvā samariṇan vātasya tvā dhrājyai pūṣṇaḥ ramhyai ūṣmaṇaḥ vyathiṣat    prayutam dveṣaḥ
translated: Let thy mind agree with our mind, let thy breath agree with our breath. Thou art red; may Agni unite thee; may the waters have united thee. For the rushing of the wind, for the bearing of Pusan, for the expansion of heat, for the destruction of the foe. A myriad of foes.

original: ghṛtaṃ ghṛtapāvānaḥ pibata vasāṃ vasāpāvānaḥ pibatāntarikṣasya havir asi svāhā / diśaḥ / pradiśaḥ / ādiśaḥ / vidiśaḥ / uddiśaḥ / digbhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ghṛtam ghṛta pāvānaḥ pibata vasām vasā pāvānaḥ pibata antarikṣasya haviḥ asi svāhā diśaḥ pradiśaḥ ādiśaḥ vidiśaḥ uddiśaḥ digbhyaḥ svāhā
translated: Drink the ghee, ye drinkers of ghee; drink the fat, ye drinkers of fat. Thou art the oblation of the atmosphere. Hail! To the quarters, the intermediate quarters, the upper and the lower quarters, to the quarters around, hail!

original: aindraḥ prāṇo aṅgeaṅge ni dīdhyad aindra udāno aṅgeaṅge nidhītaḥ / deva tvaṣṭar bhūri te samsametu salakṣmā yad viṣurūpaṃ bhavāti / devatrā yantam avase sakhāyo 'nu tvā mātā pitaro madantu //
analyzed: aindraḥ prāṇaḥ aṅge aṅge ni dīdhyat aindraḥ udānaḥ aṅge aṅge nidhītaḥ    deva tvaṣṭar bhūri te samsametu salakṣmā yat viṣurūpam bhavāti    devatrā yantam avase sakhāyaḥ nu tvā mātā pitaraḥ madantu
translated: The breath of Indra is settled in every limb, the out-breath of Indra is settled in every limb. O god Tvastr, let all be well with thee, whatever form thou hast. Let thy friends rejoice in thee going to the gods for help, let thy mother and thy father rejoice in thee.

original: samudraṃ gaccha svāhā / antarikṣaṃ gaccha svāhā / devam savitāraṃ gaccha svāhā / mitrāvaruṇau gaccha svāhā / ahorātre gaccha svāhā / chandāmsi gaccha svāhā / dyāvāpṛthivī gaccha svāhā / yajñaṃ gaccha svāhā / somaṃ gaccha svāhā / divyaṃ nabho gaccha svāhā / agniṃ vaiśvānaraṃ gaccha svāhā / mano me hārdi yaccha / divaṃ te dhūmo gacchatu svar jyotiḥ pṛthivīṃ bhasmanā pṛṇa svāhā //
analyzed: samudram gaccha svāhā  antarikṣam gaccha svāhā  devam savitāram gaccha svāhā  mitrāvaruṇau gaccha svāhā  ahorātre gaccha svāhā  chandāmsi gaccha svāhā dyāvāpṛthivī gaccha svāhā   yajñam gaccha svāhā   somam gaccha svāhā   divyam nabhaḥ gaccha svāhā agnim vaiśvānaram gaccha svāhā   manaḥ me hārdi yaccha   divam te dhūmaḥ gacchatu svar jyotiḥ pṛthivīm bhasmanā pṛṇa svāhā
translated: Go to the ocean, Hail! Go to the atmosphere, Hail! Go to the god Savitar, Hail! Go to Mitra and Varuna, Hail! Go to the day and night, Hail! Go to the metres, Hail! Go to heaven and earth, Hail! Go to the sacrifice, Hail! Go to Soma, Hail! Go to the heavenly vault, Hail! Go to Agni Vaisvânara, Hail! Turn my mind and heart to the thought of you. Let your smoke go to heaven, your light to the sky, fill the earth with your ashes, Hail!

original: māpo mauṣadhīr himsīḥ / dhāmnodhāmno rājams tato varuṇa no muñca / yad āhur aghnyā iti varuṇeti śapāmahe tato varuṇa no muñca / sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyās tasmai santu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ //
analyzed: mā apaḥ mā oṣadhīḥ himsīḥ dhāmnaḥ dhāmnaḥ rājan tatas varuṇa naḥ muñca   yat āhuḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti śapāmahe tatas varuṇa naḥ muñca     su mitriyāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyāḥ tasmai santu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: Harm not the waters, nor the plants. From each place, O king, from each place, O Varuna, deliver us. When we curse, saying, 'The innocent one,' 'Varuna,' from that, O Varuna, deliver us. Be the waters and plants friendly to us, but inimical to him who hateth us and whom we hate.

original: haviṣīmatīr imā āpo haviṣmām ā vivāsati / haviṣmān devo adhvaro haviṣmām astu sūryaḥ //
analyzed: haviṣīmatīḥ imāḥ āpaḥ haviṣmān ā vivāsati    haviṣmān devaḥ adhvaraḥ haviṣmān astu sūryaḥ
translated: These waters are full of oblations; he who is full of oblations shall enter them. Let the god who is full of oblations be the sacrifice; let the sun be full of oblations.

original: agner vo 'pannagṛhasya sadasi sādayāmi / indrāgnyor bhāgadheyī stha / mitrāvaruṇyor bhāgadheyī stha / viśveṣāṃ devānāṃ bhāgadheyī stha / amūr yā upa sūrye yābhir vā sūryaḥ saha / tā no hinvantv adhvaram //
analyzed: agneḥ vaḥ panna gṛhasya sadasi sādayāmi    indra agnyoḥ bhāgadheyīḥ stha   mitrāvaruṇyoḥ bhāgadheyīḥ stha    viśveṣām devānām bhāgadheyīḥ stha    amūḥ yāḥ upa sūrye yābhiḥ vā sūryaḥ saha    tāḥ naḥ hinvantu adhvaram
translated: In the seat of Agni, whose home is safe, I place you. Ye are the share of Indra and Agni. Ye are the share of Mitra and Varuna. Ye are the share of all the gods. Those which are above the sun, or with which the sun is joined, may they impel our sacrifice.

original: hṛde tvā manase tvā dive tvā sūryāya tvā / ūrdhvam imam adhvaraṃ divi deveṣu hotrā yaccha //
analyzed: hṛde tvā manase tvā dive tvā sūryāya tvā        imam adhvaram divi deveṣu hotrāḥ yaccha
translated: To the heart thee, to the mind thee, to the sky thee, to Surya thee. Bear this sacrifice upwards to the gods in the sky.

original: soma rājan viśvās tvaṃ prajā upāva roha / viśvās tvāṃ prajā upāva rohantu / śṛṇotv agniḥ samidhā havaṃ me śṛṇvantv āpo dhiṣaṇāś ca devīḥ / śrotā grāvāṇo viduṣo na yajñam śṛṇotu devaḥ savitā havaṃ me svāhā //
analyzed: soma rājan viśvāḥ tvam prajāḥ upa ava roha   viśvāḥ tvām prajāḥ upa ava rohantu   śṛṇotu agniḥ samidhā havam me śṛṇvantu āpaḥ dhiṣaṇāḥ ca devīḥ   śrota grāvāṇaḥ viduṣaḥ na yajñam śṛṇotu devaḥ savitā havam me svāhā
translated: O Soma, king, all people ascend to thee. May all people ascend to thee. May Agni, when he is kindled, hear my call. May the waters and the divine Dhisanas hear. May the wise Gravas hear the sacrifice. May the god Savitar hear my call. Svâhâ!

original: devīr āpo apāṃ napād yo va ūrmir viṣya indriyāvān madintamaḥ / taṃ devebhyo devatrā datta śukrapebhyo yeṣāṃ bhāga stha svāhā //
analyzed: devīḥ āpaḥ apām napāt yaḥ vaḥ ūrmiḥ viṣyaḥ indriyāvān madintamaḥ   tam devebhyaḥ devatrā datta śukra pebhyaḥ yeṣām bhāgaḥ stha svāhā
translated: O divine waters, the foot of the waters, that wave of yours which is powerful, most exhilarating, that do ye give to the gods, to the gods who have Sukra for their portion, whose share ye are. Svâhâ!

original: kārṣir asi / samudrasya tvākṣityā un nayāmi / sam āpo adbhir agmata sam oṣadhībhir oṣadhīḥ //
analyzed: kārṣiḥ asi samudrasya tvā akṣityai ud nayāmi    sam āpaḥ adbhiḥ agmata sam oṣadhībhiḥ oṣadhīḥ
translated: Thou art the Kârshî plant. I draw thee up for the ocean's security. The waters have united with the waters, the plants with the plants.

original: yam agne pṛtsu martyam avā vājeṣu yaṃ junāḥ / sa yantā śaśvatīr iṣaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: yam agne pṛtsu martyam avāḥ vājeṣu yam junāḥ    sa yantā śaśvatīḥ iṣaḥ svāhā
translated: The mortal whom thou aidest in battles, O Agni, whom thou helpest in the race for booty, he, the winner, shall win food for ever. All-hail!

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade rāvāsi gabhīram imam adhvaraṃ kṛdhīndrāya suṣūtamam / uttamena pavinorjasvantaṃ madhumantaṃ payasvantam / nigrābhyā stha devaśrutas tarpayata mā //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   ā dade rāvā asi gabhīram imam adhvaram kṛdhi indrāya suṣūtamam   uttamena pavinā ūrjasvantam madhumantam payasvantam    nigrābhyāḥ stha deva śrutaḥ tarpayata mā
translated: In the impulse of God Savitar, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan, I take thee. Thou art the deep. Make this sacrifice most delightful to Indra. With the highest purifier make it rich in sap, rich in honey, rich in milk. Ye are the Nigrâbhyâs. Ye are divine. Delight me.

original: mano me tarpayata vācaṃ me tarpayata prāṇaṃ me tarpayata cakṣur me tarpayata śrotraṃ me tarpayatātmānaṃ me tarpayata prajāṃ me tarpayata paśūn me tarpayata gaṇān me tarpayata gaṇā me mā vitṛṣan //
analyzed: manaḥ me tarpayata vācam me tarpayata prāṇam me tarpayata cakṣuḥ me tarpayata śrotram me tarpayata ātmānam me tarpayata prajām me tarpayata paśūn me tarpayata gaṇān me tarpayata gaṇāḥ me mā vitṛṣan
translated: Delight my mind, delight my speech, delight my breath, delight my eye, delight my ear, delight my soul, delight my offspring, delight my cattle, delight my clans, let not my clans be thirsty.

original: indrāya tvā vasumate rudravate / indrāya tvādityavate / indrāya tvābhimātighne / śyenāya tvā momabhṛte / agnaye tvā rāyaspoṣade //
analyzed: indrāya tvā vasumate rudravate    indrāya tvā ādityavate    indrāya tvā abhimāti ghne   śyenāya tvā moma bhṛte   agnaye tvā rāyaspoṣa de
translated: For Indra, for the possessor of wealth, for the possessor of the Rudras. For Indra, for the possessor of the Adityas. For Indra, for the slayer of enemies. For the hawk, for the bearer of the oblation. For you, for the growth of wealth.

original: yat te soma divi jyotir yat pṛthivyāṃ yad urāv antarikṣe / tenāsmai yajamānāyoru rāye kṛdhy adhi dātre vocaḥ //
analyzed: yat te soma divi jyotiḥ yat pṛthivyām yat urau antarikṣe    tena asmai yajamānāya uru rāye kṛdhī adhi dātre vocaḥ
translated: The light which is in you, O Soma, in the sky, on the earth, and in the wide atmosphere, thereby be thou a wide support for this sacrificer, and speak to the giver.

original: śvātrā stha vṛtraturo rādhogūrtā amṛtasya patnīḥ / tā devīr devatremaṃ yajñaṃ nayatopahūtāḥ somasya pibata //
analyzed: śvātrāḥ stha vṛtra turaḥ rādhaḥ gūrtāḥ amṛtasya patnīḥ    tāḥ devīḥ devatrā imam yajñam nayata upahūtāḥ somasya pibata
translated: Ye are the supporters of the dog, the conquerors of Vritra, the bestowers of wealth, the wives of immortality. Do ye goddesses lead this sacrifice to the gods. Ye are invited. Drink of the Soma.

original: mā bher mā saṃ vikthā ūrjaṃ dhatsva dhiṣaṇe vīḍvī satī vīḍayethām ūrjaṃ dadhāthām / pāpmā hato na somaḥ //
analyzed: mā bheḥ mā sam vikthāḥ ūrjam dhatsva dhiṣaṇe vīḍvī satī vīḍayethām ūrjam dadhāthām    pāpmā hataḥ na somaḥ
translated: Do not tremble, do not be afraid. Place strength, O Dhisana, being firm, do thou be firm. Place strength. The evil one is slain, not Soma.

original: prāg apāg udag adharāk sarvatas tvā diśa ā dhāvantu / amba ni ṣpara sam arīr vidām //
analyzed: prāk apāk udak adharāk sarvatas tvā diśaḥ ā dhāvantu amba ni spara sam arīḥ vidām
translated: From the east, from the west, from the north, from the south, from all sides may the quarters run to you. O mother, drive away the enemies, and let us find peace.

original: tvam aṅga pra śamsiṣo devaḥ śaviṣṭha martyam / na tvad anyo maghavann asti marḍitendra bravīmi te vacaḥ //
analyzed: tvam aṅga pra śamsiṣaḥ devaḥ śaviṣṭha martyam   na tvat anyaḥ maghavan asti marḍitā indra bravīmi te vacaḥ
translated: Thou, O god, most mighty, dost praise the mortal. There is none other than thou, O bountiful one, to be entreated. I speak to thee, O Indra, these words.

original: vācas pataye pavava vṛṣṇo amśubhyāṃ gabhastipūtaḥ / devo devebhyaḥ pavasva yeṣāṃ bhāgo 'si //
analyzed: vācaḥ pataye pavava vṛṣṇaḥ amśubhyām gabhasti pūtaḥ    devaḥ devebhyaḥ pavasva yeṣām bhāgaḥ si
translated: To the Lord of Speech, O Pavamâna, purified by the hands with the two rays of the strong one, be thou a God to the Gods, whose portion thou art.

original: madhumatīr na iṣas kṛdhi / yat te somādābhyaṃ nāma jāgṛvi tasmai te soma somāya svāhā / svāhā / urv antarikṣam anv emi //
analyzed: madhumatīḥ naḥ iṣaḥ kṛdhi    yat te soma adābhyam nāma jāgṛvi tasmai te soma somāya svāhā svāhā    uru antarikṣam anu emi
translated: Make our food rich in nourishment. What inviolate, watchful name thou hast, O Soma, to that of thine, O Soma, to Soma hail! Hail! I go along the broad atmosphere.

original: svāṃkṛto 'si viśvebhya indriyebhyo divyebhyaḥ pārthivebhyo manas tvāṣṭu svāhā tvā subhava sūryāya / devebhyas tvā marīcipebhyaḥ / devāmśo yasmai tveḍe tat satyam upariprutā bhaṅgena hato 'sau phaṭ / prāṇāya tvā / vyānāya tvā //
analyzed: svāṃkṛtaḥ si viśvebhyaḥ indriyebhyaḥ divyebhyaḥ pārthivebhyaḥ manaḥ tvā aṣṭu svāhā tvā su bhava sūryāya   devebhyaḥ tvā marīcipebhyaḥ   deva amśas yasmai tvā īḍe tat satyam upariprutā bhaṅgena hataḥ sau phaṭ    prāṇāya tvā    vyānāya tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support. For all powers, for the heavenly, for the earthly, may the mind attend on thee. Hail to thee, O well-born, to Sûrya! To the Gods who drink the rays thee! The Gods' portion, whatever thou art, that is true. Thou art crushed above, struck down by the crushing-stone. Thou art crushed. To expiration thee! To cross-breathing thee!

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy antaryaccha maghavan pāhi somam / uruṣya rāya eṣo yajasva //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si antar yaccha maghavan pāhi somam    uruṣya rāyaḥ ā iṣaḥ yajasva
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Do thou, O bountiful one, guard Soma. Preserve him for wealth. Sacrifice.

original: antas te dyāvāpṛthivī dadhāmy antardadhāmy urv antarikṣam / sajūr devebhir avaraiḥ paraiś cāntaryāme maghavan mādayasva //
analyzed: antar te dyāvāpṛthivī dadhāmi antardadhāmi uru antarikṣam     sajūs devebhiḥ avaraiḥ paraiḥ ca antaryāme maghavan mādayasva
translated: I place within thee heaven and earth. I place within thee the broad atmosphere. Accordant with the Gods, the lower and the higher, rejoice thee, O bountiful one, in the Antaryâma.

original: svāṃkṛto 'si viśvebhya indriyebhyo divyebhyaḥ pārthivebhyo manas tvāṣṭu svāhā tvā subhava sūryāya / devebhyas tvā marīcipebhyaḥ / udānāya tvā //
analyzed: svāṃkṛtaḥ si viśvebhyaḥ indriyebhyaḥ divyebhyaḥ pārthivebhyaḥ manaḥ tvā aṣṭu svāhā tvā su bhava sūryāya   devebhyaḥ tvā marīcipebhyaḥ   udānāya tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for the All-gods, for the powers, for the heavenly, for the earthly, for the mind. Hail to thee, O well-born, to Sûrya! Thee to the gods, to the drinkers of the rays! Thee to the upward breath!

original: ā yāyo bhūṣa śucipā upa naḥ sahasraṃ te niyuto viśvavāra / upo te andho madyam ayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam / vāyave tvā //
analyzed: ā yāyo bhūṣa śuci pāḥ upa naḥ sahasram te niyutaḥ viśva vāra   upa u te andhaḥ madyam ayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam      vāyave tvā
translated: Come hither, O thou who lovest the pure, to us, O thou of a thousand teams, O thou of all boons. I bring thee the draught to drink, of which, O god, thou hast the first draught. Thee to Vâyu!

original: indravāyū ime sutā upa prayobhir āgatam / indavo vām uśanti hi / upayāmagṛhīto 'si vāyava indravāyubhyāṃ tvā / eṣa te yoniḥ / sajoṣebhyāṃ tvā //
analyzed: indra vāyū ime sutāḥ upa prayobhiḥ āgatam   indavaḥ vām uśanti hi   upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si vāyave indra vāyubhyām tvā   eṣa te yoniḥ sajoṣebhyām tvā
translated: O Indra and Vâyu, come hither to these libations with your teams. The drops delight you both. Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Vâyu, to Indra and Vâyu. This is thy womb. Thee to those of one mind!

original: ayaṃ vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā sutaḥ soma ṛtāvṛdhā / mamed iha śrutam havam / upayāmagṛhīto 'si mitrāvaruṇābhyāṃ tvā //
analyzed: ayam vām mitrāvaruṇā sutaḥ somaḥ ṛtāvṛdhā   mama id iha śrutam havam   upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si mitrāvaruṇābhyām tvā
translated: This Soma, O Mitra-Varuṇa, is pressed for you, O ye who strengthen Law. Hear here my invocation. Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Mitra-Varuṇa!

original: rāyā vayam sasavāmso madema havyena devā yavasena gāvaḥ / tāṃ dhenuṃ mitrāvaruṇā yuvaṃ no viśvāhā dhattam anapasphurantīm / eṣa te yonir ṛtāyubhyāṃ tvā //
analyzed: rāyā vayam sasavāmsaḥ madema havyena devāḥ yavasena gāvaḥ    tām dhenum mitrāvaruṇā yuvam naḥ viśvāhā dhattam an apasphurantīm    eṣa te yoniḥ ṛtāyubhyām tvā
translated: With wealth may we rejoice together, O gods, with grass the cows. That milch-cow, O Mitra-Varuṇa, give ye us, who never fails, through all our days. This is thy womb. Thee to those of true life!

original: yā vāṃ kaśā madhumatyāśvinā sūnṛtāvatī / tayā yajñaṃ mimikṣatam / upayāmagṛhīto 'sy aśvibhyāṃ tvā / eṣa te yonir mādhvībhyāṃ tvā //🔽taṃ pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathemathā jyeṣṭhatātiṃ barhiṣadam svarvidam / pratīcīnaṃ vṛjanaṃ dohase dhunim āśuṃ jayantam anu yāsu vardhase / upayāmagṛhīto 'si śaṇḍāya tvā / eṣa te yonir vīratāṃ pāhi / apamṛṣṭaḥ śaṇḍaḥ / devās tvā śukrapāḥ paṇayantu / anādhṛṣṭāsi //
analyzed: yā vām kaśā madhumatyā aśvinā sūnṛtāvatī    tayā yajñam mimikṣatam    upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si aśvibhyām tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ mādhvībhyām tvā  tam pratnathā pūrvathā viśvathā imathā jyeṣṭhatātim barhiṣadam svar vidam    pratīcīnam vṛjanam dohase dhunim āśum jayantam anu yāsu vardhase    upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si śaṇḍāya tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ vīra tām pāhi    apamṛṣṭaḥ śaṇḍaḥ   devāḥ tvā śukra pāḥ paṇayantu   anādhṛṣṭā asi
translated: That whip of yours, O Asvins, which is full of sweetness and brings delight, with that do ye besprinkle the sacrifice. Thou art taken with a support: thee to the Asvins. This is thy womb: thee to the sweet.🔽Him as of old, as in the days of old, in every way, in all ways, the most mighty, seated on the strew, the finder of the heaven, the western troop, the milker, the shaker, in the battles wherein thou growest strong, thou art taken with a support: thee to Sanda. This is thy womb: guard the manly. Sanda is wiped away. Let the gods, the receivers of the pure, make thee pure. Thou art not to be overcome.

original: suvīro vīrān prajanayan parīhy abhi rāyaspoṣeṇa yajamānam / saṃjagmāno divā pṛthivyā śukraḥ śukraśociṣā / nirastaḥ śaṇḍaḥ / śukrasyādhiṣṭhānam asi //
analyzed: su vīraḥ vīrān prajanayan parīhi abhi rāyaspoṣeṇa yajamānam    saṃjagmānaḥ divā pṛthivyā śukraḥ śukra śociṣā   nirastaḥ śaṇḍaḥ   śukrasya adhiṣṭhānam asi
translated: With good heroes, begetting heroes, go round, and prosper the sacrificer with increase of wealth. Agreeing with the sky and the earth, the bright one with bright radiance, Sanda is cast away. Thou art the seat of the bright one.

original: acchinnasya te deva soma suvīryasya rāyaspoṣasya daditāraḥ syāma / sā prathamā samskṛtir viśvavārā sa prathamo varuṇo mitro agniḥ //
analyzed: acchinnasya te deva soma su vīryasya rāyaspoṣasya daditāraḥ syāma    sā prathamā samskṛtiḥ viśva vārā sa prathamaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: We will be givers to thee, O god Soma, of unbroken hero strength and increase of wealth. That is the first creation, all-bountiful, that is the first Varuna, Mitra, Agni.

original: sa prathamo bṛhaspatiś cikitvāms tasmā indrāya sutam ā juhota svāhā //
analyzed: sa prathamaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ cikitvān tasmai indrāya sutam ā juhota svāhā
translated: He is the first, the wise Brihaspati; to him offer the pressed (Soma) for Indra, Hail!

original: tṛmpantu hotrā madhvo yāḥ sv"ṣṭā yāḥ suprītāḥ suhutā yat svāhā / ayāḍ agnīt //
analyzed: tṛmpantu hotrāḥ madhvaḥ yāḥ su ṣṭāḥ yāḥ su prītāḥ su hutāḥ yat svāhā ayāṭ agnīdh
translated: May the oblations be satisfied with the sweet (Soma), well-prepared, well-pleased, well-offered, when Hail! The Agnîdh has gone away.

original: ayaṃ venaś codayat pṛśnigarbhā jyotirjarāyū rajaso vimāne / imam apām saṃgame sūryasya siśuṃ na viprā matibhī rihanti //
analyzed: ayam venaḥ codayat pṛśni garbhāḥ jyotiḥ jarāyūḥ rajasaḥ vimāne    imam apām saṃgame sūryasya siśum na viprāḥ matibhiḥ rihanti
translated: This Vena, the son of Prishni, has urged (the sun) in the chariot of the sky, the light for old age, in the expanse of the atmosphere. The sages with their thoughts kiss this child at the meeting of the waters and the sun.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si markāya tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si markāya tvā
translated: You are taken with a support. For Marka you.

original: mano na yeṣu havaneṣu tigmaṃ vipaḥ śacyā vanutho dravantā / ā yaḥ śaryābis tuvinṛmṇo asyāśrīṇītādiśaṃ gabhastau //🔽eṣa te yoniḥ prajāḥ pāhi / apamṛṣṭo markaḥ / devās tvā manthipāḥ praṇayantu / anādhṛṣtāsi //
analyzed: manaḥ na yeṣu havaneṣu tigmam vipaḥ śacyā vanuthaḥ dravantā     ā yaḥ śaryābiḥ tuvi nṛmṇaḥ asya āśrīṇīta ādiśam gabhastau  eṣa te yoniḥ prajāḥ pāhi   apamṛṣṭaḥ markaḥ   devāḥ tvā manthi pāḥ praṇayantu   anādhṛṣtā asi
translated: In whose invocations the sharp mind, with power, you have delighted, running, he who, powerful, has brought this (earth) to the end of his arms.🔽This is your birthplace. Protect the people. Marka is wiped away. The gods who drink the Manthin offer you. You are not assailed.

original: suprajāḥ prajāḥ prajanayan parīhy abhi rāyaspoṣeṇa yajamānam / saṃjagmāno divā pṛthivyā manthī mathiśociṣā / nirasto markaḥ / manthino 'dhiṣṭhānam asi //
analyzed: su prajāḥ prajāḥ prajanayan parīhi abhi rāyaspoṣeṇa yajamānam    saṃjagmānaḥ divā pṛthivyā manthī mathi śociṣā    nirastaḥ markaḥ   manthinaḥ dhiṣṭhānam asi
translated: Giving birth to good offspring, go around protecting the people, increasing the sacrificer's prosperity. The Manthin, moving together with the sky and earth, with a flame that burns, has been sent away. Marka is sent away. You are the resting place of the Manthins.

original: ye devāso divy ekādaśa stha pṛthivyām adhy ekādaśa stha / apsukṣito mahinaikādaśa stha te devāso yajñam imaṃ juṣadhvam //
analyzed: ye devāsaḥ divi ekādaśa stha pṛthivyām adhi ekādaśa stha    apsukṣitaḥ mahinā ekādaśa stha te devāsaḥ yajñam imam juṣadhvam
translated: Ye Gods who are eleven in heaven, who are eleven on earth, who are eleven in the waters, who are eleven in the great, accept ye this sacrifice.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy āgrayaṇo 'si svāgrayaṇaḥ pāhi yajñaṃ pāhi yajñapatiṃ viṣṇus tvām indriyeṇa pātu viṣṇuṃ tvaṃ pāhy abhi savanāni pāhi //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si āgrayaṇaḥ si su āgrayaṇaḥ pāhi yajñam pāhi yajñapatim viṣṇuḥ tvām indriyeṇa pātu viṣṇum tvam pāhi abhi savanāni pāhi
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thou art the first-pressed. Thou art the well-pressed. Protect the sacrifice. Protect the lord of the sacrifice. Let Vishnu protect thee with his power. Protect Vishnu. Protect the pressings.

original: somaḥ pavate somaḥ pavate 'smai brahmaṇe 'smai kṣatrāyāsmai sunvate yajamānāya pavata iṣa ūrje pavate 'dbhya oṣadhībhyaḥ pavate dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ pavate subhūtāya pavate viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ / eṣa te yonir viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ //
analyzed: somaḥ pavate somaḥ pavate smai brahmaṇe smai kṣatrāya asmai sunvate yajamānāya pavate iṣe ūrje pavate dbhyaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ pavate dyāvāpṛthivībhyām pavate subhūtāya pavate viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ    eṣa te yoniḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ
translated: Soma is purified. Soma is purified for this Brahman, for this Kshatra, for this sacrificer who presses. He is purified for food and strength. He is purified for the waters and plants. He is purified for heaven and earth. He is purified for good being. He is purified for all the gods. This is thy womb. For all the gods thee.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā bṛhadvate vayasvata ukthāvyaṃ gṛhṇāmi / yat ta indra bṛhad vayas tasmai tvā viṣṇave tvā / eṣa te yonir ukthebhyas tvā / devebhyas tvā devāvyaṃ gṛhṇāmi yajñasyāyuṣe gṛhṇāmi //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā bṛhadvate vayasvate ukthāvyam gṛhṇāmi   yat te indra bṛhat vayaḥ tasmai tvā viṣṇave tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ ukthebhyaḥ tvā   devebhyaḥ tvā devāvyam gṛhṇāmi yajñasya āyuṣe gṛhṇāmi
translated: Thou art taken with a support. I take thee dear to Indra of the great power, to the strong, to the one worthy of lauds. Whatever great strength there is in thee, to that (thee). To Vishnu thee. This is thy womb. To the lauds thee. To the gods thee. I take thee dear to the gods. I take thee for the life of the sacrifice.

original: mitrāvaruṇābhyāṃ tvā devāvyaṃ yajñasyāyuṣe gṛhṇāmi / indrāya tvā devāvyaṃ yajñasyāyuṣe gṛhṇāmi / indrāgnibhyāṃ tvā devāvyaṃ yajñasyāyuṣe gṛhṇāmi / indrāvaruṇābhyāṃ tvā devāvyaṃ yajñasyāyuṣe gṛhṇāmi / indrābṛhaspatibhyāṃ tvā devāvyaṃ yajñasyāyuṣe gṛhṇāmi / indrāviṣṇubhyāṃ tvā devāvyaṃ yajñasyāyuṣe gṛhṇāmi //
analyzed: mitrāvaruṇābhyām tvā devāvyam yajñasya āyuṣe gṛhṇāmi     indrāya tvā devāvyam yajñasya āyuṣe gṛhṇāmi    indra agnibhyām tvā devāvyam yajñasya āyuṣe gṛhṇāmi     indrāvaruṇābhyām tvā devāvyam yajñasya āyuṣe gṛhṇāmi    indrābṛhaspatibhyām tvā devāvyam yajñasya āyuṣe gṛhṇāmi    indrāviṣṇubhyām tvā devāvyam yajñasya āyuṣe gṛhṇāmi
translated: For Mitra and Varuna, divine, I take thee for the life of the sacrifice. For Indra, divine, I take thee for the life of the sacrifice. For Indra and Agni, divine, I take thee for the life of the sacrifice. For Indra and Varuna, divine, I take thee for the life of the sacrifice. For Indra and Brihaspati, divine, I take thee for the life of the sacrifice. For Indra and Vishnu, divine, I take thee for the life of the sacrifice.

original: mūrdhānaṃ divo aratiṃ pṛthivyā vaiśvānaram ṛta ā jātam agnim / kavim samrājam atithiṃ janānām āsann ā pātraṃ janayanta devāḥ //
analyzed: mūrdhānam divaḥ aratim pṛthivyāḥ vaiśvānaram ṛte ā jātam agnim    kavim samrājam atithim janānām āsan ā pātram janayanta devāḥ
translated: The head of the sky, the messenger of the earth, Vaiśvānara born in the womb of truth, Agni, the sage, the universal monarch, the guest of men, the gods have generated him as a vessel near at hand.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si dhruvo 'si dhruvakṣitir dhruvāṇāṃ dhruvatamo 'cyutānām acyutakṣittamaḥ / eṣa te yonir vaiśvānarāya tvā / dhruvaṃ dhruveṇa manasā vācā somam ava nayāmi / athā na indra id viśo 'sapatnāḥ samanasas karat //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ si dhruvaḥ si dhruva kṣitiḥ dhruvāṇām dhruvatamaḥ cyutānām acyuta kṣittamaḥ      eṣa te yoniḥ vaiśvānarāya tvā    dhruvam dhruveṇa manasā vācā somam ava nayāmi      athā naḥ indraḥ id viśaḥ sapatnāḥ samanasaḥ karat
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thou art firm, thou art firm-seated, the firmest of the firm, the best of those that are immovable. This is thy birthplace. Thee for Vaiśvānara. With firm mind and speech I pour down the Soma. Now may Indra make our people free from foes and of one mind.

original: yas te drapsa skandati yas te amśur grāvacyuto dhiṣaṇayor upasthāt / adhvaryor vā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt taṃ juhomi manasā vaṣaṭkṛtam svāhā / devānām utkramaṇam asi //🔽prāṇāya me varcodā varcase pavasva / vyānāya me varcodā varcase pavasva / udānāya me varcodā varcase pavasva / vāce me varcodā varcase pavasva / kratūdakṣābhyāṃ me varcodā varcase pavasva / śrotrāya me varcodā varcase pavasva / cakṣurbhyāṃ me varcodasau varcase pavethām //
analyzed: yaḥ te drapsaḥ skandati yaḥ te amśuḥ grāva cyutaḥ dhiṣaṇayoḥ upasthāt    adhvaryoḥ vā pari vā yaḥ pavitrāt tam juhomi manasā vaṣaṭkṛtam svāhā    devānām utkramaṇam asi  prāṇāya me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva   vyānāya me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva    udānāya me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva   vāce me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva   kratu dakṣābhyām me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva   śrotrāya me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva    cakṣurbhyām me varcaḥ dasau varcase pavethām
translated: The drop that falls from thee, O Skambha, the stalk that falls from thee, that which falls from the mortar or from the pestle, that which falls from the Adhvaryu's hand or from the strainer, that I offer with my mind, consecrated with Vashat, Hail! Thou art the departure of the gods.🔽For my out-breathing, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my through-breathing, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my up-breathing, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my voice, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my will and my power, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my hearing, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my two eyes, O you who give splendour, purify yourselves for splendour.

original: ātmane me me varcodā varcase pavasva / ojase me varcodā varcase pavasva / āyuṣe me varcodā varcase pavasva / viśvābhyo me prajābhyo varcodasau varcase pavethām //
analyzed: ātmane me me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva    ojase me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva    āyuṣe me varcaḥ dāḥ varcase pavasva    viśvābhyaḥ me prajābhyaḥ varcaḥ dasau varcase pavethām
translated: For my self, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my strength, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For my life, O you who give splendour, purify yourself for splendour. For all my offspring, O you who give splendour, purify yourselves for splendour.

original: ko 'si katamo 'si kasyāsi ko nāmāsi / yasya te nāmāmanmahi yaṃ tvā somenātītṛpāma / bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ suprajāḥ prajābhiḥ syām suvīro vīraiḥ supoṣaḥ poṣaiḥ //
analyzed: kaḥ si katamaḥ si kasya asi kaḥ nāma asi    yasya te nāma amanmahi yam tvā somena atītṛpāma   bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar suprajāḥ prajābhiḥ syām su vīraḥ vīraiḥ su poṣaḥ poṣaiḥ  /
translated: Who art thou? What art thou? Whose art thou? What is thy name? Whose name we may think on, whom we may satisfy with Soma. Earth, sky, heaven. May I be prosperous with children, prosperous with heroes, prosperous with increase.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si madhave tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si mādhavāya tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si śukrāya tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si śucaye tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si nabhase tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si nabhasyāya tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'sīṣe tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'sy ūrje tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si sahase tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si sahasyāya tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si tapase tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'si tapasyāya tvā / upayāmagṛhīto 'sy amhasaspataye tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ si madhave tvā    upayāma gṛhītaḥ si mādhavāya tvā                      si
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Madhu. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Madhava. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Sukra. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Suki. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Nabhas. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Nabhasya. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Isha. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Urja. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Sahas. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Sahasya. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Tapas. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Tapasya. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Amhasaspati.

original: indrāgnī ā gatam sutaṃ gīrbhir nabho vareṇyam / asya pātaṃ dhiyeṣitā //
analyzed: indra agnī ā gatam sutam gīrbhiḥ nabhaḥ vareṇyam    asya pātam dhiyā iṣitā
translated: O Indra and Agni, come to the pressed (juice), to the desirable rain with the hymns. Drink of this, impelled by the thoughts.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāgnibhyāṃ tvā / eṣa te yonir indrāgnibhyāṃ tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indra agnibhyām tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ indra agnibhyām tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Indra and Agni. This is thy womb. Thee to Indra and Agni.🔽They who continually kindle the fire, who strew the sacred grass, whose friend is the youthful Indra,

original: ā ghā ye agnim indhate stṛṇanti barhir ānuṣak / yeṣām indro yuvā sakhā / upayāmagṛhīto 'sy agnīndrābhyāṃ tvā / eṣa te yonir agnīndrābhyāṃ tvā //
analyzed: ā gha ye agnim indhate stṛṇanti barhiḥ ānuṣak   yeṣām indraḥ yuvā sakhā   upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si agni indrābhyām tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ agni indrābhyām tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Agni and Indra. This is thy womb. Thee to Agni and Indra.

original: omāsaś carṣaṇīdhṛto viśve devāsa ā gata / dāśvāmso dāśuṣaḥ sutam / upayāmagṛhīto 'si viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ / eṣa te yonir viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ //
analyzed: omāsaḥ carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ viśve devāsaḥ ā gata    dāśvāmsaḥ dāśuṣaḥ sutam   upayāma gṛhītaḥ si viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ   eṣa te yoniḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ
translated: O ye All-Gods, supporters of men, come hither, ye who love the gift, to the pressed (Soma) of the worshipper. Thou art taken with a support. Thee to all the gods. This is thy womb. Thee to all the gods.

original: viśve devāsa ā gata śṛṇutā ma imam havam / edaṃ barhir ni ṣīdata / upayāmagṛhīto 'si viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ / eṣa te yonir viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ //
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ ā gata śṛṇutā me imam havam    ā idam barhiḥ ni sīdata    upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ   eṣa te yoniḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ
translated: O ye All-Gods, come hither. Hearken to this my invocation. Sit ye down on this sacred grass. Thou art taken with a support. Thee to all the gods. This is thy womb. Thee to all the gods.

original: indra marutva iha pāhi somaṃ yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya / tava praṇītī tava śūra śarmann ā vivāsanti kavayaḥ suyajñāḥ //
analyzed: indra marutvas iha pāhi somam yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya  / tava praṇītī tava śūra śarman ā vivāsanti kavayaḥ su yajñāḥ
translated: O Indra, with the Maruts, here drink the Soma as thou didst the drawn juice of Sarvâri. By thy favour, O hero, the wise, the well-worshippers, have obtained their desire.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā marutvate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā marutvate //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā marutvate    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā marutvate
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Indra with the Maruts. This is thy womb. Thee for Indra with the Maruts.

original: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ vāvṛdhānam akavāriṃ divyam śāsam indram / viśvāsāham avase nūtanāyogram sahodām iha tam huvema //
analyzed: marutvantam vṛṣabham vāvṛdhānam a kavārim divyam śāsam indram       avase nūtanāya ugram sahaḥ dām iha tam huvema
translated: Indra, the Marut-girt, the Bull, the mighty, the warrior, the heavenly King, the all-subduer, the mighty, the new, for aid, him will we call here.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā marutvate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā marutvate / upayāmagṛhīto 'si marutāṃ tvaujase //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā marutvate    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā marutvate   upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si marutām tvā ojase
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Indra with the Maruts. This is thy womb. Thee for Indra with the Maruts. Thou art taken with a support. Thee for the Maruts' strength.

original: sajoṣā indra sagaṇo marudbhiḥ somaṃ piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān / jahi śatrūmr apa mṛdho nudasvāthābhayaṃ kṛṇuhi viśvato naḥ //
analyzed: sajoṣāḥ indra sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān   jahi śatrūmṇ apa mṛdhaḥ nudasva atha abhayam kṛṇuhi viśvatas naḥ
translated: O Indra, of one mind with the Maruts, of one troop, drink the Soma, O Vritra-slayer, O hero, O wise one. Slay the foe, drive away the scorners, and make all sides free from danger for us.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā marutvate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā marutvate //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā marutvate    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā marutvate
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Indra with the Maruts. This is thy womb. Thee for Indra with the Maruts.

original: marutvām indra vṛṣabho raṇāya pibā somam anuṣvadhaṃ madāya / āsiñcasva jaṭhare madhva ūrmiṃ tvam rājāsi pratipatsutānām //
analyzed: indra vṛṣabhaḥ raṇāya piba somam anuṣvadham madāya    āsiñcasva jaṭhare madhvaḥ ūrmim tvam rājā asi pratipad sutānām
translated: O Indra, the Bull, with the Maruts, for battle, drink the Soma according to the rite, for joy. Pour into thy belly the wave of sweet drink. Thou art the King of the pressed Soma juices.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā marutvate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā marutvate //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā marutvate    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā marutvate
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Indra with the Maruts. This is thy womb. Thee for Indra with the Maruts.

original: mahām indro nṛvad ā carṣaṇiprā uta dvibarhā aminaḥ sahobhiḥ / asmadryag vāvṛdhe vīryāyoruḥ pṛthuḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhir bhūt //
analyzed: mahān indraḥ nṛ vat ā carṣaṇi prāḥ uta dvibarhāḥ aminaḥ sahobhiḥ   asmadryak vāvṛdhe vīryāya uruḥ pṛthuḥ su kṛtaḥ kartṛbhiḥ bhūt
translated: Great is Indra, like a hero, the conqueror of men, and with his twofold strength he is not to be overcome. He has grown mighty for our hero strength. Let him be wide, great, well-made by the makers.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si mahendrāya tvā / eṣa te yonir mahendrāya tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si mahā indrāya tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ mahā indrāya tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Mahendra. This is thy womb. Thee for Mahendra.
