original: mahām indro ya ojasā parjanyo vṛṣṭimām iva / stomair vatsasya vāvṛdhe //
analyzed: mahām indraḥ yaḥ ojasā parjanyaḥ vṛṣṭimām iva    stomaiḥ vatsasya vāvṛdhe
translated: Great is Indra, who by his strength is like Parjanya pouring rain. He has grown by the praises of Vatsa.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si mahendrāya tvā / eṣa te yonir mahendrāya tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si mahā indrāya tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ mahā indrāya tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Mahendra. This is thy womb. Thee for Mahendra.

original: ud u tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ / dṛśe viśvāya sūryam svāhā //
analyzed: ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ   dṛśe viśvāya sūryam svāhā
translated: Upward they bear that God, the all-observing, the light, the Sun, that all may see him. All-hail!

original: citraṃ devānām ud agād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ / āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca svāhā //
analyzed: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ     āprāḥ dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca svāhā  /
translated: The wondrous form of the Gods hath risen on high, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni. It hath filled heaven and earth and air's wide region. The Sun is soul of all that moveth not or moveth. All-hail!

original: agne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān / yuyodhy asmaj juhurāṇam eno bhūyiṣṭhāṃ te namaktiṃ vidhema svāhā //
analyzed: agne naya su pathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān   yuyodhi asmat juhurāṇam enaḥ bhūyiṣṭhām te namaktim vidhema svāhā
translated: O Agni, lead us by a fair path to wealth, thou who knowest all the ways, O God. Drive from us the sin that makes us stumble, and we will render thee the highest homage. Svâhâ!

original: ayaṃ no agnir varivas kṛṇotv ayaṃ mṛdhaḥ pura etu prabhindan / ayaṃ vājān jayatu vājasātāv ayam śatrūn jayatu jarhṛṣāṇaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ayam naḥ agniḥ varivaḥ kṛṇotu ayam mṛdhaḥ puras etu prabhindan   ayam vājān jayatu vājasātau ayam śatrūn jayatu jarhṛṣāṇaḥ svāhā
translated: May this Agni make room for us; may he go forth in front of us, breaking through the foes. May he win the prizes in the contests for prizes; may he conquer the enemies, rejoicing. Svâhâ!

original: rūpeṇa vo rūpam abhyāgāṃ tutho vo viśvavedā vi bhajatu / ṛtasya pathā preta candradakṣiṇāḥ / vi svaḥ paśya vy antarikṣam / yatasva sadasyaiḥ //
analyzed: rūpeṇa vaḥ rūpam abhyāgām tuthaḥ vaḥ viśva vedāḥ vi bhajatu    ṛtasya pathā preta candra dakṣiṇāḥ   vi svar paśya vi antarikṣam   yatasva sadasyaiḥ
translated: With form I have come to your form. May Tutha, the knower of all, divide you. Go by the path of truth, with the sacrificial fee of the moon. Look upon the heaven, look upon the atmosphere. Strive with the Sadasyas.

original: brāhmaṇam adya videyaṃ pitṛmantaṃ paitṛmatyam ṛṣim ārṣeyam sudhātudakṣiṇam / asmadrātā devatrā gacchata pradātāram ā viśata //
analyzed: brāhmaṇam adya videyam pitṛmantam paitṛmatyam ṛṣim ārṣeyam sudhātu dakṣiṇam    asmad rātāḥ devatrā gacchata pradātāram ā viśata
translated: Today I have known the Brahman, possessed of fathers, of paternal grandfather, of Rishis, of the descendants of Rishis, with good sacrificial gifts. Go to the gods, having us for your portion. Enter into the giver.

original: agnaye tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātu so 'mṛtatvam aśīyāyur dātra edhi mayo mahyaṃ pratigrahītre / rudrāya tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātu so 'mṛtatvam aśīya prāṇo dātra edhi vayo mahyaṃ pratigrahītre / bṛhaspataye tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātu so 'mṛtatvam aśīya tvag dātra edhi mayo mahyaṃ pratigrahītre / yamāya tvā mahyaṃ varuṇo dadātu so 'mṛtatvam aśīya hayo dātra edhi vayo mahyaṃ pratigrahītre //
analyzed: agnaye tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya āyuḥ dātre edhi mayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre   rudrāya tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya prāṇaḥ dātre edhi vayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre   bṛhaspataye tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya tvac dātre edhi mayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre   yamāya tvā mahyam varuṇaḥ dadātu saḥ mṛta tvam aśīya hayaḥ dātre edhi vayaḥ mahyam pratigrahītre  /
translated: To Agni, to me, may Varuna give thee. May he attain immortality. Be life to the giver. Be vigour to me, the receiver. To Rudra, to me, may Varuna give thee. May he attain immortality. Be breath to the giver. Be vigour to me, the receiver. To Brihaspati, to me, may Varuna give thee. May he attain immortality. Be skin to the giver. Be vigour to me, the receiver. To Yama, to me, may Varuna give thee. May he attain immortality. Be strength to the giver. Be vigour to me, the receiver.

original: ko 'dāt kasmā adāt kāmo 'dāt kāmāyādāt / kāmo dātā kāmaḥ pratigrahītā kāmaitat te //
analyzed: kaḥ dāt kasmai adāt kāmaḥ dāt kāmāya adāt      kāmaḥ dātā kāmaḥ pratigrahītā kāma etat te
translated: Who gave? To whom did he give? Desire gave. To desire he gave. Desire is the giver. Desire is the receiver. This is thine, O Desire.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si / ādityebhyas tvā / viṣṇa urugāyaiṣa te somas tam rakṣasva mā tvā dabhan //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si ādityebhyaḥ tvā   viṣṇo uru gāya eṣa te somaḥ tam rakṣasva mā tvā dabhan
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee to the Adityas. O Vishnu, O all-pervading one, this is thy Soma. Guard it. Let it not fail thee.

original: kadā cana starīr asi nendra saścasi dāśuṣe / upopen nu maghavan bhūya in nu te dānaṃ devasya pṛcyate //
analyzed: kadā cana starīḥ asi na indra saścasi dāśuṣe     upa upa id nu maghavan bhūyaḥ id nu te dānam devasya pṛcyate
translated: Never art thou barren: thou never failest the worshipper, O Indra. Still, O bountiful one, the gift of the God is increased for thee.

original: ādityebhyas tvā //
analyzed: ādityebhyaḥ tvā
translated: To the Adityas thee!

original: kadā cana pra yucchasy ubhe ni pāsi janmanī / turīyāditya savanaṃ ta indriyam ā tasthāv amṛtaṃ divi / ādityebhyas tvā //
analyzed: kadā cana pra yucchasi ubhe ni pāsi janmanī   turīya āditya savanam te indriyam ā tasthau amṛtam divi    ādityebhyaḥ tvā
translated: Never art thou wearied: thou guardest both races. The Soma-pressing, thy power, O fourth Aditya, hath stood firm, immortal, in the sky. Thee for the Adityas.

original: yajño devānāṃ praty eti sumnam ādityāso bhavatā mṛḍayantaḥ / ā vo 'rvācī sumatir vavṛtyād amhoś cid yā varivovittarāsat / ādityebhyas tvā //
analyzed: yajñaḥ devānām prati eti sumnam ādityāsaḥ bhavata mṛḍayantaḥ   ā vaḥ rvācī sumatiḥ vavṛtyāt amhoḥ cit yā varivaḥ vittarā asat     ādityebhyaḥ tvā
translated: The sacrifice of the gods goeth to the favour of the Adityas: be ye gracious, O ye Âdityas. Let your favour come to us from the farthest distance, even from the distance of the sky. Thee for the Adityas.

original: vivasvann ādityaiṣa te somapīthas tasmin matsva / śrad asmai naro vacase dadhātana yad āśīrdā dampatī vāmam aśnutaḥ / pumān putro jāyate vindate vasv adhā viśvāhār apa edhate gṛhe //🔽vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvo divedive vāmam asmabhyam sāvīḥ / vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrer ayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma //
analyzed: vivasvan āditya eṣa te soma pīthaḥ tasmin matsva    śrath asmai naraḥ vacase dadhātana yat āśīḥ dāḥ dampatī vāmam aśnutaḥ   pumān putraḥ jāyate vindate vasu adhā viśvāhār apaḥ edhate gṛhe  vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvas dive dive vāmam asmabhyam sāvīḥ    vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūreḥ ayā dhiyā vāma bhājaḥ syāma
translated: O Vivasvan Âditya, this is thy Soma-drink: rejoice in it. Do ye men all of you grant this prayer, that the couple, the giver of the gift, may obtain what is good. A son is born, a male child: he obtaineth wealth. He increaseth in every house.🔽Good to-day, O Savitar, good to-morrow, good day by day, good to us do thou grant. For of the store of good things, O God, through this prayer may we be partakers of thy bounty.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si sāvitro 'si canodhāś canodhā asi cano mayi dhehi / jinva yajñaṃ jinva yajñapatiṃ bhagāya devāya tvā savitre //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ si sāvitraḥ si canaḥ dhāḥ canaḥ dhāḥ asi canaḥ mayi dhehi      jinva yajñam jinva yajñapatim bhagāya devāya tvā savitre
translated: Thou art taken with a support: thou art Savitar, the supporter of the hymn. Thou art the supporter: bestow the hymn on me. Animate the sacrifice, animate the lord of the sacrifice for prosperity. Thee for the god Savitar.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si suśarmāsi supratiṣṭhāno bṛhadukṣāya namaḥ / viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ / eṣa te yonir viśvebhyas tvā devebhyaḥ //🔽upayāmagṛhīto 'si bṛhaspatisutasya deva soma ta indor indriyāvataṃ patnīvato grahām ṛdhyāsam / ahaṃ parastād aham avastād yad antarikṣaṃ tad u me pitābhūt / aham sūryam ubhayato dadarśāhaṃ devānāṃ paramaṃ guhā yat //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si su śarmā asi su pratiṣṭhānaḥ bṛhadukṣāya namaḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ   eṣa te yoniḥ viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ  upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si bṛhaspati sutasya deva soma te indoḥ indriyāvatam patnīvataḥ grahām ṛdhyāsam    aham parastāt aham avastāt yat antarikṣam tat u me pitā abhūt    aham sūryam ubhayatas dadarśa aham devānām paramam guhā yat
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thou art well-protected, well-established. Homage to the great milker. To the All-gods thee! This is thy birthplace. To the All-gods thee!🔽Thou art taken with a support. Thou art of the son of the god Soma, O god Soma, of the invigorating, of the one accompanied by a wife, of the cup I shall prosper. I am yonder, I am here. What is the atmosphere, that was my father. I saw the sun on both sides. I am the highest secret of the gods.

original: patnīvant sajūr devena tvaṣṭrā somaṃ piba svāhā / prajāpatir vṛṣāsi retodhā reto mayi dhehi prajāpates ta vṛṣṇo retodhaso retodhām aśīya //
analyzed: patnīvan sajūs devena tvaṣṭrā somam piba svāhā prajāpatiḥ vṛṣā asi retaḥ dhāḥ retaḥ mayi dhehi prajāpateḥ te vṛṣṇaḥ retaḥ dhasaḥ retaḥ dhām aśīya
translated: Accompanied by a wife, in unison with the god Tvastr, drink the Soma, Hail! Thou art the male Prajapati, the bestower of seed. Place seed in me. Of Prajapati, the male, the bestower of seed, may I be the bestower of seed.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si harir asi hāriyojano haribhyāṃ tvā / haryor dhānā stha sahasomā indrāya //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si hariḥ asi hāriyojanaḥ haribhyām tvā haryoḥ dhānāḥ stha saha somāḥ indrāya
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thou art the tawny one, yoked by the tawny ones. For the two tawny ones thee! The grains of the two tawny ones are together with the Soma for Indra.

original: yas te aśvasanir bhakṣo yo gosanis tasya ta iṣṭayajuṣa stutasomasya śastokthasyopahūtasyopahūto bhakṣayāmi //
analyzed: yaḥ te aśva saniḥ bhakṣaḥ yaḥ go saniḥ tasya te iṣṭa yajuṣaḥ stuta somasya śasta ukthasya upahūtasya upahūtaḥ bhakṣayāmi
translated: The draught which is for the winning of horses, which is for the winning of cows, of that of thine which has been invoked with the Yajus, whose Soma has been praised, whose Ukthas have been chanted, which has been invoked, I invoke and eat.

original: devakṛtasyainaso 'vayajanam asi / manuṣyakṛtasyainaso 'vayajanam asi / pitṛkṛtasyainaso 'vayajanam asi / ātmakṛtasyainaso 'vayajanam asi / enasaenaso 'vayajanam asi / yac cāham eno vidvāmś cakāra yac cāvidvāms tasya sarvasyainaso 'vayajanam asi //
analyzed: deva kṛtasya enasaḥ vayajanam asi   manuṣya kṛtasya enasaḥ vayajanam asi   pitṛ kṛtasya enasaḥ vayajanam asi   ātma kṛtasya enasaḥ vayajanam asi    enasa enasaḥ vayajanam asi            asi        ca aham enaḥ vidvām cakāra yat ca a vidvān tasya sarvasya enasaḥ vayajanam asi
translated: Thou art the expiation of sin committed against the Gods. Thou art the expiation of sin committed against men. Thou art the expiation of sin committed against the Fathers. Thou art the expiation of sin committed against ourselves. Thou art the expiation of every sin. Of whatever sin I have been guilty, whether knowingly or unknowingly, thou art the expiation of all that sin.

original: saṃ varcasā payasā saṃ tanūbhir aganmahi manasā sam śivena / tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyo 'nu mārṣṭu tanvo yad viliṣṭam //
analyzed: sam varcasā payasā sam tanūbhiḥ aganmahi manasā sam śivena    tvaṣṭā su datraḥ vi dadhātu rāyaḥ nu mārṣṭu tanvaḥ yat viliṣṭam
translated: With splendour, with the milk of cows, with our bodies have we united ourselves, and with auspicious thought. May Tvashtar, the bountiful, allot to us riches, and heal whatever is amiss in us.

original: sam indra ṇo manasā neṣi gobhiḥ sam sūribhir maghavant sam svastyā / saṃ brahmaṇā devakṛtaṃ yad asti saṃ devānām sumatau yajñiyānām svāhā //
analyzed: sam indra naḥ manasā neṣi gobhiḥ sam sūribhiḥ maghavan sam svastyā    sam brahmaṇā deva kṛtam yat asti sam devānām sumatau yajñiyānām svāhā
translated: With thy mind, O Indra, lead us to the cattle, lead us, O bountiful one, to happiness, lead us to the holy lore that is the Gods' possession. Lead us to the favour of the Gods who claim our worship. All-hail!

original: saṃ varcasā payasā saṃ tanūbhir aganmahi manasā sam śivena / tvaṣṭā sudatro vidadhātu rāyo 'nu mārṣṭu tanvo yad viliṣṭam //
analyzed: sam varcasā payasā sam tanūbhiḥ aganmahi manasā sam śivena    tvaṣṭā su datraḥ vidadhātu rāyaḥ nu mārṣṭu tanvaḥ yat viliṣṭam
translated: With splendour, with the milk of cows, with our bodies have we united ourselves, and with auspicious thought. May Tvashtar, the bountiful, allot to us riches, and heal whatever is amiss in us.

original: dhātā rātiḥ savitedaṃ juṣantāṃ prajāpatir nidhipā devo agniḥ / tvaṣṭā viṣṇuḥ prajayā samrarāṇā yajamānāya draviṇaṃ dadhāta svāhā //
analyzed: dhātā rātiḥ savitā idam juṣantām prajāpatiḥ nidhi pāḥ devaḥ agniḥ    tvaṣṭā viṣṇuḥ prajayā samrarāṇāḥ yajamānāya draviṇam dadhāta svāhā
translated: May Dhatr, Rati, Savitar accept this, Prajâpati, the Lord of treasures, God, Agni. Tvashtar, Vishnu, granting offspring, bestow wealth on the sacrificer. All-hail!

original: sugā vo devāḥ sadanā akarma ya ājagmedam savanaṃ juṣāṇāḥ / bharamāṇā vahamānā havīmṣy asme dhatta vasavo vasūni svāhā //
analyzed: sugā vaḥ devāḥ sadanā akarma ye ājagma idam savanam juṣāṇāḥ   bharamāṇāḥ vahamānāḥ havīmṣi asme dhatta vasavaḥ vasūni svāhā
translated: Ye Gods, make your seats easy who have come hither to this libation, well-pleased. Bearing and carrying the sacrificial gifts, bestow on us, O Vasus, treasures. All-hail!

original: yām āvaha uśato deva devāms tān preraya sve agne sadhasthe / jakṣivāmsaḥ papivāmsaś ca viśve 'suṃ dharmam svarātiṣṭhatānu svāhā //
analyzed: yām āvahaḥ uśataḥ deva devān tān preraya sve agne sadhasthe jakṣivāmsaḥ papivāmsaḥ ca viśve sum dharmam svarā atiṣṭhata anu svāhā
translated: The Gods whom thou hast brought hither, O God, O Agni, send them to their own abode. Let all of them, having eaten and drunk, sit down in their own place, according to their wont. All-hail!

original: vayam hi tvā prayati yajñe asminn agne hotāram avṛṇīmahīha / ṛdhag ayā ṛdhag utāśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan yajñam upa yāhi vidvānt svāhā //
analyzed: vayam hi tvā prayati yajñe asmin agne hotāram avṛṇīmahi iha    ṛdhak ayā ṛdhak uta aśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan yajñam upa yāhi vidvān svāhā
translated: For we have chosen thee, O Agni, to be our Hotar Priest at this our sacrifice. Thou hast prospered, and hast prospered our desire. Knowing the sacrifice, come thou, O wise one, to the sacrifice. All-hail!

original: devā gātuvido gātuṃ vittvā gātum ita / manasaspata imaṃ deva yajñam svāhā vāte dhāḥ //
analyzed: devāḥ gātu vidaḥ gātum vittvā gātum ita manasaspate imam deva yajñam svāhā vāte dhāḥ
translated: Ye Gods who find the path, having found the path, go ye the path. O Lord of Mind, this sacrifice, O God, All-hail! Place it in the wind.

original: yajña yajñaṃ gaccha yajñapatiṃ gaccha svāṃ yoniṃ gaccha svāhā / eṣa te yajño yajñapate sahasūktavākaḥ sarvavīras taj juṣasva svāhā //
analyzed: yajña yajñam gaccha yajñapatim gaccha svām yonim gaccha svāhā eṣa te yajñaḥ yajñapate sahasūktavākaḥ sarva vīraḥ tat juṣasva svāhā
translated: Go to the sacrifice, go to the lord of the sacrifice, go to thy own place, hail! This is thy sacrifice, O lord of the sacrifice, with good praises, with all heroes; rejoice in it, hail!

original: māhir bhūr mā pṛdākuḥ / urum hi rājā varuṇaś cakāra sūryāya panthām anvetavā u / apade pādā pratidhātave 'kar utāpavaktā hṛdayāvidhaś cit / namo varuṇāyābhiṣṭhito varuṇasya pāśaḥ //
analyzed: mā ahiḥ bhūḥ mā pṛdākuḥ    urum hi rājā varuṇaḥ cakāra sūryāya panthām anvetavai u   a pade pādā pratidhātave kaḥ uta apavaktā hṛdayāvidhaḥ cit   namaḥ varuṇāya abhiṣṭhitaḥ varuṇasya pāśaḥ
translated: Be not rough, be not uneven. For wide indeed hath king Varuna made the path for the sun to travel on. On the footless he hath made the foot to be set down. He also hath disclosed the heart's secret thoughts. Homage to Varuna. Bound is Varuna's noose.

original: agner anīkam apa ā viveśāpāṃ napāt pratirakṣann asuryam / damedame samidhaṃ yakṣy agne prati te jihvā ghṛtam uc caraṇyat svāhā //
analyzed: agneḥ anīkam apaḥ ā viveśa apām napāt pratirakṣan asuryam    damedame samidham yakṣi agne prati te jihvā ghṛtam ud caraṇyat svāhā
translated: The face of Agni hath entered the waters, the son of the waters guarding the Asura nature. In every house thou shalt worship with fuel, O Agni. Thy tongue shall lick the ghee that is offered. Hail!

original: samudre te hṛdayam apsv antaḥ saṃ tvā viśantv oṣadhīr utāpaḥ / yajñasya tvā yajñapate sūktoktau namovāke vidhema yat svāhā //
analyzed: samudre te hṛdayam apsu antar sam tvā viśantu oṣadhīḥ uta apaḥ   yajñasya tvā yajña pate sūkta uktau namovāke vidhema yat svāhā
translated: In the ocean is thy heart, in the waters. Let the plants and the waters enter into thee. Thee, O lord of sacrifice, we will honour with the hymn in the invocation of the hymn, with the Namovâka, what we offer, hail!

original: devīr āpa eṣa vo garbhas tam suprītam subhṛtaṃ bibhṛta / deva somaiṣa te lokas tasmiñ chaṃ ca vakṣva pari ca vakṣva //
analyzed: devīḥ āpaḥ eṣa vaḥ garbhaḥ tam su prītam su bhṛtam bibhṛta    deva soma eṣa te lokaḥ tasmin śam ca vakṣva pari ca vakṣva
translated: O divine waters, this is your embryo. Bear it well-pleased, well-nourished. O god Soma, this is thy world. In it rejoice and around it rejoice.

original: avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa nicerur asi nicumpuṇaḥ / ava devair devakṛtam eno 'yāsiṣam ava martyair martyakṛtaṃ pururāvṇo deva riṣas pāhi //
analyzed: avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa niceruḥ asi nicumpuṇaḥ    ava devaiḥ deva kṛtam enaḥ yāsiṣam ava martyaiḥ martya kṛtam pururāvṇaḥ deva riṣaḥ pāhi
translated: O Avabhṛtha, O Nichumpuṇa, thou art Nichumpuṇa. I have passed beyond the sin committed by the gods through the gods, I have passed beyond the sin committed by men through men. O god of many voices, protect me from misfortune.

original: devānām samid asi //
analyzed: devānām samidh asi
translated: Thou art the kindling-stick of the gods.🔽Let the ten-month-old embryo move with the after-birth,🔽As this wind moves, as the ocean moves,

original: ejatu daśamāsyo garbho jarāyuṇā saha / yathāyaṃ vāyur ejati yathā samudra ejati / evāyaṃ daśamāsyo asraj jarāyuṇā saha //
analyzed: ejatu daśamāsyaḥ garbhaḥ jarāyuṇā saha    yathā ayam vāyuḥ ejati yathā samudraḥ ejati      eva ayam daśamāsyaḥ asrat jarāyuṇā saha
translated: So has this ten-month-old one moved with the after-birth.🔽Whose womb is fit for sacrifice, whose golden birthplace,

original: yasyai te yajñiyo garbho yasyai yonir hiraṇyī / aṅgāny ahrutā yasya taṃ mātrā sam ajīgamam svāhā //
analyzed: yasyai te yajñiyaḥ garbhaḥ yasyai yoniḥ hiraṇyī    aṅgāni ahrutā yasya tam mātrā sam ajīgamam svāhā
translated: Whose limbs are uninjured, I have united it with its mother. Svāhā.

original: purudasmo viṣurūpa indur antar mahimānam ānañja dhīraḥ / ekapadīṃ dvipadīṃ tripadīṃ catuṣpadīm aṣṭāpadīṃ bhuvanānu prathantām svāhā //
analyzed: puru dasmaḥ viṣurūpaḥ induḥ antar mahimānam ānañja dhīraḥ  / ekapadīm dvipadīm tripadīm catuṣpadīm aṣṭāpadīm bhuvanā anu prathantām svāhā
translated: The very bountiful, variously-formed moon, the wise one, has spread his greatness within. Let the one-footed, two-footed, three-footed, four-footed, and eight-footed worlds extend. Svāhā.🔽O Maruts, for in the abode of him🔽Who has the great glory of heaven,

original: maruto yasya hi kṣaye pāthā divo vimahasaḥ / sa sugopātamo janaḥ //
analyzed: marutaḥ yasya hi kṣaye pāthāḥ divaḥ vimahasaḥ    sa sugopātamaḥ janaḥ
translated: That people is the best protected.🔽May the great heaven and earth anoint this sacrifice of ours,

original: mahī dyauḥ pṛthivī ca na imaṃ yajñaṃ mimikṣatām / pipṛtāṃ no bharīmabhiḥ //
analyzed: mahī dyauḥ pṛthivī ca naḥ imam yajñam mimikṣatām    pipṛtām naḥ bharīmabhiḥ
translated: And fill us with nourishing food.

original: ā tiṣṭha vṛtrahan rathaṃ yuktā te brahmaṇā harī / arvācīnam su te mano grāvā kṛṇotu vagnunā //
analyzed: ā tiṣṭha vṛtrahan ratham yuktā te brahmaṇā harī   arvācīnam su te manaḥ grāvā kṛṇotu vagnunā
translated: Mount thy car, O Vritra-slayer, thy two Bay Steeds are yoked by prayer: Let the stone with its voice make thy mind turn hitherward to us.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine
translated: Thou art taken with a support: thee to Indra of the Sodashin. This is thy womb: thee to Indra of the Sodashin.

original: yukṣvā hi keśinā harī vṛṣaṇā kakṣyaprā / athā na indra somapā girām upaśrutiṃ cara //
analyzed: yukṣvā hi keśinā harī vṛṣaṇā kakṣya prā    athā naḥ indra soma pāḥ girām upaśrutim cara
translated: Yoke, O thou with the flowing hair, thy two strong Bays who draw the car, And, O thou Indra, Soma-drinker, come thou to the hearing of our songs.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine
translated: Thou art taken with a support: thee to Indra of the Sodashin. This is thy womb: thee to Indra of the Sodashin.

original: indram id dharī vahato 'pratidhṛṣṭaśavasam / ṛṣīṇāṃ ca stutīr upa yajñaṃ ca mānuṣāṇām //
analyzed: indram id harī vahataḥ pratidhṛṣṭa śavasam      ṛṣīṇām ca stutīḥ upa yajñam ca mānuṣāṇām
translated: The two Bay Steeds bring Indra, whose strength no foe may resist, To the praises of the Rishis and the sacrifices of mankind.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā ṣoḍaśine
translated: Thou art taken with a support: thee to Indra of the Sodashin. This is thy womb: thee to Indra of the Sodashin.

original: yasman na jātaḥ paro anyo asti ya āviveśa bhuvanāni viśvā / prajāpatiḥ prajayā samrarāṇas trīṇi jyotīmṣi sacate sa ṣolaśī //
analyzed: yasmat na jātaḥ paraḥ anyaḥ asti yaḥ āviveśa bhuvanāni viśvā    prajāpatiḥ prajayā samrarāṇaḥ trīṇi jyotīmṣi sacate sa ṣolaśī
translated: From whom no other hath been born, nor ever shall be born, who hath pervaded all existing things, Prajapati, rejoicing in offspring, he, the Sodashin, is associated with the three lights.

original: indraś ca samrāḍ varuṇaś ca rājā tau te bhakṣaṃ cakratur agr etam / tayor aham anu bhakṣaṃ bhakṣayāmi vāg devī juṣāṇā somasya tṛpyatu / saha prāṇena svāhā //
analyzed: indraḥ ca samrāj varuṇaḥ ca rājā tau te bhakṣam cakratuḥ agr etam    tayoḥ aham anu bhakṣam bhakṣayāmi vāc devī juṣāṇā somasya tṛpyatu     saha prāṇena svāhā
translated: Indra the Universal King and Varuna the King have made this thy first morsel. After them I eat the morsel. May the Goddess Speech, approving, be satisfied with Soma. With expiration, Hail!

original: agne pavasva svapā asme varcaḥ suvīryam / dadhad rayiṃ mayi poṣam //
analyzed: agne pavasva su apāḥ asme varcaḥ su vīryam   dadhat rayim mayi poṣam
translated: O Agni, purify thyself, O thou that art pure, give us lustre and good heroism, bestow wealth and nourishment on me.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy agnaye tvā varcase / eṣa te yonir agnaye tvā varcase / agne varcasvin varcasvāms tvaṃ deveṣv asi varcasvān ahaṃ manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si agnaye tvā varcase   eṣa te yoniḥ agnaye tvā varcase   agne varcasvin varcasvān tvam deveṣu asi varcasvān aham manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam
translated: Thou art taken with a support: thee to Agni for lustre. This is thy birthplace: thee to Agni for lustre. O Agni, full of lustre, thou art full of lustre among the gods; may I be full of lustre among men.

original: uttiṣṭhann ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ / somam indra camū sutam / upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvaujase / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvaujase / indraujiṣṭhaujiṣṭhas tvaṃ deveṣv asy ojiṣṭho 'haṃ manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam //
analyzed: uttiṣṭhan ojasā saha pītvī śipre avepayaḥ   somam indra camū sutam    upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā ojase   eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā ojase   indra ojiṣṭha ojiṣṭhaḥ tvam deveṣu asi ojiṣṭhaḥ ham manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam
translated: Rising with might, having drunk, thou hast shaken the two bays, O Indra, the Soma pressed in the bowl. Thou art taken with a support: thee to Indra for might. This is thy birthplace: thee to Indra for might. O Indra, mightiest of the mighty, thou art mightiest among the gods; may I be mightiest among men.

original: adṛśram asya ketavo vi raśmayo janām anu / bhrājanto agnayo yathā //
analyzed: adṛśram asya ketavaḥ vi raśmayaḥ janām anu    bhrājantaḥ agnayaḥ yathā
translated: The banners of this one have been seen, the rays according to the people, shining like fires.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si sūryāya tvā bhrājāya / eṣa te yoniḥ sūryāya tvā bhrājāya / sūrya bhrājiṣṭha bhrājiṣṭhas tvaṃ deveṣv asi bhrājiṣṭho 'haṃ manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si sūryāya tvā bhrājāya   eṣa te yoniḥ sūryāya tvā bhrājāya   sūrya bhrājiṣṭha bhrājiṣṭhaḥ tvam deveṣu asi bhrājiṣṭhaḥ ham manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Surya, for radiance. This is thy birthplace. Thee for Surya, for radiance. O Surya, most radiant, thou art the most radiant among the gods. May I be the most radiant among men.

original: ud u tyaṃ jātavedasaṃ devaṃ vahanti ketavaḥ / dṛśe viśvāya sūryam //
analyzed: ud u tyam jātavedasam devam vahanti ketavaḥ    dṛśe viśvāya sūryam
translated: They bear thee upward, O all-knower, the god, the banners, for the sight of all, Surya.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si sūryāya tvā bhrājāya / eṣa te yoniḥ sūryāya tvā bhrājāya / sūrya bhrājiṣṭha bhrājiṣṭhas tvaṃ deveṣv asi bhrājiṣṭho 'haṃ manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si sūryāya tvā bhrājāya   eṣa te yoniḥ sūryāya tvā bhrājāya   sūrya bhrājiṣṭha bhrājiṣṭhaḥ tvam deveṣu asi bhrājiṣṭhaḥ ham manuṣyeṣu bhūyāsam
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Surya, for radiance. This is thy birthplace. Thee for Surya, for radiance. O Surya, most radiant, thou art the most radiant among the gods. May I be the most radiant among men.

original: sahasraṃ dhukṣvorudhārā payasvatī punar māviśatād rayiḥ //
analyzed: sahasram dhukṣva uru dhārā payasvatī punar mā āviśatāt rayiḥ
translated: Milk for a thousand (nights) the full-flowing, rich in milk, may wealth enter me again.

original: iḍe rante havye kāmye candre jyote 'dite sarasvati mahi viśruti / etā te aghnye nāmāni devebhyo mā sukṛtaṃṃ brūtāt //
analyzed: iḍe rante havye kāmye candre jyote dite sarasvati mahi viśruti
translated: O Ida, Ranti, Havya, Kamya, Chandra, Jyoti, Aditi, Sarasvati, great is thy fame. These are thy names, O harmless one. Tell the gods of my good deed.

original: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ / yo asmām abhidāsaty adharaṃ gamayā tamaḥ //
analyzed: vi naḥ indra mṛdhaḥ jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ    yaḥ asmām abhidāsati adharam gamaya tamaḥ
translated: O Indra, destroy our enemies, cast down those who rise against us. Him who assails us, lead him down into the lowest darkness.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā vimṛdhe / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā vimṛdhe //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā vimṛdhe   eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā vimṛdhe
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Indra, the victorious. This is thy womb. Thee to Indra, the victorious.

original: vācas patiṃ viśvakarmāṇam ūtaye manojuvaṃ vāje adyā huvema / sa no viśvāni havanāni joṣad viśvaśambhūr avase sādhukarmā //
analyzed: vācaḥ patim viśvakarmāṇam ūtaye manaḥ juvam vāje adyā huvema    sa naḥ viśvāni havanāni joṣat viśva śambhūḥ avase sādhu karmā
translated: The Lord of Speech, the all-worker, let us call today to aid, swift-moving in the race. May he accept all our invocations, the all-beneficent, the well-working, for help.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā viśvakarmaṇe / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā viśvakarmaṇe //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā viśva karmaṇe    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā viśva karmaṇe
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Indra, the all-worker. This is thy womb. Thee to Indra, the all-worker.

original: viśvakarman haviṣā vardhanena trātāram indram akṛṇor avadhyam / tasmai viśaḥ samanamanta pūrvīr ayam ugro vihavyo yathāsat //
analyzed: viśvakarman haviṣā vardhanena trātāram indram akṛṇoḥ avadhyam    tasmai viśaḥ samanamanta pūrvīḥ ayam ugraḥ vihavyaḥ yathā asat
translated: O Vishvakarman, by this strengthening oblation thou hast made Indra invincible, the protector. To him have bowed many people. May this fierce one be as the invoked (Indra).

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā viśvakarmaṇe / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā viśvakarmaṇe //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā viśva karmaṇe    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā viśva karmaṇe
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Indra, the all-worker. This is thy womb. Thee to Indra, the all-worker.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy agnaye tvā gāyatracchandasaṃ gṛhṇāmi / indrāya tvā triṣṭupchandasaṃ gṛhṇāmi / viśvebhyas tvā devebhyo jagacchandasaṃ gṛhṇāmi / anuṣṭup te 'bhigaraḥ //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si agnaye tvā gāyatra chandasam gṛhṇāmi    indrāya tvā triṣṭubh chandasam gṛhṇāmi   viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ jagat chandasam gṛhṇāmi    anuṣṭubh te bhigaraḥ
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee to Agni, I take thee with the Gayatri metre. Thee to Indra, I take thee with the Tristubh metre. Thee to the All-gods, I take thee with the Jagati metre. The Anustubh is thy praisha.

original: vreśīnāṃ tvā patmann ā dhūnomi kukānanānāṃ tvā patmann ā dhūnomi bhandanānāṃ tvā patmann ā dhūnomi madintamānāṃ tvā patmann ā dhūnomi madhuntamānāṃ tvā patmann ā dhūnomi śukraṃ tvā śukra ā dhūnomy ahno rūpe sūryasya raśmiṣu //
analyzed: vreśīnām tvā patman ā dhūnomi kukānanānām tvā patman ā dhūnomi bhandanānām tvā patman ā dhūnomi madintamānām tvā patman ā dhūnomi madhuntamānām tvā patman ā dhūnomi śukram tvā śukre ā dhūnomi ahnaḥ rūpe sūryasya raśmiṣu
translated: I shake thee in the path of the Vrishis, I shake thee in the path of the Kukhanas, I shake thee in the path of the Bhundanas, I shake thee in the path of the most gladdening, I shake thee in the path of the most sweet, I shake thee, the pure, in the pure, in the form of the day, in the rays of the sun.

original: kakubham rūpaṃ vṛṣabhasya rocate bṛhac chukraḥ śukrasya purogāḥ somaḥ somasya purogāḥ / yat te somādābhyaṃ nāma jāgṛvi tasmai tvā gṛhṇāmi tasmai te soma somāya svāhā //
analyzed: kakubham rūpam vṛṣabhasya rocate bṛhat śukraḥ śukrasya purogāḥ somaḥ somasya purogāḥ   yat te soma adābhyam nāma jāgṛvi tasmai tvā gṛhṇāmi tasmai te soma somāya svāhā
translated: The lofty form of the bull shines forth, the pure, the pure's forerunner, Soma, Soma's forerunner. What invincible, watchful name thou hast, O Soma, for that I take thee. For that, O Soma, to Soma, Hail!

original: uśik tvaṃ deva somāgneḥ priyaṃ pātho 'pīhi / vaśī tvaṃ deva somendrasya priyaṃ pātho 'pīhi / asmatsakhā tvaṃ deva soma viśveṣāṃ devānāṃ priyaṃ pātho 'pīhi //
analyzed: uśij tvam deva soma agneḥ priyam pāthaḥ pīhi   vaśī tvam deva soma indrasya priyam pāthaḥ pīhi   asmad sakhā tvam deva soma viśveṣām devānām priyam pāthaḥ pīhi
translated: Thou, O divine Soma, the dear path of Agni, goest. Thou, O divine Soma, the dear path of Indra, goest. Thou, O divine Soma, the dear path of all the gods, goest.

original: iha ratir iha ramadhvam iha dhṛtir iha svadhṛtiḥ svāhā / upasṛjan dharuṇaṃ mātre dharuṇo mātaraṃ dhayan / rāyaspoṣam asmāsu dīdharat svāhā //
analyzed: iha ratiḥ iha ramadhvam iha dhṛtiḥ iha sva dhṛtiḥ svāhā   upasṛjan dharuṇam mātre dharuṇaḥ mātaram dhayan    rāyaspoṣam asmāsu dīdharat svāhā
translated: Here is delight, here rejoice, here is support, here is self-support, Svâhâ. The child, approaching his mother, the mother her child, may he sustain increase of wealth for us. Svâhâ.

original: satrasya ṛddhir asy aganma jyotir amṛtā abhūma divaṃ pṛthivyā adhy āruhāmāvidāma devānt svar jyotiḥ //
analyzed: satrasya ṛddhiḥ asi aganma jyotiḥ amṛtāḥ abhūma  / divam pṛthivyāḥ adhi āruhāma avidāma devān svar jyotiḥ
translated: The prosperity of the sacrifice is thine. We have attained the light. We have become immortal. We have ascended from the earth to the sky. We have found the gods. The light of heaven.

original: yuvaṃ tam indrāparvatā puroyudhā yo naḥ pṛtanyād apa taṃtam id dhataṃ vajreṇa taṃtam id dhatam / dūre cattāya chantsad gahanaṃ yad inakṣat / asmākam śatrūn pari śūra viśvato darmā darṣīṣṭa viśvataḥ //
analyzed: yuvam tam indrāparvatā puroyudhā yaḥ naḥ pṛtanyāt apa taṃtam id dhatam vajreṇa taṃtam id dhatam    dūre cattāya chantsat gahanam yat inakṣat   asmākam śatrūn pari śūra viśvatas darmā darṣīṣṭa viśvatas
translated: You, O Indra and Parvata, the vanguard, him who would fight against us, him do ye slay with the thunderbolt, him do ye slay. Far away let him go to the place he loves, to the deep, to the place he seeks. O hero, from every side let thy bolt strike our enemies.

original: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ suprajāḥ prajābhiḥ syāma suvīrā vīraiḥ supoṣāḥ poṣaiḥ //
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar suprajāḥ prajābhiḥ syāma su vīrāḥ vīraiḥ su poṣāḥ poṣaiḥ
translated: May we be prosperous with offspring, with heroes, with increase.

original: parameṣṭhy abhidhītaḥ / prajāpatir vāci vyāhṛtāyām / andho acchetaḥ / savitā sanyām / viśvakarmā dīkṣāyām / pūṣā somakrayaṇyām //
analyzed: parameṣṭhī abhidhītaḥ   prajāpatiḥ vāci vyāhṛtāyām   andhaḥ acchetaḥ    savitā sanyām   viśvakarmā dīkṣāyām pūṣā somakrayaṇyām
translated: Parameshthin is appointed, Prajapati in the uttered word, Andha in the thought, Savitar in the sacrifice, Vishvakarman in the consecration, Pushan in the Soma purchase.

original: indraś ca marutaś ca krayāyopotthitaḥ / asuraḥ paṇyamānaḥ / mitraḥ krītaḥ / viṣṇuḥ śipiviṣṭa ūrāv āsannaḥ / viṣṇur narandhiṣaḥ prohyamāṇaḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ ca marutaḥ ca krayāya upotthitaḥ   asuraḥ paṇyamānaḥ   mitraḥ krītaḥ   viṣṇuḥ śipiviṣṭe ūrau āsannaḥ    viṣṇuḥ narandhiṣaḥ prohyamāṇaḥ
translated: Indra and the Maruts rise up for the purchase, the Asura is being bartered, Mitra is bought, Vishnu, the all-pervading, is seated on the thighs, Vishnu, the all-embracing, is being carried forward.

original: soma āgataḥ / varuṇa āsandyām āsannaḥ / agnir āgnīdhre / indro havirdhāne / atharvopāvahriyamāṇaḥ //
analyzed: somaḥ āgataḥ varuṇaḥ āsandyām āsannaḥ   agniḥ āgnīdhre indraḥ havirdhāne   atharvā upāvahriyamāṇaḥ
translated: Soma has come. Varuṇa is seated on the seat. Agni is in the Āgnīdhra fire-chamber. Indra is in the Havirdhāna shed. Atharvan is being carried down.

original: viśve devā amśuṣu nyuptaḥ / viṣṇur āprītapā āpyāyyamānaḥ / yamaḥ sūyamānaḥ / viṣṇuḥ saṃbhriyamāṇaḥ / vāyuḥ pūyamānaḥ / śukraḥ pūtaḥ / śukraṃ kṣīraśrīḥ / manthī saktuśrīḥ //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ amśuṣu nyuptaḥ viṣṇuḥ āprīta pāḥ āpyāyyamānaḥ   yamaḥ sūyamānaḥ   viṣṇuḥ saṃbhriyamāṇaḥ   vāyuḥ pūyamānaḥ śukraḥ pūtaḥ    śukram kṣīra śrīḥ   manthī saktu śrīḥ
translated: The Viśve Devas are placed in the stalks. Viṣṇu is being sprinkled in the Āprīta vessel. Yama is being pressed. Viṣṇu is being prepared. Vāyu is being purified. Śukra is purified. Śukra is the glory of milk. Manthī is the glory of flour.

original: viśve devāś camaseṣūnnītaḥ / asur homāyodyataḥ / rudro hūyamānaḥ / vāto 'bhyāvṛttaḥ / nṛcakṣāḥ pratikhyātaḥ / bhakṣo bhakṣyamāṇaḥ / pitaro nārāśamsāḥ sannaḥ //
analyzed: viśve devāḥ camaseṣu unnītaḥ   asuḥ homāya udyataḥ rudraḥ hūyamānaḥ vātaḥ bhyāvṛttaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ pratikhyātaḥ bhakṣaḥ bhakṣyamāṇaḥ pitaraḥ nārāśamsāḥ sannaḥ
translated: The Viśve Devas are poured into the goblets. Asura is ready for the oblations. Rudra is being offered. Vāyu is turned back. Nṛcaksus is announced. The drink is being drunk. The Pitṛs are ready for the Nārāśamsa offerings.

original: sindhur avabhṛthāyodyataḥ / samudro 'bhyavahriyamāṇaḥ / salilaḥ praplutaḥ / yayor ojasā skabhitā rajāmsi vīryebhir vīratamā śaviṣṭhā / yā patyete apratītā sahobhir viṣṇū agan varuṇā pūrvahūtau //
analyzed: sindhuḥ avabhṛthāya udyataḥ   samudraḥ abhyavahriyamāṇaḥ salilaḥ praplutaḥ   yayoḥ ojasā skabhitā rajāmsi vīryebhiḥ vīratamā śaviṣṭhā   yā patyete apratītā sahobhiḥ viṣṇū agan varuṇā pūrva hūtau
translated: Sindhu is ready for the Avabhṛtha bath. Samudra is being carried down. Salila has plunged in. By whose might the regions are shaken, most manly by their powers, most mighty, Who rule together, incomparable by their strength, Viṣṇu and Varuṇa have gone to the first invocation.

original: devān divam agan yajñas tato mā draviṇam aṣṭu manuṣyān antarikṣam agan yajñas tato mā draviṇam aṣṭu pitṛn pṛthivīm agan yajñas tato mā draviṇam aṣṭu yaṃ kaṃ ca lokam agan yajñas tato me bhadraṃ abhūt //
analyzed: devān divam agan yajñaḥ tatas mā draviṇam aṣṭu manuṣyān antarikṣam agan yajñaḥ tatas mā draviṇam aṣṭu pitṛn pṛthivīm agan yajñaḥ tatas mā draviṇam aṣṭu yam kam ca lokam agan yajñaḥ tatas me bhadram abhūt
translated: The sacrifice has gone to the gods, to heaven: thence let wealth come unto me. The sacrifice has gone to men, to the atmosphere: thence let wealth come unto me. The sacrifice has gone to the Fathers, to the earth: thence let wealth come unto me. Whithersoever the sacrifice has gone, thence hath good come unto me.

original: catustrimśat tantavo ye vitatnire ya imaṃ yajñam svadhayā dadante / teṣāṃ chinnam sam v etad dadhāmi svāhā gharmo apy etu devān //
analyzed: catustrimśat tantavaḥ ye vitatnire ye imam yajñam svadhayā dadante    teṣām chinnam sam u etat dadhāmi svāhā gharmaḥ api etu devān
translated: The thirty-four threads which are spread out, which with their own nature give this sacrifice, their severed part I now unite. Hail! Let the Hotar go to the gods.

original: yajñasya doho vitataḥ purutrā so aṣṭadhā divam anvā tatāna / sa yajña dhukṣva mahi me prajayām rāyaspoṣaṃ viśvam āyur aśīya svāhā //
analyzed: yajñasya dohaḥ vitataḥ purutrā saḥ aṣṭadhā divam anvā tatāna    sa yajña dhukṣva mahi me prajayām rāyaspoṣam viśvam āyuḥ aśīya svāhā
translated: The milk of sacrifice is spread abroad in many a place: it hath extended itself eightfold through the sky. O sacrifice, do thou milk out for me great increase of my race. May I obtain all food and life. Hail!

original: ā pavasva hiraṇyavad aśvavat soma vīravat / vājaṃ gomantam ā bhara svāhā //
analyzed: ā pavasva hiraṇyavat aśvavat soma vīravat    vājam gomantam ā bhara svāhā
translated: Flow on, O Soma, rich in gold, in steeds, and heroes. Bring us food with much cattle. Hail!

original: deva savitaḥ pra suva yajñaṃ pra suva yajñapatiṃ bhagāya / divyo gandharvaḥ ketupūḥ ketaṃ naḥ punātu vācaspatir vājaṃ naḥ svadatu svāhā //
analyzed: deva savitar pra suva yajñam pra suva yajñapatim bhagāya     divyaḥ gandharvaḥ ketu pūḥ ketam naḥ punātu vācaspatiḥ vājam naḥ svadatu svāhā
translated: God Savitar, speed the sacrifice, speed the lord of the sacrifice to good fortune. May the divine Gandharva, the purifier of thought, purify our thought. May the lord of speech sweeten our speech. Hail!

original: dhruvasadaṃ tvā nṛṣadaṃ manaḥsadam / upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam / apsuṣadaṃ tvā ghṛtasadaṃ vyomasadam / upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam / pṛthivīsadaṃ tvāntarikṣasadaṃ divisadaṃ devasadaṃ nākasadam / upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam //
analyzed: dhruva sadam tvā nṛṣadam manaḥ sadam    upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā juṣṭam gṛhṇāmi           tvā ghṛta sadam vyoma sadam   upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā juṣṭam gṛhṇāmi         te yoniḥ indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam    pṛthivī sadam tvā antarikṣa sadam divisadam deva sadam nāka sadam      upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā juṣṭam gṛhṇāmi            te yoniḥ indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam
translated: Thee that sittest firm, thee that sittest among men, thee that sittest in the mind. Thou art taken with a support: I take thee dear to Indra. This is thy womb: thee to Indra, most acceptable. Thee that sittest in the waters, thee that sittest in the ghee, thee that sittest in the sky. Thou art taken with a support: I take thee dear to Indra. This is thy womb: thee to Indra, most acceptable. Thee that sittest on earth, thee that sittest in the atmosphere, thee that sittest in the sky, thee that sittest with the gods, thee that sittest in the vault. Thou art taken with a support: I take thee dear to Indra. This is thy womb: thee to Indra, most acceptable.🔽The sap of the waters, the strength that is in the sun, that is collected together,

original: apām rasam udvayasam sūrye santam samāhitam / apām rasasya yo rasas taṃ vo gṛhṇāmy uttamam //
analyzed: apām rasam udvayasam sūrye santam samāhitam   apām rasasya yaḥ rasaḥ tam vaḥ gṛhṇāmi uttamam
translated: The sap of the sap of the waters, that is your best, I take.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā juṣṭam gṛhṇāmi   / eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam
translated: Thou art taken with a support: I take thee dear to Indra. This is thy womb: thee to Indra, most acceptable.

original: grahā ūrjāhutayo vyanto viprāya matim / teṣāṃ viśipriyāṇāṃ vo 'ham iṣam ūrjam sam agrabham / upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā juṣṭaṃ gṛhṇāmi / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam / sampṛcau sthaḥ saṃ mā bhadreṇa pṛṅktam / vipṛcau stho vi mā pāpmanā pṛṅktam //
analyzed: grahāḥ ūrjā āhutayaḥ vyantaḥ viprāya matim   teṣām viśipriyāṇām vaḥ ham iṣam ūrjam sam agrabham    upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā juṣṭam gṛhṇāmi    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā juṣṭatamam   sampṛcau sthaḥ sam mā bhadreṇa pṛṅktam    vipṛcau sthaḥ vi mā pāpmanā pṛṅktam
translated: The Grahas, the Urjahutas, the Vyanta, the Vipra, the Mati, of them all, O ye whose paths are separate, I have grasped your food and strength. Thou art taken with a support. I take thee dear to Indra. This is thy womb. Thee for Indra, most dear. Ye are united. Unite me with what is good. Ye are separated. Separate me from evil.

original: indrasya vajro 'si vājasās tvayāyam set / vājasya nu prasave mātaraṃ mahīm aditiṃ nāma vacasā karāmahe / yasyām idaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanam āviveśa tasyāṃ no devaḥ savitā dharma sāviṣat //
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ si vāja sāḥ tvayā ayam set      vājasya nu prasave mātaram mahīm aditim nāma vacasā karāmahe    yasyām idam viśvam bhuvanam āviveśa tasyām naḥ devaḥ savitā dharma sāviṣat
translated: Thou art Indra's bolt, winning strength. By thee this (sacrificer) shall win strength. In the impulse of strength we will extol the great mother Aditi, in whom all this world hath its abode. In her may the God Savitar impel righteousness for us.

original: apsv antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam apām uta praśastiṣv aśvā bhavata vājinaḥ / devīr āpo yo va ūrmiḥ pratūrtiḥ kakunmān vājasās tenāyaṃ vājam set //
analyzed: apsu antar amṛtam apsu bheṣajam apām uta praśastiṣu aśvāḥ bhavata vājinaḥ    devīḥ āpaḥ yaḥ vaḥ ūrmiḥ pratūrtiḥ kakunmān vāja sāḥ tena ayam vājam set
translated: In the waters is the immortal, in the waters is the medicine. In the waters are the praises of the waters. Be ye strong horses. O ye divine waters, whatever wave of yours rushes forth, is impetuous, and full of strength, by that do ye make this (sacrificer) win strength.

original: vāto vā mano vā gandharvāḥ saptavimśatiḥ / te agre 'śvam ayuñjams te asmin javam ādadhuḥ //
analyzed: vātaḥ vā manaḥ vā gandharvāḥ saptavimśatiḥ   te agre śvam ayuñjam te asmin javam ādadhuḥ
translated: The wind, the mind, the Gandharvas, twenty-seven, they first yoked the horse. They bestowed speed on him.

original: vātaramhā bhava vājin yujyamāna indrasyeva dakṣiṇaḥ śriyaidhi / yuñjantu tvā maruto viśvavedasa ā te tvaṣṭā patsu javaṃ dadhātu //
analyzed: vāta ramhāḥ bhava vājin yujyamānaḥ indrasya iva dakṣiṇaḥ śriyā edhi    yuñjantu tvā marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ ā te tvaṣṭā patsu javam dadhātu
translated: Be thou yoked, O steed, for the wind's sake, as Indra's right (hand steed) for glory. Let the Maruts, all-knowing, yoke thee. Let Tvashtar bestow swiftness on thy feet.

original: javo yas te vājin nihito guhā yaḥ śyene parītto acarac ca vāte / tena no vājin balavān balena vājajic ca bhava samane ca pārayiṣṇuḥ //
analyzed: javaḥ yaḥ te vājin nihitaḥ guhā yaḥ śyene parīttaḥ acarat ca vāte     tena naḥ vājin balavān balena vāja jit ca bhava samane ca pārayiṣṇuḥ
translated: The swiftness which is laid up in thee, O steed, which is in the falcon, which hath been set in the wind, with that, O steed, be thou strong with strength, and victorious in the race, and ready to win in the contest.

original: vājino vājajito vājam sariṣyanto bṛhaspater bhāgam ava jighrata //
analyzed: vājinaḥ vāja jitaḥ vājam sariṣyantaḥ bṛhaspateḥ bhāgam ava jighrata
translated: The swift, the victorious, the strong, as they are about to run their course, smell the portion of Brihaspati.

original: devasyāham savituḥ save satyasavaso bṛhaspater uttamaṃ nākam ruheyam / devasyāham savituḥ save satyasavasa indrasyottamaṃ nākam ruheyam / devasyāham savituḥ save satyaprasavaso bṛhaspater uttamaṃ nākam aruham / devasyāham savituḥ save satyaprasavasa indrasyottamaṃ nākam aruham //
analyzed: devasya aham savituḥ save satyasavasaḥ bṛhaspateḥ uttamam nākam ruheyam
translated: By the impulse of the god Savitar, of true impulsion, may I ascend the highest vault of Brihaspati. By the impulse of the god Savitar, of true impulsion, may I ascend the highest vault of Indra. By the impulse of the god Savitar, of true impulsion, I have ascended the highest vault of Brihaspati. By the impulse of the god Savitar, of true impulsion, I have ascended the highest vault of Indra.

original: bṛhaspate vājaṃ jaya bṛhaspataye vācaṃ vadata bṛhaspatiṃ vājaṃ jāpayata / indra vājaṃ jayendrāya vācaṃ vadatendraṃ vājaṃ jāpayata //
analyzed: bṛhaspate vājam jaya bṛhaspataye vācam vadata bṛhaspatim vājam jāpayata      indra vājam jaya indrāya vācam vadata indram vājam jāpayata
translated: Brihaspati, win the prize! Speak to Brihaspati! Make Brihaspati win the prize! Indra, win the prize! Speak to Indra! Make Indra win the prize!

original: eṣā vaḥ sā satyā saṃvāg abhūd yayā bṛhaspatiṃ vājam ajījapatājījapata bṛhaspatiṃ vājaṃ vanaspatayo vi mucyadhvam / eṣā vaḥ sā satyā saṃvāg abhūd yayendraṃ vājam ajījapatājījapatendraṃ vājaṃ vanaspatayo vi mucyadhvam //🔽devasyāham savituḥ save satyaprasavaso bṛhaspater vājajito vājaṃ jeṣam / vājino vājajito 'dhvana skabhnuvanto yojanā mimānāḥ kāṣṭhāṃ gacchata //
analyzed: eṣā vaḥ sā satyā saṃvāc abhūt yayā bṛhaspatim vājam ajījapata ajījapata bṛhaspatim vājam vanaspatayaḥ vi mucyadhvam    eṣā vaḥ sā satyā saṃvāc abhūt yayā indram vājam ajījapata ajījapata indram vājam vanaspatayaḥ vi mucyadhvam  devasya aham savituḥ save satyaprasavasaḥ bṛhaspateḥ vāja jitaḥ vājam jeṣam     vājinaḥ vāja jitaḥ dhvanaḥ skabhnuvantaḥ yojanā mimānāḥ kāṣṭhām gacchata
translated: This is the true word that has come to pass, by which ye have made Brihaspati win the prize. Ye have made Brihaspati win the prize. O trees, be ye loosed! This is the true word that has come to pass, by which ye have made Indra win the prize. Ye have made Indra win the prize. O trees, be ye loosed!🔽 By the impulse of the true Savitar I will win the prize of Brihaspati, the winner of prizes. O prize-winning horses, ye that make ready the path, that measure the course, go to the goal!

original: eṣa sya vājī kṣipaṇiṃ turaṇyati grīvāyāṃ baddho apikakṣa āsani / kratuṃ dadhikrā anu samsaniṣyadat pathām aṅgāmsy anv āpanīphaṇat svāhā //
analyzed: eṣa sya vājī kṣipaṇim turaṇyati grīvāyām baddhaḥ apikakṣe āsani    kratum dadhikrāḥ anu samsaniṣyadat pathām aṅgāmsi anu āpanīphaṇat svāhā
translated: This horse, O ye swift ones, outruns the swift one, bound by the neck, in the yoke, in the pole. Dadhikrâs has followed the will of the All-conquering One, and has brought the limbs of the paths together. All-hail!🔽 And the second: This horse, O ye swift ones, outruns the swift one, bound by the neck, in the yoke, in the pole. Dadhikrâs has followed the will of the All-conquering One, and has brought the limbs of the paths together. All-hail!

original: uta smāsya druvatas turaṇayataḥ parṇaṃ na ver anu vāti pragardhinaḥ / śyenasyeva dhrajato aṅkasaṃ pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ sahorjā taritraḥ svāhā //
analyzed: uta sma asya druvataḥ turaṇayataḥ parṇam na veḥ anu vāti pragardhinaḥ    śyenasya iva dhrajataḥ aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ saha ūrjā taritraḥ svāhā
translated: And his wind blows after him as he speeds on, eager to win, as the leaf follows the bird on the wing. The swift one, like the hawk in his flight, goes round the mark of Dadhikrâvan, with the strength of Dadhikrâvan, Hail!

original: śaṃ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ / jambhayanto 'hiṃ vṛkam rakṣāmsi sanemy asmad yuyavann amīvāḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ bhavantu vājinaḥ haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ su arkāḥ jambhayantaḥ him vṛkam rakṣāmsi sanemi asmat yuyavan amīvāḥ
translated: Be gracious to us, O ye strong ones, at our invocations, ye who are guided by the gods, whose course is measured, ye who are worthy of sacrifice. Slaying the serpent, the wolf, the Râkshasas, may we win all evil away from us.

original: te no arvanto havanaśruto havaṃ viśve śṛṇvantu vājino mitadravaḥ / sahasrasā medhasātā saniṣyavo maho ye dhanam samitheṣu jabhrire //
analyzed: te naḥ arvantaḥ havana śrutaḥ havam viśve śṛṇvantu vājinaḥ mitadravaḥ    sahasra sāḥ medha sātā saniṣyavaḥ mahaḥ ye dhanam samitheṣu jabhrire
translated: May all those strong horses, who are swift to hear our invocation, all those who are guided by the gods, who are worthy of sacrifice, who have a thousand powers, who are intent on the sacrifice, who have gained the prize, who have won great wealth in the contests, may they all listen to our invocation.

original: vājevāje 'vata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ / asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṃ tṛptā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ //
analyzed: vājevāje vata vājinaḥ naḥ dhaneṣu viprāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ   asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvam tṛptāḥ yāta pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: In every contest for the prize, O ye strong ones, O ye immortal sages who know the truth, may the impulse of strength come to us. Drink of this mead and rejoice yourselves. Satisfied, go on the paths of the gods.

original: ā mā vājasya prasavo jagamyād eme dyāvāpṛthivī viśvarūpe / ā mā gantāṃ pitarā mātarā cā mā somo amṛtatvena gamyāt //
analyzed: ā mā vājasya prasavaḥ jagamyāt ā ime dyāvāpṛthivī viśva rūpe    ā mā gantām pitarā mātarā ca ā mā somaḥ amṛta tvena gamyāt
translated: May the impulse of strength come to me, to these heavens and this earth of every form. May my father and mother come to me. May Soma come to me with immortality.

original: vājino vājajito vājam sasṛvāmso bṛhaspater bhāgam ava jighrata nimṛjānāḥ //🔽āpaye svāhā / svāpaye svāhā / āpijāya svāhā / kratave svāhā / vasave svāhā / aharpataye svāhā / ahne mugdhāya svāhā / mugdhāya vainamśināya svāhā / vinamśina āntyāyanāya svāhā / antyāya bhauvanāya svāhā / bhuvanasya pataye svāhā / adhipataye svāhā //
analyzed: vājinaḥ vāja jitaḥ vājam sasṛvāmsaḥ bṛhaspateḥ bhāgam ava jighrata nimṛjānāḥ  āpaye svāhā  su āpaye svāhā   āpijāya svāhā kratave svāhā vasave svāhā aharpataye svāhā   ahne mugdhāya svāhā    mugdhāya vainamśināya svāhā   vinamśine āntyāyanāya svāhā   antyāya bhauvanāya svāhā   bhuvanasya pataye svāhā   adhipataye svāhā
translated: The strong steeds, winners of strength, have run their course, have smelt the portion of Brihaspati, have wiped their mouths.

original: āyur yajñena kalpatām / prāṇo yajñena kalpatām / cakṣur yajñena kalpatām / śrotraṃ yajñena kalpatām / pṛṣṭhaṃ yajñena kalpatām / yajño yajñena kalpatām / prajāpateḥ prajā abhūma / svardevā aganma / amṛtā abhūma //
analyzed: āyuḥ yajñena kalpatām   prāṇaḥ yajñena kalpatām   cakṣuḥ yajñena kalpatām  śrotram yajñena kalpatām pṛṣṭham yajñena kalpatām   yajñaḥ yajñena kalpatām   prajāpateḥ prajāḥ abhūma   svar devāḥ aganma    amṛtāḥ abhūma
translated: To the one who is to be appeased, hail! To the one who is to be put to sleep, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born, hail! To the one who is to be born

original: asme vo astv indriyam asme nṛmṇam uta kratur asme varcāmsi santu vaḥ / namo mātre pṛthivyai namo mātre pṛthivyai / iyaṃ te rāṭ / yantāsi yamano dhruvo 'si dharuṇaḥ kṛṣyai tvā kṣemāya tvā rayyai tvā poṣāya tvā //
analyzed: asme vaḥ astu indriyam asme nṛmṇam uta kratuḥ asme varcāmsi santu vaḥ    namaḥ mātre pṛthivyai namaḥ mātre pṛthivyai    iyam te rāj    yantāsi yamanaḥ dhruvaḥ si dharuṇaḥ kṛṣyai tvā kṣemāya tvā rayyai tvā poṣāya tvā
translated: Let your power be with us, and your manliness and your wisdom. Let your glories be with us. Homage to the mother earth! Homage to the mother earth! This is thy kingdom. Thou art the controller, the controller of control. Thou art the firm one, the supporter. For ploughing thee! For peace thee! For wealth thee! For increase thee!

original: vājasyemaṃ prasavaḥ suṣuve 'gre somam rājānam oṣadhīṣv apsu / tā asmabhyaṃ madhumatīr bhavantu vayam rāṣṭṛe jāgṛyāma purohitāḥ svāhā //
analyzed: vājasya imam prasavaḥ suṣuve gre somam rājānam oṣadhīṣu apsu   tāḥ asmabhyam madhumatīḥ bhavantu vayam rāṣṭṛe jāgṛyāma purohitāḥ svāhā
translated: The impulse of strength hath first brought forth this Soma, the king, among the plants and in the waters. May they be sweet for us. May we, the priests, watch over the kingdom, All-hail!

original: vājasyemāṃ prasavaḥ śiśriye divam imā ca viśvā bhuvanāni samrāṭ / aditsantaṃ dāpayati prajānan sa no rayim sarvavīraṃ ni yacchatu svāhā //
analyzed: vājasya imām prasavaḥ śiśriye divam imā ca viśvā bhuvanāni samrāj    a ditsantam dāpayati prajānan sa naḥ rayim sarva vīram ni yacchatu svāhā
translated: The impulse of strength hath mounted this heaven, and this universal world as sovereign. He, knowing, maketh the niggard give. May he bestow on us wealth with all heroes. All-hail!

original: vājasya nu prasava ābabhūvemā ca viśvā bhuvanāni sarvataḥ / sanemi rājā pariyāti vidvān prajāṃ puṣṭiṃ vardhayamāno asme svāhā //
analyzed: vājasya nu prasavaḥ ābabhūva imā ca viśvā bhuvanāni sarvatas     sanemi rājā pariyāti vidvān prajām puṣṭim vardhayamānaḥ asme svāhā
translated: By the impulse of strength I have become possessed of all these worlds on every side. The king, the wise one, goes round, increasing our offspring and prosperity. All-hail!

original: ādityān viṣṇum sūryaṃ brahmāṇaṃ ca bṛhaspatim svāhā //
analyzed: ādityān viṣṇum sūryam brahmāṇam ca bṛhaspatim svāhā
translated: The Adityas, Vishnu, Surya, Brahman, and Brihaspati, All-hail!

original: aryamaṇaṃ bṛhaspatim indraṃ dānāya codaya / vācaṃ viṣṇum sarasvatīm savitāraṃ ca vājinam svāhā //
analyzed: aryamaṇam bṛhaspatim indram dānāya codaya vācam viṣṇum sarasvatīm savitāram ca vājinam svāhā
translated: Aryaman, Brihaspati, Indra, urge to give; Speech, Vishnu, Sarasvati, and the strong Savitar, All-hail!

original: agne acchāvadeha naḥ prati naḥ sumanā bhava / pra no yaccha sahasrajittvam hi dhanadā asi svāhā //
analyzed: agne acchāvada iha naḥ prati naḥ sumanāḥ bhava   pra naḥ yaccha sahasra jit tvam hi dhana dāḥ asi svāhā
translated: O Agni, speak to us; be gracious to us. Grant us a thousand gifts, for thou art the giver of wealth. All-hail!

original: pra no yacchatv aryamā pra pūṣā pra bṛhaspatiḥ / pra vāg devī dadātu naḥ svāhā //
analyzed: pra naḥ yacchatu aryamā pra pūṣā pra bṛhaspatiḥ   pra vāc devī dadātu naḥ svāhā
translated: May Aryaman grant to us, may Pushan grant, may Brihaspati grant. May the Goddess Speech grant to us. All-hail!

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / sarasvatyai vāco yantur yantriye dadhāmi bṛhaspateṣ ṭvā sāmrājyenābhi ṣiñcāmy asau //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām    sarasvatyai vācaḥ yantuḥ yantriye dadhāmi bṛhaspateḥ tvā sāmrājyena abhi siñcāmi asau
translated: In the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pushan, I set thee down, O ladle, in the contrivance of Sarasvati, the controller of speech. With the sovereignty of Brihaspati I consecrate thee, N.N.!

original: agnir ekākṣareṇa prāṇam ud ajayat tam uj jeṣam / aśvinau dvyakṣareṇa dvipado manuṣyān ud ajayatāṃ tān uj jeṣam / viṣṇus tryakṣareṇa trīml lokān ud ajayat tān uj jeṣam / somaś caturakṣareṇa catuṣpadaḥ paśūn ud ajayat tān uj jeṣam //
analyzed: agniḥ eka akṣareṇa prāṇam ud ajayat tam ud jeṣam    aśvinau dvi akṣareṇa dvipadaḥ manuṣyān ud ajayatām tān ud jeṣam    viṣṇuḥ tri akṣareṇa trīn lokān ud ajayat tān ud jeṣam    somaḥ catur akṣareṇa catuṣpadaḥ paśūn ud ajayat tān ud jeṣam
translated: Agni with the one syllable conquered breath; may I conquer it. The Asvins with the two syllables conquered bipeds, men; may I conquer them. Vishnu with the three syllables conquered the three worlds; may I conquer them. Soma with the four syllables conquered the four-footed cattle; may I conquer them.

original: pūṣā pañcākṣareṇa pañca diśa ud ajayat tā uj jeṣam / savitā ṣaḍakṣareṇa ṣaḍ ṛtūn ud ajayat tān uj jeṣam / marutaḥ saptākṣareṇa sapta grāmyān paśūn ud ajayams tān uj jeṣam / bṛhaspatir aṣṭākṣareṇa gāyatrīm ud ajayat tām uj jeṣam //
analyzed: pūṣā pañca akṣareṇa pañca diśaḥ ud ajayat tāḥ ud jeṣam    savitā ṣaṣ akṣareṇa ṣaṭ ṛtūn ud ajayat tān ud jeṣam    marutaḥ sapta akṣareṇa sapta grāmyān paśūn ud ajayam tān ud jeṣam    bṛhaspatiḥ aṣṭa akṣareṇa gāyatrīm ud ajayat tām ud jeṣam
translated: Pûshan with the five-syllabled (Vâmadevya) conquered the five regions; may I conquer them. Savitar with the six-syllabled (Brhat) conquered the six seasons; may I conquer them. The Maruts with the seven-syllabled (Kakup) conquered the seven domestic animals; may I conquer them. Brihaspati with the eight-syllabled (Gâyatrî) conquered the Gâyatrî; may I conquer it.

original: mitro navākṣareṇa trivṛtam stomam ud ajayat tam uj jeṣam / varuṇo daśākṣareṇa virājam ud ajayat tām uj jeṣam / indra ekādaśākṣareṇa triṣṭubham ud ajayat tām uj jeṣam / viśve devā dvādaśākṣareṇa jagatīm ud ajayams tām uj jeṣam //
analyzed: mitraḥ nava akṣareṇa trivṛtam stomam ud ajayat tam ud jeṣam    varuṇaḥ daśa akṣareṇa virājam ud ajayat tām ud jeṣam   indraḥ ekādaśa akṣareṇa triṣṭubham ud ajayat tām ud jeṣam    viśve devāḥ dvādaśa akṣareṇa jagatīm ud ajayam tām ud jeṣam
translated: Mitra with the nine-syllabled (Anushtup) conquered the Trivrit hymn; may I conquer it. Varuna with the ten-syllabled (Virâj) conquered the Virâj; may I conquer it. Indra with the eleven-syllabled (Trishtup) conquered the Trishtup; may I conquer it. The Visve Devâh with the twelve-syllabled (Gagatî) conquered the Gagatî; may I conquer it.

original: vasavas trayodaśākṣareṇa trayodaśam stomam ud ajayams tam uj jeṣam / rudrāś caturdaśākṣareṇa caturdaśam stomam ud ajayams tam uj jeṣam / ādityāḥ pañcadaśākṣareṇa pañcadaśam stomam ud ajayams tam uj jeṣam / aditiḥ ṣoḍaśākṣareṇa ṣoḍaśam stomam ud ajayat tam uj jeṣam / prajāpatiḥ saptadaśākṣareṇa saptadaśam stomam ud ajayat tam uj jeṣam //
analyzed: vasavaḥ trayodaśa akṣareṇa trayodaśam stomam ud ajayam tam ud jeṣam    rudrāḥ caturdaśa akṣareṇa caturdaśam stomam ud ajayam tam ud jeṣam    ādityāḥ pañcadaśa akṣareṇa pañcadaśam stomam ud ajayam tam ud jeṣam    aditiḥ ṣoḍaśa akṣareṇa ṣoḍaśam stomam ud ajayat tam ud jeṣam    prajāpatiḥ saptadaśa akṣareṇa saptadaśam stomam ud ajayat tam ud jeṣam
translated: The Vasus with the thirteen-syllable (Gayatri) conquered the thirteenfold Stoma; I have conquered it. The Rudras with the fourteen-syllable (Triṣṭubh) conquered the fourteenfold Stoma; I have conquered it. The Âdityas with the fifteen-syllable (Jagatî) conquered the fifteenfold Stoma; I have conquered it. Aditi with the sixteen-syllable (Gâyatrî) conquered the sixteenfold Stoma; I have conquered it. Pragâpati with the seventeen-syllable (Gâyatrî) conquered the seventeenfold Stoma; I have conquered it.

original: eṣa te nirṛte bhāgas taṃ juṣasva svāhā / agninetrebhyo devebhyaḥ puraḥsadbhyaḥ svāhā / yamanetrebhyo devebhyo dakṣiṇāsadbhyaḥ svāhā / viśvadevanetrebhyo devebhyaḥ paścātsadbhyaḥ svāhā / mitrāvaruṇanetrebhyo vā marunnetrebhyo vā devebhya uttārasadbhyaḥ svāhā / somanetrebhyo devebhya uparisadbhyo duvasvadbhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: eṣa te nirṛte bhāgaḥ tam juṣasva svāhā agni netrebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ puraḥsadbhyaḥ svāhā   yama netrebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ dakṣiṇā sadbhyaḥ svāhā    viśvadeva netrebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ paścātsadbhyaḥ svāhā   mitrāvaruṇa netrebhyaḥ vā marut netrebhyaḥ vā devebhyaḥ uttāra sadbhyaḥ svāhā
translated: This is thy share, O Nirriti, rejoice in it, hail! To the gods whose eye is Agni, who sit in the front, hail! To the gods whose eye is Yama, who sit on the right, hail! To the gods whose eye is the All-gods, who sit behind, hail! To the gods whose eye is Mitra and Varuna, or the Maruts, who sit on the left, hail! To the gods whose eye is Soma, who sit above, and are to be worshipped, hail!

original: ye devā agninetrāḥ puraḥsadas tebhyaḥ svāhā / ye devā yamanetrā dakṣiṇāsadas tebhyaḥ svāhā / ye devā viśvadevanetrāḥ paścātsadas tebhyaḥ svāhā / ye devā mitrāvaruṇanetrā vā marunnetrā vottarāsadas tebhyaḥ svāhā / ye devāḥ somanetrā uparisado duvasvantas tebhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ye devāḥ agni netrāḥ puraḥsadaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā   ye devāḥ yama netrāḥ dakṣiṇā sadaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā    ye devāḥ viśvadeva netrāḥ paścātsadaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā    ye devāḥ mitrāvaruṇa netrāḥ vā marut netrāḥ vā uttarāsadaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā    ye devāḥ soma netrāḥ upari sadaḥ duvasvantaḥ tebhyaḥ svāhā  /
translated: To the gods whose leader is Agni, who sit in the east, Hail! To the gods whose leader is Yama, who sit in the south, Hail! To the gods whose leader is the All-gods, who sit in the west, Hail! To the gods whose leader is Mitra and Varuna, or the Maruts, who sit in the north, Hail! To the gods whose leader is Soma, who sit above, the bountiful, Hail!

original: agne sahasva pṛtanā abhimātīr apāsya / dusṭaras tarann arātīr varco dhā yajñavāhasi //
analyzed: agne sahasva pṛtanāḥ abhimātīḥ apāsya    dusṭaraḥ taran arātīḥ varcaḥ dhāḥ yajña vāhasi
translated: O Agni, conquer the battles, drive away the enemies. Most hard to bear, bear away the haters. Bestow splendour, thou who carriest the sacrifice.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / upāmśor vīryeṇa juhomi hatam rakṣaḥ svāhā / rakṣasāṃ tvā badhāya / abadhiṣma rakṣo 'badhiṣmāmum asau hataḥ //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   upāmśoḥ vīryeṇa juhomi hatam rakṣaḥ svāhā rakṣasām tvā badhāya   abadhiṣma rakṣaḥ badhiṣma amum asau hataḥ
translated: In the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I offer with the strength of the Upamshus, the slain Rakshas, Hail! For the slaying of the Rakshas I have slain the Rakshas, I have slain this one, he is slain.

original: savitā tvā savānām suvatām agnir gṛhapatīnām somo vanaspatīnām / bṛhaspatir vāca indro jyaiṣṭhyāya rudraḥ paśubhyo mitraḥ satyo varuṇo dharmapatīnām //
analyzed: savitā tvā savānām suvatām agniḥ gṛhapatīnām somaḥ vanaspatīnām    bṛhaspatiḥ vāce indraḥ jyaiṣṭhyāya rudraḥ paśubhyaḥ mitraḥ satyaḥ varuṇaḥ dharma patīnām
translated: May Savitar make thee to be born of the savanas, Agni of the householders, Soma of the trees, Brihaspati of speech, Indra for preeminence, Rudra of the cattle, Mitra of the true, Varuna of the lords of law.

original: imaṃ devā asupatnam suvadhvaṃ mahate kṣatrāya mahate jyaiṣṭhyāya mahate jānarājyāyendrasyendriyāya / imam amuṣya putram amuṣyai putram asyai viśa eṣa vo 'mī rājā somo 'smākaṃ brāhmaṇānām rājā //
analyzed: imam devāḥ asu patnam suvadhvam mahate kṣatrāya mahate jyaiṣṭhyāya mahate jānarājyāya indrasya indriyāya    imam amuṣya putram amuṣyai putram asyai viśe eṣa vaḥ mī rājā somaḥ smākam brāhmaṇānām rājā
translated: For great lordship, for great preeminence, for great sway over the people, for the power of Indra, consecrate ye this (prince), the son of N.N., the son of N.N., the son of this people. He is your king, O ye people. Soma is the king of us Brahmans.

original: apo devā madhumatīr agṛbhṇann ūrjasvatī rājasvaś citānāḥ / yābhir mitrāvaruṇāv abhyaṣiñcan yābhir indram anayann aty arātīḥ //
analyzed: apaḥ devāḥ madhumatīḥ agṛbhṇan ūrjasvatīḥ rājasvaḥ citānāḥ    yābhiḥ mitrāvaruṇau abhyaṣiñcan yābhiḥ indram anayan ati arātīḥ
translated: The Gods have grasped the waters that contain much honey, that are full of strength, that are rich in royal power, and that are thought of, with which they sprinkled Mitra and Varuna, with which they led Indra beyond his enemies.

original: vṛṣṇa ūrmir asi rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me dehi svāhā / vṛṣṇa ūrmir asi rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai dehi / vṛṣaseno si rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me dehi svāhā / vṛṣaseno si rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai dehi //
analyzed: vṛṣṇaḥ ūrmiḥ asi rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me dehi svāhā    vṛṣṇaḥ ūrmiḥ asi rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram amuṣmai dehi   vṛṣa senā u si rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me dehi svāhā      vṛṣa senā u si rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram amuṣmai dehi
translated: Thou art the wave of the strong, the giver of a kingdom. Give me a kingdom. All hail! Thou art the wave of the strong, the giver of a kingdom. Give a kingdom to N.N. Thou art the army of the strong, the giver of a kingdom. Give me a kingdom. All hail! Thou art the army of the strong, the giver of a kingdom. Give a kingdom to N.N.

original: artheta stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / artheta stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / ojasvatī stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / ojasvatī stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / āpaḥ parivāhiṇī stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / āpaḥ parivāhiṇī stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / apāṃ patir asi rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me dehi svāhā / apāṃ patir asi rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai dehi / apāṃ garbho 'si rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me dehi svāhā / apāṃ garbho 'si rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai dehi //
analyzed: arthetaḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me datta svāhā   arthetaḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta   ojasvatīḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me datta svāhā    ojasvatīḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta    āpaḥ parivāhiṇīḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me datta svāhā            / apām patiḥ asi rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me dehi svāhā     apām patiḥ asi rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me dehi svāhā     /
translated: Ye are the bestowers of a kingdom; give me a kingdom. Svâhâ! Ye are the bestowers of a kingdom; give a kingdom to N. N. Ye are full of vigour; bestow a kingdom on me. Svâhâ! Ye are full of vigour; bestow a kingdom on N. N. Ye are the flowing waters; bestow a kingdom on me. Svâhâ! Ye are the flowing waters; bestow a kingdom on N. N. Thou art the lord of the waters; bestow a kingdom on me. Svâhâ! Thou art the lord of the waters; bestow a kingdom on N. N. Thou art the waters' germ; bestow a kingdom on me. Svâhâ! Thou art the waters' germ; bestow a kingdom on N. N.

original: sūryatvacasa stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / sūryatvacasa stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / sūryavarcasa stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / sūryavarcasa stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / māndā stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / māndā stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / vrajakṣita stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / vrajakṣita stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / vāśā stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / vāśā stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / śaviṣṭhā stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / śaviṣṭhā stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / śakvarī stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / śakvarī stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / janabhṛta stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / janabhṛta stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / viśvabhṛta stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭraṃ me datta svāhā / viśvabhṛta stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta / āpaḥ svarāja stha rāṣṭradā rāṣṭram amuṃai datta / madhumatīr madhumatībhiḥ pṛcyantāṃ mahi kṣatraṃ kṣatriyāya vanvānāḥ / anādhṛṣṭāḥ sīdata sahaujaso mahi kṣatraṃ kṣatriyāya dadhatīḥ //
analyzed: sūrya tvacasaḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me datta svāhā    sūrya tvacasaḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta   sūrya varcasaḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me datta svāhā    sūrya varcasaḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta    māndāḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me datta svāhā            stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram amuṣmai datta   vraja kṣitaḥ stha rāṣṭra dāḥ rāṣṭram me datta svāhā          sth
translated: You are the sun-skinned, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the sun-skinned, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so. You are the sun-lustred, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the sun-lustred, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so. You are the delightful, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the delightful, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so. You are the abode-makers, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the abode-makers, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so. You are the powerful, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the powerful, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so. You are the most powerful, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the most powerful, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so. You are the Shakvari, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the Shakvari, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so. You are the people-supporting, givers of kingdom, give me a kingdom, svāhā. You are the people-supporting, givers of kingdom, give a kingdom to so-and-so.

original: somasya tviṣir asi taveva me tviṣir bhūyāt / agnaye svāhā / somāya svāhā / savitre svāhā / sarasvatyai svāhā / pūṣṇe svāhā / bṛhaspataye svāhā / indrāya svāhā / ghoṣāya svāhā / ślokāya svāhā / amśāya svāhā / bhagāya svāhā / aryamṇe svāhā //
analyzed: somasya tviṣiḥ asi tava iva me tviṣiḥ bhūyāt agnaye svāhā somāya svāhā savitre svāhā sarasvatyai svāhā pūṣṇe svāhā bṛhaspataye svāhā indrāya svāhā  ghoṣāya svāhā   ślokāya svāhā amśāya svāhā bhagāya svāhā  aryamṇe svāhā
translated: Thou art the radiance of Soma: let there be radiance in me like thine. To Agni hail! To Soma hail! To Savitar hail! To Sarasvatî hail! To Pûshan hail! To Brihaspati hail! To Indra hail! To Ghosha hail! To Shloka hail! To Amsha hail! To Bhaga hail! To Aryaman hail!

original: pavitre stho vaiṣṇavyau / savitur vaḥ prasava ut punāmy acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ / anibhṛṣṭam asi vāco bandhus tapojāḥ somasya dātram asi svāhā rājasvaḥ //
analyzed: pavitre sthaḥ vaiṣṇavyau   savituḥ vaḥ prasave ud punāmi acchidreṇa pavitreṇa sūryasya raśmibhiḥ   a nibhṛṣṭam asi vācaḥ bandhuḥ tapaḥ jāḥ somasya dātram asi svāhā rājasvaḥ  /
translated: Ye are the two strainers, belonging to Vishnu. By the impulse of Savitar I purify you with the flawless strainer, with the rays of the Sun. Thou art not broken, thou art the friend of speech, born of heat. Thou art the giver of Soma. Hail to the kingly power!

original: sadhamādo dyumninīr āpa etā anādhṛṣṭā apasyo vasānāḥ / pastyāsu cakre varuṇaḥ sadhastham apām śiśur mātṛtamāsv antaḥ //
analyzed: sadhamādaḥ dyumninīḥ āpaḥ etāḥ anādhṛṣṭāḥ apasyaḥ vasānāḥ   pastyāsu cakre varuṇaḥ sadhastham apām śiśuḥ mātṛtamāsu antar
translated: These waters are the most delightful, the most radiant, wearing unwounded garments, unassailed. Varuna hath made his abode in the houses of the waters, the child in the midst of the most motherly of the waters.

original: kṣatrasyolvam asi / kṣatrasya jarāyv asi / kṣatrasya yonir asi / kṣatrasya nābhir asi / indrasya vātraghnam / mitrasyāsi varuṇasyāsi / tvayāyaṃ vṛtraṃ badhet / dṛvāsi / rujāsi / kṣumāsi / pātainaṃ prāñcam / pātainaṃ pratyañcam / pātainaṃ tiryañcaṃ digbhyaḥ pāta //
analyzed: kṣatrasya ulvam asi   kṣatrasya jarāyu asi    kṣatrasya yoniḥ asi     kṣatrasya nābhiḥ asi    indrasya vātraghnam   mitrasya asi varuṇasya asi   tvayā ayam vṛtram badhet    dṛvā asi
translated: Thou art the womb of the Kshatriya. Thou art the foetus of the Kshatriya. Thou art the womb of the Kshatriya. Thou art the navel of the Kshatriya. Thou art Indra's thunderbolt. Thou art of Mitra. Thou art of Varuna. With thee he may slay Vritra. Thou art the dart. Thou art the pain. Thou art the hunger. Protect him as he goes forward. Protect him as he goes backward. Protect him as he goes crosswise. Protect him from the quarters.

original: āvirmayāḥ / āvitto agnir gṛhapatiḥ / āvitta indro vṛddhaśravāḥ / āvittau mitrāvaruṇau dhṛtavratau / āvittaḥ pūṣā viśvavedāḥ / āvitte dyāvāpṛthivī viśvaśambhuvau / āvittāditir uruśarmā //
analyzed: āvis mayāḥ    āvittaḥ agniḥ gṛhapatiḥ    āvittaḥ indraḥ vṛddha śravāḥ    āvittau mitrāvaruṇau dhṛta vratau
translated: The all-knowing ones. Agni, the householder, is all-knowing. Indra, of increased glory, is all-knowing. Mitra and Varuna, of firm vows, are all-knowing. Pusan, who knows all, is all-knowing. Heaven and earth, who bring all prosperity, are all-knowing. Aditi, of wide protection, is all-knowing.

original: aveṣṭā dandaśūkāḥ / prācīm ā roha gāyatrī tvāvatu rathantaram sāma trivṛt stomo vasanta ṛtur brahma draviṇam //
analyzed: aveṣṭāḥ dandaśūkāḥ   prācīm ā roha gāyatrī tvā avatu rathantaram sāma trivṛt stomaḥ vasantaḥ ṛtuḥ brahma draviṇam
translated: The all-knowing ones. Ascend the eastern quarter. Let the Gayatri metre protect thee. Let the Rathantara Saman protect thee. Let the Trivrit Stoma protect thee. Let the spring season protect thee. Let the Brahman wealth protect thee.

original: dakṣiṇām ā roha triṣṭup tvāvatu bṛhat sāma pañcadaśa stomo grīṣma ṛtuḥ kṣatraṃ draviṇam //
analyzed: dakṣiṇām ā roha triṣṭubh tvā avatu bṛhat sāma pañcadaśaḥ stomaḥ grīṣmaḥ ṛtuḥ kṣatram draviṇam
translated: Ascend the southern quarter. Let the Tristubh metre protect thee. Let the Brihat Saman protect thee. Let the Pañcadaśa Stoma protect thee. Let the summer season protect thee. Let the Kshatra wealth protect thee.

original: pratīcīm ā roha jagatī tvāvatu vairūpam sāma saptadaśa stomo varṣā ṛtuḥ viḍ draviṇam //
analyzed: pratīcīm ā roha jagatī tvā avatu vairūpam sāma saptadaśaḥ stomaḥ varṣā ṛtuḥ viś draviṇam
translated: Mount the west. Let the Jagati hymn protect thee. Let the Vairupa Saman be thy protection. Let the Saptadaça Stoma be thy stronghold. Let the rainy season be thy refuge. Let the people be thy wealth.

original: udīcīm ā rohānuṣṭup tvāvatu vairājam sāmaikavimśa stomaḥ śarad ṛtuḥ phalaṃ draviṇam //
analyzed: udīcīm ā roha anuṣṭubh tvā avatu vairājam sāma ekavimśaḥ stomaḥ śarad ṛtuḥ phalam draviṇam
translated: Mount the north. Let the Anustubh hymn protect thee. Let the Vairaja Saman be thy protection. Let the Ekavinça Stoma be thy stronghold. Let the autumn season be thy refuge. Let fruit be thy wealth.

original: ūrdhvām ā roha paṅktis tvāvatu śākvararaivate sāmanī triṇavatrayastrimśau stomau hemantaśiśirāv ṛtū varco draviṇam / pratyastaṃ namuceḥ śiraḥ //
analyzed: ūrdhvām ā roha paṅktiḥ tvā avatu śākvara raivate sāmanī triṇava trayastrimśau stomau hemanta śiśirau ṛtū varcaḥ draviṇam    pratyastam namuceḥ śiraḥ
translated: Mount upwards. Let the Pankti hymn protect thee. Let the Sâkvara and Raivata Samans be thy protection. Let the Trinava and Trayastrimsa Stomas be thy stronghold. Let the cold and hot seasons be thy refuge. Let splendour be thy wealth. Thou hast turned away the head of Namuci.

original: somasya tviṣir asi taveva me tviṣir bhūyāt / mṛtyoḥ pāhi / ojo 'si saho 'sy amṛtam asi //
analyzed: somasya tviṣiḥ asi tava iva me tviṣiḥ bhūyāt   mṛtyoḥ pāhi   ojaḥ si sahaḥ si amṛtam asi
translated: Thou art the radiance of Soma. Let my radiance be like thine. Protect me from death. Thou art force. Thou art strength. Thou art immortality.

original: hiraṇyarūpā uṣaso viroka ubhāv indrā udithaḥ sūryaś ca / ā rohataṃ varuṇa mitra gartaṃ tataś cakṣāthām aditiṃ ditiṃ ca //
analyzed: hiraṇya rūpau uṣasaḥ viroke ubhau indrau udithaḥ sūryaḥ ca  / ā rohatam varuṇa mitra gartam tatas cakṣāthām aditim ditim ca
translated: The dawns have shone with golden hue. Both Indras have risen, and the sun. O Varuṇa and Mitra, mount your car. Thence look ye on Aditi and Diti.

original: mitro 'si varuṇo 'si //
analyzed: mitraḥ si varuṇaḥ si
translated: Thou art Mitra. Thou art Varuna.

original: somasya tvā dyumnenābhiṣiñcāmy agner bhrājasā sūryasya varcasendrasyendriyeṇa / kṣatrāṇāṃ kṣatrapatir edhy ati didyūn pāhi //
analyzed: somasya tvā dyumnena abhiṣiñcāmi agneḥ bhrājasā sūryasya varcasā indrasya indriyeṇa    kṣatrāṇām kṣatra patiḥ edhi ati didyūn pāhi
translated: With the splendour of Soma I consecrate thee, with the radiance of Agni, with the lustre of the sun, with the power of Indra. Be thou the lord of the lordships. Protect the people from the lightning.

original: imaṃ devā asupatnam suvadhvaṃ mahate kṣatrāya mahate jyaiṣṭhyāya mahate jānarājyāyendrasyendriyāya / imam amuṣya putram amuṣyai putram asyai viśa eṣa vo 'mī rājā somo 'smākaṃ brāhmaṇānām rājā //
analyzed: imam devāḥ asu patnam suvadhvam mahate kṣatrāya mahate jyaiṣṭhyāya mahate jānarājyāya indrasya indriyāya    imam amuṣya putram amuṣyai putram asyai viśe eṣa vaḥ mī rājā somaḥ smākam brāhmaṇānām rājā
translated: For great lordship, for great preeminence, for great sway over the people, for the power of Indra, consecrate this one, free from rivals, for the great lordship, for the great preeminence, for the great sway over the people, for the power of Indra. This one, the son of so-and-so, the son of so-and-so, the son of this clan, is your king. Soma is our king, the Brahmins'.

original: pra parvatasya vṛṣabhasya pṛṣṭhān nāvaś caranti svasica iyānāḥ / tā āvavṛtrann adharāg udaktā ahiṃ budhnyam anu rīyamāṇāḥ //
analyzed: pra parvatasya vṛṣabhasya pṛṣṭhāt nāvaḥ caranti svasicaḥ iyānāḥ    tāḥ āvavṛtran adharāk udaktāḥ ahim budhnyam anu rīyamāṇāḥ
