translated: The ships move along the back of the bull, the mountain, sailing on their own course. They have turned back, the lower ones and the upper ones, following the deep-dwelling serpent.

original: viṣṇor vikarmaṇam asi / viṣṇor vikrāntam asi / viṣṇoḥ krāntam asi //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ vikarmaṇam asi    viṣṇoḥ vikrāntam asi          asi
translated: You are the stride of Vishnu. You are the leap of Vishnu. You are the step of Vishnu.

original: prajāpate na tvad etāny anyo viśvā rūpāṇi pari tā babhūva / yatkāmās te juhumas tan no astu / ayam amuṣya pitāsāv asya pitā / vayam syāma patayo rayīṇām svāhā / rudra yat te krivi paraṃ nāma tasmin hutam asy ameṣṭam asi svāhā //
analyzed: prajāpate na tvat etāni anyaḥ viśvā rūpāṇi pari tā babhūva    yad kāmāḥ te juhumaḥ tat naḥ astu   ayam amuṣya pitā asau asya pitā    vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām svāhā   rudra yat te krivi param nāma tasmin hutam asi amā iṣṭam asi svāhā
translated: Prajapati, none other than you has encompassed all these forms. Whatever desires we offer to you, let that be ours. This one is the father of so-and-so, that one is the father of this one. May we be the lords of wealth. Svāhā. O Rudra, whatever is your highest name, to that is offered this. You are the one who has been worshipped. Svāhā.

original: indrasya vajro 'si / mitrāvaruṇayos tvā praśāstroḥ praśiṣā yunajmi / avyathāyai tvā svadhāyai tvāriṣṭo arjunaḥ / marutāṃ prasavena jaya / āpāma manasā / sam indriyeṇa //
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ si    mitrāvaruṇayoḥ tvā praśāstroḥ praśiṣā yunajmi    avyathāyai tvā svadhāyai tvā ariṣṭaḥ arjunaḥ   marutām prasavena jaya    āpāma manasā    sam indriyeṇa
translated: Thou art the bolt of Indra. I yoke thee with the direction of Mitra and Varuna, the rulers. For the sake of the uninjured, for the sake of the law, the uninjured, the green one, by the impulse of the Maruts, win thou the victory. Of the waters, with the mind, with the power of Indra.

original: mā ta indra te vayaṃ turāṣāḍ ayuktāso abrahmatā vidasāma / tiṣṭhā ratham adhi yaṃ vajrahastā raśmīn deva yuvase svaśvān //
analyzed: mā te indra te vayam turāṣāh a yuktāsaḥ a brahma tā vidasāma    tiṣṭha ratham adhi yam vajrahasta raśmīn deva yuvase su aśvān
translated: Let us not, O Indra, the impetuous one, be unyoked, through want of prayer, from thee. Mount the chariot, O thou whose hand wields the thunderbolt, to which thou dost yoke thy own excellent horses, O god.

original: agnaye gṛhapataye svāhā / somāya vanaspataye svāhā / marutām ojase svāhā / indrasyendriyāya svāhā / pṛthivi mātar mā mā himsīr mo ahaṃ tvām //
analyzed: agnaye gṛhapataye svāhā   somāya vanaspataye svāhā   marutām ojase svāhā   indrasya indriyāya svāhā pṛthivi mātar mā mā himsīḥ mā u aham tvām
translated: To Agni, the lord of the house, hail! To Soma, the lord of the plants, hail! To the strength of the Maruts, hail! To the power of Indra, hail! O earth, mother, harm me not, nor may I harm thee.

original: hamsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat / nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtaṃ bṛhat //
analyzed: hamsaḥ śuciṣad vasuḥ antarikṣa sad hotā vediṣad atithiḥ duroṇa sad    nṛṣad vara sad ṛta sad vyoma sad ap jāḥ go jāḥ ṛta jāḥ adri jāḥ ṛtam bṛhat  /
translated: The swan, sitting in the pure, the good one, sitting in the atmosphere, the priest, sitting on the altar, the guest, sitting in the house, sitting among men, sitting in the best, sitting in truth, sitting in the sky, born of the waters, born of the cows, born of truth, born of the mountain, the great truth.

original: iyad asyāyur asyāyur mayi dhehi yuṅṅ asi varco 'si varco mayi dhehi / ūrg asy ūrjaṃ mayi dhehi / indrasya vāṃ vīryakṛto bāhū abhyupāva harāmi //
analyzed: iyat asya āyuḥ asya āyuḥ mayi dhehi yuj asi varcaḥ si varcaḥ mayi dhehi    ūrj asi ūrjam mayi dhehi    indrasya vām vīrya kṛtaḥ bāhū abhyupa ava harāmi
translated: So much is his life; in me lay thou life. Thou art the yoke; thou art radiance; in me lay thou radiance. Thou art strength; in me lay thou strength. I step up to the arms of you two, the arms of Indra, the doer of heroic deeds.

original: syonāsi suṣadāsi / kṣatrasya yonir asi / syonām ā sīda suṣadām ā sīda kṣatrasya yonim ā sīda //
analyzed: syonā asi suṣadā asi kṣatrasya yoniḥ asi   syonām ā sīda suṣadām ā sīda kṣatrasya yonim ā sīda
translated: Thou art the comfortable; thou art the good to sit on. Thou art the womb of the Kshatra. Sit on the comfortable; sit on the good to sit on; sit on the womb of the Kshatra.

original: ni ṣasāda ghṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsv ā / sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ //
analyzed: ni ṣasāda ghṛta vrataḥ varuṇaḥ pastyāsu ā sāmrājyāya su kratuḥ
translated: He hath sat down, the ghee-eater, Varuṇa, in the houses, the wise one, for universal sovereignty.

original: abhibhūr asy etās te pañca diśaḥ kalpantām / brahmams tvaṃ brahmāsi savitāsi satyaprasavaḥ / varuṇo 'si satyaujāḥ / indro 'si viśaujāḥ / rudro 'si suśevaḥ / bahukāra śreyaskara bhūyaskara / indrasya vajro 'si tena me radhya //
analyzed: abhibhūḥ asi etāḥ te pañca diśaḥ kalpantām    brahman tvam brahmā asi savitā asi satya prasavaḥ   varuṇaḥ si satya ojāḥ indraḥ si viśaujāḥ    indrasya vajraḥ si tena me radhya
translated: Thou art the overcomer. These five regions of thine be auspicious to thee. Thou art the Brahman, thou art the Brahman. Thou art Savitar, of true impulse. Thou art Varuṇa, of true might. Thou art Indra, of the might of the people. Thou art Rudra, of good grace. Thou art the doer of much, the doer of good, the doer of increase. Thou art Indra's bolt; with it be thou propitious to me.

original: agniḥ pṛthur dharmaṇas patir juṣāṇo agniḥ pṛthur dharmaṇas patir ājyasya vetu svāhā / svāhākṛtāḥ sūryasya raśmibir yatadhvam sajātānāṃ madhyameṣṭhyāya //
analyzed: agniḥ pṛthuḥ dharmaṇaḥ patiḥ juṣāṇaḥ agniḥ pṛthuḥ dharmaṇaḥ patiḥ ājyasya vetu svāhā    svāhākṛtāḥ sūryasya raśmibiḥ yatadhvam sajātānām madhyameṣṭhyāya
translated: May Agni, the wide one, lord of the people, rejoicing, may Agni, the wide one, lord of the people, enjoy the ghee. Hail! Anointed with Svâhâs, strive ye with the rays of the sun for preeminence among your kinsmen.

original: savitrā prasavitrā sarasvatyā vācā tvaṣṭrā rūpaiḥ pūṣṇā paśubhir indreṇāsme bṛhaspatinā brahmaṇā varuṇenaujasāgninā tejasā somena rājñā viṣṇunā daśamyā devatayā prasūtaḥ pra sarpāmi //
analyzed: savitrā prasavitrā sarasvatyā vācā tvaṣṭrā rūpaiḥ pūṣṇā paśubhiḥ indreṇa asme bṛhaspatinā brahmaṇā varuṇena ojasā agninā tejasā somena rājñā viṣṇunā daśamyā devatayā prasūtaḥ pra sarpāmi
translated: By Savitar the Impeller, by Sarasvatî the Speech, by Tvashtar the Forms, by Pûshan the Cattle, by Indra the Asvamedha, by Brihaspati the Brahman, by Varuṇa the Power, by Agni the Splendour, by Soma the King, by Vishnu the Tenth Deity, impelled, I move along.

original: aśvibhyāṃ pacyasva / sarasvatyai pacyasva / indrāya sutrāmṇe pacyasva / vāyuḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅk somo atisrutaḥ / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
analyzed: aśvibhyām pacyasva   sarasvatyai pacyasva   indrāya sutrāmṇe pacyasva   vāyuḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅ somaḥ atisrutaḥ    indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: Be thou cleansed for the Asvins. Be thou cleansed for Sarasvatî. Be thou cleansed for Indra, the good deliverer. Vâyu, purified by the fleece, Soma, hath passed through the filter, meet for Indra, a friend to join with him.

original: kuvid aṅga yavamanto vayaṃ cid yathā dānty anupūrvaṃ viyūya / ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣo namaktiṃ yajanti //
analyzed: kuvid aṅga yavamantaḥ vayam cit yathā dānti anupūrvam viyūya    iha iha eṣām kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣaḥ namaktim yajanti
translated: What, indeed, O ye who have barley, will ye do, as they who have no barley, in order, in separation? Here, here make ye food for them who pay the sacred due upon the sacred grass.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si aśvibhyām tvā sarasvatyai tvā indrāya tvā su trāmṇe
translated: Taken upon a base art thou. For the Asvins, for Sarasvatî, for Indra, the good deliverer, art thou taken.

original: vayam surāmam aśvinā namucāv āsure sacā / vipipānā śubhas patī indraṃ karmasv āvatam //
analyzed: vayam su rāmam aśvinā namucau āsure sacā    vipipānā śubhaḥ patī indram karmasu āvatam
translated: Ye Asvins, Lords of splendour, drinking the sweet juice, in company with Namuci the Asura, ye have helped Indra in his deeds.

original: putram iva pitarāv aśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyair damsanābhiḥ / yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavann abhiṣṇak //
analyzed: putram iva pitarau aśvinā ubhā indra āvathuḥ kāvyaiḥ damsanābhiḥ    yat su rāmam vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavan abhiṣṇak
translated: As parents cherish their son, so have the two Aṣvins, Indra, cherished thee with their healing powers and their wisdom, when with thy might thou drankest the Soma juice. Sarasvatî, O bounteous Lord, hath been thy helper.

original: yuñjānaḥ prathamaṃ manas tatvāya savitā dhiyam / agner jyotir nicāyya pṛthivyā adhy ābharat //
analyzed: yuñjānaḥ prathamam manaḥ tatvāya savitā dhiyam    agneḥ jyotiḥ nicāyya pṛthivyāḥ adhi ābharat
translated: The first thought he hath set in motion for the truth, Savitar hath set the hymn in motion. Having observed the light of Agni, he hath brought it up from the earth.

original: yuktena manasā vayaṃ devasya savituḥ save / svargyāya śaktyā //🔽yuktvāya savitā devānt svaryato dhiyā divam / bṛhaj jyotiḥ kariṣyataḥ savitā pra suvāti tān //
analyzed: yuktena manasā vayam devasya savituḥ save             yuktvāya savitā devān svar yataḥ dhiyā divam    bṛhat jyotiḥ kariṣyataḥ savitā pra suvāti tān
translated: With a thought that is set in motion we, with the impulse of the god Savitar, for the winning of the heaven, (perform the rite).🔽Savitar hath set the gods in motion, who are to go to the heaven by the thought, who are to make the great light. Savitar impels them.

original: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ / vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ //
analyzed: yuñjate manaḥ uta yuñjate dhiyaḥ viprāḥ viprasya bṛhataḥ vipaścitaḥ    vi hotrā dadhe vayunā vid ekaḥ id mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ
translated: The sages, the priests of the great wise God, yoke the thought, and yoke the hymns, for the first time. He, who knoweth the ordinances, hath assigned the priestly offices. Great is the praise of the god Savitar.

original: yuje vāṃ brahma pūrvyaṃ namobhir vi śloka etu pathyeva sūreḥ / śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrā ā ye dhāmāni divyāni tasthuḥ //
analyzed: yuje vām brahma pūrvyam namobhiḥ vi ślokaḥ etu pathyā iva sūreḥ    śṛṇvantu viśve amṛtasya putrāḥ ā ye dhāmāni divyāni tasthuḥ
translated: With prayers I yoke your ancient inspiration. May the hymn go forth like a chariot on its path. May all the sons of immortality listen, who have taken their places in the heavenly abodes.

original: yasya prayāṇam anv anya id yayur devā devasya mahimānam ojasā / yaḥ pārthivāni vimame sa etaśo rajāmsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā //
analyzed: yasya prayāṇam anu anye id yayuḥ devāḥ devasya mahimānam ojasā    yaḥ pārthivāni vimame saḥ etaśaḥ rajāmsi devaḥ savitā mahitvanā
translated: Who has measured the earthly spaces, that god Savitar by his greatness.

original: deva savitaḥ pra suva yajñaṃ pra suva yajñapatiṃ bhagāya / divyo gandharvaḥ ketapūḥ ketaṃ naḥ punātu vācas patir vācaṃ naḥ svadatu //
analyzed: deva savitar pra suva yajñam pra suva yajñapatim bhagāya     divyaḥ gandharvaḥ keta pūḥ ketam naḥ punātu vācaḥ patiḥ vācam naḥ svadatu  /
translated: O god Savitar, impel the sacrifice, impel the lord of the sacrifice for good fortune. May the divine Gandharva, the purifier of thoughts, purify our thought. May the lord of speech delight our speech.

original: imaṃ no deva savitar yajñaṃ pra ṇaya devāvyam sakhividam satrājitaṃ dhanajitam svarjitam / ṛcā stomam samardhaya gāyatreṇa rathantaraṃ bṛhad gāyatravartani svāhā //
analyzed: imam naḥ deva savitar yajñam pra naya devāvyam sakhi vidam satrājitam dhana jitam svar jitam    ṛcā stomam samardhaya gāyatreṇa rathantaram bṛhat gāyatra vartani svāhā
translated: O god Savitar, lead this our sacrifice to the gods, which finds friends, which wins by turns, which wins wealth, which wins heaven. Make the praise complete with the Rc, the Rathantara with the Gayatri, the Brihat with the path of the Gayatri, Hail!

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade gāyatreṇa chandasāṅgirasvat pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad ā bhara traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām    ā dade gāyatreṇa chandasā aṅgirasvat pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthāt agnim purīṣyam aṅgirasvat ā bhara traiṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat
translated: In the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee. With the metre Gayatri, in the manner of Angiras, from the abode of earth, Agni the domestic, in the manner of Angiras, bring. With the metre Tristubh, in the manner of Angiras.

original: abhrir asi nāry asi tvayā vayam agnim śakema khanitum sadhastha ā jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvat //
analyzed: abhriḥ asi nārī asi tvayā vayam agnim śakema khanitum sadhasthe ā jāgatena chandasā aṅgirasvat
translated: Thou art the spade, thou art the woman. By thee may we be able to dig Agni, his place, with the Jagati metre, in the manner of Angiras.🔽Savitar, placing his hand, bearing the golden spade,

original: hasta ādhāya savitā bibhrad abhrim hiraṇyayīm / agner jyotir nicāyya pṛthivyā adhy ā bhara //
analyzed: haste ādhāya savitā bibhrat abhrim hiraṇyayīm   agneḥ jyotiḥ nicāyya pṛthivyāḥ adhi ā bhara
translated: having taken the light of Agni from the earth, do thou bring it.

original: ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat //
analyzed: ānuṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat
translated: With the Anustubh metre, in the manner of Angiras.

original: pratūrtaṃ vājinn ā drava variṣṭhām anu samvatam / divi te janma paramam antarikṣe tava nābhiḥ pṛthivyām adhi yonir it //
analyzed: pratūrtam vājin ā drava variṣṭhām anu samvatam      divi te janma paramam antarikṣe tava nābhiḥ pṛthivyām adhi yoniḥ id
translated: Swiftly, O steed, run to the most excellent year. Thy highest birth is in the sky, thy navel in the atmosphere, thy womb is on the earth.🔽Yoke ye two the ass for this journey, ye rich in treasure,

original: yuñjāthām rāsabhaṃ yuvam asmin yāme vṛṣaṇvasū / agniṃ bharantam asmayum //
analyzed: yuñjāthām rāsabham yuvam asmin yāme vṛṣaṇvasū    agnim bharantam asmayum
translated: bearing Agni, the friend of man.

original: yogeyoge tavastaraṃ vājevāje havāmahe / sakhāya indram ūtaye //
analyzed: yoge yoge tavastaram vāje vāje havāmahe      sakhāyaḥ indram ūtaye
translated: In every need we call on thee, in every race, O Indra, for aid,🔽as friends.

original: pratūrvann ehy avakrāmann aśasto rudrasya gāṇapatyaṃ mayobhūr ehi / urv antarikṣaṃ vīhi / svastigavyūtir abhayāni kṛṇvan pūṣṇā sayujā saha //
analyzed: pratūrvan ehi avakrāman aśastaḥ rudrasya gāṇapatyam mayobhūḥ ehi    uru antarikṣam vīhi   svasti gavyūtiḥ abhayāni kṛṇvan pūṣṇā sayujā saha
translated: Approaching, advancing, uninjured, the lordship of Rudra's host, come hither, bringing bliss. Go thou to the wide atmosphere. Making safe paths and freedom from danger, with the friendly Pushan.

original: pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad ā bhara / agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad acchemaḥ / agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad bhariṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthāt agnim purīṣyam aṅgirasvat ā bhara   agnim purīṣyam aṅgirasvat acchemaḥ     agnim purīṣyam aṅgirasvat bhariṣyāmaḥ
translated: From the seat of earth bring hither Agni, the purifier, like Angiras. We will bring hither Agni, the purifier, like Angiras. We will bring Agni, the purifier, like Angiras.

original: anv agnir uṣasām agram akhyad anv ahāni prathamo jātavedāḥ / anu sūryasya purutrā ca raśmīn anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha //
analyzed: anu agniḥ uṣasām agram akhyat anu ahāni prathamaḥ jātavedāḥ    anu sūryasya purutrā ca raśmīn anu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha
translated: Agni hath looked on the foremost of the dawns, and on the days, first Jâtavedas. On the far-spreading rays of Sûrya, and on the heaven and earth thou hast extended.

original: āgatya vājy adhvānam sarvā mṛdho vidhūnute / agnim sadhasthe mahati cakṣuṣā ni cikīṣate //
analyzed: āgatya vājī adhvānam sarvāḥ mṛdhaḥ vidhūnute    agnim sadhasthe mahati cakṣuṣā ni cikīṣate
translated: Having come, O strong one, along the path, thou shakest off all the enemies. With thy eye thou seekest Agni in the great abode.

original: ākramya vājin pṛthivīm agnim iccha rucā tvam / bhūmyā vṛktvāya no brūhi yataḥ khanema taṃ vayam //
analyzed: ākramya vājin pṛthivīm agnim iccha rucā tvam    bhūmyā vṛktvāya naḥ brūhi yatas khanema tam vayam
translated: Having stepped on the earth, O strong one, seek thou Agni with thy flame. Having chosen the earth for us, tell us whence we may dig him up.

original: dyaus te pṛṣṭhaṃ pṛthivī sadhastham ātmāntarikṣam samudro yoniḥ / vikhyāya cakṣuṣā tvam abhi tiṣṭha pṛtanyataḥ //
analyzed: dyauḥ te pṛṣṭham pṛthivī sadhastham ātmā antarikṣam samudraḥ yoniḥ      vikhyāya cakṣuṣā tvam abhi tiṣṭha pṛtanyataḥ
translated: Thy back is the sky, thy seat the earth, thy body the atmosphere, thy womb the ocean. Having shone with thy eye, do thou subdue the foes.

original: ut krāma mahate saubhagāyāsmād āsthānād draviṇodā vājin / vayam syāma sumatau pṛthivyā agniṃ khananta upasthe asyāḥ //
analyzed: ud krāma mahate saubhagāya asmāt āsthānāt draviṇaḥ dāḥ vājin    vayam syāma sumatau pṛthivyāḥ agnim khanantaḥ upasthe asyāḥ
translated: Rise up, O strong one, to great prosperity from this place, O giver of wealth. May we be in the favour of the earth, digging Agni in her lap.

original: ud akramīd draviṇodā vājy arvākaḥ su lokam sukṛtaṃ pṛthivyām / tataḥ khanema supratīkam agnim svo ruhāṇā adhi nākam uttamam //
analyzed: ud akramīt draviṇaḥ dāḥ vājī arvā akaḥ su lokam su kṛtam pṛthivyām    tatas khanema su pratīkam agnim svar ruhāṇāḥ adhi nākam uttamam
translated: The wealth-bestowing steed hath stepped forth, the well-made place on earth. From thence let us dig out the fair-faced Agni, ascending to the highest vault of heaven.

original: ā tvā jigharmi manasā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantaṃ bhuvanāni viśvā / pṛthuṃ tiraścā vayasā bṛhantaṃ vyaciṣṭham annai rabhasaṃ dṛśānam //
analyzed: ā tvā jigharmi manasā ghṛtena pratikṣiyantam bhuvanāni viśvā    pṛthum tiraścā vayasā bṛhantam vyaciṣṭham annaiḥ rabhasam dṛśānam
translated: With my mind I warm thee, with ghee, thee who reachest to all the worlds. Wide, broad, with life, most capacious, with food, strong, shining.

original: ā viśvataḥ pratyañcaṃ jigharmy arakṣasā manasā taj juṣeta / maryaśrī spṛhayadvarṇo agnir nābhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ //
analyzed: ā viśvatas pratyañcam jigharmi arakṣasā manasā tat juṣeta    marya śrī spṛhayat varṇaḥ agniḥ na abhimṛśe tanvā jarbhurāṇaḥ
translated: From all sides I warm thee, facing every way, with a mind free from guile. Let him accept it. Agni, of youthful beauty, of desirable colour, not to be approached, with his body.

original: pari vājapatiḥ kavir agnir havyāny akramīt / dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: pari vāja patiḥ kaviḥ agniḥ havyāni akramīt    dadhat ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: The wise Agni, the lord of strength, hath gone round the offerings,🔽Placing treasures in the house of the worshipper.

original: pari tvāgne puraṃ vayaṃ vipram sahasya dhīmahi / dhṛṣadvarṇaṃ divedive hantāraṃ bhaṅgurāvatām //
analyzed: pari tvā agne puram vayam vipram sahasya dhīmahi      dhṛṣat varṇam dive dive hantāram bhaṅgurāvatām
translated: Thee, O Agni, the wise, the sage, the lord of the brave, we will make the citadel,🔽The one of bright colour, day by day, the destroyer of the unsteady ones.🔽Thou, O Agni, with thy lights, thou, O Agni, with thy flames, thou from the waters, thou from the stone,

original: tvam agne dyubhis tvam āśuśukṣaṇis tvam adbhyas tvam aśmanas pari / tvaṃ vanebhyas tvam oṣadhībhyas tvaṃ nṛṇāṃ nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ //
analyzed: tvam agne dyubhiḥ tvam āśuśukṣaṇiḥ tvam adbhyaḥ tvam aśmanaḥ pari tvam vanebhyaḥ tvam oṣadhībhyaḥ tvam nṛṇām nṛpate jāyase śuciḥ
translated: Thou from the woods, thou from the plants, O lord of men, thou art born pure.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvat khanāmi / jyotiṣmantaṃ tvāgne supratīkam ajasreṇa bhānunā dīdyatam / śivaṃ prajābhyo 'himsantaṃ pṛthivyā sadhasthād agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvat khanāmaḥ //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām   pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthāt agnim purīṣyam aṅgirasvat khanāmi    jyotiṣmantam tvā agne su pratīkam ajasreṇa bhānunā dīdyatam    śivam prajābhyaḥ himsantam pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthāt agnim purīṣyam aṅgirasvat khanāmaḥ  /
translated: By the impulse of God Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, from the lap of Earth I dig thee, Agni, meet for worship, after the manner of Angiras. Thee, O Agni, full of light, of fair form, shining with undecaying radiance, auspicious to creatures, harmless, from the lap of Earth we dig, Agni, meet for worship, after the manner of Angiras.

original: apāṃ pṛṣṭham asi yonir agneḥ samudram abhitaḥ pinvamānam / vardhamāno mahām ā ca puṣkare divo mātrayā varimṇā prathasva //🔽śarma ca stho varma ca stho 'cchidre bahule ubhe / vyacasvatī saṃ vasāthāṃ bhṛtam agniṃ purīṣyam //
analyzed: apām pṛṣṭham asi yoniḥ agneḥ samudram abhitas pinvamānam   vardhamānaḥ mahām ā ca puṣkare divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathasva  śarma ca sthaḥ varma ca sthaḥ chidre bahule ubhe      sam vasāthām bhṛtam agnim purīṣyam
translated: Thou art the back of the waters, the womb of Agni, the ocean swelling on every side. Increasing, on the lotus, in greatness, extend thyself with the measure of the sky.🔽Be ye two a shelter and a defence, both of you entire, both of you very wide. Ye two, full of room, be united: bear ye Agni, meet for worship.

original: saṃvasāthām svarvidā samīcī urasā tmanā / agnim antar bhariṣyantī jyotiṣmantam ajasram it //
analyzed: saṃvasāthām svarvidā samīcī urasā tmanā    agnim antar bhariṣyantī jyotiṣmantam ajasram id
translated: Ye two, finding the light, accordant, with your breast, with your own body, bearing within you Agni full of light, undecaying.

original: purīṣyo 'si viśvabharā atharvā tvā prathamo nir amanthad agne / tvām agne puṣkarād adhy atharvā nir amanthata / mūrdhno viśvasya vāghataḥ //🔽tam u tvā dadhyaṅṅ ṛṣiḥ putra īdhe atharvaṇaḥ / vṛtrahaṇaṃ puraṃdaram //
analyzed: purīṣyaḥ si viśva bharāḥ atharvā tvā prathamaḥ niḥ amanthat agne   tvām agne puṣkarāt adhi atharvā niḥ amanthata     mūrdhnaḥ viśvasya vāghataḥ  tam u tvā dadhyaṅ ṛṣiḥ putraḥ īdhe atharvaṇaḥ    vṛtra haṇam puraṃdaram
translated: Thee, O Agni, from the navel did Atharvan, the son of Atharvan, the Rishi, churn out,

original: tam u tvā pāthyo vṛṣā samīdhe dasyuhantamam / dhanaṃjayam raṇeraṇe //
analyzed: tam u tvā pāthyaḥ vṛṣā samīdhe dasyu hantamam dhanaṃjayam raṇeraṇe
translated: Thee, O Agni, the most destructive of the Dasyus, did the bull Patha churn out, the slayer of Vrtra, the breaker of forts, the winner of wealth in every fight.

original: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñam sukṛtasya yonau / devāvīr devān haviṣā yajāsy agne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ //
analyzed: sīda hotar sve u loke cikitvān sādaya yajñam sukṛtasya yonau    devāvīḥ devān haviṣā yajāsi agne bṛhat yajamāne vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Sit down, O Hotar, in thine own place, O wise one, seat the sacrifice in the womb of good action. Thou shalt worship the gods with oblation, O Agni, give long life to the sacrificer.

original: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānas tveṣo dīdivām asadat sudakṣaḥ / adabdhavratapramatir vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śucijihvo agniḥ //
analyzed: ni hotā hotṛṣadane vidānaḥ tveṣaḥ dīdivām asadat su dakṣaḥ    adabdha vrata pramatiḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ sahasrambharaḥ śuci jihvaḥ agniḥ
translated: The Hotar, the all-knower, hath sat down in the Hotar's place, the bright, the shining, the very skilful one, whose thought is firm in inviolable vows, the best, bearing a thousand, Agni, whose tongue is pure.

original: sam sīdasva mahām asi śocasva devavītamaḥ / vi dhūmam agne aruṣaṃ miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam //
analyzed: sam sīdasva mahām asi śocasva deva vītamaḥ    vi dhūmam agne aruṣam miyedhya sṛja praśasta darśatam
translated: Sit down, be thou kindled, thou art great, shine most god-adoring. Send forth thy ruddy smoke, O Agni, worthy of offering, send forth thy praiseworthy light.

original: apo devīr upasṛja madhumatīr ayakṣmāya prajābhyaḥ / tāsām āsthānād uj jihatām oṣadhayaḥ supippalāḥ //
analyzed: apaḥ devīḥ upasṛja madhumatīḥ ayakṣmāya prajābhyaḥ   tāsām āsthānāt ud jihatām oṣadhayaḥ su pippalāḥ
translated: Pour out the divine waters, rich in honey, for the health of living creatures. From their abode let plants spring up, bearing goodly berries.

original: saṃ te vāyur mātariśvā dadhātūttānāyā hṛdayaṃ yad vikastam / yo devānāṃ carasi prāṇathena kasmai deva vaṣaḍ astu tubhyam //
analyzed: sam te vāyuḥ mātariśvā dadhātu uttānāyāḥ hṛdayam yat vikastam   yaḥ devānām carasi prāṇathena kasmai deva vaṣaṭ astu tubhyam
translated: May Vayu, the bestower of life, set thy heart aright, O thou that art stretched out, and opened wide. Thou who goest about with the breath of the gods, to what god shall we offer Vashat to thee?

original: sujāto jyotiṣā saha śarma varūtham āsadat svaḥ / vāso agne viśvarūpam saṃvyayasva vibhāvaso //
analyzed: su jātaḥ jyotiṣā saha śarma varūtham āsadat svar   vāsaḥ agne viśva rūpam saṃvyayasva vibhāvaso
translated: Well-born, with light, he hath sat down to the protection and the shelter of heaven. O Agni, clothe thee in the garment of all forms, O thou of wondrous splendour.

original: ud u tiṣṭha svadhvarāvā no devyā dhiyā / dṛśe ca bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvanir āgne yāhi suśastibhiḥ //
analyzed: ud u tiṣṭha su adhvarāvā naḥ devyā dhiyā     dṛśe ca bhāsā bṛhatā śuśukvaniḥ ā agne yāhi su śastibhiḥ
translated: Rise up for our sacrifices, O thou who art to be invoked, with the divine thought, that we may see thee, with great radiance, shining brightly. O Agni, come with fair praises.

original: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇa ūtaye tiṣṭhā devo na savitā / ūrdhvo vājasya sanitā yad añjibhir vāghadbhir vihvayāmahe //
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ u su naḥ ūtaye tiṣṭha devaḥ na savitā   ūrdhvaḥ vājasya sanitā yat añjibhiḥ vāghadbhiḥ vihvayāmahe
translated: Rise up on high for our help, O thou who art to be invoked, like the god Savitar. On high is the gainer of strength, when we invoke with the anointed, with the priests.

original: sa jāto garbho asi rodasyor agne cārur vibhṛta oṣadhīṣu / citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāmsy aktūn pra mātṛbhyo adhi kanikradad gāḥ //
analyzed: sa jātaḥ garbhaḥ asi rodasyoḥ agne cāruḥ vibhṛtaḥ oṣadhīṣu    citraḥ śiśuḥ pari tamāmsi aktūn pra mātṛbhyaḥ adhi kanikradat gāḥ
translated: Thou art born as the child of the two worlds, O Agni, lovely, set in the plants. The wondrous child hath passed over the dark mists, and hath bellowed to the cows above his mothers.

original: sthiro bhava vīḍv aṅga āśur bhava vājy arvan / pṛthur bhava suṣadas tvam agneḥ purīṣavāhaṇaḥ //
analyzed: sthiraḥ bhava vīḍu aṅgaḥ āśuḥ bhava vājī arvan    pṛthuḥ bhava suṣadaḥ tvam agneḥ purīṣavāhaṇaḥ
translated: Be firm, O limb, be strong; be swift, O steed, be fleet, O horse. Be broad, be easy to sit on, thou who carriest Agni's dung.

original: śivo bhava prajābhyo mānuṣībhyas tvam aṅgiraḥ / mā dyāvāpṛthivī abhi śocīr māntarikṣaṃ mā vanaspatīn //
analyzed: śivaḥ bhava prajābhyaḥ mānuṣībhyaḥ tvam aṅgiraḥ   mā dyāvāpṛthivī abhi śocīḥ mā antarikṣam mā vanaspatīn
translated: Be auspicious to the people, to the human beings, O Angiras. Do not burn the sky and the earth, nor the atmosphere, nor the trees.

original: praitu vājī kanikradan nānadad rāsabhaḥ patvā / bharann agniṃ purīṣyaṃ mā pādy āyuṣaḥ purā / vṛṣāgniṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ bharann apāṃ garbham samudriyam //
analyzed: praitu vājī kanikradat nānadat rāsabhaḥ patvā    bharan agnim purīṣyam mā pādi āyuṣaḥ purā   vṛṣā agnim vṛṣaṇam bharan apām garbham samudriyam
translated: Let the strong horse go neighing, let the ass braying go forward. Bearing Agni who belongs to men, do not stumble before (his full) life. The bull bearing the strong Agni, the embryo of the waters, of the ocean.

original: agna āyāhi vītaye //
analyzed: agne āyāhi vītaye
translated: O Agni, come for enjoyment.

original: ṛtam satyam ṛtam satyam / agniṃ purīṣyam aṅgirasvad bharāmaḥ / oṣadhayaḥ prati modadhvam agnim etam śivam āyantam abhy atra yuṣmāḥ / vyasyan viśvā anirā amīvā niṣīdan no apa durmatiṃ jahi //
analyzed: ṛtam satyam ṛtam satyam   agnim purīṣyam aṅgirasvat bharāmaḥ   oṣadhayaḥ prati modadhvam agnim etam śivam āyantam abhi atra yuṣmāḥ   vyasyan viśvāḥ anirāḥ amīvāḥ niṣīdan naḥ apa durmatim jahi
translated: Truth, truth. We bear Agni who belongs to men, like Angiras, after the manner of Angiras. O plants, rejoice in him, in this auspicious Agni who comes hither to you. Scattering away all diseases, all evil influences, sit down and drive away our evil thoughts.

original: oṣadhayaḥ prati gṛbhṇīta puṣpavatīḥ supippalāḥ / ayaṃ vo garbha ṛtviyaḥ pratnam sadhastham āsadat //
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ prati gṛbhṇīta puṣpavatīḥ su pippalāḥ   ayam vaḥ garbhaḥ ṛtviyaḥ pratnam sadhastham āsadat
translated: O plants, receive him, ye that are full of flowers and good berries. This is your due embryo. He has sat down in his ancient abode.

original: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucāno bādhasva dviṣo rakṣaso amīvāḥ / suśarmaṇo bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syām agner aham suhavasya praṇītau //
analyzed: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucānaḥ bādhasva dviṣaḥ rakṣasaḥ amīvāḥ    su śarmaṇaḥ bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syām agneḥ aham su havasya praṇītau
translated: Shining with far-extending splendour, drive away the foes, the Rakshas, the diseases. In the protection of the great Agni, easy to invoke, may I be in the guidance of the good protector.🔽Ye waters are beneficent: bestow upon us strength,

original: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvas tā na ūrje dadhātana / mahe raṇāya cakṣase //
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana mahe raṇāya cakṣase
translated: For great enjoyment and for sight.🔽Of that most auspicious juice of yours, bestow ye unto us,

original: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ / uśatīr iva mātaraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ    uśatīḥ iva mātaraḥ
translated: As if ye were eager, O ye Mothers.🔽To him we come unto you, for whose enjoyment ye quicken us:

original: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha / āpo janayathā ca naḥ //
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha    āpaḥ janayatha ca naḥ
translated: O ye Waters, generate us too.🔽Mitra, having united the earth and the ground with light,

original: mitraḥ samsṛjya pṛthivīṃ bhūmiṃ ca jyotiṣā saha / sujātaṃ jātavedasam ayakṣmāya tvā sam sṛjāmi prajābhyaḥ //
analyzed: mitraḥ samsṛjya pṛthivīm bhūmim ca jyotiṣā saha     su jātam jātavedasam ayakṣmāya tvā sam sṛjāmi prajābhyaḥ
translated: The well-born Jâtavedas, I unite thee for freedom from disease for offspring.🔽The Rudras, having united the great light with the earth, have kindled it.

original: rudrāḥ samsṛjya pṛthivīṃ bṛhaj jyotiḥ sam īdhire / teṣāṃ bhānur ajasra ic chukro deveṣu rocate //
analyzed: rudrāḥ samsṛjya pṛthivīm bṛhat jyotiḥ sam īdhire    teṣām bhānuḥ ajasraḥ id śukraḥ deveṣu rocate
translated: Of these the pure, the ever-present light shines bright among the Gods.🔽United with the Vasus, the Rudras, the wise, the clay that is fit for work,

original: samsṛṣṭā vasubhī rudrair dhīraiḥ karmaṇyāṃ mṛdam / hastābhyāṃ mṛdvīṃ kṛtvā sinīvālī kṛṇotu tām //
analyzed: samsṛṣṭā vasubhiḥ rudraiḥ dhīraiḥ karmaṇyām mṛdam   hastābhyām mṛdvīm kṛtvā sinīvālī kṛṇotu tām
translated: Having made it soft with her hands, may Sinîvâlî form it well.

original: sinīvālī sukapardā sukurīrā svaupaśā / sā tubhyam adite mahyokhāṃ dadhātu hastayoḥ //
analyzed: sinīvālī su kapardā su kurīrā su aupaśā     sā tubhyam adite mahyā ukhām dadhātu hastayoḥ
translated: Place in thy hands, O Aditi, the great pan.🔽May Aditi with her arms and with her thought form the pan with strength.

original: ukhāṃ kṛṇotu śaktyā bāhubhyām aditir dhiyā / mātā putraṃ yathopasthe sāgniṃ bibhartu garbha ā //
analyzed: ukhām kṛṇotu śaktyā bāhubhyām aditiḥ dhiyā    mātā putram yathā upasthe sā agnim bibhartu garbhe ā
translated: As a mother her son, may she bear Agni in her lap.

original: makhasya śiro 'si //🔽vasavas tvā kṛṇvantu gāyatreṇa chandasāṅgirasvad dhruvāsi pṛthivy asi / dhārayā mayi prajām rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyam suvīryam sajātān yajamānāya //🔽rudrās tvā kṛṇvantu traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvad dhruvāsy antarikṣam asi / dhārayā mayi prajām rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyam suvīryam sajātān yajamānāya //
analyzed: makhasya śiraḥ si  vasavaḥ tvā kṛṇvantu gāyatreṇa chandasā aṅgirasvat dhruvā asi pṛthivī asi  / dhāraya mayi prajām rāyaspoṣam gaupatyam su vīryam sajātān yajamānāya  rudrāḥ tvā kṛṇvantu traiṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat dhruvā asi antarikṣam asi  / dhāraya mayi prajām rāyaspoṣam gaupatyam su vīryam sajātān yajamānāya
translated: Thou art the head of Makha.🔽May the Vasus form thee with the Gayatri metre, in the manner of Angiras. Thou art firm. Thou art the earth. Support in me offspring, increase of wealth, lordship of the house, good manhood, kinsmen for the sacrificer.🔽May the Rudras form thee with the Tristubh metre, in the manner of Angiras. Thou art firm. Thou art the atmosphere. Support in me offspring, increase of wealth, lordship of the house, good manhood, kinsmen for the sacrificer.

original: ādityās tvā kṛṇvantu jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvad dhruvāsi dyaur asi / dhārayā mayi prajām rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyam suvīryam sajātān yajamānāya //
analyzed: ādityāḥ tvā kṛṇvantu jāgatena chandasā aṅgirasvat dhruvā asi dyauḥ asi  / dhāraya mayi prajām rāyaspoṣam gaupatyam su vīryam sajātān yajamānāya
translated: May the Adityas form thee with the Jagati metre, in the manner of Angiras. Thou art firm. Thou art the sky. Support in me offspring, increase of wealth, lordship of the house, good manhood, kinsmen for the sacrificer.

original: viśve tvā devā vaiśvānarāḥ kṛṇvantv ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvad dhruvāsi diśo 'si / dhārayā mayi prajām rāyaspoṣaṃ gaupatyam suvīryam sajātān yajamānāya //
analyzed: viśve tvā devāḥ vaiśvānarāḥ kṛṇvantu ānuṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat  dhruvā asi diśaḥ si   / dhāraya mayi prajām rāyaspoṣam gaupatyam su vīryam sajātān yajamānāya
translated: May the All-gods, the Vaiśvānara fires, make thee firm by the Anushtubh metre, in the manner of Angiras. Thou art firm. Thou art the quarters. Support offspring and abundance of wealth in me, with good heroes, for the sacrificer and his people.

original: adityai rāmnāsi / aditiṣ ṭe bilaṃ gṛbhṇātu / kṛtvāya sā mahīm ukhāṃ mṛnmayīṃ yonim agnaye / putrebhyaḥ prāyacchad aditiḥ śrapayān iti //
analyzed: adityai rāmnā asi   aditiḥ te bilam gṛbhṇātu   kṛtvāya sā mahīm ukhām mṛd mayīm yonim agnaye   putrebhyaḥ prāyacchat aditiḥ śrapayān iti
translated: Thou art the rampart of Aditi. May Aditi receive thy cavity. Having made this great earthen pan, an abode for Agni, Aditi gave it to her sons to be baked.

original: vasavas tvā dhūpayantu gāyatreṇa chandasāṅgirasvat / rudrās tvā dhūpayantu traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat / ādityās tvā dhūpayantu jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvat / viśve tvā devā vaiśvānarā dhūpayantv ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat / indras tvā dhūpayatu / varuṇas tvā dhūpayatu / viṣṇu tvā dhūpayatu //
analyzed: vasavaḥ tvā dhūpayantu gāyatreṇa chandasā aṅgirasvat    rudrāḥ tvā dhūpayantu traiṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat    ādityāḥ tvā dhūpayantu jāgatena chandasā aṅgirasvat   viśve tvā devāḥ vaiśvānarāḥ dhūpayantu ānuṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat                        tvā dhūpayatu
translated: Let the Vasus fumigate thee with the Gayatri metre, in the manner of Angiras. Let the Rudras fumigate thee with the Tristubh metre, in the manner of Angiras. Let the Adityas fumigate thee with the Jagati metre, in the manner of Angiras. Let the All-gods, the Vaiśvānara fires, fumigate thee with the Anustubh metre, in the manner of Angiras. Let Indra fumigate thee. Let Varuna fumigate thee. Let Vishnu fumigate thee.

original: aditiṣ ṭvā devī viśvadevyāvatī pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat khanatv avaṭa / devānām tvā patnīr devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvad dadhatūkhe / dhiṣaṇās tvā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvad abhīndhatām ukhe / varūtrīṣ ṭvā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvac chrapayantūkhe / gnās tvā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat pacantūkhe / janayas tvācchinnapatrā devīr viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat pacantūkhe //
analyzed: aditiḥ tvā devī viśvadevyāvatī pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat khanatu avaṭa    devānām tvā patnīḥ devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat dadhatu ukhe   dhiṣaṇāḥ tvā devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat abhīndhatām ukhe    varūtrīḥ tvā devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat śrapayantu ukhe    gnāḥ tvā devīḥ viśvadevyāvatīḥ pṛthivyāḥ sadhasthe aṅgirasvat pacantu uk
translated: Let Aditi, the Goddess, accompanied by all the Gods, dig thee in the earth's abode, O Crucible, after the manner of Angiras. Let the Goddesses, the Consorts of the Gods, accompanied by all the Gods, place thee in the earth's abode, O Crucible, after the manner of Angiras. Let the Goddesses, the Disanas, accompanied by all the Gods, kindle thee in the earth's abode, O Crucible, after the manner of Angiras. Let the Goddesses, the Varutris, accompanied by all the Gods, bake thee in the earth's abode, O Crucible, after the manner of Angiras. Let the Goddesses, the Gnas, accompanied by all the Gods, cook thee in the earth's abode, O Crucible, after the manner of Angiras. Let the Goddesses, the Mothers, with unrent skirts, accompanied by all the Gods, cook thee in the earth's abode, O Crucible, after the manner of Angiras.

original: mitrasya carṣaṇīdhṛto 'vo devasya sānasi / dyumnaṃ citraśravastamam //
analyzed: mitrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ vaḥ devasya sānasi
translated: The help of Mitra, the God who rules mankind, the most illustrious glory, wondrous to behold.

original: devas tvā savitodvapatu supāṇiḥ svaṅguriḥ subāhur uta śaktyā / avyathamānā pṛthivyām āśā diśa ā pṛṇa //
analyzed: devaḥ tvā savitā udvapatu su pāṇiḥ su aṅguriḥ su bāhuḥ uta śaktyā    a vyathamānā pṛthivyām āśāḥ diśaḥ ā pṛṇa
translated: May the God Savitar, the skilful, the well-handed, the well-armed, with his power, cast thee forth, uninjured, O Crucible, in the earth's regions and quarters.

original: utthāya bṛhatī bhavod u tiṣṭha dhrutvā tvam / mitraitāṃ ta ukhāṃ pari dadāmy abhittyā eṣā mā bhedi //
analyzed: utthāya bṛhatī bhava ud u tiṣṭha dhrutvā tvam mitra etām te ukhām pari dadāmi a bhittyai eṣā mā bhedi
translated: Arise, become great, stand firm, O thou that art firm. I deliver to thee this fire-pan, that it may not be broken.

original: vasavas tvā chṛndantu gāyatreṇa chandasāṅgirasvat / rudrās tvā chṛndantu traiṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat / ādityās tvā chṛndantu jāgatena chandasāṅgirasvat / viśve tvā devā vaiśvānarā ā chṛndantv ānuṣṭubhena chandasāṅgirasvat //
analyzed: vasavaḥ tvā chṛndantu gāyatreṇa chandasā aṅgirasvat    rudrāḥ tvā chṛndantu traiṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat    ādityāḥ tvā chṛndantu jāgatena chandasā aṅgirasvat   viśve tvā devāḥ vaiśvānarāḥ ā chṛndantu ānuṣṭubhena chandasā aṅgirasvat  /
translated: May the Vasus delight thee with the Gayatri metre, O thou of Angiras' nature. May the Rudras delight thee with the Tristubh metre, O thou of Angiras' nature. May the Adityas delight thee with the Jagati metre, O thou of Angiras' nature. May the All-gods, the all-pervading, delight thee with the Anustubh metre, O thou of Angiras' nature.

original: ākūtim agniṃ prayujam svāhā / mano medhām agniṃ prayujam svāhā / cittaṃ vijñātam agniṃ prayujam svāhā / vāco vidhṛtim agniṃ prayujam svāhā / prajāpataye manave svāhā / agnaye vaiśvānarāya svāhā //
analyzed: ākūtim agnim prayujam svāhā   manaḥ medhām agnim prayujam svāhā   cittam vijñātam agnim prayujam svāhā   vācaḥ vidhṛtim agnim prayujam svāhā    prajāpataye manave svāhā   agnaye vaiśvānarāya svāhā
translated: Inspiration, Agni, I yoke, All-hail! Mind, intelligence, Agni, I yoke, All-hail! Thought, knowledge, Agni, I yoke, All-hail! The support of speech, Agni, I yoke, All-hail! To Prajapati, to Manu, All-hail! To Agni Vaisvânara, All-hail!🔽Let every man be friendly with the leader of the Gods,

original: viśvo devasya netur marto vurīta sakhyam / viśvo rāya iṣudhyati dyumnaṃ vṛṇīta puṣyase svāhā //
analyzed: viśvaḥ devasya netuḥ martaḥ vurīta sakhyam   viśvaḥ rāyaḥ iṣudhyati dyumnam vṛṇīta puṣyase svāhā
translated: Let every one desire prosperity. Choose glory that thou mayst prosper. All-hail!

original: mā su bhitthā mā su riṣo 'mba dhṛṣṇu vīrayasva su / agniś cedaṃ kariṣyathaḥ //
analyzed: mā su bhitthāḥ mā su riṣaḥ mba dhṛṣṇu vīrayasva su    agniḥ ca idam kariṣyathaḥ
translated: Be not afraid, be not terrified. O mother, be strong and exert thyself. This will ye do with Agni.

original: dṛmhasva devi pṛthivi svastaya āsurī māyā svadhayā kṛtāsi / juṣṭaṃ devebhya idam astu havyam ariṣṭā tvam ud ihi yajñe asmin //
analyzed: dṛmhasva devi pṛthivi svastaye āsurī māyā svadhayā kṛtā asi   / juṣṭam devebhyaḥ idam astu havyam ariṣṭā tvam ud ihi yajñe asmin
translated: Be thou extended, O Goddess Earth, for bliss. By thine own nature thou art made the Asura's magic. Let this oblation be acceptable to the Gods. Be thou not injured in this sacrifice, but rise up.

original: drvanna sarpirāsutiḥ pratno hotā vareṇyaḥ / sahasas putro adbhutaḥ //
analyzed: dru anna sarpiḥ āsutiḥ pratnaḥ hotā vareṇyaḥ sahasaḥ putraḥ adbhutaḥ
translated: The ancient Priest, to be chosen, fed with oil, the wondrous Son of Strength,

original: parasyā adhi saṃvato 'varām abhy ātara / yatrāham asmi tām ava //🔽paramasyāḥ parāvato rohid aśva ihā gahi / purīṣyaḥ purupriyo 'gne tvaṃ tarā mṛdhaḥ //
analyzed: parasyāḥ adhi saṃvataḥ varām abhī ātara   yatra aham asmi tām ava  paramasyāḥ parāvataḥ rohit aśvaḥ iha ā gahi    purīṣyaḥ puru priyaḥ gne tvam tara mṛdhaḥ
translated: From the highest vault come down to the lower one, to the place where I am, come down to that.🔽From the farthest distance, O thou whose horses are red, come hither. Be thou the people's friend, O Agni, much-loved by many: drive away our foes.

original: yad agne kāni kāni cid ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi / sarvaṃ tad astu te ghṛtaṃ taj juṣasva yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: yat agne kāni kāni cit ā te dārūṇi dadhmasi    sarvam tat astu te ghṛtam tat juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translated: Whatever pieces of wood, O Agni, we put on thee, let all that be for thee pure ghee. Accept that, O thou Most Youthful.

original: yad atty upajihvikā yad vamro atisarpati / sarvaṃ tad astu te ghṛtaṃ taj juṣasva yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: yat atti upajihvikā yat vamraḥ atisarpati  / sarvam tat astu te ghṛtam tat juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translated: What the tongue licks, what the Vamra crawls over, let all that be for thee pure ghee. Accept that, O thou Most Youthful.

original: aharahar aprayāvaṃ bharanto 'śvāyeva tiṣṭhate ghāsam asmai / rāyaspoṣeṇa sam iṣā madanto 'gne mā te prativeśā riṣāma //
analyzed: ahar ahar a prayāvam bharantaḥ śvāyā iva tiṣṭhate ghāsam asmai    rāyaspoṣeṇa sam iṣā madantaḥ gne mā te prativeśāḥ riṣāma
translated: Bringing thee day by day our never-failing portion, as fodder to a horse, rejoicing in food and increase of wealth, O Agni, may we dwell in thy neighbourhood without offending thee.

original: nābhā pṛthivyāḥ samidhāne agnau rāyaspoṣāya bṛhate havāmahe / iraṃmadaṃ bṛhadukthyaṃ yajatraṃ jetāram agniṃ pṛtanāsu sāsahim //
analyzed: nābhā pṛthivyāḥ samidhāne agnau rāyaspoṣāya bṛhate havāmahe    iraṃmadam bṛhat ukthyam yajatram jetāram agnim pṛtanāsu sāsahim
translated: The one who delights in battle, worthy of great praise, to be worshipped, the conqueror, Agni, the invincible in battles.🔽The armies that are fierce, that cause pain, the hordes,

original: yāḥ senā abhītvarīr āvyādhinīr ugaṇā uta / ye stenā ye ca taskarās tāms te agne 'pi dadhāmy āsye //
analyzed: yāḥ senāḥ abhītvarīḥ āvyādhinīḥ ugaṇāḥ uta    ye stenāḥ ye ca taskarāḥ tām te agne pi dadhāmi āsye
translated: And the thieves and robbers, I place in your mouth, O Agni.🔽With your fangs, the filthy ones, with your jaws, the thieves,

original: damṣṭrābhyāṃ malimlūn jambhyais taskarām uta / hanubhyām stenān bhagavas tāms tvaṃ khāda sukhāditān //
analyzed: damṣṭrābhyām malimlūn jambhyaiḥ taskarām uta hanubhyām stenān bhagavaḥ tān tvam khāda su khāditān
translated: And with your jaws, the robbers, O blessed one, eat them well-cooked.🔽Those who are filthy among the people, the thieves, the robbers in the forest,

original: ye janeṣu malimlava stenāsas taskarā vane / ye kakṣeṣv aghāyavas tāms te dadhāmi jambhayoḥ //
analyzed: ye janeṣu malimlavaḥ stenāsaḥ taskarāḥ vane   ye kakṣeṣu aghāyavaḥ tām te dadhāmi jambhayoḥ
translated: And those who are wicked in the bushes, I place them in your jaws.🔽Whoever is hostile to us, and whoever hates us among the people,

original: yo asmabhyam arātīyād yaś ca no dveṣate janaḥ / nindād yo asmān dhipsāc ca sarvaṃ taṃ bhasmasā kuru //
analyzed: yaḥ asmabhyam arātīyāt yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣate janaḥ    nindāt yaḥ asmān dhipsāt ca sarvam tam bhasmasā kuru
translated: Whoever reviles us and covets us, reduce all of them to ashes.🔽My Brahman is sharpened, my strength and power are sharpened,

original: samśitaṃ me brahma samśitaṃ vīryaṃ balam / samśitaṃ kṣatraṃ jiṣṇu yasyāham asmi purohitaḥ //
analyzed: samśitam me brahma samśitam vīryam balam    samśitam kṣatram jiṣṇu yasya aham asmi purohitaḥ
translated: My victorious Kshatriya is sharpened, of whom I am the priest.🔽I raise up their arms, their splendor and strength,

original: ud eṣāṃ bāhū atiram ud varco atho balam / kṣiṇomi brahmaṇāmitrān un nayāmi svām aham //
analyzed: ud eṣām bāhū atiram ud varcaḥ atha u balam   kṣiṇomi brahmaṇā amitrān ud nayāmi svām aham
translated: I weaken the Brahmanas' enemies, and I raise up my own.

original: annapate 'nnasya no dehy anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ / prapra dātāraṃ tāriṣa ūrjaṃ no dhehi dvipade catuṣpade //
analyzed: anna pate nnasya naḥ dehi anamīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ   pra pra dātāram tāriṣaḥ ūrjam naḥ dhehi dvipade catuṣpade
translated: Lord of food, give us food, free from sickness, and full of strength. Do thou further the giver. Bestow strength upon our bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: dṛśāno rukma urvyā vy adyaud durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ / agnir amṛto abhavad vayobhir yad enaṃ dyaur janayat suretāḥ //
analyzed: dṛśānaḥ rukmaḥ urvyā vi adyaut durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ    agniḥ amṛtaḥ abhavat vayobhiḥ yat enam dyauḥ janayat su retāḥ
translated: The golden-hued one, shining far and wide, hath risen, the life that is hard to bear, for glory. Agni hath become immortal through his powers, when Dyaus, the fruitful one, begat him.

original: naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe dhāpayete śiśum ekam samīcī / dyāvākṣāmā rukmo antar vi bhāti devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodāḥ //
analyzed: nakta uṣāsā samanasā virūpe dhāpayete śiśum ekam samīcī     dyāvākṣāmā rukmaḥ antar vi bhāti devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dāḥ
translated: Night and Dawn, of different forms, but of one mind, are nourishing the one child together. The golden one shines between the heaven and earth. The gods, bestowers of wealth, have established Agni.

original: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīd bhadraṃ dvipade catuṣpade / vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyo 'nu prayāṇam uṣaso vi rājati //
analyzed: viśvā rūpāṇi prati muñcate kaviḥ prāsāvīt bhadram dvipade catuṣpade    vi nākam akhyat savitā vareṇyaḥ nu prayāṇam uṣasaḥ vi rājati
translated: The wise one assumes all forms. He hath brought forth good for bipeds and quadrupeds. Savitar, the adorable one, hath disclosed the vault. He shines forth, following the course of the dawns.

original: suparṇo 'si garutmāms trivṛt te śiro gāyatraṃ cakṣur bṛhadrathantare pakṣau / stoma ātmā chandāmsy aṅgāni yajūmṣi nāma / sāma te tanūr vāmadevyaṃ yajñāyajñiyaṃ pucchaṃ dhiṣṇyāḥ śaphāḥ / suparṇo 'si garutmān divaṃ gaccha svaḥ pata //
analyzed: suparṇaḥ si garutmān trivṛt te śiraḥ gāyatram cakṣuḥ bṛhat rathantare pakṣau   stomaḥ ātmā chandāmsi aṅgāni yajūmṣi nāma    sāma te tanūḥ vāmadevyam yajñāyajñiyam puccham dhiṣṇyāḥ śaphāḥ    suparṇaḥ si garutmān divam gaccha svar pata
translated: Thou art the bird, the eagle. The Trivrit is thy head, the Gayatri thy eye, the Brihat and Rathantara thy wings, the Stoma thy body, the metres thy limbs, the Yajus thy name. The Saman is thy body, the Vamadevya and Yajñāyajñiya thy tail, the Dhishnyas thy hooves. Thou art the bird, the eagle. Go to the sky, fly to heaven.

original: viṣṇoḥ kramo 'si sapatnahā gāyatraṃ chanda ā roha pṛthivīm anu vi kramasva / viṣṇoḥ kramo 'sy abhimātihā traiṣṭubhaṃ chanda ā rohāntarikṣam anu vi kramasva / viṣṇoḥ kramo 'sy arātīyato hantā jāgataṃ chanda ā roha divam anu vi kramasva / viṣṇoḥ kramo 'si śatrūyato hantānuṣṭubhaṃ chanda ā roha diśo 'nu vi kramasva //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ u si sapatna hā gāyatram chandaḥ ā roha pṛthivīm anu vi kramasva    viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ u si abhimāti hā traiṣṭubham chandaḥ ā roha antarikṣam anu vi kramasva    viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ u si arātīyataḥ hantā jāgatam chandaḥ ā roha divam anu vi kramasva    viṣṇoḥ kramaḥ u si śatrūyataḥ hantā anuṣṭubham chandaḥ ā roha diśaḥ nu vi kramasva
translated: Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of foes. Mount the Gayatri metre. Step along the earth. Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of enemies. Mount the Tristubh metre. Step along the atmosphere. Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of those who hate. Mount the Jagati metre. Step along the sky. Thou art Vishnu's step, the slayer of those who hate. Mount the Anustubh metre. Step along the quarters.

original: akrandad agni stanayann iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥ samañjan / sadyo jajñāno vi hīm iddho akhyad ā rodasī bhānunā bhāty antaḥ //
analyzed: akrandat agniḥ stanayan iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihat vīrudhaḥ samañjan    sadyas jajñānaḥ vi hi īm iddhaḥ akhyat ā rodasī bhānunā bhāti antar
translated: Agni hath roared like Dyaus thundering, shaking the earth, and causing the plants to shoot forth. As soon as born, well-kindled, he hath shone forth: within the two world-halves he shineth with his light.

original: agne 'bhyāvartinn abhi mā ni vartasvāyuṣā varcasā prajayā dhanena / sanyā medhayā rayyā poṣeṇa //
analyzed: agne bhyāvartin abhi mā ni vartasva āyuṣā varcasā prajayā dhanena     sanyā medhayā rayyā poṣeṇa
translated: O Agni, turning back, turn back to me with life, with radiance, with offspring, with wealth, with learning, with prosperity, with increase.

original: agne aṅgiraḥ śataṃ te santv āvṛtaḥ sahasraṃ ta upāvṛtaḥ / adhā poṣasya poṣeṇa punar no naṣṭam ā kṛdhi punar no rayim ā kṛdhi //🔽punar ūrjā ni vartasva punar agna iṣāyuṣā / punar naḥ pāhy amhasaḥ //
analyzed: agne aṅgiraḥ śatam te santu āvṛtaḥ sahasram te upāvṛtaḥ    adha poṣasya poṣeṇa punar naḥ naṣṭam ā kṛdhi punar naḥ rayim ā kṛdhi  punar ūrjā ni vartasva punar agne iṣā āyuṣā   punar naḥ pāhi amhasaḥ
translated: O Agni, O Angiras, let there be a hundred returns for thee, a thousand further returns. Then with the increase of increase, bring back to us what we have lost, bring back to us wealth.🔽Turn back again with strength, O Agni, again with food and life. Again deliver us from woe.

original: saha rayyā ni vartasvāgne pinvasva dhārayā / viśvapsnyā viśvatas pari //
analyzed: saha rayyā ni vartasva agne pinvasva dhārayā   / viśvapsnyā viśvatas pari
translated: Turn back with wealth, O Agni, swell with thy stream, with all-sustaining nourishment, from all sides.

original: ā tvāhārṣam antar abhūr dhruvas tiṣṭhāvicācaliḥ / viśas tvā sarvā vāñchantu mā tvad rāṣṭram adhi bhraśat //
analyzed: ā tvā ahārṣam antar abhūḥ dhruvaḥ tiṣṭha avicācaliḥ    viśaḥ tvā sarvāḥ vāñchantu mā tvat rāṣṭram adhi bhraśat
translated: I have brought thee in, I have placed thee within. Stand firm, immovable. Let all the people desire thee. Let not thy kingdom be destroyed.

original: ud uttamaṃ varuṇa pāśam asmad avādhamaṃ vi madhyamam śrathāya / athā vayam āditya vrate tavānāgaso aditaye syāma //
analyzed: ud uttamam varuṇa pāśam asmat ava adhamam vi madhyamam śrathāya    athā vayam āditya vrate tava anāgasaḥ aditaye syāma
translated: Loosen the highest bond of Varuna from us, loosen the lowest, loosen the middle one for us. Then, O Aditya, in thy vow, may we be sinless for Aditi.

original: agre bṛhann uṣasām ūrdhvo asthān nirjaganvān tamaso jyotiṣāgāt / agnir bhānunā ruśatā svaṅga ā jāto viśvā sadmāny aprāḥ //
analyzed: agre bṛhan uṣasām ūrdhvaḥ asthāt nirjaganvān tamasaḥ jyotiṣā āgāt    agniḥ bhānunā ruśatā su aṅgaḥ ā jātaḥ viśvā sadmāni aprāḥ
translated: He hath stood up erect, high over the dawns, having opened the doors, he hath come from the darkness to the light. Agni with his ruddy splendour, self-bright, when born, hath filled all the regions.

original: hamsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir dūroṇasat / nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtam //
analyzed: hamsaḥ śuciṣad vasuḥ antarikṣa sad hotā vediṣad atithiḥ duroṇa sad nṛṣad vara sad ṛta sad vyoma sad ap jāḥ go jāḥ ṛta jāḥ adri jāḥ ṛtam
translated: The swan, sitting in the pure (sky), the treasure, sitting in the atmosphere, the priest, sitting on the altar, the guest, sitting in the house, sitting among men, sitting in the best (place), sitting in truth, sitting in the vault, born of the waters, born of the cows, born of truth, born of the mountain, is truth.

original: bṛhat //🔽sīda tvaṃ mātur asyā upasthe viśvāny agne vayunāni vidvān / maināṃ tapasā mārciṣābhiśocīr antar asyām śukrajyotir vi bhāhi //
analyzed: bṛhat  sīda tvam mātuḥ asyāḥ upasthe viśvāni agne vayunāni vidvān    mā enām tapasā mā arciṣā abhiśocīḥ antar asyām śukra jyotiḥ vi bhāhi
translated: Great!🔽Sit thou down, O Agni, in the lap of this thy mother, knowing all the ordinances. Do not scorch her with thy heat or flame. Shine within her with a pure light.

original: antar agne rucā tvam ukhāyāḥ sadane sve / tasyās tvam harasā tapan jātavedaḥ śivo bhava //
analyzed: antar agne rucā tvam ukhāyāḥ sadane sve   tasyāḥ tvam harasā tapan jātavedaḥ śivaḥ bhava
translated: In the womb of the pan, O Agni, with thy glow, in thy own abode. Do thou, O all-knower, shining with her heat, be auspicious.

original: śivo bhūtvā mahyam agne atho sīda śivas tvam / śivaḥ kṛtvā diśaḥ sarvāḥ svaṃ yonim ihāsadaḥ //
analyzed: śivaḥ bhūtvā mahyam agne atha u sīda śivaḥ tvam    śivaḥ kṛtvā diśaḥ sarvāḥ svam yonim iha āsadaḥ
translated: Having become auspicious to me, O Agni, then sit thou down, be thou auspicious. Having made all the quarters auspicious, sit thou down here in thy own place.

original: divas pari prathamaṃ jajñe agnir asmād dvitīyaṃ pari jātavedāḥ / tṛtīyam apsu nṛmaṇā ajasram indhāna enaṃ jarate svādhīḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ pari prathamam jajñe agniḥ asmāt dvitīyam pari jātavedāḥ    tṛtīyam apsu nṛmaṇāḥ ajasram indhānaḥ enam jarate svādhīḥ
translated: Agni was first born from the sky, from him Jâtavedas was born a second time. The third (time) in the waters, the imperishable, the man-beloved. Him the self-kindled one kindles.

original: vidmā te agne tredhā trayāṇi vidmā te dhāma vibhṛtā purutrā / vidmā te nāma paramaṃ guhā yad vidmā tam utsaṃ yata ājagantha //
analyzed: vidma te agne tredhā trayāṇi vidma te dhāma vibhṛtā purutrā    vidma te nāma paramam guhā yat vidma tam utsam yatas ājagantha
translated: We know thy highest name concealed in the cave: we know that birthplace whence thou hast come forth.

original: samudre tvā nṛmaṇā apsv antar nṛcakṣā īdhe divo agna ūdhan / tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāmsam apām upasthe mahiṣā avardhan //
analyzed: samudre tvā nṛmaṇāḥ apsu antar nṛ cakṣāḥ īdhe divaḥ agne ūdhan    tṛtīye tvā rajasi tasthivāmsam apām upasthe mahiṣāḥ avardhan
translated: O Agni, the men's friend, in the ocean, in the waters, in the womb of the sky, the men's observer, have kindled thee.

original: akrandad agni stanayann iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥ samañjan / sadyo jajñāno vi hīm iddho akhyad ā rodasī bhānunā bhāty antaḥ //
analyzed: akrandat agniḥ stanayan iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihat vīrudhaḥ samañjan    sadyas jajñānaḥ vi hi īm iddhaḥ akhyat ā rodasī bhānunā bhāti antar
translated: Agni hath cried like Dyaus who thunders, shaking the earth, and bending the plants. As soon as born, well-kindled, he hath shone forth. He shineth in the two world-halves with his light.

original: śrīṇām udāro dharuṇo rayīṇāṃ manīṣāṇāṃ prārpaṇaḥ somagopāḥ / vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahaso apsu rājā vi bhāty agra uṣasām idhānaḥ //
analyzed: śrīṇām udāraḥ dharuṇaḥ rayīṇām manīṣāṇām prārpaṇaḥ soma gopāḥ    vasuḥ sūnuḥ sahasaḥ apsu rājā vi bhāti agre uṣasām idhānaḥ
translated: The son of strength, the good, the guardian of the thoughts and wishes, the lord of the Soma, the supporter of the glories and riches, the king in the waters, the son of strength, kindled, shineth in front of the dawns.

original: viśvasya ketur bhuvanasya garbha ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ / vīḍuṃ cid adrim abhinat parāyañ janā yad agnim ayajanta pañca //
analyzed: viśvasya ketuḥ bhuvanasya garbhaḥ ā rodasī apṛṇāt jāyamānaḥ    vīḍum cit adrim abhinat parāyam janāḥ yat agnim ayajanta pañca
translated: The sign of all the world, the germ of being, he hath filled the two world-halves as he was born. He hath cleft the firm rock as he went away, when the five peoples worshipped Agni.

original: uśik pāvako aratiḥ sumedhā martyeṣv agnir amṛto ni dhāyi / iyarti dhūmam aruṣaṃ bharibhrad uc chukreṇa śociṣā dyām inakṣan //
analyzed: uśij pāvakaḥ aratiḥ sumedhāḥ martyeṣu agniḥ amṛtaḥ ni dhāyi    iyarti dhūmam aruṣam bharibhrat ud śukreṇa śociṣā dyām inakṣan
translated: The active, purifying, wise, well-disposed Agni has been placed among mortals as immortal. He sends forth the ruddy smoke, bearing it aloft, and with his bright flame he mounts to the sky.

original: dṛśāno rukma urvyā vy adyaud durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ / agnir amṛto abhavad vayobhir yad enaṃ dyaur janayat suretāḥ //
analyzed: dṛśānaḥ rukmaḥ urvyā vi adyaut durmarṣam āyuḥ śriye rucānaḥ    agniḥ amṛtaḥ abhavat vayobhiḥ yat enam dyauḥ janayat su retāḥ
translated: The beautiful one shines widely in the sky today, his life difficult to endure, shining for glory. Agni became immortal through his powers, when Dyaus, of good seed, generated him.

original: yas te adya kṛṇavad bhadraśoce 'pūpaṃ deva ghṛtavantam agne / pra taṃ naya prataraṃ vasyo acchābhi sumnaṃ devabhaktaṃ yaviṣṭha //
analyzed: yaḥ te adya kṛṇavat bhadra śoce pūpam deva ghṛtavantam agne    pra tam naya prataram vasyaḥ accha abhi sumnam deva bhaktam yaviṣṭha
translated: O Agni, who today makes for you the cake anointed with ghee, O God, lead him forward to the further shore of bliss, to the happiness of the worshipper, O youngest one.

original: ā taṃ bhaja sauśravaseṣv agna ukthauktha ā bhaja śasyamāne / priyaḥ sūrye priyo agnā bhavāty uj jātena bhinadad uj janitvaiḥ //
analyzed: ā tam bhaja sauśravaseṣu agne ukthaukthe ā bhaja śasyamāne    priyaḥ sūrye priyaḥ agnā bhavāti ud jātena bhinadat ud janitvaiḥ
translated: O Agni, share him in the glories, share him in every hymn that is sung. May he be dear to the sun, dear to Agni. May he be exalted by his offspring, exalted by his progeny.

original: tvām agne yajamānā anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi / tvayā saha draviṇam icchamānā vrajaṃ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ //
analyzed: tvām agne yajamānāḥ anu dyūn viśvā vasu dadhire vāryāṇi   tvayā saha draviṇam icchamānāḥ vrajam gomantam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ
translated: O Agni, the sacrificers, following your days, have obtained from you all the good things to be desired. Desiring wealth with you, the eager ones have opened the stall full of cattle.

original: astāvy agnir narām suśevo vaiśvānara ṛṣibhiḥ somagopāḥ / adveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devā dhatta rayim asme suvīram //
analyzed: astāvi agniḥ narām su śevaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ ṛṣibhiḥ soma gopāḥ   a dveṣe dyāvāpṛthivī huvema devāḥ dhatta rayim asme su vīram
translated: Agni, the very gracious, Vaiṣvânara, has been sung by the Ṛṣis, the guardians of Soma. To Heaven and Earth, free from all anger, let us pray. O Gods, grant us riches with brave sons.

original: samidhāgniṃ duvasyata ghṛtair bodhayatātithim / āsmin havyā juhotana //
analyzed: samidhā agnim duvasyata ghṛtaiḥ bodhayata atithim    ā asmin havyā juhotana
translated: With fuel serve ye Agni, with ghee wake ye the guest. Offer oblations in him.

original: ud u tvā viśve devā agne bharantu cittibhiḥ / sa no bhava śivas tvam supratīko vibhāvasuḥ //
analyzed: ud u tvā viśve devāḥ agne bharantu cittibhiḥ   sa naḥ bhava śivaḥ tvam su pratīkaḥ vibhāvasuḥ
translated: May all the Gods bear thee up, O Agni, with their thoughts. Be thou auspicious to us, of fair countenance, shining with wealth.

original: pred agne jyotiṣmān yāhi śivebhir arcibhiṣ ṭvam / bṛhadbhir bhānubhir bhāsan mā himsīs tanvā prajāḥ //
analyzed: pra id agne jyotiṣmān yāhi śivebhiḥ arcibhiḥ tvam    bṛhadbhiḥ bhānubhiḥ bhāsan mā himsīḥ tanvā prajāḥ
translated: Go forward, O Agni, radiant, with thy flames that bring bliss. Shining with thy great beams, harm not the people with thy body.

original: akrandad agni stanayann iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihad vīrudhaḥ samañjan / sadyo jajñāno vi hīm iddho akhyad ā rodasī bhānunā bhāty antaḥ //
analyzed: akrandat agniḥ stanayan iva dyauḥ kṣāmā rerihat vīrudhaḥ samañjan    sadyas jajñānaḥ vi hi īm iddhaḥ akhyat ā rodasī bhānunā bhāti antar
translated: Agni hath cried like Dyaus that thunders, shaking the earth, and causing the plants to shoot forth. As soon as born, well-kindled, he hath shone forth. Within the two world-halves he shineth with his light.

original: praprāyam agnir bharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryo na rocate bṛhad bhāḥ / abhi yaḥ pūruṃ pṛtanāsu tasthau dīdāya daivyo atithiḥ śivo naḥ //
analyzed: pra pra ayam agniḥ bharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryaḥ na rocate bṛhat bhās    abhi yaḥ pūrum pṛtanāsu tasthau dīdāya daivyaḥ atithiḥ śivaḥ naḥ
translated: Agni of Bharata I glorify, who spreadeth forth, whose light is great as that of Sûrya, Who standeth in the battles for Puru, the heavenly guest, shining, auspicious to us.

original: āpo devīḥ prati gṛbhṇīta bhasmaitat syone kṛṇudhvam surabhā loke / tasmai namantāṃ janayaḥ supatnīr māteva putraṃ bibhṛtāpsv enat //
analyzed: āpaḥ devīḥ prati gṛbhṇīta bhasma etat syone kṛṇudhvam surabhā loke   tasmai namantām janayaḥ su patnīḥ mātā iva putram bibhṛta apsu enat
translated: Ye Waters, receive this ash: make it ready in a pleasant place, in a fair region. To him let the Dames, good wives, bow down: as a mother her son, O ye Waters, bear him up.

original: apsv agne sadhiṣ ṭava sauṣadhīr anu rudhyase / garbhe san jāyase punaḥ //
analyzed: apsu agne sadhiḥ tava sa oṣadhīḥ anu rudhyase   garbhe san jāyase punar
translated: In the Waters, O Agni, is thy home: thou shinest forth among the plants. In the womb thou art born again.

original: garbho asy oṣadhīnāṃ garbho vanaspatīnām / garbho viśvasya bhūtasyāgne garbho apām asi //🔽prasadya bhasmanā yonim apaś ca pṛthivīm agne / samsṛjya mātṛbhiṣ ṭvaṃ jyotiṣmān punar āsadaḥ //
analyzed: garbhaḥ asi oṣadhīnām garbhaḥ vanaspatīnām   garbhaḥ viśvasya bhūtasya agne garbhaḥ apām asi  prasadya bhasmanā yonim apaḥ ca pṛthivīm agne    samsṛjya mātṛbhiḥ tvam jyotiṣmān punar āsadaḥ
translated: Thou art the germ of the plants, the germ of the trees. Thou art the germ of every being, O Agni: thou art the germ of the Waters.🔽Having rested in the womb, in the Waters, on the earth, O Agni, having united with the Mothers, thou hast again sat down, full of light.

original: punar āsadya sadanam apaś ca pṛthivīm agne / śeṣe mātur yathopasthe 'ntar asyām śivatamaḥ //
analyzed: punar āsadya sadanam apaḥ ca pṛthivīm agne    śeṣe mātuḥ yathā upasthe ntar asyām śivatamaḥ
translated: Having again sat down in the womb, in the Waters, on the earth, O Agni, thou liest in the lap of thy Mother, most auspicious within her.

original: punar ūrjā nivartasva punar agna iṣāyuṣā / punar naḥ pāhy amhasaḥ //🔽saha rayyā ni vartasvāgne pinvasva dhārayā / viśvapsnyā viśvatas pari //
analyzed: punar ūrjā nivartasva punar agne iṣā āyuṣā   punar naḥ pāhi amhasaḥ 🔽saha rayyā ni vartasva agne pinvasva dhārayā   / viśvapsnyā viśvatas pari
translated: Return again with strength, return again, O Agni, with life and food. Again do thou deliver us from tribulation.🔽Return with wealth, O Agni: swell with thy stream, on every side with all-sustaining nourishment.

original: bodhā me asya vacaso yaviṣṭha mamhiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvaḥ / pīyati tvo anu tvo gṛṇāti vandāruṣ ṭe tanvaṃ vande agne //
analyzed: bodha me asya vacasaḥ yaviṣṭha mamhiṣṭhasya prabhṛtasya svadhāvas    pīyati tvaḥ anu tvaḥ gṛṇāti vandāruḥ te tanvam vande agne
translated: O most youthful, be thou aware of this my word, O thou of thine own accord most bountiful, of this my hymn of praise. They drink of thee, they sing thy praises. I praise thy body, O Agni.

original: sa bodhi sūrir maghavā vasupate vasudāvan / yuyodhy asmad dveṣāmsi //
analyzed: sa bodhi sūriḥ maghavā vasu pate vasu dāvan   yuyodhi asmat
translated: Be thou a bountiful lord, O bountiful one, O thou who givest wealth, drive our enemies away.

original: viśvakarmaṇe svāhā //
analyzed: viśvakarmaṇe svāhā
translated: To Viśvakarman hail!

original: punas tvādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sam indhatāṃ punar brahmāṇo vasunītha yajñaiḥ / ghṛtena tvaṃ tanvaṃ vardhayasva satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ //
analyzed: punar tvā ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ sam indhatām punar brahmāṇaḥ vasu nītha yajñaiḥ   ghṛtena tvam tanvam vardhayasva satyāḥ santu yajamānasya kāmāḥ
translated: May the Âdityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, again kindle thee; may the Brahmans and the sacrifices again. With ghee increase thy body; true be the sacrificer's desires.

original: apeta vīta vi ca sarpatāto ye 'tra stha purāṇā ye ca nūtanāḥ / adād yamo 'vasānaṃ pṛthivyā akrann imaṃ pitaro lokam asmai //
analyzed: apeta vīta vi ca sarpata atas ye tra stha purāṇāḥ ye ca nūtanāḥ   adāt yamaḥ vasānam pṛthivyāḥ akran imam pitaraḥ lokam asmai
translated: Go away, depart, and creep away from hence, ye that are here, the ancient and the new. Yama hath given a dwelling on the earth; the Fathers have made this world for him.

original: saṃjñānam asi / kāmadharaṇam / mayi te kāmadharaṇaṃ bhūyāt / agner bhasmāsy agneḥ purīṣam asi / cita stha paricita ūrdhvacitaḥ śnayadhvam //
analyzed: saṃjñānam asi   kāma dharaṇam   mayi te kāma dharaṇam bhūyāt   agneḥ bhasma asi agneḥ purīṣam asi   citaḥ stha paricitaḥ ūrdhva citaḥ
translated: Thou art the recognition, the fulfiller of desire. In me be thy fulfilment of desire. Thou art the ashes of Agni, thou art the dust of Agni. Ye are piled, ye are piled around, ye are piled on high; be ye firm.

original: ayam so agnir yasmint somam indraḥ sutaṃ dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ / sahasriṇaṃ vājam atyaṃ na saptim sasavānt sant stūyase jātavedaḥ //
analyzed: ayam saḥ agniḥ yasmin somam indraḥ sutam dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ    sahasriṇam vājam atyam na saptim sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ
translated: This is that Agni in whom Indra hath placed the pressed Soma, rejoicing in his throat. Thee, O all-knowing one, they praise when thou art laden with oblations, as a thousand-winning steed, as a racer.

original: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyāṃ yad oṣadhīṣv apsv ā yajatra / yenāntarikṣam urv ātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānur arṇavo nṛcakṣāḥ //🔽agne divo arṇam acchā jigāsy acchā devām ūciṣe dhiṣṇyā ye / yā rocane parastāt sūryasya yāś cāvastād upatiṣṭhanta āpaḥ //🔽purīṣyāso agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ / juṣantāṃ yajñam adruho 'namīvā iṣo mahīḥ //
analyzed: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyām yat oṣadhīṣu apsu ā yajatra    yena antarikṣam uru ātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānuḥ arṇavaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ  agne divaḥ arṇam acchā jigāsi acchā devām ūciṣe dhiṣṇyāḥ ye   yāḥ rocane parastāt sūryasya yāḥ ca avastāt upatiṣṭhante āpaḥ  purīṣyāsaḥ agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ    juṣantām yajñam adruhaḥ namīvāḥ iṣaḥ mahīḥ
translated: O Agni, the splendour that is in the sky, on earth, in plants, O thou who art to be worshipped in the waters, wherewith thou hast spread out the wide air, that radiance of thine is variegated, like an ocean, O thou who beholdest men.

original: iḍām agne purudamsam saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha / syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //🔽ayaṃ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ / taṃ jānann agna ā rohāthā no vardhayā rayim //
analyzed: iḍām agne purudamsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha   syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme 🔽ayam te yoniḥ ṛtviyaḥ yatas jātaḥ arocathāḥ   tam jānan agne ā roha atha naḥ vardhaya rayim
translated: O Agni, thou goest to the ocean of the sky, to the ocean of the earth, to the ocean of the atmosphere. Thou goest to the ocean of the waters. Thou goest to the ocean of the quarters. Thou goest to the ocean of the world. Thou goest to the ocean of the gods. Thou goest to the ocean of the Rishis. Thou goest to the ocean of the Fathers. Thou goest to the ocean of men. Thou goest to the ocean of the waters. Thou goest to the ocean of the plants. Thou goest to the ocean of the trees. Thou goest to the ocean of the birds. Thou goest to the ocean of the beasts. Thou goest to the ocean of the Gandharvas. Thou goest to the ocean of the Apsarases. Thou goest to the ocean of the gods. Thou goest to the ocean of the quarters. Thou goest to the ocean of the world. Thou goest to the ocean of the sacrifice. Thou goest to the ocean of the oblations. Thou goest to the ocean of the clarified butter. Thou goest to the ocean of the Soma. Thou goest to the ocean of the Havirdhāna. Thou goest to the ocean of the Sadas. Thou goest to the ocean of the Agnidhriya. Thou goest to the ocean of the Gārhapatya. Thou goest to the ocean of the Dakṣiṇā. Thou goest to the ocean of the Sadasya. Thou goest to the ocean of the Hotṛ. Thou goest to the ocean of the Udgātṛ. Thou goest to the ocean of the Brahman. Thou goest to the ocean of the Adhvaryu. Thou goest to the ocean of the Agnīdh. Thou goest to the ocean of the Pratiprasthātṛ. Thou goest to the ocean of the Prastotṛ. Thou go

original: cid asi tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda / paricid asi tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
analyzed: cit asi tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvā sīda   paricit asi tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvā sīda
translated: Thou art the intellect; with that deity, in the manner of Angiras, sit ye firm. Thou art the surrounding intellect; with that deity, in the manner of Angiras, sit ye firm.

original: lokaṃ pṛṇa chidraṃ pṛṇātho sīda dhruvā tvam / indrāgnī tvā bṛhaspatir asmin yonāv asīṣadan //
analyzed: lokam pṛṇa chidram pṛṇa atha u sīda dhruvā tvam indra agnī tvā bṛhaspatiḥ asmin yonau asīṣadan
translated: Fill the space, fill the gap, and sit ye down, ye two, firm. Indra and Agni and Brihaspati have settled thee in this womb.

original: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ   janman devānām viśaḥ triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: These dappled ones, the milkers of his milk, mix the Soma for him, The clans of the gods in the three luminous realms of the sky.

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam rathīnāṃ vājānām satpatiṃ patim //
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim
translated: All the songs have strengthened Indra, who is as vast as the ocean, Best of charioteers among the charioteers, lord of strength, the lord.

original: samitam saṃ kalpethām sampriyau rociṣṇū sumanasyamānau / iṣam ūrjam abhi saṃvasānau //
analyzed: samitam sam kalpethām sampriyau rociṣṇū sumanasyamānau    iṣam ūrjam abhi saṃvasānau
translated: Be ye two alike, be ye two agreeable, shining, well-disposed, Dwelling together for food and strength.

original: saṃ vāṃ manāmsi saṃ vratā sam u cittāny ākaram / agne purīṣyādhipā bhava tvaṃ na iṣam ūrjaṃ yajamānāya dhehi //
analyzed: sam vām sam vratā sam u cittāni ākaram  / agne purīṣya adhipāḥ bhava tvam naḥ iṣam ūrjam yajamānāya dhehi
translated: I have brought together your minds, your vows, and your thoughts. O Agni, lord of the dust, be thou the lord. Bestow food and strength on the sacrificer.

original: agne tvaṃ purīṣyo rayimān puṣṭimām asi / śivāḥ kṛtvā diśaḥ sarvāḥ yonim ihāsadaḥ //
analyzed: agne tvam purīṣyaḥ rayimān puṣṭimān asi  / śivāḥ kṛtvā diśaḥ sarvāḥ yonim iha āsadaḥ
translated: O Agni, thou art the lord of the dust, full of wealth, and nourishing. Having made all the quarters propitious, sit thou down in this womb.

original: bhavataṃ naḥ samanasau sacetasāv arepasau / mā yajñam himsiṣṭaṃ mā yajñapatiṃ jātavedasau śivau bhavatam adya naḥ //
analyzed: bhavatam naḥ samanasau sacetasau arepasau mā yajñam himsiṣṭam mā yajñapatim jātavedasau śivau bhavatam adya naḥ
translated: Be ye two-minded, of one heart, free from all stain, O ye two. Injure not our sacrifice, nor the lord of the sacrifice, O ye two Jâtavedas. Be gracious unto us this day.

original: māteva putraṃ pṛthivī purīṣyam agnim sve yonāv abhār ukhā / tāṃ viśvair devair ṛtubhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ prajāpatir viśvakarmā vi muñcatu //🔽asunvantam ayajamānam iccha stenasyetyām anv ihi taskarasya / anyam asmad iccha sā ta ityā namo devi nirṛte tubhyam astu //
analyzed: mātā iva putram pṛthivī purīṣyam agnim sve yonau abhāḥ ukhā  / tām viśvaiḥ devaiḥ ṛtubhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ prajāpatiḥ viśva karmā vi muñcatu  / a sunvantam a yajamānam iccha stenasya ityām anu ihi taskarasya   anyam asmat iccha sā te ityā namaḥ devi nirṛte tubhyam astu
translated: As a mother her son, the Earth hath borne in her own womb Purîshya Agni, the Ukhâ. May Prajâpati, the all-creator, set her free, in unison with all the Gods and with the seasons.🔽Seek him who pours not out libations, who performs no sacrifices, follow the track of the thief, of the robber. Seek him elsewhere than from us. To thee be homage, O Goddess Nirriti.

original: namaḥ su te nirṛte tigmatejo 'yasmayaṃ vi cṛtā bandham etam / yamena tvaṃ yamyā saṃvidānottame nāke adhi rohayainam //
analyzed: namaḥ su te nirṛte tigma tejaḥ yasmayam vi cṛta bandham etam                    adhi rohaya enam
translated: Homage to thee, O Nirriti, whose splendour is intense. Loosen this fetter of iron. In unison with Yama and Yami raise him up to the highest vault of heaven.

original: yasyās te ghora āsan juhomy eṣāṃ bandhānām avasarjanāya / yāṃ tvā jano bhūmir iti pramandate nirṛtiṃ tvāhaṃ pari veda viśvataḥ //
analyzed: yasyāḥ te ghore āsan juhomi eṣām bandhānām avasarjanāya    yām tvā janaḥ bhūmiḥ iti pramandate nirṛtim tvā aham pari veda viśvatas
translated: To her whose terrible power I invoke, to loosen these bonds and set him free, whom the people call by the name of Earth, I, Nirriti, know thee on every side.

original: yaṃ te devī nirṛtir ābabandha pāśaṃ grīvāsv avicṛtyam / taṃ te vi ṣyāmy āyuṣo na madhyād athaitaṃ pitum addhi prasūtaḥ //
analyzed: yam te devī nirṛtiḥ ābabandha pāśam grīvāsu a vicṛtyam    tam te vi syāmi āyuṣaḥ na madhyāt atha etam pitum addhi prasūtaḥ
translated: I loosen from the midst of thy life. Now eat thou, set free, this food.

original: namo bhūtyai yedaṃ cakāra //
analyzed: namaḥ bhūtyai yā idam cakāra
translated: Homage to Bhuti, who hath made this.

original: niveśanaḥ saṃgamano vasunāṃ viśvā rūpābhi caṣṭe śacībhiḥ / deva iva savitā satyadharmendro na tasthau samare pathīnām //
analyzed: niveśanaḥ saṃgamanaḥ vasunām viśvā rūpā abhi caṣṭe śacībhiḥ    devaḥ iva savitā satya dharmā indraḥ na tasthau samare pathīnām
translated: The dweller in the house, the gatherer of treasures, with his powers beholds all forms. Like the god Savitar of true laws, Indra standeth not in the midst of the paths.

original: sīrā yuñjanti kavayo yugā vi tanvate pṛthak / dhīrā deveṣu sumnayā //🔽yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanudhvaṃ kṛte yonau vapateha bījam / girā ca śruṣṭiḥ sabharā asan no nedīya it sṛṇyaḥ pakvam eyāt //
analyzed: sīrā yuñjanti kavayaḥ yugā vi tanvate pṛthak dhīrāḥ deveṣu sumnayā  yunakta sīrā vi yugā tanudhvam kṛte yonau vapata iha bījam    girā ca śruṣṭiḥ sabharāḥ asat naḥ nedīyaḥ id sṛṇyaḥ pakvam eyāt
translated: The wise yoke the ploughs, they stretch the yokes apart, the sages in the worship of the Gods.🔽Yoke the ploughs, stretch the yokes asunder, in the prepared womb sow ye the seed. May the response of song be easy for us, may the reaper come soon, when the corn is ripe.

original: śunam su phālā vi kṛṣantu bhūmim śunaṃ kīnāśā abhi yantu vāhaiḥ / śunāsīrā haviṣā tośamānā supippalā oṣadhīḥ kartanāsme //
analyzed: śunam su phālāḥ vi kṛṣantu bhūmim śunam kīnāśāḥ abhi yantu vāhaiḥ    śunāsīrā haviṣā tośamānā su pippalāḥ oṣadhīḥ kartana asme
translated: May the ploughers till the ground well for us, may the car-warriors advance with their cars. May Suna and Sira, pleased with our offering, make the plants full of good berries for us.

original: ghṛtena sītā madhunā sam ajyatāṃ viśvair devair anumatā marudbhiḥ / ūrjasvatī payasā pinvamānāsmānt sīte payasābhyā vavṛtsva //
analyzed: ghṛtena sītā madhunā sam ajyatām viśvaiḥ devaiḥ anumatā marudbhiḥ     ūrjasvatī payasā pinvamānā asmān sīte payasā abhyā vavṛtsva
translated: With ghee let the furrow be anointed, with honey, approved by all the Gods, by the Maruts. Rich in food, swelling with milk, O furrow, turn thou unto us with milk.

original: lāṅgalaṃ pavīravat suśevam somapitsaru / tad ud vapati gām aviṃ prapharvyaṃ ca pīvarīṃ prasthāvad rathavāhanam //
analyzed: lāṅgalam pavīravat su śevam somapitsaru    tat ud vapati gām avim prapharvyam ca pīvarīm prasthāvat rathavāhanam  /
translated: The plough, the best of ploughs, very gracious, longing for Soma, that he lifts up, the cow, the sheep, the fat she-calf, the chariot with its team.

original: kāmaṃ kāmadughe dhukṣva mitrāya varuṇāya ca / indrāyāśvibhyāṃ pūṣṇe prajābhya oṣadhībhyaḥ //
analyzed: kāmam kāmadughe dhukṣva mitrāya varuṇāya ca     indrāya aśvibhyām pūṣṇe prajābhyaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ
translated: Milk as thou wilt, O thou that yieldest all desires, for Mitra, for Varuna, for Indra, for the Asvins, for Pusan, for offspring, for plants.

original: vi mucyadhvam aghnyā devayānā aganma tamasas pāram asya jyotir āpāma //
analyzed: vi mucyadhvam aghnyāḥ deva yānāḥ aganma tamasaḥ pāram asya jyotiḥ āpāma
translated: Be ye unyoked, ye that are not to be slain, we have reached the further end of this darkness, we have come to the light of the waters.

original: sajūr abdo ayavobhiḥ sajūr uṣā aruṇībhiḥ sajoṣasāv aśvinā damsobhiḥ sajūḥ sūra etaśena sajūr vaiśvānara iḍayā ghṛtena svāhā //
analyzed: sajūs abdaḥ ayavobhiḥ sajūs uṣāḥ aruṇībhiḥ sajoṣasau aśvinā damsobhiḥ sajūs sūraḥ etaśena sajūs vaiśvānaraḥ iḍayā ghṛtena svāhā
translated: The year is in unison with the plants, Dawn is in unison with the red-hued ones, the Asvins are in unison with the teeth, the sun is in unison with the swift one, Vaisvânara is in unison with the oblation and ghee. Svâhâ!

original: yā oṣadhīḥ pūrvā jātā devebhyas triyugaṃ purā / manai nu babhrūṇām aham śataṃ dhāmāni sapta ca //
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ pūrvāḥ jātāḥ devebhyaḥ tri yugam purā   nu babhrūṇām aham śatam dhāmāni sapta ca
translated: Those plants which sprang up first, three ages ago, for the gods, I, O mind, of the brown ones, of the hundred powers and seven.

original: śataṃ vo amba dhāmāni sahasram uta vo ruhaḥ / adhā śatakratvo yūyam imaṃ me agadaṃ kṛta //
analyzed: śatam vaḥ amba dhāmāni sahasram uta vaḥ ruhaḥ    adha śata kratvaḥ yūyam imam me agadam kṛta
translated: A hundred are your homes, O Plant, and a thousand are your roots. Now do ye all, ye who have a hundred powers, make this man well for me.
