original: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvaṃ puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ / aśvā iva sajitvarīr vīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ //🔽oṣadhīr iti mātaras tad vo devīr upa bruve / saneyam aśvaṃ gāṃ vāsa ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa //
analyzed: oṣadhīḥ prati modadhvam puṣpavatīḥ prasūvarīḥ   aśvāḥ iva sa jitvarīḥ vīrudhaḥ pārayiṣṇvaḥ  oṣadhīḥ iti mātaraḥ tat vaḥ devīḥ upa bruve   saneyam aśvam gām vāsaḥ ātmānam tava pūruṣa
translated: Rejoice in the plants, in those that are full of flowers and full of sap, in the herbs that are victorious like horses, that are able to save.🔽O plants, I address you thus, O ye mothers, O ye goddesses. May I win a horse, a cow, a garment, and myself, O ye, O men.

original: aśvatthe vo niṣadanaṃ parṇe vo vasatiṣ kṛtā / gobhāja it kilāsatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam //
analyzed: aśvatthe vaḥ niṣadanam parṇe vaḥ vasatiḥ kṛtā   go bhājaḥ id kila asatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam
translated: The fig tree is your seat, in the leaf your dwelling is made. Ye are indeed sharers of the cow, when ye restore the man to life.

original: yatrauṣadhīḥ samagmata rājānaḥ samitāv iva / vipraḥ sa ucyate bhiṣag rakṣohāmīvacātanaḥ //
analyzed: yatra oṣadhīḥ samagmata rājānaḥ samitau iva    vipraḥ saḥ ucyate bhiṣaj rakṣaḥ hā amīva cātanaḥ
translated: Where the plants have come together like kings to a solemn sacrifice, he is called the wise physician, the slayer of demons, the remover of disease.

original: aśvāvatīm somāvatīm ūrjayantīm udojasam / āvitsi sarvā oṣadhīr asmā ariṣṭatātaye //
analyzed: aśvāvatīm somāvatīm ūrjayantīm udojasam     āvitsi sarvāḥ oṣadhīḥ asmai ariṣṭatātaye
translated: I have obtained all the plants, the plant that has a horse, the plant that has Soma, the plant that gives increase, the plant that gives strength, for the safety of this man.

original: uc chuṣmā oṣadhīnāṃ gāvo goṣṭhād iverate / dhanam saniṣyantīnām ātmānaṃ tava pūruṣa //
analyzed: ud śuṣmāḥ oṣadhīnām gāvaḥ goṣṭhāt iva īrate  / dhanam saniṣyantīnām ātmānam tava pūruṣa
translated: The strength of the plants goes forth like cows from the stable, the wealth of those that are to be gained, the self of thee, O man.

original: iṣkṛtir nāma vo mātātho yūyam stha niṣkṛtīḥ / sīrāḥ patatriṇī sthana yad āmayati niṣkṛtha //
analyzed: iṣkṛtiḥ nāma vaḥ mātā atha u yūyam stha niṣkṛtīḥ   sīrāḥ patatriṇīḥ sthana yat āmayati niṣkṛtha
translated: Your mother is named Destruction, and you are the destroyers. You are the ploughers, the winged ones: destroy whatever disease there is.

original: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhā stena iva vrajam akramuḥ / oṣadhīḥ prācucyavur yat kiṃ ca tanvo rapaḥ //
analyzed: ati viśvāḥ pariṣṭhāḥ stenaḥ iva vrajam akramuḥ    oṣadhīḥ prācucyavuḥ yat kim ca tanvaḥ rapaḥ
translated: They have passed over all the obstacles, like a thief over a fold of cattle. The plants have shaken off whatever disease there is in the body.

original: yad imā vājayann aham oṣadhīr hasta ādadhe / ātmā yakṣmasya naśyati purā jīvagṛbho yathā //
analyzed: yat imāḥ vājayan aham oṣadhīḥ haste ādadhe    ātmā yakṣmasya naśyati purā jīva gṛbhaḥ yathā
translated: When I, rejoicing in this strength, take the plants in my hand, the soul of the disease perishes, even as one seized by the living one.

original: yasyauṣadhīḥ prasarpathāṅgamaṅgaṃ paruṣparuḥ / tato yakṣmaṃ vi bādhadhva ugro madhyamaśīr iva //
analyzed: yasya oṣadhīḥ prasarpatha aṅgam aṅgam paruḥ paruḥ tatas yakṣmam vi bādhadhve ugraḥ madhyamaśīḥ iva
translated: Wherewith ye creep, O plants, to every limb, to every joint, from thence drive ye away the disease, as a strong man would drive away the feeble.

original: sākaṃ yakṣma prapata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā / sākaṃ vātasya dhrājyā sākaṃ naśya nihākayā //
analyzed: sākam yakṣma prapata cāṣeṇa kikidīvinā    sākam vātasya dhrājyā sākam naśya nihākayā
translated: Fall down together, O disease, with the crow and the kikivi bird. Fall down together with the rushing of the wind, fall down together with the thunderbolt.

original: anyā vo anyām avatv anyānyasyā upāvata / tāḥ sarvāḥ saṃvidānā idaṃ me prāvatā vacaḥ //
analyzed: anyā vaḥ anyām avatu anyā anyasyai upāvata    tāḥ sarvāḥ saṃvidānāḥ idam me prāvata vacaḥ
translated: Let one of you speak for another, and let another speak for you. All of you together, agree to this speech of mine.

original: yāḥ phalinīr yā aphalā apuṣpā yāś ca puṣpiṇīḥ / bṛhaspatiprasūtās tā no muñcantv amhasaḥ //
analyzed: yāḥ phalinīḥ yāḥ aphalāḥ apuṣpāḥ yāḥ ca puṣpiṇīḥ    bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ tāḥ naḥ muñcantu amhasaḥ
translated: Those that are fruitful, those that are fruitless, those that are flowerless, and those that are flowery, may they, urged on by Brihaspati, deliver us from tribulation.

original: muñcantu mā śapathyād atho varuṇyād uta / atho yamasya paḍvīśāt sarvasmād devakilviṣāt //
analyzed: muñcantu mā śapathyāt atha u varuṇyāt uta  / atha u yamasya paḍvīśāt sarvasmāt deva kilviṣāt
translated: And from Yama's fetter, and from every sin against the Gods.🔽The plants that fall from heaven, the plants that creep along the ground,

original: avapatantīr avadan diva oṣadhayas pari / yaṃ jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ //
analyzed: avapatantīḥ avadan divaḥ oṣadhayaḥ pari   yam jīvam aśnavāmahai na sa riṣyāti pūruṣaḥ
translated: The man whom we shall find alive shall not be harmed by poison.🔽Of all the many plants, O plant, that have a hundred different forms,

original: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīr bahvīḥ śatavicakṣaṇāḥ / tāsām asi tvam uttamāraṃ kāmāya śam hṛde //
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma rājñīḥ bahvīḥ śata vicakṣaṇāḥ   tāsām asi tvam uttamā aram kāmāya śam hṛde
translated: Thou art the best, O plant, for this man's desire and for his heart's delight.🔽The plants that have their home in earth, O plant, that have a hundred forms,

original: yā oṣadhīḥ somarājñīr viṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīm anu / bṛhaspatiprasūtā asyai saṃ datta vīryam //
analyzed: yāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma rājñīḥ viṣṭhitāḥ pṛthivīm anu  / bṛhaspati prasūtāḥ asyai sam datta vīryam
translated: Urged on by Brihaspati, give thou to this man strength and vigour.🔽The plants that hear this speech of mine, the plants that are afar from us,

original: yāś cedam upaśṛṇvanti yāś ca dūraṃ parāgatāḥ / sarvāḥ saṃgatya vīrudho 'syai saṃ datta vīryam //
analyzed: yāḥ ca idam upaśṛṇvanti yāḥ ca dūram parāgatāḥ   sarvāḥ saṃgatya vīrudhaḥ syai sam datta vīryam
translated: All plants, come hither, gather round, and give to this man strength and vigour.🔽Let not the digger suffer harm, nor you whom I dig up for him.

original: mā vo riṣat khanitā yasmai cāhaṃ khanāmi vaḥ / dvipāc catuṣpād asmākam sarvam astv anāturam //
analyzed: mā vaḥ riṣat khanitā yasmai ca aham khanāmi vaḥ    dvipād catuṣpād asmākam sarvam astu anāturam
translated: Let all be well with bipeds and with quadrupeds that belong to us.🔽The plants have all agreed together, the plants that have King Soma for their Lord:

original: oṣadhayaḥ sam avadanta somena saha rājñā / yasmai kṛṇoti brāhmaṇas tam rājan pārayāmasi //
analyzed: oṣadhayaḥ sam avadanta somena saha rājñā   yasmai kṛṇoti brāhmaṇaḥ tam rājan pārayāmasi
translated: The man whom the Brâhmana shall make to drink, him, O King, we will deliver from thy power.

original: nāśayitrī balāsasyārśasa upacitām asi / atho śatasya yakṣmāṇāṃ pākāror asi nāśanī //
analyzed: nāśayitrī balāsasya arśasaḥ upacitām asi    atha u śatasya yakṣmāṇām pākāroḥ asi nāśanī
translated: Thou art the destroyer of disease, thou art the healer of the piles that have grown great. And thou art the destroyer of the hundred kinds of phthisis.

original: tvāṃ gandharvā akhanams tvām indras tvāṃ bṛhaspatiḥ / tvām oṣadhe somo rājā vidvān yakṣmād amucyata //
analyzed: tvām gandharvāḥ akhanam tvām indraḥ tvām bṛhaspatiḥ   tvām oṣadhe somaḥ rājā vidvān yakṣmāt amucyata
translated: The Gandharvas dug thee up, Indra dug thee up, and Brihaspati. The wise King Soma, O Plant, was freed from phthisis by thee.

original: sahasva me arātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ / sahasva sarvaṃ pāpmānam sahamānāsy oṣadhe //
analyzed: sahasva me arātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ   sahasva sarvam pāpmānam sahamānā asi oṣadhe
translated: Overcome my enemies, overcome those who fight against me. Overcome all evil, O Plant, thou who art overcome thyself.

original: dīrghāyus ta oṣadhe khanitā yasmai ca tvā khanāmy aham / atho tvaṃ dīrghāyur bhūtvā śatavalśā vi rohatāt //
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ te oṣadhe khanitā yasmai ca tvā khanāmi aham   atha u tvam dīrgha āyuḥ bhūtvā śata valśā vi rohatāt
translated: Long-lived be he, O Plant, who digs thee up, and he for whom I dig thee up. And thou, becoming long-lived, grow up with a hundred shoots.

original: tvam uttamāsy oṣadhe tava vṛkṣā upastayaḥ / upastir astu so 'smākaṃ yo asmām abhidāsati //
analyzed: tvam uttamā asi oṣadhe tava vṛkṣāḥ upastayaḥ   upastiḥ astu saḥ smākam yaḥ asmām abhidāsati
translated: Thou art the best of plants, the trees are thy supporters. Let him be a supporter of us who hates us.

original: mā mā himsīj janitā yaḥ pṛthivyā yo vā divam satyadharmā vyānaṭ / yaś cāpaś candrāḥ prathamo jajāna kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
analyzed: mā mā himsīt janitā yaḥ pṛthivyāḥ yaḥ vā divam satya dharmā vyānaṭ    yaḥ ca apaḥ candrāḥ prathamaḥ jajāna kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Let not the creator of the earth, or he who, true to law, hath spread out the sky, or he who first begat the waters and the moon, let not that God be wroth with us. To what God shall we offer with oblation?

original: abhyā vartasva pṛthivi yajñena payasā saha / vapāṃ te agnir iṣito arohat //
analyzed: abhyā vartasva pṛthivi yajñena payasā saha    vapām te agniḥ iṣitaḥ arohat
translated: Turn hither, O thou Earth, with sacrifice and with the milk. Agni, the Priest, hath mounted on thy lap.

original: agne yat te śukraṃ yac candraṃ yat pūtaṃ yac ca yajñiyam / tad devebhyo bharāmasi //
analyzed: agne yat te śukram yat candram yat pūtam yat ca yajñiyam    tat devebhyaḥ bharāmasi
translated: We bring to the gods.

original: iṣam ūrjam aham ita ādam ṛtasya yoniṃ mahiṣasya dhārām / ā mā goṣu viśatvā tanūṣu jahāmi sedim anirām amīvām //
analyzed: iṣam ūrjam aham itas ādam ṛtasya yonim mahiṣasya dhārām    ā mā goṣu viśatu ā tanūṣu jahāmi sedim anirām amīvām
translated: I have taken food and strength, the source of truth, the stream of the great bull. May it enter into me in the bodies of the cows. I cast off sluggishness and incurable disease.🔽O Agni, your fame, your vigor, your greatness, your shining flames, O you of bright splendor,

original: agne tava śravo vayo mahi bhrājante arcayo vibhāvaso / bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājam ukthyaṃ dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave //
analyzed: agne tava śravaḥ vayaḥ mahi bhrājante arcayaḥ vibhāvaso    bṛhadbhāno śavasā vājam ukthyam dadhāsi dāśuṣe kave
translated: O you of great light, you bestow strength worthy of praise by your power on the worshipper, O wise one.🔽You, O Agni, with pure radiance, bright radiance, and perfect radiance, rise up with your light,

original: pāvakavarcāḥ śukravarcā anūnavarcā ud iyarṣi bhānunā / putro mātarā vicarann upāvasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe //
analyzed: pāvaka varcāḥ śukra varcāḥ anūna varcāḥ ud iyarṣi bhānunā    putraḥ mātarā vicaran upa avasi pṛṇakṣi rodasī ubhe
translated: Wandering between your two mothers, you approach. You fill both the heaven and the earth.🔽O son of strength, O all-knower, be delighted with our good praises, being placed (in the altar) by our thoughts.

original: ūrjo napāj jātavedaḥ suśastibhir mandasva dhītibhir hitaḥ / tve iṣaḥ saṃ dadhur bhūrivarpasaś citrotayo vāmajātāḥ //
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napāt jātavedaḥ su śastibhiḥ mandasva dhītibhiḥ hitaḥ    tve iṣaḥ sam bhūri varpasaḥ citra ūtayaḥ vāma jātāḥ
translated: In you they have placed food of abundant power, having variegated offerings and born of good things.

original: irajyann agne prathayasva jantubhir asme rāyo amartya / sa darśatasya vapuṣo vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi sānasiṃ kratum //
analyzed: irajyan agne prathayasva jantubhiḥ asme rāyaḥ amartya    sa darśatasya vapuṣaḥ vi rājasi pṛṇakṣi sānasim kratum
translated: Ruling, O Agni, extend yourself among the people. Give us wealth, O immortal one. You shine forth with the form of the visible one. You fill (your worshippers) with unfailing power.

original: iṣkartāram adhvarasya pracetasaṃ kṣayantam rādhaso mahaḥ / rātiṃ vāmasya subhagāṃ mahīm iṣaṃ dadhāsi sānasim rayim //
analyzed: iṣkartāram adhvarasya pracetasam kṣayantam rādhasaḥ mahaḥ    rātim vāmasya subhagām mahīm iṣam dadhāsi sānasim rayim
translated: You bestow the bounteous gift of good things, abundant food, and ample wealth that brings all blessings.🔽The people have set forth the truthful, mighty, all-seeing Agni as their chief for happiness.

original: ṛtāvānaṃ mahiṣaṃ viśvadarśatam agnim sumnāya dadhire puro janāḥ / śrutkarṇam saprathastamaṃ tvā girā daivyaṃ mānuṣā yugā //
analyzed: ṛtāvānam mahiṣam viśva darśatam agnim sumnāya dadhire puras janāḥ     śrut karṇam saprathastamam tvā girā daivyam mānuṣāḥ yugā
translated: O Agni, with our song we have chosen you, the most famous, the most widely renowned, the one with ears to hear, the divine one, the one who unites the generations of men.

original: ā pyāyasva sam etu te viśvataḥ soma vṛṣṇyam / bhavā vājasya saṃgathe //
analyzed: ā pyāyasva sam etu te viśvatas soma vṛṣṇyam   bhava vājasya saṃgathe
translated: Be full, O Soma, let all thy strength come to thee. Be thou the gatherer of food.

original: saṃ te payāmsi sam u yantu vājāḥ saṃ vṛṣṇyāny abhimātiṣāhaḥ / āpyāyamāno amṛtāya soma divi śravāmsy uttamāni dhiṣva //
analyzed: sam te payāmsi sam u yantu vājāḥ sam vṛṣṇyāni abhimātiṣāhaḥ    āpyāyamānaḥ amṛtāya soma divi śravāmsi uttamāni dhiṣva
translated: Let thy milk and thy strength come together, O thou who conquerest in battle. Being strengthened, O Soma, for immortality, set thou in the sky the highest fame.

original: ā pyāyasva madintama soma viśvebhir amśubhiḥ / bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe //🔽ā te vatso mano yamat paramāc cit sadhasthāt / agne tvāṃkāmayā girā //
analyzed: ā pyāyasva madintama soma viśvebhiḥ amśubhiḥ   bhava naḥ su śravastamaḥ sakhā vṛdhe  ā te vatsaḥ manaḥ yamat paramāt cit sadhasthāt    agne tvāṃkāmayā girā
translated: Be thou full, O most gladdening Soma, with all thy rays. Be thou our most famous friend for increase.🔽O calf, let my mind come to thee even from the highest place. O Agni, I long for thee with a longing heart.

original: tubhyaṃ tā aṅgirastama viśvāḥ sukṣitayaḥ pṛthak / agne kāmāya yemire //
analyzed: tubhyam tāḥ aṅgirastama viśvāḥ su kṣitayaḥ pṛthak   agne kāmāya yemire
translated: To thee, O most Angiras-like one, all the well-built abodes, O Agni, have turned to be desired.

original: agniḥ priyeṣu dhāmasu kāmo bhūtasya bhavyasya / samrāḍ eko vi rājati //
analyzed: agniḥ priyeṣu dhāmasu kāmaḥ bhūtasya bhavyasya samrāj ekaḥ vi rājati
translated: he alone rules as emperor.

original: mayi gṛhṇāmy agre agnim rāyaspoṣāya suprajāstvāya suvīryāya / mām u devatāḥ sacantām //
analyzed: mayi gṛhṇāmi agre agnim rāyaspoṣāya suprajāstvāya su vīryāya   mām u devatāḥ sacantām
translated: I first receive Agni for the increase of wealth, for good offspring, for good heroism. May the deities attend upon me.

original: apāṃ pṛṣṭham asi yonir agneḥ samudram abhitaḥ pinvamānam / vardhamāno mahām ā ca puṣkare divo mātrayā varimṇā prathasva //
analyzed: apām pṛṣṭham asi yoniḥ agneḥ samudram abhitas pinvamānam   vardhamānaḥ mahām ā ca puṣkare divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathasva
translated: You are the back of the waters, the womb of Agni, the ocean swelling on all sides. Increasing, on the great lotus, extend with the measure of the sky.

original: brahma jajñānaṃ prathamaṃ purastād vi sīmataḥ suruco vena āvaḥ / sa budhnyā upamā asya viṣṭhāḥ sataś ca yonim asataś ca vi vaḥ //
analyzed: brahma jajñānam prathamam purastāt vi sīmataḥ su rucaḥ venaḥ āvaḥ    sa budhnyāḥ upamāḥ asya viṣṭhāḥ sataḥ ca yonim asataḥ ca vi var
translated: The Brahman, born first, in the beginning, from the boundary, Vena has brought forth the very radiant ones. His abodes are the deep ones. He has the womb of the existent and the non-existent.

original: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ sam avartatāgre bhūtasya jātaḥ patir eka āsīt / sa dādhāra pṛthivīṃ dyām utemāṃ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
analyzed: hiraṇya garbhaḥ sam avartata agre bhūtasya jātaḥ patiḥ ekaḥ āsīt    sa dādhāra pṛthivīm dyām uta imām kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Hiranyagarbha, in the beginning, was born, the lord of what was created. He supported this earth and this sky. To which god shall we offer with oblation?

original: drapsaś caskanda pṛthivīm anu dyām imaṃ ca yonim anu yaś ca pūrvaḥ / samānaṃ yonim anu saṃcarantaṃ drapsaṃ juhomy anu sapta hotrāḥ //
analyzed: drapsaḥ caskanda pṛthivīm anu dyām imam ca yonim anu yaḥ ca pūrvaḥ samānam yonim anu saṃcarantam drapsam juhomi anu sapta hotrāḥ
translated: The drop has fallen on the earth, on the sky, on this womb and on the former one. I offer the drop that moves along the common womb, along the seven oblations.

original: namo 'stu sarpebhyo ye ke ca pṛthivīm anu / ye antarikṣe ye divi tebhyaḥ sarpebhyo namaḥ //🔽yā iṣavo yātudhānānāṃ ye vā vanaspatīms tu / ye vāvaṭeṣu śerate tebhyaḥ sarpebhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ stu sarpebhyaḥ ye ke ca pṛthivīm anu ye antarikṣe ye divi tebhyaḥ sarpebhyaḥ namaḥ  yāḥ iṣavaḥ yātudhānānām ye vā tu ye vā avaṭeṣu śerate tebhyaḥ sarpebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to the serpents, whatever they are, that move upon the earth, or in the atmosphere, or in the sky: to all these serpents homage!🔽Homage to the arrows of the demons, or those that are in the trees, or those that lie in the holes: to all these serpents homage!

original: ye vāmī rocane divo ye vā sūryasya raśmiṣu / yeṣām apsu sadas kṛtaṃ tebhyaḥ sarpebhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: ye vāmī rocane divaḥ ye vā sūryasya raśmiṣu   yeṣām apsu sadaḥ kṛtam tebhyaḥ sarpebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to those that are in the luminous region of the sky, or those that are in the rays of the sun, or those that have their abode in the waters: to all these serpents homage!

original: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṃ na pṛthvīṃ yāhi rājevāmavām ibhena / tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṃ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ //🔽tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ / tapūmṣy agne juhvā pataṅgān asaṃdito vi sṛja viṣvag ulkāḥ //
analyzed: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitim na pṛthvīm yāhi rājā iva amavām ibhena  / tṛṣvīm anu prasitim drūṇānaḥ stāsi vidhya rakṣasaḥ tapiṣṭhaiḥ  tava bhramāsaḥ āśuyā patanti anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ   tapūmṣi agne juhvā pataṅgān a saṃditaḥ vi sṛja viṣvak ulkāḥ
translated: Make thy path wide and extended: go, like a king, on thy errand, with thy steed. Stretching thy long tongue out, O Agni, pierce the Rākshasas with thy sharpest flames.🔽Thy flames fall swiftly with their light: touch with thy tongue, O thou that art bright. With thy tongue, O Agni, cast thy moths, thy flying insects, into thy mouth: unconfined, cast thy sparks on every side.

original: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ / yo no dūre aghaśamso yo anty agne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt //
analyzed: prati spaśaḥ vi sṛja tūrṇitamaḥ bhava pāyuḥ viśaḥ asyāḥ adabdhaḥ   yaḥ naḥ dūre agha śamsaḥ yaḥ anti agne mākir ṭe vyathiḥ ā dadharṣīt
translated: O Agni, most rapid, cast off thy spies: be thou the unfailing guardian of this people's homes. Let not the mischief-maker, whether near or far away, prevail against thee.

original: ud agne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrām oṣatāt tigmahete / yo no arātim samidhāna cakre nīcā taṃ dhakṣy atasaṃ na śuṣkam //
analyzed: ud agne tiṣṭha prati ā tanuṣva ni amitrām oṣatāt tigma hete    yaḥ naḥ arātim samidhāna cakre nīcā tam dhakṣi atasam na śuṣkam
translated: Rise up, O Agni, stretch thyself forth: lay thou our foes beneath thee, O thou of keen dart. Him who hath wrought us evil, consume thou, O God, as stubble, consume him utterly.

original: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny agne / ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṃ jāmim ajāmiṃ pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn //
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ bhava prati vidhya adhi asmat āviḥ kṛṇuṣva daivyāni agne    ava sthirā tanuhi yātu jūnām jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn
translated: Rise up erect, pierce through our enemies, O Agni: reveal the heavenly lights. Rend thou the firmset works of fiends: destroy the kinsman and the stranger foe.

original: agneṣ ṭvā tejasā sādayāmi //
analyzed: agneḥ tvā tejasā sādayāmi
translated: I settle thee with the lustre of Agni.

original: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam / apām retāmsi jinvati //
analyzed: agniḥ mūrdhā divaḥ kakud patiḥ pṛthivyāḥ ayam   apām retāmsi jinvati
translated: Thou art the head of Agni, the summit of the sky, the lord of this earth. He quickeneth the seed of the waters.

original: indrasya tvaujasā sādayāmi //
analyzed: indrasya tvā ojasā sādayāmi
translated: I settle thee with the strength of Indra.

original: bhuvo yajñasya rajasaś ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ / divi mūrdhānaṃ dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ jihvām agne cakriṣe havyavāham //
analyzed: bhuvaḥ yajñasya rajasaḥ ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ    divi mūrdhānam dadhiṣe svarṣām jihvām agne cakriṣe havya vāham
translated: Thou who leadest the sacrifice and the region of the sky, where thou rejoicest with the auspicious teams, thou settest thy head in the sky, thy tongue, O Agni, thou makest ready for the offering.

original: dhruvāsi dharuṇāstṛtā viśvakarmaṇā / mā tvā samudra ud badhīn mā suparṇo 'vyathamānā pṛthivīṃ dṛmha //
analyzed: dhruvā asi dharuṇā āstṛtā viśvakarmaṇā    mā tvā samudraḥ ud badhīt mā suparṇaḥ vyathamānā pṛthivīm dṛmha
translated: Thou art firm, covered with a support, made by Viśvakarman. Let not the ocean overflood thee, let not the eagle. Firm on the earth, be thou unshaken.

original: prajāpatiṣ ṭvā sādayatv apā pṛṣṭhe samudrasyeman / vyacasvatīṃ prathasvatīṃ prathasva pṛthivy asi //
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ tvā sādayatu apāḥ pṛṣṭhe samudrasya eman    vyacasvatīm prathasvatīm prathasva pṛthivī asi
translated: May Prajapati place thee on the back of the waters, in the ocean, expansive, far-extending. Spread thee out; thou art the earth.

original: bhūr asi bhūmir asy aditir asi viśvadhāyā viśvasya bhuvanasya dhartrī / pṛthivīṃ yaccha pṛthivīṃ dṛmha pṛthivīṃ mā himsīḥ //
analyzed: bhūḥ asi bhūmiḥ asi aditiḥ asi viśva dhāyāḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya dhartrī   pṛthivīm yaccha pṛthivīm dṛmha pṛthivīm mā himsīḥ
translated: Thou art the earth, thou art the ground, thou art Aditi, the supporter of all the world. Protect the earth, support the earth, harm not the earth.

original: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāyodānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya / agniṣ ṭvābhi pātu mahyā svastyā chardiṣā śaṃtamena tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
analyzed: viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya vyānāya udānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya    agniḥ tvā abhi pātu mahyā svastyā chardiṣā śaṃtamena tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvā sīda
translated: For all the breath, the in-breath, the out-breath, the through-breath, the up-breath, for support, for movement, may Agni protect thee with great welfare, with the most auspicious shelter. In the manner of Angiras, be firm with that deity.🔽Growing from joint to joint, from shoot to shoot, around and around,

original: kāṇḍātkāṇḍāt prarohantī paruṣaḥparuṣas pari / evā no dūrve pra tanu sahasreṇa śatena ca //
analyzed: kāṇḍāt kāṇḍāt prarohantī paruṣaḥ paruṣaḥ pari  / eva naḥ dūrve pra tanu sahasreṇa śatena ca
translated: So, O Durva, spread for us with a thousand and a hundred.

original: yā śatena pratanoṣi sahasreṇa virohasi / tasyās te devīṣṭake vidhema haviṣā vayam //
analyzed: yā śatena pratanoṣi sahasreṇa virohasi  / tasyāḥ te devi iṣṭake vidhema haviṣā vayam
translated: With a hundred thou spreadest, with a thousand thou growest. Of thee, O Goddess, we will duly offer with our oblation.🔽Those thy rays, O Agni, which in the sun spread through the sky with their beams,

original: yās te agne sūrye ruco divam ātanvanti raśmibhiḥ / tābhir no adya sarvābhī ruce janāya nas kṛdhi //
analyzed: yāḥ te agne sūrye rucaḥ divam ātanvanti raśmibhiḥ   tābhiḥ naḥ adya sarvābhiḥ ruce janāya naḥ kṛdhi
translated: With all of them today, O Agni, make thou radiance for our people.

original: yā vo devāḥ sūrye ruco goṣv aśveṣu yā rucaḥ / indrāgnī tābhiḥ sarvābhī rucaṃ no dhatta bṛhaspate //
analyzed: yāḥ vaḥ devāḥ sūrye rucaḥ goṣu aśveṣu yāḥ rucaḥ  / indra agnī tābhiḥ sarvābhiḥ rucam naḥ dhatta bṛhaspate
translated: Your lights, O Gods, that are in the sun, your lights that are in the kine, your lights that are in horses, Indra-Agni, with all these lights bestow upon us light, O Br̥ihaspati.

original: virāḍ jyotir adhārayat / svarāḍ jyotir adhārayat / prajāpatiṣ ṭvā sādayatu pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyā jyotiṣmatīm / viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāya viśvaṃ jyotir yaccha / agniṣ ṭe 'dhipatis tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
analyzed: virāj jyotiḥ adhārayat   svarāj jyotiḥ adhārayat    prajāpatiḥ tvā sādayatu pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyāḥ jyotiṣmatīm   viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya vyānāya viśvam jyotiḥ yaccha    agniḥ te dhipatiḥ tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvā sīda
translated: The Viraj hath upheld the light. The Svarâj hath upheld the light. Let Prajâpati place thee on the back of the earth, full of light. For all expiration, all inspiration, all cross-breathing, give all light. Thy lord is Agni. With that deity, like Angiras, sit firm.

original: madhuś ca mādhavaś ca vāsantikāv ṛtū agner antaḥśleṣo 'si kalpetāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthaṅ nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ / ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime vāsantikāv ṛtū abhikalpamānā indram iva devā abhisaṃ viśantu tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //
analyzed: madhuḥ ca mādhavaḥ ca vāsantikau ṛtū agneḥ antaḥśleṣaḥ si  / kalpetām dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthak nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ   ye agnayaḥ samanasaḥ ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime vāsantikau ṛtū abhikalpamānāḥ indram iva devāḥ abhisam viśantu tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruve sīdatam  /
translated: Madhu and Mâdhava, the two spring-months, are the two inner lips of Agni. Thou art the union of heaven and earth. Be the waters and plants in harmony. Be the fires in harmony. For the highest homage, of one mind, to the fires that are between heaven and earth, let the two spring-months, in harmony, enter Indra as the Gods enter him. With that deity, like Angiras, sit ye firm.

original: aṣāḍhāsi sahamānā sahasvārātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ / sahasravīryāsi sā mā jinva //
analyzed: aṣāḍhā asi sahamānā sahasva arātīḥ sahasva pṛtanāyataḥ    sahasra vīryā asi sā mā jinva
translated: Thou art the invincible, the conqueror. Conquer the foes, conquer those who fight against us. Thou art possessed of a thousand powers. Do thou impel me.

original: madhu vātā ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ / mādhvīr naḥ santv oṣadhīḥ //
analyzed: madhu vātāḥ ṛtāyate madhu kṣaranti sindhavaḥ   mādhvīḥ naḥ santu oṣadhīḥ
translated: Honey to the wind that blows according to the rule, honey the rivers pour. May the plants be full of honey for us.

original: madhu naktam utoṣaso madhumat pārthivam rajaḥ / madhu dyaur astu naḥ pitā //
analyzed: madhu naktam uta uṣasaḥ madhumat pārthivam rajaḥ   madhu dyauḥ astu naḥ pitā
translated: Honey the nights and mornings, honey the earthly atmosphere, honey be our father Heaven.

original: madhumān no vanaspatir madhumām astu sūryaḥ / mādhvīr gāvo bhavantu naḥ //
analyzed: madhumān naḥ vanaspatiḥ madhumān astu sūryaḥ   mādhvīḥ gāvaḥ bhavantu naḥ
translated: May the tree be full of honey for us, may the sun be full of honey for us. May our cows be full of honey for us.

original: apāṃ gambhant sīda mā tvā sūryo 'bhi tāpsīn māgnir vaiśvānaraḥ / acchinnapatrāḥ prajā anuvīkṣasvānu tvā divyā vṛṣṭiḥ sacatām //
analyzed: apām sīda mā tvā sūryaḥ bhi tāpsīt mā agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ    a chinna patrāḥ prajāḥ anuvīkṣasva anu tvā divyā vṛṣṭiḥ sacatām
translated: Sit in the depth of the waters, let not the sun scorch thee, let not Agni Vaiśvānara. Look on the people with unbroken leaves. Let the heavenly rain attend on thee.

original: trīnt samudrānt sam asṛpat svargān apāṃ patir vṛṣabha iṣṭakānām / purīṣaṃ vasānaḥ sukṛtasya loke tatra gaccha yatra pūrve paretāḥ //
analyzed: trīn samudrān sam asṛpat svargān apām patiḥ vṛṣabhaḥ iṣṭakānām    purīṣam vasānaḥ sukṛtasya loke tatra gaccha yatra pūrve paretāḥ
translated: He hath entered the three heavenly oceans, the lord of the waters, the bull of the bricks. Wearing the dust in the world of good deeds, go thither where the former ones have gone.

original: mahī dyauḥ pṛthivī ca na imaṃ yajñaṃ mimikṣatām / pipṛtāṃ no bharīmabhiḥ //
analyzed: mahī dyauḥ pṛthivī ca naḥ imam yajñam mimikṣatām    pipṛtām naḥ bharīmabhiḥ
translated: May the great Heaven and Earth anoint this sacrifice of ours. Fill us with your sustaining powers.

original: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yato vratāni paspaśe / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ karmāṇi paśyata yatas vratāni paspaśe      indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: Behold the works of Viṣṇu, whence he hath looked on the observances, Indra's companion in the rite.

original: dhruvāsi dharuṇeto jajñe prathamam ebhyo yonibhyo adhi jātavedaḥ / sa gāyatryā triṣṭubhānuṣṭubhā ca devebhyo havyaṃ vahatu prajānan //
analyzed: dhruvā asi dharuṇā itas jajñe prathamam ebhyaḥ yonibhyaḥ adhi jātavedaḥ    sa gāyatryā triṣṭubhā anuṣṭubhā ca devebhyaḥ havyam vahatu prajānan
translated: Thou art Dhruva, born from the firm, first from these places of birth, O all-knower. May he, knowing, carry the offering to the gods with the Gayatri, Tristubh, and Anustubh metres.

original: iṣe rāye ramasva sahase dyumna ūrje apatyāya / samrāḍ asi svarāḍ asi sārasvatau tvotsau prāvatām //
analyzed: iṣe rāye ramasva sahase dyumne ūrje apatyāya    samrāj asi svarāj asi sārasvatau tvā utsau prāvatām
translated: Delight yourself in food, wealth, strength, splendor, energy, and offspring. You are the emperor, you are the self-ruling. May the two Sarasvat springs carry you away.

original: agne yukṣvā hi ye tavāśvāso deva sādhavaḥ / araṃ vahanti manyave //
analyzed: agne yukṣvā hi ye tava āśvāsaḥ deva sādhavaḥ   aram vahanti manyave
translated: O Agni, yoke those good horses of yours, O god, that carry you swiftly to your wrath.

original: yukṣvā hi devahūtamām aśvām agne rathīr iva / ni hotā pūrvyaḥ sadaḥ //
analyzed: yukṣvā hi deva hūtamām aśvām agne rathīḥ iva    ni hotā pūrvyaḥ sadaḥ
translated: Yoke those that are best invoked by the gods, O Agni, like a charioteer his horses. Sit as the ancient Hotar.

original: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ / ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhye agneḥ //
analyzed: samyak sravanti saritaḥ na dhenāḥ antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ  / ghṛtasya dhārāḥ abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayaḥ vetasaḥ madhye agneḥ
translated: The streams flow straight, like milkings, purified within the heart and mind. I behold the streams of ghee, the golden reed in the midst of Agni.

original: ṛce tvā ruce tvā bhāse tvā jyotiṣe tvā / abhūd idaṃ viśvasya bhuvanasya vājinam agner vaiśvānarasya ca //
analyzed: ṛce tvā ruce tvā bhāse tvā jyotiṣe tvā    abhūt idam viśvasya bhuvanasya vājinam agneḥ vaiśvānarasya ca
translated: To the Rc, to the lustre, to the radiance, to the light, to thee. This has become the strong one of the whole world, of Agni Vaisvānara.

original: agnir jyotiṣā jyotiṣmān rukmo varcasā varcasvān / sahasradā asi sahasrāya tvā //
analyzed: agniḥ jyotiṣā jyotiṣmān rukmaḥ varcasā varcasvān sahasra dāḥ asi sahasrāya tvā
translated: Agni, the luminous one with light, the golden one with splendor, you are the giver of a thousand. For a thousand, to you!

original: ādityaṃ garbhaṃ payasā sam aṅdhi sahasrasya pratimāṃ viśvarūpam / pari vṛṅdhi harasā mābhi mamsthāḥ śatāyuṣaṃ kṛṇuhi cīyamānaḥ //
analyzed: ādityam garbham payasā sam aṅdhi sahasrasya pratimām viśva rūpam    pari vṛṅdhi harasā mā abhi mamsthāḥ śata āyuṣam kṛṇuhi cīyamānaḥ
translated: Unite with milk the child of Aditi, the type of a thousand, of all forms. Encompass him with thy flame, touch him not with thy heat. Make him a hundred years old, as thou art piled.🔽The impulse of the wind, the navel of Varuna, the horse born in the midst of the waters,

original: vātasya jūtiṃ varuṇasya nābhim aśvaṃ jajñānam sarirasya madhye / śiśuṃ nadīnām harim adribudhnam agne mā himsīḥ parame vyoman //
analyzed: vātasya jūtim varuṇasya nābhim aśvam jajñānam sarirasya madhye   śiśum nadīnām harim adri budhnam agne mā himsīḥ parame vyoman
translated: The child of the rivers, the tawny one with a mountain for his abode, O Agni, harm him not in the highest heaven.

original: ajasram indum aruṣaṃ bhuraṇyum agnim īḍe pūrvacitti namobhiḥ / sa parvabhir ṛtuśaḥ kalpamāno gāṃ mā himsīr aditiṃ virājam //
analyzed: ajasram indum aruṣam bhuraṇyum agnim īḍe pūrvacitti namobhiḥ    sa parvabhiḥ ṛtuśas kalpamānaḥ gām mā himsīḥ aditim virājam
translated: The ceaseless, ruddy, active Indu, I praise with homage, Agni, the first to think of him. He, measured by the joints in due season,🔽Harm not the cow, Aditi, the all-ruling, the ewe of Tvashtar, the navel of Varuna, the sheep born from the highest realm of space,

original: varūtrīṃ tvaṣṭur varuṇasya nābhim aviṃ jajñānām rajasaḥ parasmāt / mahīm sāhasrīm asurasya māyām agne mā himsīḥ parme vyoman //
analyzed: varūtrīm tvaṣṭuḥ varuṇasya nābhim avim jajñānām rajasaḥ parasmāt    mahīm sāhasrīm asurasya māyām agne mā himsīḥ parme vyoman
translated: The great thousandfold illusion of the Asura. O Agni, harm him not in the highest heaven.🔽The Agni who was born from Agni, from the heat of the earth or of the sky around,

original: yo 'gnir agner adhiy ajāyata śokāt pṛthivyā uta vā divas pari / yena prajā viśvakarmā jajāna tam agne heḍaḥ pari te vṛṇaktu //
analyzed: yaḥ gniḥ agneḥ adhiy ajāyata śokāt pṛthivyāḥ uta vā divaḥ pari   yena prajāḥ viśvakarmā jajāna tam agne heḍaḥ pari te vṛṇaktu
translated: By whom Vishvakarman begat offspring, may that deception of thine, O Agni, pass him by.

original: citraṃ devānām ud agād anīkaṃ cakṣur mitrasya varuṇasyāgneḥ / āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūrya ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca //
analyzed: citram devānām ud agāt anīkam cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya agneḥ     āprāḥ dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam sūryaḥ ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca
translated: The wondrous form of the Gods hath risen up, the eye of Mitra, Varuna, and Agni. It hath filled the heaven and earth and the air. The sun is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.

original: imaṃ mā himsīr dvipādaṃ paśum sahasrākṣo medhāya cīyamānaḥ / mayuṃ paśuṃ medham agne juṣasva tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda //
analyzed: imam mā himsīḥ dvipādam paśum sahasra akṣaḥ medhāya cīyamānaḥ    mayum paśum medham agne juṣasva tena cinvānaḥ tanvaḥ ni sīda
translated: Do not injure this two-footed animal, the thousand-eyed one, being piled for wisdom. Accept the animal, the antelope, as the sacrificial essence, O Agni. Building up your bodies with that, sit down.

original: mayuṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
analyzed: mayum te śuc ṛcchatu yam dviṣmaḥ tam te śuc ṛcchatu
translated: Let the dart of the antelope strike him whom we hate. Let the dart of the antelope strike him.

original: imaṃ mā himsīr ekaśaphaṃ paśuṃ kanikradaṃ vājinaṃ vājineṣu / gauram āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda //
analyzed: imam mā himsīḥ eka śapham paśum kanikradam vājinam vājineṣu  / gauram āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānaḥ tanvaḥ ni sīda
translated: Do not injure this one-hoofed animal, the neighing steed in the contests for booty. I assign to you the wild bull. Building up your bodies with that, sit down.

original: gauraṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
analyzed: gauram te śuc ṛcchatu yam dviṣmaḥ tam te śuc ṛcchatu
translated: Let the dart of the bull strike him whom we hate. Let the dart of the bull strike him.

original: imam sāhasram śatadhāram utsaṃ vyacyamānam sarirasya madhye / ghṛtaṃ duhānām aditiṃ janāyāgne mā himsīḥ parame vyoman //
analyzed: imam sāhasram śata dhāram utsam vyacyamānam sarirasya madhye    ghṛtam duhānām aditim janāya agne mā himsīḥ parame vyoman
translated: This thousand-streamed, hundred-flowing spring, extended in the midst of the body, pouring ghee for the people, O Agni, do not injure in the highest heaven.

original: gavayam āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda / gavayaṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
analyzed: gavayam āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānaḥ tanvaḥ ni sīda  / gavayam te śuc ṛcchatu yam dviṣmaḥ tam te śuc ṛcchatu
translated: I point out to thee the wild gavaya. Gathering with it thy limbs, sit thee down. Let thy pain reach the gavaya. Let thy pain reach him whom we hate.

original: imam ūrṇāyuṃ varuṇasya nābhiṃ tvacaṃ paśūnāṃ dvipadāṃcatuṣpadām / tvaṣṭuḥ prajānāṃ prathamaṃ janitram agne mā himsīḥ parame vyoman //
analyzed: imam ūrṇāyum varuṇasya nābhim tvacam paśūnām dvipadām catuṣpadām    tvaṣṭuḥ prajānām prathamam janitram agne mā himsīḥ parame vyoman
translated: This wool-tufted one, the navel of Varuna, the skin of the two-footed and four-footed animals, the first birthplace of Tvashtar's creatures, O Agni, do not injure in the highest heaven.

original: uṣṭram āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda / uṣṭraṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
analyzed: uṣṭram āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānaḥ tanvaḥ ni sīda    uṣṭram te śuc ṛcchatu yam dviṣmaḥ tam te śuc ṛcchatu
translated: I point out to thee the wild camel. Gathering with it thy limbs, sit thee down. Let thy pain reach the camel. Let thy pain reach him whom we hate.

original: ajo hy agner ajaniṣṭa śokāt so apaśyaj janitāram agre / tena devā devatām agram āyams tena roham āyann upa medhyāsaḥ / śarabham āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānas tanvo ni ṣīda / śarabhaṃ te śug ṛcchatu yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //
analyzed: ajaḥ hi agneḥ ajaniṣṭa śokāt saḥ apaśyat janitāram agre   tena devāḥ devatām agram āyan tena roham āyan upa medhyāsaḥ   śarabham āraṇyam anu te diśāmi tena cinvānaḥ tanvaḥ ni sīda      śarabham te śuc ṛcchatu yam dviṣmaḥ tam te śuc ṛcchatu
translated: The goat was born from Agni's flame. He first beheld his progenitor. By him the gods attained the highest godhead. By him the holy ones attained the world of heaven. I point out to thee the wild sharabha. Gathering with it thy limbs, sit thee down. Let thy pain reach the sharabha. Let thy pain reach him whom we hate.

original: tvaṃ yaviṣṭha dāśuṣo nṛmḥ pāhi śṛṇudhī giraḥ / rakṣā tokam uta tmanā //
analyzed: tvam yaviṣṭha dāśuṣaḥ pāhi śṛṇudhi giraḥ    rakṣa tokam uta tmanā
translated: O youngest, protect the man who offers, listen to the songs. Guard the offspring even by thyself.

original: apāṃ tvemant sādayāmi / apāṃ tvodmant sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā bhasmant sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā jyotiṣi sādayāmi / apāṃ tvāyane sādayāmi / arṇave tvā sadane sādayāmi / samudre tvā sadane sādayāmi / sarire tvā sadane sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā kṣaye sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā sadhiṣi sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā sadane sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā sadhasthe sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā yonau sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā purīṣe sādayāmi / apāṃ tvā pāthasi sādayāmi / gāyatreṇa tvā chandasā sādayāmi / traiṣṭubhena tvā chandasā sādayāmi / jāgatena tvā chandasā sādayāmi / ānuṣṭubhena tvā chandasā sādayāmi / pāṅktena tvā chandasā sādayāmi //
analyzed: apām tvā eman sādayāmi   apām tvā udman sādayāmi    apām tvā bhasman sādayāmi   apām tvā jyotiṣi sādayāmi   apām tvā ayane sādayāmi   arṇave tvā sadane sādayāmi  samudre tvā sadane sādayāmi  sarire tvā sadane sādayāmi   apām tvā kṣaye sādayāmi   apām tvā sadhiṣi sādayāmi   apām tvā sadane sādayāmi    apām tvā sadhasthe sādayāmi    apām tvā yonau sādayāmi   apām tvā purīṣe sādayāmi    apām tvā pāthasi sādayāmi               /
translated: I settle thee in the depth of the waters. I settle thee in the flood of the waters. I settle thee in the foam of the waters. I settle thee in the light of the waters. I settle thee in the path of the waters. I settle thee in the abode of the waters. I settle thee in the abode of the ocean. I settle thee in the abode of the stream. I settle thee in the resting-place of the waters. I settle thee in the womb of the waters. I settle thee in the dust of the waters. I settle thee in the path of the waters. I settle thee with the Gayatri metre. I settle thee with the Tristubh metre. I settle thee with the Jagati metre. I settle thee with the Anustubh metre. I settle thee with the Pankti metre.

original: ayaṃ puro bhuvaḥ / tasya prāṇo bhauvanāyaḥ / vasantaḥ prāṇyanaḥ / gāyatrī vāsantī / gāyatryai gāyatram / gāyatrād upāmśuḥ / upāmśos trivṛt / trivṛto rathantaram / vasiṣṭha ṛṣiḥ / prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayā prāṇaṃ gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ //
analyzed: ayam puras bhuvaḥ   tasya prāṇaḥ bhauvanāyaḥ   vasantaḥ prāṇyanaḥ   gāyatrī vāsantī    gāyatryai gāyatram    gāyatrāt upāmśuḥ    upāmśoḥ trivṛt    trivṛtaḥ rathantaram   vasiṣṭhaḥ ṛṣiḥ   prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā prāṇam gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ
translated: This is the world of the East. Its life is the world-creating. The spring is the life-giving. The Gayatri is the spring-born. From the Gayatri the Gayatri metre. From the Gayatri metre the Upamsu. From the Upamsu the Trivrt. From the Trivrt the Rathantara. The Rishi is Vasishtha. With thee taken by Prajapati I take life for offspring.

original: ayaṃ dakṣiṇā viśvakarmā / tasya mano vaiśvakarmaṇam / grīṣmo mānasaḥ / triṣṭub graiṣmī / triṣṭubhaḥ svāram / svārād antaryāmaḥ / antaryāmāt pañcadaśaḥ / pañcadaśād bṛhat / bharadvāja ṛṣiḥ / prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayā mano gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ //
analyzed: ayam dakṣiṇā viśvakarmā   tasya manaḥ vaiśvakarmaṇam   grīṣmaḥ mānasaḥ triṣṭubh graiṣmī   triṣṭubhaḥ svāram   svārāt antaryāmaḥ   antaryāmāt pañcadaśaḥ   pañcadaśāt bṛhat    bharadvājaḥ ṛṣiḥ   prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā manaḥ gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ
translated: This is the world of the South, the all-creating. Its mind is the all-creating. The summer is the mind-born. The Tristubh is the summer-born. From the Tristubh the Svaram. From the Svaram the Antaryama. From the Antaryama the Pañc-dasa. From the Pañc-dasa the Brihat. The Rishi is Bharadvaja. With thee taken by Prajapati I take mind for offspring.

original: ayaṃ paścād viśvavyacāḥ / tasya cakṣur vaiśvavyacasam / varṣāś cākṣuṣyaḥ / jagatī vārṣī / jagatyā ṛksamam / ṛksamāc chukraḥ / śukrāt saptadaśaḥ / saptadaśād vairūpam / jamadagnir ṛṣiḥ / prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayā cakṣur gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ //
analyzed: ayam paścāt viśvavyacāḥ   tasya cakṣuḥ vaiśvavyacasam   varṣāḥ cākṣuṣyaḥ   jagatī vārṣī   jagatyāḥ ṛksamam   ṛksamāt śukraḥ   śukrāt saptadaśaḥ    saptadaśāt vairūpam    jamadagniḥ ṛṣiḥ   prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā cakṣuḥ gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ
translated: This is the one on the west, the all-embracing. Its eye is all-embracing. The rainy season is the eye's. The Jagati is the rainy season's. From the Jagati comes the Ṛk-measure. From the Ṛk-measure comes the Shukra. From the Shukra comes the Saptadaśa. From the Saptadaśa comes the Vairūpa. The sage is Jamadagni. With you taken by Prajapati, I take the eye for offspring.

original: idaṃ uttarāt svaḥ / tasya śotram sauvam / śarac chrautrī / anuṣṭup śāradī / anuṣṭubha aiḍam / aiḍān manthī / manthina ekavimśaḥ / ekavimśād vairājam / viśvāmitra ṛṣiḥ / prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayā śrotraṃ gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ //
analyzed: idam uttarāt svar   tasya śotram sauvam   śarad śrautrī   anuṣṭubh śāradī   anuṣṭubhaḥ aiḍam   aiḍāt manthī    manthinaḥ ekavimśaḥ   ekavimśāt vairājam    viśvāmitraḥ ṛṣiḥ   prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā śrotram gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ
translated: This is the one on the north, the heavenly. Its ear is heavenly. The autumn is the ear's. The Anustubh is the autumn's. From the Anustubh comes the Aindri. From the Aindri comes the Manthin. From the Manthin comes the Ekavimsa. From the Ekavimsa comes the Vairaja. The sage is Visvamitra. With you taken by Prajapati, I take the ear for offspring.

original: iyaṃ upari matiḥ / tasyai vāṅ mātyā / hemanto vācyaḥ / paṅktir haimantī / paṅktyai nidhanavat / nidhanavata āgrayaṇaḥ / āgrayaṇāt triṇavatrayastrimśau / triṇavatrayastrimśābhyām śākvararaivate / viśvakarma ṛṣiḥ / prajāpatigṛhītayā tvayā vācaṃ gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ / lokaṃ pṛṇa chidraṃ pṛṇātho sīda dhruvā tvam / indrāgnī tvā bṛhaspatir asmin yonāv asīṣadan //
analyzed: iyam upari matiḥ tasyai vāc mātyā   hemantaḥ vācyaḥ paṅktiḥ haimantī   paṅktyai nidhanavat    nidhanavataḥ āgrayaṇaḥ   āgrayaṇāt triṇava trayastrimśau   triṇava trayastrimśābhyām śākvara raivate    viśvakarmā ṛṣiḥ prajāpati gṛhītayā tvayā vācam gṛhṇāmi prajābhyaḥ   lokam pṛṇa chidram pṛṇa atha u sīda dhruvā tvam     indra agnī tvā bṛhaspatiḥ asmin yonau asīṣadan  /
translated: This is the higher thought. Its mother is speech. The winter is to be spoken of. The Paṅkti is the winter. For the Paṅkti, the Nidhanavat. From the Nidhanavat, the Āgrayana. From the Āgrayana, the Triṇava and Trayastriṃśa. From the Triṇava and Trayastriṃśa, the Śākvara and Raivata. The sage is Viśvakarman. With you taken by Prajāpati, I take speech for the people. Fill the world, fill the gap, and sit firm. Indra, Agni, and Brhaspati have seated you in this womb.🔽Those dappled ones, the Suddohas, churn the Soma for him,

original: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ   janman devānām viśaḥ triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: The clans of the gods at the birth of the gods, in the three luminous realms of the sky.🔽All the songs have increased Indra, who is vast as the ocean,

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam rathīnāṃ vājānām satpatiṃ patim //
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim
translated: The best of charioteers, the lord of lords of strength.🔽Firmly placed, with a firm foundation, you are firm. Sit in a firm place with goodness. Accepting the first banner of the fire,

original: dhruvakṣitir dhruvayonir dhruvāsi dhruvaṃ yonim ā sīda sādhuyā / ukhyasya ketuṃ prathamaṃ juṣāṇā / aśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: dhruva kṣitiḥ dhruva yoniḥ dhruvā asi dhruvam yonim ā sīda sādhuyā    ukhyasya ketum prathamam juṣāṇā   aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: May the two Adhvaryus, the Ashvins, seat you here.

original: kulāyinī ghṛtavatī puraṃdhiḥ syone sīda sadane pṛthivyāḥ / abhi tvā rudrā vasavo gṛṇantv imā brahma pīpihi saubhagāya //
analyzed: kulāyinī ghṛtavatī puraṃdhiḥ syone sīda sadane pṛthivyāḥ    abhi tvā rudrāḥ vasavaḥ gṛṇantu imā brahma pīpihi saubhagāya
translated: The nest-builder, the rich in ghee, the woman, sit on the earth's seat, O auspicious one. Let the Rudras and Vasus sing to thee. O Brahman, grow for good fortune.

original: aśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here.

original: svair dakṣair dakṣapiteha sīda devānām sumne bṛhate raṇāya / pitevaidhi sūnava ā suśevā svāveśā tanvā saṃ viśasva //
analyzed: svaiḥ dakṣaiḥ dakṣa pitā iha sīda devānām sumne bṛhate raṇāya   pitā iva edhi sūnave ā su śevā su āveśā tanvā sam viśasva
translated: O son of Daksha, sit here with thy own powers, for the great bliss of the gods, for joy. Be like a father to thy sons, O very gracious one, enter with thy own body.

original: aśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here.

original: pṛthivyāḥ purīṣam asy apso nāma tāṃ tvā viśve abhi gṛṇantu devāḥ / stomapṛṣṭhā ghṛtavatīha sīda prajāvad asme darviṇā yajasva //
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ purīṣam asi apsaḥ nāma tām tvā viśve abhi gṛṇantu devāḥ   stoma pṛṣṭhā ghṛtavatī iha sīda prajāvat asme darviṇā yajasva
translated: Thou art the dust of the earth, named water. Let all the gods sing over thee. Sit here with a hymn for thy back, rich in ghee. Worship with us, O ladle, for the sake of offspring.

original: aśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here.

original: adityās tvā pṛṣṭhe sādayāmy antarikṣasya dhartrīṃ viṣṭambhanīṃ diśāmadhipatnīṃ bhuvanānām ūrmir drapso apām asi viśvakarmā ta ṛṣiḥ //
analyzed: adityāḥ tvā pṛṣṭhe sādayāmi antarikṣasya dhartrīm viṣṭambhanīm diśām adhipatnīm bhuvanānām ūrmiḥ drapsaḥ apām asi viśvakarmā te ṛṣiḥ
translated: I settle thee on the back of Aditi, the supporter of the atmosphere, the upholder of the quarters, the lady of the worlds. Thou art the wave, the drop of the waters. Viśvakarman is thy sage.

original: aśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: May the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here.

original: śukraś ca śuciś ca graiṣmāv ṛtū agner antaḥśleṣo 'si kalpetāṇ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthaṅ nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ / ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime graiṣmāv ṛtū abhikalpamānā indram iva devā abhisaṃ viśantu tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //🔽sajūr ṛtubhiḥ sajūr vidhābhiḥ sajūr devaiḥ sajūr devair vayonādhair agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāyāśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //🔽sajūr ṛtubhiḥ sajūr vidhābhiḥ sajūr vasubhiḥ sajūr devair vayonādhair agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāyāśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: śukraḥ ca śuciḥ ca graiṣmau ṛtū agneḥ antaḥśleṣaḥ u si kalpetāṇ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthak nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ   ye agnayaḥ samanasaḥ ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime graiṣmau ṛtū abhikalpamānāḥ indram iva devāḥ abhisam viśantu tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruve sīdatam  sajūs ṛtubhiḥ sajūs vidhābhiḥ sajūs devaiḥ sajūs devaiḥ vayonādhaiḥ agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāya aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā  sajūs ṛtubhiḥ sajūs vidhābhiḥ sajūs vasubhiḥ sajūs devaiḥ vayonādhaiḥ agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāya aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: The two seasons of summer, Sukra and Sucis, are the inner lining of Agni. Thou art the inner lining. Be thou in harmony with heaven and earth. Be the waters in harmony. Be the plants in harmony. Be the fires in harmony. For preeminence, of one mind, the fires which are between heaven and earth, the two summer seasons in harmony, let them enter into Indra as the gods into the deity, with that deity, like Angiras, sit ye firm.🔽In unison with the seasons, in unison with the ordinances, in unison with the gods, in unison with the gods who support life, for thee to Agni Vaisvānara, the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, let them settle thee here.🔽In unison with the seasons, in unison with the ordinances, in unison with the Vasus, in unison with the gods who support life, for thee to Agni Vaisvānara, the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, let them settle thee here.

original: sajūr ṛtubhiḥ sajūr vidhābhiḥ sajū rudraiḥ sajūr devair vayonādhair agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāyāśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: sajūs ṛtubhiḥ sajūs vidhābhiḥ sajūs rudraiḥ sajūs devaiḥ vayonādhaiḥ agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāya aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: In unison with the seasons, in unison with the ordinances, in unison with the Rudras, in unison with the gods who support life, for thee to Agni Vaisvānara, the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, let them settle thee here.

original: sajūr ṛtubhiḥ sajūr vidhābhiḥ sajūr ādityaiḥ sajūr devair vayonādhair agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāyāśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: sajūs ṛtubhiḥ sajūs vidhābhiḥ sajūs ādityaiḥ sajūs devaiḥ vayonādhaiḥ agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāya aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: With the seasons, with the ordinances, with the Âdityas, with the gods who support life, for Agni Vaisvânara, may the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here.

original: sajūr ṛtubhiḥ sajūr vidhābhiḥ sajūr viśvair devaiḥ sajūr devair vayonādhair agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāyāśvinādhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā //
analyzed: sajūs ṛtubhiḥ sajūs vidhābhiḥ sajūs viśvaiḥ devaiḥ sajūs devaiḥ vayonādhaiḥ agnaye tvā vaiśvānarāya aśvinā adhvaryū sādayatām iha tvā
translated: With the seasons, with the ordinances, with the All-gods, with the gods who support life, for Agni Vaisvânara, may the two Asvins, the Adhvaryus, settle thee here.

original: prāṇaṃ me pāhi / apānaṃ me pāhi / vyānaṃ me pāhi / cakṣur ma urvyā vi bhāhi / śrotraṃ me ślokaya / apaḥ pinva / oṣadhīr jinva / dvipād ava / catuṣpāt pāhi / divo vṛṣṭim eraya //
analyzed: prāṇam me pāhi   apānam me pāhi   vyānam me pāhi   cakṣuḥ me urvyā vi bhāhi   śrotram me ślokaya   apaḥ pinva   oṣadhīḥ jinva   dvipād ava   catuṣpād pāhi   divaḥ vṛṣṭim eraya
translated: Protect my out-breathing. Protect my in-breathing. Protect my through-breathing. Shine widely for me, O eye. Make my ear to resound. Make the waters to swell. Animate the plants. Protect the bipeds. Protect the quadrupeds. Send down rain from the sky.

original: mūrdhā vayaḥ prajāpatiś chandaḥ / kṣatraṃ vayo mayaṃdaṃ chandaḥ / viṣṭambho vayo 'dhipatiś chandaḥ / viśvakarmā vayaḥ parameṣṭhī chandaḥ / vasto vayo vivalaṃ chandaḥ / vṛṣṇir vayo viśālaṃ chandaḥ / puruṣo vayas tandraṃ chandaḥ / vyāghro vayo 'nādhṛṣṭaṃ chandaḥ / simho vayaś chadiś chandaḥ / paṣṭhavāḍ vayo bṛhatī chandaḥ / ukṣā vayaḥ kakup chandaḥ / ṛṣabho vayaḥ satobṛhatī chandaḥ //
analyzed: mūrdhā vayaḥ prajāpatiḥ chandaḥ   kṣatram vayaḥ mayaṃdam chandaḥ   viṣṭambhaḥ vayaḥ dhipatiḥ chandaḥ viśvakarmā vayaḥ parameṣṭhī chandaḥ vastaḥ vayaḥ vivalam chandaḥ    vṛṣṇiḥ vayaḥ viśālam chandaḥ   puruṣaḥ vayaḥ tandram chandaḥ   vyāghraḥ vayaḥ nādhṛṣṭam chandaḥ   simhaḥ vayaḥ chadiḥ chandaḥ   paṣṭhavāh vayaḥ bṛhatī chandaḥ    ukṣā vayaḥ kakubh chandaḥ    ṛṣabhaḥ vayaḥ satobṛhatī chanda
translated: The head is the life, Prajapati the metre. The nobility is the life, the Mayanda the metre. The prop is the life, the Adhipati the metre. The all-worker is the life, Parameshthin the metre. The house is the life, the Vibala the metre. The bull is the life, the Vishala the metre. The man is the life, the Tandra the metre. The tiger is the life, the Anadhrishta the metre. The lion is the life, the Shade the metre. The bull is the life, the Brihati the metre. The bull is the life, the Kakup metre. The bull is the life, the Satobrihati metre.

original: anaḍvān vayaḥ paṅktiś chandaḥ / dhenur vayo jagatī chandaḥ / tryavir vayas triṣṭup chandaḥ / dityavāḍ vayo virāṭ chandaḥ / pañcāvir vayo gāyatrī chandaḥ / trivatso vaya uṣṇik chandaḥ / turyavāḍ vayo 'nuṣṭup chandaḥ / lokaṃ pṛṇa chidraṃ pṛṇātho sīda dhruvā tvam / indrāgnī tvā bṛhaspatir asmin yonāv asīṣadan //
analyzed: anaḍvān vayaḥ paṅktiḥ chandaḥ   dhenuḥ vayaḥ jagatī chandaḥ tryaviḥ vayaḥ triṣṭubh chandaḥ   dityavāṭ vayaḥ virāj chandaḥ pañcāviḥ vayaḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ trivatsaḥ vayaḥ uṣṇih chandaḥ   turyavāh vayaḥ nuṣṭubh chandaḥ    lokam pṛṇa chidram pṛṇa atha u sīda dhruvā tvam     indra agnī tvā bṛhaspatiḥ asmin yonau asīṣadan  /
translated: The ox is the life, the Pankti metre. The cow is the life, the Jagati metre. The three-year-old bull is the life, the Tristubh metre. The bull with a split hoof is the life, the Virat metre. The five-year-old bull is the life, the Gayatri metre. The three-year-old bull is the life, the Ushnih metre. The four-year-old bull is the life, the Anustubh metre. Fill the world, fill the gap, and sit firm. Indra, Agni, and Brihaspati have seated thee in this womb.

original: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ   janman devānām viśaḥ triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: The tribes of Gods, in the three luminous realms of heaven.

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam rathīnāṃ vājānām satpatiṃ patim //🔽indrāgnī avyathamānām iṣṭakāṃ dṛmhataṃ yuvam / pṛṣṭhena dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṃ ca vibādhase //
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim  indra agnī a vyathamānām iṣṭakām dṛmhatam yuvam    pṛṣṭhena dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣam ca vibādhase
translated: All songs have magnified Indra, whose greatness is like ocean. Best charioteer of charioteers, the Lord of strength, the Lord of all.🔽O Indra and Agni, ye two make the brick firm and uninjured. With the back thou fillest heaven and earth and spreadest out the wide air.

original: viśvakarmā tvā sādayatv antarikasya pṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīṃ prathasvatīm antarikṣaṃ yacchāntarikṣaṃ dṛmhāntarikṣaṃ mā himsīḥ //
analyzed: viśvakarmā tvā sādayatu antarikasya pṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīm prathasvatīm antarikṣam yaccha antarikṣam dṛmha antarikṣam mā himsīḥ
translated: May Visvakarman settle thee on the back of the atmosphere, wide, expansive. Control the atmosphere. Make the atmosphere firm. Harm not the atmosphere.

original: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāyodānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya //
analyzed: viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya vyānāya udānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya
translated: For all expiration, cross-breathing, inspiration, up-breathing, support, and movement.

original: vāyuṣ ṭvābhi pātu mahyā svastyā chardiṣā śaṃtamena tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
analyzed: vāyuḥ tvā abhi pātu mahyā svastyā chardiṣā śaṃtamena tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvā sīda
translated: May Vâyu guard thee with great welfare, with most healing shelter. In the manner of Angiras be thou firm with that deity.

original: rājñy asi prācī dik / virāḍ asi dakṣiṇā dik / samrāḍ asi praticī dik / svarāḍ asy udīcī dik / adhipatny asi bṛhatī dik //
analyzed: rājñī asi prācī diś   virāj asi dakṣiṇā diś   samrāj asi praticī diś   svarāj asi udīcī diś    adhipatnī asi bṛhatī diś
translated: Thou art the Queen, the eastern region. Thou art the Empress, the southern region. Thou art the Sovereign, the western region. Thou art the Self-ruler, the northern region. Thou art the Lady, the wide region.

original: viśvakarmā tvā sādayatv antarikasya pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīm //
analyzed: viśvakarmā tvā sādayatu antarikasya pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīm
translated: Let Visvakarman settle thee on the back of the atmosphere, full of light.

original: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāya viśvaṃ jyotir yaccha //
analyzed: viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya vyānāya viśvam jyotiḥ yaccha
translated: To all expiration, inspiration, cross-breathing, give all light.

original: vāyuṣ ṭe 'dhipatis tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
analyzed: vāyuḥ te dhipatiḥ tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvā sīda
translated: Vayu is thy overlord. With that deity, in the manner of Angiras, sit firm.

original: nabhaś ca nabhasyaś ca vārṣikāv ṛtū agner antaḥśleṣo 'si kalpetāṇ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthaṅ nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ / ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime vārṣikāv ṛtū abhikalpamānā indram iva devā abhisaṃ viśantu tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //
analyzed: nabhaḥ ca nabhasyaḥ ca vārṣikau ṛtū agneḥ antaḥśleṣaḥ si  kalpetāṭ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthak nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ   ye agnayaḥ samanasaḥ ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime vārṣikau ṛtū abhikalpamānāḥ indram iva devāḥ abhisam viśantu tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruve sīdatam
translated: The rainy seasons Nabhas and Nabhasya are the inner lining of Agni. Be thou kindly disposed. Let the heaven and earth be kindly disposed. Let the waters and plants be kindly disposed. Let the fires be kindly disposed, each one according to his vow, for preeminence. Those fires which are of one mind within heaven and earth, these two rainy seasons, being kindly disposed, let them enter into Indra as the gods (enter) into Agni. With that deity, in the manner of Angiras, sit ye firm.

original: iṣaś corjaś ca śāradāv ṛtū agner antaḥśleṣo 'si kalpetāṇ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthaṅ nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ / ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime śāradāv ṛtū abhikalpamānā indram iva devā abhisaṃ viśantu tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //
analyzed: iṣaḥ ca ūrjaḥ ca śāradau ṛtū agneḥ antaḥśleṣaḥ u si kalpetāṇ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthak nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ   ye agnayaḥ samanasaḥ ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime śāradau ṛtū abhikalpamānāḥ indram iva devāḥ abhisam viśantu tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruve sīdatam
translated: The seasons Autumn and Winter are the two ends of Agni. Thou art the end of Agni. Be ye two united. Be the heavens and earth united. Be the waters and plants united. Be the fires united. For the sake of the highest, of one rite, the fires which are of one mind between the heaven and earth, the two autumn seasons being united, let them enter into Indra as the gods into the deity, with that deity, like Angiras, sit ye firm.

original: āyur me pāhi / prāṇaṃ me pāhi / apānaṃ me pāhi / vyānaṃ me pāhi / cakṣur me pāhi / śrotraṃ me pāhi / vācaṃ me pinva / mano me jinva / ātmānaṃ me pāhi / jyotir me yaccha //
analyzed: āyuḥ me pāhi   prāṇam me pāhi   apānam me pāhi   vyānam me pāhi   cakṣuḥ me pāhi   śrotram me pāhi   vācam me pinva   manaḥ me jinva    ātmānam me pāhi   jyotiḥ me yaccha
translated: Protect my life. Protect my breath. Protect my out-breath. Protect my through-breath. Protect my eye. Protect my ear. Fill for me speech. Excite for me mind. Protect my self. Grant me light.

original: mā chandaḥ / pramā chandaḥ / pratimā chandaḥ / amrīvayaś chandaḥ / paṅktiś chandaḥ / uṣṇik chandaḥ / bṛhatī chandaḥ / anuṣṭup chandaḥ / virāṭ chandaḥ / gāyatrī chandaḥ / triṣṭup chandaḥ / jagatī chandaḥ //
analyzed: mā chandaḥ   pramā chandaḥ   pratimā chandaḥ   amrīvayaḥ chandaḥ paṅktiḥ chandaḥ  uṣṇih chandaḥ bṛhatī chandaḥ anuṣṭubh chandaḥ virāj chandaḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ  triṣṭubh chandaḥ   jagatī chandaḥ
translated: The metre Mā, the metre Pramā, the metre Pratima, the metre Amrīvaya, the metre Paṅkti, the metre Uṣṇik, the metre Bṛhatī, the metre Anuṣṭup, the metre Virāṭ, the metre Gāyatrī, the metre Triṣṭup, the metre Jagatī.

original: pṛthivī chandaḥ / antarikṣaṃ chandaḥ / dyauś chandaḥ / samāś chandaḥ / nakṣatrāṇi chandaḥ / vāk chandaḥ / manaś chandaḥ / kṛṣiś chandaḥ / hiraṇyaṃ chandaḥ / gauś chandaḥ / ajā chandaḥ / aśvaś chandaḥ //
analyzed: pṛthivī chandaḥ   antarikṣam chandaḥ dyauḥ chandaḥ samāḥ chandaḥ nakṣatrāṇi chandaḥ vāc chandaḥ manaḥ chandaḥ kṛṣiḥ chandaḥ hiraṇyam chandaḥ gauḥ chandaḥ   ajā chandaḥ   aśvaḥ chandaḥ
translated: Earth is a metre. Atmosphere is a metre. Heaven is a metre. Seasons are a metre. Stars are a metre. Speech is a metre. Mind is a metre. Agriculture is a metre. Gold is a metre. Cow is a metre. Goat is a metre. Horse is a metre.

original: agnir devatā / vāto devatā / sūryo devatā / candramā devatā / vasavo devatā / rudrā devatā / ādityā devatā / maruto devatā / viśve devā devatā / bṛhaspatir devatā / indro devatā / varuṇo devatā //
analyzed: agniḥ devatā    vātaḥ devatā sūryaḥ devatā   candramāḥ devatā   vasavaḥ devatā rudrāḥ devatā ādityāḥ devatā marutaḥ devatā   viśve devāḥ devatā bṛhaspatiḥ devatā   indraḥ devatā   varuṇaḥ devatā
translated: Fire is a deity. Wind is a deity. Sun is a deity. Moon is a deity. Vasus are a deity. Rudras are a deity. Adityas are a deity. Maruts are a deity. All gods are a deity. Brihaspati is a deity. Indra is a deity. Varuna is a deity.

original: mūrdhāsi rāḍ dhruvāsi dharuṇā dhartry asi dharaṇī / āyuṣe tvā varcase tvā kṛṣyai tvā kṣemāya tvā //
analyzed: mūrdhā asi rāj dhruvā asi dharuṇā dhartrī asi dharaṇī    āyuṣe tvā varcase tvā kṛṣyai tvā kṣemāya tvā
translated: You are the head, you are the firm axis, you are the supporter, you are the earth. For life I take you, for radiance I take you, for agriculture I take you, for peace I take you.

original: yantrī rāḍ yantry asi yamanī dhruvāsi dharitrī / iṣe tvorje tvā rayyai tvā poṣāya tvā //
analyzed: yantrī rāj yantrī asi yamanī dhruvā asi dharitrī    iṣe tvā ūrje tvā rayyai tvā poṣāya tvā
translated: You are the moving axis, you are the mover, you are the firm controller, you are the supporter. For food I take you, for strength I take you, for wealth I take you, for prosperity I take you.

original: lokaṃ pṛṇa chidraṃ pṛṇātho sīda dhruvā tvam / indrāgnī tvā bṛhaspatir asmin yonāv asīṣadan //
analyzed: lokam pṛṇa chidram pṛṇa atha u sīda dhruvā tvam indra agnī tvā bṛhaspatiḥ asmin yonau asīṣadan
translated: Fill the space, fill the gap, and sit firm. Indra, Agni, and Brihaspati have seated you in this womb.

original: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ   janman devānām viśaḥ triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: the people of the Gods, in the three luminous regions of the sky.🔽All songs have magnified Indra, whose greatness is like ocean,

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam rathīnāṃ vājānām satpatiṃ patim //
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim
translated: best of charioteers, the Lord of strength, the Lord of all.

original: āśur trivṛt / bhāntaḥ pañcadaśaḥ / vyomā saptadaśaḥ / dharuṇa ekavimśaḥ / pratūrtir aṣṭādaśaḥ / tapo navadaśaḥ / abhīvartaḥ savimśaḥ / varco dvāvimśaḥ / saṃbharaṇas trayovimśaḥ / yoniś caturvimśaḥ / garbhāḥ pañcavimśaḥ / ojas triṇavaḥ / kratur ekatrimśaḥ / pratiṣṭhā trayastrimśaḥ / bradhnasya viṣṭapaṃ catustrimśaḥ / nākaḥ ṣaṭtrimśaḥ / vivarto 'ṣṭācatvārimśaḥ / dhartraṃ catuṣṭomaḥ //
analyzed: āśuḥ trivṛt   bhāntaḥ pañcadaśaḥ vyomā saptadaśaḥ   dharuṇaḥ ekavimśaḥ pratūrtiḥ aṣṭādaśaḥ tapaḥ navadaśaḥ abhīvartaḥ savimśaḥ varcaḥ dvāvimśaḥ saṃbharaṇaḥ trayovimśaḥ yoniḥ caturvimśaḥ garbhāḥ pañcavimśaḥ ojaḥ triṇavaḥ   kratuḥ ekatrimśaḥ   pratiṣṭhā trayastrimśaḥ bradhnasya viṣṭapam catustrimśaḥ   nākaḥ ṣaṭtrimśaḥ    vivartaḥ ṣṭācatvārimśaḥ    dhartram catuṣṭomaḥ  /
translated: The swift one is the Trivrit. The shining one is the Pañcadaça. The all-encompassing one is the Saptadaça. The supporter is the Ekavinça. The impetuous one is the Aṣṭâdaça. The heat is the Navadaça. The overcomer is the Savinça. The radiance is the Dvāvimça. The gathering is the Trayovimça. The womb is the Catuṣṭoma. The embryos are the Pañcavimça. The force is the Trinava. The will is the Ekatrimsa. The foundation is the Trayastrimsa. The region of the sun is the Catustrimsa. The vault is the Sattraimsa. The turning back is the Aṣṭâcatvārimsa. The supporter is the Catuṣṭoma.

original: agner bhāgo 'si dīkṣāyā ādhipatyaṃ brahma spṛtaṃ trivṛt stomaḥ / indrasya bhāgo 'si viṣṇor ādhipatyaṃ ksatram spṛtaṃ pañcadaśaḥ stomaḥ / nṛcakṣasāṃ bhāgo 'si dhātur ādhipatyaṃ janitram spṛtam saptadaśaḥ stomaḥ / mitrasya bhāgo 'si varuṇasyādhipatyaṃ divo vṛṣṭir vāta spṛta ekavimśa stomaḥ //
analyzed: agneḥ bhāgaḥ u si dīkṣāyāḥ ādhipatyam brahma spṛtam trivṛt stomaḥ     indrasya bhāgaḥ u si viṣṇoḥ ādhipatyam ksatram spṛtam pañcadaśaḥ stomaḥ   nṛ cakṣasām bhāgaḥ u si dhātuḥ ādhipatyam janitram spṛtam saptadaśaḥ stomaḥ    mitrasya bhāgaḥ u si varuṇasya ādhipatyam divaḥ vṛṣṭiḥ vātaḥ spṛtaḥ ekavimśaḥ stomaḥ
translated: Thou art the portion of Agni, the overlordship of consecration, the Brahman is won, the Trivrit Stoma. Thou art the portion of Indra, the overlordship of Vishnu, the Kshatra is won, the Pañchadasa Stoma. Thou art the portion of the Nrichakṣas, the overlordship of Dhatr, the birthplace is won, the Saptadaša Stoma. Thou art the portion of Mitra, the overlordship of Varuna, the rain of heaven, the wind is won, the Ekavinša Stoma.

original: vasūnāṃ bhāgo 'si rudrāṇām ādhipatyaṃ catuṣpāt spṛtaṃ caturvimśa stomaḥ / ādityānāṃ bhāgo 'si marutām ādhipatyaṃ garbhā spṛtāḥ pañcavimśa stomaḥ / adityai bhāgo 'si pūṣṇa ādhipatyam oja spṛtaṃ triṇava stomaḥ / devasya savitur bhāgo 'si bṛhaspater ādhipatyam samīcīr diśa spṛtāś catuṣṭoma stomaḥ //
analyzed: vasūnām bhāgaḥ u si rudrāṇām ādhipatyam catuṣpād spṛtam caturvimśaḥ stomaḥ    ādityānām bhāgaḥ u si marutām ādhipatyam garbhāḥ spṛtāḥ pañcavimśaḥ stomaḥ   adityai bhāgaḥ u si pūṣṇaḥ ādhipatyam ojaḥ spṛtam triṇavaḥ stomaḥ    devasya savituḥ bhāgaḥ u si bṛhaspateḥ ādhipatyam samīcīḥ diśaḥ spṛtāḥ catuṣṭomaḥ stomaḥ
translated: Thou art the portion of the Vasus, the overlordship of the Rudras, the four-footed is won, the Chaturvimša Stoma. Thou art the portion of the Adityas, the overlordship of the Maruts, the embryos are won, the Pañchavimša Stoma. Thou art the portion of Aditi, the overlordship of Pusan, the strength is won, the Trinava Stoma. Thou art the portion of the god Savitr, the overlordship of Brihaspati, the meeting directions are won, the Chatusstoma Stoma.

original: yavānāṃ bhāgo 'sy ayavānām ādhipatyaṃ prajā spṛtāś catuścatvārimśa stomaḥ / ṛbhūṇāṃ bhāgo 'si viśveṣāṃ devānām ādhipatyaṃ bhūtam spṛtaṃ trayastrimśa stomaḥ //
analyzed: yavānām bhāgaḥ u si ayavānām ādhipatyam prajāḥ spṛtāḥ catuścatvārimśaḥ stomaḥ   ṛbhūṇām bhāgaḥ u si viśveṣām devānām ādhipatyam bhūtam spṛtam trayastrimśaḥ stomaḥ
translated: Thou art the share of the barley-eaters, the overlordship of the non-barley-eaters, the people are seized, the Catuścatvārimsa Stoma. Thou art the share of the Rbhus, the overlordship of the Visve Devas, the created is seized, the Trayastrimsa Stoma.

original: sahaś ca sahasyaś ca haimantikāv ṛtū agner antaḥśleṣo 'si kalpetāṇ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthaṅ nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ / ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime haimantikāv ṛtū abhikalpamānā indram iva devā abhisaṃ viśantu tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //
analyzed: sahaḥ ca sahasyaḥ ca haimantikau ṛtū agneḥ antaḥśleṣaḥ si kalpetāṇ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthak nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ   ye agnayaḥ samanasaḥ ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime haimantikau ṛtū abhikalpamānāḥ indram iva devāḥ abhisam viśantu tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruve sīdatam
translated: The two winter seasons, Saha and Sahasya, are the inner clasps of Agni. Be ye two harmonious, O heaven and earth. Be the waters and plants harmonious. Be the fires harmonious, each one, for the highest unity, of one vow. Those fires which are of one mind between heaven and earth, these two winter seasons, being prepared, let them enter Indra as the gods enter him. By that deity, in the manner of Angiras, sit ye firm.

original: ekayāstuvata prajā adhīyanta prajāpatir adhipatir āsīt / tisṛbhir astuvata brahmāsṛjyata brahmaṇaspatir adhipatir āsīt / pañcabhir astuvata bhūtāny asṛjyanta bhūtānāṃ patir adhipatir āsīt / saptabhir astuvata sapta ṛṣayo 'sṛjyanta dhātādhipatir āsīt //
analyzed: ekayā astuvata prajāḥ adhīyanta prajāpatiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt   tisṛbhiḥ astuvata brahma asṛjyata brahmaṇaspatiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt   pañcabhiḥ astuvata bhūtāni asṛjyanta bhūtānām patiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt    saptabhiḥ astuvata sapta ṛṣayaḥ sṛjyanta dhātā adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: By one (verse) they sang praises; creatures were produced; Prajapati was the overlord. By three they sang praises; the Brahman was produced; Brahmanaspati was the overlord. By five they sang praises; the beings were produced; the lord of beings was the overlord. By seven they sang praises; the seven Rishis were produced; Dhatr was the overlord.

original: navabhir astuvata pitaro 'sṛjyantāditir adhnipatny āsīt / ekādaśabhir astuvata ṛtavo 'sṛjyantārtavā adhipataya āsan / trayodaśabhir astuvata māsā asṛjyanta saṃvatsaro 'dhipatir āsīt / pañcadaśabhir astuvata kṣatram asṛjyatendro 'dhipatir āsīt / saptadaśabhir astuvata grāmyāḥ paśavo 'sṛjyanta bṛhaspatir adhipatir āsīt //
analyzed: navabhiḥ astuvata pitaraḥ sṛjyanta aditiḥ adhni patnī āsīt     ekādaśabhiḥ astuvata ṛtavaḥ sṛjyanta ārtavāḥ adhipatayaḥ āsan    trayodaśabhiḥ astuvata māsāḥ asṛjyanta saṃvatsaraḥ dhipatiḥ āsīt    pañcadaśabhiḥ astuvata kṣatram asṛjyata indraḥ dhipatiḥ āsīt     saptadaśabhiḥ astuvata grāmyāḥ paśavaḥ sṛjyanta bṛhaspatiḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt
translated: By nine they sang praises; the fathers were produced; Aditi was the overlady. By eleven they sang praises; the seasons were produced; the seasonal periods were the overlords. By thirteen they sang praises; the months were produced; the year was the overlord. By fifteen they sang praises; the Kshatra was produced; Indra was the overlord. By seventeen they sang praises; the domestic animals were produced; Brihaspati was the overlord.

original: navadaśabhir astuvata śūdrāryāv asṛjyetām ahorātre adhipatnī āstām / ekavimśatyāstuvataikaśaphāḥ paśavo 'sṛjyanta varuṇo 'dhipatir āsīt / trayovimśatyāstuvata kṣudrāṃ paśavo 'sṛjyanta pūṣādhipatir āsīt / pañcavimśatyāstuvatāraṇyāḥ paśavo 'sṛjyanta vāyur adhipatir āsīt / saptavimśatyāstuvata dyāvāpṛthivī vyaitāṃ vasavo rudrā ādityā anuvy āyams ta evādhipataya āsan //
analyzed: navadaśabhiḥ astuvata śūdra āryau asṛjyetām ahar rātre adhipatnī āstām  / ekavimśatyā astuvata ekaśaphāḥ paśavaḥ sṛjyanta varuṇaḥ dhipatiḥ āsīt    trayovimśatyā astuvata kṣudrām paśavaḥ sṛjyanta pūṣā adhipatiḥ āsīt    pañcavimśatyā astuvata āraṇyāḥ paśavaḥ sṛjyanta vāyuḥ adhipatiḥ āsīt    saptavimśatyā astuvata dyāvāpṛthivī vyaitām vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ anuvi āyan te eva adhipatayaḥ āsan
translated: By nineteen they created the Sûdra and the Arya; day and night were their over-lords. By twenty-one they created the one-hoofed animals; Varuna was their over-lord. By twenty-three they created the small cattle; Pûshan was their over-lord. By twenty-five they created the wild animals; Vâyu was their over-lord. By twenty-seven they created heaven and earth; the Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas followed them; they were their over-lords.

original: navasimśatyāstuvata vanaspatayo 'sṛjyanta somo 'dhipatir āsīt / ekatrimśatāstuvata prajā asṛjyanta yavāś cāyavāś cādhipataya āsan / trayastrimśatāstuvata bhūtāny aśāmyan prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhy adhipatir āsīt / lokaṃ pṛṇa chidraṃ pṛṇātho sīda dhruvā tvam / indrāgnī tvā bṛhaspatir asmin yonāv asīṣadan //
analyzed: navasimśatyā astuvata vanaspatayaḥ sṛjyanta somaḥ dhipatiḥ āsīt    ekatrimśatā astuvata prajāḥ asṛjyanta yavāḥ ca ayavāḥ ca adhipatayaḥ āsan    trayastrimśatā astuvata bhūtāni aśāmyan prajāpatiḥ parameṣṭhī adhipatiḥ āsīt    lokam pṛṇa chidram pṛṇa atha u sīda dhruvā tvam    indra agnī tvā bṛhaspatiḥ asmin yonau asīṣadan  /
translated: By twenty-nine they created the trees; Soma was their over-lord. By thirty-one they created living beings, the Yavas and Ayavas were their over-lords. By thirty-three they created the created beings; Pragâpati, the Supreme Lord, was their over-lord. Fill thou the region, fill the gap, and seat thee firm and steady. Indra and Agni, and Brihaspati have settled thee in this womb.

original: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ   janman devānām viśaḥ triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: In the three luminous realms of heaven.🔽All songs have magnified Indra, whose greatness is like ocean's vastness,

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam rathīnāṃ vājānām satpatiṃ patim //🔽agne jātān pra ṇuda naḥ sapatnān praty ajātān nuda jātavedaḥ / adhi no brūhi sumanā aheḍams tava syāma śarmams trivarūtha udbhau //
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim  agne jātān pra nuda naḥ sapatnān prati a jātān nuda jātavedaḥ    adhi naḥ brūhi sumanāḥ a heḍam tava syāma śarmam tri varūthe udbhau
translated: Best of charioteers, the Lord of strength, the Lord of all.🔽Drive off our foemen, O thou Agni, born, and drive away those yet unborn. Be gracious unto us, O thou all-knower, and we will dwell in thy threefold shelter.

original: sahasā jātān pra ṇudā naḥ sapatnān praty ajātān jātavedo nudasva / adhi no brūhi sumanasyamāno vayam syāma pra ṇudā naḥ sapatnān //
analyzed: sahasā jātān pra nuda naḥ sapatnān prati a jātān jātavedaḥ nudasva    adhi naḥ brūhi sumanasyamānaḥ vayam syāma pra nuda naḥ sapatnān
translated: Drive off our foemen, O thou Agni, born, and drive away those yet unborn. Be gracious unto us, O thou all-knower, and we will dwell in thy threefold shelter.

original: ṣoḍaśī stoma ojo draviṇam / catuścatvārimśa stomo varco draviṇam / agneḥ purīṣam asya apso nāma tāṃ tvā viśve abhi gṛṇantu devāḥ / stomapṛṣṭhā ghṛtavatīha sīda prajāvad asme draviṇā yajasva //
analyzed: ṣoḍaśī stomaḥ ojaḥ draviṇam   catuścatvārimśaḥ stomaḥ varcaḥ draviṇam   agneḥ purīṣam asya apsaḥ nāma tām tvā viśve abhi gṛṇantu devāḥ    stoma pṛṣṭhā ghṛtavatī iha sīda prajāvat asme draviṇāḥ yajasva
translated: The Sodashi Stoma is power and wealth. The Chaturvimsa Stoma is splendour and wealth. The Purisha of Agni is called Apsas. May all the Gods accept thee. With the Stoma for thy back, rich in ghee, sit thou down here. Bestow on us wealth with offspring.

original: evaś chandaḥ / varivaś chandaḥ / śaṃbhūś chandaḥ / paribhūś chandaḥ / ācchac chandaḥ / manaś chandaḥ / vyacaś chandaḥ / sindhuś chandaḥ / samudraś chandaḥ / sariraṃ chandaḥ / kakup chandaḥ / trikakup chandaḥ / kāvyaṃ chandaḥ / aṅkupaṃ chandaḥ / akṣarapaṅktiś chandaḥ / padapaṅktiś chandaḥ / viṣṭārapaṅktiś chandaḥ / kṣuro bhrājaś chandaḥ //
analyzed: evaḥ chandaḥ varivaḥ chandaḥ śaṃbhūḥ chandaḥ paribhūḥ chandaḥ ācchad chandaḥ manaḥ chandaḥ vyacaḥ chandaḥ sindhuḥ chandaḥ samudraḥ chandaḥ sariram chandaḥ kakubh chandaḥ trikakubh chandaḥ kāvyam chandaḥ aṅkupam chandaḥ   akṣarapaṅktiḥ chandaḥ padapaṅktiḥ chandaḥ viṣṭārapaṅktiḥ chandaḥ  / kṣuraḥ bhrājaḥ chandaḥ  /
translated: The Evam metre. The Varivam metre. The Sambhu metre. The Paribhu metre. The Acchā metre. The Manas metre. The Vyaca metre. The Sindhu metre. The Samudra metre. The Sarirā metre. The Kakup metre. The Trikakup metre. The Kavya metre. The Angkup metre. The Aksharapankti metre. The Padapaṅkti metre. The Vistārapankti metre. The Kshurabhraja metre.

original: ācchac chandaḥ / pracchac chandaḥ / saṃyac chandaḥ / viyac chandaḥ / bṛhac chandaḥ / rathantaraṃ chandaḥ / nikāyaś chandaḥ / vivadhaś chandaḥ / giraś chandaḥ / bhrajaś chandaḥ / samstup chandaḥ / anuṣṭup chandaḥ / evaś chandaḥ / varivaś chandaḥ / vayaś chandaḥ / vayaskṛc chandaḥ / viṣpardhāś chandaḥ / viśālaṃ chandaḥ / chadiś chandaḥ / dūrohaṇaṃ chandaḥ / tandraṃ chandaḥ / aṅkāṅkaṃ chandaḥ //
analyzed: ācchad chandaḥ pracchad chandaḥ saṃyat chandaḥ viyat chandaḥ bṛhat chandaḥ rathantaram chandaḥ nikāyaḥ chandaḥ vivadhaḥ chandaḥ giraḥ chandaḥ bhrajaḥ chandaḥ samstubh chandaḥ anuṣṭubh chandaḥ evaḥ chandaḥ varivaḥ chandaḥ vayaḥ chandaḥ vayaskṛt chandaḥ viṣpardhāḥ chandaḥ viśālam chandaḥ chadiḥ chandaḥ dūrohaṇam chandaḥ tandram chandaḥ aṅkāṅkam chandaḥ chandaḥ chandaḥ chandaḥ chandaḥ chandaḥ chandaḥ chandaḥ c
translated: The Ākṣa metre. The Prakṣa metre. The Saṃyaka metre. The Viyaka metre. The Bṛhat metre. The Rathantara metre. The Nikāya metre. The Vivadha metre. The Giri metre. The Bhrāja metre. The Sāṁstupa metre. The Anuṣṭubh metre. The Eva metre. The Variva metre. The Vaya metre. The Vayaṅkṛt metre. The Viṣparśa metre. The Viśāla metre. The Chāḍi metre. The Dūrāhana metre. The Tandra metre. The Aṅkāṅka metre.

original: raśminā satyāya satyaṃ jinva / pretinā dharmaṇā dharmaṃ jinva / anvityā divā divaṃ jinva / saṃdhināntarikṣeṇāntarikṣaṃ jinva / pratidhin pṛthivyā pṛthivīṃ jinva / viṣṭambhena vṛṣṭyā vṛsṭiṃ jinva / pravayāhnāhar jinva / anuyā ratryā rātrīṃ jinva / uśijā vasubhyo vasūn jinva / praketenādityebhya ādityān jinva //
analyzed: raśminā satyāya satyam jinva   pretinā dharmaṇā dharmam jinva    anvityā divā divam jinva   saṃdhinā antarikṣeṇa antarikṣam jinva   pratidhin pṛthivyā pṛthivīm jinva   viṣṭambhena vṛṣṭyā vṛsṭim jinva    pravayā ahnā ahar jinva   anu yā ratryā rātrīm jinva   uśijā vasubhyaḥ vasūn jinva    praketena ādityebhyaḥ ādityān jinva
translated: With the ray of truth quicken truth. With the going forth of the law quicken the law. With the following of the day quicken the day. With the joining of the atmosphere quicken the atmosphere. With the support of the earth quicken the earth. With the upholding of the rain quicken the rain. With the going forth of the day quicken the day. With the following of the night quicken the night. With the swiftness of the Vasus quicken the Vasus. With the going forth of the Adityas quicken the Adityas.

original: tantunā rāyaspoṣeṇa rāyaspoṣaṃ jinva / samsarpeṇa śrutāya śrutaṃ jinva / aiḍenauṣadhībhir oṣadhīr jinva / uttamena tanūbhis tanūr jinva / vayodhasādhīteanādhītaṃ jinva / abhijitā tejasā tejo jinva //
