analyzed: tantunā rāyaspoṣeṇa rāyaspoṣam jinva   samsarpeṇa śrutāya śrutam jinva   aiḍena oṣadhībhiḥ oṣadhīḥ jinva   uttamena tanūbhiḥ tanūḥ jinva   vayodhasā adhīte an ādhītam jinva     abhijitā tejasā tejaḥ jinva
translated: With the thread of the increase of wealth quicken the increase of wealth. With the gliding of the heard quicken the heard. With the swelling of the plants quicken the plants. With the highest of the bodies quicken the bodies. With the life-giving quicken the not life-giving. With the victorious with the splendour quicken the splendour.

original: pratipad asi pratipade tvā / anupad asy anupade tvā / sampad asi sampade tvā / tejo 'si tejase tvā //
analyzed: pratipad asi pratipade tvā    anupad asi anupade tvā    sampad asi sampade tvā    tejaḥ si tejase tvā
translated: Thou art the advance, for the advance thee! Thou art the following, for the following thee! Thou art the joining, for the joining thee! Thou art the splendour, for the splendour thee!

original: trivṛd asi trivṛte tvā / pravṛd asi pravṛte tvā / vivṛd asi vivṛte tvā / savṛd asi savṛte tvā / ākramo 'sy ākramāya tvā / saṃkramo 'si saṃkramāya tvā / utkramo 'sy utkramāya tvā / utkrāntir asy utkrāntyai tvā / adhipatinorjorjaṃ jinva //
analyzed: trivṛt asi trivṛte tvā   pravṛt asi pravṛte tvā   vivṛt asi vivṛte tvā   savṛt asi savṛte tvā   ākramaḥ u si ākramāya tvā   saṃkramaḥ u si saṃkramāya tvā    utkramaḥ u si utkramāya tvā    utkrāntiḥ asi utkrāntyai tvā    adhipatinā ūrjā ūrjam jinva
translated: Thou art the three-fold one; for the three-fold thee. Thou art the forward one; for the forward thee. Thou art the spreading one; for the spreading thee. Thou art the all-spreading one; for the all-spreading thee. Thou art the step; for the step thee. Thou art the stepping-stone; for the stepping-stone thee. Thou art the stepping up; for the stepping up thee. Thou art the stepping out; for the stepping out thee. Thou art the stepping over; for the stepping over thee. Thou art the overlord; quicken the strength of strength.

original: rājñy asi prācī dig vasavas te devā adhipatayo 'gnir hetīnāṃ pratidhartā trivṛt tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatv ājyam uktham avyathāyai stabhnātu rathantaram sāma pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa ṛṣayas tvā prathamajā deveṣu divo mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā cāyam adhipatiś ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānaṃ ca sādayantu //
analyzed: rājñī asi prācī diś vasavaḥ te devāḥ adhipatayaḥ gniḥ hetīnām pratidhartā trivṛt tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu ājyam uktham a vyathāyai stabhnātu rathantaram sāma pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā prathama jāḥ deveṣu divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā ca ayam adhipatiḥ ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānam ca sādayantu
translated: Thou art the queen, the eastern region. The Vasus are thy gods, the overlords. Agni is the repeller of missiles. Let the Trivrit Stoma settle thee on earth. Let the Ajya Uktha settle thee for steadiness. Let the Rathantara Saman settle thee for support. Let the Rishis, the first-born, spread thee among the gods by the measure, by the width of the sky. Let this the supporter and this the overlord, all of you, being of one accord, settle the sacrificer on the ridge of the vault, in the world of heaven.

original: virāḍ asi dakṣiṇā dig rudrās te devā adhipataya indro hetīnāṃ pratidhartā pañcadaśas tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu pragam uktham avyathāyai stabhnātu bṛhat sāma pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa ṛṣayas tvā prathamajā deveṣu divo mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā cāyam adhipatiś ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānaṃ ca sādayantu //
analyzed: virāj asi dakṣiṇā diś rudrāḥ te devāḥ adhipatayaḥ indraḥ hetīnām pratidhartā pañcadaśaḥ tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu pragam uktham a vyathāyai stabhnātu bṛhat sāma pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā prathama jāḥ deveṣu divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā ca ayam adhipatiḥ ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānam ca sādayantu
translated: Thou art Virâg, the southern region. The Rudras are thy gods, the lords. Indra is the repeller of shafts. The Pañkadasa hymn shall settle thee on the earth. The Pragâpsa hymn shall settle the Brihat Sâman for thy support. The Rishis, the first-born, among the gods, shall extend thee among the gods with the measure of the sky. Let this supporter and this overlord, all of them agreeing, settle the sacrificer on the ridge of the vault, in the world of Svarga.

original: samrāḍ asi pratīcī dig ādityās te devā adhipatayo varuṇo hetīnāṃ pratidhartā saptadaśas tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu marutvatīyam uktham avyathāyai stabhnātu vairūpam sāma pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa ṛṣayas tvā prathamajā deveṣu divo mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā cāyam adhipatiś ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānaṃ ca sādayantu //
analyzed: samrāj asi pratīcī diś ādityāḥ te devāḥ adhipatayaḥ varuṇaḥ hetīnām pratidhartā saptadaśaḥ tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu marutvatīyam uktham a vyathāyai stabhnātu vairūpam sāma pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā prathama jāḥ deveṣu divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā ca ayam adhipatiḥ ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānam ca sādayantu
translated: Thou art the universal king, the western region. The Âdityas are thy gods, the lords. Varuna is the repeller of shafts. The Saptadasa-stoma shall settle thee on the earth. The Marutvatîya hymn shall settle thee for support. The Vairûpa Sâman shall settle thee for support. The Rishis, the first-born, among the gods, shall extend thee among the gods, with the measure of the sky, with the breadth of the sky. This supporter and this overlord, and all these who agree together, shall settle the sacrificer on the ridge of the vault, in the world of Svarga.

original: svarāḍ asy udīcy diṅ marutas te devā adhipatayaḥ somo hetīnāṃ pratidhartaikavimśas tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu niṣkevalyam uktham avyathāyai stabhnātu vairājam sāma pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa ṛṣayas tvā prathamajā deveṣu divo mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā cāyam adhipatiś ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānaṃ ca sādayantu //
analyzed: svarāj asi udīcī diś marutaḥ te devāḥ adhipatayaḥ somaḥ hetīnām  / pratidhartā ekavimśaḥ tvā stomaḥ pṛthivyām śrayatu niṣkevalyam uktham a vyathāyai stabhnātu vairājam sāma pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā prathama jāḥ deveṣu divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā ca ayam adhipatiḥ ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānam ca sādayantu
translated: Thou art the self-ruling; the northern region is thine; the Maruts are thy gods, the overlords; Soma is the repeller of shafts; the twenty-one-fold hymn shall establish thee on earth; the complete hymn shall establish the unshaken (world); the Vairâja Sâman for support. The Rishis, the first-born, among the gods, shall extend thee in the heaven's breadth, with the heaven's measure. And this the supporter, and this the overlord, and all these, agreeing together, shall establish thee on the ridge of the vault, in the world of Svarga, and the sacrificer also.

original: adhipatny asi bṛhatī dig viśve te devā adhipatayo bṛhaspatir hetīnāṃ pratidhartā triṇavatrayastrimśau tvā stomau pṛthivyām śrayatāṃ vaiśvadevāgnimārute ukthe avyathāyai stabhnītām śākvararaivate sāmanī pratiṣṭhityā antarikṣa ṛṣayas tvā prathamajā deveṣu divo mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā cāyam adhipatiś ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānaṃ ca sādayantu //
analyzed: adhipatnī asi bṛhatī diś viśve te devāḥ adhipatayaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ hetīnām pratidhartā triṇava trayastrimśau tvā stomau pṛthivyām śrayatām vaiśvadeva āgnimārute ukthe a vyathāyai stabhnītām śākvara raivate sāmanī pratiṣṭhityai antarikṣe ṛṣayaḥ tvā prathama jāḥ deveṣu divaḥ mātrayā varimṇā prathantu vidhartā ca ayam adhipatiḥ ca te tvā sarve saṃvidātā nākasya pṛṣṭhe svarge loke yajamānam ca sādayantu  /
translated: Thou art the over-lady, the great region. The All-gods are thy over-lords. Brihaspati is the repeller of missiles. The Trinava and Trayastrimsa Stomas shall settle thee on earth. The Vaisvadeva and Agnimarautya Sâmans shall support thee for unshaken prosperity. The Sâkvara and Raivata Sâmans shall establish thee in the atmosphere. The Rishis, the first-born, among the gods, shall extend thee with the measure and breadth of the sky. The supporter and the over-lord, and all these in unison, shall settle the Sacrificer on the ridge of the vault, in the world of Svarga.

original: ayaṃ puro harikeśaḥ sūryaraśmis tasya rathagṛtsaś ca rathaujāś ca senānīgrāmaṇyā //
analyzed: ayam puras hari keśaḥ sūrya raśmiḥ tasya rathagṛtsaḥ ca rathaujāḥ ca senānī grāmaṇyā
translated: This is the eastern quarter, with golden hair, with sun-beams. Its commanders are Rathugrits and Rathoujas.

original: puñjikasthalā ca kratusthalā cāpsarasau daṅkṣṇavaḥ paśavo hetiḥ pauruṣeyo vadhaḥ prahetis tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //
analyzed: puñjikasthalā ca kratusthalā ca apsarasau daṅkṣṇavaḥ paśavaḥ hetiḥ pauruṣeyaḥ vadhaḥ prahetiḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: The Apsarases are Punjikasthalâ and Kratusthalâ. The Dankshnus are cattle. The weapon is the stroke of man. The counter-weapon is the stroke of woman. To them homage. May they protect us. May they be gracious to us. Him whom we hate and he who hates us, him we place in their jaws.

original: ayaṃ dakṣiṇā viśvakarmā tasya rathasvanaś ca rathecitraś ca senānīgrāmaṇyā //
analyzed: ayam dakṣiṇā viśvakarmā tasya rathasvanaḥ ca rathecitraḥ ca senānī grāmaṇyā
translated: This is the southern (quarter), the all-worker. His commanders and village chiefs are Rathasvana and Rathéchitra.

original: menakā ca sahajanyā cāpsarasau yātudhānā hetī rakṣāmsi prahetis tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //
analyzed: menakā ca sahajanyā ca apsarasau yātudhānāḥ hetiḥ rakṣā asi prahetiḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: The Apsarases Menakā and Sahajanyā, the Yātudhānas, the missiles, the Rakṣases, the Prāhetyā—to them be homage. May they protect us. May they have mercy upon us. Him whom we hate and who hates us, him we place in their jaws.

original: ayaṃ paścād viśvavyacās tasya rathaprotaś cāsamarathaś ca senānīgrāmaṇyā //
analyzed: ayam paścāt viśvavyacāḥ tasya rathaprotaḥ ca asamarathaḥ ca senānī grāmaṇyā
translated: This is the western (quarter), the all-encompassing. His commanders and village chiefs are Rathéchitta and Asamaratha.

original: pramlocantī cānumlocantī cāpsarasau vyāghrā hetiḥ sarpā prahetis tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //
analyzed: pramlocantī ca anumlocantī ca apsarasau vyāghrāḥ hetiḥ sarpā prahetiḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: The Apsarases Pramlocā and Anumlocā, the tigers, the missiles, the serpents, the Prāhetyās—to them be homage. May they protect us. May they have mercy upon us. Him whom we hate and who hates us, him we place in their jaws.

original: ayam uttarāt saṃyadvasus tasya tārkṣyaś cāriṣṭanemiś ca senānīgrāmaṇyā //
analyzed: ayam uttarāt saṃyadvasuḥ tasya tārkṣyaḥ ca ariṣṭanemiḥ ca senānī grāmaṇyā
translated: This is the northern (quarter), the possessor of wealth. His commanders and village chiefs are Tārkṣya and Ariṣṭanemi.

original: viśvācī ca ghṛtācī cāpsarasāv āpo hetir vātaḥ prahetis tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //
analyzed: viśvācī ca ghṛtācī ca apsarasau āpaḥ hetiḥ vātaḥ prahetiḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: Vishvachi and Ghritachi, the two Apsarases, the waters are the missile, the wind the counter-missile; to them homage; may they protect us; may they have mercy upon us. Him whom we hate and who hateth us, him we place in their jaws.

original: ayam upary arvāgvasus tasya senajic ca suṣeṇaś ca senānīgrāmaṇyā //
analyzed: ayam upari arvāgvasuḥ tasya senajit ca suṣeṇaḥ ca senānī grāmaṇyā
translated: This one above, the one with wealth below, his generals are Senajit and Sushena, and his village chiefs.

original: urvaśī ca pūrvacittiś cāpsarasāv avasphūrjan hetir vidyut prahetis tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //
analyzed: urvaśī ca pūrvacittiḥ ca apsarasau avasphūrjan hetiḥ vidyut prahetiḥ tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: Urvashi and Purvachitti, the two Apsarases, the thunder is the missile, the lightning the counter-missile; to them homage; may they protect us; may they have mercy upon us. Him whom we hate and who hateth us, him we place in their jaws.

original: agnir mūrdhā divaḥ kakut patiḥ pṛthivyā ayam / apām retāmsi jinvati //
analyzed: agniḥ mūrdhā divaḥ kakud patiḥ pṛthivyāḥ ayam   apām retāmsi jinvati
translated: This Agni is the head, the summit of the sky, the lord of this earth. He quickens the seed of the waters.

original: ayam agniḥ sahasriṇo vājasya śatinas patiḥ / mūrdhā kavī rayīṇām //
analyzed: ayam agniḥ sahasriṇaḥ vājasya śatinaḥ patiḥ    mūrdhā kaviḥ rayīṇām
translated: This Agni is the lord of a thousandfold strength, of a hundredfold food. He is the head, the sage, of riches.

original: tvām agne puṣkarād adhy atharvā nir amanthata / mūrdhno viśvasya vāghataḥ //
analyzed: tvām agne puṣkarāt adhi atharvā niḥ amanthata     mūrdhnaḥ viśvasya vāghataḥ
translated: From the navel, O Agni, Atharvan rubbed thee forth, the head of every Hotar priest.

original: bhuvo yajñasya rajasaś ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ / divi mūrdhānaṃ dadhiṣe svarṣāṃ jihvām agne cakṛṣe havyavāham //
analyzed: bhuvaḥ yajñasya rajasaḥ ca netā yatrā niyudbhiḥ sacase śivābhiḥ    divi mūrdhānam dadhiṣe svarṣām jihvām agne cakṛṣe havya vāham
translated: Thou settest in the sky thy head, O thou of wondrous might: thou, O Agni, hast made thy tongue the bearer of oblations.

original: abodhy agniḥ samidhā janānāṃ prati dhenum ivāyatīm uṣāsam / yahvā iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam accha //
analyzed: abodhi agniḥ samidhā janānām prati dhenum iva āyatīm uṣāsam    yahvāḥ iva pra vayām ujjihānāḥ pra bhānavaḥ sisrate nākam accha
translated: Agni hath wakened with the fuel of the people, as it were a milch-cow coming to the milking, at early morn. Like vigorous steeds he hath extended his tongues, and his bright flames have streamed forth to the vault of heaven.

original: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vaco vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe / gaviṣṭhiro namasā stomam agnau divīva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret //
analyzed: avocāma kavaye medhyāya vacaḥ vandāru vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe      gaviṣṭhiraḥ namasā stomam agnau divi iva rukmam uruvyañcam aśret
translated: To the adorable sage we have sung forth our hymn, our praise to the mighty Steer, the Lord of Bounty. Gavishtanta with homage hath raised in Agni his song, like a bright ornament in the sky.

original: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ / yam apnavāno bhṛgavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṃ vibhvaṃ viśeviśe //
analyzed: ayam iha prathamaḥ dhāyi dhātṛbhiḥ hotā yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvareṣu īḍyaḥ   yam apnavānaḥ bhṛgavaḥ virurucuḥ vaneṣu citram vibhvam viśeviśe
translated: This Agni was the first to be established by the creators, the Hotar, most to be worshipped at sacrifices. Him the Apnavâna and the Bhrigus have made to shine, the wondrous, the all-pervading, in every house.

original: janasya gopā ajaniṣṭa jāgṛvir agniḥ sudakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase / ghṛtapratīko bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumad vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ //
analyzed: janasya gopāḥ ajaniṣṭa jāgṛviḥ agniḥ su dakṣaḥ suvitāya navyase    ghṛta pratīkaḥ bṛhatā divispṛśā dyumat vi bhāti bharatebhyaḥ śuciḥ
translated: The watchful Guardian of the people hath been born, Agni, the very wise, for a new prosperity. He, with his face turned to the ghee, with the lofty one that toucheth heaven, shineth brightly for the Bharatas, pure.

original: tvām agne aṅgiraso guhā hitam anv avindañ chiśriyāṇaṃ vanevane / sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ saho mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasas putram aṅgiraḥ //🔽sakhāyaḥ saṃ vaḥ samyañcam iṣam stomaṃ cāgnaye / varṣiṣṭhāya kṣitīnām ūrjo naptre sahasvate //
analyzed: tvām agne aṅgirasaḥ guhā hitam anu avindam śiśriyāṇam vanevane      sa jāyase mathyamānaḥ sahaḥ mahat tvām āhuḥ sahasaḥ putram aṅgiraḥ  sakhāyaḥ sam vaḥ samyañcam iṣam stomam ca agnaye
translated: O Agni, the Angirases found thee, hidden in the cave, resting in every wood. Thou art born, when rubbed, with mighty strength. They call thee, O Angiras, the son of strength.🔽O friends, unite your food and praise for Agni, most lofty over all lands, grandson of strength, the mighty.

original: samsam id yuvase vṛṣann agne viśvāny arya ā / iḍas pade sam idhyase sa no vasūny ā bhara //🔽tvāṃ citraśravastama havante vikṣu jantavaḥ / śociṣkeśaṃ purupriyāgne havyāya voḍhave //
analyzed: sam sam id yuvase vṛṣan agne viśvāni aryaḥ ā    iḍaḥ pade sam idhyase sa naḥ vasūni ā bhara  tvām citraśravastama havante vikṣu jantavaḥ   śociṣkeśam puru priya agne havyāya voḍhave
translated: O bull, thou art united with all things, O Agni, with all that is good. Thou art kindled in the place of worship. Bring thou to us all good things.🔽O Agni, most famous for thy wondrous fame, men in their homes call thee, O thou whose hair is flame, O Agni, much-loved, to bear their offerings.

original: enā vo agniṃ namasorjo napātam ā huve / priyaṃ cetiṣṭham aratim svadhvaraṃ viśvasya dūtam amṛtam //🔽viśvasya dūtam amṛtaṃ viśvasya dūtam amṛtam / sa yojate aruṣā viśvabhojasā sa dudravat svāhutaḥ //
analyzed: enā vaḥ agnim namasā ūrjaḥ napātam ā huve   priyam cetiṣṭham aratim su adhvaram viśvasya dūtam amṛtam  viśvasya dūtam amṛtam viśvasya dūtam amṛtam     sa yojate aruṣā viśva bhojasā sa dudravat su āhutaḥ
translated: To you I call this Agni, the grandson of strength, to offer worship, to the dear, most watchful envoy, well-adoring, the immortal messenger of all.🔽The messenger of all, the immortal, the messenger of all, the immortal. He yokes the ruddy one, the all-enjoyer. He runs, well-offered.

original: sa dudravat svāhutaḥ sa dudravat svāhutaḥ / subrahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnāṃ devam rādho janānām //
analyzed: sa dudravat su āhutaḥ sa dudravat su āhutaḥ   / su brahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnām devam rādhaḥ janānām
translated: He runs, well-offered. He runs, well-offered. The sacrifice with good prayer, the good friend of treasures, the god's gift to men.

original: agne vājasya gomata īśānaḥ sahaso yaho / asme dhehi jātavedo mahi śravaḥ //
analyzed: agne vājasya gomataḥ īśānaḥ sahasaḥ yaho    asme dhehi jātavedaḥ mahi śravaḥ
translated: O Agni, lord of wealth in food, O mighty one, O son of strength,🔽Do thou, O all-knower, grant us great glory.🔽That Agni, the kindler, the good sage, is to be worshipped with speech.

original: sa idhāno vasuṣ kavir agnir īḍenyo girā / revad asmabhyaṃ purvaṇīka dīdihi //
analyzed: saḥ idhānaḥ vasuṣ kaviḥ agniḥ īḍenyaḥ girā    revat asmabhyam purvaṇīka dīdihi
translated: Shine forth for us, O Agni, O first-born, with great wealth.🔽O king, O Agni, in the night, in the morning, and in the dawn,

original: kṣapo rājann uta tmanāgne vastor utoṣasaḥ / sa tigmajambha rakṣaso daha prati //
analyzed: kṣapaḥ rājan uta tmanā agne vastoḥ uta uṣasaḥ    sa tigma jambha rakṣasaḥ daha prati
translated: Do thou, O thou with sharp teeth, burn the Rakshasas away.🔽May our Agni, when offered to, be auspicious to us, O prosperous one, may the gift be auspicious, the sacrifice auspicious.

original: bhadro no agnir āhuto bhadrā rātiḥ subhaga bhadro adhvaraḥ / bhadrā uta praśastayaḥ //
analyzed: bhadraḥ naḥ agniḥ āhutaḥ bhadrā rātiḥ subhaga bhadraḥ adhvaraḥ    bhadrāḥ uta praśastayaḥ
translated: And may the praises be auspicious.

original: bhadrā uta praśastayo bhadraṃ manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye / yenā samatsu sāsahaḥ //
analyzed: bhadrāḥ uta praśastayaḥ bhadram manaḥ kṛṇuṣva vṛtratūrye   yena samatsu sāsahaḥ
translated: And may the praises be auspicious. Make thy mind auspicious in the battle against Vritra, wherewith thou mayst be victorious in the battles.

original: yenā samatsu sāsaho 'va sthirā tanuhi bhūri śardhatām / vanemā te abhiṣṭibhiḥ //
analyzed: yena samatsu sāsahaḥ vaḥ sthirā tanuhi bhūri śardhatām     vanema te abhiṣṭibhiḥ
translated: With what thou mayst be victorious in the battles, do thou, O strong one, crush the firm and the many who are eager to attack. May we serve thee with our aids.🔽I think of that Agni who is the good one, to whom the milch-cows go,

original: agniṃ taṃ manye yo vasur astaṃ yaṃ yanti dhenavaḥ / astam arvanta āśavo 'staṃ nityāso vājina iṣam stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: agnim tam manye yaḥ vasuḥ astam yam yanti dhenavaḥ   astam arvantaḥ āśavaḥ stam nityāsaḥ vājinaḥ iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: To whom the swift horses go, to whom the strong steeds always go. Bring food to the praisers.

original: so agnir yo vasur gṛṇe saṃ yam āyanti dhenavaḥ / sam arvanto raghudruvaḥ sam sujātāsaḥ sūraya iṣam stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: saḥ agniḥ yaḥ vasuḥ gṛṇe sam yam āyanti dhenavaḥ    sam arvantaḥ raghudruvaḥ sam su jātāsaḥ sūrayaḥ iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: Bring food to the praisers.

original: ubhe suścandra sarpiṣo darvī śrīṇīṣa āsani / uto na ut pupūryā uktheṣu śavasas pata iṣam stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: ubhe su ścandra sarpiṣaḥ darvī śrīṇīṣe āsani   uta u naḥ ud pupūryāḥ uktheṣu śavasaḥ pate iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: O thou of beautiful rays, fill both thy ladles with ghee in the fire,🔽And also fill us in our praises, O lord of power. Bring food to the praisers.

original: agne tam adyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadram hṛdispṛśam / ṛdhyāmā ta ohaiḥ //
analyzed: agne tam adya aśvam na stomaiḥ kratum na bhadram hṛdispṛśam   ṛdhyāma te ohaiḥ
translated: O Agni, today with our hymns make that sacrifice successful,🔽Like a horse, like a good thought that touches the heart. May we prosper through your favours.🔽For you, O Agni, are the charioteer of the great chariot of truth,

original: adhā hy agne krator bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ / rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato babhūtha //
analyzed: adhā hi agne kratoḥ bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ   rathīḥ ṛtasya bṛhataḥ babhūtha
translated: Of the good, the righteous, the powerful sacrifice.🔽With these hymns of ours, be thou inclined to us, O Agni, to the light of heaven,

original: ebhir no arkair bhavā no arvāṅ svar ṇa jyotiḥ / agne viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ //
analyzed: ebhiḥ naḥ arkaiḥ bhava naḥ arvāṅ svar na jyotiḥ   agne viśvebhiḥ sumanāḥ anīkaiḥ
translated: With all thy most gracious faces.🔽I regard Agni as the Hotar priest, the bountiful Vasu, the son of strength, the all-knowing, the sage, the all-knowing,🔽The god who with his upward course looks with favour on the god,

original: agnim hotāraṃ manye dāsvantaṃ vasum sūnum sahaso jātavedasaṃ vipraṃ na jātavedasam / ya ūrdhvayā svadhvaro devo devācyā kṛpā / ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ //
analyzed: agnim hotāram manye dāsvantam vasum sūnum sahasaḥ jātavedasam vipram na jātavedasam    yaḥ ūrdhvayā su adhvaraḥ devaḥ devācyā kṛpā    ghṛtasya vibhrāṣṭim anu vaṣṭi śociṣā ājuhvānasya sarpiṣaḥ
translated: Who follows the spreading flame of ghee, the invoked ghee, with his radiance.

original: agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhava varūthyaḥ //
analyzed: agne tvam naḥ antamaḥ uta trātā śivaḥ bhava varūthyaḥ
translated: Be thou, O Agni, our nearest friend, and a kind deliverer and protector.

original: vasur agnir vasuśravā acchā nakṣi dyumattamam rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: vasuḥ agniḥ vasu śravāḥ acchā nakṣi dyumattamam rayim dāḥ
translated: Agni is treasure, treasure-renowned: he hath attained the most splendid wealth. Grant us wealth.

original: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: tam tvā śociṣṭha dīdivas sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Thee, O most radiant one, we implore for bliss, for our friends,🔽By whom the Rishis, kindling Agni, attained the sacrificial session through austerity, and brought heaven to themselves.

original: yena ṛṣayas tapasā satram āyann indhānā agnim svar ābharantaḥ / tasminn ahaṃ ni dadhe nāke asgniṃ yam āhur manava stīrṇabarhiṣam //
analyzed: yena ṛṣayaḥ tapasā satram āyan indhānāḥ agnim svar ābharantaḥ    tasmin aham ni dadhe nāke a sgnim yam āhuḥ manavaḥ stīrṇa barhiṣam
translated: In that Agni, whom the men call on, whose sacrificial grass is strewn, I have placed in the vault of the sky.

original: taṃ patnībhir anu gacchema devāḥ putrair bhrātṛbhir uta vā hiraṇyaiḥ / nākaṃ gṛbhṇānāḥ sukṛtasya loke tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: tam patnībhiḥ anu gacchema devāḥ putraiḥ bhrātṛbhiḥ uta vā hiraṇyaiḥ   nākam gṛbhṇānāḥ sukṛtasya loke tṛtīye pṛṣṭhe adhi rocane divaḥ
translated: Let us follow him with our wives, O gods, with our sons, our brothers, or with gold, grasping the vault in the world of good deeds, on the third back, in the light of the sky.🔽This Agni hath mounted to the middle of speech, the weighty one, this Agni, the lord of the people, the discerning one.

original: ā vāco madhyam aruhad guraṇyur ayam agniḥ satpatiś cekitānaḥ / pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyā nihito davidyutad adhas padaṃ kṛṇutāṃ ye pṛtanyavaḥ //
analyzed: ā vācaḥ madhyam aruhat guraṇyuḥ ayam agniḥ satpatiḥ cekitānaḥ   pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyāḥ nihitaḥ davidyutat adhas padam kṛṇutām ye pṛtanyavaḥ  /
translated: Firmly placed on the back of the earth, he hath shone forth: let those who are hostile make their foot low.🔽This Agni, best at giving heroes, strength, a thousandfold, may he shine, not sleeping.

original: ayam agnir vīratamo vayodhāḥ sahasriyo dyotatām aprayucchan / vibhrājamānaḥ sarirasya madhya upa pra yāhi divyāni dhāma //
analyzed: ayam agniḥ vīratamaḥ vayodhāḥ sahasriyaḥ dyotatām aprayucchan    vibhrājamānaḥ sarirasya madhye upa pra yāhi divyāni dhāma
translated: Shining in the midst of the firmament, go forward to the heavenly abodes.

original: sampra cyavadhvam upa sampra yātāgne patho devayānān kṛṇudhvam / punaḥ kṛṇvānā pitarā yuvānānvā tāmsīt tvayi tantum etam //
analyzed: sampra cyavadhvam upa sampra yāta agne pathaḥ deva yānān kṛṇudhvam    punar kṛṇvānā pitarā yuvānā vā tāmsīt tvayi tantum etam
translated: Go forward both of you, come hither: make ye the paths, O ye two, that go to the Gods. Making the Parents young again, do ye, O ye two, weave this thread in this highest place of meeting.

original: ud budhyasvāgne prati jāgṛhi tvam iṣṭāpūrte sam sṛjethām ayaṃ ca / asmint sadhasthe adhy uttarasmin visve devā yajamānāś ca sīdata //
analyzed: ud budhyasva agne prati jāgṛhi tvam iṣṭāpūrte sam sṛjethām ayam ca    asmin sadhasthe adhi uttarasmin visve devāḥ yajamānāḥ ca sīdata
translated: Awake, O Agni, and be watchful: do thou unite this man with his good works and with his offerings. In this highest place of meeting, in this, sit ye all Gods and sacrificers.🔽By which thou carriest a thousand, by which all wealth, O Agni,

original: yena vahasi sahasraṃ yenāgne sarvavedasam / tenemaṃ yajñaṃ no naya svar deveṣu gantave //
analyzed: yena vahasi sahasram yena agne sarvavedasam     tena imam yajñam naḥ naya svar deveṣu gantave
translated: by that lead this sacrifice of ours to the heaven to go to the Gods.

original: ayaṃ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ / taṃ jānann agna ārohāthā no vardhayā rayim //
analyzed: ayam te yoniḥ ṛtviyaḥ yatas jātaḥ arocathāḥ   tam jānan agne āroha atha naḥ vardhaya rayim
translated: This is thy natural place of birth, whence thou wast born refulgent. Knowing that, O Agni, mount thou, and increase our substance.

original: tapaś ca tapasyaś ca śaiśirāv ṛtū agner antaḥśleṣo 'si kalpetāṃ dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpa oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthaṅ nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ / ye agnayaḥ samanaso 'ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime śaiśirāv ṛtū abhikalpamānā indram iva devā abhisaṃ viśantu tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //
analyzed: tapaḥ ca tapasyaḥ ca śaiśirau ṛtū agneḥ antaḥśleṣaḥ u si kalpetām dyāvāpṛthivī kalpantām āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ kalpantām agnayaḥ pṛthak nama jyaiṣṭhyāya savratāḥ   ye agnayaḥ samanasaḥ ntarā dyāvāpṛthivī ime śaiśirau ṛtū abhikalpamānāḥ indram iva devāḥ abhisam viśantu tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruve sīdatam
translated: Tapas and Tapasya are the two winter seasons. Thou art the inner cement of Agni. Be the two worlds disposed in order. Be the waters disposed in order. Be the plants disposed in order. Be the fires disposed in order, each one according to his wont, for preeminence, of one mind, the fires which are between the sky and the earth, the two winter seasons being disposed in order, let them enter into Indra as the gods into the god. With that deity, in the manner of Angiras, sit ye firm.

original: parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatu divas pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīm / viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāyodānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya / sūryas te 'dhipatis tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvā sīda //
analyzed: parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatu divaḥ pṛṣṭhe jyotiṣmatīm      viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya vyānāya udānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya    sūryaḥ te dhipatiḥ tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvā sīda
translated: May Parameshthin settle thee on the back of the sky, full of light, for all expiration, for inspiration, for cross-breathing, for the up-breathing, for support, for movement. Sûrya is thy overlord. With that deity, in the manner of Angiras, do thou sit firm.

original: lokaṃ pṛṇa chidraṃ pṛṇātho sīda dhruvā tvam / indrāgnī tvā bṛhaspatir asmin yonāv asīṣadan //
analyzed: lokam pṛṇa chidram pṛṇa atha u sīda dhruvā tvam indra agnī tvā bṛhaspatiḥ asmin yonau asīṣadan
translated: Fill the region, fill the gap, and sit firm. Indra, Agni, and Brihaspati have settled thee in this womb.

original: tā asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ / janman devānāṃ viśas triṣv ā rocane divaḥ //
analyzed: tāḥ asya sūdadohasaḥ somam śrīṇanti pṛśnayaḥ   janman devānām viśaḥ triṣu ā rocane divaḥ
translated: These dappled ones, the milkers of his milk, mix the Soma for him, the clans of the gods, in the three luminous realms of the sky.

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam rathīnāṃ vājānām satpatiṃ patim //
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim
translated: The best of charioteers among the charioteers, the lord of strength, the lord.🔽The horse neighs like one let loose upon the barley-field, when he hath stepped forth from the great enclosure.

original: prothad aśvo na yavase 'viṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇād vy asthāt / ād asya vāto anu vāti śocir adha sma te vrajanaṃ kṛṣṇam asti //
analyzed: prothat aśvaḥ na yavase viṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇāt vi asthāt    āt asya vātaḥ anu vāti śociḥ adha sma te vrajanam kṛṣṇam asti
translated: The wind blows after his flame. Then is thy path black.🔽In the abode of the ocean, in the shade of the vault, I place thee, O life-giving one.

original: āyoṣ ṭvā sadane sādayāmy avataś chāyāyām samudrasya hṛdaye / raśmīvatīṃ bhāsvatīm ā yā dyāṃ bhāsy ā pṛthivīm orv antarikṣam //
analyzed: āyoḥ tvā sadane sādayāmi avataḥ chāyāyām samudrasya hṛdaye raśmīvatīm bhāsvatīm ā yā dyām bhāsi ā pṛthivīm ā uru antarikṣam
translated: Rich in rays, shining, thou who shinest to the sky, to the earth, to the broad atmosphere.

original: parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatu divas pṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīṃ prathasvatīm divaṃ yaccha divaṃ dṛmha divaṃ mā himsīḥ //
analyzed: parameṣṭhī tvā sādayatu divaḥ pṛṣṭhe vyacasvatīm prathasvatīm divam yaccha divam dṛmha divam mā himsīḥ
translated: May Prajapati place thee on the back of the sky, expansive, wide-spreading. Support the sky, strengthen the sky, harm not the sky.

original: viśvasmai prāṇāyāpānāya vyānāyodānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya //
analyzed: viśvasmai prāṇāya apānāya vyānāya udānāya pratiṣṭhāyai caritrāya
translated: For all the in-breath, the out-breath, the through-breath, the up-breath, for support, for movement.

original: sūryas tvābhi pātu mahyā svastyā chardiṣā śaṃtamena tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruve sīdatam //
analyzed: sūryaḥ tvā abhi pātu mahyā svastyā chardiṣā śaṃtamena tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruve sīdatam
translated: May Surya protect thee with great welfare, with the most auspicious shelter. With that deity, like Angiras, sit ye firm.

original: sahasrasya pramāsi / sahasrasya pratimāsi / sahasrasyonmāsi / sāhasro 'si / sahasrāya tvā //
analyzed: sahasrasya pramā asi    sahasrasya pratimā asi     sahasrasya unmā asi
translated: Thou art the measure of a thousand. Thou art the counterpart of a thousand. Thou art the counterpart of a thousand. Thou art a thousandfold. For a thousand thee.

original: namas te rudra manyava uto ta iṣave namaḥ / bāhubhyām uta te namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ te rudra manyave uta u te iṣave namaḥ    bāhubhyām uta te namaḥ
translated: Homage to thee, O Rudra, for thy wrath, and homage to thy shaft. And homage to thy arms.

original: yā te rudra śivā tanūr aghorāpāpakāśinī / tayā nas tanvā śaṃtamayā giriśantābhi cākaśīhi //
analyzed: yā te rudra śivā tanūḥ aghora a pāpa kāśinī    tayā naḥ tanvā śaṃtamayā giriśanta abhi cākaśīhi
translated: With that most auspicious form of thine, O Rudra, which is harmless, not terrible, not frightful, look thou upon us with that most auspicious form of thine, O thou who art to be praised by the mountains.

original: yām iṣuṃ giriśanta haste bibharṣy astave / śivāṃ giritra tāṃ kuru mā himsīḥ puruṣaṃ jagat //
analyzed: yām iṣum giriśanta haste bibharṣi astave   / śivām giritra tām kuru mā himsīḥ puruṣam jagat
translated: The arrow which thou bearest in thy hand, O thou who art to be praised by the mountains, to be shot, make that, O Lord of the mountains, auspicious to us. Injure not man, injure not the world.

original: śivena vacasā tvā giriśācchā vadāmasi / yathā naḥ sarvam ij jagad ayakṣmam sumanā asat //
analyzed: śivena vacasā tvā giriśa acchā vadāmasi    yathā naḥ sarvam id jagat ayakṣmam su manāḥ asat
translated: With a propitious speech we address thee, O Lord of the mountains, that all this world may be well-disposed to us, and free from sickness.

original: adhy avocad adhivaktā prathamo daivyo bhiṣak / ahīmś ca sarvān jambhayant sarvāś ca yātudhānyo 'dharācīḥ parā suva //
analyzed: adhi avocat adhivaktā prathamaḥ daivyaḥ bhiṣak    ahīm ca sarvān jambhayan sarvāḥ ca yātudhānyaḥ dharācīḥ parā suva
translated: The divine physician, the first, the overseer, hath spoken. Having crushed all the serpents, and all the witches, drive them downward, drive them away.

original: asau yas tāmro aruṇa uta babhruḥ sumaṅgalaḥ / ye cainam rudrā abhito dikṣu śritāḥ sahasraśo 'vaiṣām heḍa īmahe //
analyzed: asau yaḥ tāmraḥ aruṇaḥ uta babhruḥ su maṅgalaḥ   ye ca enam rudrāḥ abhitas dikṣu śritāḥ sahasraśas vā eṣām heḍaḥ īmahe
translated: He who is coppery-red, ruddy, and brown, and very auspicious, and those Rudras who are around him in the quarters, a thousand in number, their wrath we appease.

original: asau yo 'vasarpati nīlagrīvo vilohitaḥ / utainaṃ gopā adṛśrann adṛśrann udahāryaḥ sa dṛṣto mṛḍayāti naḥ //
analyzed: asau yaḥ vasarpati nīlagrīvaḥ vilohitaḥ   uta enam gopāḥ adṛśran adṛśran udahāryaḥ sa dṛṣtaḥ mṛḍayāti naḥ
translated: He who creeps along, blue-necked, red-limbed, the cowherds have seen him, the milkmen have seen him. He, when seen, is gracious to us.

original: namo 'stu nīlagrīvāya sahasrākṣāya mīḍhuṣe / atho ye asya satvāno 'haṃ tebhyo 'karaṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ stu nīlagrīvāya sahasrākṣāya mīḍhuṣe   atho ye asya satvānaḥ ham tebhyaḥ karam namaḥ
translated: Homage to him whose neck is blue, to the thousand-eyed, to the bountiful one. And also to his powers, to them all have I paid homage.

original: pra muñca dhanvanas tvam ubhayor ārtnyor jyām / yāś ca te hasta iṣavaḥ parā tā bhagavo vapa //
analyzed: pra muñca dhanvanaḥ tvam ubhayoḥ ārtnyoḥ jyām    yāḥ ca te haste iṣavaḥ parā tāḥ bhagavas vapa
translated: Unstring thy bow, O Dhanvan, from both its ends, and let the arrows that are in thy hand fall down, O Bhaga.

original: vijyaṃ dhanuḥ kapardino viśalyo vāṇavām uta / aneśann asya yā iṣava ābhur asya niṣaṅgadhiḥ //🔽yā te hetir mīḍhuṣṭama haste babhūva te dhanuḥ / tayāsmān viśvatas tvam ayakṣmayā pari bhuja //
analyzed: vijyam dhanuḥ kapardinaḥ viśalyaḥ vāṇavām uta  / aneśan asya yāḥ iṣavaḥ ābhuḥ asya niṣaṅgadhiḥ  yā te hetiḥ mīḍhuṣṭama haste babhūva te dhanuḥ    tayā asmān viśvatas tvam ayakṣmayā pari bhuja
translated: The bow of Kapardin is unstrung, and the quiver is empty. The arrows that were his have gone away, and the quiver is left behind.🔽Thy shaft, O most bountiful one, that hath been in thy hand, thy bow, with that, O Bhaga, from all sides, free us from consumption.

original: pari te dhanvano hetir asmān vṛṇaktu viśvataḥ / atho ya iṣudhis tavāre asman ni dhehi tam //
analyzed: pari te dhanvanaḥ hetiḥ asmān vṛṇaktu viśvatas   atha u yaḥ iṣudhiḥ tava āre asmat ni dhehi tam
translated: Let the shaft of thy bow avoid us from all sides. And the quiver that is thine, place thou far away from us.

original: avatatya dhanuṣ ṭvam sahasrākṣa śateṣudhe / niśīrya śalyānāṃ mukhā śivo naḥ sumanā bhava //
analyzed: avatatya dhanuḥ tvam sahasrākṣa śata iṣudhe    niśīrya śalyānām mukhā śivaḥ naḥ su manāḥ bhava
translated: Having unstrung thy bow, O thou of a thousand eyes, O thou of a hundred quivers, having loosened the points of thy arrows, be gracious and well-disposed to us.

original: namas ta āyudhāyānātatāya dhṛṣṇave / ubhābhyām uta te namo bāhubhyāṃ tava dhanvane //
analyzed: namaḥ te āyudhāya an ātatāya dhṛṣṇave    ubhābhyām uta te namaḥ bāhubhyām tava dhanvane
translated: Homage to thy weapon, O thou who never failest, to thy dart, to both thy arms, and to thy bow.

original: mā no mahāntam uta mā no arbhakaṃ mā na ukṣantam uta mā na ukṣitam / mā no vadhīḥ pitaraṃ mota mātaraṃ mā naḥ priyās tanvo rudra rīriṣaḥ //
analyzed: mā naḥ mahāntam uta mā naḥ arbhakam mā naḥ ukṣantam uta mā naḥ ukṣitam   / mā naḥ vadhīḥ pitaram mā uta mātaram mā naḥ priyāḥ tanvaḥ rudra rīriṣaḥ
translated: Harm not our great one, harm not our infant, harm not our bull, harm not our bullock. Harm not our father, harm not our mother. Harm not our dear bodies, O Rudra.

original: mā nas toke tanaye mā na āyuṣi mā no goṣu mā no aśveṣu rīriṣaḥ / mā no vīrān rudra bhāmino vadhīr haviṣmantaḥ sadam it tvā havāmahe //
analyzed: mā naḥ toke tanaye mā naḥ āyuṣi mā naḥ goṣu mā naḥ aśveṣu rīriṣaḥ     mā naḥ vīrān rudra bhāminaḥ vadhīḥ haviṣmantaḥ sadam id tvā havāmahe
translated: Harm us not in our offspring, harm us not in our life, harm us not in our cows, harm us not in our horses. Harm not our heroes, O Rudra, who are to be cherished. We always invoke thee with oblations.

original: namo hiraṇyabāhave senānye diśāṃ ca pataye namo namo vṛkṣebhyo harikeśebhyaḥ paśūnāṃ pataye namo namaḥ śaṣpiñjarāya tviṣīmate pathīnāṃ pataye namo namp harikeśāyopavītine puṣṭānāṃ pataye namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ hiraṇyabāhave senānye diśām ca pataye namaḥ namaḥ vṛkṣebhyaḥ hari keśebhyaḥ paśūnām pataye namaḥ namaḥ śaṣpiñjarāya tviṣīmate pathīnām pataye namaḥ namp hari keśāya upavītine puṣṭānām pataye namaḥ
translated: Homage to the golden-armed commander, to the lord of the quarters, homage. Homage to the trees with tawny hair, to the lord of cattle, homage. Homage to the crackling, sparkling lord of paths, homage. Homage to the tawny-haired one who wears the sacred thread, to the lord of the nourished ones, homage.

original: namo babhluśāya vyādhine 'nnānāṃ pataye namo namo bhavasya hetyai jagatāṃ pataye namo namo rudrāyātatāyine kṣetrāṇāṃ pataye namo namaḥ sūtāyāhantyaivanānāṃ pataye namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ babhluśāya vyādhine nnānām pataye namaḥ namaḥ bhavasya hetyai jagatām pataye namaḥ namaḥ rudrāya ātatāyine kṣetrāṇām pataye namaḥ namaḥ sūtāya ahantyai vanānām pataye namaḥ
translated: Homage to the diseased one with scabs, to the lord of food, homage. Homage to Bhava's dart, to the lord of wanderers, homage. Homage to Rudra who stretches out, to the lord of fields, homage. Homage to the slayer who is born, to the lord of the various, homage.

original: namo rohitāya sthapataye vṛkṣāṇāṃ pataye namo namo bhuvantaye vārivaskṛtāyauṣadhīnāṃ pataye namo namo mantriṇe vāṇijāya kakṣāṇāṃ pataye namo nama uccairghoṣāyākrandayate pattīnāṃ pataye namaḥ //🔽namaḥ kṛtsnāyatayā dhāvate satvanāṃ pataye namo namaḥ sahamānāya nivyādhina āvyādhinīnāṃ pataye namo namo niṣaṅgiṇe kakubhāya stenānāṃ pataye namo nam nicerave paricarāyāraṇyānāṃ pataye namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ rohitāya sthapataye vṛkṣāṇām pataye namaḥ namaḥ bhuvantaye vārivaskṛtāya oṣadhīnām pataye namaḥ namaḥ mantriṇe vāṇijāya kakṣāṇām pataye namaḥ namaḥ uccairghoṣāya ākrandayate pattīnām pataye namaḥ  namaḥ kṛtsna āyatayā dhāvate satvanām pataye namaḥ namaḥ sahamānāya nivyādhine āvyādhinīnām pataye namaḥ namaḥ niṣaṅgiṇe kakubhāya stenānām pataye namaḥ nam nicerave paricarāya araṇyānām pataye namaḥ
translated: Homage to the Red One, to the Architect, to the Lord of trees, homage! Homage to the Mover, to the Water-maker, to the Lord of plants, homage! Homage to the Counsellor, to the Trader, to the Lord of the shoulders, homage! Homage to the One of Loud Voice, to the Shouter, to the Lord of foot-soldiers, homage!🔽Homage to the One who runs in all directions, to the Lord of living beings, homage! Homage to the Conqueror, to the One who pierces, to the Lord of the piercing ones, homage! Homage to the Quiver-bearer, to the Archer, to the Lord of thieves, homage! Homage to the One who moves low, to the One who moves around, to the Lord of the wild beasts, homage!

original: namo vañcate parivañcate stāyūnāṃ pataye namo namo niṣaṅgiṇa iṣudhimate taskarāṇāṃ pataye namo namaḥ sṛkāyibhyo jighāmsadbhyo muṣṇatāṃ pataye namo namo 'simadbhyo naktaṃ caradbhyo vikṛntānāṃ pataye namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ vañcate parivañcate stāyūnām pataye namaḥ namaḥ niṣaṅgiṇe iṣudhimate taskarāṇām pataye namaḥ namaḥ sṛkāyibhyaḥ jighāmsadbhyaḥ muṣṇatām pataye namaḥ namaḥ simadbhyaḥ naktam caradbhyaḥ vikṛntānām pataye namaḥ
translated: Homage to the One who deceives, to the One who deceives around, to the Lord of the birds, homage! Homage to the Quiver-bearer, to the One who has arrows, to the Lord of robbers, homage! Homage to the Spear-men, to the Desirous Ones, to the Lord of the plunderers, homage! Homage to the Sword-bearers, to the Night-wanderers, to the Lord of the deformed ones, homage!

original: nama uṣṇīṣiṇe giricarāya kuluñcānāṃ pataye namo nama iṣumadhbyo dhanvāyibhyaś ca vo namo nama ātanvānebhyaḥ pratidadhānebhyaś ca vo namo nama āyacchadbhyo 'syadbhyaś ca vo namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ uṣṇīṣiṇe giri carāya kuluñcānām pataye namaḥ namaḥ iṣumadhbyaḥ dhanvāyibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ ātanvānebhyaḥ pratidadhānebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ āyacchadbhyaḥ syadbhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to the turbaned, to the mountain-wanderers, to the lords of the Kuluchas, homage. Homage to you, the bowmen, and to the archers, homage. Homage to you, the stringers, and to the counter-stringers, homage. Homage to you, the bow-holders, and to the bow-loosers, homage.

original: namo visṛjadbhyo vidhyadbhyaś ca vo namo namaḥ svapadbhyo jāgradbhyaś ca vo namo namaḥ śayānebhya āsīnebhyaś ca vo namo namas tiṣṭhadbhyo dhāvadbhyaś ca vo namaḥ //🔽namaḥ sabhābhyaḥ sabhāpatibhyaś ca vo namo namo 'śvebhyo 'śvapatibhyaś ca vo namo nama āvyādhinībhyo vividhyantībhyaś ca vo namo nama ugaṇābhyas tṛmhatībhyaś ca vo namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ visṛjadbhyaḥ vidhyadbhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ svapadbhyaḥ jāgradbhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ śayānebhyaḥ āsīnebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ tiṣṭhadbhyaḥ dhāvadbhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ  namaḥ sabhābhyaḥ sabhā patibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ śvebhyaḥ śva patibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ āvyādhinībhyaḥ vividhyantībhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ ugaṇābhyaḥ tṛmhatībhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to you, the dischargers, and to the piercers, homage. Homage to you, the sleepers, and to the watchers, homage. Homage to you, the recumbent, and to the seated, homage. Homage to you, the standing, and to the running, homage.

original: namo gaṇebhyo gaṇapatibhyaś ca vo namo namo vrātebhyo vrātapatibhyaś ca vo namo namgṛtsebhyo gṛtsapatibhyaś ca vo namo namo virūpebhyo viśvarūpebhyaś ca vo namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ gaṇebhyaḥ gaṇa patibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ vrātebhyaḥ vrāta patibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ nam gṛtsebhyaḥ gṛtsa patibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ virūpebhyaḥ viśvarūpebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to the assemblies, and to the lords of assemblies, homage. Homage to you, the horses, and to the lords of horses, homage. Homage to you, the tormentors, and to the piercers, homage. Homage to you, the heaped-up, and to the crushing, homage.🔽Homage to the bands, and to the lords of bands, homage. Homage to you, the troops, and to the lords of troops, homage. Homage to you, the eager, and to the lords of the eager, homage. Homage to you, the deformed, and to the multi-formed, homage.

original: namaḥ senābhyaḥ senānibhyaś ca vo namo namo rathibhyo aratebhyaś ca vo namo namaḥ kṣattṛbhyaḥ saṃgrahītṛbhyaś ca vo namo namo mahadbhyo arbhakebhyaś ca vo namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ senābhyaḥ senānibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ rathibhyaḥ a ratebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ kṣattṛbhyaḥ saṃgrahītṛbhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ mahadbhyaḥ arbhakebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to the armies and to your army leaders. Homage to you charioteers and to your non-charioteers. Homage to you householders and to your treasurers. Homage to you great ones and to your young ones.

original: namas takṣabhyo rathakārebhyaś ca vo namo namaḥ kulālebhyaḥ kurmārebhyaś ca vo namo namo niṣādebhyaḥ puñjiṣṭebhyaś ca vo namo namaḥ śvanibhyo mṛgayubhyaś ca vo namaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ takṣabhyaḥ rathakārebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ kulālebhyaḥ kurmārebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ niṣādebhyaḥ puñjiṣṭebhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ śvanibhyaḥ mṛgayubhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ
translated: Homage to you carpenters and to your chariot-makers. Homage to you potters and to your basket-makers. Homage to you fishermen and to your hunters. Homage to you dog-keepers and to your fowlers.

original: namaḥ śvabhyaḥ śvapatibhyaś ca vo namo namo bhavāya ca rudrāya ca namaḥ śarvāya ca paśupataye ca namo nīlagrīvāya ca śitikaṇṭhāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ śvabhyaḥ śva patibhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ bhavāya ca rudrāya ca  namaḥ śarvāya ca paśupataye ca namaḥ nīlagrīvāya ca śitikaṇṭhāya ca
translated: Homage to dogs and to their lords. Homage to you Bhava and Rudra. Homage to Sharva and Pashupati. Homage to the blue-throated and the white-necked.

original: namaḥ kapardine ca vyuptakeśāya ca namaḥ sahasrākṣāya ca śatadhanvane ca namo giriśayāya ca śipiviṣṭāya ca namo mīḍhuṣṭamāya ceṣumate ca //
analyzed: namaḥ kapardine ca vyupta keśāya ca namaḥ sahasrākṣāya ca śatadhanvane ca namaḥ giriśayāya ca śipiviṣṭāya ca namaḥ mīḍhuṣṭamāya ca iṣumate ca
translated: Homage to the matted-haired and the shaved-headed. Homage to the thousand-eyed and the hundred-bowed. Homage to the mountain-dweller and the one with consumption. Homage to the most bountiful and to the archer.

original: namo hrasvāya ca vāmanāya ca namo bṛhate ca varṣīyase ca namo vṛddhāya ca savṛdhe ca namo 'gryāya ca prathamāya ca //🔽nama āśave cājirāya ca namaḥ śīghryāya ca śībhyāya ca nama ūrmyāya cāvasvanyāya ca namo nādeyāya ca dvīpyāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ hrasvāya ca vāmanāya ca namaḥ bṛhate ca varṣīyase ca namaḥ vṛddhāya ca savṛdhe ca namaḥ gryāya ca prathamāya ca  namaḥ āśave ca ajirāya ca namaḥ śīghryāya ca śībhyāya ca namaḥ ūrmyāya ca avasvanyāya ca namaḥ nādeyāya ca dvīpyāya ca
translated: Homage to the short one and the dwarf, homage to the great one and the oldest, homage to the aged one and the prosperous, homage to the foremost and the first.🔽Homage to the swift one and the slow one, homage to the quick one and the speedy one, homage to the wavy one and the noisy one, homage to the riverine one and the island one.

original: namo jyeṣṭhāya ca kaniṣṭhāya ca namaḥ pūrvajāya cāparajāya ca namo madhyamāya cāpagalbhāya ca namo jaghanyāya ca budhnyāya ca //🔽namaḥ somyāya ca pratisaryāya ca namo yāmyāya ca kṣemyāya ca namaḥ ślokyāya cāvasānyāya ca nama urvaryāya ca khalyāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ jyeṣṭhāya ca kaniṣṭhāya ca namaḥ pūrva jāya ca apara jāya ca namaḥ madhyamāya ca apagalbhāya ca namaḥ jaghanyāya ca budhnyāya ca  namaḥ somyāya ca pratisaryāya ca namaḥ yāmyāya ca kṣemyāya ca  namaḥ ślokyāya ca avasānyāya ca namaḥ urvaryāya ca khalyāya ca
translated: Homage to the eldest and the youngest, homage to the firstborn and the lastborn, homage to the middle one and the bold one, homage to the lowest and the firm one.🔽Homage to the Soma-worthy one and the returning one, homage to the Yama-worthy one and the secure one, homage to the praiseworthy one and the concluding one, homage to the fertile one and the barren one.

original: namo vanyāya ca kakṣṇyāya ca namaḥ śravāya ca pratiśravāya ca nama āśuṣeṇāya cāśurathāya ca namaḥ śūrāya cāvabhedine ca //
analyzed: namaḥ vanyāya ca kakṣṇyāya ca namaḥ śravāya ca pratiśravāya ca  namaḥ āśuṣeṇāya ca āśu rathāya ca namaḥ śūrāya ca avabhedine ca
translated: Homage to the forest one and the thicket one, homage to the famous one and the renowned one, homage to the swift-chariot one and the swift-vehicle one, homage to the heroic one and the penetrating one.

original: namo bilmine ca kavacine ca namo varmiṇe ca varūthine ca namaḥ śrutāya ca śrutasenāya ca namo dundubhyāya cāhananyāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ bilmine ca kavacine ca namaḥ varmiṇe ca varūthine ca namaḥ śrutāya ca śruta senāya ca namaḥ dundubhyāya ca āhananyāya ca
translated: Homage to Bilmina and Kavachina, homage to Varmina and Varuthina, homage to Shruta and Shruta-sena, homage to Dundubhya and Ahananya.

original: namo dhṛṣṇave ca pramṛśāya ca namo niṣaṅgiṇe ceṣudhimate ca namas tīkṣṇeṣave cāyudhine ca namaḥ svāyudhāya ca sudhanvane ca //
analyzed: namaḥ dhṛṣṇave ca pramṛśāya ca namaḥ niṣaṅgiṇe ca iṣudhimate ca  namaḥ tīkṣṇa iṣave ca āyudhine ca namaḥ su āyudhāya ca su dhanvane ca
translated: Homage to Dhrisnava and Pramrisha, homage to Nishajgin and Ishudhimata, homage to Tishneshava and Ayudhin, homage to Sva-ayudha and Sudhanva.

original: namaḥ srutyāya ca pathyāya ca namaḥ kāṭyāya ca nīpyāya ca namaḥ kulyāya ca sarasyāya ca namo nādeyāya ca vaiśantāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ srutyāya ca pathyāya ca namaḥ kāṭyāya ca nīpyāya ca namaḥ kulyāya ca sarasyāya ca namaḥ nādeyāya ca vaiśantāya ca
translated: Homage to Srutya and Pathya, homage to Katya and Nipya, homage to Kulyaya and Sarasyaya, homage to Nadiya and Vaishanta.

original: namaḥ kūpyāya cāvaṭyāya ca namo vīdhryāya cātapyāya ca namo meghyāya ca ca vidyutyāya namo varṣyāya cāvarṣyāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ kūpyāya ca avaṭyāya ca namaḥ vīdhryāya ca ātapyāya ca namaḥ meghyāya ca ca vidyutyāya namaḥ varṣyāya ca a varṣyāya ca
translated: Homage to Koopyaya and Avata, homage to Vidhrya and Atapa, homage to Meghaya and Vidyutya, homage to Varshya and Avarshya.

original: namo vātyāya ca reṣmyāya ca namo vāstavyāya ca vāstupāya ca namaḥ somāya ca rudrāya ca namas tāmrāya cāruṇāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ vātyāya ca reṣmyāya ca namaḥ vāstavyāya ca vāstupāya ca  / namaḥ somāya ca rudrāya ca namaḥ tāmrāya ca aruṇāya ca
translated: Homage to Vatyaya and Reshya, homage to Vastavya and Vastupa, homage to Soma and Rudra, homage to Tamra and Aruna.

original: namaḥ śaṃgave ca paśupataye ca nama ugrāya ca bhīmāya ca namo agrevadhāya ca dūrevadhāya ca namo hantre ca hanīyase ca namo vṛkṣebhyo harikeśebhyo namas tārāya //
analyzed: namaḥ śaṃgave ca paśupataye ca namaḥ ugrāya ca bhīmāya ca namaḥ agrevadhāya ca dūrevadhāya ca namaḥ hantre ca hanīyase ca namaḥ vṛkṣebhyaḥ hari keśebhyaḥ namaḥ tārāya
translated: Homage to the fierce one and to the terrible one. Homage to the one who kills in front and to the one who kills from afar. Homage to the killer and to the one who is to be killed. Homage to the trees with tawny hair. Homage to Tara.

original: namaḥ śambhavāya ca mayobhavāya ca namaḥ śaṃkarāya ca mayaskarāya ca namaḥ śivāya ca śivatarāya ca //🔽namaḥ pāryāya cāvāryāya ca namaḥ prataraṇāya cottaraṇāya ca namas tīrthyāya ca kūlyāya ca namaḥ śaṣpyāya ca phenyāya ca //🔽namaḥ sikatyāya ca pravāhyāya ca namaḥ kimśilāya ca kṣayaṇāya ca namaḥ kapardine ca pulastaye ca nama iriṇyāya ca prapathyāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ śambhavāya ca mayobhavāya ca namaḥ śaṃkarāya ca mayaskarāya ca namaḥ śivāya ca śivatarāya ca  namaḥ pāryāya ca avāryāya ca namaḥ prataraṇāya ca uttaraṇāya ca namaḥ tīrthyāya ca kūlyāya ca namaḥ śaṣpyāya ca phenyāya ca  namaḥ sikatyāya ca pravāhyāya ca namaḥ kimśilāya ca kṣayaṇāya ca namaḥ kapardine ca pulastaye ca namaḥ iriṇyāya ca prapathyāya ca
translated: Homage to the one who brings peace and to the one who brings bliss. Homage to the one who brings prosperity and to the one who brings happiness. Homage to Shiva and to the one more auspicious than Shiva.🔽Homage to the one who goes to the other shore and to the one who goes to the near shore. Homage to the one who crosses over and to the one who crosses back. Homage to the one who goes to the ford and to the one who goes to the bank. Homage to the one who goes to the grass and to the one who goes to the foam.🔽Homage to the one who goes to the sandy bank and to the one who goes to the current. Homage to the one who goes to the rocky shore and to the one who goes to the pebbles. Homage to the one who goes to the matted locks and to the one who goes to the sacrificial grass. Homage to the one who goes to the path and to the one who goes to the crossroads.

original: namo vrajyāya ca goṣṭhyāya ca namas talpyāya ca gehyāya ca namo hṛdayyāya ca niveṣyāya ca namaḥ kāṭyāya ca gahvareṣṭhāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ vrajyāya ca goṣṭhyāya ca namaḥ talpyāya ca gehyāya ca namaḥ hṛdayyāya ca niveṣyāya ca namaḥ kāṭyāya ca gahvareṣṭhāya ca
translated: Homage to the one who goes to the village and to the one who goes to the cow pen. Homage to the one who goes to the bed and to the one who goes to the house. Homage to the one who goes to the heart and to the one who goes to the dwelling. Homage to the one who goes to the field and to the one who dwells in the cave.

original: namaḥ śuṣkyāya ca harityāya ca namaḥ pāmsavyāya ca rajasyāya ca namo lopyāya colapyāya ca nama ūrvyāya ca sūrvyāya ca //
analyzed: namaḥ śuṣkyāya ca harityāya ca namaḥ pāmsavyāya ca rajasyāya ca  namaḥ lopyāya ca ulapyāya ca namaḥ ūrvyāya ca sūrvyāya ca
translated: Homage to the Dry One and the Green One. Homage to the Sandy One and the Dusty One. Homage to the Destroyer and the Destroyer of the Destroyer. Homage to the Plougher and the Good Plougher.

original: namaḥ parṇāya ca parṇaśadāya ca nama udguramāṇāya cābhighnate ca nama ākhidate ca prakhidate ca nama iṣukṛdbhyo dhanuṣkṛdbhyas ca vo namo namo vaḥ kirikebhyo devānām hṛdayebhyo namo vicinvatkebhyo namo vikṣiṇatkebhyo nama ānirhatebhyaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ parṇāya ca parṇa śadāya ca namaḥ udguramāṇāya ca abhighnate ca  / namaḥ ākhidate ca prakhidate ca namaḥ iṣu kṛdbhyaḥ dhanuṣkṛdbhyaḥ ca vaḥ namaḥ namaḥ vaḥ kirikebhyaḥ devānām hṛdayebhyaḥ namaḥ vicinvatkebhyaḥ namaḥ vikṣiṇatkebhyaḥ namaḥ ā nirhatebhyaḥ
translated: Homage to the Leafer and the Leafer-cutter. Homage to the Udgurâna and the Abhigna. Homage to the Akhida and the Prakhada. Homage to the makers of arrows and the makers of bows. Homage to you all. Homage to you, O Kirîkas, to the hearts of the gods. Homage to the seekers, homage to the scatterers. Homage to the unvanquished.

original: drāpe andhasas pate daridra nīlalohita / āsāṃ prajānām eṣāṃ paśūnāṃ mā bher mā roṅ mo ca naḥ kiṃ canāmamat //
analyzed: drāpe andhasaḥ pate daridra nīlalohita    āsām prajānām eṣām paśūnām mā bheḥ mā roṣ mā u ca naḥ kim cana amamat  /
translated: O Drapa, lord of the essence, be poor, O Nîlalohita. Do not injure these people, these cattle. Do not injure us in any way.

original: imā rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya pra bharāmahe matīḥ / yathā śam asad dvipade catuṣpade viśvaṃ puṣṭaṃ grāme asminn anāturam //
analyzed: imāḥ rudrāya tavase kapardine kṣayadvīrāya pra bharāmahe matīḥ    yathā śam asat dvipade catuṣpade viśvam puṣṭam grāme asmin anāturam
translated: To Rudra, the mighty, the dread, we bring these hymns, to him whose heroes sleep. That he may be propitious to our quadrupeds and bipeds, to all our cattle in this village, to all that is not diseased.

original: yā te rudra śivā tanūḥ śivā viśvāhā bheṣajī / śivā rutasya bheṣajī tayā no mṛḍa jīvase //
analyzed: yā te rudra śivā tanūḥ śivā viśvāhā bheṣajī   śivā rutasya bheṣajī tayā naḥ mṛḍa jīvase
translated: That form of thine, O Rudra, which is propitious, propitious to all, which is a medicine, propitious to the cry of distress, which is a medicine, be thou propitious to us thereby for life.

original: pari no rudrasya hetir vṛṇaktu pari tveṣasya durmatir aghāyoḥ / ava sthirā maghavadbhyas tanuṣva mīḍhvas tokāya tanayāya mṛḍa //
analyzed: pari naḥ rudrasya hetiḥ vṛṇaktu pari tveṣasya durmatiḥ aghāyoḥ    ava sthirā maghavadbhyaḥ tanuṣva mīḍhvaḥ tokāya tanayāya mṛḍa
translated: May the dart of Rudra pass us by, the dart of him the terrible, the wicked, the malicious. Make firm the bows for the wealthy, be gracious to our children and to our offspring.

original: mīḍhuṣṭama śivatama śivo naḥ sumanā bhava / parame vṛkṣa āyudhaṃ nidhāya kṛttiṃ vasāna ā cara pinākaṃ bibhrad ā gahi //
analyzed: mīḍhuṣṭama śivatama śivaḥ naḥ su manāḥ bhava    parame vṛkṣe āyudham nidhāya kṛttim vasānaḥ ā cara pinākam bibhrat ā gahi
translated: Most bountiful, most auspicious, be gracious and well-disposed to us, O Śiva. Having laid aside thy weapon on the highest tree, clad in thy skin, come hither, bearing thy bow, come thou to us.

original: vikiridra vilohita namas te astu bhagavaḥ / yās te sahasram hetayo 'nyam asman ni vapantu tāḥ //
analyzed: vikiridra vilohita namaḥ te astu bhagavaḥ   yāḥ te sahasram hetayaḥ asmat ni vapantu tāḥ
translated: O thou of red hair, O thou of red garments, be it known to thee, O holy one, let thy thousand darts fall on another than us.

original: sahasrāṇi sahasraśo bāhvos tava hetayaḥ / tāsām īśāno bhagavaḥ parācīnā mukhā kṛdhi //
analyzed: sahasrāṇi sahasraśas bāhvoḥ tava hetayaḥ   tāsām īśānaḥ bhagavaḥ parācīnā mukhā kṛdhi
translated: In thy arms are a thousand, a thousand times a thousand darts. O holy one, be thou the lord of them, and turn their points away from us.

original: asaṃkhyātā sahasrāṇi ye rudrā adhi bhūmyām / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: asaṃkhyātā sahasrāṇi ye rudrāḥ adhi bhūmyām   teṣām sahasra yojane va dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: The Rudras who are innumerable by thousands on the earth, of them, on the path of a thousand leagues, we appease the shafts.

original: asmin mahaty arṇave 'ntarikṣe bhavā adhi / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: asmin mahati arṇave ntarikṣe bhavāḥ adhi  / teṣām sahasra yojane va dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: The Bhavas who are on this great ocean, in the atmosphere, of them, on the path of a thousand leagues, we appease the shafts.

original: nīlagrīvāḥ śitikaṇṭhā divam rudrā upāśritāḥ / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: nīlagrīvāḥ śitikaṇṭhāḥ divam rudrāḥ upāśritāḥ   teṣām sahasrayojane va dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: The Rudras whose necks are blue, whose throats are white, who are seated in the sky, of them, on the path of a thousand leagues, we appease the shafts.

original: nīlagrīvāḥ śitikaṇṭhāḥ śarvā adhaḥ kṣamācarāḥ / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: nīlagrīvāḥ śitikaṇṭhāḥ śarvāḥ adhas kṣamā carāḥ   teṣām sahasra yojane va dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: The Rudras, blue-necked, white-throated, who dwell below the earth,🔽On their thousand-yoked way we lay the shafts.🔽The Rudras, tawny-hued, blue-necked, red-coloured, who dwell in the trees,

original: ye vṛkṣeṣu śaṣpiñjarā nīlagrīvā vilohitāḥ / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //🔽ye bhūtānām adhipatayo viśikhāsaḥ kapardinaḥ / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //🔽ye pathāṃ pathirakṣasa ailabṛdā āyuryudhaḥ / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: ye vṛkṣeṣu śaṣpiñjarāḥ nīlagrīvāḥ vilohitāḥ   teṣām sahasra yojane va dhanvāni tanmasi  ye bhūtānām adhipatayaḥ viśikhāsaḥ kapardinaḥ    teṣām sahasra yojane va dhanvāni tanmasi  ye pathām pathirakṣasaḥ ailabṛdāḥ āyuḥ yudhaḥ    teṣām sahasra yojane vaḥ dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: On their thousand-yoked way we lay the shafts.🔽The Rudras, lords of beings, wearing turbans and matted locks,🔽On their thousand-yoked way we lay the shafts.🔽The Rudras, guardians of the paths, wearing turbans and armour, fighting for life,

original: ye tīrthāni pracaranti sṛkāhastā niṣaṅgiṇaḥ / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: ye tīrthāni pracaranti sṛkā hastāḥ niṣaṅgiṇaḥ   teṣām sahasra yojane va dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: On their thousand-yoked way we lay the shafts.🔽The Rudras, carrying sacrificial ladles, wearing quivers, who move about at the sacred fords,🔽On their thousand-yoked way we lay the shafts.🔽The Rudras who pierce people in their food and drink in their vessels,

original: ye 'nneṣu vividhyanti pātreṣu pibato janān / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: ye nneṣu vividhyanti pātreṣu pibataḥ janān   teṣām sahasra yojane va dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: On their thousand-yoked way we lay the shafts.🔽The Rudras who dwell in the directions, as many as there are and more,

original: ye etāvantaś ca bhūyāmsaś ca diśo rudrā vitasthire / teṣām sahasrayojane 'va dhanvāni tanmasi //
analyzed: ye etāvantaḥ ca bhūyāmsaḥ ca diśaḥ rudrāḥ vitasthire   teṣām sahasra yojane vaḥ dhanvāni tanmasi
translated: On their thousand-yoked way we lay the shafts.

original: namo 'stu rudrebhyo ye divi yeṣāṃ varṣam iṣavaḥ / tebhyo daśa prācīr daśa dakṣiṇā daśa pratīcīr daśodīcīr daśordhvāḥ / tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //🔽namo 'stu rudrebhyo ye 'ntarikṣe yeṣāṃ vāta iṣavaḥ / tebhyo daśa prācīr daśa dakṣiṇā daśa pratīcīr daśodīcīr daśordhvāḥ / tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ stu rudrebhyaḥ ye divi yeṣām varṣam iṣavaḥ  / tebhyaḥ daśa prācīḥ daśa dakṣiṇāḥ daśa pratīcīḥ daśa udīcīḥ daśa ūrdhvāḥ    tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ  namaḥ stu rudrebhyaḥ ye ntarikṣe yeṣām vātaḥ iṣavaḥ    tebhyaḥ daśa prācīḥ daśa dakṣiṇāḥ daśa pratīcīḥ daśa udīcīḥ daśa ūrdhvāḥ    tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: Homage to the Rudras who are in the sky, whose arrow is rain. To them ten eastward, ten southward, ten westward, ten northward, ten upward. To them homage! May they protect us. May they be gracious to us. Him whom we hate and he who hates us, him we place in their jaws.🔽Homage to the Rudras who are in the atmosphere, whose arrow is the wind. To them ten eastward, ten southward, ten westward, ten northward, ten upward. To them homage! May they protect us. May they be gracious to us. Him whom we hate and he who hates us, him we place in their jaws.

original: namo 'stu rudrebhyo ye pṛthivyāṃ yeṣām annam iṣavaḥ / tebhyo daśa prācīr daśa dakṣiṇā daśa pratīcīr daśodīcīr daśordhvāḥ / tebhyo namo astu te no 'vantu te no mṛḍayantu te yaṃ dviṣmo yaś ca no dveṣṭi tam eṣāṃ jambhe dadhmaḥ //
analyzed: namaḥ stu rudrebhyaḥ ye pṛthivyām yeṣām annam iṣavaḥ  / tebhyaḥ daśa prācīḥ daśa dakṣiṇāḥ daśa pratīcīḥ daśa udīcīḥ daśa ūrdhvāḥ    tebhyaḥ namaḥ astu te naḥ vantu te naḥ mṛḍayantu te yam dviṣmaḥ yaḥ ca naḥ dveṣṭi tam eṣām jambhe dadhmaḥ
translated: Homage to the Rudras who are on the earth, whose arrow is food. To them ten eastward, ten southward, ten westward, ten northward, ten upward. To them homage! May they protect us. May they be gracious to us. Him whom we hate and he who hates us, him we place in their jaws.

original: aśmann ūrjaṃ parvate śiśriyāṇām adbhya oṣadhībhyo vanaspatibhyo 'dhi sambhṛtaṃ payaḥ / tāṃ na iṣam ūrjaṃ dhatta marutaḥ samrarāṇāḥ //
analyzed: aśman ūrjam parvate śiśriyāṇām adbhyaḥ oṣadhībhyaḥ vanaspatibhyaḥ dhi sambhṛtam payaḥ   tām naḥ iṣam ūrjam dhatta marutaḥ samrarāṇāḥ
translated: The strength that rests in the stone, in the mountain, in the waters, in the plants, in the trees, the milk that is collected from them, that food and strength bestow on us, O Maruts, when ye are angry.

original: aśmams te kṣut / mayi ta ūrk / yaṃ dviṣmas taṃ te śug ṛcchatu //🔽imā me agna iṣṭakā dhenavaḥ santv ekā ca daśa ca daśa ca śataṃ ca śataṃ ca sahasraṃ ca sahasraṃ cāyutaṃ cāyutaṃ ca niyutaṃ ca niyutaṃ ca prayutaṃ cārbudaṃ ca nyarbudam samudraś ca madhyaṃ cāntaś ca parārdhaś caitā me agna iṣṭakā dhenavaḥ santv amutrāmuṣmiṃl loke //
analyzed: aśmam te kṣudh   mayi te ūrj   yam dviṣmaḥ tam te śuc ṛcchatu  imāḥ me agne iṣṭakāḥ dhenavaḥ santu ekā ca daśa ca daśa ca śatam ca śatam ca sahasram ca sahasram ca ayutam ca ayutam ca niyutam ca niyutam ca prayutam ca arbudam ca nyarbudam samudraḥ ca madhyam ca antaḥ ca parārdhaḥ ca etāḥ me agne iṣṭakāḥ dhenavaḥ santu amutra amuṣmin loke
translated: The stone is thy hunger. In me is thy strength. Let thy heat reach him whom we hate.

original: ṛtava stha ṛtāvṛdha ṛtuṣṭhā stha ṛtāvṛdhaḥ / ghṛtaścyuto madhuścyuto virājo nāma kāmadughā akṣīyamāṇāḥ //🔽samudrasya tvāvakayāgne pari vyayāmasi / pāvako asmabhyam śivo bhava //
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ stha ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ṛtuṣṭhāḥ stha ṛtāvṛdhaḥ    ghṛtaścyutaḥ madhuścyutaḥ virājaḥ nāma kāmadughāḥ a kṣīyamāṇāḥ 🔽samudrasya tvā avakayā agne pari vyayāmasi    pāvakaḥ asmabhyam śivaḥ bhava
translated: Let these bricks of mine, O Agni, be milch cows to me, one and ten, and ten and a hundred, and a hundred and a thousand, and a thousand and ten thousand, and ten thousand and a hundred thousand, and a hundred thousand and a myriad, and a myriad and ten myriads, and ten myriads and a lakh, and a lakh and ten lakhs, and ten lakhs and a hundred lakhs, and a hundred lakhs and a koti, and a koti and ten kotis, and ten kotis and a hundred kotis, and a hundred kotis and a hundred kotis of myriads, and a hundred kotis of myriads and a hundred kotis of lakhs, and a hundred kotis of lakhs and a hundred kotis of kotis, and a hundred kotis of kotis and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of myriads, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of myriads and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of lakhs, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of kotis, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of myriads, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of myriads, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of lakhs, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of kotis, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of myriads, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of myriads, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of lakhs, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred kotis of kotis, and a hundred kotis of hundred kotis of hundred ko

original: himasya tvā jarāyuṇāgne pari vyayāmasi / pāvako asmabhyam śivo bhava //
analyzed: himasya tvā jarāyuṇā agne pari vyayāmasi   pāvakaḥ asmabhyam śivaḥ bhava
translated: We clothe thee, O Agni, with the caul of snow, with the caul of frost. Be thou pure and auspicious to us.

original: upa jmann upa vetase 'va tara nadīṣv ā / agne pittam apām asi / maṇḍūki tābhir ā gahi semaṃ no yajñaṃ pāvakavarṇam śivaṃ kṛdhi //
analyzed: upa jman upa vetase va tara nadīṣu ā  / agne pittam apām asi   / maṇḍūki tābhiḥ ā gahi sā imam naḥ yajñam pāvaka varṇam śivam kṛdhi
translated: On the earth, on the reed, sink down in the rivers, O Agni, thou art the bile of the waters. O Mandooki, come hither with them. Make this sacrifice of ours pure-coloured and auspicious.

original: apām idaṃ nyayanam samudrasya niveśanam / anyāms te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvako asmabhyam śivo bhava //
analyzed: apām idam nyayanam samudrasya niveśanam   anyān te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvakaḥ asmabhyam śivaḥ bhava
translated: This is the resting-place of the waters, the abode of the ocean. Let thy flames burn against others than us. Be thou pure and auspicious to us.

original: agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā / ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca //
analyzed: agne pāvaka rociṣā mandrayā deva jihvayā    ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
translated: O Agni, O purifying one, with thy bright and pleasant tongue, O god, bring the gods and worship them.

original: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdivo 'gne devām ihā vaha / upa yajñam haviś ca naḥ //
analyzed: sa naḥ pāvaka dīdivas gne devām iha ā vaha    upa yajñam haviḥ ca naḥ
translated: Do thou, O purifying one, O shining one, O Agni, bring hither the gods, and approach our sacrifice and our oblation.

original: pāvakayā yaś citayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruca uṣaso na bhānunā / tūrvan na yāmann etaśasya nū raṇa ā yo ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇo ajaraḥ //
analyzed: pāvakayā yaḥ citayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruce uṣasaḥ na bhānunā   tūrvan na yāman etaśasya nu raṇe ā yaḥ ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇaḥ ajaraḥ
translated: He who with his purifying thought, with his flame, shines on the surface of the earth, like the lights of the dawns, hastening like Etaṣa on his way, who is not satiated, not old in his wrath.

original: namas te harase śociṣe namas te astv arciṣe / anyāms te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvako asmabhyam śivo bhava //
analyzed: namaḥ te harase śociṣe namaḥ te astu arciṣe   anyān te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvakaḥ asmabhyam śivaḥ bhava
translated: Homage to thy flame, O Agni, homage to thy glow. Let thy flames burn against others than us. Be thou pure and auspicious to us.

original: nṛṣade veṭ / apsuṣade veṭ / barhiṣade veṭ / vanasade veṭ / svarvide veṭ //
analyzed: nṛṣade veṭ   apsuṣade veṭ   barhiṣade veṭ   vana sade veṭ    svar vide veṭ
translated: To the men-seated, Vet! To the water-seated, Vet! To the sacrificial grass-seated, Vet! To the forest-seated, Vet! To the heaven-finding, Vet!

original: ye devā devānāṃ yajñiyā yajñiyānām saṃvatsarīṇam upa bhāgam āsate / ahutādo haviṣo yajñe asmint svayaṃ pibantu madhuno ghṛtasya //
analyzed: ye devāḥ devānām yajñiyāḥ yajñiyānām saṃvatsarīṇam upa bhāgam āsate     a huta adaḥ haviṣaḥ yajñe asmin svayam pibantu madhunaḥ ghṛtasya
translated: Those gods among the gods, who are worthy of sacrifice, among the worthy of sacrifice, who sit in the annual portion, who are not eaters of the offered (oblation), may they themselves drink of the honey and ghee at this sacrifice.

original: ye devā deveṣv adhi devatvam āyan ye brahmaṇaḥ puraetāro asya / yebhyo na ṛte pavate dhāma kiṃ cana na te divo na pṛthivyā adhi snuṣu //
analyzed: ye devāḥ deveṣu adhi deva tvam āyan ye brahmaṇaḥ puraetāraḥ asya    yebhyaḥ na ṛte pavate dhāma kim cana na te divaḥ na pṛthivyāḥ adhi snuṣu  /
translated: Those gods who have attained godhead among the gods, who are the precursors of this Brahman, from whom nothing whatever proceeds without them, they are not in the sky nor on the earth, nor in the waters.

original: prāṇadā apānadā vyānadā varcodā varivodāḥ / anyāms te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvako asmabhyam śivo bhava //
analyzed: prāṇa dāḥ apāna dāḥ vyāna dāḥ varcaḥ dāḥ varivaḥ dāḥ    anyān te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvakaḥ asmabhyam śivaḥ bhava
translated: Breath-givers, out-breath-givers, through-breath-givers, splendor-givers, room-givers, let their darts burn others than us; be thou purifying and auspicious to us.

original: agnis tigmena śociṣā yāsad viśvaṃ ny atriṇam / agnir no vanate rayim //
analyzed: agniḥ tigmena śociṣā yāsat viśvam ni atriṇam   agniḥ naḥ vanate rayim
translated: Let Agni sit with his sharp flame, to burn up all the greedy ones. Agni shall win wealth for us.

original: ya imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvad ṛṣir hotā ny asīdat pitā naḥ / sa āśiṣā draviṇam icchamānaḥ prathamacchad avarām ā viveśa //
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā bhuvanāni juhvat ṛṣiḥ hotā ni asīdat pitā naḥ    saḥ āśiṣā draviṇam icchamānaḥ prathamacchad avarām ā viveśa
translated: The Rishi who, as our father, sat down as Hotar, offering up all these worlds, he, desiring wealth with his blessing, entered the lowest, the first to be covered.

original: kim svid āsīd adhiṣṭhānam ārambhaṇaṃ katamat svit kathāsīt / yato bhūmiṃ janayan viśvakarmā vi dyām aurṇon mahinā viśvacakṣāḥ //
analyzed: kim svid āsīt adhiṣṭhānam ārambhaṇam katamat svid kathā āsīt    yatas bhūmim janayan viśvakarmā vi dyām aurṇot mahinā viśva cakṣāḥ
translated: What was the foundation? What was the support? How was it disposed? When the all-creating one, producing the earth, covered the sky with his greatness, all-seeing.

original: viśvataścakṣur uta viśvatomukho viśvatobāhur uta viśvataspāt / saṃ bāhubhyāṃ dhamati saṃ patatrair dyāvābhūmī janayan deva ekaḥ //
analyzed: viśvatas cakṣuḥ uta viśvatomukhaḥ viśvatobāhuḥ uta viśvataspād     sam bāhubhyām dhamati sam patatraiḥ dyāvābhūmī janayan devaḥ ekaḥ
translated: He who hath eyes on all sides, a mouth on all sides, who embraceth all quarters, arms on all sides, and feet on all sides, with his two wings this God alone, producing the sky and the earth, flieth.

original: kim svid vanaṃ ka u sa vṛkṣa āsa yato dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣuḥ / manīṣiṇo manasā pṛcchated u tad yad adhyatiṣṭhad bhuvanāni dhārayan //🔽yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yāvamā yā madhyamā viśvakarmann utemā / śikṣā sakhibhyo haviṣi svadhāvaḥ svayaṃ yajasva tanvaṃ vṛdhānaḥ //
analyzed: kim svid vanam kaḥ u sa vṛkṣaḥ āsa yatas dyāvāpṛthivī niṣṭatakṣuḥ    manīṣiṇaḥ manasā pṛcchata id u tat yat adhyatiṣṭhat bhuvanāni dhārayan  yā te dhāmāni paramāṇi yā avamā yā madhyamā viśvakarman  uta imā śikṣa sakhibhyaḥ haviṣi svadhāvas svayam yajasva tanvam vṛdhānaḥ
translated: What was the wood? What was the tree, from which they fashioned the sky and the earth? Let the wise man ask this with his mind, he who standeth over all things, supporting the worlds.🔽Thy highest, thy lowest, and these thy midmost abodes, O all-creating one, let them be propitious to thy friends, O thou of sweet voice. Worship thyself, increasing thy body in the oblation.

original: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayaṃ yajasva pṛthivīm uta dyām / muhyantv anye abhito sapatnā ihāsmākaṃ maghavā sūrir astu //
analyzed: viśvakarman haviṣā vāvṛdhānaḥ svayam yajasva pṛthivīm uta dyām    muhyantu anye abhitas sapatnāḥ iha asmākam maghavā sūriḥ astu
translated: O all-creating one, increased by the oblation, worship thou thyself the earth and the sky. Let our enemies be confounded on every side. Here let Maghavan be our protector.

original: vācas patiṃ viśvakarmāṇam ūtaye manojuvaṃ vāje adyā huvema / sa no viśvāni havanāni joṣad viśvaśambhūr avase sādhukarmā //
analyzed: vācaḥ patim viśvakarmāṇam ūtaye manaḥ juvam vāje adyā huvema    sa naḥ viśvāni havanāni joṣat viśva śambhūḥ avase sādhu karmā
translated: The Lord of Speech, the all-creating one, let us invoke today with mind-swift speed for help. May he accept all our invocations, the all-beneficent one, for our protection.

original: viśvakarman haviṣā vardhanena trātāram indram akṛṇor avadhyam / tasmai viśaḥ samanamanta pūrvīr ayam ugro vihavyo yathāsat //
analyzed: viśvakarman haviṣā vardhanena trātāram indram akṛṇoḥ avadhyam    tasmai viśaḥ samanamanta pūrvīḥ ayam ugraḥ vihavyaḥ yathā asat
translated: O Vishvakarman, by this strengthening oblation, thou madest Indra invincible, the protector. To him the many clans bowed down, that this fierce one, worthy of worship, might be as he is.

original: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīro ghṛtam ene ajanan namnamāne / yaded antā adadṛhanta pūrva ād id dyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām //
analyzed: cakṣuṣaḥ pitā manasā hi dhīraḥ ghṛtam ene ajanat namnamāne    yadā id antāḥ adadṛhanta pūrve āt id dyāvāpṛthivī aprathetām
translated: The father of sight, for the mind is wise, they have generated these two, bending (to the ground). When they, the ends, have been firmly fixed, then indeed did heaven and earth extend.

original: viśvakarmā vimanā ād vihāyā dhātā vidhātā paramota saṃdṛk / teṣām iṣṭāni sam iṣā madanti yatrā saptaṛṣīn para ekam āhuḥ //
analyzed: viśvakarmā vimanāḥ āt vihāyāḥ dhātā vidhātā paramā uta saṃdṛś    teṣām iṣṭāni sam iṣā madanti yatrā sapta ṛṣīn paras ekam āhuḥ
translated: Vishvakarman, the wise one, the bird, the spreader, the ordainer, the highest, and the seer, their offerings rejoice in food, where they call one beyond the seven Rishis.

original: yo naḥ pitā janitā yo vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā / yo devānāṃ nāmadhā eka eva tam saṃpraśnaṃ bhuvanā yanty anyā //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ pitā janitā yaḥ vidhātā dhāmāni veda bhuvanāni viśvā   yaḥ devānām nāmadhāḥ ekaḥ eva tam saṃpraśnam bhuvanā yanti anyā
translated: He who is our father, the begetter, the ordainer, who knows all abodes and all beings, who alone bears the names of the gods, to him the other beings go for consultation.

original: ta āyajanta draviṇam sam asmā ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāro na bhūnā / asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtāni samakṛṇvann imāni //
analyzed: te āyajanta draviṇam sam asmai ṛṣayaḥ pūrve jaritāraḥ na bhūnā    asūrte sūrte rajasi niṣatte ye bhūtāni samakṛṇvan imāni
translated: They, the ancient Rishis, the singers, have brought him forth to give wealth to us. In the unmeasured, measured, and middle region, they who have made these beings,

original: paro divā para enā pṛthivyā paro devebhir asurair yad asti / kam svid garbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥ samapaśyanta pūrve //
analyzed: paras divā paras enā pṛthivyā paras devebhiḥ asuraiḥ yat asti    kam svid garbham prathamam dadhre āpaḥ yatra devāḥ samapaśyanta pūrve
translated: Higher than heaven, higher than this earth, higher than all that is, than the gods and the Asuras, what germ did the waters first conceive, wherein the ancient gods beheld?

original: tam id garbhaṃ prathamaṃ dadhra āpo yatra devāḥ samagacchanta viśve / ajasya nābhāv adhy ekam arpitaṃ yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ //
analyzed: tam id garbham prathamam dadhre āpaḥ yatra devāḥ samagacchanta viśve    ajasya nābhau adhi ekam arpitam yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ
translated: The waters first conceived that germ, wherein all the gods assembled. In the womb of the unborn one, one is laid, in whom all beings have their place.

original: na taṃ vidātha ya imā jajānānyad yuṣmākam antaraṃ babhūva / nīhāreṇa prāvṛtā jalpyā cāsutṛpa ukthaśāsaś caranti //
analyzed: na tam vidātha yaḥ imā jajāna anyat yuṣmākam antaram babhūva    nīhāreṇa prāvṛtāḥ jalpyā ca asutṛpaḥ uktha śāsaḥ caranti
translated: Ye find not him who made these things: another thing hath been produced between you and him. They move about, the greedy, the unsatisfied, the singers of praises, wrapped in darkness and in delusion.

original: viśvakarmā hy ajaniṣṭa deva ād id gandharvo abhavad dvitīyaḥ / tṛtīyaḥ pitā janitauṣadhīnām apāṃ garbhaṃ vy adadhāt purutrā //
analyzed: viśvakarmā hi ajaniṣṭa devaḥ āt id gandharvaḥ abhavat dvitīyaḥ    tṛtīyaḥ pitā janitā oṣadhīnām apām garbham vi adadhāt purutrā
translated: For Vishvakarman was born as a god, and as a Gandharva he became the second. The third is the father who produced the plants. He hath set the germ of the waters in many places.

original: āśuḥ śiśāno vṛṣabho na bhīmo ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaś carṣaṇīnām / saṃkrandano 'nimiṣa ekavīraḥ śatam senā ajayat sākam indraḥ //
analyzed: āśuḥ śiśānaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ghanāghanaḥ kṣobhaṇaḥ carṣaṇīnām    saṃkrandanaḥ nimiṣaḥ eka vīraḥ śatam senāḥ ajayat sākam indraḥ
