translated: The roaring, unblinking, single hero, Indra with his hundred armies conquered at once.🔽With the roaring, unblinking, victorious, fighting, hard-to-move, daring one,

original: saṃkrandanenānimiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā / tad indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvaṃ yudho nara iṣuhastena vṛṣṇā //
analyzed: saṃkrandanena animiṣeṇa jiṣṇunā yutkāreṇa duścyavanena dhṛṣṇunā      tat indreṇa jayata tat sahadhvam yudhaḥ naraḥ iṣu hastena vṛṣṇā
translated: With Indra conquer that, be united with that, O men, in the battle with the powerful archer.🔽He, the powerful one with the archers and the quiver-bearers, the creator of battles, Indra with his troop,

original: sa iṣuhastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhir vaśī samsraṣṭā sa yudha indro gaṇena / samsṛṣṭajit somapā bāhuśardhy ugradhanvā pratihitābhir astā //
analyzed: saḥ iṣu hastaiḥ sa niṣaṅgibhiḥ vaśī samsraṣṭā sa yudhaḥ indraḥ gaṇena samsṛṣṭa jit soma pāḥ bāhuśardhī ugra dhanvā pratihitābhiḥ astā
translated: The conqueror in the battle, the drinker of Soma, the mighty-armed, the wielder of the fierce bow with the well-aimed arrows.🔽O Brihaspati, go around with your chariot, the slayer of demons, repelling the enemies,

original: bṛhaspate pari dīyā rathena rakṣohāmitrān apabādhamānaḥ / prabhañjant senāḥ pramṛṇo yudhā jayann asmākam edhy avitā rathānām //
analyzed: bṛhaspate pari dīya rathena rakṣaḥ hā amitrān apabādhamānaḥ   prabhañjan senāḥ pramṛṇaḥ yudhā jayan asmākam edhi avitā rathānām
translated: Crushing the armies, destroying in battle, victorious, be the protector of our chariots.🔽The powerful, the aged, the foremost, the enduring, the strong, the conqueror, the fierce,

original: balavijñāya sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamāna ugraḥ / abhivīro abhisatvā sahojā jaitram indra ratham ā tiṣṭha govit //
analyzed: balavijñāya sthaviraḥ pravīraḥ sahasvān vājī sahamānaḥ ugraḥ    abhivīraḥ abhisatvā sahaḥ jāḥ jaitram indra ratham ā tiṣṭha go vid
translated: The hero over the heroes, the powerful over the powerful, O Indra, knowing the cattle, mount the victorious chariot.

original: gotrabhidaṃ govidaṃ vajrabāhuṃ jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā / imam sajātā anu vīrayadhvam indram sakhāyo anu sam rabhadhvam //
analyzed: gotrabhidam go vidam vajra bāhum jayantam ajma pramṛṇantam ojasā    imam sajātāḥ anu vīrayadhvam indram sakhāyaḥ anu sam rabhadhvam
translated: Him, O kinsmen, follow ye, and be ye strong: follow ye Indra, and be of one accord with him.🔽Plunging with might into the stalls of cattle, Indra, the hero, irresistible, of hundred powers,

original: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamāno 'dayo vīraḥ śatamanyur indraḥ / duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāḍ ayudhyo 'smākam senā avatu pra yutsu //
analyzed: abhi gotrāṇi sahasā gāhamānaḥ dayaḥ vīraḥ śatamanyuḥ indraḥ    duścyavanaḥ pṛtanāṣāh ayudhyaḥ smākam senāḥ avatu pra yutsu
translated: Indestructible, victorious in fight, may he, our army, protect us in the frays.

original: indra āsāṃ netā bṛhaspatir dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ pura etu somaḥ / devasenānām abhibhañjatīnāṃ jayantīnāṃ maruto yantv agram //
analyzed: indraḥ āsām netā bṛhaspatiḥ dakṣiṇā yajñaḥ puras etu somaḥ    deva senānām abhibhañjatīnām jayantīnām marutaḥ yantu agram
translated: Indra their leader, Brihaspati their guide, the sacrifice their vanguard, Soma go before. May the Maruts go in front of the conquering armies of the gods, of the armies that crush (the foe).

original: indrasya vṛṣṇo varuṇasya rājña ādityānāṃ marutām śardha ugram / mahāmanasāṃ bhuvanacyavānāṃ ghoṣo devānāṃ jayatām ud asthāt //
analyzed: indrasya vṛṣṇaḥ varuṇasya rājñaḥ ādityānām marutām śardhaḥ ugram mahāmanasām bhuvanacyavānām ghoṣaḥ devānām jayatām ud asthāt
translated: The mighty shout of the victorious gods hath arisen, of Indra the mighty, of Varuna the king, of the Maruts' troop, of the Adityas,🔽Of those of mighty thought, of those who shake the world. Exalt, O bountiful one, the weapons; exalt the spirits of my heroes;

original: ud dharṣaya maghavann āyudhāny ut satvanāṃ māmakānāṃ manāmsi / ud vṛtrahan vājināṃ vājināny ud rathānāṃ jayatāṃ yantu ghoṣāḥ //
analyzed: ud dharṣaya maghavan āyudhāni ud satvanām māmakānām    ud vṛtrahan vājinām vājināni ud rathānām jayatām yantu ghoṣāḥ
translated: Exalt, O Vr̥itra-slayer, the strength of the strong steeds; let the shout of the conquering chariots go up.

original: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣv asmākaṃ yā iṣavas tā jayantu / asmākaṃ vīrā uttare bhavantv asmām u devā avatā haveṣu //
analyzed: asmākam indraḥ samṛteṣu dhvajeṣu asmākam yāḥ iṣavaḥ tāḥ jayantu    asmākam vīrāḥ uttare bhavantu asmām u devāḥ avata haveṣu
translated: May Indra be with us when our banners are advanced to victory; may our arrows be victorious; may our heroes be victorious; may the gods help us in the battles.

original: amīṣāṃ cittaṃ pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇāṅgāny apve parehi / abhi prehi nir daha hṛtsu śokair andhenāmitrās tamasā sacantām //
analyzed: amīṣām cittam pratilobhayantī gṛhāṇa aṅgāni apve parehi abhi prehi niḥ daha hṛtsu śokaiḥ andhena amitrāḥ tamasā sacantām
translated: Confounding the minds of these (enemies), taking away their limbs, O Apva, go away. Go forward and burn them in their hearts with grief. Let the enemies go about in blind darkness.

original: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahmasamśite / gacchāmitrān pra padyasva māmīṣāṃ kaṃ canoc chiṣaḥ //
analyzed: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahma samśite     gaccha amitrān pra padyasva mā amīṣām kam cana ud śiṣaḥ
translated: Discharged, fly away, O Sharvya, sharpened by Brahman. Go to the enemies and fall upon them. Cut off some one of them.

original: pretā jayatā nara indro vaḥ śarma yacchatu / ugrā vaḥ santu bāhavo 'nādhṛṣyā yathāsatha //
analyzed: pra ita jayata naraḥ indraḥ vaḥ śarma yacchatu    ugrāḥ vaḥ santu bāhavaḥ na adhṛṣyāḥ yathā asatha
translated: Go forward, O men, to victory. May Indra grant you protection. May your arms be strong, that you may be invincible as you are.

original: asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣām abhyaiti na ojasā spardhamānā / tāṃ gūhata tamasāpavratena yathāmī anyo anyaṃ na jānan //
analyzed: asau yā senā marutaḥ pareṣām abhyaiti naḥ ojasā spardhamānā     tām gūhata tamasā apavratena yathā amī anyaḥ anyam na jānan
translated: That army of the enemies, O Maruts, which advances against us, challenging us with its might, cover it with darkness and with Apvrt, that they may not know one another.

original: yatra vāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārā viśikhā iva / tatra indro bṛhaspatir aditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu //
analyzed: yatra vāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārāḥ viśikhāḥ iva    tatra indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ aditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu
translated: Where the arrows fly together like young men with darts, there may Indra, Brihaspati, Aditi grant protection, may they grant protection for all time.

original: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somas tvā rājāmṛtenānu vastām / uror varīyo varuṇas te kṛṇotu jayantaṃ tvānu devā madantu //
analyzed: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somaḥ tvā rājā amṛtena anu vastām    uroḥ varīyaḥ varuṇaḥ te kṛṇotu jayantam tvā anu devāḥ madantu
translated: I cover thy vital parts with armour. Let Soma, the King, anoint thee with immortality. Let Varuna make thee wider in thy chest. Let the gods rejoice in thee as thou art victorious.

original: ud enam uttarāṃ nayāgne ghṛtenāhuta / rāyaspoṣeṇa ram sṛja prajayā ca bahuṃ kṛdhi //
analyzed: ud enam uttarām naya agne ghṛtena āhuta rāyaspoṣeṇa ram sṛja prajayā ca bahum kṛdhi
translated: Carry him up to the highest place, O Agni, offered with ghee. Send him forth with increase of wealth. Make him abundant with offspring.

original: indremaṃ pratarāṃ naya sajātānām asadvaśī / sam enaṃ varcasā sṛja devānāṃ bhāgadā asat //
analyzed: indra imam pratarām naya sajātānām asat vaśī    sam enam varcasā sṛja devānām bhāga dāḥ asat
translated: Lead him further forward in Indra. Let him be the lord of his equals. Send him forth with splendour. Let him be the distributor of shares to the gods.

original: yasaya kurmo gṛhe havis tam agne vardhayā tvam / tasmai devā adhi bravann ayaṃ ca brahmaṇaspatiḥ //
analyzed: yasaya kurmaḥ gṛhe haviḥ tam agne vardhaya tvam    tasmai devāḥ adhi bravan ayam ca brahmaṇaspatiḥ
translated: The one in whose house we make the offering, him, O Agni, do thou increase. For him do the gods speak, and this Brahmanaspati.

original: ud u tvā viśve devā agne bharantu cittibhiḥ / sa no bahva śivas tvam supratīko vibhāvasuḥ //
analyzed: ud u tvā viśve devāḥ agne bharantu cittibhiḥ   sa naḥ bahva śivaḥ tvam su pratīkaḥ vibhāvasuḥ
translated: Let all the gods bear thee up, O Agni, with their thoughts. Be thou to us very rich in blessings, of fair countenance, full of light.

original: pañca diśo daivīr yajñam avantu devīr apāmatiṃ durmatiṃ bādhamānāḥ / rāyaspoṣe yajñapatim ābhajantī rāyaspoṣe adhi yajño asthāt //
analyzed: pañca diśaḥ daivīḥ yajñam avantu devīḥ apa amatim durmatim bādhamānāḥ    rāyaspoṣe yajñapatim ābhajantīḥ rāyaspoṣe adhi yajñaḥ asthāt
translated: May the five divine quarters, the divine goddesses, favour the sacrifice, repelling evil thought and misfortune. Bestowing increase of wealth on the lord of the sacrifice, increase of wealth is where the sacrifice stands.

original: samiddhe agnāv adhi māmahāna ukthapatra īḍyo gṛbhītaḥ / taptaṃ gharmaṃ parigṛhyāyajantorjā yad yajñam ayajanta devāḥ //
analyzed: samiddhe agnau adhi māmahānaḥ uktha patraḥ īḍyaḥ gṛbhītaḥ    taptam gharmam parigṛhya ayajanta ūrjā yat yajñam ayajanta devāḥ
translated: In the well-kindled fire, the great one, to be praised, with the face of praise, is seized. Having taken hold of the heated cauldron, they sacrificed. With strength they sacrificed the sacrifice to the gods.

original: daivyāya dhartre joṣṭre devaśrīḥ śrīmanāḥ śatapayāḥ / parigṛhya devā yajñam āyan devā devebhyo adhvaryanto asthuḥ //
analyzed: daivyāya dhartre joṣṭre deva śrīḥ śrī manāḥ śata payāḥ parigṛhya devāḥ yajñam āyan devāḥ devebhyaḥ adhvaryantaḥ asthuḥ
translated: To the divine supporter, to the nourisher, the god-glorious, the glorious-minded, with a hundred libations, having taken hold, the gods came to the sacrifice. The gods, the priests, have come to the gods.

original: vītam haviḥ śamitam śamitā yajadhyai turīyo yajño yatra havyam eti / tato vākā āśiṣo no juṣantām //
analyzed: vītam haviḥ śamitam śamitā yajadhyai turīyaḥ yajñaḥ yatra havyam eti    tatas vākāḥ āśiṣaḥ naḥ juṣantām
translated: The oblation is purified, the peace-offering is prepared, to be offered. The fourth sacrifice, where the offering goes, thence let the prayers accept our blessings.

original: sūryaraśmir harikeśaḥ purastāt savitā jyotir ud ayām ajasram / tasya pūṣā prasave yāti vidvānt sampaśyan viśvā bhuvanāni gopāḥ //
analyzed: sūrya raśmiḥ hari keśaḥ purastāt savitā jyotiḥ ud ayām ajasram    tasya pūṣā prasave yāti vidvān sampaśyan viśvā bhuvanāni gopāḥ
translated: The sun's ray, with tawny hair, Savitar, the light, rises in front, unceasing. Pūṣan, knowing, goes forth in his impulse, beholding all the worlds as a protector.

original: vimāna eṣa divo madhya āsta āpaprivān rodasī antarikṣam / sa viśvācīr abhi caṣṭe ghṛtācīr antarā pūrvam aparaṃ ca ketum //
analyzed: vimānaḥ eṣa divaḥ madhye āste āpaprivān rodasī antarikṣam     sa viśvācīḥ abhi caṣṭe ghṛtācīḥ antarā pūrvam aparam ca ketum
translated: This one sits in the middle of the sky, having filled the two worlds and the atmosphere. He looks upon all the bright things between the former and the latter sign.

original: ukṣā samudro aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yoniṃ pitur ā viveśa / madhye divo nihitaḥ pṛśnir aśmā vi cakrame rajasas pāty antau //
analyzed: ukṣā samudraḥ aruṇaḥ suparṇaḥ pūrvasya yonim pituḥ ā viveśa    madhye divaḥ nihitaḥ pṛśniḥ aśmā vi cakrame rajasaḥ pāti antau
translated: The bull, the sea, the ruddy bird hath entered the birthplace of the ancient Father. The dappled stone is set in the midst of heaven. He hath extended himself to the ends of the region.

original: indraṃ viśvā avīvṛdhant samudravyacasaṃ giraḥ / rathītamam rathīnāṃ vājānām satpatiṃ patim //
analyzed: indram viśvāḥ avīvṛdhan samudra vyacasam giraḥ rathītamam rathīnām vājānām satpatim patim
translated: All the songs have strengthened Indra, who is as vast as the sea, best of charioteers among the charioteers, lord of strength, the lord.

original: devahūr yajña ā ca vakṣat sumnahūr yajña ā ca vakṣat / yakṣad agnir devo devām ā ca vakṣat //
analyzed: deva hūḥ yajñaḥ ā ca vakṣat sumna hūḥ yajñaḥ ā ca vakṣat    yakṣat agniḥ devaḥ devām ā ca vakṣat
translated: The invocation of the gods shall bring the sacrifice, the invocation of bliss shall bring the sacrifice. May Agni, the god, invite the gods and bring them.

original: vajasya mā prasave udgrābheṇod agrabhīt / adha sapatnān indro me nigrābheṇādharām akaḥ //🔽udgrābhaṃ ca nigrābhaṃ ca brahma devā avīvṛdhan / adhā sapatnān indrāgnī me viṣūcīnān vy asyatām //
analyzed: vajasya mā prasave udgrābheṇa ud agrabhīt    adha sapatnān indraḥ me nigrābheṇa adharām akaḥ  udgrābham ca nigrābham ca brahma devāḥ avīvṛdhan    adha sapatnān indra agnī me viṣūcīnān vi asyatām
translated: By the impulse of the thunderbolt, by the uplifting, he hath uplifted me. Therewith hath Indra, by the grasping down, set my foes beneath me.🔽The gods have strengthened the uplifting and the grasping, the prayer. Therewith, O Indra and Agni, do ye stretch my foes, who are on every side, asunder.

original: kramadhvam agninā nākam ukhyam hasteṣu bibhrataḥ / divas pṛṣṭham svar gatvā miśrā devebhir ādhvam //
analyzed: kramadhvam agninā nākam ukhyam hasteṣu bibhrataḥ   divas pṛṣṭham svar gatvā miśrā devebhiḥ ādhvam
translated: Bearing in your hands the smoke-bannered Agni, ascend to the vault of heaven. Having gone to the back of the sky, the world of the gods, be ye united with the gods.

original: prācīm anu pradiśaṃ prehi vidvān agner agne puroagnir bhaveha / viśvā āśā dīdyāno vi bhāhy ūrjaṃ no dhehi dvipade catuṣpade //
analyzed: prācīm anu pradiśam prehi vidvān agneḥ agne puras agniḥ bhava iha  / viśvāḥ āśāḥ dīdyānaḥ vi bhāhi ūrjam naḥ dhehi dvipade catuṣpade
translated: Go forward, knowing, in the direction of the east, and be thou, O Agni, the fore-fire of Agni. Shine thou, illuminating all the regions, and grant us food for our bipeds and quadrupeds.

original: pṛthivyā aham ud antarikṣam āruham antarikṣād divam āruham / divo nākasya pṛṣṭhāt svar jyotir agām aham //
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ aham ud antarikṣam āruham antarikṣāt divam āruham    divaḥ nākasya pṛṣṭhāt svar jyotiḥ agām aham
translated: From the earth I have ascended to the atmosphere; from the atmosphere I have ascended to the sky. From the back of the vault of the sky I have gone to the heavenly light.

original: svar yanto nāpekṣanta ā dyām rohanti rodasī / yajñaṃ ye viśvatodhāram suvidvāmso vitenire //
analyzed: svar yantaḥ na apekṣante ā dyām rohanti rodasī    yajñam ye viśvatas dhāram su vidvāmsaḥ vitenire
translated: Those who have spread out the sacrifice, which has all the streams, in every way, the well-knowing ones, go to the heaven, without looking back, they ascend the sky and the earth.

original: agne prehi prathamo devayatāṃ cakṣur devānām uta martyānām / iyakṣamāṇā bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ svar yantu yajamānāḥ svasti //
analyzed: agne prehi prathamaḥ devayatām cakṣuḥ devānām uta martyānām   iyakṣamāṇāḥ bhṛgubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ svar yantu yajamānāḥ svasti
translated: O Agni, go forward, the first of those who go to the gods, the eye of the gods and of men. Accordant with the Bhṛgus, let the sacrificers, when they are about to sacrifice, go to the heaven in peace.

original: naktoṣāsā samanasā virūpe dhāpayete śiśum ekam samīcī / dyāvākṣāmā rukmo antar vi bhāti devā agniṃ dhārayan draviṇodāḥ //
analyzed: nakta uṣāsā samanasā virūpe dhāpayete śiśum ekam samīcī     dyāvākṣāmā rukmaḥ antar vi bhāti devāḥ agnim dhārayan draviṇaḥ dāḥ
translated: Night and Dawn, of different forms, but of one mind, nourish the one child together. The light shines between the heaven and the earth. The gods, bestowers of wealth, have established Agni.

original: agne sahasrākṣa śatamūrdhañ chataṃ te prāṇāḥ sahasraṃ vyānāḥ / tvam sāhasrasya rāya īśiṣe tasmai te vidhema vājāya svāhā //
analyzed: agne sahasra akṣa śata mūrdham śatam te prāṇāḥ sahasram vyānāḥ   tvam sāhasrasya rāyaḥ īśiṣe tasmai te vidhema vājāya svāhā
translated: O Agni, thou who hast a thousand eyes, a hundred heads, a hundred powers, a thousand vital airs, thou art the lord of a thousandfold wealth. To thee, O strength, we offer this oblation.

original: suparṇo 'si garunmān pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyāḥ sīda / bhāsāntarikṣam ā pṛṇa jyotiṣā divam ut tabhāna tejasā diśa ud dṛmha //
analyzed: suparṇaḥ si garunmān pṛṣṭhe pṛthivyāḥ sīda  / bhāsā antarikṣam ā pṛṇa jyotiṣā divam ud tabhāna tejasā diśaḥ ud dṛmha
translated: Thou art the bird, the eagle, on the back of the earth be seated. Fill the atmosphere with light, with radiance lift up the sky, with splendour support the quarters.

original: ājuhvānaḥ supratīkaḥ purastād agne yonim ā sīda sādhuyā / asmint sashasthe adhy uttarasmin viśve devā yajamānaś ca sīdata //
analyzed: ājuhvānaḥ su pratīkaḥ purastāt agne yonim ā sīda sādhuyā   asmin sashasthe adhi uttarasmin viśve devāḥ yajamānaḥ ca sīdata
translated: Invited, of fair countenance, in front, O Agni, sit in the place of worship with ease. In this place, the highest, sit ye all gods and the sacrificer.

original: tam savitur vareṇyasya citrām āhaṃ vṛṇe sumatiṃ viśvajanyām / yām asya kaṇvo aduhat prapīnām sahasradhārāṃ payasā mahīṃ gām //🔽vidhema te parame janmann agne vidhema stomair avare sadhasthe / yasmād yoner udārithā yaje taṃ pra tve havīmṣi juhure samiddhe //🔽preddho agne dīdihi puro no 'jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha / tvām śaśvanta upa yanti vājāḥ //
analyzed: tam savituḥ vareṇyasya citrām ā aham vṛṇe sumatim viśvajanyām    yām asya kaṇvaḥ aduhat prapīnām sahasra dhārām payasā mahīm gām  vidhema te parame janman agne vidhema stomaiḥ avare sadhasthe    yasmāt yoneḥ udāritha yaje tam pra tve havīmṣi juhure samiddhe  preddhaḥ agne dīdihi puras naḥ jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha   tvām śaśvantaḥ upa yanti vājāḥ
translated: Of Savitar the adorable one I choose the wondrous favour, common to all men, Which Kanva milked as full, the great cow, yielding milk in a thousand streams.🔽We will worship thee in the highest birth, O Agni, we will worship thee with praises in the lowest abode, From what womb, O adorable one, thou hast come forth, to that (womb) offer sacrifice. In thee, when kindled, they offer oblations.🔽Be thou enkindled, O Agni, shine in front of us, O youngest (god), with thy ceaseless light. To thee come all the powers.

original: agne tam adyāśvaṃ na stomaiḥ kratuṃ na bhadram hṛdispṛśam / ṛdhyāmā ta ohaiḥ //
analyzed: agne tam adya aśvam na stomaiḥ kratum na bhadram hṛdispṛśam   ṛdhyāma te ohaiḥ
translated: O Agni, with our praises to-day, as to a horse, I honour that rite which is good and touches the heart. May we prosper through thy help.

original: cittiṃ juhomi manasā ghṛtena yathā devā ihāgaman vītihotrā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ / patye viśvasya bhūmano juhomi viśvakarmaṇe viśvāhādābhyam havi //
analyzed: cittim juhomi manasā ghṛtena yathā devāḥ iha agaman vītihotrāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ   patye viśvasya bhūmanaḥ juhomi viśvakarmaṇe viśvāhā adābhyam havi
translated: I offer my thought with mind and ghee, that the gods may come hither, the worshippers, the increasers of truth. I offer to the lord of all the world, to Viśvakarman, the all-pervading oblation, day by day.

original: sapta te agne samidhaḥ sapta jihvāḥ sapta ṛṣayaḥ sapta dhāma priyāṇi / sapta hotrāḥ saptadhā tvā yajanti sapta yonīr ā pṛṇasva ghṛtena svāhā //
analyzed: sapta te agne samidhaḥ sapta jihvāḥ sapta ṛṣayaḥ sapta dhāma priyāṇi   / sapta hotrāḥ saptadhā tvā yajanti sapta yonīḥ ā pṛṇasva ghṛtena svāhā
translated: Seven are thy logs, O Agni, seven thy tongues, seven Rishis, seven dear abodes. Seven are thy priests, sevenfold they worship thee. Fill with ghee the seven wombs. Svâhâ!

original: śukrajyotiś ca citrajyotiś ca satyajyotiś ca jyotiṣmāmś ca / śukraś ca ṛtapāś cātyamhāḥ //
analyzed: śukra jyotiḥ ca citra jyotiḥ ca satya jyotiḥ ca jyotiṣmāmś ca śukraḥ ca ṛta pāḥ ca atyamhāḥ
translated: The bright light, the variegated light, the true light, the luminous, the bright, the law-upholder, the overcomer.

original: īdṛṅ cānyadṛṅ ca sadṛṅ ca pratisadṛṅ ca / mitaś ca saṃmitaś ca sabharāḥ //🔽ṛtaś ca satyaś ca dhruvaś ca dharuṇaś ca / dhartā ca vidhartā ca vidhārayaḥ //
analyzed: īdṛś ca anyadṛś ca sadṛś ca pratisadṛś ca    mitaḥ ca saṃmitaḥ ca sabharāḥ  ṛtaḥ ca satyaḥ ca dhruvaḥ ca dharuṇaḥ ca    dhartā ca vidhartā ca vidhārayaḥ
translated: The like, the other-like, the similar, the counter-similar, the measured, the distributed, the equal-burdened.🔽The true, the real, the firm, the supporter, the bearer, the disposer, the supporter.

original: ṛtajic ca satyajic ca senajic ca suṣeṇaś ca / antimitraś ca dūreamitraś ca gaṇaḥ //
analyzed: ṛta jit ca satya jit ca senajit ca suṣeṇaḥ ca antimitraḥ ca dūreamitraḥ ca gaṇaḥ
translated: The truth-conquering, the truth-winning, the army-conquering, the good-army, the near-friend, the far-enemy, the group.

original: īdṛkṣāsa etādṛkṣāsa ū ṣu ṇaḥ sadṛkṣāsaḥ pratisadṛkṣāsa etana / mitāsaś ca saṃmitāso no adya sabharaso maruto yajñe asmin //
analyzed: īdṛkṣāsaḥ etādṛkṣāsaḥ u su naḥ sadṛkṣāsaḥ pratisadṛkṣāsaḥ etana     mitāsaḥ ca saṃmitāsaḥ naḥ adya sabharasaḥ marutaḥ yajñe asmin
translated: Such as these, so great as these, so like as these, so unlike as these, so measured as these, so well-measured as these, so bountiful as these, O Maruts, at this our sacrifice.

original: svatavāmś ca praghāsī ca sāṃtapanaś ca gṛhamedhī ca / krīḍī ca śākī cojjeṣī //
analyzed: svatavāmū ca praghāsī ca sāṃtapanaḥ ca gṛhamedhī ca krīḍī ca śākī ca ujjeṣī
translated: The self-powerful, the voracious, the scorching, the householder, the playful, the strong, the victorious.

original: ugraś ca bhīmaś ca dhvāntaś ca dhuniś ca / sāsahvāmś cābhiyugvā ca vikṣipaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ugraḥ ca bhīmaḥ ca dhvāntaḥ ca dhuniḥ ca    ca abhiyugvā ca vikṣipaḥ svāhā
translated: The fierce, the terrible, the dark, the noisy, the overpowering, the attacking, the scattering, hail!

original: indraṃ daivīr viśo maruto 'nuvartmāno 'bhavan yathendraṃ daivīr viśo maruto 'nuvartmāno 'bhavan / evam imaṃ yajamānaṃ daivīś ca viśo mānuṣīścānuvartmāno bhavantu //
analyzed: indram daivīḥ viśaḥ marutaḥ nuvartmānaḥ bhavan yathā indram daivīḥ viśaḥ marutaḥ nuvartmānaḥ bhavan      evam imam yajamānam daivīḥ ca viśaḥ mānuṣīḥ ca anuvartmānaḥ bhavantu
translated: The divine clans, the Maruts, followed Indra, just as the divine clans, the Maruts, followed Indra. In the same way, may the divine and human clans follow this sacrificer.

original: imam stanam ūrjasvantaṃ dhayāpāṃ prapīnam agne sarirasya madhye / utsaṃ juṣasva madhumantam arvant samudriyam sadanam ā viśasva //
analyzed: imam stanam ūrjasvantam dhaya apām prapīnam agne sarirasya madhye    utsam juṣasva madhumantam arvan samudriyam sadanam ā viśasva
translated: This nourishing breast of the waters, the full one, O Agni, in the middle of the body, enjoy the honey-filled spring, O horse, enter your ocean home.

original: ghṛtaṃ mimikṣe ghṛtam asya yonir ghṛte śrito ghṛtam v asya dhāma / anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtaṃ vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam //
analyzed: ghṛtam mimikṣe ghṛtam asya yoniḥ ghṛte śritaḥ ghṛtam u asya dhāma    anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva svāhākṛtam vṛṣabha vakṣi havyam
translated: Ghee is his food, ghee is his birthplace; in ghee he rests, ghee is his element. Bring him hitherward, make him glad, O thou whose oblation is accepted. Bear the offering, O Bull.

original: samudrād ūrmir madhumām ud ārad upāmśunā sam amṛtatvam ānaṭ / ghṛtasya nāma guhyaṃ yad asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ //
analyzed: samudrāt ūrmiḥ madhumām ud ārat upa amśunā sam amṛta tvam ānaṭ    ghṛtasya nāma guhyam yat asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
translated: From the ocean the wave, rich in sweetness, hath risen, with the hidden (oblation) it hath attained immortality. The secret name of ghee, which it is, is the tongue of the gods, the navel of immortality.

original: vayaṃ nāma pra bravāmā ghṛtasyāsmin yajñe dhārayāmā namobhiḥ / upa brahmā śṛṇavac chasyamānaṃ catuḥśṛṅgo 'vamīd gaura etat //
analyzed: vayam nāma pra bravāma ghṛtasya asmin yajñe dhārayāma namobhiḥ  / upa brahmā śṛṇavat śasyamānam catur śṛṅgaḥ vamīt gauraḥ etat
translated: We will proclaim the name of ghee in this sacrifice with our thoughts and with adorations. Let the Brahman listen to the praise: the Bull hath brought forth this, having four horns, three feet, two heads, and seven hands.

original: catvāri śṛṅgā trayo asya pādā dve śīrṣe sapta hastāso asya / tridhā baddho vṛṣabho roravīti maho devo martyām ā viveśa //
analyzed: catvāri śṛṅgā trayaḥ asya pādāḥ dve śīrṣe sapta hastāsaḥ asya           roravīti mahaḥ devaḥ martyām ā viveśa
translated: He hath four horns, three are his feet, two heads it hath; seven hands hath this bull. Bound in three places, the bull bel lows: the great god hath entered into men.

original: tridhā hitaṃ paṇibhir guhyamānaṃ gavi devāso ghṛtam anv avindan / indra ekam sūrya ekaṃ jajāna venād ekam svadhayā niṣ ṭatakṣuḥ //
analyzed: tridhā hitam paṇibhiḥ guhyamānam gavi devāsaḥ ghṛtam anu avindan    indraḥ ekam sūryaḥ ekam jajāna venāt ekam svadhayā niḥ tatakṣuḥ
translated: The gods found ghee in the cow, divided into three parts, concealed by the Pāṇis. Indra generated one part, the sun one; from Vena they fashioned one part by their own power.

original: etā arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāc chatavrajā ripuṇā nāvacakṣe / ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhya āsām //
analyzed: etāḥ arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāt śata vrajāḥ ripuṇā na avacakṣe    ghṛtasya dhārāḥ abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayaḥ vetasaḥ madhye āsām
translated: These flow from out the heart, from out the ocean, a hundred currents, never to be stayed by foes. I look upon the streams of oil, and in their midst the reed of gold.

original: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ / ete arṣanty ūrmayo ghṛtasya mṛgā iva kṣipaṇor īṣamāṇāḥ //
analyzed: samyak sravanti saritaḥ na dhenāḥ antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ    ete arṣanti ūrmayaḥ ghṛtasya mṛgāḥ iva kṣipaṇoḥ īṣamāṇāḥ
translated: They flow together like the streams of rivers, purified within the heart and mind. These waves of oil flow onward, longing for the sieve, like antelopes.

original: sindhor iva prādhvane śūghanāso vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ / ghṛtasya dhārā aruṣo na vājī kāṣṭhā bhindann ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ //
analyzed: sindhoḥ iva prādhvane śūghanāsaḥ vāta pramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ    ghṛtasya dhārāḥ aruṣaḥ na vājī kāṣṭhāḥ bhindan ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ
translated: Like Sindhu on his way, the mighty ones, the youthful, borne by wind, fly forth, the streams of oil. The red steed, bursting through the dam, swells with the waves.

original: abhi pravanta samaneva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāso agnim / ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidho nasanta tā juṣāṇo haryati jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: abhi samanā iva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāsaḥ agnim    ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidhaḥ nasanta tāḥ juṣāṇaḥ haryati jātavedāḥ
translated: They come to him like maidens to the marriage, the lovely smiling ones to Agni. The streams of oil are their fuel. He, the all-knower, gladly licks them up.

original: kanyā iva vahatum etavā u añjy añjānā abhi cākaśīmi / yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajño ghṛtasya dhārā abhi tat pavante //
analyzed: kanyāḥ iva vahatum etavai u añjī añjānāḥ abhi cākaśīmi     yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajñaḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ abhi tat pavante
translated: I look upon the ruddy ones, as if they were maidens, anointed with red ointment, where the Soma is pressed, where the sacrifice is, the streams of oil flow forth to that place.

original: abhy arṣata suṣṭutiṃ gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta / imaṃ yajñaṃ nayata devatā no ghṛtasya dhārā madhumat pavante //
analyzed: abhi arṣata suṣṭutim gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta    imam yajñam nayata devatāḥ naḥ ghṛtasya dhārāḥ madhumat pavante
translated: Pour down the praise, the race for cattle; bestow on us good treasures. Lead this our sacrifice to the Gods. The streams of ghee, rich in honey, are purified.

original: dhāman te viśvaṃ bhuvanam adhi śritam antaḥ samudre hṛdy antar āyuṣi / apām anīke samithe ya ābhṛtas tam aśyāma madhumantaṃ ta ūrmim //🔽vajaś ca me prasavaś ca me prayatiś ca me prasitiś ca me dhītiś ca me kratuś ca me svaraś ca me ślokaś ca me śravaś ca me śrutiś ca me jyotiś ca me svaś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antar samudre hṛdi antar āyuṣi    apām anīke samithe yaḥ ābhṛtaḥ tam aśyāma madhumantam te ūrmim  vajaḥ ca me prasavaḥ ca me prayatiḥ ca me prasitiḥ ca me dhītiḥ ca me kratuḥ ca me svaraḥ ca me ślokaḥ ca me śravaḥ ca me śrutiḥ ca me jyotiḥ ca me svar ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: In thy abode all the world is established, within the ocean, within the heart, within life. Him who is brought in the vanguard of the waters in the gathering, may we obtain that wave rich in honey.🔽May my thunderbolt and my impulse and my exertion and my firmness and my thought and my wisdom and my tone and my verse and my fame and my hearing and my light and my own nature be made ready by the sacrifice.

original: prāṇaś ca me 'pānaś ca me vyānaś ca me 'suś ca me cittaṃ ca ma ādhītaṃ ca me vāk ca me manaś ca me cakṣuś ca me śrotraṃ ca me dakṣaś ca me balaṃ ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: prāṇaḥ ca me pānaḥ ca me vyānaḥ ca me suḥ ca me cittam ca me ādhītam ca me vāc ca me manaḥ ca me cakṣuḥ ca me śrotram ca me dakṣaḥ ca me balam ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May my out-breathing and my in-breathing and my through-breathing and my life and my mind and my learning and my speech and my thought and my eye and my ear and my skill and my strength be made ready by the sacrifice.

original: ojas ca me sahaś ca ma ātmā ca me tanūś ca me śarma ca me varma ca me 'ṅgāni ca me 'sthāni ca me parūmṣi ca me śarīrāṇi ca ma āyuś ca me jarā ca me yajñena kalpantām //🔽jyaiṣṭhyaṃ ca me ādhipatyaṃ ca me manyuś ca me bhāmaś ca me 'maś ca me 'mbhaś ca me mahimā ca me varimā ca me prathimā ca me varṣimā ca me drāghimā ca me vṛddhaṃ ca me vṛddhiś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: ojaḥ ca me sahaḥ ca me ātmā ca me tanūḥ ca me śarma ca me varma ca me ṅgāni ca me sthāni ca me parūmṣi ca me śarīrāṇi ca me āyuḥ ca me jarā ca me yajñena kalpantām  jyaiṣṭhyam ca me ādhipatyam ca me manyuḥ ca me bhāmaḥ ca me maḥ ca me mbhaḥ ca me mahimā ca me varimā ca me prathimā ca me varṣimā ca me drāghimā ca me vṛddham ca me vṛddhiḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: And my strength and my vigour, and my soul and my body, and my protection and my armour, and my limbs and my bones, and my joints and my members, and my life and my old age, may these by sacrifice be established.🔽And my preeminence and my overlordship, and my wrath and my anger, and my might and my power, and my greatness and my abundance, and my vastness and my greatness, and my length and my duration, and my increase and my prosperity, may these by sacrifice be established.

original: satyaṃ ca me śraddhā ca me jagac ca me dhanaṃ ca me viśvaṃ ca me mahaś ca me krīḍā ca me modaś ca me jātaṃ ca me janiṣyamāṇaṃ ca me sūktaṃ ca me sukṛtaṃ ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: satyam ca me śraddhā ca me jagat ca me dhanam ca me viśvam ca me mahaḥ ca me krīḍā ca me modaḥ ca me jātam ca me janiṣyamāṇam ca me sūktam ca me sukṛtam ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: And my truth and my faith, and my world and my wealth, and my all and my greatness, and my sport and my joy, and my born and my to-be-born, and my well-spoken and my well-done, may these by sacrifice be established.

original: ṛtaṃ ca me 'mṛtaṃ ca me 'yakṣmaṃ ca me 'nāmayac ca me jīvātuś ca me dīrghāyutvaṃ ca me 'namitraṃ ca me 'bhayaṃ ca me sukhaṃ ca me śayanaṃ ca me suṣāś ca me sudinaṃ ca me yajñena kalpantām //🔽yantā ca me dhartā ca me kṣemaś ca me dhṛtiś ca me viśvaṃ ca me mahaś ca me saṃvic ca me jñātraṃ ca me sūś ca me prasūś ca me sīraṃ ca me layaś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: ṛtam ca me mṛtam ca me yakṣmam ca me nāmayat ca me jīvātuḥ ca me dīrgha āyu tvam ca me namitram ca me bhayam ca me sukham ca me śayanam ca me suṣāḥ ca me sudinam ca me yajñena kalpantām  yantā ca me dhartā ca me kṣemaḥ ca me dhṛtiḥ ca me viśvam ca me mahaḥ ca me saṃvid ca me jñātram ca me sūḥ ca me prasūḥ ca me sīram ca me layaḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May truth and immortality and freedom from consumption and freedom from disease and longevity and long life and freedom from enemies and freedom from fear and happiness and rest and good nights and good days be accomplished for me by the sacrifice.🔽May the supporter and the upholder and peace and firmness and all and greatness and consciousness and knowledge and the good and the impulse and the plough and the resting place be accomplished for me by the sacrifice.

original: śaṃ ca me mayaś ca me priyaṃ ca me 'nukāmaś ca me kāmaś ca me saumanasaś ca me bhagaś ca me draviṇaṃ ca me bhadraṃ ca me śreyaś ca me vasīyaś ca me yaśaś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: śam ca me mayaḥ ca me priyam ca me nukāmaḥ ca me kāmaḥ ca me saumanasaḥ ca me bhagaḥ ca me draviṇam ca me bhadram ca me śreyaḥ ca me vasīyaḥ ca me yaśaḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May welfare and prosperity and what is dear and what is desired and desire and satisfaction and good fortune and wealth and what is good and what is excellent and what is better and glory be accomplished for me by the sacrifice.

original: ūrk ca me sūnṛtā ca me payaś ca me rasaś ca me ghṛtaṃ ca me madhu ca me sagdhiś ca me sapītiś ca me kṛṣiś ca me vṛṣṭiś ca me jaitraṃ ca ma audbhidyaṃ ca me yajñena kalpantām //🔽rayiś ca me rāyaś ca me puṣṭaṃ ca me puṣṭiś ca me vibhu ca me prabhu ca me pūrṇaṃ ca me pūrṇataraṃ ca me kuyavaṃ ca me 'kṣitaṃ ca me 'nnaṃ ca me 'kṣuc ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: ūrj ca me sūnṛtā ca me payaḥ ca me rasaḥ ca me ghṛtam ca me madhu ca me sagdhiḥ ca me sapītiḥ ca me kṛṣiḥ ca me vṛṣṭiḥ ca me jaitram ca me audbhidyam ca me yajñena kalpantām  rayiḥ ca me rāyaḥ ca me puṣṭam ca me puṣṭiḥ ca me vibhu ca me prabhu ca me pūrṇam ca me pūrṇataram ca me kuyavam ca me kṣitam ca me annam ca me kṣudh ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: And may my food and my truth and my milk and my sap and my ghee and my honey and my companionship and my fellowship and my husbandry and my rain and my victory and my abundance prosper by sacrifice.🔽And may my wealth and my riches and my nourishment and my prosperity and my power and my lordship and my fullness and my exceeding fullness and my store and my unfailing supply and my food and my corn prosper by sacrifice.

original: vittaṃ ca me vedyaṃ ca me bhūtaṃ ca me bhaviṣyac ca me sugaṃ ca me supathyaṃ ca ma ṛddhaṃ ca ma ṛddhiś ca me k /lptaṃ ca me k /lptiś ca me matiś ca me sumatiś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: vittam ca me vedyam ca me bhūtam ca me bhaviṣyat ca me sugam ca me su pathyam ca me ṛddham ca me ṛddhiḥ ca me klptam ca me klptiḥ ca me matiḥ ca me sumatiḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: And may my knowledge and my knowable and my past and my future and my good path and my good way and my prosperity and my success and my equipment and my equipment-ness and my thought and my good thought prosper by sacrifice.

original: vrīhayaś ca me yavāś ca me māṣāś ca me tilāś ca me mudgāś ca me khalvāś ca me priyaṅgavaś ca me 'ṇavaś ca me śyāmākāś ca me nīvārāś ca me godhūmāś ca me masūrāś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: vrīhayaḥ ca me yavāḥ ca me māṣāḥ ca me tilāḥ ca me mudgāḥ ca me khalvāḥ ca me priyaṅgavaḥ ca me ṇavaḥ ca me śyāmākāḥ ca me nīvārāḥ ca me godhūmāḥ ca me masūrāḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May my rice, my barley, my beans, my sesamum, my kidney-beans, my vetches, my priyangu, my aṇu, my śyāmāka, my wild rice, my wheat, and my lentils prosper by sacrifice.

original: aśmā ca me mṛttikā ca me girayaś ca me parvatāś ca me sikatāś ca me vanaspatayaś ca me hiraṇyaṃ ca me 'yaś ca me śyāmaṃ ca me lohaṃ ca me sīsaṃ ca me trapu ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: aśmā ca me mṛttikā ca me girayaḥ ca me parvatāḥ ca me sikatāḥ ca me vanaspatayaḥ ca me hiraṇyam ca me yaḥ ca me śyāmam ca me loham ca me sīsam ca me trapu ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May my stone, my clay, my mountains, my hills, my sand, my trees, my gold, my iron, my dark (metal), my copper, my lead, and my tin prosper by sacrifice.

original: agniś ca ma āpaś ca me vīrudhaś ca ma oṣadhayaś ca me kṛṣṭapacyāś ca me 'kṛṣṭapacyāś ca me grāmyāś ca me paśava āraṇyāś ca me vittaṃ ca me vittiś ca me bhūtaṃ ca me bhūtiś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: agniḥ ca me āpaḥ ca me vīrudhaḥ ca me oṣadhayaḥ ca me kṛṣṭapacyāḥ ca me kṛṣṭapacyāḥ ca me grāmyāḥ ca me paśavaḥ āraṇyāḥ ca me vittam ca me vittiḥ ca me bhūtam ca me bhūtiḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām  /
translated: May my fire, my water, my plants, my herbs, my cultivated crops, my uncultivated crops, my domestic animals, my wild animals, my wealth, my acquisition, my being, and my prosperity prosper by sacrifice.

original: vasu ca me vasatiś ca me karma ca me śaktiś ca me 'rthaś ca ma emaś ca ma ityā ca me gatiś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: vasu ca me vasatiḥ ca me karma ca me śaktiḥ ca me rthaḥ ca me ca me ityā ca me gatiḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May my wealth, my dwelling, my action, my power, my object, my motion, my going, and my progress prosper by sacrifice.

original: agniś ca ma indraś ca me somaś ca ma indraś ca me savitā ca ma indraś ca me sarasvatī ca ma indraś ca me pūṣā ca ma indraś ca me bṛhaspatiś ca ma indraś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: agniḥ ca me indraḥ ca me somaḥ ca me indraḥ ca me savitā ca me indraḥ ca me sarasvatī ca me indraḥ ca me pūṣā ca me indraḥ ca me bṛhaspatiḥ ca me indraḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May Agni and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Soma and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Savitar and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Sarasvatî and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Pûshan and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Brihaspati and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice.

original: mitraś ca ma indraś ca me varuṇaś ca ma indraś ca me dhātā ca ma indraś ca me tvaṣṭā ca ma indraś ca me marutaś ca ma indraś ca me viśve ca me devā indraś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: mitraḥ ca me indraḥ ca me varuṇaḥ ca me indraḥ ca me dhātā ca me indraḥ ca me tvaṣṭā ca me indraḥ ca me marutaḥ ca me indraḥ ca me viśve ca me devāḥ indraḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May Mitra and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Varuna and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Dhâtar and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Tvashtar and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May the Maruts and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May the All-Gods and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice.

original: pṛthivī ca ma indraś ca me 'ntarikṣaṃ ca ma indraś ca me dyauś ca ma indraś ca me samāś ca ma indraś ca me nakṣatrāṇi ca ma indraś ca me diśaś ca ma indraś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: pṛthivī ca me indraḥ ca me ntarikṣam ca me indraḥ ca me dyauḥ ca me indraḥ ca me samāḥ ca me indraḥ ca me nakṣatrāṇi ca me indraḥ ca me diśaḥ ca me indraḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May Earth and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Firmament and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May Heaven and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May the Seasons and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May the Stars and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice. May the Quarters and Indra prosper for me by the sacrifice.

original: amśuś ca me raśmiś ca me 'dābhyaś ca me 'dhipatiś ca ma upāmśuś ca me 'ntaryāmaś ca ma aindravāyavaś ca me maitrāvaruṇaś ca ma āśvinaś ca me pratiprasthānaś ca me śukraś ca me manthī ca me yajñena kalpantām //🔽āgrayāṇaś ca me vaiśvadevaś ca me dhruvaś ca me vaiśvānaraś ca ma aindrāgnaś ca me mahāvaiśvadevaś ca me marutvatīyāś ca me niṣkevalyaś ca me sāvitraś ca me sārasvataś ca me patnīvataś ca me hāriyaojanaś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: amśuḥ ca me raśmiḥ ca me dābhyaḥ ca me dhipatiḥ ca me upāmśuḥ ca me ntaryāmaḥ ca me aindra vāyavaḥ ca me maitrāvaruṇaḥ ca me āśvinaḥ ca me pratiprasthānaḥ ca me śukraḥ ca me manthī ca me yajñena kalpantām  āgrayāṇaḥ ca me vaiśvadevaḥ ca me dhruvaḥ ca me vaiśvānaraḥ ca me aindrāgnaḥ ca me mahāvaiśvadevaḥ ca me marutvatīyāḥ ca me niṣkevalyaḥ ca me sāvitraḥ ca me sārasvataḥ ca me patnīvataḥ ca me hāriyaojanaḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May my Amsu and my Rasmi, and my Adabhya and my Adhipati, and my Upamshu and my Antaryama, and my Aindravayava and my Maitraravuna, and my Asvins, and my Pratiprasthana, and my Sukra and my Manthin be established by sacrifice.🔽May my Agrayana and my Vaisvadeva and my Dhruva and my Vaisvanara, and my Aindragna and my Mahavaisvadeva, and my Marutvatlya and my Niskaklya, and my Savitra and my Sarasvata, and my Patnivata and my Hariyojana be established by sacrifice.

original: srucaś ca me camasāś ca me vāyavyāni ca me droṇakalaśaś ca me grāvāṇaś ca me 'dhiṣavaṇe ca me pūtabhṛc ca ma ādhavanīyaś ca me vediś ca me barhiś ca me 'vabhṛtaś ca me svagākāraś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: srucaḥ ca me camasāḥ ca me vāyavyāni ca me droṇakalaśaḥ ca me grāvāṇaḥ ca me dhiṣavaṇe ca me pūtabhṛt ca me ādhavanīyaḥ ca me vediḥ ca me barhiḥ ca me cabhṛtaḥ ca me svagākāraḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May my ladles and my cups, and my Vayavya vessels, and my Dronakalasha, and my pressing-stones and my two pressing-boards, and my Putabhrt and my Adhavaniya jars, and my Vedi and my sacrificial grass, and my Avabhritha and my Svaha-call be established by sacrifice.

original: agniś ca me gharmaś ca me 'rkaś ca me sūryaś ca me prāṇaś ca me 'svamedhaś ca me pṛthivī ca me 'ditiś ca me ditiś ca me dyauś ca me 'ṅgulayaḥ śakvarayo diśaś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: agniḥ ca me gharmaḥ ca me rkaḥ ca me sūryaḥ ca me prāṇaḥ ca me sva medhaḥ ca me pṛthivī ca me ditiḥ ca me ditiḥ ca me dyauḥ ca me ṅgulayaḥ śakvarayaḥ diśaḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May Agni and Gharma and Arka and Surya and Prana and Asvamedha and Earth and Aditi and Diti and Heaven and the fingers and the Sakvaras and the quarters be established by sacrifice for me.

original: vrataṃ ca ma ṛtavaś ca me tapaś ca me saṃvatsaraś ca me 'horātre ūrvaṣṭhīve bṛhadrathantare ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: vratam ca me ṛtavaḥ ca me tapaḥ ca me saṃvatsaraḥ ca me horātre ūru aṣṭhīve bṛhat rathantare ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: May the vow and the seasons and penance and the year and the day and night and the thighs and the Brihat and Rathantara be established by sacrifice for me.

original: ekā ca me tisraś ca me tisraś ca me pañca ca me pañca ca me sapta ca me sapta ca me nava ca me nava ca ma ekādaśa ca ma ekādaśa ca me trayodaśa ca me trayodaśa ca me pañcadaśa ca me pañcadaśa ca me saptadaśa ca me śaptadaśa ca me navadaśa ca me navadaśa ca ma ekavimśatiś ca ma ekavimśatiś ca me trayovimśatiś ca me trayovimśatiś ca me pañcavimśatiś ca me pañcavimśatiś ca me saptavimśatiś ca me saptavimśatiś ca me navavimśatiś ca me navavimśatiś ca ma ekatrimśac ca ma ekatrimśac ca me trayastrimśac ca me trayastrimśac ca me yajñena kalpantām //

May they prosper through the sacrifice.

original: paṣṭhavāṭ ca me paṣṭhauhī ca ma ukṣā ca me vaśā ca ma ṛṣabhaś ca me vehac ca me 'naḍvāmś ca me dhenuś ca me yajñena kalpantām //
analyzed: paṣṭhavāh ca me paṣṭhauhī ca me ukṣā ca me vaśā ca me ṛṣabhaḥ ca me vehat ca me naḍvāmū ca me dhenuḥ ca me yajñena kalpantām
translated: And my bull and my barren cow and my bull and my cow and my bull and my heifer and my bull and my milch cow, may they prosper by sacrifice.

original: vājāya svāhā prasavāya svāhāpijāya svāhā kratave svāhā vasave svāhāharpataye svāhāhne svāhā mugdhāya svāhā mugdhāya vainamśināya svāhāvinamśina āntyāyanāya svāhāntyāya bhauvanāya svāhā bhuvanasya pataye svāhādhipataye svāhā prajāpataye svāhā / iyaṃ te rāṇ mitrāya yantāsi yamana ūrje tvā vṛṣṭyai tvā prajānāṃ tvādhipatyāya //
analyzed: vājāya svāhā prasavāya svāhā apijāya svāhā kratave svāhā vasave svāhā aharpataye svāhā ahne svāhā mugdhāya svāhā mugdhāya vainamśināya svāhā avinamśine āntyāyanāya svāhā antyāya bhauvanāya svāhā bhuvanasya pataye svāhā adhipataye svāhā prajāpataye svāhā  / iyam te rāj mitrāya yantā asi yamane ūrje tvā vṛṣṭyai tvā prajānām tvā ādhipatyāya  /
translated: To Vaja hail! To Prasava hail! To Apti hail! To Kratu hail! To Vasu hail! To the Lord of the Day hail! To the Day hail! To the Bright hail! To the Bright with the Shining hail! To the Shining with the Last-born hail! To the Last-born of the World hail! To the Lord of the World hail! To the Overlord hail! To Prajapati hail! This is thy kingdom, O Mitra. Thou art the controller, the restrainer. For strength thee! For rain thee! For lordship over creatures thee!

original: āyur yajñena kalpatāṃ prāṇo yajñena kalpatāṃ cakṣur yajñena kalpatām śrotraṃ yajñena kalpatāṃ vāg yajñena kalpatāṃ mano yajñena kalpatām ātmā yajñena kalpatāṃ brahmā yajñena kalpatāṃ jyotir yajñena kalpatām svar yajñena kalpatāṃ pṛṣṭhaṃ yajñena kalpatāṃ yajño yajñena kalpatām / stomaś ca yajuś ca ṛk ca sāma ca bṛhac ca rathantaraṃ ca / svar devā aganmāmṛtā abhūma prajāpateḥ prajā abhūma veṭ svāhā //
analyzed: āyuḥ yajñena kalpatām prāṇaḥ yajñena kalpatām cakṣuḥ yajñena kalpatām śrotram yajñena kalpatām vāc yajñena kalpatām manaḥ yajñena kalpatām ātmā yajñena kalpatām brahmā yajñena kalpatām jyotiḥ yajñena kalpatām svar yajñena kalpatām pṛṣṭham yajñena kalpatām yajñaḥ yajñena kalpatām  / stomaḥ ca yajuḥ ca ṛc ca sāma ca bṛhat ca rathantaram ca    svar devāḥ aganma amṛtāḥ abhūma prajāpateḥ prajāḥ abhūma veṭ svāhā
translated: May life be perfected by the sacrifice, may breath be perfected by the sacrifice, may sight be perfected by the sacrifice, may hearing be perfected by the sacrifice, may speech be perfected by the sacrifice, may mind be perfected by the sacrifice, may the self be perfected by the sacrifice, may the Brahman be perfected by the sacrifice, may light be perfected by the sacrifice, may heaven be perfected by the sacrifice, may the back (of the altar) be perfected by the sacrifice, may the sacrifice be perfected by the sacrifice. May the Stoma, the Yajus, the Rik, the Saman, the Brihat, the Rathantara, may the gods have gone to heaven, may we have become immortal, may we have become the offspring of Prajapati. Vet, hail!

original: vājasya nu prasave mātaraṃ mahīm aditiṃ nāma vacasā karāmahe / yasyām idaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanam āviveśa tasyāṃ no devaḥ savitā dharma sāviṣat //
analyzed: vājasya nu prasave mātaram mahīm aditim nāma vacasā karāmahe    yasyām idam viśvam bhuvanam āviveśa tasyām naḥ devaḥ savitā dharma sāviṣat
translated: We will extol with our speech the great mother Aditi, the mother of the impulse of strength, in whom this whole world has found a place. In her may the god Savitar impel our spiritual power.

original: viśve adya maruto viśva ūtī viśve bhavantv agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ / viśve no devā avasā gamantu viśvam astu draviṇaṃ vājo asme //
analyzed: viśve adya marutaḥ viśve ūtī viśve bhavantu agnayaḥ samiddhāḥ   viśve naḥ devāḥ avasā gamantu viśvam astu draviṇam vājaḥ asme
translated: May all the Maruts today be our helpers, may all the fires be enkindled for us. May all the gods come to us with help. May all wealth and strength be ours.

original: vājo naḥ sapta pradiśaś catasro vā parāvataḥ / vājo no viśvair devair dhanasātāv ihāvatu //🔽vājo no adya pra suvāti dānaṃ vājo devām ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti / vājo hi mā sarvavīraṃ jajāna viśvā āśā vājapatir jayeyam //
analyzed: vājaḥ naḥ sapta pradiśaḥ catasraḥ vā parāvataḥ   vājaḥ naḥ viśvaiḥ devaiḥ dhana sātau iha avatu  vājaḥ naḥ adya pra suvāti dānam vājaḥ devām ṛtubhiḥ kalpayāti    vājaḥ hi mā sarva vīram jajāna viśvāḥ āśāḥ vāja patiḥ jayeyam
translated: May Vaja (strength) be to us in the seven regions, or in the four remote ones. May Vaja (strength) help us here in gaining wealth with all the gods.🔽May Vaja (strength) today speed our gift, may Vaja (strength) make the gods ready with the seasons. For Vaja (strength) has begotten me with all heroes. I would conquer all quarters as lord of strength.

original: vajaḥ purastād uta madhyato no vājo devān haviṣā vardhayāti / vājo hi mā sarvavīraṃ cakāra sarvā āśā vājapatir bhaveyam //
analyzed: vajaḥ purastāt uta madhyatas naḥ vājaḥ devān haviṣā vardhayāti   vājaḥ hi mā sarva vīram cakāra sarvāḥ āśāḥ vāja patiḥ bhaveyam
translated: May Vaja (strength) from the east and from the west, may Vaja (strength) from the south and from the north, may Vaja (strength) from above and from below, may Vaja (strength) from all sides increase our strength.

original: saṃ mā sṛjāmi payasā pṛthivyāḥ saṃ mā sṛjāmy adbhir oṣadhībhiḥ / so 'haṃ vājam saneyam agne //
analyzed: sam mā sṛjāmi payasā pṛthivyāḥ sam mā sṛjāmi adbhiḥ oṣadhībhiḥ    saḥ ham vājam saneyam agne
translated: I unite myself with the milk of the earth, I unite myself with the water and the plants. May I, O Agni, win strength.

original: payaḥ pṛthivyāṃ paya oṣadhīṣu payo divy antarikṣe payo dhāḥ / payasvatīḥ pradiśaḥ santu mahyam //
analyzed: payaḥ pṛthivyām payaḥ oṣadhīṣu payaḥ divi antarikṣe payaḥ dhāḥ   / payasvatīḥ pradiśaḥ santu mahyam
translated: Milk is in the earth, milk is in the plants, milk is in the sky, milk is in the atmosphere. Give me milk. Let all the quarters be rich in milk for me.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / sarasvatyai vāco yantur yantreṇāgneḥ sāmrājyenābhi ṣiñcāmi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām      sarasvatyai vācaḥ yantuḥ yantreṇa agneḥ sāmrājyena abhi siñcāmi
translated: By the impulse of the god Savitr, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, with the contrivance of Sarasvati the controller of speech, I consecrate (you) with the sovereignty of Agni.

original: ṛtāṣāḍ ṛtadhāmāgnir gandharvas tasyauṣadhayo 'psaraso mudo nāma / sa na idaṃ brahma kṣatraṃ pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā //🔽samhito viśvasāmā sūryo gandharvas tasya marīcayo 'psarasa āyuvo nāma / sa na idaṃ brahma kṣatraṃ pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ṛtāṣāh ṛta dhāmā agniḥ gandharvaḥ tasya oṣadhayaḥ psarasaḥ mudaḥ nāma     sa naḥ idam brahma kṣatram pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā  samhitaḥ viśvasāmā sūryaḥ gandharvaḥ tasya marīcayaḥ psarasaḥ āyuvaḥ nāma    sa naḥ idam brahma kṣatram pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā
translated: The Gandharva Agni, the upholder of truth, the lord of truth, whose Apsarases are the plants, whose name is Mudas. May he protect this our priesthood and nobility. To him hail! To them hail!🔽The Gandharva Surya, the all-conquering, the all-supporting, whose Apsarases are the sun's rays, whose name is Ayuvas. May he protect this our priesthood and nobility. To him hail! To them hail!

original: suṣumṇaḥ sūryaraśmiś candramā gandharvas tasya nakṣatrāṇy apsaraso bhekurayo nāma / sa na idaṃ brahma kṣatraṃ pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā //🔽iṣiro viśvavyacā vāto gandharvas tasyapo apsarasa ūrjo nāma / sa na idaṃ brahma kṣatraṃ pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: suṣumṇaḥ sūrya raśmiḥ candramāḥ gandharvaḥ tasya nakṣatrāṇi apsarasaḥ bhekurayaḥ nāma    sa naḥ idam brahma kṣatram pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā  iṣiraḥ viśva vyacāḥ vātaḥ gandharvaḥ tasya apaḥ apsarasaḥ ūrjaḥ nāma    sa naḥ idam brahma kṣatram pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā
translated: The Gandharva Chandrama, the sun's ray, whose Apsarases are the stars, whose name is Bhekurus. May he protect this our priesthood and nobility. To him hail! To them hail!🔽The Gandharva Vata, the all-pervading, the all-supporting, whose Apsarases are the waters, whose name is Urjas. May he protect this our priesthood and nobility. To him hail! To them hail!

original: bhujyuḥ suparṇo yajño gandharvas tasya dakṣiṇā apsarasa stāvā nāma / sa na idaṃ brahma kṣatraṃ pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: bhujyuḥ suparṇaḥ yajñaḥ gandharvaḥ tasya dakṣiṇāḥ apsarasaḥ stāvāḥ nāma   sa naḥ idam brahma kṣatram pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā
translated: The Gandharva Yajna, the well-winged, the well-feathered, whose Apsarases are the sacrificial fees, whose name is Stavas. May he protect this our priesthood and nobility. To him hail! To them hail!

original: prajāpatir viśvakarmā mano gandharvas tasya ṛksāmāny apsarasa eṣṭayo nāma / sa na idaṃ brahma kṣatraṃ pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ viśvakarmā manaḥ gandharvaḥ tasya ṛk sāmāni apsarasaḥ eṣṭayaḥ nāma    sa naḥ idam brahma kṣatram pātu tasmai svāhā vāṭ tābhyaḥ svāhā
translated: Prajapati, the all-creating, the mind, the Gandharva, his Apsarases are the Rikas and Samans, named Eshtas. May he protect this Brahman and Kshatriya. To him Svâhâ! To them Svâhâ!

original: sa no bhuvanasya pate prajāpate yasya ta upari gṛhā yasya veha / asmai brahmaṇe 'smai kṣatrāya mahi śarma yaccha svāhā //
analyzed: sa naḥ bhuvanasya pate prajāpate yasya te upari gṛhāḥ yasya vā iha    asmai brahmaṇe smai kṣatrāya mahi śarma yaccha svāhā
translated: He, O Lord of the world, O Prajapati, whose houses are above and whose are below, to him the Brahman, to him the Kshatriya, grant great protection. Svâhâ!

original: samudro 'si nabhasvān ārdradānuḥ śambhūr mayobhūr abhi mā vāhi svāhā / māruto 'si marutāṃ gaṇaḥ śambhūr mayobhūr abhi mā vāhi svāhā / avasyūr asi duvasvāñ chambhūr mayobhūr abhi mā vāhi svāhā //🔽yās te agne sūrye ruco divam ātanvanti raśmibhiḥ / tābhir no adya sarvābhī ruce janāya nas kṛdhi //
analyzed: samudraḥ si nabhasvān ārdra dānuḥ śambhūḥ mayobhūḥ abhi mā vāhi svāhā   mārutaḥ si marutām gaṇaḥ śambhūḥ mayobhūḥ abhi mā vāhi svāhā   avasyuḥ asi duvasvān śambhūḥ mayobhūḥ abhi mā vāhi svāhā  yāḥ te agne sūrye rucaḥ divam ātanvanti raśmibhiḥ   tābhiḥ naḥ adya sarvābhiḥ ruce janāya naḥ kṛdhi
translated: Thou art the ocean, the cloud-bearing, the rain-giving, the auspicious, the kindly. Bear me up to heaven. Svâhâ! Thou art the Marut, the troop of Maruts, the auspicious, the kindly. Bear me up to heaven. Svâhâ! Thou art the dependent, the worshipper, the auspicious, the kindly. Bear me up to heaven. Svâhâ!🔽Thy flames, O Agni, which, in the sun, O God, thou spreadest through the sky with thy rays, - With all of them this day make thou our people shine with splendour.

original: yā vo devāḥ sūrye ruco goṣv aśveṣu yā rucaḥ / indrāgnī tābhiḥ sarvābhī rucaṃ no dhatta bṛhaspate //
analyzed: yāḥ vaḥ devāḥ sūrye rucaḥ goṣu aśveṣu yāḥ rucaḥ  / indra agnī tābhiḥ sarvābhiḥ rucam naḥ dhatta bṛhaspate
translated: Your flames, O Gods, which are in the sun, and your flames which are in the cows and horses, - With all of them, O Indra and Agni, grant us splendour, O Brhaspati.

original: rucaṃ no dhehi brāhmaṇeṣu rucam rājasu nas kṛdhi / rucaṃ viśyeṣu śūdreṣu mayi dhehi rucā rucam //
analyzed: rucam naḥ dhehi brāhmaṇeṣu rucam rājasu naḥ kṛdhi   rucam viśyeṣu śūdreṣu mayi dhehi rucā rucam
translated: Grant us favour among the Brahmans, grant us favour among the kings. Grant us favour among the Vaishyas and Shudras. Grant me favour with favour.

original: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānas tad ā śāste yajamāno havirbhiḥ / aheḍamāno varuṇeha bodhy uruśamsa mā na āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ //
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ tat ā śāste yajamānaḥ havirbhiḥ    a heḍamānaḥ varuṇa iha bodhi uru śamsa mā naḥ āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ
translated: With this prayer I come to thee, worshipping, and the sacrificer with oblations implores this of thee. Be not angry here, O Varuna: be propitious, O thou of much wealth, and let not our life be shortened.

original: svar ṇa gharmaḥ svāhā / svar ṇārkaḥ svāhā / svar ṇa śukraḥ svāhā / svar ṇa jyotiḥ svāhā / svar ṇa sūryaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: svar na gharmaḥ svāhā svar na arkaḥ svāhā   svar na śukraḥ svāhā svar na jyotiḥ svāhā svar na sūryaḥ svāhā
translated: To the heaven, O Gharma, hail! To the heaven, O Arka, hail! To the heaven, O Shukra, hail! To the heaven, O Jyotis, hail! To the heaven, O Surya, hail!

original: agniṃ yunajmi śavasā ghṛtena divyam suparṇaṃ vayasā bṛhantam / tena vayaṃ gamema bradhnasya viṣṭapam svo ruhāṇā adhi nakam uttamam //
analyzed: agnim yunajmi śavasā ghṛtena divyam suparṇam vayasā bṛhantam    tena vayam gamema bradhnasya viṣṭapam svar ruhāṇāḥ adhi nakam uttamam
translated: I yoke Agni with strength and ghee, the divine bird, great in his wings. By him may we go to the wide expanse of the atmosphere, ascending our own highest station.

original: imau te pakṣāv ajarau patatriṇau yābhyām rakṣāmsy apahamsy agne / tābhyāṃ patema sukṛtām u lokaṃ yatra ṛṣayo jagmuḥ prathamajāḥ purāṇāḥ //
analyzed: imau te pakṣau ajarau patatriṇau yābhyām rakṣāmsi apahamsi agne    tābhyām patema su kṛtām u lokam yatra ṛṣayaḥ jagmuḥ prathama jāḥ purāṇāḥ
translated: These two thy wings, O Agni, undecaying, wherewith thou fliest about, wherewith thou drivest away the Raksases, — by them may we fly to the world of the virtuous, where the Rishis, the first-born ancients, have gone.

original: indur dakṣaḥ śyena ṛtāvā hiraṇyapakṣaḥ śakuno bhuraṇyuḥ / mahānt sadhasthe dhruva ā niṣatto namas te astu mā mā himsīḥ //
analyzed: induḥ dakṣaḥ śyenaḥ ṛtāvā hiraṇya pakṣaḥ śakunaḥ bhuraṇyuḥ    mahān sadhasthe dhruve ā niṣattaḥ namaḥ te astu mā mā himsīḥ
translated: Firm in the great abode, is set. To thee be homage: harm me not.🔽Thou art the head of heaven, the navel of earth, the strength of waters and plants.

original: divo mūrdhāsi pṛthivyā nābhir ūrg apām oṣadhīnām / viśvāyuḥ śarma saprathā namas pathe //
analyzed: divaḥ mūrdhā asi pṛthivyāḥ nābhiḥ ūrj apām oṣadhīnām    viśvāyuḥ śarma saprathāḥ namaḥ pathe
translated: All-life, shelter, and wide expanse, homage to the path.

original: viśvasya mūrdhann adhi tiṣṭhasi śritaḥ samudre te hṛdayam apsv āyur apo dattodadhiṃ bhintta / divas parjanyād antarikṣāt pṛthivyās tato no vṛṣṭyāva //
analyzed: viśvasya mūrdhan adhi tiṣṭhasi śritaḥ samudre te hṛdayam apsu āyuḥ apaḥ datta udadhim bhintta        parjanyāt antarikṣāt pṛthivyāḥ tatas naḥ vṛṣṭī ava
translated: Thou standest on the head of the universe, supported. The ocean is thy heart, life is in the waters. Thou hast given the waters, thou hast cleft the ocean. From heaven, from Parjanya, from the atmosphere, from earth, from there come to us with rain.

original: iṣṭo yajño bhṛgubhir āśīrdā vasubhiḥ / tasya na iṣṭasya prītasya draviṇehā gameḥ //
analyzed: iṣṭaḥ yajñaḥ bhṛgubhiḥ āśīḥ dāḥ vasubhiḥ   tasya naḥ iṣṭasya prītasya draviṇā īhāḥ gameḥ
translated: The sacrifice is offered, with the Bhṛgus, bestowing blessings, with the Vasus. Of that offered sacrifice, of the delighted one, come thou to the possession of wealth.

original: iṣṭo agnir āhutaḥ pipartu na iṣṭam haviḥ / svagedaṃ devebhyo namaḥ //
analyzed: iṣṭaḥ agniḥ āhutaḥ pipartu naḥ iṣṭam haviḥ    svagā idam devebhyaḥ namaḥ
translated: May the offered Agni, the invoked, protect our offered oblation. To the gods be this homage.🔽What hath flowed from the thought, from the heart, or from the mind, collected from the eye,

original: yad ākūtāt samasusrod dhṛdo vā manaso vā sambhṛtaṃ cakṣuṣo vā / tad anu preta sukṛtām u olkaṃ yatra ṛṣayo jagmuḥ prathamajāḥ purāṇāḥ //
analyzed: yat ākūtāt samasusrot dhṛdaḥ vā manasaḥ vā sambhṛtam cakṣuṣaḥ vā    tat anu preta su kṛtām u ā ulkam yatra ṛṣayaḥ jagmuḥ prathama jāḥ purāṇāḥ
translated: Follow that, to the light of the good deeds, where the Ṛṣis, the first-born ancients, have gone.

original: etam sadhastha pari te dadāmi yam āvahāc chevadhiṃ jātavedāḥ / anvāgantā yajñapatir vo atra tam sma jānīta parame vyoman //
analyzed: etam sadhastha pari te dadāmi yam āvahāt śevadhim jātavedāḥ    anvāgantā yajñapatiḥ vaḥ atra tam sma jānīta parame vyoman
translated: I give him over to your care, O abode of the gods, whom Jâtavedas shall bring to you as his portion. The lord of sacrifice shall follow him hither: know ye him in the highest heaven.

original: etaṃ jānātha parame vyoman devāḥ sadhasthā vida rūpam asya / yad āgacchāt pathibhir devayānair iṣṭāpūrte kṛṇavāthāvir asmai //
analyzed: etam jānātha parame vyoman devāḥ sadhasthāḥ vida rūpam asya    yat āgacchāt pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ iṣṭāpūrte kṛṇavātha āvis asmai
translated: Know ye this one in the highest heaven, O ye gods, in your abode, know his form. When he hath come by the paths that go to the gods, make ye manifest to him his offered sacrifice.

original: ud budhyasvāgne prati jāgṛhi tvam iṣṭāpūrte sam sṛjethām ayaṃ ca / asmint sadhasthe adhy uttarasmin visve devā yajamānāś ca sīdata //
analyzed: ud budhyasva agne prati jāgṛhi tvam iṣṭāpūrte sam sṛjethām ayam ca    asmin sadhasthe adhi uttarasmin visve devāḥ yajamānāḥ ca sīdata
translated: Awake, O Agni, and be watchful: with this one do thou unite this one in the performance of sacrifice and the gaining of heaven. Sit ye down all ye gods in this highest place of assembly, and ye sacrificers.🔽By which thou carriest a thousand, by which all wealth, O Agni,

original: yena vahasi sahasraṃ yenāgne sarvavedasam / tenemaṃ yajñaṃ no naya svar deveṣu gantave //
analyzed: yena vahasi sahasram yena agne sarvavedasam     tena imam yajñam naḥ naya svar deveṣu gantave
translated: by that lead this sacrifice of ours to heaven, that we may go to the gods.

original: prastareṇa paridhinā srucā vedyā ca barhiṣā / ṛcemaṃ yajñaṃ no naya svar deveṣu gantave //
analyzed: prastareṇa paridhinā srucā vedyā ca barhiṣā    ṛcā imam yajñam naḥ naya svar deveṣu gantave
translated: By the Prastara, by the enclosing-sticks, by the offering-spoon, by the altar, by the sacrificial grass, lead this sacrifice of ours to heaven, that we may go to the gods.

original: yad dattaṃ yat parādānaṃ yat pūrtaṃ yāś ca dakṣiṇāḥ / tad agnir vaiśvakarmaṇaḥ svar deveṣu no dadhat //
analyzed: yat dattam yat parādānam yat pūrtam yāḥ ca dakṣiṇāḥ   tat agniḥ vaiśvakarmaṇaḥ svar deveṣu naḥ dadhat
translated: What is given, what is taken away, what is fulfilled, and what sacrificial gifts there are, may Agni, the all-worker, bestow these in heaven for us among the gods.

original: yatra dhārā anapetā madhor ghṛtasya ca yāḥ / tad agnir vaiśvakarmaṇaḥ svar deveṣu no dadhat //
analyzed: yatra dhārāḥ an apetāḥ madhoḥ ghṛtasya ca yāḥ      tat agniḥ vaiśvakarmaṇaḥ svar deveṣu naḥ dadhat
translated: Where the streams of honey and ghee are not lacking, there may Agni, the all-worker, bestow heaven upon us among the gods.

original: agnir asmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtaṃ me cakṣur amṛtaṃ ma āsan / arkas tridhātū rajaso vimāno 'jasro gharmo havir asmi nāma //
analyzed: agniḥ asmi janmanā jātavedāḥ ghṛtam me cakṣuḥ amṛtam me āsan   arkaḥ tri dhātuḥ rajasaḥ vimānaḥ jasraḥ gharmaḥ haviḥ asmi nāma
translated: I am Agni by birth, the all-knower; ghee is my eye, immortality my food. The Arka, threefold, the measurer of space, the ceaseless heat, the oblation, is my name.

original: ṛco nāmāsmi yajūmṣi nāmāsmi sāmāni nāmāsmi / ye agnayaḥ prāñcajanyā asyāṃ pṛthivyām adhi / teṣām asi tvam uttamaḥ pra no jīvatave suva //
analyzed: ṛcaḥ nāma asmi yajūmṣi nāma asmi sāmāni nāma asmi    ye agnayaḥ prāñcajanyāḥ asyām pṛthivyām adhi    teṣām asi tvam uttamaḥ pra naḥ jīvatave suva
translated: I am the name of the Ṛc verses, I am the name of the Yajus formulas, I am the name of the Sāman chants. Of the fires that have been kindled in the east, in the south, in the west, in the north, on this earth, you are the best. Lead us to life, to prosperity.

original: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca / indra tvā vartayāmasi //
analyzed: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca    indra tvā vartayāmasi
translated: For the slaying of Vṛtra, for strength, and for conquering in battles, O Indra, we invoke you.

original: sahadānuṃ puruhūta kṣiyantam ahastam indra saṃ piṇak kuṇārum / abhi vṛtraṃ vardhamānaṃ piyārum apādam indra tavasā jaghantha //
analyzed: saha dānum puruhūta kṣiyantam ahastam indra sam piṇak kuṇārum    abhi vṛtram vardhamānam piyārum a pādam indra tavasā jaghantha
translated: O Indra, invoked by many, you crushed the handless demon who dwelt with the Dānus, and you struck down the growing, fat Vrtra, O Indra, with your power.

original: vi na indra mṛdho jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ / yo asmām abhidāsaty adharaṃ gamayā tamaḥ //
analyzed: vi naḥ indra mṛdhaḥ jahi nīcā yaccha pṛtanyataḥ    yaḥ asmām abhidāsati adharam gamaya tamaḥ
translated: O Indra, destroy our enemies, cast down those who rise against us. Cast down into the lowest darkness him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: mṛgo na bhīmaḥ kucaro giriṣṭhāḥ parāvata ā jaganthā parasyāḥ / sṛkam samśāya pavim indra tigmaṃ vi śatrūn tāḍhi vi mṛdho nudasva //
analyzed: mṛgaḥ na bhīmaḥ kucaraḥ giriṣṭhāḥ parāvataḥ ā jagantha parasyāḥ  / sṛkam samśāya pavim indra tigmam vi śatrūn tāḍhi vi mṛdhaḥ nudasva
translated: Like a terrible beast ranging the mountains, come thou from the farthest distance, O Agni, from the other world. Having fixed thy dart and thy sharp point, O Indra, destroy the enemies, drive away the foes.

original: vaiśvānaro na ūtaya ā pra yātu parāvataḥ / agnir naḥ suṣṭutīr upa //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ ūtaye ā pra yātu parāvataḥ   agniḥ naḥ suṣṭutīḥ upa
translated: May Vaisvānara Agni come to us for our help from the farthest distance. May Agni come to our praises.

original: pṛṣṭo divi pṛṣṭo agniḥ pṛthivyāṃ pṛṣṭo viśvā oṣadhīr ā viveśa / vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭo agniḥ sa no divā sa riṣas pātu naktam //
analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ divi pṛṣṭaḥ agniḥ pṛthivyām pṛṣṭaḥ viśvāḥ oṣadhīḥ ā viveśa     vaiśvānaraḥ sahasā pṛṣṭaḥ agniḥ sa naḥ divā sa riṣaḥ pātu naktam
translated: Agni is worshipped in heaven, worshipped on earth, worshipped he hath entered into all the plants. Agni Vaisvānara is worshipped with might. May he by day and night protect us from injury.

original: aśyāma te kāmam agne tavotī aśyāma rayim rayivaḥ suvīram / aśyāma vājam abhi vājayanto 'śyāma dyumnam ajarājaraṃ te //
analyzed: aśyāma te kāmam agne tava ūtī aśyāma rayim rayivas su vīram   aśyāma vājam abhi vājayantaḥ śyāma dyumnam ajara ajaram te
translated: We would win thy favour, O Agni, with our songs, we would win wealth, O wealthy one, with brave sons. We would win strength, O thou who givest strength, we would win glory, O thou of unfading glory.

original: vayaṃ te adya rarimā hi kāmam uttānahastā namasopasadya / yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān asredhatā manmanā vipro agne //
analyzed: vayam te adya rarimā hi kāmam uttāna hastāḥ namasā upasadya   yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān a sredhatā manmanā vipraḥ agne
translated: We have to-day fulfilled thy will, O Agni, we with uplifted hands, sitting down, with homage. With most reverent spirit worship the gods, O Agni, the priest with unstinted hymn.

original: dhāmacchad agnir indro brahmā devo bṛhaspatiḥ / sacetaso viśve devāyajñaṃ prāvantu naḥ śubhe //
analyzed: dhāmacchad agniḥ indraḥ brahmā devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ    sacetasaḥ viśve devāyajñam prāvantu naḥ śubhe
translated: Agni, the abode-concealer, Indra, Brahman, the god Brihaspati, the all-cognizant gods, may they all favour our sacrifice for our welfare.

original: tvaṃ yaviṣṭha dāśuṣo nṛmḥ pāhi śṛṇudhī giraḥ / rakṣā tokam uta tmanā //
analyzed: tvam yaviṣṭha dāśuṣaḥ pāhi śṛṇudhi giraḥ    rakṣa tokam uta tmanā
translated: Thou, O most youthful, protect the man who offers gifts: hear thou his songs. Guard thou the offspring and thyself.

original: svādvīṃ tvā svādunā tīvrāṃ tīvreṇāmṛtām amṛtena / madhumatīṃ madhumatā sṛjāmi sam somena //
analyzed: svādvīm tvā svādunā tīvrām tīvreṇa amṛtām amṛtena    madhumatīm madhumatā sṛjāmi sam somena
translated: Thee, sweet with what is sweet, strong with what is strong, immortal with what is immortal, rich in meath with what is rich in meath, I mix together with Soma.

original: somo 'si / aśvibhyāṃ pacyasva / sarasvatyai pacyasva / indrāya sutrāmṇe pacyasva //
analyzed: somaḥ si  aśvibhyām pacyasva   sarasvatyai pacyasva   indrāya sutrāmṇe pacyasva
translated: Thou art Soma. Be thou purified for the Asvins. Be thou purified for Sarasvatî. Be thou purified for Indra, the good protector.

original: parīto ṣiñcatā sutam somo ya uttamam haviḥ / dadhanvā yo naryo apsv antar ā suṣāva somam adribhiḥ //🔽vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅk somo atidrutaḥ / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
analyzed: pari itas siñcata sutam somaḥ yaḥ uttamam haviḥ   dadhanvā yaḥ naryaḥ apsu antar ā suṣāva somam adribhiḥ  vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅ somaḥ atidrutaḥ indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: Pour round the juice that hath been pressed, Soma, the best of sacrificial offerings, He who hath flowed in the streams for men, who hath been filtered with the stones.🔽Purified by Vâyu with the cleansing sieve, Soma hath flowed in varied course, A friend meet for the friendship of Indra.

original: vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅk somo atidrutaḥ / indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā //
analyzed: vāyoḥ pūtaḥ pavitreṇa pratyaṅ somaḥ atidrutaḥ indrasya yujyaḥ sakhā
translated: Purified by Vâyu with the cleansing sieve, Soma hath flowed in varied course, A friend meet for the friendship of Indra.

original: punāti te parisrutam somam sūryasya duhitā / vāreṇa śaśvatā tanā //
analyzed: punāti te parisrutam somam sūryasya duhitā    vāreṇa śaśvatā tanā
translated: The Daughter of the Sun purifieth thee, O Soma, as thou flowest on, With the eternal filter.

original: brahma kṣatraṃ pavate teja indriyam surayā somaḥ suta āsuto madāya / śukreṇa deva devatāḥ pipṛgdhi rasenānnaṃ yajamānāya dhehi //
analyzed: brahma kṣatram pavate tejaḥ indriyam surayā somaḥ sutaḥ āsutaḥ madāya    śukreṇa deva devatāḥ pipṛgdhi rasena annam yajamānāya dhehi
translated: The Brahman and the Kshatra flow, the strength and energy of Soma, pressed with the Surâ, for the gladdening draught. With the bright juice, O God, satisfy the Gods, and give the sacrificer food with the sap.

original: kuvid aṅga yavamanto vayaṃ cid yathā dānty anupūrvaṃ viyūya / ihehaiṣāṃ kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣo namaktiṃ yajanti //
analyzed: kuvid aṅga yavamantaḥ vayam cit yathā dānti anupūrvam viyūya    iha iha eṣām kṛṇuhi bhojanāni ye barhiṣaḥ namaktim yajanti
translated: What, indeed, are we, the possessors of barley, like those who, in due order, distribute (the food)? Here, here, make ready their food, they who worship with reverence of the sacrificial grass.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si aśvibhyām tvā sarasvatyai tvā indrāya tvā su trāmṇe
translated: Thou art taken with a support; to the Asvins thee! to Sarasvatî thee! to Indra thee, the good protector!

original: eṣa te yonis tejase tvā vīryāya tvā balāya tvā //
analyzed: eṣa te yoniḥ tejase tvā vīryāya tvā balāya tvā
translated: This is thy womb; for splendour thee! for hero strength thee! for power thee!

original: nānā hi vāṃ devahitam sadas kṛtaṃ mā sam sṛkṣāthāṃ parame vyoman / surā tvam asi śuṣmiṇī soma eṣa mā mā himsīḥ svāṃ yonim āviśantī //
analyzed: nānā hi vām deva hitam sadaḥ kṛtam mā sam sṛkṣāthām parame vyoman      surā tvam asi śuṣmiṇī somaḥ eṣa mā mā himsīḥ svām yonim āviśantī
translated: Different is the place ye two have in the Gods' abode: do not ye two be mixed up in the highest heaven. Thou art the strong Surâ; he is Soma. Do not thou harm me as I enter my own womb.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy āśvinaṃ tejaḥ sārasvataṃ vīryam aindraṃ balam / eṣa te yonir modāya tvānandāya tvā mahase tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si āśvinam tejaḥ sārasvatam vīryam aindram balam     eṣa te yoniḥ modāya tvā ānandāya tvā mahase tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support; the Asvin splendour, the Sarasvatî hero strength, the Aindri power. This is thy womb; for joy thee! for delight thee! for greatness thee!

original: tejo 'si tejo mayi dhehi / vīryam asi vīryaṃ mayi dhehi / balam asi balaṃ mayi dhehi / ojo 'sy ojo mayi dhehi / manyur asi manyuṃ mayi dhehi / saho 'si saho mayi dhehi //
analyzed: tejaḥ si tejaḥ mayi dhehi    vīryam asi vīryam mayi dhehi    balam asi balam mayi dhehi   ojaḥ si ojaḥ mayi dhehi    manyuḥ asi manyum mayi dhehi    sahaḥ si sahaḥ mayi dhehi
translated: Thou art splendour; bestow splendour on me. Thou art hero strength; bestow hero strength on me. Thou art power; bestow power on me. Thou art force; bestow force on me. Thou art wrath; bestow wrath on me. Thou art might; bestow might on me.

original: yā vyāghraṃ viṣūcikobhau vṛkaṃ ca rakṣati / śyenaṃ patatriṇam simham semaṃ pātv amhasaḥ //
analyzed: yā vyāghram viṣūcikā ubhau vṛkam ca rakṣati śyenam patatriṇam simham sā imam pātu amhasaḥ
translated: She who protects the tiger, the leopard, the wolf, and the hawk, the bird, the lion, may she protect us from misfortune.🔽When the son, joyfully sucking, has ground his mother,

original: yad āpipeṣa mātaraṃ putraḥ pramudito dhayan / etat tad agne anṛṇo bhavāmy ahatau pitarau mayā //
analyzed: yat āpipeṣa mātaram putraḥ pramuditaḥ dhayan    etat tat agne anṛṇaḥ bhavāmi a hatau pitarau mayā
translated: by this, O Agni, I become debtless, my parents have been freed by me.

original: sampṛca stha saṃ mā bhadreṇa pṛṅkta / vipṛca stha vi mā pāpmanā pṛṅkta //
analyzed: sampṛcaḥ stha sam mā bhadreṇa pṛṅkta   vipṛcaḥ stha vi mā pāpmanā pṛṅkta
translated: Ye are united, unite me with good fortune. Ye are separated, separate me from evil.🔽The gods spread the sacrifice, the healing Asvins, the physicians,

original: devā yajñam atanvata bheṣajaṃ bhiṣajāśvinā / vācā sarasvatī bhiṣag indrāyendriyāṇi dadhataḥ //
analyzed: devāḥ yajñam atanvata bheṣajam bhiṣajā aśvinā    vācā sarasvatī bhiṣaj indrāya indriyāṇi dadhataḥ
translated: with speech, Sarasvatī, the physician, bestowing powers on Indra.🔽The grass is the form of initiation, the sprouts are of the Pravargya,

original: dīkṣāyai rūpam śaṣpāṇi prāyaṇīyasya tokmāni / krayasya rūpam somasya lājāḥ somāmśavo madhu //
analyzed: dīkṣāyai rūpam śaṣpāṇi prāyaṇīyasya tokmāni   krayasya rūpam somasya lājāḥ madhu
translated: the parched grains are the form of the purchase of Soma, the Soma-shares are honey.🔽The Māsara is the form of the guest-offering, the naked sage is of the Mahāvīra,

original: ātithyarūpaṃ māsaraṃ mahāvīrasya nagnahuḥ / rūpam upasadām etat tisro rātrīḥ surāsutā //
analyzed: ātithya rūpam māsaram mahāvīrasya nagnahuḥ   rūpam upasadām etat tisraḥ rātrīḥ surā sutā
translated: this is the form of the Upasads, three nights of Surā-drinking.🔽The sprinkling of the purchased Soma is the form of Soma,

original: somasya rūpa krītasya parisrut pari ṣicyate / aśvibhyāṃ dudgdhaṃ bheṣajam indrāyaindram sarasvatyā //
analyzed: somasya rūpa krītasya parisrut pari sicyate   aśvibhyām dudgdham bheṣajam indrāya aindram sarasvatyā
translated: the healing milk, milked by the Asvins, for Indra, the Indra-like, by Sarasvatī.

original: āsandī rūpam rājāsandyai vedyai kumbhī surādhānī / antara uttaravedyā rūpaṃ kārotaro bhiṣak //
analyzed: āsandī rūpam rāja āsandyai vedyai kumbhī surādhānī    antare uttaravedyāḥ rūpam kārotaraḥ bhiṣaj
translated: The form of the sacrificial platform is the royal seat, the pot is the form of the sacrificial altar and the wine-holder. The form within the northern altar is the surgeon.

original: vedyā vediḥ sam āpyate barhiṣā barhir indriyam / yūpena yūpa āpyate praṇīto agnir agninā //
analyzed: vedyāḥ vediḥ sam āpyate barhiṣā barhiḥ indriyam    yūpena yūpaḥ āpyate praṇītaḥ agniḥ agninā
translated: The altar is united with the altar, the sacrificial grass with the sacrificial grass, the power of Indra. The sacrificial post is united with the sacrificial post, the consecrated fire with the fire.

original: havirdhānaṃ yad aśvināgnīdhraṃ yat sarasvatī / indrāyaindram sadas kṛtaṃ patnīśālaṃ gārhapatyaḥ //🔽praiṣebhiḥ praiṣān āpnoty āprībhir āprīr yajñasya / prayājebhir anuyājān vaṣaṭkārebhir āhutīḥ //
analyzed: havirdhānam yat aśvinā āgnīdhram yat sarasvatī indrāya aindram sadaḥ kṛtam patnīśālam gārhapatyaḥ  praiṣebhiḥ praiṣān āpnoti āprībhiḥ āprīḥ yajñasya     prayājebhiḥ anuyājān vaṣaṭkārebhiḥ āhutīḥ
translated: The Havirdhana is the two Ashvins, the Agnidhra is Sarasvati. The hall for Indra is made for Indra, the Garhapatya is the wife's chamber.🔽By the Praisas one obtains the Praisas, by the Apras one obtains the Apras of the sacrifice. By the Prayajas one obtains the Anuyajas, by the Vasat-calls one obtains the oblations.

original: paśubhiḥ paśūn āpnoti puroḍāśair havīmṣy ā / chandobhiḥ sāmidhenīr yājyābhir vaṣaṭkārān //
analyzed: paśubhiḥ paśūn āpnoti puroḍāśaiḥ havīmṣi ā chandobhiḥ sāmidhenīḥ yājyābhiḥ vaṣaṭkārān
translated: By the animals one obtains the animals, by the sacrificial cakes the oblations. By the metres one obtains the Samidhenis, by the Yajyas the Vasat-calls.

original: dhānāḥ karambhaḥ saktavaḥ parīvāpaḥ payo dadhi / somasya rūpam haviṣa āmikṣā vājinaṃ madhu //
analyzed: dhānāḥ karambhaḥ saktavaḥ parīvāpaḥ payaḥ dadhi      somasya rūpam haviṣaḥ āmikṣā vājinam madhu
translated: The grains, the gruel, the flour, the sprinkling, the milk, the curd, the clarified butter, the curds, the whey, the honey - these are the forms of Soma.

original: dhānānām rūpaṃ kuvalaṃ parīvāpasya godhūmāḥ / saktūnām rūpaṃ badaram upavākāḥ karambhasya //
analyzed: dhānānām rūpam kuvalam parīvāpasya godhūmāḥ    saktūnām rūpam badaram upavākāḥ karambhasya
translated: The form of the grains is the lotus, of the sprinkling the wheat. The form of the flour is the jujube, the jujube fruits are the form of the gruel.

original: payaso rūpaṃ yad yavā dadhno rūpaṃ karkandhūni / saomasya rūpaṃ vājinam saumyasya rūpam āmikṣā //
analyzed: payasaḥ rūpam yat yavāḥ dadhnaḥ rūpam karkandhūni saomasya rūpam vājinam saumyasya rūpam āmikṣā
translated: The form of milk is barley, the form of curds is jujube fruits. The form of Soma is the strong (drink), the form of Soma is curds.

original: ā śrāvayeti stotriyāḥ pratyāśrāvo anurūpaḥ / yajeti dhayyārūpaṃ pragāthā yeyajāmahāḥ //
analyzed: ā śrāvaya iti stotriyāḥ pratyāśrāvaḥ anurūpaḥ   yaja iti dhayyā rūpam pragāthāḥ yeyajāmahāḥ
translated: The invocations are the Stotriya verses, the response is the Anurūpa. The Yajati formula is the Dhāyyā form, the Prastāva and the Yajamāna are the Prastāva.

original: ardhaṛcair ukthānām rūpaṃ padair āpnoti nividaḥ / praṇavaiḥ śastrāṇām rūpaṃ payasā soma āpyate //
analyzed: ardhaṛcaiḥ ukthānām rūpam padaiḥ āpnoti nividaḥ   praṇavaiḥ śastrāṇām rūpam payasā somaḥ āpyate
translated: The form of the Ukthas is the half-verses, one obtains the Nivids by the feet. The form of the Śastras is the Praṇavas, Soma is obtained by the milk.

original: aśvibhyāṃ prātaḥsavanam indreṇaindraṃ mādhyandinam / vaiśvadevam sarasvatyā tṛtīyam āptam savanam //
analyzed: aśvibhyām prātaḥsavanam indreṇa aindram mādhyandinam      vaiśvadevam sarasvatyā tṛtīyam āptam savanam
translated: The morning pressing is obtained by the two Açvins, the midday pressing belonging to Indra by Indra, the third pressing is obtained by Sarasvatî as belonging to the Visve devâh.

original: vāyavyair vāyavyān āpnoti satena droṇakalaśam / kumbhībhyām ambhṛṇau sute sthālībhi sthālīr āpnoti //🔽yajurvhir āpyante grahā grahai stomāś ca viṣṭutīḥ / chandobhir ukthāśastrāṇi sāmnāvabhṛtha āpyate //
analyzed: vāyavyaiḥ vāyavyān āpnoti satena droṇakalaśam kumbhībhyām ambhṛṇau sute sthālībhiḥ sthālīḥ āpnoti  yajurvhiḥ āpyante grahāḥ grahaiḥ stomāḥ ca viṣṭutīḥ chandobhiḥ ukthā śastrāṇi sāmnā avabhṛthaḥ āpyate
translated: By the Vāyavyas one obtains the Vāyavya libations, by the Sattra the Dronakalasa, by the two Kumbhis the two Ambhris, by the Sthalīs one obtains the Sthalīs.🔽The Grahas are obtained by the Yajuṣ, by the Grahas the Stomas and the praises, by the metres the Ukthas and the Śastras, the Avabhṛtha is obtained by the Sāman.

original: iḍābhir bhakṣān āpnoti sūktavākenāśiṣaḥ / śamyunā patnīsaṃyājānt samiṣṭayajuṣā samsthām //
analyzed: iḍābhiḥ bhakṣān āpnoti sūktavākena āśiṣaḥ    śamyunā patnīsaṃyājān samiṣṭa yajuṣā samsthām
translated: By the Idās one obtains the libations, by the Sûktavâka the blessings, by the Samyu the Patnīsaṁyâjas, by the Samishtayagus the conclusion.
