original: vratena dīkṣām āpnoti dīkṣayāpnoti dakṣiṇām / dakṣiṇā śraddhām āpnoti śraddhayā satyam āpyate //
analyzed: vratena dīkṣām āpnoti dīkṣayā āpnoti dakṣiṇām    dakṣiṇā śraddhām āpnoti śraddhayā satyam āpyate
translated: By the vow one attains initiation; by initiation one attains the sacrificial fee; by the sacrificial fee one attains faith; by faith one attains truth.

original: etāvad rūpaṃ yajñasya yad devair brahmaṇā kṛtam / tad etat sarvam āpnoti yajñe sautrāmaṇī sute //
analyzed: etāvat rūpam yajñasya yat devaiḥ brahmaṇā kṛtam   tat etat sarvam āpnoti yajñe sautrāmaṇī sute
translated: This much is the form of the sacrifice, which is done by the gods and Brahman. By that, one attains all this in the Soma sacrifice of the Sautrāmaṇī.

original: surāvantaṃ barhiṣadam suvīraṃ yajñam hinvanti mahiṣā namobhiḥ / dadhānāḥ somaṃ divi devatāsu mademendraṃ yajamānāḥ svarkāḥ //
analyzed: surāvantam barhiṣadam su vīram yajñam hinvanti mahiṣāḥ namobhiḥ    dadhānāḥ somam divi devatāsu madema indram yajamānāḥ su arkāḥ
translated: The great ones urge the sacrifice with the Sura, seated on the sacrificial grass, with good heroes, with salutations. Placing Soma among the gods in heaven, the sacrificers, the good ones, delight Indra, Agni.

original: yas te rasaḥ sambhṛta oṣadhīṣu somasya śuṣmaḥ surayā sutasya / tena jinva yajamānaṃ madena sarasvatīm aśvināv indram agnim //🔽yam aśvinā namucer āsurād adhi sarasvaty asunod indriyāya / imaṃ tam śukraṃ madhumantam indum somam rājānam iha bhakṣayāmi //
analyzed: yaḥ te rasaḥ sambhṛtaḥ oṣadhīṣu somasya śuṣmaḥ surayā sutasya    tena jinva yajamānam madena sarasvatīm aśvinau indram agnim  yam aśvinā namuceḥ āsurāt adhi sarasvatī asunot indriyāya    imam tam śukram madhumantam indum somam rājānam iha bhakṣayāmi
translated: The essence that is collected in the plants, the vigor of Soma, the essence of the distilled Sura, with that essence they delight the sacrificer. May Sarasvatī, the two Aśvins, Indra, Agni be delighted.🔽The essence that Sarasvatī pressed out for Indra's strength from Namuci, the demon, this bright, sweet essence, this Soma, the king, I enjoy here.

original: yad atra riptam rasinaḥ sutasya yad indro apibac chacībhiḥ / ahaṃ tad asya manasā śivena somam rājānam iha bhakṣayāmi //
analyzed: yat atra riptam rasinaḥ sutasya yat indraḥ apibat śacībhiḥ    aham tat asya manasā śivena somam rājānam iha bhakṣayāmi
translated: What essence there is of the intoxicating distilled Soma, what Indra drank with his might, that I enjoy here with his gracious mind, the Soma, the king.

original: pitṛbhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ / pitāmahebhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ / prapitāmahebhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ / akṣan pitaraḥ / amīmadanta pitaraḥ / atītṛpanta pitaraḥ / pitaraḥ śundhadhvam //🔽punantu mā pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ punantu mā pitāmahāḥ / punantu prapitāmahāḥ pavitreṇa śatāyuṣā //
analyzed: pitṛbhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ   pitāmahebhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ   prapitāmahebhyaḥ svadhāyibhyaḥ svadhā namaḥ   akṣan pitaraḥ   amīmadanta pitaraḥ    atītṛpanta pitaraḥ    pitaraḥ śundhadhvam  punantu mā pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ punantu mā pitāmahāḥ   punantu prapitāmahāḥ pavitreṇa śata āyuṣā
translated: To the Fathers who have the Svadha, Svâhâ! To the Grandfathers who have the Svadha, Svâhâ! To the Great-grandfathers who have the Svadha, Svâhâ! The Fathers have eaten. The Fathers have rejoiced. The Fathers have been satisfied. O Fathers, be ye pure.🔽May the Fathers who are worthy of Soma purify me; may the Grandfathers purify me; may the Great-grandfathers purify me with the pure (water) of a hundred winters.

original: punantu mā pitāmahāḥ somyāsaḥ punantu prapitāmahāḥ / pavitreṇa śatāyuṣā viśvam āyur vy aśnavai //
analyzed: punantu mā pitāmahāḥ somyāsaḥ punantu prapitāmahāḥ   pavitreṇa śata āyuṣā viśvam āyuḥ vi aśnavai
translated: May the Grandfathers who are worthy of Soma purify me; may the Great-grandfathers purify me with the pure (water) of a hundred winters. May I attain the whole life.

original: agna āyūmṣi pavasva ā suvorjam iṣaṃ ca naḥ / āre bādhasva ducchunām //
analyzed: agne āyūmṣi pavasva ā suva ūrjam iṣam ca naḥ        bādhasva ducchunām
translated: O Agni, purify life for us; grant us food and strength. Drive away evil.

original: punantu mā devajanāḥ punantu manasā dhiyaḥ / punantu viśvā bhūtāni jātavedaḥ punīhi mā //
analyzed: punantu mā deva janāḥ punantu manasā dhiyaḥ   punantu viśvā bhūtāni jātavedaḥ punīhi mā
translated: May the divine people purify me; may the thoughts purify me with the mind. May all beings purify me. O all-knower, purify me.

original: pavitreṇa punīhi mā śukreṇa deva dīdyat / agne kratvā kratūmr anu //
analyzed: pavitreṇa punīhi mā śukreṇa deva dīdyat     agne kratvā kratūmr anu
translated: With the pure, O bright god, do thou purify me, O Agni, with the thought, following the thought.

original: yat te pavitram arciṣy agne vitatam antarā / brahma tena punātu mā //
analyzed: yat te pavitram arciṣi agne vitatam antarā    brahma tena punātu mā
translated: That purifying flame of thine, O Agni, which is spread out within, may that thought purify me with the Brahman.

original: pavamānaḥ so adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ / yaḥ potā sa punātu mā //
analyzed: pavamānaḥ saḥ adya naḥ pavitreṇa vicarṣaṇiḥ   yaḥ potā sa punātu mā
translated: May he, the purifier, the most active, today, O Pavamâna, he who is the purifier, purify me with the purifying (rite).

original: ubhābhyāṃ deva savitaḥ pavitreṇa savena ca / māṃ punīhi viśvataḥ //
analyzed: ubhābhyām deva savitar pavitreṇa savena ca    mām punīhi viśvatas
translated: With both, O God Savitar, with the purifying (rite) and with thy impulse, purify me on every side.

original: vaiśvadevī punatī devy āgād yasyām imā bahvyas tanvo vītapṛṣṭhāḥ / tayā madantaḥ sadhamādeṣu vayam syāma patayo rayīṇām //
analyzed: vaiśvadevī punatī devī āgāt yasyām imāḥ bahvyaḥ tanvaḥ vīta pṛṣṭhāḥ   tayā madantaḥ sadhamādeṣu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: The purifying goddess who belongs to the All-Gods, in whom are many bodies, wide-backed, hath come. May we rejoice in her at the drinking of the pure ghee. May we be lords of wealth in this world for a hundred winters.

original: ye samānāḥ samanasaḥ pitaro yamarājye / teṣāṃ lokaḥ svadhā namo yajño deveṣu kalpatām //
analyzed: ye samānāḥ samanasaḥ pitaraḥ yama rājye   teṣām lokaḥ svadhā namaḥ yajñaḥ deveṣu kalpatām
translated: Those who are the same, of one mind, the Fathers in Yama's realm, To them be the world, to them the sacrifice among the Gods.

original: ye samānāḥ samanaso jīvā jīveṣu māmakāḥ / teṣām śrīr mayi kalpatām asmiṃ loke satam samāḥ //
analyzed: ye samānāḥ samanasaḥ jīvāḥ jīveṣu māmakāḥ    teṣām śrīḥ mayi kalpatām asmin loke satam samāḥ
translated: Those who are the same, of one mind, the living among the living, who are mine, May their prosperity be established in me. May I be for a hundred winters in this world.

original: dve sṛtī aśṛnavaṃ pitṝṇām ahaṃ devānām uta martyānām / tābhyām idaṃ viśvam ejat sam eti yad antarā pitaraṃ mātaraṃ ca //
analyzed: dve sṛtī aśṛnavam pitṝṇām aham devānām uta martyānām    tābhyām idam viśvam ejat sam eti yat antarā pitaram mātaram ca
translated: I have heard of two courses of the Fathers, of the Gods and of mortal men. On these two this moving world is set, that which is between the father and the mother.

original: idam haviḥ prajananaṃ me astu daśavīram sarvagaṇam svastaye / ātmasani prajāsani paśusani lokasany abhayasani / agniḥ prajāṃ bahulāṃ me karotv annaṃ payo reto asmāsu dhatta //
analyzed: idam haviḥ prajananam me astu daśa vīram sarva gaṇam svastaye    ātma sani prajā sani paśu sani loka sani abhaya sani    agniḥ prajām bahulām me karotu annam payaḥ retaḥ asmāsu dhatta
translated: May this offering of mine be for my propagation, with ten heroes, with all the clans, for my welfare, bringing soul, bringing offspring, bringing cattle, bringing the world, bringing fearlessness. May Agni make my offspring abundant. Grant us food, milk, seed.

original: ud īratām avara ut parāsa un madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ / asuṃ ya īyur avṛkā ṛtajñās te no 'vantu pitaro haveṣu //
analyzed: ud īratām avare ud parāsaḥ ud madhyamāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ   asum ye īyuḥ avṛkāḥ ṛta jñāḥ te naḥ vantu pitaraḥ haveṣu
translated: Let the lower, the higher, and the middlemost fathers, worthy of Soma, rise up. Those who have gone to the immortal state, free from enmity, knowing the truth, may those fathers protect us in our invocations.

original: aṅgiraso naḥ pitaro navagvā atharvāṇo bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ / teṣāṃ vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma //
analyzed: aṅgirasaḥ naḥ pitaraḥ navagvāḥ atharvāṇaḥ bhṛgavaḥ somyāsaḥ    teṣām vayam sumatau yajñiyānām api bhadre saumanase syāma
translated: Our fathers, the Angirases, the Navagvas, the Atharvans, the Bhrigus, worthy of Soma, - may we enjoy the gracious favour, the pleasant goodwill, of those who are to be worshipped at sacrifices.

original: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāso 'nūhire somapīthaṃ vasiṣṭhāḥ / tebhir yamaḥ samrarāṇo havīmṣy uśann uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu //
analyzed: ye naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ nūhire soma pītham vasiṣṭhāḥ    tebhiḥ yamaḥ samrarāṇaḥ havīmṣī uśan uśadbhiḥ pratikāmam attu
translated: Our ancient fathers, worthy of Soma, the most excellent, who have gone to the drinking of Soma, - with them may Yama, rejoicing, eat the oblations, according to his desire, with those who rejoice.

original: tvam soma pra cikito manīṣā tvam rajiṣṭham anu neṣi panthām / tava praṇītī pitaro na indo deveṣu ratnam abhajanta dhīrāḥ //
analyzed: tvam soma pra cikitaḥ manīṣā tvam rajiṣṭham anu neṣi panthām     tava praṇītī pitaraḥ naḥ indo deveṣu ratnam abhajanta dhīrāḥ
translated: Thou, O Soma, hast disclosed the thoughts. Thou leadest along the straightest path. By thy guidance, O Indu, the wise fathers have distributed treasure among the gods.

original: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamāna dhīrāḥ / vanvann avātaḥ paridhīmr aporṇu vīrebhir aśvair maghavā bhavā naḥ //
analyzed: tvayā hi naḥ pitaraḥ soma pūrve karmāṇi cakruḥ pavamāna dhīrāḥ   vanvan a vātaḥ paridhīmr aporṇu vīrebhiḥ aśvaiḥ maghavā bhava naḥ
translated: For our fathers, O Soma, in the days of old, the sages, O Pavamâna, have performed their rites. Driving away the foe, unbar the doors of heaven. Be thou a liberal prince to us with heroes.

original: tvam soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidāno 'nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha / tasmai ta indo haviṣā vidhema vayam syāma patayo rayīṇām //
analyzed: tvam soma pitṛbhiḥ saṃvidānaḥ nu dyāvāpṛthivī ā tatantha  / tasmai te indo haviṣā vidhema vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: Thou, O Soma, in accord with the Fathers, hast spread over the sky and the earth. To thee, O Indu, let us offer with oblation. May we be lords of wealth.

original: barhiṣadaḥ pitara ūty arvāg imā vo havyā cakṛmā juṣadhvam / ta ā gatāvasā śaṃtamenāthā naḥ śaṃ yor arapo dadhāta //
analyzed: barhiṣadaḥ pitaraḥ ūtī arvāk imā vaḥ havyā cakṛma juṣadhvam    te ā gata avasā śaṃtamena athā naḥ śam yos arapaḥ dadhāta
translated: O Fathers, seated on the sacred grass, come hitherward. Accept these offerings which we make to you. Come hither unto us with most auspicious favour, and grant us health and strength and freedom from disease.

original: āhaṃ pitṛn suvidatrām avitsi napātaṃ ca vikramaṇaṃ ca viṣṇoḥ / barhiṣado ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvas ta ihāgamiṣṭhāḥ //
analyzed: ā aham pitṛn suvidatrām avitsi napātam ca vikramaṇam ca viṣṇoḥ      barhiṣadaḥ ye svadhayā sutasya bhajanta pitvaḥ te iha āgamiṣṭhāḥ
translated: I have found the Fathers who are easy to win, the son of Nâsatyas, and the stride of Vishnu. They who sit on the sacred grass, the Fathers, who enjoy the juice offered according to the law, are most to be worshipped here.

original: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāso barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu / ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantv adhi bruvantu te 'vantv asmān //
analyzed: upahūtāḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ barhiṣyeṣu nidhiṣu priyeṣu   te ā gamantu te iha śruvantu adhi bruvantu te vantu asmān
translated: The Fathers who are worthy of Soma have been invited to their dear and precious place on the sacred grass. May they come hither and listen to us here. May they speak to us and favour us.

original: ā yantu naḥ pitaraḥ somyāso 'gniṣvāttāḥ pathibhir devayānaiḥ / asmin yajñe svadhayā madanto 'dhi bruvantu te 'vantv asmān //
analyzed: ā yantu naḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ gniṣvāttāḥ pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ    asmin yajñe svadhayā madantaḥ dhi bruvantu te vantu asmān
translated: Let the Fathers come to us, worthy of Soma, who have Agni for their guest, by paths that Gods frequent, rejoicing in this sacrifice, in their own manner. May they bless us, and may they protect us.

original: agniṣvāttāḥ pitara eha gacchata sadaḥsadaḥ sadata supraṇītayaḥ / attā havīmṣi prayatāni barhiṣy athā rayim sarvavīraṃ dadhātana //
analyzed: agniṣvāttāḥ pitaraḥ ā iha gacchata sadaḥ sadaḥ sadata su praṇītayaḥ   attā havīmṣi prayatāni barhiṣi athā rayim sarva vīram dadhātana
translated: O ye Fathers who have Agni for your guest, come hither, well-conducted, to the place of assembly. Eat the oblations set upon the sacred grass, and then bestow upon us riches with brave sons.

original: ye agniṣvāttā ye anagniṣvāttā madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante / tebhyaḥ svarāḍ asunītim etāṃ yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ kalpayāti //
analyzed: ye agniṣvāttāḥ ye an agniṣvāttāḥ madhye divaḥ svadhayā mādayante     tebhyaḥ svarāj asu nītim etām yathāvaśam tanvam kalpayāti
translated: Those who have Agni for their guest, and those who have not, who rejoice in their own nature in the midst of the sky, for them the self-ruling one, the Asura, fashions this sacrifice, his own body, as he wills.

original: agniṣvāttām ṛtumato havāmahe nārāśamse somapīthaṃ ya āśuḥ / te no viprāsaḥ suhavā bhavantu vayam syāma patayo rayīṇām //
analyzed: agniṣvāttām ṛtumataḥ havāmahe nārāśamse soma pītham ye āśuḥ   te naḥ viprāsaḥ su havāḥ bhavantu vayam syāma patayaḥ rayīṇām
translated: We call the Nârâsamsa, who has Agni for his guest, who is in season, who is swift, who has Soma for his drink. May these sages be easy to invoke for us. May we be lords of riches.

original: ācyā jānu dakṣiṇato niṣadyemaṃ yajñam abhi gṛṇīta viśve / mā himsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cin no yad va āgaḥ puruṣatā karāma //
analyzed: ācya jānu dakṣiṇatas niṣadya imam yajñam abhi gṛṇīta viśve   mā himsiṣṭa pitaraḥ kena cit naḥ yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma
translated: Sitting on the right side, bending your knees, all of you welcome this sacrifice. Injure us not, O Fathers, in any way, for any sin that we have committed against you.

original: āsīnāso aruṇīnām upasthe rayiṃ dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya / putrebhyaḥ pitaras tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata ta ihorjaṃ dadhāta //
analyzed: āsīnāsaḥ aruṇīnām upasthe rayim dhatta dāśuṣe martyāya    putrebhyaḥ pitaraḥ tasya vasvaḥ pra yacchata te iha ūrjam dadhāta
translated: Seated on the lap of the red dawns, bestow wealth on the mortal who offers. To your sons, O fathers, grant a portion of that good thing, and here bestow strength on us.

original: yam agne kavyavāhana tvaṃ cin manyase rayim / taṃ no gīrbhiḥ śravāyyaṃ devatrā panayā yujam //
analyzed: yam agne kavya vāhana tvam cit manyase rayim   tam naḥ gīrbhiḥ śravāyyam devatrā panaya yujam
translated: O Agni, whatever wealth thou thinkest to be most desirable, bring that to us by thy songs, worthy of fame, to be enjoyed by the gods and the fathers.

original: yo agniḥ kavyavāhanaḥ pitṛn yakṣad ṛtāvṛdhaḥ / pred u havyāni vocati devebhyaś ca pitṛbhya ā //
analyzed: yaḥ agniḥ kavya vāhanaḥ pitṛn yakṣat ṛtāvṛdhaḥ   pra id u havyāni vocati devebhyaḥ ca pitṛbhyaḥ ā
translated: That Agni who bears the oblations, who serves the fathers, who is true to his promise, he proclaims the offerings to the gods and the fathers.

original: tvam agna īḍitaḥ kavyavāhanāvāḍ ḍhavyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvī / prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣann addhi tvaṃ deva prayatā havīmṣi //
analyzed: tvam agne īḍitaḥ kavya vāha nāvāṭ havyāni surabhīṇi kṛtvī prādāḥ pitṛbhyaḥ svadhayā te akṣan addhi tvam deva prayatā
translated: O Agni, when thou art invoked, O bearer of the oblations, having made the offerings fragrant, thou hast given them to the fathers, who have eaten them with their own portion. Eat thou, O god, the offered oblations.

original: ye ceha pitaro ye ca neha yāmś ca vidma yām u ca na pravidma / tvaṃ vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhir yajñam sukṛtaṃ juṣasva //
analyzed: ye ca iha pitaraḥ ye ca na iha yām ca vidma yām u ca na pravidma    tvam vettha yati te jātavedaḥ svadhābhiḥ yajñam su kṛtam juṣasva
translated: Those fathers who are here, and those who are not here, whom we know, and whom we do not know, thou knowest them, O all-knowing one. Accept with thy portions the well-performed sacrifice.

original: idaṃ pitṛbhyo namo astv adya ye pūrvāso ya uparāsa īyuḥ / ye pārthive rajasy ā niṣattā ye vā nūnam suvṛjanāsu vikṣu //
analyzed: idam pitṛbhyaḥ namaḥ astu adya ye pūrvāsaḥ ye uparāsaḥ īyuḥ   ye pārthive rajasi ā niṣattāḥ ye vā nūnam su vṛjanāsu vikṣu
translated: To the fathers be homage today, to those who have gone before, and to those who have come after, to those who have sat down on the earthly realm, and to those who now are in the well-ordered abodes.

original: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso agna ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ / śucīd ayan dīdhitim ukthaśāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran //
analyzed: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāsaḥ agne ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ   śucī id ayan dīdhitim uktha śāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindantaḥ aruṇīḥ apa vran
translated: purifying the light, directing the hymn, cleft the red cloud and let the rain-water loose.

original: uśantas tvā ni dhīmahy uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi / uśann uśata ā vaha pitṛn haviṣe attave //
analyzed: uśantaḥ tvā ni dhīmahi uśantaḥ sam idhīmahi    uśan uśataḥ ā vaha pitṛn haviṣe attave
translated: We kindle thee, O thou who lovest, we lay thee down who art beloved. O thou who lovest, bring the Fathers who love (thee) to eat the sacrificial food.

original: apāṃ phenena namuceḥ śira indrod avartayaḥ / viśvā yad ajaya spṛdhaḥ //
analyzed: apām phenena namuceḥ śiraḥ indra ud avartayaḥ    viśvāḥ yat ajayaḥ spṛdhaḥ
translated: With the foam of the waters thou, O Indra, didst roll away the head of Namuci,🔽when thou hadst conquered all the Dasyus.🔽Soma, the King, immortal, pressed, hath by the dregs avoided death,

original: somo rājāmṛtam suta ṛjīṣeṇājahān mṛtyum / ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
analyzed: somaḥ rājā amṛtam sutaḥ ṛjīṣeṇa ajahāt mṛtyum   ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu
translated: by Law, the truth, the power, the drinking of the bright juice. This is Indra's power, this milk, this immortal mead.🔽Krū, the son of Aṅgiras, hath by his thought drunk out the milk from out the waters.

original: adbhyaḥ kṣīraṃ vy apibat kruṅṅ āṅgiraso dhiyā / ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
analyzed: adbhyaḥ kṣīram vi apibat kruñc āṅgirasaḥ dhiyā     ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu
translated: By Law, the truth, the power, the drinking of the bright juice. This is Indra's power, this milk, this immortal mead.🔽The swan, the pure one, hath drunk out the Soma from the waters by the metre.

original: somam adbhyo vy apibac chandasā hamsaḥ śuciṣat / ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
analyzed: somam adbhyaḥ vi apibat chandasā hamsaḥ śuciṣad     ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu
translated: By Law, the truth, the power, the drinking of the bright juice. This is Indra's power, this milk, this immortal mead.

original: annāt parisruto rasaṃ brahmaṇā vy apibat kṣatraṃ payaḥ somaṃ prajāpatiḥ / ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
analyzed: annāt parisrutaḥ rasam brahmaṇā vi apibat kṣatram payaḥ somam prajāpatiḥ    ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu
translated: By truth he drank the essence, the pure, the bright, the strength of Indra, the drink, the pure juice. This is the milk, the nectar, the honey, the strength of Indra.

original: reto mūtraṃ vi jahāti yoniṃ praviśad rayim / garbho jarāyuṇāvṛta ulvaṃ jahāti janmanā //
analyzed: retaḥ mūtram vi jahāti yonim praviśat rayim   garbhaḥ jarāyuṇā āvṛtaḥ ulvam jahāti janmanā
translated: The seed leaves the womb, enters the womb, and becomes wealth. The embryo, covered with the amnion, leaves the caul with birth.

original: ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
analyzed: ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu
translated: By truth he drank the essence, the pure, the bright, the strength of Indra, the drink, the pure juice. This is the milk, the nectar, the honey, the strength of Indra.

original: dṛṣṭvā rūpe vyākarot satyānṛte prajāpatiḥ / aśraddhām anṛte 'dadhāc chraddhām satye prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā rūpe vyākarot satya anṛte prajāpatiḥ   aśraddhām anṛte dadhāt śraddhām satye prajāpatiḥ
translated: Having seen the form, Prajapati declared the truth and untruth. Prajapati placed faith in untruth and faith in truth.

original: ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //🔽vedena rūpe vy apibat sutāsutau prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu  vedena rūpe vi apibat suta a sutau prajāpatiḥ
translated: By truth he drank the essence, the pure, the bright, the strength of Indra, the drink, the pure juice. This is the milk, the nectar, the honey, the strength of Indra.

original: ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
analyzed: ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu
translated: By the Veda he drank the essence, the pure, the bright, the strength of Indra, the drink, the pure juice. This is the milk, the nectar, the honey, the strength of Indra.🔽By truth he drank the essence, the pure, the bright, the strength of Indra, the drink, the pure juice. This is the milk, the nectar, the honey, the strength of Indra.

original: dṛṣṭvā parisruto rasam śukreṇa śukraṃ vy apibat / payaḥ somaṃ prajāpatiḥ //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā parisrutaḥ rasam śukreṇa śukram vi apibat    payaḥ somam prajāpatiḥ
translated: Seeing the juice that had flowed out, Prajapati drank the semen with semen. The milk, the Soma, is the semen of Indra.

original: ṛtena satyam indriyaṃ vipānam śukram andhasa indrasyendriyam idaṃ payo 'mṛtaṃ madhu //
analyzed: ṛtena satyam indriyam vipānam śukram andhasaḥ indrasya indriyam idam payaḥ mṛtam madhu
translated: By truth, by power, by drinking the pure Soma juice, by the semen of the sacrifice, this is the power of Indra, this is the milk, the nectar, the honey.

original: sīsena tantraṃ manasā manīṣiṇā ūrṇāsūtreṇa kavayo vayanti / aśvinā yajñam savitā sarasvatīndrasya rūpaṃ varuṇo bhiṣajyan //
analyzed: sīsena tantram manasā manīṣiṇaḥ ūrṇā sūtreṇa kavayaḥ vayanti    aśvinā yajñam savitā sarasvatī indrasya rūpam varuṇaḥ bhiṣajyan
translated: With lead, with the mind, with the wise, with the thread of wool, the poets weave. The Asvins, Savitar, Sarasvati, Varuna, healing, are the sacrifice, the form of Indra.

original: tad asya rūpam amṛtam śacībhis tasro dadhur devatāḥ samrarāṇāḥ / lomāni śaṣpair bahudhā na tokmabhis tvag asya māmsam abhavan na lājāḥ //
analyzed: tat asya rūpam amṛtam śacībhiḥ tasraḥ dadhuḥ devatāḥ samrarāṇāḥ    lomāni śaṣpaiḥ bahudhā na tokmabhiḥ tvac asya māmsam abhavat na lājāḥ
translated: This is his form, the immortal, which the three deities, in conflict, have placed with their powers. The hair with the blades of grass in many ways, not with the young plants; his skin became the flesh, not the parched grain.

original: tad aśvinā bhiṣajā rudravartanī sarasvatī vayati peśo antaram / asthi majjānaṃ māsaraiḥ kārotareṇa dadhato gavāṃ tvaci //
analyzed: tat aśvinā bhiṣajā rudravartanī sarasvatī vayati peśaḥ antaram   asthi majjānam māsaraiḥ kārotareṇa dadhataḥ gavām tvaci
translated: The Asvins, the two physicians, the two who move with Rudra, Sarasvati, form the flesh within. They place the bone, the marrow, in the two parts of the cow's hide.

original: sarasvatī manasā peśalaṃ vasu nāsatyābhyāṃ vayati darśataṃ vapuḥ / rasaṃ parisrutā na rohitaṃ nagnahur dhīras tasaraṃ na vema //
analyzed: sarasvatī manasā peśalam vasu nāsatyābhyām vayati darśatam vapuḥ    rasam parisrutā na rohitam nagnahuḥ dhīraḥ tasaram na vema
translated: Sarasvati, with the mind, forms the beautiful treasure, the lovely form with the two Nâsatyas. The flowing juice, the red, the Nâgnahus, the wise one, the thread, the Tsarahs.

original: payasā śukram amṛtaṃ janitram surayā mūtrāj janayanta retaḥ / apāmatiṃ durmatiṃ bādhamānā ūvadhyaṃ vātam sabvaṃ tad ārāt //
analyzed: payasā śukram amṛtam janitram surayā mūtrāt janayanta retaḥ    apa amatim durmatim bādhamānāḥ ūvadhyam vātam sabvam tat ārāt
translated: With milk, the seed, the immortal, the birthplace, with Surâ, from urine, they generate seed. Driving away the evil spirit of the waters, the evil thought, the obstruction, the wind, all that from afar.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā hṛdayeṇa satyaṃ puroḍāśena savitā jajāna / yakṛt klomānaṃ varuṇo bhiṣajyan matasne vāyavyair na mināti pittam //
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā hṛdayeṇa satyam puroḍāśena savitā jajāna   yakṛt klomānam varuṇaḥ bhiṣajyat matasne vāyavyaiḥ na mināti pittam
translated: Indra, the good protector, with his heart, the truth, Savitar with the sacrificial cake hath generated. Varuna, the physician, hath healed the liver and lungs. He does not injure the bile with the Vâyu offerings.

original: āntrāṇi sthālīr madhu pinvamānā gudāḥ pātrāṇi sudughā na dhenuḥ / śyenasya patraṃ na plīhā śacībhir āsandī nābhir udaraṃ na mātā //
analyzed: āntrāṇi sthālīḥ madhu pinvamānāḥ gudāḥ pātrāṇi sudughā na dhenuḥ    śyenasya patram na plīhā śacībhiḥ āsandī nābhiḥ udaram na mātā
translated: The intestines are the dishes, swelling with honey. The bowels are the vessels, like a cow yielding good milk. The spleen is like the wing of a hawk in its strength. The navel is like a seat, the belly like a mother.

original: kumbho vaniṣṭhur janitā śacībhie yasminn agre yonyāṃ garbho antaḥ / plāśir vyaktaḥ śatadhāra utso duhe na kumbhī svadhāṃ pitṛbhyaḥ //
analyzed: kumbhaḥ vaniṣṭhuḥ janitā śacībhiḥ yasmin agre yonyām garbhaḥ antar   plāśiḥ vyaktaḥ śata dhāraḥ utsaḥ duhe na kumbhī svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ
translated: The bladder is the womb, the generator, in its strength, wherein the child is first contained in the womb. The penis is the vessel, a hundred-streamed, well-springing. The scrotum yields the oblation to the Fathers.

original: mukham sad asya śira it satena jihvā pavitram aśvināsant sarasvatī / capyaṃ na pāyur bhiṣag asya vālo vastir na śepo harasā tarasvī //
analyzed: mukham sat asya śiraḥ id satena jihvā pavitram aśvinā āsan sarasvatī      capyam na pāyuḥ bhiṣaj asya vālaḥ vastiḥ na śepaḥ harasā tarasvī
translated: The mouth is his truth, the head is his truth. The tongue is the purifying sieve, the Asvins, Sarasvatî. The anus is like a physician, his hair. The penis is like a reed, strong with its power.

original: aśvibhyāṃ cakṣur amṛtaṃ grahābhyāṃ chāgena tejo haviṣā śṛtena / pakṣmāṇi godhūmaiḥ kuvalair utāni peśo na śukram asitaṃ vasāte //
analyzed: aśvibhyām cakṣuḥ amṛtam grahābhyām chāgena tejaḥ haviṣā śṛtena    pakṣmāṇi godhūmaiḥ kuvalaiḥ utāni peśaḥ na śukram asitam vasāte
translated: The eyes, the immortal draught, from the two Asvins; the splendour, from the goat, with the roasted oblation; the eye-lids, from the wheat and the beans; the flesh, the bright and the dark, it forms.

original: avir na meṣo nasi vīryāya prāṇasya panth amṛto grahābhyām / sarasvaty upavākair vyānaṃ nasyāni barhir badarair jajāna //
analyzed: aviḥ na meṣaḥ nasi vīryāya prāṇasya panth amṛtaḥ grahābhyām     sarasvatī upavākaiḥ vyānam nasyāni barhiḥ badaraiḥ jajāna
translated: The ram and the he-goat, for strength, to the nose; the path of the breath, the immortal draught; the Vyana, from Sarasvatî, the Upâvakas; the nostrils, from the sacrificial grass and the jujube, it produced.

original: indrasya rūpaṃ vṛṣabho balāya karṇābhyām śrotram amṛtaṃ grahābhyāṃ / yavā na barir bhruvi kesarāṇi karkandhu jajñe madhu sāraghaṃ mukhāt //
analyzed: indrasya rūpam vṛṣabhaḥ balāya karṇābhyām śrotram amṛtam grahābhyām    yavāḥ na bariḥ bhruvi kesarāṇi karkandhu jajñe madhu sāragham mukhāt
translated: The bull, for strength, the form of Indra; the hearing, from the ears, the immortal draught; the barley, the sacrificial grass, the beard; the jujube produced honey, the essence, from the mouth.

original: ātmann upasthe na vṛkasya loma mukhe śmaśrūṇi na vyāghraloma / keśā na śīrṣan yaśase śriyai śikhā simhasya loma tviṣir indriyāṇi //
analyzed: ātman upasthe na vṛkasya loma mukhe śmaśrūṇi na vyāghra loma    keśāḥ na śīrṣan yaśase śriyai śikhā simhasya loma tviṣiḥ indriyāṇi
translated: The hair of the wolf, in the body, in the organ of generation; the beard, in the mouth, the hair of the tiger; the hair, on the head, for glory; the crest, for prosperity; the hair of the lion, the splendour, the powers.

original: aṅgāny ātman bhiṣajā tad aśvinātmānam aṅgaiḥ sam adhāt sarasvatī / indrasya rūpam śatamānam āyuś candreṇa jyotir amṛtaṃ dadhānāḥ //
analyzed: aṅgāni ātman bhiṣajā tat aśvinā ātmānam aṅgaiḥ sam adhāt sarasvatī    indrasya rūpam śata mānam āyuḥ candreṇa jyotiḥ amṛtam dadhānāḥ
translated: The limbs, in the body, the two Asvins, the physicians; the body, with the limbs, Sarasvatî has put together; the form of Indra, the life of a hundred years, bestowing with the moon the immortal light.

original: sarasvatī yonyāṃ garbham antar aśvibhyāṃ patnī sukṛtaṃ bibharti / apām rasena varuṇo na sāmnendram śriyai janayann apsu rājā //
analyzed: sarasvatī yonyām garbham antar aśvibhyām patnī su kṛtam bibharti    apām rasena varuṇaḥ na sāmnā indram śriyai janayan apsu rājā
translated: The wife of good deeds bears in her womb, in the womb of Sarasvatī, the embryo of the two Asvins. With the essence of the waters, like Varuṇa with the Sāman, the king, begetting Indra for glory, in the waters.

original: tejaḥ paśūnām havir indriyāvat parisrutā payasā sāraghaṃ madhu / aśvibhyāṃ dugdhaṃ bhiṣajā sarasvatyā sutāsutābhyām amṛtaḥ soma induḥ //
analyzed: tejaḥ paśūnām haviḥ indriyāvat parisrutā payasā sāragham madhu    aśvibhyām dugdham bhiṣajā sarasvatyā sutā sutābhyām amṛtaḥ somaḥ induḥ
translated: The essence of the animals, the oblation, the powerful, the flowing with milk, the honey of the Sārasvata,

original: kṣatrasya yonir asi kṣatrasya nābhir asi / mā tvā himsīn mā mā himsīḥ //
analyzed: kṣatrasya yoniḥ asi kṣatrasya nābhiḥ asi    mā tvā himsīt mā mā himsīḥ
translated: You are the womb of the Kshatriya, you are the navel of the Kshatriya. Do not injure me, do not injure me.

original: ni ṣasāda ghṛtavrato varuṇaḥ pastyāsv ā / sāmrājyāya sukratuḥ //
analyzed: ni ṣasāda ghṛta vrataḥ varuṇaḥ pastyāsu ā sāmrājyāya su kratuḥ
translated: The one with ghee as his vow, Varuṇa, has sat down in the houses, for universal sovereignty, the one with good thoughts.

original: mṛtyoḥ pāhi / vidyot pāhi //
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ pāhi vidyoḥ pāhi
translated: Protect from death. Protect from the lightning.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / aśvinor bhaiṣajyena tejase brahmavarcasāyābhi ṣiñcāmi / sarasvatyai bhaiṣajyena vīryāyānnādyāyābhi ṣiñcāmi / indrasyendriyeṇa balāya śriyai yaśase 'bhi ṣiñcāmi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām    aśvinoḥ bhaiṣajyena tejase brahmavarcasāya abhi siñcāmi    sarasvatyai bhaiṣajyena vīryāya annādyāya abhi siñcāmi     indrasya indriyeṇa balāya śriyai yaśase bhi siñcāmi
translated: By the impulse of the god Savitr, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, with the medicine of the two Asvins, I sprinkle (him) for splendor and holy lustre. With the medicine of Sarasvatī, I sprinkle (him) for strength, for food to eat. With the power of Indra, I sprinkle (him) for power, for prosperity, for fame.

original: ko 'si katamo 'si kasmai tvā kāya tvā / suśloka sumaṅgala satyarājan //
analyzed: kaḥ si katamaḥ si kasmai tvā kāya tvā su śloka su maṅgala satya rājan
translated: Who art thou? What art thou? For whom art thou? For what art thou? Well-praised, well-auspicious, true king!

original: śiro me śrīr yaśo mukhaṃ tviṣiḥ keśāś ca śmaśrūṇi / rājā me prāṇo amṛtam samrāṭ cakṣur virāṭ śrotram //
analyzed: śiraḥ me śrīḥ yaśaḥ mukham tviṣiḥ keśāḥ ca śmaśrūṇi    rājā me prāṇaḥ amṛtam samrāj cakṣuḥ virāj śrotram
translated: My head is glory, my face fame, my lustre the hair on my head and beard. My king is my life-breath, my emperor the immortal, my eyes the universal king, my ears.

original: jihvā me bhadraṃ vāṅ maho mano manyuḥ svarāḍ bhāmaḥ / modāḥ pramodā aṅgulīr aṅgāni mitraṃ me sahaḥ //
analyzed: jihvā me bhadram vāc mahaḥ manaḥ manyuḥ svarāj bhāmaḥ    modāḥ pramodāḥ aṅgulīḥ aṅgāni mitram me sahaḥ
translated: My tongue is good, my speech greatness, my mind anger, my self-sovereign joy. My delights and raptures are the fingers, my limbs my friend and strength.

original: bāhū me balam indriyam hastau me karma vīryam / ātmā kṣatram uro mama //
analyzed: bāhū me balam indriyam hastau me karma vīryam   ātmā kṣatram uraḥ mama
translated: My arms are my strength and power, my hands my work and valor. My chest is the Kshatriya class.

original: pṛṣṭīr me rāṣṭram udaram amsau grīvāś ca śroṇī / ūrū aratnī jānunī viśo me 'ṅgāni sarvataḥ //
analyzed: pṛṣṭīḥ me rāṣṭram udaram amsau grīvāḥ ca śroṇī   ūrū aratnī jānunī viśaḥ me ṅgāni sarvatas
translated: My back is my kingdom, my belly my people, my shoulders, neck, and hips. My thighs, forearms, and knees are all my limbs everywhere.

original: nābhir me cittaṃ vijñānaṃ pāyur me 'pacitir bhasat / ānandanandāv āṇḍau me bhagaḥ saubhāgyaṃ pasaḥ / jaṅghābhyāṃ pādbhyāṃ dharmo 'smi viśi rājā pratiṣṭhitaḥ //
analyzed: nābhiḥ me cittam vijñānam pāyuḥ me pacitiḥ bhasad     ānanda nandau āṇḍau me bhagaḥ saubhāgyam pasaḥ   jaṅghābhyām pādbhyām smi viśi rājā pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: My navel is my mind, my consciousness, my anus is my satisfaction and stomach. My testicles are bliss and joy, my penis good fortune and luck. By my shanks and feet I am Dharma, the king established in the people.

original: prati kṣatre prati tiṣṭhāmi rāṣṭre praty aśveṣu prati tiṣṭhāmi goṣu / praty aṅgeṣu prati tiṣṭhāmy ātman prati prāṇeṣu kṣatre prati tiṣṭhāmi puṣṭe prati dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ prati tiṣṭhāmi //
analyzed: prati kṣatre prati tiṣṭhāmi rāṣṭre prati aśveṣu prati tiṣṭhāmi goṣu    prati aṅgeṣu prati tiṣṭhāmi ātman prati prāṇeṣu kṣatre prati tiṣṭhāmi puṣṭe prati dyāvāpṛthivyoḥ prati tiṣṭhāmi
translated: In the Kshatriya I stand firm, in the kingdom I stand firm, in the horses I stand firm, in the cows I stand firm. In the limbs I stand firm, in the self I stand firm, in the vital breaths I stand firm, in the Kshatriya I stand firm, in the nourishment I stand firm, in heaven and earth I stand firm.

original: trayā devā ekādaśa trayastrimśāḥ surādhasaḥ / bṛhaspatipurohitā devasya savituḥ save / devā devair avantu mā //
analyzed: trayāḥ devāḥ ekādaśa trayastrimśāḥ su rādhasaḥ    bṛhaspati purohitāḥ devasya savituḥ save    devāḥ devaiḥ avantu mā
translated: The three gods, the eleven, the thirty-three, the bountiful ones, with Brihaspati as their priest, by the impulse of the god Savitar, may the gods with the gods help me.

original: prathamā dvitīyair dvitīyās tṛtīyais tṛtīyāḥ satyena satyaṃ yajñena yajño yajurbhir yajūmṣi sāmabhiḥ sāmāny ṛgbhir ṛcaḥ puro'nuvākyābhiḥ puro'nuvākyā yājyābhir yājyā vaṣaṭkārair vaṣaṭkārā āhutibhir ahutayo me kāmānt sam ardhayantu bhūḥ svāhā //
analyzed: prathamāḥ dvitīyaiḥ dvitīyāḥ tṛtīyaiḥ tṛtīyāḥ satyena satyam yajñena yajñaḥ yajurbhiḥ yajūmṣi sāmabhiḥ sāmāni ṛgbhiḥ ṛcaḥ puronuvākyābhiḥ puronuvākyāḥ yājyābhiḥ yājyāḥ vaṣaṭkāraiḥ vaṣaṭkārāḥ āhutibhiḥ ahutayaḥ me kāmān sam ardhayantu bhūḥ svāhā
translated: The first with the second, the second with the third, the third with truth, truth with sacrifice, sacrifice with Yajus formulas, the Yajus formulas with Samans, the Samans with the Rig verses, the Rig verses with the Puronuvakyas, the Puronuvakyas with the Yajyas, the Yajyas with the Vasat calls, the Vasat calls with the oblations, may the oblations fulfil my desires. Earth, hail!

original: lomāni prayatir mama tvaṅ ma ānatir āgatiḥ / māmsaṃ ma upanatir vasv asthi majjā ma ānatiḥ //
analyzed: lomāni prayatiḥ mama tvac me ānatiḥ āgatiḥ   māmsam me upanatiḥ vasu asthi majjā me ānatiḥ
translated: My hair is my exertion, my skin is my approach and coming, my flesh is my near approach and wealth, my bone is my marrow and near approach.

original: yad devā devaheḍanaṃ devāsaś cakṛmā vayam / agnir mā tasmād enaso viśvān muñcatv amhasaḥ //
analyzed: yat devāḥ deva heḍanam devāsaḥ cakṛma vayam   agniḥ mā tasmāt enasaḥ viśvāt muñcatu amhasaḥ
translated: Whatever sin against the gods, O ye gods, we have committed, may Agni deliver me from that sin, from all distress.

original: yadi divā yadi naktam enāmsi cakṛmā vayam / vāyur mā tasmād enaso viśvān muñcatv amhasaḥ //
analyzed: yadi divā yadi naktam enāmsi cakṛma vayam     vāyuḥ mā tasmāt enasaḥ viśvāt muñcatu amhasaḥ
translated: If by day or by night we have committed sins, may Vayu deliver me from that sin, from all distress.

original: yadi jāgrad yadi svapna enāmsi cakṛmā vayam / sūryo mā tasmād enaso viśvān muñcatv amhasaḥ //
analyzed: yadi jāgrat yadi svapne enāmsi cakṛma vayam         mā tasmāt enasaḥ viśvāt muñcatu amhasaḥ
translated: If we have committed sins, whether awake or asleep, may Surya deliver me from that sin, from all distress.

original: yad grāme yad araṇye yat sabhāyāṃ yad indriye / yac chūdre yad arye yad enaś cakṛmā vayaṃ yad ekasyādhi dharmaṇi tasyāvayajanam asi //
analyzed: yat grāme yat araṇye yat sabhāyām yat indriye   yat śūdre yat arye yat enaḥ cakṛma vayam yat ekasya adhi dharmaṇi tasya avayajanam asi
translated: Whatever sin we have committed in the village, in the forest, in the assembly, in the presence of the powerful, among the Shudras, among the Aryas, and whatever sin we have committed against the law of one, thou art the expiation of that.

original: yad āpo aghnyā iti varuṇeti śapāmahe tato varuṇa no muñca / avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa nicerur asi nicumpuṇaḥ / ava devair devakṛtam eno 'yakṣy ava martyair martyakṛtam / pururāvṇo deva riṣas pāhi //
analyzed: yat āpaḥ aghnyāḥ iti varuṇa iti śapāmahe tatas varuṇa naḥ muñca       avabhṛtha nicumpuṇa niceruḥ asi nicumpuṇaḥ   ava devaiḥ deva kṛtam enaḥ yakṣi ava martyaiḥ martya kṛtam    pururāvṇaḥ deva riṣaḥ pāhi
translated: From that sin, O Varuna, deliver us, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O Varuna, from that sin, O

original: samudre te hṛdayam apsv antaḥ saṃ tvā viśantv oṣadhīr utāpaḥ / sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyās tasmai santu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ //
analyzed: samudre te hṛdayam apsu antar sam tvā viśantu oṣadhīḥ uta apaḥ    su mitriyāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyāḥ tasmai santu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: In the sea is thy heart, in the waters. Let the plants and the waters enter into thee. Be the waters and the plants friendly to us. Be they unfriendly to him who hateth us and whom we hate.🔽Like one freed from a snare, like one bathed and sweating, freed from dirt,

original: drupadād iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snāto malād iva / pūtaṃ pavitreṇevājyam āpaḥ śundhantu mainasaḥ //
analyzed: drupadāt iva mumucānaḥ svinnaḥ snātaḥ malāt iva    pūtam pavitreṇa iva ājyam āpaḥ śundhantu mā enasaḥ
translated: let the waters purify my thought, as if it were pure ghee in a strainer.🔽We have come from the darkness, beholding the light above,

original: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari svaḥ paśyanta uttaram / devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari svar paśyantaḥ uttaram    devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam
translated: the god Sûrya, to the gods, to the highest light.

original: apo adyānv acāriṣam rasena sam asṛkṣmahi / payasvān agna āgamaṃ taṃ mā sam sṛja varcasā prajayā ca dhanena ca //
analyzed: apaḥ adya anu acāriṣam rasena sam asṛkṣmahi    payasvān agne āgamam tam mā sam sṛja varcasā prajayā ca dhanena ca
translated: I have to-day gone along the waters: with the juice have I united myself. Rich in milk, O Agni, have I come: unite me with splendour, with offspring, with wealth.🔽Thou art fuel: may we prosper. Thou art kindling: thou art radiance. Place radiance in me.

original: edho 'sy edhiṣīmahi / samid asi tejo 'si tejo mayi dhehi / samā vavarti pṛthivī sam uṣāḥ sam u sūryaḥ / sam u viśvam idaṃ jagat / vaiśvānarajyotir bhūyāsaṃ vibhūn kāmān vy aśnavai bhūḥ svāhā //
analyzed: edhaḥ si edhiṣīmahi    samidh asi tejaḥ si tejaḥ mayi dhehi   samā vavarti pṛthivī sam uṣāḥ sam u sūryaḥ   sam u viśvam idam jagat   vaiśvānara jyotiḥ bhūyāsam vibhūn kāmān vi aśnavai bhūḥ svāhā
translated: The earth hath turned to me, the dawn, the sun hath turned to me. This whole world hath turned to me. May I be possessed of the light of Vaisvânara. May I obtain the boons that are in the quarters. Earth! Hail!

original: abhyā dadhāmi samidham agne vratapate tvayi / vrataṃ ca śraddhāṃ copaimīndhe tvā dīkṣito aham //
analyzed: abhyā dadhāmi samidham agne vratapate tvayi    vratam ca śraddhām ca upaimi indhe tvā dīkṣitaḥ aham
translated: I place the kindling-stick in thee, O Agni, Lord of vows. In thee I take my stand on vow and faith. I kindle thee, consecrated.🔽Where Brahman and Kshatriya move together in harmony,

original: yatra brahma ca kṣatraṃ ca samyañco carataḥ saha / taṃ lokaṃ puṇyaṃ pra jñeṣaṃ yatra devāḥ sahāgninā //
analyzed: yatra brahma ca kṣatram ca carataḥ saha     tam lokam puṇyam pra jñeṣam yatra devāḥ saha agninā
translated: I will go to that holy world where the gods are with Agni.🔽Where Indra and Vayu move together in harmony,

original: yatrendraś ca vāyuś ca samyañco carataḥ saha / taṃ lokaṃ puṇyaṃ pra jñeṣaṃ yatra sedir na vidyate //
analyzed: yatra indraḥ ca vāyuḥ ca carataḥ saha     tam lokam puṇyam pra jñeṣam yatra sediḥ na vidyate
translated: I will go to that holy world where fatigue is not found.

original: amśunā te amśuḥ pṛcyatāṃ paruṣā paruḥ / gandhas te somam avatu madāya raso acyutaḥ //
analyzed: amśunā te amśuḥ pṛcyatām paruṣā paruḥ   gandhaḥ te somam avatu madāya rasaḥ acyutaḥ
translated: Let thy shoot be joined with my shoot, let thy hair be joined with my hair. May thy fragrance protect thy Soma for the sake of joy, thy juice that does not fail.

original: siñcanti pari ṣiñcanty ut siñcanti punanti ca / surāyai babhrvai made kiṃtvo vadati kiṃtvaḥ //
analyzed: siñcanti pari siñcanti ud siñcanti punanti ca      surāyai babhrvai made kiṃtvaḥ vadati kiṃtvaḥ
translated: They sprinkle, they sprinkle around, they sprinkle upwards, they purify. What does the brown Sura say when intoxicated? What does it say?🔽Endowed with curds, with gruel, with cakes, with hymns,

original: dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam / indra prātar juṣasva naḥ //
analyzed: dhānāvantam karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam     indra prātar juṣasva naḥ
translated: O Indra, be pleased with us in the morning.🔽Sing forth to Indra, the Maruts, the best slayer of Vrtra,

original: bṛhad indrāya gāyata maruto vṛtrahantamam / yena jyotir ajanayann ṛtāvṛdho devaṃ devāya jāgṛvi //
analyzed: bṛhat indrāya gāyata marutaḥ vṛtra hantamam   yena jyotiḥ ajanayan ṛtāvṛdhaḥ devam devāya jāgṛvi
translated: by whom they have produced the light, the gods who increase truth, the god for the god who is watchful.

original: adhvaryo adribhiḥ sutam somaṃ pavitra ā naya / punīhīndrāya pātave //
analyzed: adhvaryo adribhiḥ sutam somam pavitre ā naya   punīhi indrāya pātave
translated: O Adhvaryu, with the stones, lead the Soma pressed into the filter, purify it for Indra to drink.🔽He who is the lord of beings, in whom the worlds are established,

original: yo bhūtānām adhipatir yasmiṃ lokā adhi śritāḥ / ya īśe mahato mahāms tena gṛhṇāmi tvām ahaṃ mayi gṛhṇāmi tvām aham //
analyzed: yaḥ bhūtānām adhipatiḥ yasmin lokāḥ adhi śritāḥ   yaḥ īśe mahataḥ tena gṛhṇāmi tvām aham mayi gṛhṇāmi tvām aham
translated: who is the lord of the great and mighty, by him I take you, I take you in me.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe / eṣa te yonir aśvibhyāṃ tvā sarasvatyai tvendrāya tvā sutrāmṇe //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si aśvibhyām tvā sarasvatyai tvā indrāya tvā su trāmṇe    eṣa te yoniḥ aśvibhyām tvā sarasvatyai tvā indrāya tvā su trāmṇe
translated: You are taken with a support; for the Ashvins you, for Sarasvati you, for Indra you, for Sutramna. This is your birthplace; for the Ashvins you, for Sarasvati you, for Indra you, for Sutramna.

original: prāṇapā me apānapāś cakṣuṣpāḥ śrotrapāś ca me / vāco me viśvabheṣajo manaso 'si vilāyakaḥ //
analyzed: prāṇa pāḥ me apāna pāḥ cakṣuṣpāḥ śrotra pāḥ ca me    vācaḥ me viśva bheṣajaḥ manasaḥ si vilāyakaḥ
translated: You are the protector of my breath, the protector of my out-breath, the protector of my eye, the protector of my ear. You are the universal remedy for my speech, the disperser for my mind.

original: aśvinakṛtasya te sarasvatikṛtasyendreṇa sumtrāmṇā kṛtasya / upahūta upahūtasya bhakṣayāmi //
analyzed: aśvina kṛtasya te sarasvati kṛtasya indreṇa sumtrāmṇā kṛtasya          upahūtaḥ upahūtasya bhakṣayāmi
translated: Of you who are made by the Ashvins, who are made by Sarasvati, who are made by Indra with good protection, I partake of the invoked, of the invoked.

original: samiddha indra uṣasām anīke purorucā pūrvakṛd vāvṛdhānaḥ / tribhir devais trimśatā vajrabāhur jaghāna vṛtraṃ vi duro vavāra //
analyzed: samiddhaḥ indraḥ uṣasām anīke purorucā pūrva kṛt vāvṛdhānaḥ    tribhiḥ devaiḥ trimśatā vajra bāhuḥ jaghāna vṛtram vi duraḥ vavāra
translated: Kindled, Indra, in the forefront of the dawns, with his ancient deeds, with his far-reaching deeds, with the three gods, with the thirty, with his thunderbolt-armed hand, he slew Vritra, and opened the enclosures.

original: narāśamsaḥ prati śūro mimānas tanūnapāt prati yajñasya dhāma / gobhir vapāvān madhunā samañjan hiraṇyaiś candrī yajati pracetāḥ //
analyzed: narāśamsaḥ prati śūraḥ mimānaḥ tanūnapāt prati yajñasya dhāma   gobhiḥ vapāvān madhunā samañjan hiraṇyaiḥ candrī yajati pracetāḥ
translated: Anointed with fat and honey, adorned with gold, the radiant one offers sacrifice with the metres.🔽Called by the gods, the brown-hued protector, invited, swelling with oblation,

original: īḍito devair harivām abhiṣṭir ājuhvāno haviṣā śardhamānaḥ / puraṃdaro gotabhid vajrabāhur ā yātu yajñam upa no juṣāṇaḥ //
analyzed: īḍitaḥ devaiḥ harivān abhiṣṭiḥ ājuhvānaḥ haviṣā śardhamānaḥ    puraṃdaraḥ gotabhid vajra bāhuḥ ā yātu yajñam upa naḥ juṣāṇaḥ
translated: The breaker of forts, the wielder of the thunderbolt, may he come to the sacrifice, accepting it.🔽Accepting the strew, the brown-hued one, may Indra sit down to the east of the earth,🔽The widely-spread, the pleasant, the first to spread, anointed by the Adityas, in accord with the Vasus.

original: juṣāṇo barhir harivān na indraḥ prācīnam sīdat pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ / uruprathāḥ prathamānam syonam ādityair aktaṃ vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ //
analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ barhiḥ harivān naḥ indraḥ prācīnam sīdat pradiśā pṛthivyāḥ     uru prathāḥ prathamānam syonam ādityaiḥ aktam vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: Let the doors, the young cows, running to Indra, the strong one, let the well-wedded wives come,🔽Let the two divine doors be opened on both sides, rich in heroes, extending the hero with great powers.

original: indraṃ duraḥ kavaṣyo dhāvamānā vṛṣāṇaṃ yantu janayaḥ supatnīḥ / dvāro devīr abhito vi śrayantām suvīrā vīraṃ prathamānā mahobhiḥ //
analyzed: indram duraḥ kavaṣyaḥ dhāvamānāḥ vṛṣāṇam yantu janayaḥ su patnīḥ   dvāraḥ devīḥ abhitas vi śrayantām su vīrāḥ vīram prathamānāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: Dawn and Night, the great ones, the brown-hued, the rich in milk, the well-milking, the hero Indra,

original: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī bṛhantaṃ payasvatī sudughe śūram indram / tantuṃ tataṃ peśasā saṃvayantī devānāṃ devaṃ yajataḥ surukme //
analyzed: uṣāsānaktā bṛhatī bṛhantam payasvatī sudughe śūram indram   / tantum tatam peśasā saṃvayantī devānām devam yajataḥ su rukme
translated: Stretching the stretched thread with their bodies, the god of the gods, the one to be worshipped, of beautiful rays.

original: daivyā mimānā manuṣaḥ purutrā hotārāv indraṃ prathamā suvācā / mūrhdan yajñasya madhunā dadhānā prācīnaṃ jyotir haviṣā vṛdhātaḥ //
analyzed: daivyā mimānā manuṣaḥ purutrā hotārau indram prathamā su vācā   mūrhdan yajñasya madhunā dadhānā prācīnam jyotiḥ haviṣā vṛdhātaḥ
translated: Endowing the head of the sacrifice with honey, increasing the ancient light with oblation.🔽The three goddesses, waxing great with oblation, Indra, the joyous ones, the wives, accepting,

original: tisro devīr haviṣā vardhamānā indraṃ juṣāṇā janayo na patnīḥ / acchinnaṃ tantuṃ payasā sarasvatīḍā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ //
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ haviṣā vardhamānāḥ indram juṣāṇāḥ janayaḥ na patnīḥ    acchinnam tantum payasā sarasvatī iḍā devī bhāratī viśvatūrtiḥ
translated: The unbroken thread, with milk, Sarasvatî, the goddess Iḍâ, Bhâratî, all-powerful.🔽Tvashtri, bestowing strength on Indra, the bull, the cook, the uncooked, for many glories,

original: tvaṣṭā dadhac chuṣmam indrāya vṛṣṇe 'pāko 'ciṣṭur yaśase purūṇi / vṛṣā yajan vṛṣaṇaṃ bhūriretā mūrdhan yajñasya sam anaktu devān //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā dadhat śuṣmam indrāya vṛṣṇe pākaḥ ciṣṭuḥ yaśase purūṇi    vṛṣā yajan vṛṣaṇam bhūri retāḥ mūrdhan yajñasya sam anaktu devān
translated: The bull, sacrificing to the bull, of much seed, let him anoint the head of the sacrifice, the gods.🔽The lord of the forest, loosed from the bonds, adjusting himself, the appeaser, like a god,

original: vanaspatir avasṛṣṭo na pāśais tmanyā samañjañ chamitā na devaḥ / indrasya havyair jaṭharaṃ pṛṇānaḥ svadāti yajñaṃ madhunā ghṛtena //
analyzed: vanaspatiḥ avasṛṣṭaḥ na pāśaiḥ tmanyā samañjam śamitā na devaḥ    indrasya havyaiḥ jaṭharam pṛṇānaḥ svadāti yajñam madhunā ghṛtena
translated: Satisfying with the oblations of Indra the belly, he delights the sacrifice with honey and ghee.🔽The drops, Indra, the hero, for the Soma, the bull, the strong, the mighty,

original: stokānā / induṃ prati śūra indro vṛṣāyamāṇo vṛṣabhas turāṣāṭ / ghṛtapruṣā manasā modamānāḥ svāhā devā amṛtā mādayantām //
analyzed: stokānaḥ indum prati śūraḥ indraḥ vṛṣāyamāṇaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ turāṣāh    ghṛta pruṣā manasā modamānāḥ svāhā devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām
translated: Rejoicing in spirit with the ghee-dripping (oblation), let the gods, the immortal ones, rejoice with the Svâhâ.

original: ā yātv indro 'vasa upa na iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ / vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrvīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt //🔽ā na indro dūrād ā na āsād abhiṣṭikṛd avase yāsad ugraḥ / ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṃge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn //
analyzed: ā yātu indraḥ vase upa naḥ iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ    vāvṛdhānaḥ taviṣīḥ yasya pūrvīḥ dyauḥ na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt  ā naḥ indraḥ dūrāt ā naḥ āsāt abhiṣṭi kṛt avase yāsat ugraḥ    ojiṣṭhebhiḥ nṛpatiḥ vajra bāhuḥ saṃge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn
translated: May Indra come to us for our protection: here let the Hero be extolled and worshipped. May he, exalted, with his mighty powers, be glorified as King, as heaven is glorified.🔽May Indra come to us from far away, or near at hand, the Uprechter, to our aid, the mighty, with his most powerful aids, the Lord of men, whose arms are strong, the conqueror of foes in the encounter and in war.

original: ā na indro haribhir yātv acchārvācīno 'vase rādhase ca / tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśīmaṃ yajñam anu no vājasātau //🔽trātāram indram avitāram indram havehave suhavam śūram indram / hvayāmi śakraṃ puruhūtam indram svasti no maghavā dhātv indraḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ indraḥ haribhiḥ yātu acchā arvācīnaḥ vase rādhase ca    tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśī imam yajñam anu naḥ vājasātau  trātāram indram avitāram indram havehave su havam śūram indram      hvayāmi śakram puru hūtam indram svasti naḥ maghavā dhātu indraḥ
translated: May Indra come to us with tawny coursers, from far away or near, to give us shelter and bestow his bounties. The wielder of the thunderbolt, the bountiful, the mighty, may he come to this our sacrifice to aid us in the winning of strength.🔽I call on Indra, the protector, the defender, the hero who must be invoked in every fight, on Indra, the mighty, invoked of many. May Indra, the bountiful, grant us welfare.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā svavām avobhiḥ sumṛḍīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ / bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma //
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā su avām avobhiḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ   bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the self-dependent, the gracious, the all-knowing, be gracious to us with his favours. May he drive away our foes and make us safe. May we be lords of goodly hero strength.

original: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma / sa sutrāmā svavām indro asme ārāc cid dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu //
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma     sa sutrāmā svavām indraḥ asme ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu
translated: May we enjoy the favour of that adorable one, and may we enjoy his gracious love. May Indra, the good protector, the mighty, drive away our foes, even from afar.

original: ā mandrair indra haribhir yāhi mayūraromabhiḥ / mā tvā ke cin ni yaman viṃ nā pāśino 'ti dhanveva tām ihi //
analyzed: ā mandraiḥ indra haribhiḥ yāhi mayūra romabhiḥ   mā tvā ke cit ni yaman vim nā pāśinaḥ ti dhanvā iva tām ihi
translated: Come, O Indra, with thy cheerful Bay Steeds, whose tails are like peacock's plumes. Let none restrain thee, as the fowler with his net. Come hither as thou listest.

original: eved indraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhuṃ vasiṣṭhāso abhy arcanty arkaiḥ / sa na stuto vīravad dhātu gomad yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: eva id indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum vasiṣṭhāsaḥ abhī arcanti arkaiḥ    sa naḥ stutaḥ vīravat dhātu gomat yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Even him, the mighty Indra, whose arm wields the thunderbolt, the Vasishṭhas glorify with lauds. May he, when lauded, grant us wealth in heroes and in cattle. Ye Gods, preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: samiddho agnir aśvinā tapto gharmo virāṭ sutaḥ / duhe dhenuḥ sarasvatī somam śukram ihendriyam //🔽tanūpā bhiṣajā sute 'svinobhā sarasvatī / adhvā rajāmsīndriyam indrāya pathibhir vahān //
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ aśvinā taptaḥ gharmaḥ virāj sutaḥ    duhe dhenuḥ sarasvatī somam śukram iha indriyam  tanūpā bhiṣajā sute svinā ubhā sarasvatī    adhvā rajāmsi indriyam indrāya pathibhiḥ vahān
translated: Enkindled is the fire, O Asvins. The caldron is heated, the Sudḍhâka pressed. The cow Dhenuka milks for Sarasvatî the pure and bright Soma, the source of power and might.🔽The Asvins, the two physicians, in the pressed (Soma), and Sarasvatî, the saviour of life, carry on the path, the regions, the power, the might, to Indra.

original: indrāyendum sarasvatī narāśamsena nagnahum / adhātām aśvinā madhu bheṣajaṃ bhiṣajā sute //
analyzed: indrāya indum sarasvatī narāśamsena nagnahum    adhātām aśvinā madhu bheṣajam bhiṣajā sute
translated: Sarasvatî and the two Asvins have brought to Indra the Soma, the moon, with the Nârâsamsa (hymn), the naked one. They have brought the honey, the medicine, the healing balm, in the pressed (Soma).

original: ājuhvānā sarasvatīndrāyendriyāṇi vīryam / iḍābhir aśvināv iṣam sam ūrjam sam rayiṃ dadhuḥ //
analyzed: ājuhvānā sarasvatī indrāya indriyāṇi vīryam   iḍābhiḥ aśvinau iṣam sam ūrjam sam rayim dadhuḥ
translated: Sarasvatî, the offerer, hath sent Indra power and manly strength. The Asvins with the Idâs have bestowed on him food and strength and wealth.

original: aśvinā namuceḥ sutam somam śukraṃ parisrutā / sarasvatī tām ābharad barhiṣendrāya pātave //
analyzed: aśvinā namuceḥ sutam somam śukram parisrutā    sarasvatī tām ābharat barhiṣā indrāya pātave
translated: The Asvins, with the bright Soma juice of Namuci, with the flowing (juice), Sarasvatî brought it to Indra to drink, to the strewed sacred grass.

original: kavaṣyo na vyacasvatīr aśvibhyāṃ na duro diśaḥ / indro na rodasī ubhe duhe kāmānt sarasvatī //
analyzed: kavaṣyaḥ na vyacasvatīḥ aśvibhyām na duraḥ diśaḥ   indraḥ na rodasī ubhe duhe kāmān sarasvatī
translated: The spacious quarters of the earth are not more spacious than the Asvins. Indra and both the worlds, the heaven and the earth, and Sarasvatî, yield their desires.

original: uṣāsānaktāśvinā divendram sāyam indriyaiḥ / saṃjānāne supeśasā sam añjāte sarasvatyā //
analyzed: uṣāsānaktā aśvinā divā indram sāyam indriyaiḥ    saṃjānāne supeśasā sam añjāte sarasvatyā
translated: Dawn and Night, O Asvins, with their beauty, with their knowledge, in the evening to Indra the heavenly, the two Adhvaryus, the physicians, shall pour the Soma, with Sarasvatî, to Indra, to the pressed (juice).

original: pātaṃ no aśvinā divā pāhi naktam sarasvati / daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā pātām indram sacā sute //
analyzed: pātam naḥ aśvinā divā pāhi naktam sarasvati    daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā pātām indram sacā sute
translated: Protect us by day, O Asvins, protect us by night, O Sarasvatî. The two heavenly Adhvaryus, the physicians, shall pour Indra to the pressed (juice).

original: tisras tredhā sarasvaty aśvinā bhāratīḍā / tīvraṃ parisrutā somam indrāya suṣuvur madam //
analyzed: tisraḥ tredhā sarasvatī aśvinā bhāratī iḍā    tīvram parisrutā somam indrāya suṣuvuḥ madam
translated: The three Sarasvatîs, the Asvins, Bhâratî, and Idâ, have pressed out for Indra the strong flowing Soma, the gladdening drink.

original: aśvinā bheṣajaṃ madhu bheṣajaṃ naḥ sarasvatī / indre tvaṣṭā yaśaḥ śriyam rūpamrūpam adhuḥ sute //
analyzed: aśvinā bheṣajam madhu bheṣajam naḥ sarasvatī    indre tvaṣṭā yaśaḥ śriyam rūpam rūpam adhuḥ sute
translated: The Asvins the healing balm, the healing balm for us, O Sarasvatî. Tvashtar in the pressed (juice) hath bestowed on Indra glory, beauty, form after form.

original: ṛtuthendro vanaspatiḥ śaśamānaḥ parisrutā / kīlālam aśvibhyāṃ madhu duhe dhenuḥ sarasvatī //
analyzed: ṛtuthā indraḥ vanaspatiḥ śaśamānaḥ parisrutā   kīlālam aśvibhyām madhu duhe dhenuḥ sarasvatī
translated: The God of the season, Indra, the lord of the forest, the active one, the flowing one, the cow Sarasvatī milks the sweet essence for the two Asvins.

original: gobhir na somam aśvinā māsareṇa parisrutā / sam adhātam sarasvatyā svāhendre sutaṃ madhu //🔽aśvinā havir indriyaṃ namucer dhiyā sarasvatī / ā śukram āsurād vasu magham indrāya jabhrire //
analyzed: gobhiḥ na somam aśvinā māsareṇa parisrutā   sam adhātam sarasvatyā svāhā indre sutam madhu  aśvinā haviḥ indriyam namuceḥ dhiyā sarasvatī    ā śukram āsurāt vasu magham indrāya jabhrire
translated: With cows, O Asvins, with the month-old flowing Soma, you have placed together with Sarasvatī the sweet essence pressed for Indra, hail!🔽The Asvins, Sarasvatī with the oblation, Indra's power, the bright treasure of the Asura Namuci, they brought to Indra as a gift.

original: yam aśvinā sarasvatī haviṣendram avardhayan / sa bidheda valaṃ maghaṃ namucāv āsure sacā //
analyzed: yam aśvinā sarasvatī haviṣā indram avardhayan    sa bidheda valam magham namucau āsure sacā
translated: The Indra whom the Asvins, Sarasvatī with the oblation, have exalted, he will burst open the stronghold, the treasure, together with Namuci the Asura.

original: tam indram sacāśvinobhā sarasvatī / dadhānā abhy anūṣata haviṣā yajña indriyaiḥ //
analyzed: tam indram sacā aśvinā ubhā sarasvatī    dadhānāḥ abhī anūṣata haviṣā yajñe indriyaiḥ
translated: That Indra, both the Asvins and Sarasvatī, bestowing, have they praised with the oblation, with the power of sacrifice.

original: ya indra indriyaṃ dadhuḥ savitā varuṇo bhagaḥ / sa sutrāmā haviṣpatir yajamānāya saścata //
analyzed: yaḥ indre indriyam savitā varuṇaḥ bhagaḥ    sa sutrāmā haviṣpatiḥ yajamānāya saścata
translated: He who has bestowed power on Indra, Savitar, Varuna, Bhaga, he, the good protector, the lord of oblations, waits on the sacrificer.

original: savitā varuṇo dadhad yajamānāya dāśuṣe / ādatta namucer vasu sutrāmā balam indriyam //
analyzed: savitā varuṇaḥ dadhat yajamānāya dāśuṣe    ādatta namuceḥ vasu sutrāmā balam indriyam
translated: Savitar, Varuna bestowing on the sacrificer who offers gifts, has taken the treasure from Namuci, the good protector, the power, the strength.

original: varuṇaḥ kṣatram indriyaṃ bhagena savitā śriyam / sutrāmā yaśasā balaṃ dadhānā yajñam āśata //
analyzed: varuṇaḥ kṣatram indriyam bhagena savitā śriyam    sutrāmā yaśasā balam dadhānāḥ yajñam āśata
translated: Sutramana the fame and strength, having bestowed these, have come to the sacrifice.🔽The Asvins the power with the cows, the strength and valour with the horses,

original: aśvinā gobhir indriyam aśvebhir vīryaṃ balam / haviṣendram sarasvatī yajamānam avardayan //
analyzed: aśvinā gobhiḥ indriyam aśvebhiḥ vīryam balam    haviṣā indram sarasvatī yajamānam avardayan
translated: Sarasvati with the oblation have favoured Indra, the sacrificer.🔽Those two Nâsatyas, of fair forms, the two men who have golden paths,🔽Sarasvatî who receives oblations, O Indra, have helped us in our rites.

original: tā nāsatyā supeśasā hiraṇyavartanī narā / sarasvatī haviṣmatīndra karmasu no 'vata //
analyzed: tā nāsatyā supeśasā hiraṇya vartanī narā sarasvatī haviṣmatī indra karmasu naḥ vata
translated: Those two physicians, of fair deeds, that good milker Sarasvatî,

original: tā bhiṣajā sukarmaṇā sā sudughā sarasvatī / sa vṛtrahā śatakratur indrāya dadhur indriyam //
analyzed: tā bhiṣajā su karmaṇā sā su dughā sarasvatī      sa vṛtra hā śatakratuḥ indrāya dadhuḥ indriyam
translated: That Vritra-slayer of a hundred powers have bestowed power on Indra.🔽You two, O Asvins, the Sura-drink with Namuchi the Asura,

original: yuvam surāmam aśvinā namucāv āsure sacā / vipipānāḥ sarasvatīndraṃ karmasv āvata //
analyzed: yuvam su rāmam aśvinā namucau āsure sacā    vipipānāḥ sarasvati indram karmasu āvata
translated: Drinking together, O Sarasvatî, have favoured Indra in his deeds.🔽As father and mother help their son, so have the Asvins helped Indra with their two hymns, with their glances,

original: putram iva pitarāv aśvinobhendrāvathuḥ kāvyair damsanābhiḥ / yat surāmaṃ vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavann abhiṣṇak //
analyzed: putram iva pitarau aśvinā ubhā indra āvathuḥ kāvyaiḥ damsanābhiḥ    yat su rāmam vyapibaḥ śacībhiḥ sarasvatī tvā maghavan abhiṣṇak
translated: When thou hast drunk the Sura with thy might, Sarasvatî, O bountiful one, hath refreshed thee.🔽In whom the horses, bulls, oxen, barren cows, and rams have been offered, and let loose,

original: yasminn aśvāsa ṛṣabhāsa ukṣaṇo vaśā meṣā avasṛṣṭāsa āhutāḥ / kīlālape somapṛṣṭhāya vedhase hṛdā matiṃ janaye cārum agnaye //
analyzed: yasmin aśvāsaḥ ṛṣabhāsaḥ ukṣaṇaḥ vaśāḥ meṣāḥ avasṛṣṭāsaḥ āhutāḥ   kīlāla pe soma pṛṣṭhāya vedhase hṛdā matim janaye cārum agnaye
translated: The sweet juice to the wise one whose back is the Soma, generate in thy heart a fair thought for Agni.

original: ahāvy agne havir āsye te srucīva ghṛtaṃ camvīva somaḥ / vājasanim rayim asme suvīraṃ praśastaṃ dhehi yaśasaṃ bṛhantam //
analyzed: ahāvi agne haviḥ āsye te sruci iva ghṛtam camvi iva somaḥ vāja sanim rayim asme su vīram praśastam dhehi yaśasam bṛhantam
translated: O Agni, let the oblation be in thy mouth, as the ghee in the ladle, as the Soma in the cup. Grant us wealth in the form of cattle, O Indra, with good heroes, praised, glorious, and great.

original: aśvinā tejasā cakṣuḥ prāṇena sarasvatī vīryam / vācendro balenendrāya dadhur indriyam //
analyzed: aśvinā tejasā cakṣuḥ prāṇena sarasvatī vīryam   vācā indraḥ balena indrāya dadhuḥ indriyam
translated: The Asvins with their splendor, Sarasvatī with her breath, Indra with his strength have bestowed power on Indra.

original: gomad ū ṣu ṇāsatyā aśvāvad yātam aśvinā / vartī rudrā nṛpāyyam //
analyzed: gomat u su nāsatyau aśvāvat yātam aśvinā    vartiḥ rudrā nṛpāyyam
translated: O Nâsatyas, come with your wealth of cattle and horses, O Asvins, to the house of the man who worships you.

original: na yat paro nāntara ādadharṣad vṛṣaṇvasū / duḥśamso martyo ripuḥ //
analyzed: na yat paras na antare ādadharṣat vṛṣaṇvasū duḥśamsaḥ martyaḥ ripuḥ
translated: The mortal enemy, O you whose wealth is great, the evil-minded one, whom neither one from afar nor one from near has ever injured,

original: tā na ā voḍham aśvinā rayiṃ piśaṅgasaṃdṛśam / dhiṣṇyā varivovidam //🔽pāvakā naḥ sarasvatī vājebhir vājinīvatī / yajñaṃ vaṣṭu dhiyāvasuḥ //
analyzed: tā naḥ ā voḍham aśvinā rayim piśaṅga saṃdṛśam dhiṣṇyā varivaḥ vidam  pāvakā naḥ sarasvatī vājebhiḥ vājinīvatī   yajñam vaṣṭu dhiyāvasuḥ
translated: O Asvins, bring us that wealth which is like gold, which is to be desired, which is full of room.🔽May Sarasvatī, the purifier, rich in treasures, with her powers, accept our sacrifice.

original: codayitrī sūnṛtānāṃ cetantī sumatīnām / yajñaṃ dadhe sarasvatī //
analyzed: codayitrī sūnṛtānām cetantī sumatīnām    yajñam dadhe sarasvatī
translated: Sarasvatī, the inspirer of good thoughts, the bestower of good intentions, has established the sacrifice.

original: maho arṇaḥ sarasvatī pra cetayati ketunā / dhiyo viśvā vi rājati //
analyzed: mahaḥ arṇaḥ sarasvatī pra cetayati ketunā    dhiyaḥ viśvāḥ vi rājati
translated: The great flood, Sarasvatī, with her banner, inspires with thought; she shines over all our thoughts.

original: indrā yāhi citrabhāno sutā ime tvāyavaḥ / aṇvībhis tanā pūtāsaḥ //
analyzed: indra ā yāhi citra bhāno sutāḥ ime tvāyavaḥ   aṇvībhiḥ tanā pūtāsaḥ
translated: O Indra, come, O you of wondrous light! These juices are ready for you, purified by the finest straining.

original: indrā yāhi dhiyeṣito viprajūtaḥ sutāvataḥ / upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ //🔽indrā yāhi tūtujāna upa brahmāṇi harivaḥ / sute dadhiṣva naś canaḥ //
analyzed: indra ā yāhi dhiyā iṣitaḥ vipra jūtaḥ sutāvataḥ    upa brahmāṇi vāghataḥ  indra ā yāhi tūtujānaḥ upa brahmāṇi harivas   sute dadhiṣva naḥ canaḥ
translated: Urged on by the thought of the worshipper, urged on by the holy singer, come, O Indra, to the Soma-presser's prayers.🔽Come, O Indra, urged on, O Lord of Bay Steeds, to the prayers of the worshipper. Accept our offering when the Soma is pressed.

original: aśvinā pibatāṃ madhu sarasvatyā sajoṣasā / indraḥ sutrāmā vṛtrahā juṣantām somyaṃ madhu //
analyzed: aśvinā pibatām madhu sarasvatyā sajoṣasā    indraḥ sutrāmā vṛtrahā juṣantām somyam madhu
translated: Drink the sweet juice, O Asvins, in accord with Sarasvatî. May Indra, the good protector, the Vr̥itra-slayer, accept the Soma-meath.

original: imaṃ me varuṇa śrudhī havam adyā ca mṛḍaya / tvām asvasyur ā cake //
analyzed: imam me varuṇa śrudhi havam adyā ca mṛḍaya   tvām asvasyuḥ ā cake
translated: Hear this my call, O Varuṇa, and today be gracious unto me. I have come to thee as one who fain would live.

original: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānas tad ā śāste yajamāno havirbhiḥ / aheḍamāno varuṇeha bodhy uruśamsa mā na āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ //🔽tvaṃ no agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḍo 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ / yajiṣṭho vahnitamaḥ śośucāno viśvā dveṣāmsi pra mumugdhy asmat //
analyzed: tat tvā yāmi brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ tat ā śāste yajamānaḥ havirbhiḥ    a heḍamānaḥ varuṇa iha bodhi uru śamsa mā naḥ āyuḥ pra moṣīḥ  tvam naḥ agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḍaḥ vaḥ yāsisīṣṭhāḥ    yajiṣṭhaḥ vahnitamaḥ śośucānaḥ viśvā dveṣām si pra mumugdhi asmat
translated: With prayer I come to thee for this: the sacrificer with oblations bids me do so. Be not wrathful here, O Varuṇa: be gracious, O thou of ample sway, and take not our life from us.🔽Thou, O Agni, who knowest, must go to the wrath of Varuṇa the God, as best sacrificer, most purifying, shining, free us from all our hatreds.

original: sa tvaṃ no agne 'vamo bhavotī nediṣṭho asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau / ava yakṣva no varuṇam rarāṇo vīhi mṛḍīkam suhavo na edhi //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ agne vamaḥ bhava ūtī nediṣṭhaḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau   ava yakṣva naḥ varuṇam rarāṇaḥ vīhi mṛḍīkam su havaḥ naḥ edhi
translated: So be thou, O Agni, our nearest friend, most near at this dawn of the dawn. Worship thou Varuṇa for us, granting us grace. Be thou easy to invoke for us.

original: mahīm ū ṣu mātaram suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase huvema / tuvikṣatrām ajarantīm urūcīm suśarmāṇam aditim supraṇītim //
analyzed: mahīm ū ṣu mātaram suvratānām ṛtasya patnīm avase huvema    tuvikṣatrām ajarantīm urūcīm suśarmāṇam aditim supraṇītim
translated: To Aditi, whose dominion is wide, whose rule is good, whose protection is good, whose counsel is good, who is not subject to old age, who is far-reaching, whose troops are invincible.🔽To the earth that is well-guarded, to the sky that is free from sin, to Aditi that has good protection, that has good rule,

original: sutrāmāṇaṃ pṛthivīṃ dyām anehasam suśarmāṇam aditim supraṇītim / devīṃ nāvam svaritrām anāgasam asravantīm ā ruhemā svastaye //
analyzed: su trāmāṇam pṛthivīm dyām anehasam su śarmāṇam aditim su praṇītim    devīm nāvam su aritrām anāgasam a sravantīm ā ruhema svastaye
translated: To the divine ship that is well-constructed, that is free from sin, that flows not away, let us embark for our well-being.🔽Let me embark on the ship that is well-constructed, that flows not away, that is free from sin,

original: sunāvam ā ruheyam asravantīm anāgasam / śatāritrām svastaye //
analyzed: su nāvam ā ruheyam a sravantīm anāgasam    śata aritrām svastaye
translated: That has a hundred oars, for my well-being.🔽Pour upon us, O Mitra-Varuṇa, with ghee the path of the cows,

original: ā no mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtair gavyūtim ukṣatam / madhvā rajāmsi sukratū //
analyzed: ā naḥ mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtaiḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam madhvā rajāmsi su kratū
translated: With honey, O ye of good rites, the regions.🔽Stretch forth your arms to give us life; pour upon us the path of the cows with ghee;

original: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṃ jīvase na ā no gavyūtim ukṣataṃ ghṛtena / ā no jane śravayataṃ yuvānā śrutaṃ me mitrāvaruṇā havemā //
analyzed: pra bāhavā sisṛtam jīvase naḥ ā naḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam ghṛtena    ā naḥ jane śravayatam yuvānā śrutam me mitrāvaruṇā havā imā
translated: Make us renowned among men, O ye young ones; hear my call, O Mitra-Varuṇa.🔽Be auspicious to us, O strong ones, in our invocations, O ye of measured speed, O ye of heavenly nature,

original: śaṃ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ / jambhayanto 'hiṃ vṛkam rakṣāmsi sanemy asmad yuyavann amīvāḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ bhavantu vājinaḥ haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ su arkāḥ jambhayantaḥ him vṛkam rakṣāmsi sanemi asmat yuyavan amīvāḥ
translated: Crushing the serpent, the wolf, the Rākṣasas, may we obtain from you the removal of misfortune.

original: vājevāje 'vata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ / asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṃ tṛptā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ //
analyzed: vājevāje vata vājinaḥ naḥ dhaneṣu viprāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ   asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvam tṛptāḥ yāta pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: In every contest, O ye mighty ones, come to our aid, ye immortal sages, knowing the truth, in our battles. Drink of this mead, and rejoice yourselves. Satisfied, go on the paths of the gods.

original: samiddho agniḥ samidhā susamiddho vareṇyaḥ / gāyatrī chanda indriyaṃ tryavir gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: samiddhaḥ agniḥ samidhā su samiddhaḥ vareṇyaḥ gāyatrī chandaḥ indriyam tryaviḥ gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: Agni is kindled with fuel, well kindled, to be chosen. The Gayatri metre is the power. A cow with three-fourths of milk gives life.

original: tanūnapāc chucivratas tanūpāś ca sarasvatī / uṣṇihā chanda indriyaṃ dityavāḍ gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: tanūnapāt śuci vrataḥ tanū pāḥ ca sarasvatī uṣṇihā chandaḥ indriyam dityavāṭ gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: Tanunapat, of pure vow, and Tanupa, Sarasvati, the Ushnih metre is the power. A cow with a calf a year old gives life.

original: iḍābhir agnir īḍyaḥ somo devo amartyaḥ / anuṣṭup chanda indriyaṃ pañcāvir gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: iḍābhiḥ agniḥ īḍyaḥ somaḥ devaḥ amartyaḥ anuṣṭubh chandaḥ indriyam pañcāviḥ gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: Agni is to be worshipped with oblations. Soma, the immortal god, the Anushtup metre is the power. A cow with five-fourths of milk gives life.

original: subarhir agniḥ pūṣaṇvānt stīrṇabarhir amartyaḥ / bṛhatī chanda indriyaṃ trivatso gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: su barhiḥ agniḥ pūṣaṇvān stīrṇa barhiḥ amartyaḥ    bṛhatī chandaḥ indriyam trivatsaḥ gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: Agni with good grass, with Pusan, with strewn grass, the immortal, the Brihati metre is the power. A cow with three years old calf gives life.

original: duro devīr diśo mahīr brahmā devo bṛhaspatiḥ / paṅktiś chanda ihendriyaṃ turyavāḍ gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: duraḥ devīḥ diśaḥ mahīḥ brahmā devaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ   paṅktiḥ chandaḥ iha indriyam turyavāh gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The doors, the goddesses, the great quarters, Brahma, the god Brihaspati, the Pankti metre is the power here. A cow with a calf four years old gives life.

original: uṣe yahvī supeśasā viśve devā amartyāḥ / triṣṭup chanda ihendriyaṃ paṣṭhavāḍ gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: uṣe yahvī supeśasā viśve devāḥ amartyāḥ triṣṭubh chandaḥ iha indriyam paṣṭhavāh gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The young, beautiful Dawn, all the immortal gods, the Tristubh metre is the power here. A cow with a calf five years old gives life.

original: daivyā hotārā bhiṣajendreṇa sayujā yujā / jagatī chanda indriyam anaḍvān gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā indreṇa sayujā yujā jagatī chandaḥ indriyam anaḍvān gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The two divine Hotars, the physicians, with Indra, the companion, the yoke-fellow, have bestowed the Jagati metre, the power, the bull, the cow, and life.

original: tisra iḍā sarasvatī bhāratī maruto viśaḥ / virāṭ chanda ihendriyaṃ dhenur gaur na vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: tisraḥ iḍā sarasvatī bhāratī marutaḥ viśaḥ    virāj chandaḥ iha indriyam dhenuḥ gauḥ na vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The three, Ida, Sarasvatî, Bhâratî, the Maruts, the people, have bestowed the Virâj metre, the power, the cow, the milch cow, and life.

original: tvaṣṭā turīpo adbhuta indrāgnī puṣṭivardhanā / dvipadā chanda indriyam ukṣā gaur na vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā turīpaḥ adbhutaḥ indra agnī puṣṭi vardhanā      dvipadā chandaḥ indriyam ukṣā gauḥ na vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: Tvastr, the wondrous, the four-cornered, Indra and Agni, the increasers of prosperity, have bestowed the Dvipadâ metre, the power, the bull, the cow, and life.

original: śamitā no vanaspatiḥ savitā prasuvan bhagam / kakup chanda indriyaṃ vaśā vehad vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: śamitā naḥ vanaspatiḥ savitā prasuvan bhagam kakubh chandaḥ indriyam vaśā vehat vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: May the controller, the lord of the forest, Savitar, the impeller, bestow prosperity. They have bestowed the Kakup metre, the power, the barren cow, and life.

original: svāhā yajñaṃ varuṇaḥ sukṣatro bheṣajaṃ karat / aticchandā indriyaṃ bṛhad ṛṣabho gaur vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: svāhā yajñam varuṇaḥ su kṣatraḥ bheṣajam karat   aticchandāḥ indriyam bṛhat ṛṣabhaḥ gauḥ vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: May Varuna, the good lord, bestow the sacrifice, the remedy. They have bestowed the Atichandas metre, the power, the great, the bull, the cow, and life.

original: vasantena ṛtunā devā vasvavas trivṛtā stutāḥ / rathantareṇa tejasā havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: vasantena ṛtunā devāḥ trivṛtā stutāḥ   rathantareṇa tejasā haviḥ indre vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The gods, the Vasus, have been praised with the Trivrit, by the spring season. They have bestowed the power, the oblation, the life in Indra, by the Rathantara, and by the splendour.

original: grīṣmeṇa ṛtunā devā rudrāḥ pañcadaśe stutāḥ / bṛhatā yaśasā balam havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: grīṣmeṇa ṛtunā devāḥ rudrāḥ pañcadaśe stutāḥ   bṛhatā yaśasā balam haviḥ indre vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The gods, the Rudras, have been praised with the Pañchadasa, by the summer season. They have bestowed the strength, the oblation, the life in Indra, by the Brihat, and by the glory.

original: varṣābhir ṛtunādityā stome saptadaśe stutāḥ / vairūpeṇa viśaujasā havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: varṣābhiḥ ṛtunā ādityāḥ stome saptadaśe stutāḥ   vairūpeṇa viśā ojasā haviḥ indre vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The Adityas, praised with the Varsha season, the seventeenfold hymn, and the Vairupa metre, have bestowed strength and oblation on Indra, the powerful one.

original: śāradena ṛtunā devā ekavimśa ṛbhava stutāḥ / vairājena śriyā śriyam havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //🔽hemantena ṛtunā devās triṇave maruta stutāḥ / balena śakvarīḥ saho havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: śāradena ṛtunā devāḥ ekavimśe ṛbhavaḥ stutāḥ   vairājena śriyā śriyam haviḥ indre vayaḥ dadhuḥ  hemantena ṛtunā devāḥ triṇave marutaḥ stutāḥ   balena śakvarīḥ sahaḥ haviḥ indre vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The gods, praised with the autumn season, the twenty-onefold hymn, and the Vairaja metre, have bestowed glory upon glory.🔽The gods, praised with the winter season, the twenty-sevenfold hymn, and the Bala metre, have bestowed strength and oblation on Indra.

original: śaiśireṇa ṛtunā devās trayastrimśe 'mṛtā stutāḥ / satyena revatīḥ kṣatram havir indre vayo dadhuḥ //
analyzed: śaiśireṇa ṛtunā devāḥ trayastrimśe mṛtā stutāḥ   satyena revatīḥ kṣatram haviḥ indre vayaḥ dadhuḥ
translated: The immortal gods, praised with the cold season, the thirty-threefold hymn, and the Satya metre, have bestowed the Revatis and Kshatra upon Indra.

original: hotā yakṣat samidhāgnim iḍas pade 'śvinendram sarasvatīm ajo dhūmro na godhūmaiḥ kuvalair bheṣajaṃ madhu śaṣpair na teja indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat samidhā agnim iḍaḥ pade śvinā indram sarasvatīm ajaḥ dhūmraḥ na godhūmaiḥ kuvalaiḥ bheṣajam madhu śaṣpaiḥ na tejaḥ indriyam payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: The Hotar priest shall worship Agni with kindling sticks, Indra with barley, Sarasvati with rice, the Ashvins with wheat and beans, the medicine with herbs, strength and power with grass, milk with Soma, clarified butter with honey. Let the Hotar priest offer the oblation of ghee.
