original: hotā yakṣat tanūnapāt sarasvatī avir meṣo na bheṣajaṃ pathā madhumatā bharann aśvinendrāya vīryaṃ badarair upavākābhir bheṣajaṃ tokmabhiḥ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //🔽hotā yakṣan narāśamsaṃ na nagnahuṃ patim surayā bheṣajaṃ meṣaḥ sarasvatī bhiṣag ratho na candry aśvinor vapā indrasya vīryaṃ badarair upavākābhir bheṣajaṃ tokmabhiḥ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat tanūnapāt sarasvatī aviḥ meṣaḥ na bheṣajam pathā madhumatā bharan aśvinā indrāya vīryam badaraiḥ upavākābhiḥ bheṣajam tokmabhiḥ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja  hotā yakṣat narāśamsam na nagnahum patim surayā bheṣajam meṣaḥ sarasvatī bhiṣaj rathaḥ na candrī aśvinoḥ vapāḥ indrasya vīryam badaraiḥ upavākābhiḥ bheṣajam tokmabhiḥ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Tanûnapât, Sarasvatî, the ewe, the ram, the medicine, bringing on the sweet path the strength of the Asvins for Indra. With jujubes, with Upâvakâs, with Tokmâs, the medicine, with milk, with Soma, with the dripping (plant), with ghee, with honey, let them enjoy the ghee. Hotar, worship.🔽Let the Hotar worship Narâsamsa, the lord of the naked, with Surâ, the medicine, the ram, the physician Sarasvatî, the chariot like the moon, the omentum of the Asvins, the strength of Indra. With jujubes, with Upâvakâs, with Tokmâs, the medicine, with milk, with Soma, with the dripping (plant), with ghee, with honey, let them enjoy the ghee. Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣad iḍeḍita ājuhvānaḥ sarasvatīm indraṃ balena vardhayann ṛṣabheṇa gavendriyam aśvinendrāya bheṣajaṃ yavair karkandhubhir madhu lājair na māsaraṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat iḍā īḍitaḥ ājuhvānaḥ sarasvatīm indram balena vardhayan ṛṣabheṇa gavā indriyam aśvinā indrāya bheṣajam yavaiḥ karkandhubhiḥ madhu lājaiḥ na māsaram payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Idâ, the invoked, Sarasvatî, Indra, strengthening him with strength, with the bull, with the cow, with the strength of Indra. The medicine of the Asvins for Indra, with barley, with jujubes, with honey, with flour of parched jujubes, with milk, with Soma, with the dripping (plant), with ghee, with honey, let them enjoy the ghee. Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣad barhir ūrṇamradā bhiṣaṅ nāsatyā bhiṣajāśvināśvā śiśumatī bhiṣag dhenuḥ sarasvatī bhiṣag duha indrāya bheṣajaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //🔽hotā yakṣad duro diśaḥ kavaṣyo na vyacasvatīr aśvibhyāṃ na duro diśa indro na rodasī dughe duhe dhenuḥ sarasvaty aśvinendrāya bheṣajam śukraṃ na jyotir indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat barhiḥ ūrṇamradā bhiṣaj nāsatyā bhiṣajā aśvinā aśvā śiśumatī bhiṣaj dhenuḥ sarasvatī bhiṣaj duhe indrāya bheṣajam payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja  hotā yakṣat duraḥ diśaḥ kavaṣyaḥ na vyacasvatīḥ aśvibhyām na duraḥ diśaḥ indraḥ na rodasī dughe duhe dhenuḥ sarasvatī aśvinā indrāya bheṣajam śukram na jyotiḥ indriyam payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the strew, soft as wool, the two Nâsatyas, the physicians, the two Asvins, the physicians, the cow, the physician, bearing a calf, Sarasvatî, the physician, milks medicine for Indra, the milk. Let Soma, the trickling, ghee, and honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.🔽Let the Hotar worship the quarters, the regions, the spacious ones, like the two Asvins, the regions. Indra, like the two worlds, milks. The cow milks medicine for Indra and the Asvins. Let the bright light, the power, the milk of Sarasvatî, Soma, the trickling, ghee, and honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣat supeśasoṣe naktaṃ divāśvinā samañjati sarasvatyā tviṣim indre na bheṣajam śyeno na rajasā hṛdā śriyā na māsaraṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat supeśasā uṣe naktam divā aśvinā samañjati sarasvatyā tviṣim indre na bheṣajam śyenaḥ na rajasā hṛdā śriyā na māsaram payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the two, the beautiful, Night and Dawn, the two Asvins. Sarasvatî unites the radiance with Indra, the medicine. Like a hawk with the wind, with the heart, with glory, the two months, the milk. Let Soma, the trickling, ghee, and honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣad daivyā hotārā bhiṣajāśvinendraṃ na jāgṛvi divā naktaṃ na bheṣajaiḥ śūṣam sarasvatī bhiṣak sīsena duha indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //🔽hotā yakṣat tisro devīr na bheṣajaṃ trayastridhātavo 'paso rūpam indre hiraṇyayam aśvineḍā na bhāratī vācā sarasvatī maha indrāya duha indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā aśvinā indram na jāgṛvi divā naktam na bheṣajaiḥ śūṣam sarasvatī bhiṣak sīsena duhe indriyam payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja  hotā yakṣat tisraḥ devīḥ na bheṣajam trayaḥ tri dhātavaḥ pasaḥ rūpam indre hiraṇyayam aśvinā iḍā na bhāratī vācā sarasvatī mahe indrāya duhe indriyam payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the two divine Hotars, the physicians, Asvins, Indra with the watchful (ones), by day and by night, with medicines, with strength. Sarasvatî, the physician, milks with her horn the sap of strength. Let the Soma, the pourer, the ghee, the honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, sacrifice.🔽Let the Hotar worship the three goddesses as a medicine, the three with three constituents, the thoughts, gold in Indra, the two Asvins, the Ida, Sarasvatî as speech, the great one. He milks the sap of strength for Indra. Let the Soma, the pourer, the ghee, the honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, sacrifice.

original: hotā yakṣat surerasam ṛṣabhaṃ naryāpasaṃ tvaṣṭāram indram aśvinā bheṣajaṃ na sarasvatīm ojo na hūtir indriyaṃ vṛko na rabhaso bhiṣag yaśaḥ surayā bheṣajam śriyā na māsaraṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat surerasam ṛṣabham narya apasam tvaṣṭāram indram aśvinā bheṣajam na sarasvatīm ojaḥ na hūtiḥ indriyam vṛkaḥ na rabhasaḥ bhiṣaj yaśaḥ surayā bheṣajam śriyā na māsaram payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Tvastr, the bull, the companion of men, the good essence, Indra, the Asvins, Sarasvatî as a medicine, the shout as strength, the sap, the wolf as a swift physician, glory as a medicine with the Surâ, the sap as the monthly portion with prosperity. Let the Soma, the pourer, the ghee, the honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, sacrifice.

original: hotā yakṣad vanaspatim śamitāram śatakratuṃ bhīmaṃ na manyum rājānaṃ vyāghraṃ namasāśvinā bhāmam sarasvatī bhiṣag indrāya duha indriyaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat vanaspatim śamitāram śatakratum bhīmam na manyum rājānam vyāghram namasā aśvinā bhāmam sarasvatī bhiṣaj indrāya duhe indriyam payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the Lord of the forest, the shaper, the hundred-powered, the terrible wrath, the king, the tiger, the Asvins with homage, the radiant one with Sarasvatî. The physician milks power and strength for Indra. Let the Soma, the melted butter, the honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer it.

original: hotā yakṣad agnim svāhājyasya stokānām svāhā medasāṃ pṛthak svāhā chāgam aśvibhyām svāhā meṣam sarasvatyai svāha ṛṣabham indrāya simhāya sahasa indriyam svāhāgniṃ na bheṣajam svāhā somam indriyam svāhendram sutrāmāṇam savitāraṃ varuṇaṃ bhiṣajāṃ patim svāhā vanaspatiṃ priyaṃ pātho na bheṣajam svāhā devā ājyapā juṣāṇo agnir bheṣajaṃ payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtaṃ madhu vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat agnim svāhā ājyasya stokānām svāhā medasām pṛthak svāhā chāgam aśvibhyām svāhā meṣam sarasvatyai svāhā ṛṣabham indrāya simhāya sahase indriyam svāhā agnim na bheṣajam svāhā somam indriyam svāhā indram su trāmāṇam savitāram varuṇam bhiṣajām patim svāhā vanaspatim priyam pāthaḥ na bheṣajam svāhā devāḥ ājya pāḥ juṣāṇaḥ agniḥ bheṣajam payaḥ somaḥ parisrutā ghṛtam madhu vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Agni, the drops of ghee, the portions of fat separately, the he-goat for the Asvins, the ram for Sarasvatî, the bull for Indra, the lion for strength, a thousand times. Hail to Agni as a remedy, hail to Soma as strength, hail to Indra as the good protector, to Savitar, to Varuna, the lord of physicians, hail to the lord of the forest as a dear remedy. Hail to the gods who drink ghee. May Agni, the remedy, the milk, the Soma, the melted butter, the honey enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer it.

original: hotā yakṣad aśvinau chāgasya vapāyā medaso juṣetām havir hotar yaja / hotā yakṣat sarasvatīṃ meṣasya vapāyā medaso juṣatām havir hotar yaja / hotā yakṣad indram ṛṣabhasya vapāyā medaso juṣatām havir hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat aśvinau chāgasya vapāyāḥ medasaḥ juṣetām haviḥ hotar yaja    hotā yakṣat sarasvatīm meṣasya vapāyāḥ medasaḥ juṣatām haviḥ hotar yaja    hotā yakṣat indram ṛṣabhasya vapāyāḥ medasaḥ juṣatām haviḥ hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the Asvins. Let them enjoy the fat of the he-goat's omentum. Offer the oblation, O Hotar, worship. Let the Hotar worship Sarasvatî. Let her enjoy the fat of the ram's omentum. Offer the oblation, O Hotar, worship. Let the Hotar worship Indra. Let him enjoy the fat of the bull's omentum. Offer the oblation, O Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣad aśvinau sarasvatīm indram sutrāmāṇam ime somāḥ surāmāṇaś chāgair na meṣair ṛṣabhaiḥ sutāḥ śaṣpair ba tokmabhir lājair mahasvanto madā māsareṇa pariṣkṛtāḥ śukrāḥ payasvanto 'mṛtāḥ prasthitā vo madhuścutas tān aśvinā sarasvatīndraḥ sutrāmā vṛtrahā juṣantām somyaṃ madhu pibantu vyantu hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat aśvinau sarasvatīm indram su trāmāṇam ime somāḥ su rāmāṇaḥ chāgaiḥ na meṣaiḥ ṛṣabhaiḥ sutāḥ śaṣpaiḥ tokmabhiḥ lājaiḥ mahasvantaḥ madāḥ māsareṇa pariṣkṛtāḥ śukrāḥ payasvantaḥ mṛtāḥ prasthitāḥ vaḥ madhuścutaḥ tān aśvinā sarasvatī indraḥ su trāmā vṛtrahā juṣantām somyam madhu pibantu vyantu hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the Asvins, Sarasvatî, Indra, the good protector. These Soma-juices, the gladdening, have been pressed for you with goats, with rams, with bulls, with fresh grass, with young plants, with parched corn, with the newest (juice), purified with the newest (strainers), bright, rich in milk, immortal, ready to start, dropping honey. Let the Asvins, Sarasvatî, Indra, the good protector, the Vr̥itra-slayer, enjoy them. Let them delight in the Soma-juice. Let them drink. Let them enjoy themselves, O Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣad aśvinau chāgasya haviṣa āttām adya madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyā gṛbho ghastāṃ nūnaṃ ghāseajrāṇāṃ yavasaprathamānām sumatkṣarāṇām śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānāṃ pīvopavasānāṃ pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmata utsādato 'ṅgādaṅgād avattānāṃ karata evāśvinā juṣetām havir hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat aśvinau chāgasya haviṣaḥ āttām adya madhyataḥ medaḥ udbhṛtam purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyāḥ gṛbhaḥ nūnam ghāseajrāṇām yavasa prathamānām sumatkṣarāṇām śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānām pīvopavasānām pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmataḥ utsādataḥ ṅgāt aṅgāt avattānām karataḥ eva aśvinā juṣetām haviḥ hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the Asvins, the two divine physicians, with the oblation of the he-goat. Let them today, from the middle, take out the fat, before hatreds, before the seizure of manliness. Let them eat of the grass-eaters, of those who first eat the grass, of those with good teeth, of those with a hundred Rudras, of those who have Agni in their belly, of those who have fat as their drink, of those from the side, of those from the hip, of those from the back, of those from the haunch, of those from the limb, of those from the part. Let the Asvins accept the oblation from the hand. O Hotar, offer the oblation.

original: hotā yakṣat sarasvatīṃ meṣasya haviṣa āvayad adya madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyā gṛbho ghasan nūnaṃ ghāseajrāṇāṃ yavasaprathamānām sumatkṣarāṇām śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānāṃ pīvopavasānāṃ pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmata utsādato 'ṅgādaṅgād avattānāṃ karad evam sarasvatī juṣatām havir hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat sarasvatīm meṣasya haviṣaḥ āvayat adya madhyataḥ medaḥ udbhṛtam purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyāḥ gṛbhaḥ ghasat nūnam ghāseajrāṇām yavasaprathamānām sumatkṣarāṇām śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānām pīvopavasānām pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmataḥ utsādataḥ ṅgāt aṅgāt avattānām karat evam sarasvatī juṣatām haviḥ hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Sarasvati, the divine goddess of speech, with the oblation of the ram. Let her today, from the middle, take out the fat, before hatreds, before the seizure of manliness. Let her eat of the grass-eaters, of those who first eat the grass, of those with good teeth, of those with a hundred Rudras, of those who have Agni in their belly, of those who have fat as their drink, of those from the side, of those from the hip, of those from the back, of those from the haunch, of those from the limb, of those from the part. Let Sarasvati accept the oblation from the hand. O Hotar, offer the oblation.

original: hotā yakṣad indram ṛṣabhasya haviṣa āvayad adya madhyato meda udbhṛtaṃ purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyā gṛbho ghasan nūnaṃ ghāseajrāṇāṃ yavasaprathamānām sumatkṣarāṇām śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānāṃ pīvopavasānāṃ pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmata utsādato 'ṅgādaṅgād avattānāṃ karad evam indro juṣatām havir hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat indram ṛṣabhasya haviṣaḥ āvayat adya madhyataḥ medaḥ udbhṛtam purā dveṣobhyaḥ purā pauruṣeyyāḥ gṛbhaḥ ghasat nūnam ghāseajrāṇām yavasaprathamānām sumatkṣarāṇām śatarudriyāṇām agniṣvāttānām pīvopavasānām pārśvataḥ śroṇitaḥ śitāmataḥ utsādataḥ ṅgāt aṅgāt avattānām karat evam indraḥ juṣatām haviḥ hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Indra with the oblation of the bull, the fat that hath been taken out to-day from the middle, before the enmities, before the grasp of man. Devouring, now, of those that have no grass to eat, that have the first share of the grass, that are well-fed, that have a hundred Rudras, that have Agni in their bowels, that have fat and marrow, from the sides, from the loins, from the flesh, from every limb, let him cut out and give. Thus let Indra rejoice in the oblation. Hotar, offer the sacrifice.

original: hotā yakṣad vanaspatim abhi hi piṣṭatamayā rabhiṣṭayā raśanayādhita / yatrāśvinoś chāgasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra sarasvatyā meṣasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatrendrasya ṛṣabhasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatrāgneḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra somasya priyā dhāmāni yatrendrasya sutrāmṇaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra savituḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra varuṇasya priyā dhāmāni yatra vanaspateḥ priyā pāthāmsi yatra devānām ājyapānāṃ priyā dhāmāni yatrāgner hotuḥ priyā dhāmāni tatraitān prastutyevopastutyevopāva srakṣad rabhīyasa iva kṛtvī karad evaṃ devo vanaspatir juṣatām havir hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat vanaspatim abhi hi piṣṭatamayā rabhiṣṭayā raśanayā ādhita  / yatra aśvinoḥ chāgasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra sarasvatyāḥ meṣasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra indrasya ṛṣabhasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra agneḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra somasya priyā dhāmāni yatra indrasya sutrāmṇaḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra savituḥ priyā dhāmāni yatra varuṇasya priyā dhāmāni yatra vanaspateḥ priyā pāthāmsi yatra devānām ājya pānām priy
translated: Let the Hotar worship Vanaspatî: for he is pressed with the most pressing, with the most rapid harnessing. Where are the dear abodes of the Asvins' offering of a he-goat, where are the dear abodes of Sarasvatî's offering of a ram, where are the dear abodes of Indra's offering of a bull, where are the dear abodes of Agni, where the dear abodes of Soma, where the dear abodes of Indra, the protector, where the dear abodes of Savitar, where the dear abodes of Varuna, where the dear abodes of Vanaspatî, where the dear abodes of the Gods who drink the oily portion, where the dear abodes of Agni the Hotar. There let him stretch them forth, as it were, and praise them, and let him make them grow, as it were, with the most rapid, as it were, with the most pressing. So may the God Vanaspatî accept the offering. Hotar, offer the oblation.

original: hotā yakṣad agnim sviṣṭakṛtam ayāḍ agnir aśvinoś chāgasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāṭ sarasvatyā meṣasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ indrasya ṛṣabhasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ agneḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāṭ somasya priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ indrasya sutrāmṇaḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāṭ savituḥ priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ varuṇasya priyā dhāmāny ayāḍ vanaspateḥ priyā pāthāmsy ayāḍ devānām ājyapānāṃ priyā dhāmāni yakṣad agner hotuḥ priyā dhāmāni yakṣat svaṃ mahimānam ā yajatām ejyā iṣaḥ kṛṇotu so adhvarā jātavedā juṣatām havir hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat agnim sviṣṭakṛtam ayāṭ agniḥ aśvinoḥ chāgasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ sarasvatyāḥ meṣasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ indrasya ṛṣabhasya haviṣaḥ priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ agneḥ priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ somasya priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ indrasya sutrāmṇaḥ priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ savituḥ priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ varuṇasya priyā dhāmāni ayāṭ vanaspateḥ priyā pāthāmsi ayāṭ devānām ājya pānām priyā dhāmāni yakṣat
translated: Let the Hotar worship Agni Svishtakrit. Agni has gone to the dear abodes of the Asvins, of the offering of the goat. He has gone to the dear abodes of Sarasvati, of the offering of the ram. He has gone to the dear abodes of Indra, of the offering of the bull. He has gone to the dear abodes of Agni. He has gone to the dear abodes of Soma. He has gone to the dear abodes of Indra Sūtraman. He has gone to the dear abodes of Savitar. He has gone to the dear abodes of Varuna. He has gone to the dear paths of Vanaspati. Let him worship the dear abodes of the gods who drink the oily portion. Let him worship the dear abodes of Agni the Hotar. Let him worship his own greatness. Let the moving food make ready for the worshippers. Let the all-knower enjoy the offering. O Hotar, worship.

original: devaṃ barhiḥ sarasvatī sudevam indre aśvinā / tejo na cakṣur akṣyor barhiṣā dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devam barhiḥ sarasvatī su devam indre aśvinā   tejaḥ na cakṣuḥ akṣyoḥ barhiṣā dadhuḥ indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: The divine strew, Sarasvatī, well-worshipped, the Asvins in Indra, have placed in the eyes the eye, the radiance, the power, in the strew. Let them enjoy of the Vasus, of the Vasus' offering. Sacrifice.

original: devīr dvāro aśvinā bhiṣajendre sarasvatī / prāṇaṃ na vīryaṃ nasi dvāro dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ aśvinā bhiṣajā indre sarasvatī   prāṇam na vīryam nasi dvāraḥ dadhuḥ indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: The Goddesses, the Doors, the Asvins, the Physicians, to Indra, Sarasvatî,🔽Have set in the nose the breath as strength, the power, the wealth. Let them enjoy the sacrifice, etc.🔽The Goddesses, Dawn and Night, to Indra, the Asvins, the Physicians, Sarasvatî,

original: devī uṣāsāv aśvinā sutrāmendre sarasvatī / balaṃ na vācam āsya uṣābhyāṃ dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //🔽devī joṣṭrī sarasvaty aśvinendram avardhayan / śrotraṃ na karṇayor yaśo joṣṭrībhāṃ dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devī uṣā asau aśvinā sutrāmā indre sarasvatī   balam na vācam āsye uṣābhyām dadhuḥ indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja  devī joṣṭrī sarasvatī aśvinā indram avardhayan   śrotram na karṇayoḥ yaśaḥ joṣṭrī ibhām dadhuḥ indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: Have set in the mouth the voice as strength, the power, the wealth. Let them enjoy the sacrifice, etc.🔽The Goddesses, the two nourishing ones, Sarasvatî, and the Asvins, have strengthened Indra,🔽The two nourishing ones have set in the ears the hearing as glory, the power, the wealth. Let them enjoy the sacrifice, etc.

original: devī ūrjāhutī dughe sudughendre sarasvaty aśvinā bhiṣajāvataḥ / śukraṃ na jyoti stanayor āhutī dhatta indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devī ūrjā āhutī dughe sudughā indre sarasvatī aśvinā bhiṣajāvataḥ    śukram na jyotiḥ stanayoḥ āhutī dhatte indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: The Goddesses, the two libations of strength, the two well-milking ones, to Indra, Sarasvatî, and the Asvins, the Physicians,🔽Have set in the two breasts the bright light as the libations, the power, the wealth. Let them enjoy the sacrifice, etc.🔽The Gods, the Physicians of the Gods, the two Hotars, the Asvins, to Indra, Sarasvatî,

original: devā devānāṃ bhiṣajā hotārāv indram aśvinā / vaṣaṭkāraiḥ sarasvatī tviṣiṃ na hṛdaye matim hotṛbhyāṃ dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devā devānām bhiṣajā hotārau indram aśvinā    vaṣaṭkāraiḥ sarasvatī tviṣim na hṛdaye matim hotṛbhyām dadhuḥ indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: With the Vasat calls have set in the heart the thought as radiance, the power, the wealth. Let them enjoy the sacrifice, etc.

original: devīs tisras tisro devīr aśvineḍā sarasvatī / śūṣaṃ na madhye nābhyām indrāya dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //🔽deva indro narāśamsas trivarūthaḥ sarasvatyāśvibhyām īyate rathaḥ / reto na rūpam amṛtaṃ janitram indrāya tvaṣṭā dadhad indriyāṇi vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //🔽devo devair vanaspatir hiraṇyaparṇo aśvibhyām sarasvatyā supippala indrāya pacyate madhu / ojo na jūtir ṛṣabho na bhāmaṃ vanaspatir no dadhad indriyāṇi vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devīḥ tisraḥ tisraḥ devīḥ aśvinā iḍā sarasvatī   śūṣam na madhye nābhyām indrāya dadhuḥ indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja  devaḥ indraḥ narāśamsaḥ tri varūthaḥ sarasvatyā aśvibhyām īyate rathaḥ    retaḥ na rūpam amṛtam janitram indrāya tvaṣṭā dadhat indriyāṇi vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja  devaḥ devaiḥ vanaspatiḥ hiraṇya parṇaḥ aśvibhyām sarasvatyā su pippalaḥ indrāya pacyate madhu    ojaḥ na jūtiḥ ṛṣabhaḥ na bhāmam vanaspatiḥ naḥ dadhat indriyāṇi vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: The three goddesses, the three goddesses, the two Asvins, the Ida, Sarasvatî, have placed in the middle, in the navel, strength, as it were, as power for Indra. Do they prosper for him who offers, for the sake of wealth, for the sake of the oblation? Let them sacrifice.

original: devaṃ barhir vāritīnām adhvare stīrṇam aśvibhyām ūrṇamradāḥ sarasvatyā syonam indra te sadaḥ / īśāyai manyum rājānaṃ barhiṣā dadhur indriyaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devam barhiḥ vāritīnām adhvare stīrṇam aśvibhyām ūrṇamradāḥ sarasvatyā syonam indra te sadaḥ    īśāyai manyum rājānam barhiṣā dadhuḥ indriyam vasuvane vasudheyasya  vyantu yaja
translated: The god Indra, the man-desiring, the three-protected, the chariot is carried by the Asvins and Sarasvatî. Like seed, like form, like immortality, like a birthplace, Tvashtri, giving to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to Indra power, to

original: devo agniḥ sviṣṭakṛd devān yakṣad yathāyatham hotārāv indram aśvinā vācā vācam sarasvatīm agnim somam sviṣṭakṛt sv"ṣṭa indraḥ sutrāmā savitā varuṇo bhiṣag iṣṭo devovanaspatiḥ sv"ṣṭā devā ājyapāḥ sv"ṣṭo agnir agninā hotā hotre sviṣṭakṛd yaśo na dadhad indriyam ūrjam apacitim svadhāṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devaḥ agniḥ sviṣṭakṛt devān yakṣat yathāyatham hotārau indram aśvinā vācā vācam sarasvatīm agnim somam sviṣṭakṛt svṣṭaḥ indraḥ sutrāmā savitā varuṇaḥ bhiṣaj iṣṭaḥ devovanaspatiḥ svṣṭāḥ devāḥ ājya pāḥ svṣṭaḥ agniḥ agninā hotā hotre sviṣṭakṛt yaśaḥ na dadhat indriyam ūrjam apacitim svadhām vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: Let the god Agni, the well-offerer, worship the gods each according to his rank, the two Hotars, Indra, the two Asvins, speech with speech, Sarasvatî, Agni, Soma, the well-offerer, Indra, the good protector, Savitar, Varuna the physician, the worshipped god Vanaspatî, the worshipped gods who drink the oily portion of the sacrifice, the worshipped Agni with Agni, the Hotar with the well-offerer, bestowing glory, power, strength, satisfaction, wealth. May they enjoy the oblation, the sacrifice, the offering of wealth, for the sake of wealth. Worship!

original: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇītāyaṃ yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśān badhnann aśvibhyāṃ chāgam sarasvatyai meṣam indrāya ṛṣabham sunvann aśvibhyām sarasvatyā indrāya sutrāmṇe surāsomān //
analyzed: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇīta ayam yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśān badhnan aśvibhyām chāgam sarasvatyai meṣam indrāya ṛṣabham sunvan aśvibhyām sarasvatyai indrāya sutrāmṇe surā somān
translated: This sacrificer has to-day chosen Agni as Hotar, cooking the cooked viands, cooking the sacrificial cakes, binding the he-goat to the two Asvins, the ram to Sarasvatî, the bull to Indra, pressing the Surâ and Soma for the two Asvins, Sarasvatî, Indra the good protector.

original: sūpasthā adya devo vanaspatir abhavad aśvibhyāṃ chāgena sarasvatyai meṣeṇendrāya ṛṣabheṇākṣams tān medastaḥ prati pacatāgṛbhīṣatāvīvṛdhanta puroḍāśair apur aśvinā sarasvatīndraḥ sutrāmā surāsomān //
analyzed: su upasthāḥ adya devaḥ vanaspatiḥ abhavat aśvibhyām chāgena sarasvatyai meṣeṇa indrāya ṛṣabheṇa akṣam tān medastaḥ prati pacata agṛbhīṣata avīvṛdhanta puroḍāśaiḥ apuḥ aśvinā sarasvatī indraḥ sutrāmā surā somān
translated: Well-established is the god Vanaspatî to-day, with the he-goat for the Asvins, with the ram for Sarasvatî, with the bull for Indra. I have seized them as they are roasted, well-roasted, from the fat. They have waxed great with the sacrificial cakes. The Asvins, Sarasvatî, Indra, the good protector, have obtained the Soma and the Surâ.

original: tvām adya ṛṣa ārṣeya ṛṣīṇāṃ napād avṛṇītāyṃ yajamāno bahubhya ā saṃgatebhya eṣa me deveṣu vasu vāryāyakṣyata iti tā yā devā deva dānāny adus tāny asmā ā ca śāssvā ca gurasveṣitaś ca hotar asi bhadravācyāya preṣito mānuṣaḥ sūktavākāya sūktā brūhi //
analyzed: tvām adya ṛṣaḥ ārṣeyaḥ ṛṣīṇām napāt avṛṇīta ayam yajamānaḥ bahubhyaḥ ā saṃgatebhyaḥ eṣa me deveṣu vasu vārya ayakṣyata iti tāḥ yāḥ devāḥ deva dānāni aduḥ tāni asmai ā ca śāssva ā ca gurasva iṣitaḥ ca hotar asi bhadra vācyāya preṣitaḥ mānuṣaḥ sūktavākāya sūktāḥ brūhi
translated: Thee to-day, O Rṣi, descendant of Rṣis, this sacrificer has chosen, as the Rṣis' foot, from among many assembled, thinking, 'This will win me good things among the gods.' Those gifts which the gods have granted, teach thou to me, and instruct me, and be thou a leader. Thou art the appointed Hotri for the utterance of good things, the human one for the utterance of hymns. Speak the hymns.

original: tejo 'si śukram amṛtam āyuṣpā āyur me pāhi / devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade //
analyzed: tejaḥ si śukram amṛtam āyuṣpāḥ āyuḥ me pāhi    devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām    ā dade
translated: Thou art splendour, thou art brightness, thou art immortality, thou art life-preserving. Preserve my life. I take thee in the impulse of the god Savitar, with the arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan.

original: imām agṛbhṇan raśanām ṛtasya pūrva āyuṣi vidatheṣu kavyā / sā no asmint suta ā babhūva ṛtasya sāmant saramārapantī //
analyzed: imām agṛbhṇan raśanām ṛtasya pūrve āyuṣi vidatheṣu kavyā    sā naḥ asmin sute ā babhūva ṛtasya sāman saramā ārapantī
translated: They have grasped this bond of order, in the ancient life, in the assemblies, the wise one. It has become for us here at this pressing, the boundary of the sacrifice, carrying the hymn.

original: abhidhā asi bhuvanam asi yantāsi dhartā / sa tvam agniṃ vaiśvānaram saprathasaṃ gaccha svāhākṛtaḥ //
analyzed: abhidhā asi bhuvanam asi yantā asi dhartā    sa tvam agnim vaiśvānaram saprathasam gaccha svāhākṛtaḥ
translated: Thou art the utterer, thou art the world, thou art the controller, thou art the supporter. Go thou to Agni Vaisvânara, to the wide expanse, offered with Svâhâ.

original: svagā tvā devebhyaḥ prajāpataye brahmann aśvaṃ bhantsyāmi devebhyaḥ prajāpataye tena rādhyāsam / taṃ badhāna devebhyaḥ prajāpataye tena rādhnuhi //🔽prajāpataye tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / indrāgnibhyāṃ tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / vāyave tvā juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / viśvebhyas tvā devebhyo juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / sarvebhyas tvā devebhyo juṣṭaṃ prokṣāmi / yo arvantaṃ jighāmsati tam abhy amīti varuṇaḥ paro martaḥ paraḥ śvā //
analyzed: svagā tvā devebhyaḥ prajāpataye brahman aśvam bhantsyāmi devebhyaḥ prajāpataye tena rādhyāsam   tam badhāna devebhyaḥ prajāpataye tena rādhnuhi  prajāpataye tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi   indra agnibhyām tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi   vāyave tvā juṣṭam prokṣāmi   viśvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ juṣṭam prokṣāmi    sarvebhyaḥ tvā devebhyaḥ juṣṭam prokṣāmi   yaḥ arvantam jighāmsati tam abhi amī iti varuṇaḥ paraḥ martaḥ paraḥ śvā
translated: To the gods thee, to Prajâpati. O Brahman, I will lead the horse; by him may I prosper. Bind him to the gods, to Prajâpati; by him prosper.

original: agnaye svāhā / somāya svāhā / apāṃ modāya svāhā / savitre svāhā / vāyave svāhā / viṣṇave svāhā / indrāya svāhā / bṛhaspataye svāhā / mitrāya svāhā / varuṇāya svāhā //
analyzed: agnaye svāhā somāya svāhā   apām modāya svāhā savitre svāhā vāyave svāhā  viṣṇave svāhā indrāya svāhā  bṛhaspataye svāhā   mitrāya svāhā   varuṇāya svāhā

I sprinkle thee acceptable to all the gods. Him whom the horse looks at with his left eye, him he looks upon as food. Him whom he looks at with his right eye, him he looks upon as a foe. original: hiṅkārāya svāhā hiṅkṛtāya svāhā krandate svāhāvakrandāya svāhā prothate svāhā praprothāya svāhā gandhāya svāhā ghrātāya svāhā niviṣṭāya svāhopaviṣṭāya svāhā saṃditāya svāhā valgate svāhāsīnāya svāhā śayānāya svāhā svapate svāhā jāgrate svāhā kūjate svāhā prabuddhāya svāhā vijṛmbhamāṇāya svāhā vicṛtāya svāhā samhānāya svāhopasthitāya svāhāyanāya svāhā prāyaṇāya svāhā //
analyzed: hiṅkārāya svāhā hiṅkṛtāya svāhā krandate svāhā avakrandāya svāhā prothate svāhā praprothāya svāhā gandhāya svāhā ghrātāya svāhā niviṣṭāya svāhā upaviṣṭāya svāhā saṃditāya svāhā valgate svāhā āsīnāya svāhā śayānāya svāhā svapate svāhā jāgrate svāhā kūjate svāhā prabuddhāya svāhā vijṛmbhamāṇāya svāhā vicṛtāya svāhā samhānāya svāhā upasthitāya svāhā ayanāya svāhā prāyaṇāya svāhā
