translated: May Pûshan, who hath all things that may be bought, be for our increase, our protector, guard, and unfailing help to give us bliss.

original: svasti na indro vṛddhaśravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśvavedāḥ / svasti nas tārkṣyo ariṣṭanemiḥ svasti no bṛhaspatir dadhātu //
analyzed: svasti naḥ indraḥ vṛddha śravāḥ svasti naḥ pūṣā viśva vedāḥ   svasti naḥ tārkṣyaḥ ariṣṭa nemiḥ svasti naḥ bṛhaspatiḥ dadhātu
translated: May Indra, who hath waxen strong, be gracious unto us, may Pûshan, who hath all things that may be bought, be gracious unto us. May Târkshya, whose car-wheels move not, be gracious unto us. May Brihaspati vouchsafe us bliss and happiness.🔽The Maruts, whose steeds are dappled, whose mother is Pûshan, who are of glorious birth, who move in ordered course in sacrifices,

original: pṛṣadaśvā marutaḥ pṛśnimātaraḥ śubhaṃyāvāno vidatheṣu jagmayaḥ / agnijihvā manavaḥ sūracakṣaso viśve no devā avasā gamann iha //
analyzed: pṛṣat aśvāḥ marutaḥ pṛśni mātaraḥ śubhaṃyāvānaḥ vidatheṣu jagmayaḥ     agni jihvāḥ manavaḥ sūra cakṣasaḥ viśve naḥ devāḥ avasā gaman iha
translated: the sages, whose tongue is Agni, whose eye is the sun, may all the Gods come hither to our help.

original: bhadraṃ karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devā bhadraṃ paśyemākṣabhir yajatrāḥ / sthirair aṅgais tuṣṭuvāmsas tanūbhir vy aśemahi devahitaṃ yad āyuḥ //
analyzed: bhadram karṇebhiḥ śṛṇuyāma devāḥ bhadram paśyema akṣabhiḥ yajatrāḥ   sthiraiḥ aṅgaiḥ tuṣṭuvāmsaḥ tanūbhiḥ vi aśemahi deva hitam yat āyuḥ
translated: May we hear with our ears what is good, O ye Gods. May we see with our eyes what is good, O ye Holy Ones. With firm limbs and bodies may we glorify the life that is good and acceptable to the Gods.

original: śatam in nu śarado anti devā yatrā naś cakrā jarasaṃ tanūnām / putrāso yatra pitaro bhavanti mā no madhyā rīriṣatāyur gantoḥ //
analyzed: śatam id nu śaradaḥ anti devāḥ yatrā naḥ cakra jarasam tanūnām    putrāsaḥ yatra pitaraḥ bhavanti mā naḥ madhyā rīriṣata āyuḥ gantoḥ
translated: A hundred winters yet, O ye Gods, must we live, to the end that ye have appointed for our bodies. To the end that our sons may become fathers. Do not leave us in the middle of our life.

original: aditir dyaur aditir antarikṣam aditir mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ / viśve devā aditiḥ pañca janā aditir jātam aditir janitvam //
analyzed: aditiḥ dyauḥ aditiḥ antarikṣam aditiḥ mātā sa pitā sa putraḥ    viśve devāḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ aditiḥ jātam aditiḥ janitvam
translated: Heaven is Aditi, the atmosphere is Aditi, Aditi is the mother, the father, and the son. Aditi are all the Gods, the five peoples, Aditi is the born, Aditi is the generating.

original: mā no mitro varuṇo aryamāyur indra ṛbhukṣā marutaḥ pari khyan / yad vājino devajātasya sapteḥ pravakṣyāmo vidathe vīryāṇi //
analyzed: mā naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā āyuḥ indraḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ marutaḥ pari khyan   yat vājinaḥ deva jātasya sapteḥ pravakṣyāmaḥ vidathe vīryāṇi
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, Aryaman, Indra, Rbhukshan, the Maruts, O ye strong ones, spare our life, when we proclaim in the assembly the exploits of the God-born steed.

original: yan nirṇijā rekṇasā prāvṛtasya rātiṃ gṛbhītāṃ mukhato nayanti / suprāṅ ajo memyad viśvarūpa indrāpūṣṇoḥ priyam apy eti pāthaḥ //
analyzed: yat nirṇijā rekṇasā prāvṛtasya rātim gṛbhītām mukhataḥ nayanti    su prāṅ ajaḥ memyat viśva rūpaḥ indrāpūṣṇoḥ priyam api eti pāthaḥ
translated: When they lead forth the grasped gift of the steed, covered with the robe of fat, the sacrificial cake, the goat bleats forth with fair voice, and goes to the dear place of Indra and Pusan.

original: eṣa chāgaḥ puro aśvena vājinā pūṣṇo bhāgo nīyate viśvadevyaḥ / abhipriyaṃ yat puroḍāśam arvatā tvaṣṭed enam sauśravasāya jinvati //
analyzed: eṣa chāgaḥ puras aśvena vājinā pūṣṇaḥ bhāgaḥ nīyate viśvadevyaḥ    abhipriyam yat puroḍāśam arvatā tvaṣṭā id enam sauśravasāya jinvati
translated: This goat, O horse, is led forward as a share for Pûshan, who is worshipped by all the Gods. The cake which is dear to Tvashtar, when the horse is led forward, he quickens it for his glory.

original: yad dhaviṣyam ṛtuśo devayānaṃ trir mānuṣāḥ pary aśvaṃ nayanti / atrā pūṣṇaḥ prathamo bhāga eti yajñaṃ devebhyaḥ prativedayann ajaḥ //
analyzed: yat haviṣyam ṛtuśas deva yānam tris mānuṣāḥ pari aśvam nayanti   / atrā pūṣṇaḥ prathamaḥ bhāgaḥ eti yajñam devebhyaḥ prativedayan ajaḥ
translated: When thrice the men lead round the horse according to the season, as an offering to the Gods, Then the first share of Pûshan goes to him, the goat who announces the sacrifice to the Gods.🔽The Hotri, the Adhvaryu, the Avayya, the kindler of the sacred fire, the holder of the stone, and the priest who praises well,

original: hotādhvaryur āvayā agnimindho grāvagrābha uta śamstā suvipraḥ / tena yajñena svaraṃkṛtena sv"ṣṭena vakṣaṇā ā pṛṇadhvam //
analyzed: hotā adhvaryuḥ āvayāḥ agnimindhaḥ grāvagrābhaḥ uta śamstā su vipraḥ tena yajñena su araṃkṛtena su ṣṭena vakṣaṇāḥ ā pṛṇadhvam
translated: With that sacrifice, well-performed, well-ordered, fill ye the regions with your own selves.🔽Those who cut the post for the stake, those who carry the stake, those who carve the top for the stake of the horse,

original: yūpavraskā uta ye yūpavāhāś caṣālaṃ ye aśvayūpāya takṣati / ye cārvate pacanam sambharanty uto teṣām abhigūrtir na invatu //
analyzed: yūpavraskāḥ uta ye yūpa vāhāḥ caṣālam ye aśva yūpāya takṣati    ye ca arvate pacanam sambharanti uta u teṣām abhigūrtiḥ naḥ invatu
translated: And those who prepare the cooking for the bay horse, may their approval also impel us.

original: upa prāgāt suman me 'dhāyi manma devānām āśā upa vītapṛṣṭhaḥ / anv enaṃ viprā ṛṣayo madanti devānāṃ puṣṭe cakṛmā subandhum //
analyzed: upa prāgāt sumat me dhāyi manma devānām āśāḥ upa vīta pṛṣṭhaḥ   anu enam viprāḥ ṛṣayaḥ madanti devānām puṣṭe cakṛma su bandhum
translated: He hath come nigh: my hymn hath been accepted: the wish of Gods hath been fulfilled by me. The sages, the Rishis, rejoice in him. We have made a good friend in the Gods' increase.

original: yad vājino dāma saṃdānam arvato yā śīrṣaṇyā raśanā rajjur asya / yad vā ghāsya prabhṛtam āsye tṛṇam sarvā tā te api deveṣv astu //
analyzed: yat vājinaḥ dāma saṃdānam arvataḥ yā śīrṣaṇyā raśanā rajjuḥ asya    yat vā gha asya prabhṛtam āsye tṛṇam sarvā tā te api deveṣu astu
translated: The bridle of the horse, the bit in the mouth, the rope that is tied to his head, the rein,🔽Or the grass that is put in his mouth for food, may all that be for thee among the gods.🔽The horse's blood that is in the flies, or what is sticking to the knife and the hatchet,

original: yad aśvasya kraviṣo makṣikāśa yad vā svarau svadhitau riptam asti / yad dhastayoḥ śamitur yan nakheṣu sarvā tā te api deveṣv astu //
analyzed: yat aśvasya kraviṣaḥ makṣikā āśa yat vā svarau svadhitau riptam asti    yat hastayoḥ śamituḥ yat nakheṣu sarvā tā te api deveṣu astu
translated: Or in the hands of the slayer, or in his nails, may all that be for thee among the gods.🔽What is cut out from the belly, what is smelt of the raw flesh,

original: yad ūvadhyam udarasyāpavāti ya āmasya kraviṣo gandho asti / sukṛtā tac chamitāraḥ kṛṇvantūta medham śṛtapākaṃ pacantu //
analyzed: yat ūvadhyam udarasya apavāti yaḥ āmasya kraviṣaḥ gandhaḥ asti   / su kṛtā tat śamitāraḥ kṛṇvantu uta medham śṛta pākam pacantu
translated: That the skilful butchers make good, and let them cook the oblation with the boiled meat.🔽What of thy body, when it is cooked by the fire, runs down from the spit when thou art impaled,

original: yat te gātrād agninā pacyamānād abhi śūlaṃ nihatasyāvadhāvati / mā tad bhūmyām ā śriṣan mā tṛṇeṣu devebhyas tad uśadbhyo rātam astu //
analyzed: yat te gātrāt agninā pacyamānāt abhi śūlam nihatasya avadhāvati   / mā tat bhūmyām ā śriṣat mā tṛṇeṣu devebhyaḥ tat uśadbhyaḥ rātam astu  /
translated: Let it not sink into the ground, let it not go into the grass, let that be offered to the joyous gods.🔽They who look on the horse when it is cooked, and say to it, 'Carry it away, it is sweet,'

original: ye vājinaṃ paripaśyanti pakvaṃ ya īm āhuḥ surabhir nir hareti / ye cārvato māmsabhikṣām upāsata uto teṣām abhigūrtir na invatu //
analyzed: ye vājinam paripaśyanti pakvam ye īm āhuḥ surabhiḥ niḥ hara iti    ye ca arvataḥ māmsabhikṣām upāsate uta u teṣām abhigūrtiḥ naḥ invatu
translated: And they who wait on the flesh-food of the horse, may their approval also speed it on.

original: yan nīkṣaṇaṃ māmspacanyā ukhāyā yā pātrāṇi yūṣṇa āsecanāni / ūṣmaṇyāpidhānā carūṇām aṅkāḥ sūnāḥ pari bhūṣanty aśvam //🔽mā tvāgnir dhvanayīd dhūmagandhir mokhā bhrājanty abhi vikta jaghriḥ / iṣṭaṃ vītam abhigūrtaṃ vaṣaṭkṛtaṃ taṃ devāsaḥ prati gṛbhṇanty aśvam //
analyzed: yat nīkṣaṇam māmspacanyāḥ ukhāyāḥ yā pātrāṇi yūṣṇaḥ āsecanāni   / ūṣmaṇyā apidhānā carūṇām aṅkāḥ sūnāḥ pari bhūṣanti aśvam  mā tvā agniḥ dhvanayīt dhūma gandhiḥ mā ukhā bhrājantī abhi vikta jaghriḥ    iṣṭam vītam abhigūrtam vaṣaṭkṛtam tam devāsaḥ prati gṛbhṇanti aśvam
translated: The heart, the lungs, the liver, and the spleen, the stomach, and the intestines, and the entrails,🔽The caul that wraps the child, the bowels, the flesh, the vessels of the flesh, the kidneys, and the lights,🔽Let not the fire, smoky, crackling, blaze thee, nor the bright pan with its flame consume thee. Offered, enjoyed, extolled, consecrated, the Gods receive the horse as 'twere a guest.🔽

original: nikramaṇaṃ niṣadanaṃ vivartanaṃ yac ca paḍvīśam arvataḥ / yac ca papau yac ca ghāsiṃ jaghāsa sarvā tā te api deveṣv astu //🔽yad aśvāya vāsa upastṛṇanty adhīvāsaṃ yā hiraṇyāny asmai / saṃdānam arvantaṃ paḍvīśaṃ priyā deveṣv ā yāmayanti //🔽yat te sāde mahasā śūkṛtasya pārṣṇyā vā kaśayā vā tutoda / sruceva tā haviṣo adhvareṣu sarvā tā te brahmaṇā sūdayāmi //
analyzed: nikramaṇam niṣadanam vivartanam yat ca paḍvīśam arvataḥ   yat ca papau yat ca ghāsim jaghāsa sarvā tā te api deveṣu astu 🔽yat aśvāya vāsaḥ upastṛṇanti adhīvāsam yā hiraṇyāni asmai saṃdānam arvantam paḍvīśam priyā deveṣu ā yāmayanti 🔽yat te sāde mahasā śūkṛtasya pārṣṇyā vā kaśayā vā tutoda   srucā iva tā haviṣaḥ adhvareṣu sarvā tā te brahmaṇā sūdayāmi
translated: The heart, the lungs, the liver, the spleen, the entrails, the stomach, the bowels, the throat, the head, the neck, the back, the shoulders, the fore-feet, the hooves, the tail, the belly, the sides, the ribs, the chest, the flanks, the buttocks, the hams, the knees, the fetlocks, the hooves, the hair, the skin, the flesh, the bones, the marrow, the sinews, the veins, the blood, the breath, the heat, the voice, the sight, the hearing, the mind, the soul, the body, the hair, the beard, the nails, the teeth, the excrement, the urine, the semen, the womb, the foetus, the milk, the curd, the butter, the whey, the sour milk, the dung, the urine, the flesh, the blood, the marrow, the fat, the suet, the bones, the hair, the skin, the flesh, the sinews, the veins, the breath, the heat, the voice, the sight, the hearing, the mind, the soul, the body, the hair, the beard, the nails, the teeth, the excrement, the urine, the semen, the womb, the foetus, the milk, the curd, the butter, the whey, the sour milk, the dung, the urine, the flesh, the blood, the marrow, the fat, the bones, the hair, the skin, the flesh, the sinews, the veins, the breath, the heat, the voice, the sight, the hearing, the mind, the soul, the body, the hair, the beard, the nails, the teeth, the excrement, the urine, the semen, the womb, the foetus, the milk, the curd, the butter, the whey, the sour milk, the dung, the urine, the flesh, the blood, the marrow, the fat, the bones, the hair, the skin, the flesh, the sinews, the veins, the breath, the heat, the voice, the sight, the hearing, the mind, the soul, the body, the hair, the beard, the nails, the teeth, the excrement, the urine, the semen, the womb, the foetus, the milk, the curd, the butter, the whey, the sour milk, the dung, the urine, the flesh, the blood, the marrow, the

original: catustrimśad vājino devabandhor vaṅkrīr aśvasya svadhitiḥ sam eti / acchidrā gātrā vayunā kṛṇota paruṣparur anughuṣyā vi śasta //
analyzed: catustrimśat vājinaḥ deva bandhoḥ vaṅkrīḥ aśvasya svadhitiḥ sam eti     acchidrā gātrā vayunā kṛṇota paruḥ paruḥ anughuṣya vi śasta
translated: The axe of the four-and-thirty ribs of the horse, the bond of the gods, the ribs of the horse, the axe approaches. Make the limbs without a flaw, one by one, O thou that art skilled in slaying, and cut them off.

original: ekas tvaṣṭur aśvasyā viśastā dvā yantārā bhavatas tatha ṛtuḥ / yā te gātrāṇām ṛtuthā kṛṇomi tātā piṇḍānāṃ pra juhomy agnau //
analyzed: ekaḥ tvaṣṭuḥ aśvasya viśastā dvā yantārā bhavataḥ tathā ṛtuḥ   yā te gātrāṇām ṛtuthā kṛṇomi tātā piṇḍānām pra juhomi agnau
translated: One is Tvashtar's portion of the horse's body; two are the charioteers' portions, so is the rule. The parts of thy body which I cut in order, of these, O child, I offer the portions in the fire.

original: mā tvā tapat priya ātmāpiyantaṃ mā svadhitis tanva ā tiṣṭhipat te / mā te gṛdhnur aviśastātihāya chidrā gātrāṇy asinā mithū kaḥ //
analyzed: mā tvā tapat priyaḥ ātmā apiyantam mā svadhitiḥ tanve ā tiṣṭhipat te    mā te gṛdhnuḥ aviśastā atihāya chidrā gātrāṇi asinā mithū kaḥ
translated: Let not thy dear body burn thee as thou passest away; let not the axe enter into thy limbs. Let not the greedy one, the cutter, leaving nothing, make thy limbs uneven, thy joints disjointed.

original: na vā u etan mriyase na riṣyasi devām id eṣi pathibhiḥ sugebhiḥ / harī te yuñjā pṛṣatī abhūtām upāsthād vājī dhuri rāsabhasya //
analyzed: na vai u etat mriyase na riṣyasi devām id eṣi pathibhiḥ su gebhiḥ    harī te pṛṣatī abhūtām upāsthāt vājī dhuri rāsabhasya
translated: Thou dost not die, thou art not injured; by the easy paths of the gods thou goest to the gods. Thy two bay steeds, harnessed to the pole, have become spotted. The strong one has mounted the ass.

original: sugavyaṃ no vājī svaśvyaṃ pumsaḥ putrām uta viśvāpuṣam rayim / anāgāstvaṃ no aditiḥ kṛṇotu kṣatraṃ no aśvo vanatām haviṣmān //
analyzed: su gavyam naḥ vājī su aśvyam pumsaḥ putrām uta viśvāpuṣam rayim    anāgāstvam naḥ aditiḥ kṛṇotu kṣatram naḥ aśvaḥ vanatām haviṣmān
translated: The strong one has given us a rich possession in cattle, in horses, in sons, and in all things that are desirable. May Aditi grant us freedom from sin. May the sacrificial horse, bringing oblations, win us lordship.

original: imā nu kaṃ bhuvanā sīṣadhāmendraś ca viśve ca devāḥ / ādityair indraḥ sagaṇo marudbhir asmabhyaṃ bheṣajā karat / yajñaṃ ca nas tanvaṃ ca prajāṃ cādityair indraḥ saha sīṣadhāti //
analyzed: imā nu kam bhuvanā sīṣadhāma indraḥ ca viśve ca devāḥ    ādityaiḥ indraḥ sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ asmabhyam bheṣajā karat    yajñam ca naḥ tanvam ca prajām ca ādityaiḥ indraḥ saha sīṣadhāti
translated: May we be the possessors of these worlds, Indra and all the gods. May Indra with the Adityas and the Maruts grant us healing. May Indra with the Adityas grant us sacrifice, body, and offspring.

original: agne tvaṃ no antama uta trātā śivo bhava varūthyaḥ //
analyzed: agne tvam naḥ antamaḥ uta trātā śivaḥ bhava varūthyaḥ
translated: O Agni, be our nearest friend, and a kind deliverer and a good protector.

original: vasur agnir vasuśravā acchā nakṣi dyumattamam rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: vasuḥ agniḥ vasu śravāḥ acchā nakṣi dyumattamam rayim dāḥ
translated: Agni is a good friend, of good fame; may he bestow on us the most brilliant wealth.

original: taṃ tvā śociṣṭha dīdivaḥ sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: tam tvā śociṣṭha dīdivas sumnāya nūnam īmahe sakhibhyaḥ
translated: To thee, O Agni, O most radiant one, we come for bliss to our friends.

original: agniś ca pṛthivī ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / vāyuś cāntarikṣaṃ ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / ādityaś ca dyauś ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / āpaś ca varuṇaś ca saṃnate te me saṃ namatām adaḥ / sapta samsado aṣṭamī bhūtasādhanī / sakāmām adhvanas kuru saṃjñānam astu me 'munā //
analyzed: agniḥ ca pṛthivī ca saṃnate te me sam namatām adaḥ   vāyuḥ ca antarikṣam ca saṃnate te me sam namatām adaḥ   ādityaḥ ca dyauḥ ca saṃnate te me sam namatām adaḥ    āpaḥ ca varuṇaḥ ca saṃnate te me sam namatām adaḥ    sapta samsadaḥ aṣṭamī bhūta sādhanī    sa kāmām adhvanaḥ kuru saṃjñānam astu me munā  /
translated: May Agni and Earth, bent together, be well-bent for me. May Vayu and the atmosphere, bent together, be well-bent for me. May Aditya and the sky, bent together, be well-bent for me. May the waters and Varuna, bent together, be well-bent for me. The seven assemblies, the eighth is the fulfiller of beings. Make my desire successful on the path. Let there be agreement between me and him.

original: yathemāṃ vācaṃ kalyāṇīm āvadāni janebhyaḥ / brahmarājanyābhyām śūdrāya cāryāya ca svāya cāraṇāya //
analyzed: yathā imām vācam kalyāṇīm āvadāni janebhyaḥ brahma rājanyābhyām śūdrāya ca āryāya ca svāya cāraṇāya
translated: That I may utter this auspicious speech to the people, to the Brahmins and nobles, to the Shudras and Aryas, to the noble and the base.

original: priyo devānāṃ dakṣiṇāyai dātur iha bhūyāsam ayaṃ me kāmaḥ sam ṛdhyatām upa mādo namatu //
analyzed: priyaḥ devānām dakṣiṇāyai dātuḥ iha bhūyāsam ayam me kāmaḥ sam ṛdhyatām upa mā adaḥ namatu
translated: May I be dear to the gods, to the Dakshina, to the giver here. May this desire of mine be fulfilled. May the favour bow down to me.

original: bṛhaspate ati yad aryo arhād dyumad vibhāti kratumaj janeṣu / yad dīdayac chavasa ṛtaprajāta tad asmāsu draviṇaṃ dhehi citram //
analyzed: bṛhaspate ati yat aryaḥ arhāt dyumat vibhāti kratumat janeṣu   yat dīdayat śavase ṛta prajāta tat asmāsu draviṇam dhehi citram
translated: O Brihaspati, when the enemy surpasses the worthy one, shines with glory and wisdom among the people, when he shines with power, O you born of truth, bestow upon us that wonderful wealth.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si bṛhaspataye tvā / eṣa te yonir bṛhaspataye tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si bṛhaspataye tvā   eṣa te yoniḥ bṛhaspataye tvā
translated: You are taken with a support. You are for Brihaspati. This is your birthplace. You are for Brihaspati.

original: indra gomann ihā yāhi pibā somam śatakrato / vidyadbhir grāvabhiḥ sutam //
analyzed: indra goman iha ā yāhi piba somam śatakrato    vidyadbhiḥ grāvabhiḥ sutam
translated: O Indra, come here, O lord of cattle, drink the Soma, O performer of a hundred sacrifices, the extracted (Soma) with the shining pressing stones.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā gomate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā gomate //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā gomate    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā gomate
translated: You are taken with a support. You are for Indra, for the sake of cattle. This is your birthplace. You are for Indra, for the sake of cattle.

original: indrā yāhi vṛtrahan pibā somam śatakrato / gomadbhir grāvabhiḥ sutam //
analyzed: indra ā yāhi vṛtrahan pibā somam śatakrato    gomadbhiḥ grāvabhiḥ sutam
translated: O Indra, come, O slayer of Vrtra, drink the Soma, O performer of a hundred sacrifices, the extracted (Soma) with the cattle-bearing pressing stones.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sīndrāya tvā gomate / eṣa te yonir indrāya tvā gomate //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si indrāya tvā gomate    eṣa te yoniḥ indrāya tvā gomate
translated: You are taken with a support. You are for Indra, for the sake of cattle. This is your birthplace. You are for Indra, for the sake of cattle.

original: ṛtāvānaṃ vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣas patim / ajasraṃ gharmam īmahe //
analyzed: ṛtāvānam vaiśvānaram ṛtasya jyotiṣaḥ patim    ajasram gharmam īmahe
translated: The truthful, the all-encompassing, the lord of the light of truth,🔽The ceaseless heat we implore.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si vaiśvānarāya tvā / eṣa te yonir vaiśvānarāya tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si vaiśvānarāya tvā   eṣa te yoniḥ vaiśvānarāya tvā
translated: You are taken with a support. You are for Vaisvānara. This is your birthplace. You are for Vaisvānara.

original: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kaṃ bhuvanānām abhiśrīḥ / ito jāto viśvam idaṃ vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaro yatate sūryeṇa //
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya sumatau syāma rājā hi kam bhuvanānām abhiśrīḥ   itas jātaḥ viśvam idam vi caṣṭe vaiśvānaraḥ yatate sūryeṇa
translated: May we enjoy the favor of Vaisvānara, for he is the king, the overlord of the worlds. Born from here, he looks upon this all. Vaisvānara strives with the sun.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si vaiśvānarāya tvā / eṣa te yonir vaiśvānarāya tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si vaiśvānarāya tvā   eṣa te yoniḥ vaiśvānarāya tvā
translated: You are taken with a support. You are for Vaisvānara. This is your birthplace. You are for Vaisvānara.🔽May Vaisvānara come to us from afar to help,

original: vaiśvānaro na ūtaya ā pra yātu parāvataḥ / agnir ukthena vāhasā //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ naḥ ūtaye ā pra yātu parāvataḥ   agniḥ ukthena vāhasā
translated: Agni with the hymn and the oblation.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si vaiśvānarāya tvā / eṣa te yonir vaiśvānarāya tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si vaiśvānarāya tvā   eṣa te yoniḥ vaiśvānarāya tvā
translated: You are taken with a support. You are for Vaisvānara. This is your birthplace. You are for Vaisvānara.🔽Agni, the sage, the purifier, the fivefold priest,

original: agnir ṛṣiḥ pavamānaḥ pāñcajanyaḥ purohitaḥ / tam īmahe mahāgayam //
analyzed: agniḥ ṛṣiḥ pavamānaḥ pāñcajanyaḥ purohitaḥ   tam īmahe mahā gayam
translated: Him we implore, the great bestower of wealth.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'sy agnaye tvā varcase / eṣa te yonir agnaye tvā varcase //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si agnaye tvā varcase   eṣa te yoniḥ agnaye tvā varcase
translated: You are taken with a support. You are for Agni, for splendor. This is your birthplace. You are for Agni, for splendor.🔽May Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the sixteenth, grant protection.

original: mahām indro vajrahastaḥ ṣoḍaśī śarma yacchatu / hantu pāpmānaṃ yo 'smān dveṣṭi //
analyzed: mahān indraḥ vajra hastaḥ ṣoḍaśī śarma yacchatu hantu pāpmānam yaḥ smān dveṣṭi
translated: May he slay the evil one who hates us.

original: upayāmagṛhīto 'si mahendrāya tvā / eṣa te yonir mahendrāya tvā //
analyzed: upayāma gṛhītaḥ u si mahā indrāya tvā    eṣa te yoniḥ mahā indrāya tvā
translated: Thou art taken with a support. Thee for Mahendra. This is thy birthplace. Thee for Mahendra.

original: taṃ vo dasmam ṛtīṣahaṃ vasor mandānam andhasaḥ / abhi vatsaṃ na svasareṣu dhenava indraṃ gīrbhir navāmahe //
analyzed: tam vaḥ dasmam ṛtīṣaham vasoḥ mandānam andhasaḥ    abhi vatsam na svasareṣu dhenavaḥ indram gīrbhiḥ navāmahe
translated: We praise with songs that wondrous Indra, the conqueror of foes, who rejoices in the juice of the Soma, as the cows low to their calves in the fold.

original: yad vāhiṣṭhaṃ tad agnaye bṛhad arca vibhāvaso / mahiṣīva tvad rayis tvad vājā ud īrate //
analyzed: yat vāhiṣṭham tat agnaye bṛhat arca vibhāvaso mahiṣī iva tvat rayiḥ tvat vājāḥ ud īrate
translated: That which is best, that is for Agni, the great light, O you of shining splendour. Like a mighty bull, your wealth, your strength rises up from you.

original: ehy ū ṣu bravāṇi te 'gna itthetarā giraḥ / ebhir vardhāsa indubhiḥ //
analyzed: ehi u su bravāṇi te gne itthā itarāḥ giraḥ   ebhiḥ vardhāse indubhiḥ
translated: Come, I will speak to you these other songs, O Agni, with these strengthening drops.

original: ṛtavas te yajñaṃ vi tanvantu māsā rakṣantu te haviḥ / saṃvatsaras te yajñaṃ dadhātu naḥ prajāṃ ca pari pātu naḥ //
analyzed: ṛtavaḥ te yajñam vi tanvantu māsāḥ rakṣantu te haviḥ    saṃvatsaraḥ te yajñam dadhātu naḥ prajām ca pari pātu naḥ
translated: May the seasons arrange your sacrifice, may the months protect your oblation. May the year bestow your sacrifice upon you. May it guard our offspring and protect us.

original: upahvare girīṇām saṃgame ca nadīnām / dhiyā vipro ajāyata //
analyzed: upahvare girīṇām saṃgame ca nadīnām    dhiyā vipraḥ ajāyata
translated: The sage was born by the impulse of the spirit, on the high plateaus of the mountains, and at the confluence of the rivers.

original: uccā te jātam andhaso divi sad bhūmy ā dade / ugram śarma mahi śravaḥ //
analyzed: uccā te jātam andhasaḥ divi sat bhūmī ā dade  / ugram śarma mahi śravaḥ
translated: Thy greatness, O Soma, which is born in heaven, I have obtained on earth. Mighty is thy protection, great is thy glory.

original: sa na indrāya yajyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ / varivovit pari srava //
analyzed: sa naḥ indrāya yajyave varuṇāya marudbhyaḥ   varivaḥ vid pari srava
translated: Flow on, thou who givest room, around for Indra who deserves worship, for Varuna, for the Maruts.

original: enā viśvāny arya ā dyumnāni mānuṣāṇām / siṣāsanto vanāmahe //
analyzed: enā viśvāni aryaḥ ā dyumnāni mānuṣāṇām    siṣāsantaḥ vanāmahe
translated: We long for all the glories of men, O you who conquer all, that we may win them.

original: anu vīrair anu puṣyāsma gobhir anv aśvair anu sarveṇa puṣṭaiḥ / anu dvipadānu catuṣpadā vayaṃ devā no yajñam ṛtuthā nayantu //
analyzed: anu vīraiḥ anu puṣyāsma gobhiḥ anu aśvaiḥ anu sarveṇa puṣṭaiḥ    anu dvipadā anu catuṣpadā vayam devāḥ naḥ yajñam ṛtuthā nayantu
translated: May we prosper with heroes, with cattle, with horses, with all increase. May we prosper with bipeds, with quadrupeds. May the Gods lead our sacrifice in due season.🔽O Agni, bring hither the wives of the Gods who love to come,

original: agne patnīr ihā vaha devānām uśatīr upa / tvaṣṭāram somapītaye //
analyzed: agne patnīḥ iha ā vaha devānām uśatīḥ upa    tvaṣṭāram soma pītaye
translated: Bring Tvashtar to the Soma feast.

original: abhi yajñaṃ gṛṇīhi no gnāvo neṣṭaḥ piba ṛtunā / tvam hi ratnadhā asi //
analyzed: abhi yajñam gṛṇīhi naḥ gnāvaḥ neṣṭar piba ṛtunā   tvam hi ratna dhāḥ asi
translated: O Gnavati, praise our sacrifice. O Neshtri, drink with the season. For thou art the bestower of treasure.

original: draviṇodāḥ pipīṣati juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata / neṣṭrād ṛtubhir iṣyata //
analyzed: draviṇaḥ dāḥ pipīṣati juhota pra ca tiṣṭhata   neṣṭrāt ṛtubhiḥ iṣyata
translated: The giver of wealth longs to drink. Offer and stand near. He is to be invoked from the Neshtri with the seasons.

original: tavāyam somas tvam ehy arvāṅ chaśvattamam sumanā asya pāhi / asmin yajñe barhiṣy ā niṣadyā dadhiṣvemaṃ jaṭhara indum indra //
analyzed: tava ayam somaḥ tvam ehi arvāṅ śaśvattamam sumanāḥ asya pāhi    asmin yajñe barhiṣi ā niṣadya ā dadhiṣva imam jaṭhare indum indra
translated: This Soma is for thee. Come hither. Guard this Soma with the most kindly mind. Sit on the sacrificial grass at this sacrifice. Place this drop in thy belly, O Indra.

original: ameva naḥ suhavā ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatanā raṇiṣṭana / athā mandasva jujuṣāṇo andhasas tvaṣṭar devebhir janibhiḥ sumadgaṇaḥ //
analyzed: amā iva naḥ su havāḥ ā hi gantana ni barhiṣi sadatana raṇiṣṭana    athā mandasva jujuṣāṇaḥ andhasaḥ tvaṣṭar devebhiḥ janibhiḥ sumat gaṇaḥ
translated: Come hither, O ye who are easy to invoke. Sit on the sacrificial grass. Be delighted with the oblation. Then rejoice, O Tvashtar, with the Gods, with the clans, with a great company.

original: svādiṣṭhayā madiṣṭhayā pavasva soma dhārayā / indrāya pātave sutaḥ //
analyzed: svādiṣṭhayā madiṣṭhayā pavasva soma dhārayā indrāya pātave sutaḥ
translated: Flow on, O Soma, with the sweetest, most delightful stream, pressed, for Indra to drink.

original: rakṣohā viśvacarṣaṇir abhi yonim ayohatam / druṇā sadhastham āsadat //
analyzed: rakṣaḥ hā viśvacarṣaṇiḥ abhi yonim ayaḥ hatam      druṇā sadhastham āsadat
translated: The Rakshas-slayer, worshipped by all men, hath sat him down upon his iron-bound seat,

original: sās tvāgna ṛtavo vardhayantu saṃvatsarā ṛṣayo yāni satyā / saṃ divyena dīdihi rocanena viśvā ā bhāhi pradiśaś catasraḥ //
analyzed: sāḥ tvā agne ṛtavaḥ vardhayantu saṃvatsarāḥ ṛṣayaḥ yāni satyā    sam divyena dīdihi rocanena viśvāḥ ā bhāhi pradiśaḥ catasraḥ
translated: May the seasons, O Agni, the years, the Rishis, and the truths make thee grow. Shine with the heavenly light. Illumine the four quarters.

original: saṃ cedhyasvāgne pra ca bodhayainam uc ca tiṣṭha mahate saubhagāya / mā ca riṣad upasattā te agne brahmāṇas te yaśasaḥ santu mānye //
analyzed: sam ca idhyasva agne pra ca bodhaya enam ud ca tiṣṭha mahate saubhagāya    mā ca riṣat upasattā te agne brahmāṇaḥ te yaśasaḥ santu mā anye
translated: Be kindled, O Agni, and awake him. Rise up and stand erect for great bliss. Let not the worshipper be harmed by thee, O Agni. Let thy priests be glorious, O most adorable.

original: tvām agne vṛṇate brāhmaṇā ime śivo agne saṃvaraṇe bhavā naḥ / sapatnahā no abhimātijic ca sve gaye gāgṛhy aprayucchan //
analyzed: tvām agne vṛṇate brāhmaṇāḥ ime śivaḥ agne saṃvaraṇe bhava naḥ    sapatna hā naḥ abhimāti jit ca sve gaye gāgṛhi aprayucchan
translated: These Brahmans here elect thee, O Agni. Be gracious, O Agni, in our dwellings. Be thou the slayer of our foes and conqueror of our enemies. Unharmed, O Agni, in thine own house.

original: ihaivāgne adhi dhārayā rayiṃ mā tvā ni kran pūrvacito nikāriṇaḥ / kṣatram agne suyamam astu tubhyam upasattā vardhatāṃ te aniṣṭṛtaḥ //
analyzed: iha eva agne adhi dhāraya rayim mā tvā ni kran pūrva citaḥ nikāriṇaḥ   kṣatram agne suyamam astu tubhyam upasattā vardhatām te a niṣṭṛtaḥ
translated: Here, O Agni, establish wealth. Let not the niggards, the first to rise, prevail against thee. Let thy rule, O Agni, be easy to us. Let the worshipper prosper through thee, O thou that art not to be surpassed.

original: kṣatreṇāgne svāyuḥ sam rabhasva mitreṇāgne mitradheye yatasva / sajātānāṃ madhyamasthā edhi rājñām agne vihavyo dīdihīha //
analyzed: kṣatreṇa agne su āyuḥ sam rabhasva mitreṇa agne mitradheye yatasva      sajātānām madhyama sthāḥ edhi rājñām agne vihavyaḥ dīdihi iha
translated: With the nobility, O Agni, win thou strength. Strive, O Agni, for the sake of friendship in the matter of friendship. Stand thou in the midst of thy equals. Shine thou here, O Agni, as the guest of kings, to be honoured by them.

original: ati niho ati sridho 'ty acittim aty arātim agne / viśvā hy agne duritā sahasvāthāsmabhyam sahavīrām rayiṃ dāḥ //
analyzed: ati nihaḥ ati sridhaḥ ti acittim ati arātim agne    viśvā hi agne duritā sahasva atha asmabhyam saha vīrām rayim dāḥ
translated: Over all evils, O Agni, rule thou, and grant us wealth with heroes.🔽Unassailable is Jâtavedas, unassailable the mighty one: shine here, O Agni, supporting the people.

original: anādhṛṣyo jātavedā anādhṛṣṭo virāḍ agne kṣatrabhṛd dīdihīha / viśvā āśāḥ pramuñcan mānuṣīr bhayaḥ śivebhir adya pari pāhi no vṛdhe //
analyzed: anādhṛṣyaḥ jātavedāḥ anādhṛṣṭaḥ virāj agne kṣatra bhṛt dīdihi iha   / viśvāḥ āśāḥ pramuñcan mānuṣīḥ bhayaḥ śivebhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ vṛdhe
translated: Freeing all regions from the fear of men, guard us this day, O thou of happy guidance, for increase.🔽O Br̥ihaspati, O Savitar, inspire him: sharpen him, even the sharpened one, still further.

original: bṛhaspate savitar bodhayainam samśitaṃ cit saṃtarām sam śiśādhi / vardhayainaṃ mahate saubhagāya viśva enam anu madantu devāḥ //
analyzed: bṛhaspate savitar bodhaya enam saṃśitam cit saṃtarām sam śiśādhi    vardhaya enam mahate saubhagāya viśve enam anu madantu devāḥ
translated: Increase him for great bliss: let all the Gods rejoice in him.🔽When thou, O Br̥ihaspati, didst free him from the curse of Yama, who was here below,

original: amutrabhūyādadha yad yamasya bṛhaspate abhisaster amuñcaḥ / praty auhatām aśvinā mṛtyum asmād devānām agne bhiṣajā śacībhiḥ //
analyzed: amutrabhūyā adadha yat yamasya bṛhaspate abhisasteḥ amuñcaḥ    prati auhatām aśvinā mṛtyum asmāt devānām agne bhiṣajā śacībhiḥ
translated: The Asvins and the healing Gods, O Agni, removed his death from him.🔽We have ascended from this world to the world of light, to the world of heaven,

original: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari svaḥ paśyanta uttaram / devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari svar paśyantaḥ uttaram    devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam
translated: To the God Sûrya, to the highest light.🔽The kindling-sticks of him are raised on high, the pure bright flames of Agni are raised on high,

original: ūrdhvā asya samidho bhavanty ūrdhvā śukrā śocīmṣy agneḥ / dyumattamā supratīkasya sūnoḥ //
analyzed: ūrdhvāḥ asya samidhaḥ bhavanti ūrdhvā śukrā śocīmṣī agneḥ    dyumattamā su pratīkasya sūnoḥ
translated: Of the Son of the fair-faced one, most glorious.

original: tanūnapād asuro viśvavedā devo deveṣu devaḥ / patho anaktu madhvā ghṛtena //
analyzed: tanūnapāt asuraḥ viśva vedāḥ devaḥ deveṣu devaḥ pathaḥ anaktu madhvā ghṛtena
translated: Let him anoint the paths with honey and ghee.🔽With honey thou goest to the sacrifice, delighting, O Narāśaṁsa, O Agni,

original: madhvā yajñaṃ nakṣase prīṇāno narāśamso agne / sukṛd devaḥ savitā viśvavāraḥ //
analyzed: madhvā yajñam nakṣase prīṇānaḥ narāśamsaḥ agne su kṛt devaḥ savitā viśva vāraḥ
translated: The good god Savitar, all-bountiful.🔽He cometh hither with his might, with ghee, the priest, the singer, with homage,

original: acchāyam eti śavasā ghṛteneḍāno vahnir namasā / agnim sruco adhvareṣu prayatsu //
analyzed: acchā ayam eti śavasā ghṛtena īḍānaḥ vahniḥ namasā    agnim srucaḥ adhvareṣu prayatsu
translated: To Agni, the ladles at the sacrifices.🔽He shall serve his greatness, of Agni, he is the pleasant one, the well-disposed,

original: sa yakṣad asya mahimānam agneḥ sa īṃ mandrā suprayasaḥ / vasuś vetiṣṭho vasudhātamaś ca //🔽dvāro devīr anv asya viśve vratā dadante agneḥ / uruvyacaso dhāmnā patyamānāḥ //
analyzed: sa yakṣat asya mahimānam agneḥ saḥ īm mandrā su prayasaḥ    vasuḥ vetiṣṭhaḥ vasu dhātamaḥ ca  dvāraḥ devīḥ anu asya viśve vratā dadante agneḥ    uru vyacasaḥ dhāmnā patyamānāḥ
translated: The good one, the best, and the best bestower of goods.🔽The divine doors, all the observances of him,🔽The wide-ruling ones, by their rule, are ruling.🔽Those two, his two heavenly wives, in the womb,

original: te asya yoṣaṇe divye na yonā uṣāsānaktā / imaṃ yajñam avatām adhvaraṃ naḥ //
analyzed: te asya yoṣaṇe divye na yonau uṣāsānaktā      imam yajñam avatām adhvaram naḥ
translated: Dawn and Night, may they favour this our sacrifice, this our worship.🔽The divine Hotṛs, lift up our sacrifice, in the ladle of Agni, accept it,

original: daivyā hotārā ūrdhvam adhvaraṃ no 'gner juhvām abhi gṛṇītam / kṛṇutam naḥ sv"ṣṭam //
analyzed: daivyā hotārau ūrdhvam adhvaram naḥ gneḥ juhvām abhi gṛṇītam   kṛṇutam naḥ svṣṭam
translated: Make it good for us.🔽Let the three goddesses, Idā, Sarasvatī, Bhāratī,

original: tisro devīr barhir idam sadantv iḍā sarasvatī bhāratī / mahī gṛṇānā //
analyzed: tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ idam sadantu iḍā sarasvatī bhāratī mahī gṛṇānā
translated: The great ones, sit on this strew, singing.

original: tan nas turīpam adbhutaṃ purukṣu tvaṣṭā suvīryam / rāyaspoṣaṃ vi ṣyatu nābhim asme //
analyzed: tat naḥ turīpam adbhutam purukṣu tvaṣṭā su vīryam    rāyaspoṣam vi syatu nābhim asme
translated: That wondrous food of ours, O Tvastr, rich in store of food, and hero strength,

original: vanaspate 'va sṛjā rarāṇas tmanā deveṣu / agnir havyam śamitā sūdayāti //
analyzed: vanaspate vaḥ sṛja rarāṇaḥ tmanā deveṣu    agniḥ havyam śamitā sūdayāti
translated: Do thou, O Lord of the forest, send forth, rejoicing, in thy own way, among the gods. May Agni, the preparer, make ready the offering.

original: agne svāhā kṛṇuhi jātavedo indrāya havyam / viśve devā havir idaṃ juṣantām //
analyzed: agne svāhā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ indrāya havyam   viśve devāḥ haviḥ idam juṣantām
translated: O Agni, Jâtavedas, make the offering acceptable to Indra. May all the gods rejoice in this oblation.

original: pīvoannā rayiṃvṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ / te vāyave samanaso vi tasthur viśven naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ //
analyzed: pīvaḥ annāḥ rayiṃvṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ   te vāyave samanasaḥ vi tasthuḥ viśvā id naraḥ su apatyāni cakruḥ
translated: The white one, rich in food, increasing wealth, of good thoughts, is sprinkled with the measured (libation), the most delightful. They, of one mind, have stood forth for Vâyu. All men have performed their several duties.

original: rāye nu yaṃ jajñatū rodasīme rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam / adha vāyuṃ niyutaḥ saścata svā uta śvetaṃ vasudhitiṃ nireke //
analyzed: rāye nu yam jajñatuḥ rodasī ime rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam     adha vāyum niyutaḥ saścata svāḥ uta śvetam vasu dhitim nireke
translated: For wealth was he born whom the two world-halves brought forth. For wealth the Goddess Dhishaṇa nourishes the god. Now Vâyu with his teams is to be invoked. Now the white Vasudhiti is to be invoked.🔽When the great waters all flowed hither, bearing the germ, generating Agni,

original: āpo ha yad bṛhatīr viśvam āyan garbhaṃ dadhānā janayantīr agnim / tato devānām sam avartatāsur ekaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
analyzed: āpaḥ ha yat bṛhatīḥ viśvam āyan garbham dadhānāḥ janayantīḥ agnim      tatas devānām sam avartata asuḥ ekaḥ kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: From that time the life of the gods has been set in motion. To what god shall we offer with oblation?

original: yaś cid āpo mahinā paryapaśyad dakṣaṃ dadhānā janayantīr yajñam / yo deveṣv adhi deva eka āsīt kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema //
analyzed: yaḥ cit āpaḥ mahinā paryapaśyat dakṣam dadhānāḥ janayantīḥ yajñam    yaḥ deveṣu adhi devaḥ ekaḥ āsīt kasmai devāya haviṣā vidhema
translated: Who was the one God over the Gods: to what God shall we offer with oblation?🔽With what (steeds) dost thou come to the worshipper, O Vayu, to the house for worship, with thy teams?

original: pra yābhir yāsi dāśvāmsam acchā niyudbhir vāyav iṣṭaye duroṇe / ni no rayim subhojasaṃ yuvasva ni vīraṃ gavyam aśvyaṃ ca rādhaḥ //
analyzed: pra yābhiḥ yāsi dāśvāmsam acchā niyudbhiḥ vāyo iṣṭaye duroṇe    ni naḥ rayim su bhojasam yuvasva ni vīram gavyam aśvyam ca rādhaḥ
translated: Bestow on us wealth which is good to enjoy, and bestow on us the gift of heroic strength in cattle and horses.🔽With thy teams by hundreds and by thousands come to our sacrifice and our worship.

original: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhir adhvaram sahasriṇībhir upa yāhi yajñam / vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: ā naḥ niyudbhiḥ śatinībhiḥ adhvaram sahasriṇībhiḥ upa yāhi yajñam    vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: O Vayu, rejoice in this libation. Do ye all preserve us evermore with your blessings.🔽O Vayu, come hither with thy teams, this bright oblation is ready for thee.

original: niyutvān vāyav ā gahy ayam śukro ayāmi te / gantāsi sunvato gṛham //
analyzed: niyutvān vāyo ā gahi ayam śukraḥ ayāmi te   gantāsi sunvataḥ gṛham
translated: Thou goest to the house of the presser.

original: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo agraṃ diviṣṭiṣu / ā yāhi somapītaye spārho deva niyutvatā //
analyzed: vāyo śukraḥ ayāmi te madhvaḥ agram diviṣṭiṣu   ā yāhi soma pītaye spārhaḥ deva niyutvatā
translated: O Vayu, I send forth the bright (oblation) to thee, the first of the sweet (draughts) at the feasts of heaven. Come to the drinking of the Soma, O desirable God, with thy teams.

original: vāyur agregā yajñaprīḥ sākaṃ gan manasā yajñam / śivo niyudbhiḥ śivābhiḥ //
analyzed: vāyuḥ agregāḥ yajña prīḥ sākam gat manasā yajñam  / śivaḥ niyudbhiḥ śivābhiḥ
translated: Vayu, the leader of sacrifices, the dear one, goes together with the mind to the sacrifice, the auspicious one with the auspicious teams.

original: vāyo ye te sahasriṇo rathāsas tebhir ā gahi / niyutvānt somapītaye //
analyzed: vāyo ye te sahasriṇaḥ rathāsaḥ tebhiḥ ā gahi niyutvān soma pītaye
translated: O Vayu, come hither with thy teams on those thousand chariots of thine.

original: ekayā ca daśabhiś ca svabhūte dvābhyām iṣṭaye vimśatī ca / tisṛbhiś ca vahase trimśatā ca niyudbhir vāyav iha tā vi muñca //
analyzed: ekayā ca daśabhiḥ ca sva bhūte dvābhyām iṣṭaye vimśatī ca    tisṛbhiḥ ca vahase trimśatā ca niyudbhiḥ vāyo iha tāḥ vi muñca
translated: And with three and with thirty, with thy teams, O Vayu, here release them.🔽O Vayu, O lord of truth, son-in-law of Tvastr, wondrous one,

original: tava vāyav ṛtaspate tvaṣṭur jāmātar adbhuta / avāmsy ā vṛṇīmahe //
analyzed: tava vāyo ṛtaspate tvaṣṭuḥ jāmātar adbhuta   avāmsi ā vṛṇīmahe
translated: We choose thee for our own.🔽We sing to thee, O hero, like milch cows that are dry,

original: abhi tvā śūra nonumo 'dugdhā iva dhenavaḥ / īśānam asya jagataḥ svardṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ //
analyzed: abhi tvā śūra nonumaḥ dugdhāḥ iva dhenavaḥ    īśānam asya jagataḥ svar dṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ
translated: The lord of this moving world, the lord of the firm, O Indra.🔽No other god or mortal, born or to be born,

original: na tvāvām anyo divyo na pārthivo na jāto na janiṣyate / aśvāyanto maghavann indra vājino gavyantas tvā havāmahe //🔽tvām id dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ / tvāṃ vṛtreṣv indra satpatiṃ naras tvāṃ kāṣṭhāsv arvataḥ //
analyzed: na tvāvām anyaḥ divyaḥ na pārthivaḥ na jātaḥ na janiṣyate    aśvāyantaḥ maghavan indra vājinaḥ gavyantaḥ tvā havāmahe  tvām id hi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ   tvām vṛtreṣu indra satpatim naraḥ tvām kāṣṭhāsu arvataḥ
translated: O bountiful Indra, we call on thee, O mighty one, longing for horses and cattle.🔽For we call on thee, O bountiful one, the singers of praise for the sake of strength.🔽We call on thee, O Indra, as the lord of heroes in battles, on thee in the races of horses.🔽So, O wondrous one, O wielder of the thunderbolt, O bold one, O wielder of the stone,

original: sa tvaṃ naś citra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ / gām aśvam rathyam indra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jigyuṣe //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ citra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā mahaḥ stavānaḥ adrivas    gām aśvam rathyam indra sam kira satrā vājam na jigyuṣe
translated: Scatter the cow, the horse fit for the chariot, O Indra, always the prize to be gained, for one who longs to conquer.🔽By what aid, O prosperous one, ever increasing, wilt thou come to us, O friend?

original: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā / kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā //
analyzed: kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā   kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā
translated: By what most mighty company?

original: kas tvā satyo madānāṃ mamhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ / dṛḍhā cid āruje vasu //
analyzed: kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām mamhiṣṭhaḥ matsat andhasaḥ    dṛḍhā cit āruje vasu
translated: Who, true to the gladdening juices, most bountiful, with the juice that gladdens,🔽Shall burst open even the firm-closed treasure.🔽Be thou the guardian of our friends, the worshipper's protector,

original: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām / śataṃ bhavāsy ūtaye //
analyzed: abhi su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām    śatam bhavāsi ūtaye
translated: Be thou a hundredfold to help us.

original: yajñāyajñā vo agnaye girāgirā ca dakṣase / prapra vayam amṛtaṃ jātavedasaṃ priyaṃ mitraṃ na śamsiṣam //
analyzed: yajñāyajñāḥ vaḥ agnaye girā girā ca dakṣase pra pra vayam amṛtam jātavedasam priyam mitram na śamsiṣam
translated: To your Agni, who is to be invoked at each sacrifice, to him who is to be praised at each hymn, to him who is to be glorified, we go for protection. We will extol the immortal, the all-knowing, the dear friend.

original: pāhi no agna ekayā pāhy uta dvitīyayā / pāhi gīrbhis tisṛbhir ūrjāṃ pate pāhi catasṛbhir vaso //
analyzed: pāhi naḥ agne ekayā pāhi uta dvitīyayā pāhi gīrbhiḥ tisṛbhiḥ ūrjām pate pāhi catasṛbhiḥ vaso
translated: Protect us, O Agni, with one (protection), protect us with the second, protect us with the third (protection), O lord of strength. Protect us with the four (protections), O Vasu.

original: ūrjo napātam sa hināyam asmayur dāśema havyadātaye / bhuvad vājeṣv avitā bhuvad vṛdha uta trātā tanūnām //
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam sa hina ayam asmayuḥ dāśema havya dātaye    bhuvat vājeṣu avitā bhuvat vṛdhaḥ uta trātā tanūnām
translated: The son of strength, he who is to be invoked, who is to be served, to whom we should bring oblations. He who is to be glorified in battles, who is to be glorified as the increaser, and who is to be glorified as the protector of bodies.

original: saṃvatsaro 'si parivatsaro 'sīdāvatsaro 'sīdvatsaro 'si vatsaro 'si / uṣasas te kalpantām ahorātrās te kalpantām ardhamāsās te kalpantāṃ māsās te kalpantām ṛtavas te kalpantām saṃvatsaras te kalpatām / pretyā etyai saṃ cāñca pra ca sāraya / suparṇacid asi tayā devatayāṅgirasvad dhruvaḥ sīda //🔽hotā yakṣad samidhendram iḍas pade nābhā pṛthivyā adhi / divo varṣmant sam idhyata ojiṣṭhaś carṣaṇīsahāṃ vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ si parivatsaraḥ sīdāvatsaraḥ sīdvatsaraḥ si vatsaraḥ si  / uṣasaḥ te kalpantām ahar rātrāḥ te kalpantām ardha māsāḥ te kalpantām māsāḥ te kalpantām ṛtavaḥ te kalpantām saṃvatsaraḥ te kalpatām      pretyai etyai sam ca añca pra ca sāraya    suparṇa cit asi tayā devatayā aṅgirasvat dhruvaḥ sīda  / hotā yakṣat samidhā indram iḍaḥ pade nābhā pṛthivyāḥ adhi      divaḥ varṣman sam idhyate ojiṣṭhaḥ carṣaṇī sahām vetu ājyasya hotar yaja  /
translated: Thou art the year, the year round, the year gone by, the year gone by, the year gone by, the year gone by, the year gone by. Let thy dawns prosper, let thy days and nights prosper, let thy half-months prosper, let thy months prosper, let thy seasons prosper, let thy year prosper. For departing and returning, for union and for motion, move thou. Thou art the bird-knower. With that deity, like Angiras, sit firm.🔽Let the Hotar worship Indra on the place of worship, on the navel of the earth, on the ridge of the sky, kindled together, most powerful, conqueror of men, with the ghee. Let him enjoy, O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣat tanūnapātam ūtibhir jetāram aparājitam / indraṃ devam svarvidaṃ pathibhir madhumattamair narāśamsena tejasā vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat tanū napātam ūtibhiḥ jetāram aparājitam    indram devam svar vidam pathibhiḥ madhumattamaiḥ narāśamsena tejasā vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Tanûnapât with his aids, the conqueror, the unvanquished, the god Indra, the finder of the heaven, with the sweetest paths, with the splendour of Narâsamsa. Let him enjoy, O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣad iḍābhir indram īḍitam ājuhvānam amartyam / devo devaiḥ savīryo vajrahastaḥ puraṃdaro vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat iḍābhiḥ indram īḍitam ājuhvānam amartyam    devaḥ devaiḥ sa vīryaḥ vajra hastaḥ puraṃdaraḥ vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Indra with the Idâs, the praised, the invoked, the immortal, the god with the gods, of one strength, with the thunderbolt in his hand, the breaker of forts. Let him enjoy, O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣad bariṣīndraṃ niṣadvaraṃ vṛṣabhaṃ naryāpasam / vasubhī rudrair ādityaiḥ suyugbhir barhir āsadad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat bariṣī indram niṣad varam vṛṣabham narya apasam    vasubhiḥ rudraiḥ ādityaiḥ su yugbhiḥ barhiḥ āsadat vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship Indra, the guest-loving, the bull, the man-like, with the Barhis, with the Vasus, the Rudras, the Adityas, well-yoked. Let him sit on the strew. Let him enjoy the ghee. Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣad ojo na vīryam saho dvāra indram avardhayan / suprāyaṇā asmin yajñe vi śrayantām ṛtāvṛdho svāra indrāya mīḍhuṣe vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat ojaḥ na vīryam sahaḥ dvāraḥ indram avardhayan    su prāyaṇāḥ asmin yajñe vi śrayantām ṛtāvṛdhaḥ svāraḥ indrāya mīḍhuṣe vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship strength, manly vigour, power, the doors which have strengthened Indra. Let them, well-directed, in this sacrifice, the supporters of truth, be spread out. Let them enjoy the ghee for Indra the bountiful. Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣad uṣe indrasya dhenū sudughe mātarā mahī / savātarau na tejasā vatsam indram avardhatāṃ vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat uṣe indrasya dhenū sudughe mātarā mahī    sa vātarau na tejasā vatsam indram avardhatām vītām ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the two Dawns, the two milch-cows of Indra, the two bountiful, great mothers. Let them, with their son Indra, increase with their own strength. Let them enjoy the ghee. Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣad daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā sakhāyā haviṣendraṃ bhiṣajyataḥ / kavī devau pracetasāv indrāya dhatta indriyaṃ vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat daivyā hotārā bhiṣajā sakhāyā haviṣā indram bhiṣajyataḥ    kavī devau pracetasau indrāya dhattaḥ indriyam vītām ājyasya hotar yaja  /
translated: Let the Hotar worship the two divine Hotars, the two physicians, the two friends, who with the oblation heal Indra. The two sages, the two wise ones, give power to Indra. Let them enjoy the ghee. Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣat tisro devīr na bheṣajaṃ trayas tridhātavo 'pasa iḍā sarasvat bhāratī mahīḥ / indrapatnīr haviṣmatīr vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat tisraḥ devīḥ na bheṣajam trayaḥ tri dhātavaḥ pasaḥ iḍā sarasvat bhāratī mahīḥ    indra patnīḥ haviṣmatīḥ vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the three goddesses, the three medicines, the three with three constituents, the three waters, Ida, Sarasvatî, Bhâratî, the great ones, the wives of Indra, rich in oblations. Let them enjoy the ghee. Hotar, worship.

original: hotā yakṣat tvaṣṭāram indraṃ devaṃ bhiṣajam suyajaṃ ghṛtaśriyam / pururūpam suretasaṃ maghonam indrāya tvaṣṭā dadhad indriyāṇi vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat tvaṣṭāram indram devam bhiṣajam suyajam ghṛta śriyam    puru rūpam su retasam maghonam indrāya tvaṣṭā dadhat indriyāṇi vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: The Hotar shall worship Tvashtar, Indra, the god, the physician, the well-worshipped, glorious with ghee, of many forms, very virile, the wealthy one. Tvashtar bestowing powers on Indra. Let him enjoy the ghee, O Hotar, offer the sacrifice.

original: hotā yakṣad vanaspatim śamitāram śatakratuṃ dhiyo joṣṭāram indriyam / madhvā samañjan pathibhiḥ sugebhiḥ svadāti yajñaṃ madhunā ghṛtena vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat vanaspatim śamitāram śatakratum dhiyaḥ joṣṭāram indriyam    madhvā samañjan pathibhiḥ su gebhiḥ svadāti yajñam madhunā ghṛtena vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: The Hotar shall worship the lord of the forest, the shakti, the one with a hundred powers, the supporter of thoughts, the powerful one. Anointing with honey on easy paths, he delights the sacrifice with ghee. Let him enjoy the ghee, O Hotar, offer the sacrifice.

original: hotā yakṣad indram svāhājyasya svāhā medasaḥ svāhā stokānām svāhā svāhākṛtīnām svāhā havyasūktīnām / svāhā devā ājyapā juṣāṇā indra ājyasya vyantu hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat indram svāhā ājyasya svāhā medasaḥ svāhā stokānām svāhā svāhākṛtīnām svāhā havyasūktīnām    svāhā devāḥ ājya pāḥ juṣāṇāḥ indraḥ ājyasya vyantu hotar yaja
translated: The Hotar shall worship Indra, svâhâ of the ghee, svâhâ of the suet, svâhâ of the drops, svâhâ of the oblations, svâhâ of the sacrificial hymns. Svâhâ, may the gods who drink ghee enjoy the ghee, O Indra, O Hotar, offer the sacrifice.

original: devaṃ barhir indram sudevaṃ devair vīravat stīrṇaṃ vedyām avardhayat / vastor vṛtaṃ prāktor bhṛtam rāyā barhiṣmato 'ty agād vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: devam barhiḥ indram su devam devaiḥ vīravat stīrṇam vedyām avardhayat    vastoḥ vṛtam prāktoḥ bhṛtam rāyā barhiṣmataḥ ti agāt vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: The divine sacrificial grass, Indra, the well-god, spread by the gods on the altar, has increased in heroes. Chosen in the morning, brought in the evening, with wealth it has passed beyond the possessor of sacrificial grass. May it enjoy of the offering rich in goods. Offer the sacrifice.

original: devīr dvāra indram saṃghāte vīḍvīr yāmann avardhayan / ā vatsena taruṇena kumāreṇa ca mīvatāpārvāṇam reṇukakāṭaṃ nudantāṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //🔽devī uṣāsānaktendraṃ yajñe prayaty ahvetām / daivīr viśaḥ prāyāsiṣṭām suprīte sudhite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //🔽devī joṣṭrī vasudhitī devam indram avardhatām / ayāvy anyāghā dveṣāmsy ānyā vakṣad vasu vāryāṇi yajamānāya śikṣite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ indram saṃghāte vīḍvīḥ yāman avardhayan    ā vatsena taruṇena kumāreṇa ca reṇu kakāṭam nudantām vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja  devī uṣāsānaktā indram yajñe prayatī ahvetām     daivīḥ viśaḥ prāyāsiṣṭām su prīte sudhite vasu vane vasudheyasya vītām yaja  devī joṣṭrī vasu dhitī devam indram avardhatām   ayāvi anyā aghā dveṣāmsi ā anyā vakṣat vasu vāryāṇi yajamānāya śikṣite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītām yaja
translated: The Goddesses, the Doors, Indra in the gathering, the firm ones, in the course, have increased. With the young calf, with the boy, with the dear one, driving away the dust-heap of the border, may they prosper for me the sacrifice, for the obtaining of wealth. Worship!🔽The Goddesses, Dawn and Night, have called Indra to the sacrifice. The Goddesses' clans have gone forth, well-pleased, well-disposed, in the wood of wealth, for the obtaining of wealth. Worship!🔽The Goddesses, the two nourishing ones, have increased the God Indra. One shall drive away the sins, the other the hostilities. The two shall teach the sacrificer the wealth and the good things. In the wood of wealth, for the obtaining of wealth, worship!

original: devī ūrjāhutī dughe payasendram avardhatām / iṣam ūrjam anyā vakṣat sagdhim sapītim anyā navena pūrvaṃ dayamāne purāṇena navam adhātām ūrjam ūrjāhutī ūrjayamāne vasu vṛyāṇi yajamānāya śikṣite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
analyzed: devī ūrjā āhutī dughe payasā indram avardhatām    iṣam ūrjam anyā vakṣat sagdhim sapītim anyā navena pūrvam dayamāne purāṇena navam adhātām ūrjam ūrjā āhutī ūrjayamāne vasu vṛyāṇi yajamānāya śikṣite vasuvane vasudheyasya vītām yaja
translated: The Goddesses, the two who offer food, have increased Indra with milk. One shall drive away food and strength, the other shall drive away companionship and fellowship. The one shall support the old with the new, the other shall support the new with the old. The two who offer food shall support strength, for the obtaining of wealth. Worship!

original: devā devyā hotārā devam indram avardhatām / hatāghaśamsāv ābhārṣṭāṃ vasu vāryāṇi yajamānāya śikṣitau vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
analyzed: devā devyāḥ hotārā devam indram avardhatām    hata agha śamsau ābhārṣṭām vasu vāryāṇi yajamānāya śikṣitau vasuvane vasudheyasya vītām yaja
translated: The two divine Hotars, the gods, have exalted the god Indra. Having slain the foe, they have brought him wealth and good things. Skilled in the sacrifice, they have gained wealth for the sacrificer. Let them enjoy the offering in the forest of wealth, in the winning of wealth. Worship.

original: devīs tisras tisro devīḥ patim indram avardhayan / aspṛkṣad bhāratī divam rudrair yajñam sarasvatīḍā vasumatī gṛhān vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devīḥ tisraḥ tisraḥ devīḥ patim indram avardhayan   aspṛkṣat bhāratī divam rudraiḥ yajñam sarasvatī iḍā vasumatī gṛhān vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: The three divine goddesses, the three goddesses, have exalted the lord Indra. Bharati has touched the sky. Sarasvati has the sacrifice with the Rudras. Ida, the rich one, the houses. Let them enjoy the offering in the forest of wealth, in the winning of wealth. Worship.

original: deva indro narāśamsas trivarūthas tribandhuro devam indram avardhayat / śatena śitipṛṣṭhānām āhitaḥ sahasreṇa pra vartate mitrāvaruṇed asya hotram arhato bṛhaspati stotram aśvinādhvaryavaṃ vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: devaḥ indraḥ narāśamsaḥ tri varūthaḥ tri bandhuraḥ devam indram avardhayat    śatena śiti pṛṣṭhānām āhitaḥ sahasreṇa pra vartate mitrāvaruṇā id asya hotram arhataḥ bṛhaspatiḥ stotram aśvinā ādhvaryavam vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: The god Indra, the man-desiring one, with three ramparts and three supports, has exalted the god Indra. Set up with a hundred of sharp-backed ones, he proceeds with a thousand. Mitra and Varuna are worthy of his priesthood. Brihaspati is worthy of his praise. The Ashvins are worthy of his Adhvaryu office. Let him enjoy the offering in the forest of wealth, in the winning of wealth. Worship.

original: devo devair vanaspatir hiraṇyaparṇo madhuśākhaḥ supippalo devam indram avardhayat / divam agreṇāspṛkṣad āntariksaṃ pṛthivīm adṛmhīd vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: devaḥ devaiḥ vanaspatiḥ hiraṇya parṇaḥ madhu śākhaḥ su pippalaḥ devam indram avardhayat    divam agreṇa aspṛkṣat āntariksam pṛthivīm adṛmhīt vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: The god, the tree, the god with the golden leaves, the honey-branch, the good-berry, has exalted the god Indra. He has touched the sky with his top. He has held the atmosphere and the earth. Let him enjoy the offering in the forest of wealth, in the winning of wealth. Worship.

original: devaṃ barhir vāritīnāṃ devam indram avardhayat / svāsastham indreṇāsannam anyā barhīmṣy abhy abhūd vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //🔽devo agniḥ sviṣṭakṛd devam indram avardhayat / sv"ṣṭaṃ kurvant sviṣṭakṛt sv"ṣṭam adya karotu no vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: devam barhiḥ vāritīnām devam indram avardhayat   svāsastham indreṇa āsannam anyā barhiḥ īmṣī abhī abhūt vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja  devaḥ agniḥ sviṣṭakṛt devam indram avardhayat   svṣṭam kurvan sviṣṭakṛt svṣṭam adya karotu naḥ vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: The divine sacrificial grass of the Varitinas exalted the divine Indra. It is self-established, pressed down by Indra. It has become superior to other sacrificial grasses. Let it partake of the offering for the sake of wealth. Recite the Yajya.🔽The divine Agni, the well-offerer, exalted the divine Indra. Performing the well-offering, may the well-offerer perform the well-offering for us today. Let it partake of the offering for the sake of wealth. Recite the Yajya.

original: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇītāyaṃ yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśaṃ badhnann indrāya chāgam / sūpasthā adya devo vanaspatir abhavad indrāya chāgena / aghat taṃ medastaḥ prati pacatāgrabhīd avīvṛdhat puroḍāśena //
analyzed: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇīta ayam yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśam badhnan indrāya chāgam   su upasthāḥ adya devaḥ vanaspatiḥ abhavat indrāya chāgena   aghat tam medastaḥ prati pacata agrabhīt avīvṛdhat puroḍāśena
translated: Today this sacrificer has chosen Agni as the Hotar priest, cooking the cooked food, cooking the sacrificial cake, binding the goat for Indra. Today the divine tree became well-established for Indra with the goat. He seized it from the fat while it was being cooked, and it was strengthened by the sacrificial cake.

original: tvām adya ṛṣa ārṣeya ṛṣīṇāṃ napād avṛṇītāyṃ yajamāno bahubhya ā saṃgatebhya eṣa me deveṣu vasu vāryāyakṣyata iti tā yā devā deva dānāny adus tāny asmā ā ca śāssvā ca gurasveṣitaś ca hotar asi bhadravācyāya preṣito mānuṣaḥ sūktavākāya sūktā brūhi //🔽hotā yakṣat samidhānaṃ mahad yaśaḥ susamiddhaṃ vareṇyam agnim indraṃ vayodhasam / gāyatrīṃ chanda indriyaṃ tryaviṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: tvām adya ṛṣaḥ ārṣeyaḥ ṛṣīṇām napāt avṛṇīta ayam yajamānaḥ bahubhyaḥ ā saṃgatebhyaḥ eṣa me deveṣu vasu vārya ayakṣyata iti tāḥ yāḥ devāḥ deva dānāni aduḥ tāni asmai ā ca śāssva ā ca gurasva iṣitaḥ ca hotar asi bhadra vācyāya preṣitaḥ mānuṣaḥ sūktavākāya sūktāḥ brūhi  hotā yakṣat samidhānam mahat yaśaḥ su samiddham vareṇyam agnim indram vayodhasam    gāyatrīm chandaḥ indriyam tryavim gām vayaḥ dadhat vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: To-day, O Rṣi's son, the Rṣis have chosen thee, the sacrificer, from among many assembled, for me, that thou mayest win for me among the gods wealth and boons. Do thou teach him the gifts which the gods have bestowed, and instruct him and guide him. Thou art the appointed Hotri for the utterance of good things. Send forth the man to utter the Sûkta. Speak the Sûkta.🔽Let the Hotri worship the well-kindled, the great-renowned, the well-enkindled, the excellent Agni, Indra, the life-bestower. The metre Gâyatrî is the power. He who bestows life, the three-year-old cow, let him enjoy the butter. Let the Hotri offer.

original: hotā yakṣat tanūnapātam udbhidaṃ yaṃ garbham aditir dadhe śucim indraṃ vayodhasam / uṣṇihaṃ chanda indriyaṃ dityavāhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat tanūnapātam udbhidam yam garbham aditiḥ dadhe śucim indram vayodhasam   uṣṇiham chandaḥ indriyam dityavāham gām vayaḥ dadhat vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotri worship the all-nourishing, the bursting forth, whom Aditi hath conceived, the pure, Indra, the life-bestower. The metre Uṣṇih is the power. The cow with the sun for her bearer, he who bestows life, let him enjoy the butter. Let the Hotri offer.

original: hotā yakṣad īḍenyam īḍitaṃ vṛtrahantamam iḍābhir īḍyam sahaḥ somam indram vayodhasam / anuṣṭubhaṃ chanda indriyaṃ pañcāviṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat īḍenyam īḍitam vṛtra hantamam iḍābhiḥ īḍyam sahaḥ somam indram vayodhasam    anuṣṭubham chandaḥ indriyam pañcāvim gām vayaḥ dadhat vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the adorable, the worshipped, the best of Vritra-slayers, the strength to be worshipped with oblations, Indra, the life-giving, Soma. The Anustubh metre is the power. He places the life-giving strength in the five-pieced cow. Let him enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣat subarhiṣaṃ pūṣaṇvantam amartyam sīdantaṃ barhiṣi priye 'mṛtendraṃ vayodhasam / bṛhatīṃ chanda indriyaṃ trivatsaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat su barhiṣam pūṣaṇvantam amartyam sīdantam barhiṣi priye mṛta indram vayodhasam    bṛhatīm chandaḥ indriyam trivatsam gām vayaḥ dadhat vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the one with good sacrificial grass, the immortal one accompanied by Pushan, seated on his dear sacrificial grass, Indra, the life-giving, the immortal. The Brihati metre is the power. He places the life-giving strength in the three-pieced cow. Let him enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣad vyacasvatīḥ suprāyaṇā ṛtāvṛdho dvāro devīr hiraṇyayīr brahmāṇam indraṃ vayodhasam / paṅktiṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ turyavāhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat vyacasvatīḥ su prāyaṇāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ dvāraḥ devīḥ hiraṇyayīḥ brahmāṇam indram vayodhasam    paṅktim chandaḥ iha indriyam turyavāham gām vayaḥ dadhat vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the spacious ones, the well-directed, the promoters of truth, the golden divine doors, the Brahman, Indra, the life-giving. The Pankti metre is the power here. He places the life-giving strength in the four-pieced cow. Let them enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣat supeśasā suśilpe bṛhatī ubhe naktoṣāsā na darśate viśvam indraṃ vayodhasam / triṣṭubhaṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ paṣṭhavahaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat supeśasā su śilpe bṛhatī ubhe naktoṣāsā na darśate viśvam indram vayodhasam     triṣṭubham chandaḥ iha indriyam paṣṭhavaham gām vayaḥ dadhat vītām ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the two very beautiful ones, the well-formed, the spacious, the night and the dawn, the two that shine, Indra, the life-giving. The Tristubh metre is the power here. He places the life-giving strength in the six-pieced cow. Let them enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣat pracetasā devānām uttamaṃ yaśo hotārā daivyā kavī sayujendraṃ vayodhasam / jagatīṃ chanda indriyam anaḍvāhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vītām ājyasya hotar yaja //🔽hotā yakṣat peśasvatīs tisro devīr hiraṇyayīr bhāratīr bṛhatīr mahīḥ patim indraṃ vayodhasam / virājaṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ dhenuṃ gāṃ na vayo dadhad vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat pracetasā devānām uttamam yaśaḥ hotārā daivyā kavī sayujā indram vayodhasam    jagatīm chandaḥ indriyam anaḍvāham gām vayaḥ dadhat vītām ājyasya hotar yaja  hotā yakṣat peśasvatīḥ tisraḥ devīḥ hiraṇyayīḥ bhāratīḥ bṛhatīḥ mahīḥ patim indram vayodhasam    virājam chandaḥ iha indriyam dhenum gām na vayaḥ dadhat vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: The Hotar shall worship with the most intelligent, the highest glory of the gods, the two divine sages, Indra, the life-sustaining, with the Jagati metre, the life-sustaining, the cow, the strength, the well-prepared, let him enjoy the ghee, O Hotar, offer.🔽The Hotar shall worship the three goddesses, the bountiful, the golden, the eloquent, the great, the mighty, Indra, the life-sustaining, the lord, the Viraj metre, the power, the cow, the strength, let him enjoy the ghee, O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣat suretasaṃ tvaṣṭāraṃ puṣṭivardhanam rūpāṇi bibhrataṃ pṛthak puṣṭim indraṃ vayodhasam / dvipadaṃ chanda indriyam ukṣāṇaṃ gāṃ na vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat su retasam tvaṣṭāram puṣṭi vardhanam rūpāṇi bibhratam pṛthak puṣṭim indram vayodhasam     dvipadam chandaḥ indriyam ukṣāṇam gām na vayaḥ dadhat vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: The Hotar shall worship the very virile Tvastr, the increaser of prosperity, bearing separate forms, prosperity, Indra, the life-sustaining, the two-footed metre, the bull, the cow, the strength, let him enjoy the ghee, O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣad vanaspatim śamitāram śatakratum hiraṇyaparṇam ukthinam raśanāṃ bibhrataṃ vaśiṃ bhagam indraṃ vayodhasam / kakubhaṃ chanda ihendriyaṃ vaśāṃ vehataṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vetv ājyasya hotar yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat vanaspatim śamitāram śatakratum hiraṇya parṇam ukthinam raśanām bibhratam vaśim bhagam indram vayodhasam    kakubham chandaḥ iha indriyam vaśām vehatam gām vayaḥ dadhat vetu ājyasya hotar yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the lord of the forest, the shaper, the one with a hundred powers, the golden-leaved one worthy of praise, bearing the reins, the powerful, the fortunate Indra, the life-giving. The Kakup metre is the power here, the cow Vehata is the life-giving. Let him enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.

original: hotā yakṣat svāhākṛtīr agniṃ gṛhapatiṃ pṛthag varuṇaṃ bheṣajaṃ kaviṃ kṣatram indraṃ vayodhasam / aticchandasaṃ chanda indriyaṃ bṛhad ṛṣabhaṃ gāṃ vayo dadhad vyantv ājyasya hotar yaja //🔽devaṃ barhir vayodhasaṃ devam indram avardhayat / gāyatryā chandasendriyaṃ cakṣur indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: hotā yakṣat svāhākṛtīḥ agnim gṛhapatim pṛthak varuṇam bheṣajam kavim kṣatram indram vayodhasam    aticchandasam chandaḥ indriyam bṛhat ṛṣabham gām vayaḥ dadhat vyantu ājyasya hotar yaja  devam barhiḥ vayodhasam devam indram avardhayat    gāyatryā chandasā indriyam cakṣuḥ indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: Let the Hotar worship the forms of oblations, Agni the lord of the house, Varuna the separate one, the medicine, the wise one, Indra the powerful, the lord of the people. The Atichandas metre is the power, the great bull is the cow. Let him enjoy the ghee. O Hotar, offer.🔽The divine sacrificial grass, life-giving, has strengthened the divine Indra. The Gayatri metre is the power, it places the eye in Indra, the life. Let it enjoy of the offering for Vasu. O Hotar, offer.

original: devīr dvāro vayodhasam śucim indram avardhayan / uṣṇihā chandasendriyaṃ prāṇam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devīḥ dvāraḥ vayodhasam śucim indram avardhayan    uṣṇihā chandasā indriyam prāṇam indre vayaḥ dadhat vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: The divine doors, life-giving, have strengthened the pure Indra. The Ushnih metre is the power, it places the breath in Indra, the life. Let them enjoy of the offering for Vasu. O Hotar, offer.

original: devī uṣāsānaktā devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devī devam avardhatām / anuṣṭubhā chandasendriyaṃ balam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
analyzed: devī uṣāsānaktā devam indram vayodhasam devī devam avardhatām    anuṣṭubhā chandasā indriyam balam indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vītām yaja
translated: The Goddesses Dawn and Night have strengthened the God Indra, the Life-giver. The Goddesses have strengthened the God with the Anushtubh metre, with power and strength. Bestowing life on Indra, in the wood, etc.

original: devī joṣṭrī vasudhitī devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devī devam avardhatām / bṛhatyā chandasendriyam śrotram indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //🔽devī ūrjāhutī dughe sudughe payasendraṃ vayodhasaṃ devī devam avardhatām / paṅktyā chandasendriyam śukram indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
analyzed: devī joṣṭrī vasu dhitī devam indram vayodhasam devī devam avardhatām     bṛhatyā chandasā indriyam śrotram indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vītām yaja  devī ūrjā āhutī dughe sudughe payasā indram vayodhasam devī devam avardhatām    paṅktyā chandasā indriyam śukram indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vītām yaja
translated: The Goddesses, the bountiful, the benefactors, have strengthened the God Indra, the Life-giver. The Goddesses have strengthened the God with the Brihatî metre, with power and strength. Bestowing hearing on Indra, in the wood, etc.🔽The Goddesses, the pourers of oblations, the two well-milking milk-givers, have strengthened Indra, the Life-giver. The Goddesses have strengthened the God with the Paṅkti metre, with power and strength. Bestowing the bright life on Indra, in the wood, etc.

original: devā daivyā hotārā devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devau devam avardhatām / triṣṭubhā chandasendriyaṃ tviṣim indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vītāṃ yaja //
analyzed: devā daivyā hotārā devam indram vayodhasam devau devam avardhatām    triṣṭubhā chandasā indriyam tviṣim indre vayaḥ dadhat vasuvane vasudheyasya vītām yaja
translated: The two Gods, the divine Hotars, have strengthened the God Indra, the Life-giver. The two Gods have strengthened the God with the Trishtubh metre, with power and strength. Bestowing splendour on Indra, in the wood, etc.

original: devīs tisras tisro devīr vayodhasaṃ patim indram avardhayan / jagatyā chandasendriyam śūṣam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja //
analyzed: devīḥ tisraḥ tisraḥ devīḥ vayodhasam patim indram avardhayan jagatyā chandasā indriyam śūṣam indre vayaḥ dadhat vasuvane vasudheyasya vyantu yaja
translated: The three goddesses, the three goddesses have exalted Indra, the lord of life and strength. With the Jagati metre, he has bestowed power and vigour on Indra. Let him enjoy the sacrifice, etc.

original: devo narāśamso devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devo devam avardhayat / virājā chandasendriyam rupam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //🔽devo vanaspatir devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devo devam avardhayat / dvipadā chandasendriyaṃ bhagam indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: devaḥ narāśamsaḥ devam indram vayodhasam devaḥ devam avardhayat    virājā chandasā indriyam rupam indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja  devaḥ vanaspatiḥ devam indram vayodhasam devaḥ devam avardhayat     dvipadā chandasā indriyam bhagam indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: The god Narâsamsa has exalted the god Indra, the lord of life and strength. With the Virâj metre he has bestowed beauty on Indra. Let him enjoy, etc.🔽The god of the forest has exalted the god Indra, the lord of life and strength. With the Dvipadâ metre he has bestowed prosperity on Indra. Let him enjoy, etc.

original: devaṃ barhir vāritīnāṃ devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devaṃ devam avardhayat / kakubhā chandasendriyaṃ yaśa indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: devam barhiḥ vāritīnām devam indram vayaḥ dhasam devam devam avardhayat    kakubhā chandasā indriyam yaśaḥ indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: The divine grass of the waters has exalted the god Indra, the lord of life and strength. With the Kakubh metre he has bestowed glory on Indra. Let him enjoy, etc.

original: devo agniḥ sviṣṭakṛd devam indraṃ vayodhasaṃ devo devam avardhayat / aticchandasā chandasendriyaṃ kṣatram indre vayo dadhad vasuvane vasudheyasya vetu yaja //
analyzed: devaḥ agniḥ sviṣṭakṛt devam indram vayodhasam devaḥ devam avardhayat    aticchandasā chandasā indriyam kṣatram indre vayaḥ dadhat vasu vane vasudheyasya vetu yaja
translated: The God Agni, the well-sacrificing, hath exalted the God Indra, the life-bestower. With the Atichhandas metre he hath bestowed power and princely rank on Indra. Let him enjoy the Vasus' gift of wealth. Let him sacrifice.

original: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇītāyaṃ yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśaṃ badhnann indrāya vayodhase chāgam / sūpasthā adya devo vanaspatir abhavad indrāya vayodhase chāgena / aghat taṃ medastaḥ prati pacatāgrabhīd avīvṛdhat puroḍāśena //
analyzed: agnim adya hotāram avṛṇīta ayam yajamānaḥ pacan paktīḥ pacan puroḍāśam badhnan indrāya vayodhase chāgam   su upasthāḥ adya devaḥ vanaspatiḥ abhavat indrāya vayodhase chāgena    aghat tam medastaḥ prati pacata agrabhīt avīvṛdhat puroḍāśena
translated: This sacrificer to-day hath chosen Agni as Hotar, cooking the cooked viands, cooking the sacrificial cake, binding the he-goat for Indra, the life-bestower. To-day the divine tree hath been well-established for Indra, the life-bestower, with the he-goat. He hath seized it from the fat, as it was cooked, and hath exalted it with the sacrificial cake.

original: tvām adya ṛṣa ārṣeya ṛṣīṇāṃ napād avṛṇītāyṃ yajamāno bahubhya ā saṃgatebhya eṣa me deveṣu vasu vāryāyakṣyata iti tā yā devā deva dānāny adus tāny asmā ā ca śāssvā ca gurasveṣitaś ca hotar asi bhadravācyāya preṣito mānuṣaḥ sūktavākāya sūktā brūhi //
analyzed: tvām adya ṛṣaḥ ārṣeyaḥ ṛṣīṇām napāt avṛṇīta ayam yajamānaḥ bahubhyaḥ ā saṃgatebhyaḥ eṣa me deveṣu vasu vārya ayakṣyata iti tāḥ yāḥ devāḥ deva dānāni aduḥ tāni asmai ā ca śāssva ā ca gurasva iṣitaḥ ca hotar asi bhadra vācyāya preṣitaḥ mānuṣaḥ sūktavākāya sūktāḥ brūhi
translated: Thee to-day, O Rishi, sprung from Rishis, this sacrificer hath chosen, as the descendant of Rishis, from many assembled, thinking, 'This one shall win for me among the gods wealth and boons.' Those boons which the gods have granted, teach thou him, and instruct him. Thou art the appointed Hotri, the human one, sent forth for the utterance of good words. Speak the good words.

original: samiddho añjan kṛdaraṃmatīnāṃ ghṛtam agne madhumat pinvamānaḥ / vājī vahan vājinaṃ jātavedo devānāṃ vakṣi priyam ā sadhastham //
analyzed: samiddhaḥ añjan kṛdaraṃmatīnām ghṛtam agne madhumat pinvamānaḥ   vājī vahan vājinam jātavedaḥ devānām vakṣi priyam ā sadhastham
translated: the strong one carrying the strong one, O all-knower, you shall carry the dear one of the gods to their abode.

original: ghṛtenāñjant saṃ patho devayānān prajānan vājy apy etu devān / anu tvā sapte pradiśaḥ sacantām svadhām asmai yajamānāya dhehi //
analyzed: ghṛtena añjan sam pathaḥ deva yānān prajānan vājī api etu devān      anu tvā sapte pradiśaḥ sacantām svadhām asmai yajamānāya dhehi
translated: Anointing the paths that lead to the gods with ghee, may the strong one, knowing, go to the gods. May the quarters attend on you, O horse. Bestow your own nature on this sacrificer.

original: īḍyaś cāsi vandyaś ca vājinn āśuś cāsi medhyaś ca sapte / agniṣ ṭvā devair vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ prītaṃ vahniṃ vahatu jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: īḍyaḥ ca asi vandyaḥ ca vājin āśuḥ ca asi medhyaḥ ca sapte    agniḥ tvā devaiḥ vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ prītam vahnim vahatu jātavedāḥ
translated: You are to be praised and worshipped, O horse, and you are swift and pure. May Agni, in accord with the gods and Vasus, carry you, the delighted bearer, O all-knower.

original: stīrṇaṃ barhiḥ suṣṭarīmā juṣāṃoru pṛthu prathamānaṃ pṛthivyām / devebhir yuktam aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ syonaṃ kṛṇvāna suvite dadhātu //
analyzed: stīrṇam barhiḥ suṣṭarīmā juṣāṃā uru pṛthu prathamānam pṛthivyām     devebhiḥ yuktam aditiḥ sajoṣāḥ syonam kṛṇvāna suvite dadhātu
translated: Accept the well-spread grass, wide, broad, and extended on the earth, in accord with the gods. May Aditi, making it pleasant, place it in good fortune.

original: etā u vaḥ subhagā viśvarūpā vi pakṣobhiḥ śrayamāṇā ud ātaiḥ / ṛṣvāḥ satīḥ kavaṣaḥ śumbhamānā dvāro devīḥ suprāyaṇā bhavantu //
analyzed: etāḥ u vaḥ subhagāḥ viśva rūpāḥ vi pakṣobhiḥ śrayamāṇāḥ ud ātaiḥ    ṛṣvāḥ satīḥ kavaṣaḥ śumbhamānāḥ dvāraḥ devīḥ su prāyaṇāḥ bhavantu
translated: These your auspicious ones, of all forms, spreading out with their wings and rising up with their breasts, lofty, true, adorning the bowls, may the divine doors be well-opened for you.

original: antarā mitrāvaruṇā carantī mukhaṃ yajñānām abhi saṃvidāne / uṣāsā vām suhiraṇye suśilpe ṛtasya yonāv iha sādayāmi //
analyzed: antarā mitrāvaruṇā carantī mukham yajñānām abhi saṃvidāne    uṣāsā vām su hiraṇye su śilpe ṛtasya yonau iha sādayāmi
translated: Moving between Mitra and Varuna, accepting the face of sacrifices, I place here, O Ushas and Sarasvati, you two, having beautiful gold, beautiful skill, in the womb of truth.

original: prathamā vām sarathinā suvarṇā devau paśyantau bhuvanāni viśvā / apiprayaṃ codanā vāṃ mimānā hotārā jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā //
analyzed: prathamā vām sa rathinā suvarṇā devau paśyantau bhuvanāni viśvā   apiprayam codanā vām mimānā hotārā jyotiḥ pradiśā diśantā
translated: You two, having golden chariots, seeing all the worlds, the two Adhvaryus, the two Hotars, directing the light with the directions, you two, O gods, being measured by the two Pratiprasthātrs, should be worshipped by me.

original: ādityair no bhāratī vaṣṭu yajñam sarasvatī saha rudrair na āvīt / iḍopahūtā vasubhiḥ sajoṣā yajñaṃ no devīr amṛteṣu dhatta //
analyzed: ādityaiḥ naḥ bhāratī vaṣṭu yajñam sarasvatī saha rudraiḥ naḥ āvīt    iḍā upahūtā vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ yajñam naḥ devīḥ amṛteṣu dhatta
translated: May Bharati, together with the Adityas, accept our sacrifice; may Sarasvati, together with the Rudras, come to us. May Iḍā, invoked with the Vasus, in accord with them, O goddesses, bestow our sacrifice upon the immortals.

original: tvaṣṭā vīraṃ devakāmaṃ jajāna tvaṣṭur arvā jāyata āśur aśvaḥ / tvaṣṭedaṃ viśvaṃ bhuvanaṃ jajāna bahoḥ kartāram iha yakṣi hotaḥ //
analyzed: tvaṣṭā vīram deva kāmam jajāna tvaṣṭuḥ arvā jāyate āśuḥ aśvaḥ    tvaṣṭā idam viśvam bhuvanam jajāna bahoḥ kartāram iha yakṣi hotar
translated: Tvaṣṭṛ has generated the hero who desires the gods; Tvaṣṭṛ's swift horse is born. Tvaṣṭṛ has generated this entire world. Worship here, O Hotṛ, the creator of much.

original: aśvo ghṛtena tmanyā samakta upa devām ṛtuśaḥ pātha etu / vanaspatir devalokaṃ prajānann agninā havyā svaditāni vakṣat //
analyzed: aśvaḥ ghṛtena tmanyā samaktaḥ upa devām ṛtuśas pāthaḥ etu  / vanaspatiḥ deva lokam prajānan agninā havyā svaditāni vakṣat
translated: The horse, anointed with ghee in its own place, should come to the gods in due season. The tree, knowing the world of the gods, should carry the offerings made by Agni.

original: prajāpates tapasā vāvṛdhānaḥ sadyo jāto dadhiṣe yajñam agne / svāhākṛtena haviṣā purogā yāhi sādhyā havir adantu devāḥ //
analyzed: prajāpateḥ tapasā vāvṛdhānaḥ sadyas jātaḥ dadhiṣe yajñam agne    svāhākṛtena haviṣā purogāḥ yāhi sādhyāḥ haviḥ adantu devāḥ
translated: Grown by the fervour of Prajâpati, thou, Agni, born this day, hast taken to thyself the sacrifice. Go forward with the oblation sanctified with Svâhâ. Let the Sâdhyas and the Gods enjoy the sacrificial food.

original: yad akrandaḥ prathamaṃ jāyamāna udyant samudrād uta vā purīṣāt / śyenasya pakṣā hariṇasya bāhū upastutyaṃ mahi jātaṃ te arvan //
analyzed: yat akrandaḥ prathamam jāyamānaḥ udyan samudrāt uta vā purīṣāt    śyenasya pakṣāḥ hariṇasya bāhū upastutyam mahi jātam te arvan
translated: When thou, O Steed, wast first brought forth, whether from the sea or from the dust, thy wings were those of the hawk, thy shoulders those of the antelope. Thou, O Steed, art to be praised as great when born.
