analyzed: vidat yadī saramā rugṇam adreḥ mahi pāthaḥ pūrvyam sadhryak kaḥ   agram nayat su padī akṣarāṇām acchā ravam prathamā jānatī gāt
translated: She hath gone forward, first, to the cry of the birds, to the foremost place of the moving things.

original: nahi spaśam avidann anyam asmād vaiśvānarāt puraetāram agneḥ / em enam avṛdhann amṛtā amartyaṃ vaiśvānaraṃ kṣaitrajityāya devāḥ //
analyzed: nahi spaśam avidan anyam asmāt vaiśvānarāt puraetāram agneḥ    ā īm enam avṛdhan amṛtāḥ amartyam vaiśvānaram kṣaitrajityāya devāḥ
translated: For they knew no other guardian than this Vaiśvānara, the forerunner of Agni. The immortal ones have exalted him, the immortal one, Vaiśvānara, for the conquest of fields, the gods.

original: ugrā vighaninā mṛdha indrāgnī havāmahe / tā no mṛḍāta īdṛśe //
analyzed: ugrā vighaninā mṛdhaḥ indra agnī havāmahe   tā naḥ mṛḍātaḥ īdṛśe
translated: We invoke the fierce destroyers of hostility, Indra and Agni. May they be gracious to us in this matter.

original: upāsmai gāyatā naraḥ pavamānāyendave / abhi devām iyakṣate //
analyzed: upa asmai gāyata naraḥ pavamānāya indave    abhi devām iyakṣate
translated: Sing to him, O men, to the purifying Indra, to the one who delights in the Soma. He will carry the oblations to the gods.

original: ye tvāhihatye maghavann avardhan ye śāmbare harivo ye gaviṣṭau / ye tvā nūnam anumadanti viprāḥ pibendra somam sagaṇo marudbhiḥ //
analyzed: ye tvā ahi hatye maghavan avardhan ye śāmbare harivas ye gaviṣṭau    ye tvā nūnam anumadanti viprāḥ piba indra somam sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ
translated: O Indra, the sages who have extolled you in the battle with Ahi, in the battle with Shambara, in the battle for the cow, and those who now rejoice in you, O wise one, drink the Soma, O Indra, together with the Maruts.

original: janiṣṭhā ugraḥ sahase turāya mandra ojiṣṭho bahulābhimānaḥ / avardhann indraṃ marutaś cid atra mātā yad vīraṃ dadhanad dhaniṣṭhā //
analyzed: janiṣṭhāḥ ugraḥ sahase turāya mandraḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ bahula abhimānaḥ    avardhan indram marutaḥ cit atra mātā yat vīram dadhanat dhaniṣṭhā
translated: The fierce one was born for conquest, the delightful one, the strongest, the one with abundant power. The Maruts have exalted Indra here, as the mother, the most powerful one, has nourished the hero.

original: ā tū na indra vṛtrahann asmākam ardham ā gahi / mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: ā tu naḥ indra vṛtrahan asmākam ardham ā gahi   / mahān mahībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Come now to us, O Indra, the Vrtra-slayer, come to our side. Great with your mighty aids.

original: tvam indra pratūrtiṣv abhi viśvā asi spṛdhaḥ / aśastihā janitā viśvatūr asi tvaṃ tūrya taruṣyataḥ //
analyzed: tvam indra pratūrtiṣu abhi viśvāḥ asi spṛdhaḥ   aśasti hā janitā viśvatūr asi tvam tūrya taruṣyataḥ
translated: You, O Indra, in your attacks, are all-conquering. You are the destroyer of curses, the all-victorious creator. You are the one who triumphs over those who need to be triumphed over.

original: anu te śuṣmaṃ turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśuṃ na mātarā / viśvās te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtraṃ yad indra tūrvasi //
analyzed: anu te śuṣmam turayantam īyatuḥ kṣoṇī śiśum na mātarā    viśvāḥ te spṛdhaḥ śnathayanta manyave vṛtram yat indra tūrvasi
translated: The two worlds follow thy impulse, as the two mothers follow the child, To subdue all thy foes, when thou, O Indra, goest to smite Vritra.

original: yajño devānāṃ praty eti sumnam ādityāso bhavatā mṛḍayantaḥ / ā vo 'rvācī sumatir vavṛtyād amhoś cid yā varivovittarāsat //🔽adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvam śivebhir adya pari pāhi no gayam / hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākir no aghaśamsa īśata //
analyzed: yajñaḥ devānām prati eti sumnam ādityāsaḥ bhavata mṛḍayantaḥ   ā vaḥ rvācī sumatiḥ vavṛtyāt amhoḥ cit yā varivaḥ vittarā asat  adabdhebhiḥ savitar pāyubhiḥ tvam śivebhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ gayam   hiraṇya jihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākir naḥ agha śamsaḥ īśata
translated: The sacrifice of the gods goes forth to the favour of the Âdityas. Be gracious, O ye Âdityas. May your favour turn hither to us, even from the distance, and be most bountiful to us.🔽With unfailing, O Savitar, with propitious guardians, do thou this day guard our abode. O thou whose tongue is gold, for fresh prosperity. Let not the evil-wisher have power over us.

original: pra vīrayā śucayo dadrire vām adhvaryubhir madhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ / vaha vāyo niyuto yāhy acchā pibā sutasyāndhaso madāya //
analyzed: pra vīrayā śucayaḥ dadrire vām adhvaryubhiḥ madhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ   vaha vāyo niyutaḥ yāhi acchā piba sutasya andhasaḥ madāya
translated: The pure (waters), with hero strength, have flowed forth to you, the sweet juices with the Adhvaryus. O Vâyu, bring thy teams, come hitherward. Drink of the juice that is expressed for thy delight.

original: gāva upāvatāvataṃ mahī yajñasya rapsudā / ubhā karṇā hiraṇyayā //
analyzed: gāvaḥ upāvata avatam mahī yajñasya rapsu dā    ubhā karṇā hiraṇyayā
translated: The cows have come nigh to help, the great ones to remove the curse of sacrifice. Both ears are made of gold.

original: kāvyayor ājāneṣu kratvā dakṣasya duroṇe / riśādasā sadhastha ā //
analyzed: kāvyayoḥ ājāneṣu kratvā dakṣasya duroṇe    riśādasā sadhasthe ā
translated: In the house of the wise one, in the abode of Daksha, the two Rishis, the two who slay the foe,

original: daivyāv adhvaryū ā gatam rathena sūryatvacā / madhvā yajñam sam añjāthe //
analyzed: daivyau adhvaryū ā gatam rathena sūrya tvacā    madhvā yajñam sam añjāthe
translated: The two divine Adhvaryus have come with a chariot covered with the sun's rays. With sweetness do ye consecrate the sacrifice.

original: taṃ pratnathā / ayaṃ venaḥ //🔽tiraścīno vitato raśmir eṣām adhaḥ svid upari svid / retodhā āsan mahimāna āsant svadhā avastāt prayatiḥ parastāt //
analyzed: tam pratnathā ayam venaḥ  tiraścīnaḥ vitataḥ raśmiḥ eṣām adhas svid upari svid     retaḥ dhāḥ āsan mahimānaḥ āsan svadhā avastāt prayatiḥ parastāt
translated: Him, even him of old. This Vena.🔽The ray of these is stretched athwart and wide. Below, it may be, or above, it may be. They were the seed-bestowers, they were the great ones. The power was under, the exertion was above.

original: ā rodasī apṛṇad ā svar mahaj jātaṃ yad enam apaso adhārayan / so adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kavir atyo na vājasātaye canohitaḥ //
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇat ā svar mahat jātam yat enam apasaḥ adhārayan    saḥ adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kaviḥ atyaḥ na vājasātaye canohitaḥ
translated: He hath filled both worlds, the heaven and the great light, when the skilful ones have set him forth. He is led around for the sacrifice, the sage, like a horse to the winning of strength, well-disposed.

original: ukthebhir vṛtrahantamā yā mandānā cid ā girā / āṅgūṣair āvivāsataḥ //
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ vṛtra hantamā yā mandānā cit ā girā    āṅgūṣaiḥ āvivāsataḥ
translated: With lauds, O most Vritra-slaying, even of those who are fain to praise with song,🔽With eulogies, do thou delight them.

original: upa naḥ sūnavo giraḥ śṛṇvantv amṛtasya ye / sumṛḍīkā bhavantu naḥ //
analyzed: upa naḥ sūnavaḥ giraḥ śṛṇvantu amṛtasya ye     su mṛḍīkāḥ bhavantu naḥ
translated: May the sons of immortality listen to our songs and hymns. Be gracious unto us.

original: brahmāṇi me matayaḥ śam sutāsaḥ śuṣma iyarti prabhṛto me adriḥ / ā śāsate prati haryanty ukthemā harī vahatas tā no accha //
analyzed: brahmāṇi me matayaḥ śam sutāsaḥ śuṣmaḥ iyarti prabhṛtaḥ me adriḥ   ā śāsate prati haryanti ukthā imā harī vahataḥ tā naḥ accha
translated: My prayers are prayers, my libations are libations. My stone is set in motion, my strength is urged forward. They are bidden to the command, they rejoice in the laud. Bring hither the two bay steeds. Come to us.

original: anuttam ā te maghavan nakir nu na tvāvām asti devatā vidānaḥ / na jāyamāno naśate na jāto yāni kariṣyā kṛṇuhi pravṛddha //
analyzed: anuttam ā te maghavan nakir nu na asti devatā vidānaḥ    na jāyamānaḥ naśate na jātaḥ yāni kariṣyā kṛṇuhi pravṛddha
translated: No one, O Maghavan, can surpass thee. No god is there who may know thee. What thou wilt do when born, that thou dost, O mighty one, when born thou dost not perish.

original: tad id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭhaṃ yato jajña ugras tveṣanṛmṇaḥ / sadyo jajñāno ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yaṃ viśve madanty ūmāḥ //
analyzed: tat id āsa bhuvaneṣu jyeṣṭham yatas jajñe ugraḥ tveṣa nṛmṇaḥ    sadyas jajñānaḥ ni riṇāti śatrūn anu yam viśve madanti ūmāḥ
translated: This is the most excellent of all things in the worlds, whence he was born, the mighty one of terrible valour. As soon as he is born, he slays the enemies, whom all the joyous ones delight.

original: imā u tvā purūvaso giro vardhantu yā mama / pāvakavarṇāḥ śucayo vipaścito 'bhi stomair anūṣata //
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā purūvaso giraḥ vardhantu yāḥ mama   / pāvaka varṇāḥ śucayaḥ vipaścitaḥ bhi stomaiḥ anūṣata
translated: May these my songs, O thou of plenteous wealth, exalt thee, O thou of pure radiance, the pure, the wise, who hast been praised with hymns.

original: yasyāyaṃ viśva āryo dāsaḥ śevadhipā ariḥ / tiraś cid arye ruśame parīravi tubhyet so ajyate rayiḥ //
analyzed: yasya ayam viśvaḥ āryaḥ dāsaḥ śevadhi pāḥ ariḥ tiras cit arye ruśame tubhya id saḥ ajyate rayiḥ
translated: Whose is this all-ruling power, whose is this lordship over wealth, whose is this universal sway? The wealth which is thine is praised even by the noble.

original: ayam sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudra iva paprathe / satyaḥ so asya mahimā gṛṇe śavo yajñeṣu viprarājye //
analyzed: ayam sahasram ṛṣibhiḥ sahaskṛtaḥ samudraḥ iva paprathe     satyaḥ saḥ asya mahimā gṛṇe śavaḥ yajñeṣu vipra rājye
translated: This (Agni) has been made a thousand-fold by the Rishis, he has spread himself like the ocean. His true greatness and power I extol at the sacrifices of the Brahmans and Kshatriyas.

original: adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvam śivebhir adya pari pāhi no gayam / hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākir no aghaśamsa īśata //
analyzed: adabdhebhiḥ savitar pāyubhiḥ tvam śivebhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ gayam   hiraṇya jihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākir naḥ agha śamsaḥ īśata
translated: With thy infallible, protecting, auspicious ways, O Savitar, do thou this day guard our dwelling. O thou whose tongue is gold, for fresh prosperity. Let not the evil-wisher have power over us.

original: ā no yajñaṃ divispṛśaṃ vāyo yāhi sumanmabhiḥ / antaḥ pavitra upari śrīṇāno 'yam śukro ayāmi te //
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam divispṛśam vāyo yāhi su manmabhiḥ   antar pavitre upari śrīṇānaḥ yam śukraḥ ayāmi te
translated: Come, O Vayu, to our sacrifice which reaches to the sky, with those who think most highly of thee. Pouring (thyself) above the purifying filter, this pure (drink) is offered to thee.

original: indravāyū susaṃdṛśā suhaveha havāmahe / yathā naḥ sarva ij jano 'namīvaḥ saṃgame sumanā asat //
analyzed: indra vāyū su saṃdṛśā su havā iha havāmahe    yathā naḥ sarvaḥ id janaḥ namīvaḥ saṃgame su manāḥ asat
translated: Indra and Vâyu, fair to look on, swift to hear, we call on you this day, That all the people may be well-disposed, free from all sickness, at our gathering.

original: ṛdhag itthā sa martyaḥ śaśame devatātaye / yo nūnaṃ mitrāvaruṇāv abhiṣṭaya ācakre havyadātaye //
analyzed: ṛdhak itthā sa martyaḥ śaśame devatātaye    yaḥ nūnam mitrāvaruṇau abhiṣṭaye ācakre havya dātaye
translated: This mortal man hath prospered in the service of the Gods, Who now hath brought you, Varuṇa and Mitra, to give him gifts of sacrificial food.

original: ā yātam upa bhūṣataṃ madhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā / dugdhaṃ payo vṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā no mardhiṣṭam ā gatam //
analyzed: ā yātam upa bhūṣatam madhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā    dugdham payaḥ vṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā naḥ mardhiṣṭam ā gatam
translated: Come hither, seat you, drink the meath, O ye Âsvins, drink the milk, ye mighty, ye who bring all blessings. Injure us not, come hitherward.

original: praitu brahmaṇas patiḥ pra devy etu sūnṛtā / acchā vīraṃ naryaṃ paṅktirādhasaṃ devā yajñaṃ nayantu naḥ //
analyzed: praitu brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ pra devī etu sūnṛtā   acchā vīram naryam paṅkti rādhasam devāḥ yajñam nayantu naḥ
translated: Let Brahmanaspati depart, let Sûnr̥ita the Goddess go, Let the Gods lead our sacrifice to Vîra, to the man who gives the fivefold gift.

original: candramā apsv antar ā suparṇo dhāvate divi / rayiṃ piśaṃgaṃ bahulaṃ puruspṛham harir eti kanikradat //
analyzed: candramāḥ apsu antar ā suparṇaḥ dhāvate divi    rayim piśaṃgam bahulam puruspṛham hariḥ eti kanikradat
translated: The Moon runs in the waters, the bird runs in the sky. The tawny wealth, much-longed-for, is brought by the golden one who neighs.

original: devaṃdevaṃ vo 'vase devaṃdevam abhiṣṭaye / devaṃdevam huvema vājasātaye gṛṇanto devyā dhiyā //
analyzed: devaṃdevam vaḥ vase devaṃdevam abhiṣṭaye devaṃdevam huvema vājasātaye gṛṇantaḥ devyā dhiyā
translated: To each of you, O Gods, for aid, to each of you for victory, To each of you, O Gods, we call, singing with holy song, to win us strength.

original: divi pṛṣṭo arocatāgnir vaiśvānaro bṛhan / kṣmayā vṛdhāna ojasā canohito jyotiṣā bādhate tamaḥ //
analyzed: divi pṛṣṭaḥ arocata agniḥ vaiśvānaraḥ bṛhan   kṣmayā vṛdhānaḥ ojasā canohitaḥ jyotiṣā bādhate tamaḥ
translated: Agni Vaisvânara, set in the heaven, hath shone forth on high, Grown great by earth, by power, by light, well-worshipped, he dispels the gloom.

original: indrāgnī apād iyaṃ pūrvāgāt padvatībhyaḥ / hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadac carat trimśat padā ny akramīt //
analyzed: indra agnī apāt iyam pūrvā āgāt padvatībhyaḥ    hitvī śiraḥ jihvayā vāvadat carat trimśat padā ni akramīt
translated: Indra and Agni, this first step hath been taken by the lame among the sound. The tongue hath wagged, leaving the head behind, and hath gone down the thirty steps.

original: devāso hi ṣmā manave samanyavo viśve sākam sarātayaḥ / te no adya te aparaṃ tuce tu no bhavantu varivovidaḥ //
analyzed: devāsaḥ hi sma manave samanyavaḥ viśve sākam sa rātayaḥ   te naḥ adya te aparam tuce tu naḥ bhavantu varivaḥ vidaḥ
translated: For ye, O Gods, are all of one accord with Manu in our battles. Ye have been all our helpers in the strife. Be they our helpers now and hereafter, and give us room and freedom.

original: apādhamad abhiśastīr aśastihāthendro dyumny ābhavat / devās ta indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhadbhāno marudgaṇa //
analyzed: apādhamat abhiśastīḥ aśasti hā atha indraḥ dyumnī ābhavat    devāḥ te indra sakhyāya yemire bṛhat bhāno marut gaṇa
translated: He hath removed the curses, he who conquers curses. Indra hath become resplendent. The Gods, O Indra, have submitted to thee for friendship, O thou of lofty radiance, O thou who hast the Maruts for thy troop.

original: pra va indrāya bṛhate maruto brahmārcata / vṛtram hanati vṛtrahā śatakratur vajreṇa śataparvaṇā //
analyzed: pra vaḥ indrāya bṛhate marutaḥ brahma arcata    vṛtram hanati vṛtrahā śatakratuḥ vajreṇa śata parvaṇā
translated: Sing forth to Indra, to the mighty, O ye Maruts, a hymn of praise. The Vr̥itra-slayer, Ṣatakratu, with his hundred-knotted thunderbolt, slays Vr̥itra.

original: asyed indro vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyam śavo made sutasya viṣṇavi / adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavo 'nu ṣṭuvanti pūrvathā //
analyzed: asya id indraḥ vāvṛdhe vṛṣṇyam śavaḥ made sutasya viṣṇavi    adyā tam asya mahimānam āyavaḥ nu stuvanti pūrvathā
translated: Here hath Indra waxed in strength, in the wild joy of the juice outpoured, in Vishnu's place. The living men this day extol his greatness as of old.

original: imā u tvā / yasyāyam / ayam sahasram / ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇaḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā  yasya ayam  ayam sahasram   ūrdhvaḥ u su naḥ
translated: These are thine, O thou whose is this. This is the thousand. Upward and higher still for us.

original: yaj jāgrato dūram udaiti daivaṃ tad u suptasya tathaivaiti / dūraṃgamaṃ jyotiṣāṃ jyotir ekaṃ tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
analyzed: yat jāgrataḥ dūram udaiti daivam tat u suptasya tathā eva eti   / dūraṃgamam jyotiṣām jyotiḥ ekam tat me manaḥ śiva saṃkalpam astu
translated: That which is the far-reaching divine light that shines when one is awake, that same light comes to one when one is asleep. That one light of all the lights, which goes far, may that be my mind, with auspicious intentions.

original: yena karmāṇy apaso manīṣiṇo yajñe kṛṇvanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ / yad apūrvaṃ yakṣam antaḥ prajānāṃ tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
analyzed: yena karmāṇi apasaḥ manīṣiṇaḥ yajñe kṛṇvanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ   yat apūrvam yakṣam antar prajānām tat me manaḥ śiva saṃkalpam astu
translated: By which the wise and learned perform their duties in sacrifices and assemblies, which is the ancient and unseen power within all beings, may that be my mind, with auspicious intentions.

original: yat prajñānam uta ceto dhṛtiś ca yaj jyotir antar amṛtaṃ prajāsu / yasmān na ṛte kiṃ cana karma kriyate tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
analyzed: yat prajñānam uta cetaḥ dhṛtiḥ ca yat jyotiḥ antar amṛtam prajāsu    yasmāt na ṛte kim cana karma kriyate tat me manaḥ śiva saṃkalpam astu
translated: That which is wisdom, the mind, firmness, the immortal light within all beings, without which no action can be performed, may that be my mind, with auspicious intentions.

original: yenedaṃ bhūtaṃ bhuvanaṃ bhaviṣyat parigṛhītam amṛtena sarvam / yena yajñas tāyate saptahotā tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
analyzed: yena idam bhūtam bhuvanam bhaviṣyat parigṛhītam amṛtena sarvam    yena yajñaḥ tāyate saptahotā tat me manaḥ śiva saṃkalpam astu
translated: By which this past, present and future world is all pervaded by immortality, by which the sacrifice with seven Hotras is performed, may that be my mind, with auspicious intentions.

original: yasminn ṛcaḥ sāma yajūmṣi yasmin pratiṣṭhitā rathanābhāv ivārāḥ / yasmimś cittam sarvam otaṃ prajānaṃ tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
analyzed: yasmin ṛcaḥ sāma yajūmṣi yasmin pratiṣṭhitāḥ ratha nābhau iva arāḥ     yasmin cittam sarvam otam prajānam tat me manaḥ śiva saṃkalpam astu
translated: In which the Ṛk, Sāman and Yajuṣ verses are established, like spokes in a wheel, and in which all the knowing mind is woven, may that be my mind, with auspicious intentions.

original: suṣārathir aśvān iva yan manuṣyān nenīyate 'bhīśubhir vājina iva / hṛtpratiṣṭhaṃ yad ajiraṃ javiṣṭhaṃ tan me manaḥ śivasaṃkalpam astu //
analyzed: suṣārathiḥ aśvān iva yat manuṣyān nenīyate bhīśubhiḥ vājinaḥ iva  / hṛd pratiṣṭham yat ajiram javiṣṭham tat me manaḥ śiva saṃkalpam astu
translated: As a charioteer guides his horses well, so he leads men with the reins, as if they were swift horses. That which is in the heart, swift, most swift, may that be my mind, with good intentions.

original: pituṃ nu stoṣaṃ maho dharmāṇaṃ taviṣīm / yasya trito vy ojasā vṛtraṃ viparvam ardayat //
analyzed: pitum nu stoṣam mahaḥ dharmāṇam taviṣīm    yasya tritaḥ vi ojasā vṛtram viparvam ardayat
translated: I will praise the father, the great one of mighty deeds, whose son Trita with his strength crushed Vṛtra, whose joints were broken.

original: anv id anumate tvaṃ manyāsai śaṃ ca nas kṛdhi / kratve dakṣāya no hinu pra ṇa āyūmṣi tāriṣaḥ //
analyzed: anu id anumate tvam manyāsai śam ca naḥ kṛdhi   kratve dakṣāya naḥ hinu pra naḥ āyūmṣi tāriṣaḥ
translated: O Anumati, do thou follow this our sacrifice and grant us peace. Lead us to wisdom and power, and prolong our lives.

original: anu no 'dyānumatir yajñaṃ deveṣu manyatām / agniś ca havyavāhano bhavataṃ dāśuṣe mayaḥ //
analyzed: anu naḥ dyānumatiḥ yajñam deveṣu manyatām   agniḥ ca havya vāhanaḥ bhavatam dāśuṣe mayaḥ
translated: May Anumati today favor our sacrifice among the gods, and may Agni, the bearer of oblations, be a source of joy to the worshipper.

original: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā / juṣasva havyam āhutaṃ prajāṃ devi didiḍḍhi naḥ //
analyzed: sinīvāli pṛthuṣṭuke yā devānām asi svasā   juṣasva havyam āhutam prajām devi didiḍḍhi naḥ
translated: O Sinivali, O thou of wide fame, thou who art the sister of the gods, accept the offered oblation, and grant us offspring, O goddess.

original: pañca nadyaḥ sarasvatīm api yanti sasrotasaḥ / sarasvatī tu pañcadhā so deśe 'bhavat sarit //
analyzed: pañca nadyaḥ sarasvatīm api yanti sasrotasaḥ   sarasvatī tu pañcadhā sā u deśe bhavat sarit
translated: The five rivers flow to the Sarasvati with their streams. But the Sarasvati in five ways became a river in that region.

original: tvam agne prathamo aṅgirā ṛṣir devo devānām abhavaḥ śivaḥ sakhā / tava vrate kavayo vidmanāpaso 'jāyanta maruto bhrājadṛṣṭayaḥ //
analyzed: tvam agne prathamaḥ aṅgirāḥ ṛṣiḥ devaḥ devānām abhavaḥ śivaḥ sakhā    tava vrate kavayaḥ vidmana apasaḥ jāyanta marutaḥ bhrājat ṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, art the first Angiras, the sage, the God of the Gods, the auspicious friend. In thy ordinance the wise, the thoughtful, the Maruts, were born, of radiant appearance.

original: tvaṃ no agne tave deva pāyubhir maghono rakṣa tanvaś ca vandya / trātā tokasya tanaye gavām asy animeṣam rakṣaṇas tava vrate //
analyzed: tvam naḥ agne tave deva pāyubhiḥ maghonaḥ rakṣa tanvaḥ ca vandya    trātā tokasya tanaye gavām asi animeṣam rakṣaṇaḥ tava vrate
translated: Do thou, O Agni, O God, with thine own guards, O adorable one, guard our riches and our bodies. Thou art the protector of offspring and of cattle in this race. Thou art the watchful guardian in thy ordinance.

original: uttānāyām ava bharā cikitvānt sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṃ jajāna / aruṣastūpo ruśad asya pāja iḍāyās putro vayune 'janiṣṭa //
analyzed: uttānāyām ava bhara cikitvān sadyas pravītā vṛṣaṇam jajāna    aruṣa stūpaḥ ruśat asya pājaḥ iḍāyāḥ putraḥ vayune janiṣṭa
translated: In the extended (earth) lay thou down the wise one. The immediately prepared one hath brought forth the strong one. His back is ruddy, his radiance is bright. The son of Ida is born in the place of separation.

original: iḍāyās tvā pade vayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā adhi / jātavedo ni dhīmahy agne havyāya voḍhave //🔽pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣam āṅgūṣaṃ girvaṇase aṅgirasvat / suvṛktibhi stuvata ṛgmiyāyārcāmārkaṃ nare viśrutāya //
analyzed: iḍāyāḥ tvā pade vayam nābhā pṛthivyāḥ adhi   / ni dhīmahi agne havyāya voḍhave  pra manmahe śavasānāya śūṣam āṅgūṣam girvaṇase aṅgirasvat      suvṛktibhiḥ stuvate ṛgmiyāya arcāma arkam nare viśrutāya
translated: In the place of Ida, in the navel of the earth, we establish thee, O all-knower, O Agni, for the carrying of oblations.🔽We meditate on strength for the most powerful one, on praise for the lover of song, like Angiras. We extol with good hymns the one to be praised, the Arka, the famous one among men.

original: pra vo mahe mahi namo bharadhvam āṅgūṣyam śavasānāya sāma / yenā naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ padajñā arcanto aṅgiraso gā avindan //
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahi namaḥ bharadhvam āṅgūṣyam śavasānāya sāma    yena naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ pada jñāḥ arcantaḥ aṅgirasaḥ gāḥ avindan
translated: Bring forth to the most powerful one your great, great homage, the praiseworthy hymn with strength, whereby our fathers of old, the Angirases, finding the cows, sang with praises.

original: icchanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṃ dadhati prayāmsi / titikṣante abhiśastiṃ janānām indra tvad ā kaś cana hi praketaḥ //
analyzed: icchanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somam dadhati prayāmsi    titikṣante abhiśastim janānām indra tvat ā kaḥ cana hi praketaḥ
translated: Thy friends who love thee, Indra, long for thee: they press the Soma and prepare the banquet. They suffer the reproach of men: no one, O Indra, is a match for thee.

original: na te dūre paramā cid rajāmsy asyā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām / sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau //
analyzed: na te dūre paramā cit rajāmsi asyā tu pra yāhi harivas haribhyām     sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtā imā yuktāḥ grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau
translated: Not far away are the most distant regions: come hitherward, O thou whose wealth is horses, with thy two Bay Steeds, to the strong juice we offer. The pressing-stones are set, the fire is kindled.

original: aṣāḍhaṃ yutsu pṛtanāsu paprim svarṣām apsāṃ vṛjanasya gopām / bhareṣujām sukṣitim suśravasaṃ jayantaṃ tvām anu madema soma //
analyzed: aṣāḍham yutsu pṛtanāsu paprim svarṣām ap sām vṛjanasya gopām    bhareṣujām su kṣitim suśravasam jayantam tvām anu madema soma
translated: The mighty, the protector in the battles, the self-resplendent, the guardian of the people, the son of strength, the well-housed, the famous, thee, O Soma, we will follow as thou winnest.

original: somo dhenum somo arvantam āśum somo vīraṃ karmaṇyaṃ dadāti / sādanyaṃ vidathyam sabheyaṃ pitṛśravaṇaṃ yo dadāśad asmai //
analyzed: somaḥ dhenum somaḥ arvantam āśum somaḥ vīram karmaṇyam dadāti  / sādanyam vidathyam sabheyam pitṛ śravaṇam yaḥ dadāśat asmai
translated: Soma gives the milch cow, Soma gives the fleet steed, Soma gives the hero skilled in work, the guest in the house, the friend in the house, the guest in the assembly, the son of strength, the well-housed, the famous, to him who offers him.

original: tvam imā oṣadhīḥ soma viśvās tvam apo ajanayas tvaṃ gāḥ / tvam ā tatanthorv antarikṣaṃ tvaṃ jyotiṣā vi tamo vavartha //
analyzed: tvam imāḥ oṣadhīḥ soma viśvāḥ tvam apaḥ ajanayaḥ tvam gāḥ   tvam ā tatantha uru antarikṣam tvam jyotiṣā vi tamaḥ vavartha
translated: Thou, O Soma, hast created all these plants, thou hast created the waters and the cows. Thou hast stretched out the broad wide atmosphere. With light thou hast dispelled the darkness.

original: devena no manasā deva soma rāyo bhāgam sahasāvann abhi yudhya / mā tvā tanad īśiṣe vīryasyobhayebhyaḥ pra cikitsā gaviṣṭau //
analyzed: devena naḥ manasā deva soma rāyaḥ bhāgam sahasāvan abhi yudhya   mā tvā tanat īśiṣe vīryasya ubhayebhyaḥ pra cikitsa gaviṣṭau
translated: With thy divine mind, O God Soma, O thou who hast a thousand powers, fight for our share of wealth. Let not thy vigour fail thee: show thyself strong for both sides in the fray for cattle.

original: aṣṭau vy akhyat kakubhaḥ pṛthivyās trī dhanva yojanā sapta sindhūn / hiraṇyākṣaḥ savitā deva āgād dadhad ratnā dāśuṣe vāryāṇi //🔽hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā vicarṣaṇir ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī antar īyate / apāmīvāṃ bādhate veti sūryam abhi kṛṣṇena rajasā dyām ṛṇoti //
analyzed: aṣṭau vi akhyat kakubhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ trī dhanva yojanā sapta sindhūn    hiraṇya akṣaḥ savitā devaḥ āgāt dadhat ratnā dāśuṣe vāryāṇi  hiraṇya pāṇiḥ savitā vicarṣaṇiḥ ubhe dyāvāpṛthivī antar īyate   apa amīvām bādhate veti sūryam abhi kṛṣṇena rajasā dyām ṛṇoti
translated: He hath looked forth on the eight regions of earth, on the three rivers' courses, on the seven floods. Savitar, the golden-eyed God, hath come, bringing precious treasures to the worshipper.🔽Savitar, golden-handed, swift to listen, moves between the earth and heaven. He driveth away the demon's spiteful malice, and with his dark-hued robe he veils the sunlight.

original: hiraṇyahasto asuraḥ sunīthaḥ sumṛḍīkaḥ svavā yātv arvāṅ / apasedhan rakṣaso yātudhānān asthād devaḥ pratidoṣaṃ gṛṇānaḥ //
analyzed: hiraṇya hastaḥ asuraḥ su nīthaḥ su mṛḍīkaḥ svavā yātu arvāṅ    apasedhan rakṣasaḥ yātudhānān asthāt devaḥ pratidoṣam gṛṇānaḥ
translated: The Asura, golden-handed, well-disposed, of easy access, with kindly succour, may he come hitherward. Driving away the demons and the Rakshas, the God hath taken up his station, praised with lauds.

original: ye te panthāḥ savitaḥ pūrvyāso 'reṇavaḥ sukṛtā antarikṣe / tebhir no adya pathibhiḥ sugebhī rakṣā ca no adhi ca brūhi deva //
analyzed: ye te panthāḥ savitar pūrvyāsaḥ reṇavaḥ su kṛtāḥ antarikṣe    tebhiḥ naḥ adya pathibhiḥ su gebhiḥ rakṣā ca naḥ adhi ca brūhi deva
translated: Those ancient paths of thine, O Savitar, which are dustless, well-made, in the wide atmosphere, By those good paths of thine this day, O God, protect us, and speak thou to us words of comfort.

original: ubhā pibatam aśvinobhā naḥ śarma yacchatam / avidriyābhir ūtibhiḥ //
analyzed: ubhā pibatam aśvinā ubhā naḥ śarma yacchatam avidriyābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: Drink ye both, O ye Aṣvins, grant ye both a shelter unto us, With aids that fail not.

original: apnasvatīm aśvinā vācam asme kṛtaṃ no dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām / adyūtye 'vase ni hvaye vāṃ vṛdhe ca no bhavataṃ vājasātau //
analyzed: apnasvatīm aśvinā vācam asme kṛtam naḥ dasrā vṛṣaṇā manīṣām    a dyūtye vase ni hvaye vām vṛdhe ca naḥ bhavatam vājasātau
translated: O Asvins, make our speech effectual: ye Wonder-Workers, mighty Ones, accept our thought. I call you to the aid of him who fights no more: be ye to us for increase in the winning of strength.

original: dyubhir aktubhiḥ pari pātam asmān ariṣṭebhir aśvinā saubhagebhiḥ / tan no mitro varuṇo māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ //
analyzed: dyubhiḥ aktubhiḥ pari pātam asmān ariṣṭebhiḥ aśvinā saubhagebhiḥ   tat naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ māmahantām aditiḥ sindhuḥ pṛthivī uta dyauḥ
translated: With your celestial rays, O ye Asvins, guard us with your infallible and happy favours. This boon may Varuna and Mitra grant us, and Aditi and Sindhu, Earth and Heaven.

original: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamāno niveśayann amṛtaṃ martyaṃ ca / hiraṇyayena savitā rathenā devo yāti bhuvanāni paśyan //🔽ā rātri pārthivam rajaḥ pitur aprāyi dhāmabhiḥ / divaḥ sadāmsi bṛhatī vi tiṣṭhasa ā tveṣaṃ vartate tamaḥ //
analyzed: ā kṛṣṇena rajasā vartamānaḥ niveśayan amṛtam martyam ca  / hiraṇyayena savitā rathena ā devaḥ yāti bhuvanāni paśyan  ā rātri pārthivam rajaḥ pituḥ aprāyi dhāmabhiḥ    divaḥ sadāmsi bṛhatī vi tiṣṭhase ā tveṣam vartate tamaḥ
translated: Savitar, moving in the dark-hued region, setting in order immortality and death, Goes on his golden chariot, God, beholding all the worlds of life.🔽O Night, thou hast extended over the earthly region the abode of thy father with thy powers. Thou, lofty One, hast spread abroad the eternal lights of heaven. The darkness wraps thee round, O thou of wondrous form.

original: uṣas tac citram ā bharāsmabhyaṃ vājinīvati / yena tokaṃ ca tanayaṃ ca dhāmahe //
analyzed: uṣaḥ tat citram ā bhara asmabhyam vājinīvati   yena tokam ca tanayam ca dhāmahe
translated: O Dawn, bring hither that wondrous treasure to us, O thou who art rich in wealth, Wherewith we may support our children and our offspring.

original: prātar agniṃ prātar indram havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā / prātar bhagaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇaspatiṃ prātaḥ somam uta rudram huvema //
analyzed: prātar agnim prātar indram havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā  / prātar bhagam pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaspatim prātar somam uta rudram huvema
translated: In the morning we invoke Agni, in the morning Indra, in the morning Mitra-Varuṇa, in the morning the Asvins, In the morning Bhaga, Pûshan, and the Lord of prayer; in the morning Soma, and also Rudra we will invoke.

original: prātarjitaṃ bhagam ugram huvema vayaṃ putram aditer yo vidhartā / ādhraś cid yaṃ manyamānas turaś cid rājā cid yaṃ bhagaṃ bhakṣīty āha //
analyzed: prātar jitam bhagam ugram huvema vayam putram aditeḥ yaḥ vidhartā    ādhraḥ cit yam manyamānaḥ turaḥ cit rājā cit yam bhagam bhakṣi iti āha
translated: Let us invoke the mighty Bhaga, the Victorious, the Son of Aditi, the Ordainer. Even the poor man, thinking of him, the strong man, the king, says, 'I will enjoy Bhaga.'

original: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satyarādho bhagemāṃ dhiyam ud avā dadan naḥ / bhaga pra ṇo janaya gobhir aśvair bhaga pra nṛbhir nṛvantaḥ syāma //
analyzed: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satya rādhaḥ bhaga imām dhiyam ud ava dadan naḥ    bhaga pra naḥ janaya gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ bhaga pra nṛbhiḥ nṛvantaḥ syāma
translated: O Bhaga, leader, Bhaga, whose gifts are true, O Bhaga, raise this thought of ours. O Bhaga, generate us with cattle and horses. O Bhaga, may we be rich in men through men.

original: utedānīṃ bhagavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām / utoditā maghavan sūryasya vayaṃ devānām sumatau syāma //
analyzed: uta idānīm bhagavantaḥ syāma uta prapitve uta madhye ahnām    uta uditā maghavan sūryasya vayam devānām sumatau syāma
translated: Now may we be prosperous, O Bhaga, in the morning, in the middle of the day, and in the evening. And when the sun has risen, O bountiful one, may we be in the favor of the gods.

original: bhaga eva bhagavām astu devās tena vayaṃ bhagavantaḥ syāma / taṃ tvā bhaga sarva ij johavīti sa no bhaga puraetā bhaveha //
analyzed: bhagaḥ eva bhagavām astu devāḥ tena vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma    tam tvā bhaga sarvaḥ id johavīti sa naḥ bhaga puraetā bhava iha
translated: Let Bhaga alone be prosperous, O gods; through him may we be prosperous, O Bhaga. All invoke you, O Bhaga; be you our forerunner, O Bhaga.

original: sam adhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya / arvācīnaṃ vasuvidaṃ bhagaṃ no ratham ivāśvā vājina ā vahantu //
analyzed: sam adhvarāya uṣasaḥ namanta dadhikrāvā iva śucaye padāya    arvācīnam vasu vidam bhagam naḥ ratham iva aśvāḥ vājinaḥ ā vahantu
translated: Let the dawns bow to Bhaga for the sacrifice, like Dadhikrâvan to the pure path. Let them bring us Bhaga, who finds wealth, as it were a chariot, borne by strong horses.

original: aśvāvatīr gomatīr na uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ / ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ //
analyzed: aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ naḥ uṣāsaḥ vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ   ghṛtam duhānāḥ viśvatas prapītāḥ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Let the blessed dawns rise for us, rich in horses, rich in cattle, rich in heroes, always. Giving ghee to be drunk on every side. Do ye preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṃ na riṣyema kadā cana / stotāras ta iha smasi //
analyzed: pūṣan tava vrate vayam na riṣyema kadā cana    stotāraḥ te iha smasi
translated: O Pusan, never may we suffer wrong while we are in thy keeping. We are thy praisers here.

original: pathaspathaḥ paripatiṃ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhy ānaḍ arkam / sa no rāsac churudhaś candrāgrā dhiyaṃdhiyam sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā //
analyzed: pathaspathaḥ paripatim vacasyā kāmena kṛtaḥ abhī ānaṭ arkam    sa naḥ rāsat śurudhaḥ candra agrāḥ dhiyam dhiyam sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā
translated: Along the paths, the way-finder, made by desire, I have approached the sun. May he bestow upon us the sharp, the bright, the pointed, and Pusan shall set each thought in order.

original: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇur gopā adābhyaḥ / ato dharmāṇi dhārayan //
analyzed: trīṇi padā vi cakrame viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ adābhyaḥ   atas dharmāṇi dhārayan
translated: Vishnu, the guardian, the infallible, hath strode along three steps. Thence supporting all the laws.

original: tad viprāso vipanyavo jāgṛvāmsaḥ sam indhate / viṣṇor yat paramaṃ padam //
analyzed: tat viprāsaḥ vipanyavaḥ jāgṛvāmsaḥ sam indhate      viṣṇoḥ yat paramam padam
translated: The singers, the inspired, the watchful, kindle him, the highest place of Vishnu.

original: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānām abhiśriyorvī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā / dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajare bhūriretasā //
analyzed: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānām abhiśriyā urvī pṛthvī madhu dughe supeśasā    dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajare bhūri retasā
translated: Rich in ghee, the abodes of all existing things, the broad, wide earth, the milker of sweetness, fair to behold, the heaven and the earth, by the law of Varuna, the two, the undecaying, the widely prolific, are stretched apart.

original: ye naḥ sapatnā apa te bhavantv indrāgnibhyām ava bādhāmahe tān / vasavo rudrā ādityā uparispṛśaṃ mograṃ cettāram adhirājam akran //
analyzed: ye naḥ sapatnāḥ apa te bhavantu indra agnibhyām ava bādhāmahe tān vasavaḥ rudrāḥ ādityāḥ uparispṛśam mā ugram cettāram adhirājam akran
translated: Let those who are our enemies be turned away. We drive them off with Indra and Agni. The Vasus, Rudras, and Adityas have made me the mighty overlord, the ruler who touches the heights.

original: ā nāsatyā tribhir ekādaśair iha devebhir yātaṃ madhupeyam aśvinā / prāyus tāriṣṭaṃ nī rapāmsi mṛkṣatam sedhataṃ dveṣo bhavatam sacābhuvā //
analyzed: ā nāsatyā tribhiḥ ekādaśaiḥ iha devebhiḥ yātam madhu peyam aśvinā    pra āyuḥ tāriṣṭam niḥ rapāmsi mṛkṣatam sedhatam dveṣaḥ bhavatam sacābhuvā  /
translated: O Nāsatyas, come here with the three groups of eleven gods, O Aśvins, to drink the sweet drink. Extend our life, save us from misfortune, remove our sins, drive away our enemies, be our companions.

original: eṣa va stomo maruta iyaṃ gīr māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ / eṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayāṃ vidyāmeṣaṃ vṛjanaṃ jīradānum //
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ stomaḥ marutaḥ iyam gīḥ māndāryasya mānyasya kāroḥ    ā iṣā yāsīṣṭa tanve vayām vidyāma iṣam vṛjanam jīra dānum
translated: This is your praise, O Maruts, this is your song, of Māndārya, the honored one, the son of Kāra. May this be for your bodies for strength. May we find that which gives life, the people who give easily.

original: sahastomāḥ sahacchandasa āvṛtaḥ sahapramā ṛṣayaḥ sapta daivyāḥ / pūrveṣāṃ panthām anudṛśya dhīrā anvālebhire rathyo na raśmīn //
analyzed: saha stomāḥ saha chandasaḥ āvṛtaḥ saha pramāḥ ṛṣayaḥ sapta daivyāḥ pūrveṣām panthām anudṛśya dhīrāḥ anvālebhire rathyaḥ na raśmīn
translated: The thousand-versed, the same-minded, the same-measured, the seven divine sages, having seen the path of the ancient ones, have followed it like swift horses follow their reins.

original: āyuṣyaṃ varcasyam rāyaspoṣam audbhidam / idam hiraṇyaṃ varcasvaj jaitrāyā viśatād u mām //
analyzed: āyuṣyam varcasyam rāyaspoṣam audbhidam   idam hiraṇyam varcasvat jaitrāyāḥ viśatāt u mām
translated: This life-giving, splendor-giving, wealth-increasing, sprouting gold, this shining gold, may it enter me for victory.

original: na tad rakṣāmsi na piśācās taranti devānām ojaḥ prathamajam hy etat / yo bibharti dākṣāyaṇam hiraṇyam sa deveṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ sa manuṣyeṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ //
analyzed: na tat rakṣāmsi na piśācāḥ taranti devānām ojaḥ prathama jam hi etat    yaḥ bibharti dākṣāyaṇam hiraṇyam sa deveṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ sa manuṣyeṣu kṛṇute dīrgham āyuḥ
translated: Neither Rakshasas nor Pisachas over- come it, for this is the first-born power of the Gods. He who wears the gold of Daksha's son, makes for himself long life among the Gods, and long life among mankind.

original: yad ābadhnan dākṣāyaṇā hiraṇyam śatānīkāya sumanasyamānāḥ / tan ma ā badhnāmi śataśāradāyāyuṣmān jaradaṣṭir yathāsam //
analyzed: yat ābadhnan dākṣāyaṇāḥ hiraṇyam śatānīkāya sumanasyamānāḥ   tat me ā badhnāmi śata śāradāya āyuṣmān jaradaṣṭiḥ yathā āsam
translated: The gold which the sons of Daksha, with joyful hearts, bound on the neck of Shatanika, that I now bind on thee for a hundred autumns, that thou mayst live a long life, and be free from sickness.

original: uta no 'hir budhnyaḥ śṛṇotv aja ekapāt pṛthivī samudraḥ / viśve devā ṛtāvṛdho huvānā stutā mantrāḥ kaviśastā avantu //
analyzed: uta naḥ hiḥ budhnyaḥ śṛṇotu ajaḥ eka pād pṛthivī samudraḥ    viśve devāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ huvānāḥ stutāḥ mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ avantu
translated: May the Ahi Budhnya, the one-footed, the earth, the ocean, listen to us. May the All-Gods, increasers of truth, when called, and the hymns praised by the sages, protect us.

original: imā gira ādityebhyo ghṛtasnūḥ sanād rājabhyo juhvā juhomi / śṛṇotu mitro aryamā bhago nas tuvijāto varuṇo dakṣo amśaḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ ādityebhyaḥ ghṛtasnūḥ sanāt rājabhyaḥ juhvā juhomi    śṛṇotu mitraḥ aryamā bhagaḥ naḥ tuvi jātaḥ varuṇaḥ dakṣaḥ amśaḥ
translated: These hymns, bathed in ghee, I offer to the Adityas, the eternal kings, with the ladle. May Mitra, Aryaman, Bhaga, the mighty, Varuna, Daksha, Amsha listen to us.

original: sapta ṛṣayaḥ pratihitāḥ śarīre sapta rakṣanti sadam apramādam / saptāpaḥ svapato lokam īyus tatra jāgṛto asvapnajau satrasadau ca devau //
analyzed: sapta ṛṣayaḥ pratihitāḥ śarīre sapta rakṣanti sadam apramādam    sapta apaḥ svapataḥ lokam īyuḥ tatra jāgṛtaḥ a svapna jau satra sadau ca devau
translated: The seven Rishis are appointed in the body; seven always watch over it with care. Seven waters go to the sleeping man's world; there the two gods who watch and are not asleep, and the two who sit in the session, are.

original: ut tiṣṭha brahmaṇaspate devayantas tvemahe / upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānava indra prāśūr bhavā sacā //
analyzed: ud tiṣṭha brahmaṇaspate devayantaḥ tvā īmahe    upa pra yantu marutaḥ sudānavaḥ indra prāśūḥ bhava sacā
translated: Rise up, O Lord of prayer, we who long for the gods honour thee. Let the bountiful Maruts advance, O Indra, be ready with the draught.

original: pra nūnaṃ brahmaṇaspatir mantraṃ vadaty ukthyam / yasminn indro varuṇo mitro aryamā devā okāmsi cakrire //
analyzed: pra nūnam brahmaṇaspatiḥ mantram vadati ukthyam   yasmin indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā devāḥ okāmsi cakrire
translated: Now indeed the Lord of prayer speaks the hymn worthy of praise, in whom Indra, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman, the gods have made their seats.

original: brahmaṇaspate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayaṃ ca jinva / viśvaṃ tad bhadraṃ yad avanti devā bṛhad vadema vidathe suvīrāḥ //
analyzed: brahmaṇaspate tvam asya yantā sūktasya bodhi tanayam ca jinva        tat bhadram yat avanti devāḥ bṛhat vadema vidathe su vīrāḥ
translated: O Lord of prayer, thou art the impeller of this hymn, be thou the supporter and quicken the son. All that good thing which the gods favour, with great strength may we speak in the assembly, with brave sons.

original: ya imā viśvā / viśvakarmā / yo naḥ pitā / annapate 'nnasya no dehi //
analyzed: yaḥ imā viśvā   viśva karmā   yaḥ naḥ pitā   anna pate nnasya naḥ dehi
translated: He who all these. All-worker. He who is our father. O Lord of food, give us food.

original: apeto yantu paṇayo 'sumnā devapīyavaḥ / asya lokaḥ sutāvataḥ //
analyzed: apa itas yantu paṇayaḥ sumnā deva pīyavaḥ   asya lokaḥ sutāvataḥ
translated: Let the worthless, the inauspicious, the godless go away. This world is for the virtuous.

original: dyubhir ahobhir aktubhir vyaktaṃ yamo dadātv avasānam asmai //
analyzed: dyubhiḥ ahobhiḥ aktubhiḥ vyaktam yamaḥ dadātu avasānam asmai
translated: May Yama give him a place to dwell, marked by the lights, the days, and the nights.

original: savitā te śarīrebhyaḥ pṛthivyāṃ lokam icchatu / tasmia yujyantām usriyāḥ //
analyzed: savitā te śarīrebhyaḥ pṛthivyām lokam icchatu tasmia yujyantām usriyāḥ
translated: May Savitar seek a place for thee on earth among the bodies. Let the cows be yoked for him.

original: vāyuḥ punātu / savitā punātu / agner bhrājasā / sūryasya varcasā / vi mucyantām usriyāḥ //
analyzed: vāyuḥ punātu savitā punātu   agneḥ bhrājasā   sūryasya varcasā   vi mucyantām usriyāḥ
translated: May Vayu purify. May Savitar purify. By the radiance of Agni, by the splendour of the sun. Let the cows be released.

original: aśvatthe vo niṣadanaṃ parṇe vo vasatiṣ kṛtā / gobhāja it kilāsatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam //
analyzed: aśvatthe vaḥ niṣadanam parṇe vaḥ vasatiḥ kṛtā   go bhājaḥ id kila asatha yat sanavatha pūruṣam
translated: Your seat is in the holy fig-tree, your dwelling is made in the leaf. Ye are verily sharers of the cow when ye restore the man to life.

original: savitā te śarīrāṇi mātur upastha ā vapatu / tasmai pṛthivi śaṃ bhava //
analyzed: savitā te śarīrāṇi mātuḥ upasthe ā vapatu   tasmai pṛthivi śam bhava
translated: May Savitar spread out thy limbs in the lap of thy mother. Be thou propitious to him, O Earth.

original: prajāpatau tvā devatāyām upodake loke ni dadhāmy asau / apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: prajāpatau tvā devatāyām upodake loke ni dadhāmi asau apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: In Prajapati, the deity, in the region of the waters, I place thee, N.N. Drive away our sin.

original: paraṃ mṛtyo anu parehi panthāṃ yas te anya itaro devayānāt / cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajām rīriṣo mota vīrān //🔽śaṃ vātaḥ śam hi te ghṛṇiḥ śaṃ te bhavantv iṣṭakāḥ / śaṃ te bhavantv agnayaḥ pārthivāso mā tvābhi śūśucan //
analyzed: param mṛtyo anu parehi panthām yaḥ te anyaḥ itaraḥ deva yānāt    cakṣuṣmate śṛṇvate te bravīmi mā naḥ prajām rīriṣaḥ mā uta vīrān  śam vātaḥ śam hi te ghṛṇiḥ śam te bhavantu iṣṭakāḥ   śam te bhavantu agnayaḥ pārthivāsaḥ mā tvā abhi śūśucan
translated: Go beyond death, O Death, along the path which is other than that of the gods. I speak to thee who hast eyes and hearest. Harm not our children nor our heroes.🔽Be the wind propitious to thee, be the sun propitious to thee. Be the bricks propitious to thee. Be the fires propitious to thee, O earthly one. Let them not burn thee.

original: kalpantāṃ te diśas tubhyam āpaḥ śivatamās tubhyaṃ bhavantu sindhavaḥ / antarikṣam śivaṃ tubhyaṃ kalpantāṃ te diśaḥ sarvāḥ //
analyzed: kalpantām te diśaḥ tubhyam āpaḥ śivatamāḥ tubhyam bhavantu sindhavaḥ    antarikṣam śivam tubhyam kalpantām te diśaḥ sarvāḥ
translated: May the quarters be favourable to thee. May the waters be most propitious to thee. May the rivers be propitious to thee. May the sky be propitious to thee. May all the quarters be favourable to thee.

original: aśmanvatī rīyate sam rabhadhvam ut tiṣṭhata pra taratā sakhāyaḥ / atra jahīmo 'śivā ye asañchivān vayam uttaremābhi vājān //🔽apāgham apa kilviṣam apa kṛtyām apo rapaḥ / apāmārga tvam asmad apa duḥṣvapnyam suva //
analyzed: aśmanvatī rīyate sam rabhadhvam ud tiṣṭhata pra tarata sakhāyaḥ    atra jahīmaḥ śivāḥ ye asan śivān vayam uttarema abhi vājān  apa agham apa kilviṣam apa kṛtyām apa u rapaḥ apa amārga tvam asmat apa duḥṣvapnyam suva
translated: The water-bearing (cow) is milked; be ready, rise up, O friends, and pass over. Here let us leave the inauspicious ones who are not good. Let us go to the auspicious prizes.🔽Drive away misfortune, drive away sin, drive away sorcery, drive away disease. O Apamarga, drive away from us evil, drive away bad dreams.

original: sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyās tasmai santu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ //
analyzed: su mitriyāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyāḥ tasmai santu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: May the waters and plants be friendly to us. Unfriendly may they be to him who hates us and whom we hate.

original: anaḍvāham ā rabhāmahe saurabheyam svastaye / sa na indra iva devebhyo vahniḥ saṃtaraṇo bhava //
analyzed: anaḍvāham ā rabhāmahe saurabheyam svastaye    sa naḥ indraḥ iva devebhyaḥ vahniḥ saṃtaraṇaḥ bhava
translated: We take hold of the bull, the son of Surabhi, for our welfare. Like Indra to the gods, may he be our bearer across (difficulties).

original: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari svaḥ paśyanta uttaram / devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari svar paśyantaḥ uttaram    devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam
translated: We have risen from the darkness, beholding the light above. We have gone to the god, to the godlike sun, to the highest light.

original: imaṃ jīvebhyaḥ paridhiṃ dadhāmi maiṣāṃ nu gād aparo artham etam / śataṃ jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīr antar mṛtyuṃ dadhatāṃ parvatena //
analyzed: imam jīvebhyaḥ paridhim dadhāmi mā eṣām nu gāt aparaḥ artham etam    śatam jīvantu śaradaḥ purūcīḥ antar mṛtyum dadhatām parvatena
translated: I set this boundary for the living. Let none of them go beyond this to the other world. Let them live a hundred full years. Let them keep death away with the mountain.

original: agna āyūmṣi pavasva ā suvorjam iṣaṃ ca naḥ / āre bādhasva ducchunām //
analyzed: agne āyūmṣi pavasva ā suva ūrjam iṣam ca naḥ        bādhasva ducchunām
translated: O Agni, purify our lives, and grant us food and strength. Drive away evil.

original: āyuṣmān agne haviṣā vṛdhāno ghṛtaprsatīko ghṛtayonir edhi / ghṛtaṃ pītvā madhu cāru gavyaṃ piteva putram abhi rakṣatād imānt svāhā //
analyzed: āyuṣmān agne haviṣā vṛdhānaḥ ghṛta prsatīkaḥ ghṛta yoniḥ edhi  / ghṛtam pītvā madhu cāru gavyam pitā iva putram abhi rakṣatāt imān svāhā
translated: O Agni, long-lived, growing by the offering, be thou the enjoyer of ghee, the source of ghee. Having drunk the sweet, lovely ghee of the cow, may he protect these (people) as a father his son. Svâhâ!

original: parīme gām aneṣata pary agnim ahṛṣata / deveṣv akrata śravaḥ ka imām ā dadharṣati //
analyzed: pari ime gām aneṣata pari agnim ahṛṣata     deveṣu akrata śravaḥ kaḥ imām ā dadharṣati
translated: They have gone round this cow, they have gone round the fire. They have made fame among the gods. Who will dare to attack this (cow)?

original: kravyādam agniṃ pra hiṇomi dūraṃ yamarājyaṃ gacchatu ripravāhaḥ / ihaivāyam itaro jātavedā devebhyo havyaṃ vahatu prajānan //
analyzed: kravya adam agnim pra hiṇomi dūram yama rājyam gacchatu ripra vāhaḥ    iha eva ayam itaraḥ jātavedāḥ devebhyaḥ havyam vahatu prajānan
translated: I send away the flesh-eating Agni to a distance. Let the carrier of impurity go to Yama's realm. Let this other Jâtavedas, right here, knowing, carry the offering to the gods.

original: vaha vapāṃ jātavedaḥ pitṛbhyo yatrainān vettha nihitān parāke / medasaḥ kulyā upa tānt sravantu satyā eṣām āśiṣaḥ saṃ namantām svāhā //
analyzed: vaha vapām jātavedaḥ pitṛbhyaḥ yatra enān vettha nihitān parāke    medasaḥ kulyāḥ upa tān sravantu satyāḥ eṣām āśiṣaḥ sam namantām svāhā
translated: Carry the omentum, O Jâtavedas, to the Fathers, where thou knowest them laid out in the distance. Let the streams of fat flow to them. Let their wishes be fulfilled. Let them be appeased. Svâhâ!

original: syonā pṛthivi no bhavānṛkṣarā niveśanī / yacchā naḥ śarma saprathāḥ //
analyzed: syonā pṛthivi naḥ bhava anṛkṣarā niveśanī    yaccha naḥ śarma saprathāḥ
translated: Be thou kindly unto us, O Earth, free from thorns, a resting-place. Grant us wide shelter.

original: apa naḥ śośucad agham //
analyzed: apa naḥ śośucat agham
translated: Drive thou away our sin.

original: asmāt tvam adhi jāto 'si tvad ayaṃ jāyatāṃ punaḥ / asau svargāya lokāya svāhā //
analyzed: asmāt tvam adhi jātaḥ u si tvat ayam jāyatām punar asau svargāya lokāya svāhā
translated: From out of this (earth) thou hast been born. From thee let him be born again. This (earth) for the heavenly world. Svâhâ!

original: ṛcaṃ vācaṃ pra padye mano yajuḥ pra padye sāma prāṇaṃ pra padye cakṣuḥ śrotraṃ pra padye / vāg ojaḥ sahaujo mayi prāṇāpānau //
analyzed: ṛcam vācam pra padye manaḥ yajuḥ pra padye sāma prāṇam pra padye cakṣuḥ śrotram pra padye    vāc ojaḥ saha ojaḥ mayi prāṇa apānau
translated: I enter into speech which is the Ṛc verse; I enter into the mind which is the Yajuṣ; I enter into the breath which is the Sāman; I enter into the eye and the ear; may speech, strength, and vigour be in me, and the in-breathing and the out-breathing.

original: yan me chidraṃ cakṣuṣo hṛdayasya manaso vātitṛṇaṃ bṛhaspatir me tad dadhātu / śaṃ no bhavatu bhuvanasya yas patiḥ //
analyzed: yat me chidram cakṣuṣaḥ hṛdayasya manasaḥ vā atitṛṇam bṛhaspatiḥ me tat dadhātu    śam naḥ bhavatu bhuvanasya yaḥ patiḥ
translated: Whatever defect there is in my eye, in my heart, in my mind, may Brhaspati make good that for me. May he be the lord of the world, may he be gracious to us.

original: bhūr bhuvaḥ svaḥ / tat savitur vareṇyaṃ bhargo devasya dhīmahi / dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayat //🔽kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā / kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā //
analyzed: bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar   tat savituḥ vareṇyam bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi   dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayat  kayā naḥ citraḥ ā bhuvat ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā   kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā
translated: Earth, ether, heaven. That excellent glory of Savitar the God may we meditate, that he may stimulate our prayers.🔽By what wondrous help wilt thou come to us, O thou who givest good, as a friend ever waxing great? By what most mighty company?

original: kas tvā satyo madānāṃ mamhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ / dṛḍhā cid āruje vasu //
analyzed: kaḥ tvā satyaḥ madānām mamhiṣṭhaḥ matsat andhasaḥ    dṛḍhā cit āruje vasu
translated: What truth of thine, O gladdener, most liberal, of the gladdening drink, will thou burst open even the firm-set wealth?

original: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām / śataṃ bhavāsy ūtaye //
analyzed: abhi su naḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām    śatam bhavāsi ūtaye
translated: Be thou the guardian of our friends, the helper of our worshippers. Be thou a hundredfold to aid.

original: kayā tvam na ūtyābhi pra mandase vṛṣan / kayā stotṛbhya ā bhara //
analyzed: kayā tvam naḥ ūtyā abhi pra mandase vṛṣan   kayā stotṛbhyaḥ ā bhara
translated: By what favour wilt thou delight us, O strong one? By what (favour) wilt thou bring to the praisers?

original: indro viśvasya rājati / śaṃ no astu dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade //
analyzed: indraḥ viśvasya rājati   śam naḥ astu dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: Indra rules over all. May he be gracious to our bipeds and to our quadrupeds.

original: śaṃ no mitram śaṃ varuṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavatv aryamā / śaṃ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ śaṃ no viṣṇur urukramaḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ mitram śam varuṇaḥ śam naḥ bhavatu aryamā   śam naḥ indraḥ bṛhaspatiḥ śam naḥ viṣṇuḥ uru kramaḥ
translated: May Mitra be gracious to us, may Varuna, may Aryaman be gracious. May Indra be gracious, and Brihaspati, and Vishnu of the wide stride.

original: śaṃ no vātaḥ pavatām śaṃ nas tapatu sūryaḥ / śaṃ naḥ kanikradad devaḥ parjanyo abhi varṣatu //
analyzed: śam naḥ vātaḥ pavatām śam naḥ tapatu sūryaḥ   śam naḥ kanikradat devaḥ parjanyaḥ abhi varṣatu
translated: May the wind blow auspiciously for us, may the sun shine auspiciously. May the thundering god Parjanya rain auspiciously.

original: ahāni śaṃ bhavantu naḥ śam rātrīḥ prati dhīyatām / śaṃ na indrāgnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śaṃ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā / śaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau śam indrāsomā suvitāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: ahāni śam bhavantu naḥ śam rātrīḥ prati dhīyatām   śam naḥ indra agnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śam naḥ indrāvaruṇā rāta havyā   śam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau śam indrāsomā suvitāya śam yoḥ
translated: May the days be auspicious for us, may the nights be auspicious. May Indra and Agni be auspicious to us with their favours, may Indra and Varuna who accept offerings be auspicious to us. May Indra and Pushan in the winning of strength be auspicious, may Indra and Soma be auspicious for prosperity and peace.

original: śaṃ no devīr abhiṣṭaya āpo bhavantu pītaye / śaṃ yor abhi sravantu naḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ devīḥ abhiṣṭaye āpaḥ bhavantu pītaye   śam yos abhi sravantu naḥ
translated: May the divine waters be auspicious to us for drinking and for sprinkling. May they flow auspiciously to us.

original: syonā pṛthivi no bhavānṛkṣarā niveśanī / yacchā naḥ śarma saprathāḥ //
analyzed: syonā pṛthivi naḥ bhava anṛkṣarā niveśanī    yaccha naḥ śarma saprathāḥ
translated: Be thou soft and free from thorns, O Earth, to sit upon. Grant us wide shelter.

original: āpo hi ṣṭhā mayobhuvas tā na ūrje dadhātana / mahe raṇāya cakṣase //
analyzed: āpaḥ hi stha mayobhuvaḥ tāḥ naḥ ūrje dadhātana mahe raṇāya cakṣase
translated: Ye waters are beneficent: bestow upon us strength, for great enjoyment and for sight.

original: yo vaḥ śivatamo rasas tasya bhājayateha naḥ / uśatīr iva mātaraḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ śivatamaḥ rasaḥ tasya bhājayata iha naḥ    uśatīḥ iva mātaraḥ
translated: Of that most auspicious juice of yours, O ye waters, grant unto us a portion, as to loving mothers.

original: tasmā araṃ gamāma vo yasya kṣayāya jinvatha / āpo janayathā ca naḥ //
analyzed: tasmai aram gamāma vaḥ yasya kṣayāya jinvatha    āpaḥ janayatha ca naḥ
translated: Therefore, we come to you, for whose enjoyment ye quicken, and beget us children.

original: dyauḥ śāntir antarikṣam śāntiḥ pṛthivī śāntir āpaḥ śāntir oṣadhayaḥ śāntiḥ / vanaspatayaḥ śāntir viśve devāḥ śāntir brahma śāntiḥ sarvam śāntiḥ śāntir eva śāntiḥ sā mā śāntir edhi //
analyzed: dyauḥ śāntiḥ antarikṣam śāntiḥ pṛthivī śāntiḥ āpaḥ śāntiḥ oṣadhayaḥ śāntiḥ   vanaspatayaḥ śāntiḥ viśve devāḥ śāntiḥ brahma śāntiḥ sarvam śāntiḥ śāntiḥ eva śāntiḥ sā mā śāntiḥ edhi
translated: Heaven is peace, the atmosphere is peace, the earth is peace, the waters are peace, the plants are peace, the trees are peace, the All-gods are peace, the Brahman is peace, all is peace, peace itself is peace. May that peace be for me.

original: dṛte dṛmha mā mitrasya mā cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi bhūtāni sam īkṣantām / mitrasyāhaṃ cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi bhūtāni samīkṣe / mitrasya cakṣuṣā sam īkṣāmahe //
analyzed: dṛte dṛmha mā mitrasya mā cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi bhūtāni sam īkṣantām      mitrasya aham cakṣuṣā sarvāṇi bhūtāni samīkṣe    mitrasya cakṣuṣā sam īkṣāmahe
translated: O Drita, be firm. May all beings look upon me with the eye of Mitra. I look upon all beings with the eye of Mitra. We look upon (each other) with the eye of Mitra.

original: dṛte dṛmha mā / jyok te saṃdṛśi jīvyāsaṃ jyok te saṃdṛśi jīvyāsam //🔽namas te harase śociṣe namas te astv arciṣe / anyāms te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvako asmabhyam śivo bhava //
analyzed: dṛte dṛmha mā   jyok te saṃdṛśi jīvyāsam jyok te saṃdṛśi jīvyāsam  namaḥ te harase śociṣe namaḥ te astu arciṣe   anyān te asmat tapantu hetayaḥ pāvakaḥ asmabhyam śivaḥ bhava
translated: O Drita, be firm. May I live to see thee long. May I live to see thee long.🔽Homage to thy flame, homage to thy glow, homage be to thy dart. Let thy darts burn against others than us. Be thou pure and auspicious to us.

original: namas te astu vidyute namas te stanayitnave / namas te bhagavann astu yataḥ svaḥ samīhase //
analyzed: namaḥ te astu vidyute namaḥ te stanayitnave   namaḥ te bhagavan astu yatas svar samīhase
translated: Homage to thee, O lightning, homage to thee, O thunder. Homage be to thee, O Lord, from whom thou sendest forth the lightning.

original: yatoyataḥ samīhase tato no abhayaṃ kuru / śaṃ naḥ kuru prajābhyo 'bhayaṃ naḥ paśubhyaḥ //
analyzed: yatas yatas samīhase tatas naḥ abhayam kuru   śam naḥ kuru prajābhyaḥ bhayam naḥ paśubhyaḥ
translated: From whatever quarter thou seekest us, from that quarter give us freedom from fear. Give us freedom from fear to our offspring, freedom from fear to our cattle.

original: sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyās tasmai santu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ //
analyzed: su mitriyāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyāḥ tasmai santu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: May the waters and plants be friendly to us. Unfriendly may they be to him who hateth us and whom we hate.

original: tac cakṣur devahitaṃ purastāc chukram uc carat / paśyema śaradaḥ śataṃ jīvema śaradaḥ śatam śṛṇuyāma śaradaḥ śataṃ pra bravāma śaradaḥ śatam adīnāḥ syāma śaradaḥ śataṃ bhūyaś ca śaradaḥ śatāt //
analyzed: tat cakṣuḥ deva hitam purastāt śukram ud carat  / paśyema śaradaḥ śatam jīvema śaradaḥ śatam śṛṇuyāma śaradaḥ śatam pra  bravāma śaradaḥ śatam a dīnāḥ syāma śaradaḥ śatam bhūyaḥ ca śaradaḥ śatāt  /
translated: That eye which is friendly to the gods, the bright one, riseth up in the east. A hundred autumns may we see it. A hundred autumns may we live. A hundred autumns may we hear. A hundred autumns may we speak. A hundred autumns may we breathe. A hundred autumns may we move about. A hundred autumns and more than a hundred autumns.

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade nārir asi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām    ā dade nāriḥ asi
translated: By the impulse of God Savitar, with the arms of the two Asvins, with the hands of Pusan, I take thee. Thou art a woman.

original: yuñjate mana uta yuñjate dhiyo viprā viprasya bṛhato vipaścitaḥ / vi hotrā dadhe vayunāvid eka in mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ svāhā //
analyzed: yuñjate manaḥ uta yuñjate dhiyaḥ viprāḥ viprasya bṛhataḥ vipaścitaḥ    vi hotrā dadhe vayunā vid ekaḥ id mahī devasya savituḥ pariṣṭutiḥ svāhā
translated: They yoke the mind, they yoke the thoughts, the priests of the great wise God. He, the knower of beings, hath assigned the Hotras. Great is the praise of God Savitar. All hail!

original: devī dyāvāpṛthivī makhasya vm adya śiro rādhyāsaṃ devayajane pṛthivyāḥ / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //
analyzed: devī dyāvāpṛthivī makhasya vm adya śiraḥ rādhyāsam devayajane pṛthivyāḥ   makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe
translated: O Goddesses Heaven and Earth, I will to-day set up the head of Makha on the altar of the earth. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha.

original: devyo vamryo bhūtasya prathamajā makhasya vo 'dya śiro rādhyāsaṃ devayajane pṛthivyāḥ / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //🔽iyaty agre āsīn makhasya te 'dya śiro rādhyāsaṃ devayajane pṛthivyāḥ / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //
analyzed: devyaḥ vamryaḥ bhūtasya prathama jāḥ makhasya vaḥ dya śiraḥ rādhyāsam devayajane pṛthivyāḥ    makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe  iyatī agre āsīt makhasya te dya śiraḥ rādhyāsam devayajane pṛthivyāḥ   makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe
translated: O Goddesses Vamra, first-born of being, I will to-day set up the head of Makha on the altar of the earth. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha.🔽So great was it in the beginning. I will to-day set up the head of Makha on the altar of the earth. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha.

original: indrasyauja stha makhasya vo 'dya śiro rādhyāsaṃ devayajane pṛthivyāḥ / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //
analyzed: indrasya ojaḥ stha makhasya vaḥ dya śiraḥ rādhyāsam devayajane pṛthivyāḥ   makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe
translated: Ye are Indra's strength. I will to-day set up the head of Makha on the altar of the earth. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha.

original: praitu brahmaṇas patiḥ pra devy etu sūnṛtā / acchā vīraṃ naryaṃ paṅktirādhasaṃ devā yajñaṃ nayantu naḥ //
analyzed: praitu brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ pra devī etu sūnṛtā   acchā vīram naryam paṅkti rādhasam devāḥ yajñam nayantu naḥ
translated: Let Brahmanaspati depart, let the Goddess Sūnritā come. Let the Gods lead our sacrifice to the hero, the manly, the giver of the Pankti (hymn-form).

original: makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //🔽makhasya śiro 'si / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe / makhasya śiro 'si / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe / makhasya śiro 'si / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //
analyzed: makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe  makhasya śiraḥ si   makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe    makhasya śiraḥ si   makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe                              tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe
translated: For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee! For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee! For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee!🔽Thou art the head of Makha. For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee! Thou art the head of Makha. For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee! Thou art the head of Makha. For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee!

original: makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //
analyzed: makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe
translated: For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee! For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee! For Makha thee! For Makha's head thee!

original: aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmi devayajane pṛthivyāḥ / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe / aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmi devayajane pṛthivyāḥ / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe / aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmi devayajane pṛthivyāḥ / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //🔽ṛjave tvā / sādhave tvā / sukṣityai tvā / makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe //
analyzed: aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmi devayajane pṛthivyāḥ   makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe   aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmi devayajane pṛthivyāḥ    makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe    aśvasya tvā vṛṣṇaḥ śaknā dhūpayāmi devayajane pṛthivyāḥ    makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe                                                                                                                                                        ṛjave tvā sādhave tvā   su kṣityai tvā    makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe makhāya tvā makhasya tvā śīrṣṇe
translated: I fumigate thee, O horse, the strong one's hide, on the altar of the earth, for Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha. I fumigate thee, O horse, the strong one's hide, on the altar of the earth, for Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha. I fumigate thee, O horse, the strong one's hide, on the altar of the earth, for Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha. Thee for Makha, thee for the head of Makha.🔽For the upright thee! For the good thee! For good abode thee! For Makha thee! For the head of Makha thee! For Makha thee! For the head of Makha thee! For Makha thee! For the head of Makha thee!

original: yamāya tvā / makhāya tvā / sūryasya tvā tapase / devas tvā savitā madhvānaktu / pṛthivyāḥ samspṛśas pāhi / arcir asi śocir asi tapo 'si //
analyzed: yamāya tvā   makhāya tvā   sūryasya tvā tapase    devaḥ tvā savitā madhvā anaktu   pṛthivyāḥ samspṛśaḥ pāhi   arciḥ asi śociḥ asi tapaḥ si
translated: For Yama thee! For Makha thee! For the heat of Surya thee! Let the god Savitar anoint thee with honey. Guard the touches of the earth. Thou art the flame, thou art the glow, thou art the heat.

original: anādhṛṣṭā purastād agner ādhipatya āyur me dāḥ / putravato dakṣiṇata indrasyādhipatye prajāṃ me dāḥ / suṣadā paścād devasya savitur ādhipatye cakṣur me dāḥ / āsrutir uttarato dhātur ādhipatye rāyaspoṣaṃ me dāḥ / vidhṛtir upariṣṭād bṛhaspater ādhipatye ojo me dāḥ / viśvābhyo mā nāṣṭrābhyas pāhi / manor aśvāsi //
analyzed: anādhṛṣṭā purastāt agneḥ ādhipatye āyuḥ me dāḥ   putravataḥ dakṣiṇatas indrasya ādhipatye prajām me dāḥ   suṣadā paścāt devasya savituḥ ādhipatye cakṣuḥ me dāḥ   āsrutiḥ uttaratas dhātuḥ ādhipatye rāyaspoṣam me dāḥ    vidhṛtiḥ upariṣṭāt bṛhaspateḥ ādhipatye ojaḥ me dāḥ    viśvābhyaḥ mā nāṣṭrābhyaḥ pāhi    manoḥ aśvā asi
translated: Unconquered art thou in front. In the overlordship of Agni bestow life upon me. In the overlordship of Indra, on the right, with the prosperous, bestow offspring upon me. In the overlordship of the god Savitar, on the left, bestow sight upon me. In the overlordship of the creator, above, bestow prosperity upon me. In the overlordship of Brihaspati, above, bestow strength upon me. Guard me from all the Nâsatyas. Thou art the steed of Manu.

original: svāhā marudbhiḥ pari śrīyasva / divaḥ samspṛśas pāhi / madhu madhu madhu //
analyzed: svāhā marudbhiḥ pari śrīyasva   divaḥ samspṛśaḥ pāhi   madhu madhu madhu
translated: Hail! Be thou glorified with the Maruts. Protect the sky-kissing (waters). Sweet, sweet, sweet!🔽The father of the gods, the lord of thoughts, the lord of offspring,

original: g devānāṃ pitā matīnāṃ patiḥ prajānām / saṃ devo devena savitrā gata sam sūryeṇa rocate //
analyzed: g devānām pitā matīnām patiḥ prajānām    sam devaḥ devena savitrā gata sam sūryeṇa rocate
translated: The god hath gone with the god Savitar, he shineth with the sun.

original: sam agnir agninā gata saṃ daivena savitrā sam sūryeṇārociṣṭa / svāhā sam agnis tapasā gata saṃ daivyena savitrā sam sūryeṇārūrucata //
analyzed: sam agniḥ agninā gata sam daivena savitrā sam sūryeṇa arociṣṭa svāhā sam agniḥ tapasā gata sam daivyena savitrā sam sūryeṇa arūrucata
translated: Agni hath gone with Agni, with the divine Savitar, he hath shone with the sun. Hail! Agni hath gone with the heat, with the divine Savitar, he hath shone with the sun.

original: dhartā divo vi bhāti tapasas pṛthivyāṃ dhartā devo devānām amartyas tapojāḥ / vācam asme ni yaccha devāyuvam //
analyzed: dhartā divaḥ vi bhāti tapasaḥ pṛthivyām dhartā devaḥ devānām amartyaḥ tapaḥ jāḥ    vācam asme ni yaccha devāyuvam
translated: The supporter of heaven shines forth in the heat on earth, the immortal god among the gods, born of heat. Bestow upon us speech that is dear to the gods.

original: apaśyaṃ gopām anipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiś carantam / sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīr vasāna ā varīvartti bhuvaneṣv antaḥ //
analyzed: apaśyam gopām a nipadyamānam ā ca parā ca pathibhiḥ carantam     sa sadhrīcīḥ sa viṣūcīḥ vasānaḥ ā varīvarti bhuvaneṣu antar
translated: I have seen the guardian who never stumbles, moving along the paths that go and return. He, wearing the same directions, the same and opposite, moves about within the worlds.

original: viśvāsāṃ bhuvāṃ pate viśvasya manasas pate viśvasya vacasas pate sarvasya vacasas pate / devaśrut tvaṃ deva gharma devo devān pāhi / atra prāvīr anu vāṃ devavītaye / madhu mādhvībhyāṃ madhu mādhūcībhyām //
analyzed: viśvāsām bhuvām pate viśvasya manasaḥ pate viśvasya vacasaḥ pate sarvasya vacasaḥ pate
translated: Lord of all existing things, lord of the mind of all, lord of all speech, lord of every word, heard by the gods, O divine Gharma, protect the gods, O god. Here I have brought you for the feast of the gods. Honey for the two honey-lovers, honey for the two honey-makers.

original: hṛde tvā manase tvā dive tvā sūryāya tvā / ūrdhvo adhvaraṃ divi deveṣu dhehi //
analyzed: hṛde tvā manase tvā dive tvā sūryāya tvā        adhvaram divi deveṣu dhehi
translated: For the heart thee, for the mind thee, for the sky thee, for the sun thee. Upright, place the sacrifice in the sky among the gods.

original: pitā no 'si pitā no bodhi namas te astu mā mā himsīḥ / tvaṣṭṛmantas tvā sapema putrān paśūn mayi dhehi prajām asmāsu dhehy ariṣṭāham sahapatyā bhūyāsam //
analyzed: pitā naḥ si pitā naḥ bodhi namaḥ te astu mā mā himsīḥ   tvaṣṭṛmantaḥ tvā sapema putrān paśūn mayi dhehi prajām asmāsu dhehi  ariṣṭā aham sahapatyā bhūyāsam
translated: You are our father, be a father to us. Let there be homage to you, do not injure me. We enjoy you with Tvastr. Place sons and cattle in me. Place offspring in us. May I be safe with my husband.

original: ahaḥ ketunā juṣatām sujyotir jyotiṣā svāhā / rātriḥ ketunā juṣatām sujyotir jyotiṣā svāhā //
analyzed: ahar ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā   rātriḥ ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā
translated: May the Day, accepted with the banner, with the light of good light, Svâhâ! May the Night, accepted with the banner, with the light of good light, Svâhâ!

original: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave 'śvinor bāhubhyāṃ pūṣṇo hastābhyām / ā dade 'dityai rāsnāsi //
analyzed: devasya tvā savituḥ prasave śvinoḥ bāhubhyām pūṣṇaḥ hastābhyām    ā dade dityai rāsnā asi
translated: In the impulse of God Savitar I take thee with arms of the Asvins, with the hands of Pûshan. Thou art the girdle of Aditi.

original: iḍa ehi / adita ehi / sarasvatty ehi / asāv ehi / asāv ehi / asāv ehi //
analyzed: iḍe ehi adite ehi sarasvatti ehi   asau ehi asau ehi asau ehi
translated: Come hither, Iḍā! Come hither, Aditi! Come hither, Sarasvatî! Come hither, N.N.! Come hither, N.N.! Come hither, N.N.!

original: adityai rāsnāsīndrāṇyā uṣṇīṣaḥ / pūṣāsi / gharmāya dīṣva //
analyzed: adityai rāsnā asi indrāṇyai uṣṇīṣaḥ pūṣā asi   / gharmāya dīṣva
translated: Thou art the girdle of Aditi, the turban of Indrânî. Thou art Pûshan. Shine for the hot drink.

original: aśvibhyāṃ pinvasva / sarasvat pinvasva / indrāya pinvasva / svāhendravat / svāhendravat / svāhendravat //
analyzed: aśvibhyām pinvasva sarasvat pinvasva   indrāya pinvasva   svāhā indravat    svāhā indravat
translated: For the Asvins swell thee. For Sarasvatî swell thee. For Indra swell thee. Svâhâ! With Indra. Svâhâ! With Indra. Svâhâ! With Indra.

original: yas te stanaḥ śaśayo yo mayobhūr yo ratnadhā vasuvid yaḥ sudatraḥ / yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvat tam iha dhātave 'kaḥ //
analyzed: yaḥ te stanaḥ śaśayaḥ yaḥ mayobhūḥ yaḥ ratna dhāḥ vasu vid yaḥ su datraḥ    yena viśvā puṣyasi vāryāṇi sarasvat tam iha dhātave kaḥ
translated: That breast of thine which is full of milk, which is beneficent, which bestows treasure, which gives good gifts, wherewith thou nourishest all things most excellent, O Sarasvatî, make that ready here for our use.

original: urv antarikṣam anv emi //
analyzed: uru antarikṣam anu emi
translated: I go along the broad atmosphere.

original: gāyatraṃ chando si / traiṣṭubhaṃ chando si / dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ tvā pari gṛhṇāmi / antarikṣeṇopa yacchāmi / indrāśvinā / madhunaḥ sāraghasya gharmaṃ pāta vasavo yajata vāṭ / svāhā sūryasya raśmaye vṛṣṭivanaye //
analyzed: gāyatram chandaḥ si   traiṣṭubham chandaḥ si    dyāvāpṛthivībhyām tvā pari gṛhṇāmi    antarikṣeṇa upa yacchāmi   indra aśvinā   madhunaḥ sāraghasya gharmam pāta vasavaḥ yajata vāṭ svāhā sūryasya raśmaye vṛṣṭi vanaye
translated: Thou art the Gayatri metre. Thou art the Tristubh metre. I grasp thee with heaven and earth. I accept thee in the atmosphere. Indra and the Asvins. Drink the hot beverage of honey from the Sâragha. Worship, O Vasus. Hail to the ray of the sun, which causes rain.

original: samudrāya tvā vātāya svāhā / sarirāya tvā vātāya svāhā / anādhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāhā / apratidhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāhā / avasyave tvā vātāya svāhā / aśimidāya tvā vātāya svāhā //
analyzed: samudrāya tvā vātāya svāhā   sarirāya tvā vātāya svāhā    anādhṛṣyāya tvā vātāya svāhā
translated: To the ocean thee, to the wind, hail! To the stream thee, to the wind, hail! To the irresistible thee, to the wind, hail! To the unresisted thee, to the wind, hail! To the helpful thee, to the wind, hail! To the harmless thee, to the wind, hail.

original: indrāya tvā vasumate rudravate svāhā / indrāya tvādityavate svāhā / indrāya tvābhimātighne svāhā / savitre tva ṛbhumate vibhumate vājavate svāhā / bṛhaspataye tvā viśvadevyāvate svāhā //
analyzed: indrāya tvā vasumate rudravate svāhā   indrāya tvā ādityavate svāhā    indrāya tvā abhimāti ghne svāhā   savitre tvā ṛbhumate vibhumate vājavate svāhā    bṛhaspataye tvā viśvadevyāvate svāhā
translated: To Indra thee, to him who hath the Vasus and Rudras, hail! To Indra thee, to him who hath the Âdityas, hail! To Indra thee, to him who smites his foes, hail! To Savitar thee, to him who hath the Rbhus, the Vibhus, and Vâja, hail! To Brihaspati thee, to him who hath all the gods, hail.

original: yamāya tvāṅgirasvate pitṛmate svāhā / svāhā gharmāya / svāhā gharmaḥ pitre //
analyzed: yamāya tvā aṅgirasvate pitṛmate svāhā svāhā gharmāya svāhā gharmaḥ pitre
translated: To Yama thee, to him who is Angiras, to him who is the father of the fathers, hail! Hail to the hot beverage! Hail to the hot beverage to the father.

original: viśvā āśā dakṣiṇasad viśvān devān ayāḍ iha / svāhākṛtasya gharmasya madhoḥ pibatam aśvinā //🔽divi dhā imaṃ yajñam imam yajñaṃ divi dhāḥ / svāhāgnaye yajñiyāya śaṃ yajurbhyaḥ //
analyzed: viśvāḥ āśāḥ dakṣiṇa sad viśvān devān ayāṭ iha    svāhākṛtasya gharmasya madhoḥ pibatam aśvinā  divi dhāḥ imam yajñam imam yajñam divi dhāḥ    svāhā agnaye yajñiyāya śam yajurbhyaḥ
translated: Sit ye on all the quarters, sit ye on all the Gods here. Drink ye of the Gharma, of the sweet, O ye Âsyvins, when the Svâhâ is uttered.🔽Place this sacrifice in heaven, place this sacrifice in the sky. All-hail to Gharma meet for worship! Hail to the Yagus!

original: aśvinā gharmaṃ pātam hārdvānam ahar divābhir ūtibhiḥ / tantrāyiṇo namo dyāvāpṛthivībhyām //
analyzed: aśvinā gharmam pātam hārdvānam ahar divābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ tantrāyiṇaḥ namaḥ dyāvāpṛthivībhyām
translated: Drink ye the Gharma, O ye Âdityas, with the rays of heaven. To the supporters of the world homage! To Heaven and Earth homage!

original: apātām aśvinā gharmam anu dyāvāpṛthivī amamsātām / ihaiva rātayaḥ santu //
analyzed: apātām aśvinā gharmam anu dyāvāpṛthivī amamsātām    iha eva rātayaḥ santu
translated: Have the Âdityas drunk the Gharma? Have Heaven and Earth eaten the Amrit? Here be our gifts.

original: iṣe pinvasva / ūrje pinvasva / brahmaṇe pinvasva / kṣatrāya pinvasva / dyāvāpṛthivībhyāṃ pinvasva / dharmāsi sudharma / ameny asme nṛmṇāni dhāraya brahma dhāraya kṣatram dhāraya viśaṃ dhāraya //
analyzed: iṣe pinvasva   ūrje pinvasva brahmaṇe pinvasva   kṣatrāya pinvasva   dyāvāpṛthivībhyām pinvasva   dharma asi su dharma   ameni asme nṛmṇāni dhāraya brahma dhāraya kṣatram dhāraya viśam dhāraya
translated: For food swell thou. For strength swell thou. For holy power swell thou. For the ruling power swell thou. For Heaven and Earth swell thou. Thou art the Law, the good Law. In us, O irresistible one, lay thou strength. Lay thou holy power. Lay thou the ruling power. Lay thou the people.

original: svāhā pūṣṇe śarase / svāhā grāvabhyaḥ / svāhā pratiravebhyaḥ / svāhā pitṛbhya ūrdhvabarhirbhyo gharmapāvabhyaḥ / svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām / svāhā viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ //
analyzed: svāhā pūṣṇe śarase   svāhā grāvabhyaḥ svāhā pratiravebhyaḥ svāhā pitṛbhyaḥ ūrdhva barhirbhyaḥ gharma pāvabhyaḥ svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām svāhā viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ
translated: All-hail to Pûshan the sharer! All-hail to the pressing-stones! All-hail to the echoes! All-hail to the Fathers who strew the grass upwards and drink the Gharma! All-hail to Heaven and Earth! All-hail to the All-Gods!

original: svāhā rudrāya rudrahūtaye / svāhā saṃ jyotiṣā jyotiḥ / ahaḥ ketunā juṣatām sujyotir jyotiṣā svāhā / rātriḥ ketunā juṣatām sujyotir jyotiṣā svāhā / madhu hutam indratame agnāv aśyāma te deva gharma namas te astu mā mā himsīḥ //
analyzed: svāhā rudrāya rudra hūtaye svāhā sam jyotiṣā jyotiḥ    ahar ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā    rātriḥ ketunā juṣatām su jyotiḥ jyotiṣā svāhā    madhu hutam indratame agnau aśyāma te deva gharma namaḥ te astu mā mā himsīḥ
translated: Hail to Rudra, to him who is invoked as Rudra! Hail! May the light unite with light. May the day accept the sign, the good light with the light, All-hail! May the night accept the sign, the good light with the light, All-hail! Let us enjoy the honey offered in the fire most dear to Indra. O God Gharma, homage be to thee. Injure me not.

original: abhīmaṃ mahimā divaṃ vipro babhūva saprathāḥ / uta śravasā pṛthivīm sam sīdasva mahām asi rocasva devavītamaḥ //
analyzed: abhi imam mahimā divam vipraḥ babhūva saprathāḥ      uta śravasā pṛthivīm sam sīdasva mahām asi rocasva deva vītamaḥ
translated: The sage hath become of great might, extending to the sky, and by his fame to earth. Be seated; thou art great. Shine thou most acceptable to the gods.

original: yā te gharma divyā śug yā gāyatryām havirdhāne / sā ta ā pyāyatāṃ ni ṣṭyāyatāṃ tasyai te svāhā //
analyzed: yā te gharma divyā śuc yā gāyatryām havirdhāne     sā te ā pyāyatām ni styāyatām tasyai te svāhā
translated: That glow of thine which is in the sky, O Gharma, which is in the Gâyatrî, in the oblation-holder, may that be increased for thee, may it be firmly established for thee. To that of thine be homage.

original: yā te gharmāntarikṣe śug yā triṣṭubhy āgnīdhre / sā ta ā pyāyatāṃ ni ṣṭyāyatāṃ tasyai te svāhā //
analyzed: yā te gharma antarikṣe śuc yā triṣṭubhi āgnīdhre    sā te ā pyāyatām ni styāyatām tasyai te svāhā
translated: That glow of thine which is in the air, O Gharma, which is in the Trishtup, in the Âgnîdhrîya, may that be increased for thee, may it be firmly established for thee. To that of thine be homage.

original: yā te gharma pṛthivyām śug yā jagatyām sadasyā / sā ta ā pyāyatāṃ ni ṣṭyāyatāṃ tasyai te svāhā //
analyzed: yā te gharma pṛthivyām śuc yā jagatyām sadasyā    sā te ā pyāyatām ni styāyatām tasyai te svāhā
translated: That glow of thine which is on earth, O Gharma, which is in the Jagatî, in the Sadas, may that be increased for thee, may it be firmly established for thee. To that of thine be homage.

original: kṣatrasya tvā paraspāya brahmaṇas tanvaṃ pāhi / viśas tvā dharmaṇā vayam anu krāmāma suvitāya navyase //
analyzed: kṣatrasya tvā paraspāya brahmaṇaḥ tanvam pāhi    viśaḥ tvā dharmaṇā vayam anu krāmāma suvitāya navyase
translated: For the protection of the Kshatriya, guard the body of the Brahman. We follow thee with the law of the people, for fresh prosperity.

original: catuḥsraktir nābhir ṛtasya saprathāḥ sa no viśvāyuḥ saprathāḥ sa naḥ sarvāyuḥ saprathāḥ / apa dveṣo apa hvaro 'nyavratasya saścima //
analyzed: catur sraktiḥ nābhiḥ ṛtasya saprathāḥ sa naḥ viśva āyuḥ saprathāḥ sa naḥ sarva āyuḥ saprathāḥ    apa dveṣaḥ apa hvaraḥ nyavratasya saścima
