translated: The four-cornered navel of truth, extending far, may it extend far for all our life, may it extend far for our full life. We follow the vow of him who hath a different vow, beyond hatred, beyond contempt.

original: gharmaitat te purīṣaṃ tena vardhasva cā ca pyāyasva / vardhiṣīmahi ca vayam ā ca pyāsiṣīmahi //
analyzed: gharma etat te purīṣam tena vardhasva ca ā ca pyāyasva   vardhiṣīmahi ca vayam ā ca pyāsiṣīmahi
translated: This is thy body, O Gharma; by it grow thou great and full. May we grow great and be full.

original: acikradad vṛṣā harir mahān mitro na darśataḥ / sam sūryeṇa didyutad udadhir nidhiḥ //
analyzed: acikradat vṛṣā hariḥ mahān mitraḥ na darśataḥ   sam sūryeṇa didyutat udadhiḥ nidhiḥ
translated: The great tawny bull hath bellowed, beautiful as Mitra. He hath flashed with the sun. He is the ocean, the treasure.

original: sumitriyā na āpa oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyās tasmai santu yo 'smān dveṣṭi yaṃ ca vayaṃ dviṣmaḥ //
analyzed: su mitriyāḥ naḥ āpaḥ oṣadhayaḥ santu durmitriyāḥ tasmai santu yaḥ smān dveṣṭi yam ca vayam dviṣmaḥ
translated: May the waters and plants be friendly to us. Unfriendly may they be to him who hateth us and whom we hate.

original: ud vayaṃ tamasas pari svaḥ paśyanta uttaram / devaṃ devatrā sūryam aganma jyotir uttamam //
analyzed: ud vayam tamasaḥ pari svar paśyantaḥ uttaram    devam devatrā sūryam aganma jyotiḥ uttamam
translated: We have gone up from this darkness, beholding the higher light, the god Sûrya, the god among the gods, the highest light.

original: edho 'sy edhiṣīmahi / samid asi tejo 'si tejo mayi dhehi //
analyzed: edhaḥ si edhiṣīmahi samidh asi tejaḥ si tejaḥ mayi dhehi
translated: Thou art fuel; may we prosper. Thou art a kindling-stick; thou art radiance; bestow radiance on me.

original: yāvato dyāvāpṛthivī yāvac ca sapta sindhavo vitasthire / tavantam indra te graham ūrjā gṛhṇāmy akṣitaṃ mayi gṛhṇāmy akṣitam //
analyzed: yāvataḥ dyāvāpṛthivī yāvat ca sapta sindhavaḥ vitasthire    tavantam indra te graham ūrjā gṛhṇāmi akṣitam mayi gṛhṇāmi akṣitam
translated: As far as heaven and earth extend, and as far as the seven rivers have spread themselves, I draw thee, O Indra, thy draught, which is so great, to me, to my house, which is inexhaustible. I draw to me, to my house, which is inexhaustible.

original: mayi tyad indriyaṃ bṛhan mayi dakṣo mayi kratuḥ / gharmas triśug vi rājati virājā jyotiṣā saha brahmaṇā tejasā saha //
analyzed: mayi tyad indriyam bṛhat mayi dakṣaḥ mayi kratuḥ   gharmaḥ tri śuc vi rājati virājā jyotiṣā saha brahmaṇā tejasā saha
translated: In me is that great power, in me is skill, in me is wisdom. The threefold Gharma shines forth, with the Viraj, with light, with holy power, with splendour.

original: payaso reta ābhṛtaṃ tasya doham aśīmahy uttarāmuttarām samām / tviṣaḥ saṃvṛk kratve dakṣasya te suṣuvāṇasya te suṣumṇāgnihutaḥ / indrapītasya prajāpatibhakṣitasya madhumata upahūta upahūtasya bhakṣayāmi //
analyzed: payasaḥ retaḥ ābhṛtam tasya doham aśīmahi uttarām uttarām samām   tviṣaḥ saṃvṛj kratve dakṣasya te suṣuvāṇasya te suṣumṇā agni hutaḥ    indra pītasya prajāpati bhakṣitasya madhumataḥ upahūtaḥ upahūtasya bhakṣayāmi
translated: The seed of milk is brought forth. We have obtained the milking of it, higher and higher every year. The light, the covering, the skill, of thee, the well-pressed, of thee, the well-effused, offered in the fire, drunk by Indra, eaten by Prajapati, I enjoy of the sweet, of the invoked, of the invoked.

original: svāhāprāṇebhyaḥ sādhipatikebhyaḥ / pṛthivyai svāhā / agnaye svāhā / antarikṣe svāhā / vāyave svāhā / dive svāhā / sūryāya svāhā //
analyzed: svāhā prāṇebhyaḥ sa ādhipatikebhyaḥ pṛthivyai svāhā  agnaye svāhā  antarikṣe svāhā vāyave svāhā  dive svāhā  sūryāya svāhā
translated: Hail to the vital airs with their lord, to the earth hail! to Agni hail! to the atmosphere hail! to Vayu hail! to the sky hail! to Surya hail!

original: digbhyaḥ svāhā / candrāya svāhā / nakṣatrebhyaḥ svāhā / adbhyaḥ svāhā / varuṇāya svāhā / nābhyai svāhā / pūtāya svāhā //
analyzed: digbhyaḥ svāhā candrāya svāhā nakṣatrebhyaḥ svāhā adbhyaḥ svāhā varuṇāya svāhā nābhyai svāhā   pūtāya svāhā
translated: To the quarters hail! to the moon hail! to the stars hail! to the waters hail! to Varuna hail! to the navel hail! to the purified hail!

original: vāce svāhā / prāṇāya svāhā / prāṇāya svāhā / cakṣuṣe svāhā / cakṣuṣe svāhā / śrotrāya svāhā / śrotrāya svāhā //
analyzed: vāce svāhā  prāṇāya svāhā  prāṇāya svāhā  cakṣuṣe svāhā cakṣuṣe svāhā  śrotrāya svāhā  śrotrāya svāhā
translated: To speech Svâhâ! To breath Svâhâ! To breath Svâhâ! To sight Svâhâ! To sight Svâhâ! To hearing Svâhâ! To hearing Svâhâ!

original: manasaḥ kāmam ākūtiṃ vācaḥ satyam aśīya / paśūnām rūpam annasya raso yaśaḥ śrīḥ śrayatāṃ mayi svāhā //
analyzed: manasaḥ kāmam ākūtim vācaḥ satyam aśīya paśūnām rūpam annasya rasaḥ yaśaḥ śrīḥ śrayatām mayi svāhā
translated: I have attained the desire of the mind, the purpose of speech, the truth of speech. The form of cattle, the sap of food, glory and prosperity have entered into me. Svâhâ!

original: prajāpatiḥ saṃbhriyamāṇaḥ samrāṭ saṃbhṛto vaiśvadevaḥ samsanno gharmaḥ pravṛktas teja udyata āśvinaḥ payasyānīyamāne pauṣṇo viṣpandamāne mārutaḥ klathan / maitraḥ śarasi saṃtāyyamāne vāyavyo hriyamāṇa āgneyo hūyamāno vāg ghutaḥ //
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ saṃbhriyamāṇaḥ samrāj saṃbhṛtaḥ vaiśvadevaḥ samsannaḥ gharmaḥ pravṛktaḥ tejaḥ udyataḥ āśvinaḥ payasi ānīyamāne pauṣṇaḥ viṣpandamāne mārutaḥ maitraḥ śarasi saṃtāyyamāne vāyavyaḥ hriyamāṇaḥ āgneyaḥ hūyamānaḥ vāc ghutaḥ  /
translated: Prajâpati, being collected, is the emperor; being collected, he is the All-gods; being settled, he is the Gharma; being set in motion, he is the light; being raised, he is the Âsvina; being drawn, he is the Payasyâ; being shaken, he is the Paushna; being torn, he is the Marut; being cut up, he is the Maitra; being carried, he is the Vâyu; being offered, he is the Âgneya; being offered, he is speech.

original: savitā prathame 'hann agnir dvitīye vāyus tṛtīya ādityaś caturthe candramāḥ pañcama ṛtuḥ ṣaṣṭhe marutaḥ saptame bṛhaspatir aṣṭame / mitro navame varuṇo daśama indra ekādaśe viśve devā dvādaśe //
analyzed: savitā prathame han agniḥ dvitīye vāyuḥ tṛtīye ādityaḥ caturthe candramāḥ pañcame ṛtuḥ ṣaṣṭhe marutaḥ saptame bṛhaspatiḥ aṣṭame    mitraḥ navame varuṇaḥ daśame indraḥ ekādaśe viśve devāḥ dvādaśe
translated: Savitar on the first day, Agni on the second, Vâyu on the third, Âditya on the fourth, the Moon on the fifth, the season on the sixth, the Maruts on the seventh, Brihaspati on the eighth, Mitra on the ninth, Varuna on the tenth, Indra on the eleventh, the Visve devâh on the twelfth.

original: ugraś ca bhīmaś ca dhvāntaś ca dhuniś ca / sāsahvāmś cābhiyugvā ca vikṣipaḥ svāhā //
analyzed: ugraḥ ca bhīmaḥ ca dhvāntaḥ ca dhuniḥ ca    ca abhiyugvā ca vikṣipaḥ svāhā
translated: Ugra, Bhima, Dhumra, Dhuni, Sasahva, Abhiyuga, Viksipa, Svāhā.

original: agnim hṛdayenāśanim hṛdayāgreṇa paśupatiṃ kṛtsnahṛdayena bhavaṃ yaknā / śarvaṃ matasnābhyām īśānaṃ manyunā mahādevam antaḥparśavyenograṃ devaṃ vaniṣṭhunā vasiṣṭhahanuḥ śiṅgīni kośyābhyām //
analyzed: agnim hṛdayena aśanim hṛdaya agreṇa paśupatim kṛtsna hṛdayena bhavam yaknā  / śarvam matasnābhyām īśānam manyunā mahādevam antar parśavyena ugram devam vaniṣṭhunā vasiṣṭha hanuḥ śiṅgīni kośyābhyām
translated: Agni with the heart, lightning with the tip of the heart, Pasupati with the whole heart, Bhava with the liver, Sarva with the kidneys, Īśāna with anger, Mahādeva with the internal parts, Ugra with the intestines, the god with the anus, Vasishṭha's jaw with the testicles and penis.

original: ugraṃ lohitena mitram sauvratyena rudraṃ daurvratyenendraṃ prakrīḍena maruto balena sādhyān pramudā / bhavasya kaṇṭham rudrasyāntaḥpārśvyaṃ mahādevasya yakṛc charvasya vaniṣṭhuḥ paśupateḥ purītat //
analyzed: ugram lohitena mitram sauvratyena rudram daurvratyena indram prakrīḍena marutaḥ balena sādhyān pramudā  / bhavasya kaṇṭham rudrasya antaḥpārśvyam mahādevasya yakṛt śarvasya vaniṣṭhuḥ paśupateḥ purītat
translated: Ugra with blood, Mitra with good conduct, Rudra with bad conduct, Indra with playfulness, the Maruts with strength, the Sādhyas with joy, Bhava's throat, Rudra's internal parts, Mahādeva's liver, Sarva's intestines, Pasupati's stomach.

original: lomabhyaḥ svāhā lomabhyaḥ svāhā tvace svāhā tvace svāhā lohitāya svāhā lohitāya svāhā medobhyaḥ svāhā medobhyaḥ svāhā / māmsebhyaḥ svāhā māmsebhyaḥ svāhā snāvabhyaḥ svāhā snāvabhyaḥ svāhāsthabhyaḥ svāhāsthabhyaḥ svāhā majjabhyaḥ svāhā majjabhyaḥ svāhā / retase svāhā pāyave svāhā //🔽āyāsāya svāhā prāyāsāya svāhā saṃyāsāya svāhā viyāsāya svāhodyāsāya svāhā / śuce svāhā śocate svāhā śocamānāya svāhā śokāya svāhā //
analyzed: lomabhyaḥ svāhā lomabhyaḥ svāhā tvace svāhā tvace svāhā lohitāya svāhā lohitāya svāhā medobhyaḥ svāhā medobhyaḥ svāhā    māmsebhyaḥ svāhā māmsebhyaḥ svāhā snāvabhyaḥ svāhā snāvabhyaḥ svāhā asthabhyaḥ svāhā asthabhyaḥ svāhā majjabhyaḥ svāhā majjabhyaḥ svāhā  / retase svāhā pāyave svāhā  āyāsāya svāhā prāyāsāya svāhā saṃyāsāya svāhā viyāsāya svāhā udyāsāya svāhā    śuce svāhā śocate svāhā śocamānāya svāhā śokāya svāhā
translated: To the hairs, hail! To the hairs, hail! To the skin, hail! To the skin, hail! To the blood, hail! To the blood, hail! To the fat, hail! To the fat, hail! To the flesh, hail! To the flesh, hail! To the sinews, hail! To the sinews, hail! To the bones, hail! To the bones, hail! To the marrow, hail! To the marrow, hail! To the seed, hail! To the anus, hail!🔽To the exertion, hail! To the striving, hail! To the striving together, hail! To the striving apart, hail! To the going up, hail! To the pure one, hail! To the one who burns, hail! To the one who is burning, hail! To the burning, hail! To the grief, hail!

original: tapase svāhā tapyate svāhā tapyamānāya svāhā taptāya svāhā gharmāya svāhā / niṣkṛtyai svāhā prāyaścittyai svāhābheṣajāya svāhā //
analyzed: tapase svāhā tapyate svāhā tapyamānāya svāhā taptāya svāhā gharmāya svāhā    niṣkṛtyai svāhā prāyaścittyai svāhā abheṣajāya svāhā
translated: To the austerity, hail! To the one who is tormented, hail! To the one who is being tormented, hail! To the tormented one, hail! To the heat, hail! To the atonement, hail! To the expiation, hail! To the remedy, hail!

original: yamāya svāhāntakāya svāhā mṛtyave svāhā brahmaṇe svāhā brahmahatyāyai svāhā viśvebhyo devebhyaḥ svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām svāhā //
analyzed: yamāya svāhā antakāya svāhā mṛtyave svāhā brahmaṇe svāhā brahmahatyāyai svāhā viśvebhyaḥ devebhyaḥ svāhā dyāvāpṛthivībhyām svāhā
translated: To Yama, hail! To the Ender, hail! To Death, hail! To Brahman, hail! To the Brahman-slayer, hail! To the All-gods, hail! To Heaven and Earth, hail!

original: īśā vāsyam idam sarvaṃ yat kiṃ ca jagatyāṃ jagat / tena tyaktena bhuñjīthā mā gṛdhaḥ kasya svid dhanam //
analyzed: īśā vā asyam idam sarvam yat kim ca jagatyām jagat    tena tyaktena bhuñjīthāḥ mā gṛdhaḥ kasya svid dhanam
translated: He who is the Lord of this universe, whatever moves or moves not, by renouncing Him, do thou enjoy, covet not the wealth of any one.

original: kurvann eveha karmāṇi jijīviṣec chatam samāḥ / evaṃ tvayi nānyatheto 'sti na karma lipyate nare //
analyzed: kurvan evā iha karmāṇi jijīviṣet śatam samāḥ    evam tvayi na anyathā itas sti na karma lipyate nare
translated: Even while performing actions, one should desire to live a hundred years, thus, O son of Kunti, no sin will touch thee.

original: asuryā nāma te lokā andhena tamasāvṛtāḥ / tāms te pretyāpi gacchanti ye ke cātmahano janāḥ //
analyzed: asuryāḥ nāma te lokāḥ andhena tamasā āvṛtāḥ   tām te pretya api gacchanti ye ke ca ātma hanaḥ janāḥ
translated: Those worlds which are called Asura, are enveloped in thick darkness; those who are self-murderers go there after death.

original: anejad ekaṃ manaso javīyo nainad devā āpnuvan pūrvam arśat / tad dhāvato 'nyān aty eti tiṣṭhat tasminn apo mātariśvā dadhāti //
analyzed: anejat ekam manasaḥ javīyaḥ na enat devāḥ āpnuvan pūrvam arśat     tat dhāvataḥ nyān ati eti tiṣṭhat tasmin apaḥ mātariśvā dadhāti
translated: That which is unmoving, alone, swifter than the mind, the gods did not attain, it went before. It goes beyond those that go, it stands beyond those that stand. In it, Matarishvan places the waters.

original: tad ejati tan naijati tad dūre tad v antike / tad antar asya sarvasya tad u saravasyāsya bāhyataḥ //
analyzed: tat ejati tat na ejati tat dūre tat u antike    tat antar asya sarvasya tat u sa ravasya asya bāhyatas
translated: It moves, it does not move; it is far, it is near. It is within this all, and it is outside this all.

original: yas tu sarvāṇi bhūtāny ātmann evānupaśyati / sarvabhūteṣu cātmānaṃ tato na vi cikitsati //
analyzed: yaḥ tu sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātman eva anupaśyati    sarva bhūteṣu ca ātmānam tatas na vi cikitsati
translated: He who sees all beings in the self, and the self in all beings, he goes to the highest end.

original: yasmint sarvāṇi bhūtāny ātmaivābhūd vijānataḥ / tatra ko mohaḥ kaḥ śoka ekatvam anupaśyataḥ //
analyzed: yasmin sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātmā eva abhūt vijānataḥ    tatra kaḥ mohaḥ kaḥ śokaḥ eka tvam anupaśyataḥ
translated: In whom all beings become the Self to one who knows, there is delusion for whom? there is grief for whom? who sees unity.

original: sa pary agāc chukram akāyam avraṇam asnāviram śuddham apāpaviddham / kavir manīṣī paribhūḥ svayaṃbhūr yāthātathyato 'rthān vy adadhāc chāśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ //
analyzed: sa pari agāt śukram akāyam avraṇam a snāviram śuddham a pāpa viddham    kaviḥ manīṣī paribhūḥ svayaṃbhūḥ yāthātathyataḥ rthān vi adadhāt śāśvatībhyaḥ samābhyaḥ
translated: He has gone around the bright, bodiless, unhurt, unblemished, pure, sinless. The wise, the thoughtful, the lord, the self-existent one, has established things in their true nature for eternal years.

original: andhaṃ tamaḥ pra viśanti ye 'saṃbhūtim upāsate / tato bhūya iva te tamo ya u saṃbhūtyām ratāḥ //
analyzed: andham tamaḥ pra viśanti ye saṃbhūtim upāsate   tatas bhūyaḥ iva te tamaḥ ye u saṃbhūtyām ratāḥ
translated: Those who worship non-existence enter into blinding darkness. Even greater is the darkness of those who delight in existence.

original: anyad evāhuḥ saṃbhavād anyad āhur śaṃbhavāt / iti śuśruma dhīrāṇāṃ ye nas tad vicacakṣire //
analyzed: anyat eva āhuḥ saṃbhavāt anyat āhuḥ śaṃbhavāt      iti śuśruma dhīrāṇām ye naḥ tat vicacakṣire
translated: They say one thing about existence, they say another about non-existence. We have heard this from the wise who have explained it to us.

original: saṃbhūtiṃ ca vināśaṃ ca yas tad vedobhayam saha / vināśena mṛtyuṃ tīrtvā saṃbhūtyāmṛtam aśnute //
analyzed: saṃbhūtim ca vināśam ca yaḥ tat veda ubhayam saha    vināśena mṛtyum tīrtvā saṃbhūtyā amṛtam aśnute
translated: He who knows both existence and non-existence together, having crossed over death by non-existence, enjoys immortality by existence.

original: andhaṃ tamaḥ pra viśanti ye 'vidyām upāsate / tato bhūya iva te tamo ya u vidyāyām ratāḥ //
analyzed: andham tamaḥ pra viśanti ye vidyām upāsate   tatas bhūyas iva te tamaḥ ye u vidyāyām ratāḥ
translated: Those who worship ignorance enter into blinding darkness. Even greater is the darkness of those who delight in knowledge.

original: anyad evāhur vidyāyā anyad āhur avidyāyāḥ / iti śuśruma dhīrāṇāṃ ye nas tad vicacakṣire //
analyzed: anyat eva āhuḥ vidyāyāḥ anyat āhuḥ avidyāyāḥ    iti śuśruma dhīrāṇām ye naḥ tat vicacakṣire
translated: They say one thing is knowledge, they say another is ignorance. Thus we have heard from the wise ones who have explained it to us.

original: vidyāṃ cāvidyāṃ ca yas tad vedobhayam saha / avidyayā mṛtyuṃ tīrtvā vidyayāmṛtam aśnute //
analyzed: vidyām ca avidyām ca yaḥ tat veda ubhayam saha avidyayā mṛtyum tīrtvā vidyayā amṛtam aśnute
translated: He who knows both knowledge and ignorance together, having crossed death through ignorance, enjoys immortality through knowledge.

original: vāyur anilam amṛtam athedaṃ bhasmāntam śarīram / krato smara klibe smara kṛtam smara //
analyzed: vāyuḥ anilam amṛtam atha idam bhasma antam śarīram    krato smara klibe smara kṛtam smara
translated: The wind is the immortal spirit, and this body ends in ashes. Remember the sacrifice, O impotent one, remember what is done, remember.

original: agne naya supathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān / yuyodhy asmaj juhurāṇam eno bhuyiṣṭhāṃ te namaktiṃ vidhema //
analyzed: agne naya su pathā rāye asmān viśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān   yuyodhi asmat juhurāṇam enaḥ bhuyiṣṭhām te namaktim vidhema
translated: O Agni, lead us by the good path to wealth, O god, who knowest all works. Remove from us the sin that we may look upon thee, O thou most bountiful one.

original: hiraṇmayena pātreṇa satyasyāpihitaṃ mukham / yo 'sāv āditye puruṣaḥ so 'sāv aham //
analyzed: hiraṇmayena pātreṇa satyasya apihitam mukham   yaḥ sau āditye puruṣaḥ saḥ sau aham
translated: The face of truth is covered by a golden plate. The person who is in the sun, he is indeed myself.

original: khaṃ brahma //
analyzed: kham brahma
translated: The sky is Brahman.
